metadata.novel_title: Isn’t the wannabe Villain too cute?

novel_info.title: Isn’t the wannabe Villain too cute?
novel_info.author: Svneighter
novel_info.summary: Being surrounded by people and receiving praises over the thing which I felt natural to do, wasn't something that could excite me.Since childhood, I wasn't able to find anything which could heal my boredom and understand how much it takes to be in such a center of attraction.But one day I finally found a person who was an exception to this world.From a general perspective, he was an arrogant noble who taunted women and made vulgar comments about others. A person whome you feel justified in hating.But strangely I was able to see how he was forcing himself to do such a thing in front of all. His shaky hands and fake pride were clearly seen from the way I looked at himMaybe it was the start of my first entertainment which eventually turned into something more.Something which I hadn't experienced before.Something which people regard as love..._._Synopsis from MC pov:-This main heroine is becoming problematic day by day.Since I was reincarnated here and received the villain system I just wanted to fulfill the thing which the system required to fulfill my sole wish.My only desire for which I could even give up my life for...But this main heroine isn't acting the way  I have read in my previous life.Why she is leaving the hero's invitation and joining my party under all those heavy gazes.Why the heck are you asking me on a date when the hero is watching you with such pitiful eyes.Why the fuck you are kissing me in front of the whole nation ...are you nuts!!!This is my story as a villain, which this bothersome heroine is doing her all to destroy.___________...____________A/N:- Hello.This work is something I have been thinking since so long that I had nearly forgotten...The MC would be a little weak-willed due to his past and present life but we will have character development.There would be multi POVs but I will mainly focus on Mc's and FL's pov.There would be romance and drama at the start but I will add action and op moments too, later in the story.At last, I just hope you guys like my work, Sayonara~

chapters.title: Chapter 1: Her Curiosity!
chapters.content:
**SLAP**
The sound of flesh hitting flesh resonated in the whole hall pausing everyone from whatever they were doing.
The music was also halted by the choir as the slapping sound was enough to throw them into a startling state.
I was standing some feet away from the main scene with a glass of fruit beer in my hand with some of my classmates beside me.
Unlike me, they had their mouth covered with their hand in astonishment with visible amusement rising in their expectancy.
The whole hall was now looking at the pair of people who arose such commotion and naturally were in the center of all attraction.
The girl who just raised her hand and slapped the person in front was one of my classmates and training partners, Lilia Von Verlin. Daughter of Viscount Verlin.
The person she slapped was her fiancè and the person I was genuinely interested in for the first in my whole life.
Austin Wright.
The reason she slapped him was clear as day for me.
Austin came alone for the ball and when he saw Lilia walking around with another man whome I know too very well, Austin just went toward them and started shouting some insults at the guy who mostly has stolen Austin's fiancè.
"On the name of my father, I, Lilia Von Verlin from this very moment call off our engagement. I have already told my father about it so don't worry about the compensation. Now get lost from here and don't show that face of yours ever again!!."
Well, now that mostly changed into completely.
The man Lilia sided in the ball was another classmate of mine, Kyouki Sudou.
In this whole scenario, he was neutral except for the fact that he encouraged Lilia to take this step just some moments ago.
To be honest, it was a natural thing to happen in the count of everything Austin was partaking in this whole half-year.
The way he acts and taunts Kyouki, the favorite of all humanity, and the way he bad mouths women around him, which unsurprisingly, includes me too, I think he was lucky to still be attending this school. Well, being a Count's son must be helping him.
Every person inside the hall seemed to sigh or deliver the same kind of expression as in to show how satisfied they were with this conclusion.
I should also have felt something like that toward the person who has called me a slut, whore, and whatnot this past half a year.
But looking at his fallen head which he never held back up since the moment he was slapped, I was somewhat anxious.
There could be any two reactions a person who's self-obsessed such as Austin, could give upon being shamed like this in the middle of the whole crowd.
First, whether he would slap her back by saying some other vulgar words and reject the annulment entirely.
Second, he would threaten her in the name of his father and discard the situation by backing off arrogantly.
But he did none of what I thought.
He just hung his head low and turned on his heels. Under the mocking gaze of everyone, he started walking silently and soon disappeared from the ceremonial mall.
It just felt like he was tasked to do something like this...
But I wasn't sure who in the world would ever want to be treated like this or get slapped in front of those many gazes.
Even though I don't care about people's perceptions of me, I don't think I could ever tolerate such humiliation at all.
However he behaved, whatever he did, he still was in the end a proud  son of a Count.
'I have to talk to him...'
Before I could think anything further, my feet were already on a move toward the direction where Austin just left.
I only walked about two steps when someone called for me.
"Luna? Where are you going ?"
It was my classmate and the person who arose that uproar indirectly some moments ago.
Smiling at me he asked casually as I felt some pair of daggers directed in my direction.
It wasn't tough to tell who those women were as I was acquainted with them but in all honesty, I didn't have a single piece of care for their envy toward me.
Heck, I didn't even know why they had to envy me when I was not into their favourite man at all.
But arising such an argument right now wasnt something I wanted to bother myself so I just made a plain excuse.
"I don't feel good, so I am going back to my dorm."
It was the best way to escape a scene that despite being generic, I use every time I wanted to escape something weary.
"Oh is that so. Then let me accompany you."
But Kyouki was Kyouki. He had to play the good guy all the time.
I immediately shook my head with my fake smile slowly dropping in annoyance.
"It's okay, Kyouki-kun. I will be fine by myself."
I didn't stand there to hear Kyouki's exclamation or his harem's curse for how mean a woman I was.
I just couldn't stand those guys.
Walking out of the hall was also prolonged because of the number of people who greeted me on the way.
My position in the academy was only below one and above all.
Naturally being called the Saint of humanity didn't feel much good to hear but there wasn't anything I could do.
Since I was proficient with healing magic and was filling the gap in the hero's party, people named me such.
Not only that. From the general mentality, if I was in a party of women with a sole man named Kyouki, people started believing I would be his first wife or sort.
Even though I denied it a couple of times, the women beside me in the party thinks me as their rival and always said something, 'I will not lose to you even Kyouki-kun never look at me, or something along those lines.
I feel so irritated when the whole world tries to frame that man who doesn't even could discern that the women around him, love him madly.
I mean even a mindless creature would start reacting if those many beautiful women fawning over them, yet he sees those gestures as merely a sign of their friendly behavior.
'Ah...I seriously have to leave his party as soon as possible.'
Shaking off my useless thought about myself I walked out of the hall and entered the garden which was just after the main entrance of the ceremonial block.
The night had fallen with nocturnal creatures buzzing in the background.
I knew even in this peaceful silence it would take me time to find Austin so I just used [Mana Detection], and immediately pinpointed him.
I knelt down and after clipping off my sandals which have given me quite love bites around my ankle, I started walking toward him.
He wasn't far away so it didn't take me more than 5 minutes to reach a distance where I could see his figure.
I didn't advance more than necessary and hiding behind a tree I concentrated mana on my optic nerves to see what he was doing.
As I drew my eyes closer his image become more vivid.
He was currently sitting on a bench with his both legs curled up with his face being supported by his knees.
He had a blue kind of rectangular slim marble-like thing in hand which had two black circles drawn on its back. The strange thing was illuminating Austin's face with vibrant blue light.
But still, that weird illumination didn't make me startle this much, as something else did.
Austin's eyes which I have often seen filled with arrogance and pride were devoid of any such sins.
His pair of olive green eyes were now relaxed to the point where I felt myself lost in them. There was a glint of loneliness with love filled in those eyes.
His all-time smug face carried only a gentle smile which made me realize that this person could make such an expression too.
I was stunned by such a sight after so long.
No, maybe this was the first time when I felt someone's expression exhilarating my emotions to this extent.
Calming my nerves I exhaled deeply.
It wasn't how I usually behaved but strangely I didn't hate it. More like I felt natural in this last moment.
Now the thing I wanted to know the most was the content which that blue stone was displaying, which drew out such an expression from the famous good-for-nothing noble.
I erased my mana and used [Camouflage] before I walked toward him silently.
This skill of mine was a secret which I and only my grandma knew about .
I have used this spell a couple of times for ambush and when I wanted to study in the library for whole night, but this was my first time using it for something like this.
Using it to spy on a man whom I felt interesting ...would be suitable I guess.
Being aware of the path I was walking upon I made way toward the bench on which Austin was sitting before I took the position just behind him.
Leaning my head slightly I finally was able to the see the source of such weird illumination. And when I finally did see the content, my eyes went wide in disbelief.....

chapters.title: Chapter 2: His sorrow!
chapters.content:
"How many villain points do I need for this week, system?"
[Ding! The host requires 200 more points to gain the weekly reward]
Sighing I leaned back on my chair while thinking of the thing I can do to gain these 200 points.
'I guess today's ball will do the work'.
Staring at the image in the mirror, I was greeted by a handsome face that in originality was far better than my last life's.
Staring at nothing particular I was drowned in the memories of the time I have spent in this world up until now.
15 years ago I died in my last life and was reborn here, as the minor villain of a famous manga I have read in my previous life.
At the start when I identified myself, I was somewhat downhearted as I have seen what fate this character awaits.
But since this was me inside this body, I thought to change my destiny.
For the fourteen years of my life, I did everything in a better way and never showed the sign of being an arrogant bastard as I was in the manga.
Training diligently, acquiring world knowledge, and helping people in need, I did everything which seemed natural for me to do.
Well, ironically I found parents in this life just like my previous ones.
They hated me for some reason.
I was the third child of my father and mother just like my older brother and sister. There wasn't any case of being a child of a concubine or maid to get hated in the house.
I was a legitimate child of Count and Countess.
Yet, I was clearly able to see how partial their love was for me and their other two children.
The loving gaze they direct at them and they stare they bestow upon me visibly felt different.
But since I was used to such behavior I didn't think of it more than necessary.
I was getting a home to live in. A luxurious life to enjoy and enough resources to build my foundation as a mage warrior.
I had planned everything on how I would avoid the protagonist and his harem when I would start my academy after turning fifteen.
I even had decided my future and how I would spend the rest of my life in this unknown world.
But everything came down crashing as, on just the day of my birthday, a black and white screen popped in front of my retina.
[The Villain System]
As the name suggests, I was tasked to do stuff that a villain does in a story to torment the hero and in the end, get killed like useless garbage.
Naturally doing something disgusting and behaving like a scum didn't sound good to me, so I thought to not use the system at all.
I was getting powerful by myself slowly and steadily so I thought it was okay for me not to use this system and live how I used to.
But what made my mind blank and my thought process reverse in an instant was the rewards it offered.
The system worked on a weekly reward basis. The villainous deeds I would partake in the whole 7 days would be counted and the system would reward me on the seventh day.
If the reward would have only the artifacts and stats advancement, then I would have ignored the system entirely.
But the added reward at the bottom of the list made my heart shake vibrantly and made all my previous reasoning burn at once.
[Host can use the points he accumulates in the week to cure any illness or injury of a person who belongs to any part of this multiverse.]
What's more, the system confirmed that the timeline of this world and the previous one were highly mismatched.
If I have been reborn here for fourteen years, then in my previous world it must be only 14 days passed since my death.
My elation went beyond words when I realized such a reward.
After all, with this, I would be able to save the sole person, the only being who I hold dearest to my heart.
I disregarded every previous plan of mine for a better future and started writing a new page of my villain's plot.
Starting from my family I started behaving like a useless brat who threw tantrums at everything and started acting like a pervert who was born to chase skirts.
Surprisingly, the behavior of my parents and siblings remained the same as they were before with me. More like their expressions toward me started looking more justified.
But even with that, my first week of being an asshole, went like hell.
Despite how much I tried to behave like a haughty noble I was still far from used to it.
But somehow I managed to attain 300 points which the system asked me to complete my weekly supply.
There was still doubt in my mind about how I would be sure about my desired reward when I wasn't in that world anymore.
But the system took care of it too, which didn't help but only motivated me to continue my evil deeds as a useless Noble and good-for-nothing son.
**Knock**
A set of knocks pulled me out of my stupor as I heard my maid calling for me.
"Young Master, the preparation has been done."
Humming in response I jumped off my hair and stood straight while facing myself in the mirror.
Slapping my sullen face which became like this because I reminisced, I inhaled deeply.
Taking my back straight I stretched my lips into a wide curve and narrowed my eyes in a way where my previous sullen look started seeming better.
...
"We have arrived, young master."
Stood outside the carriage gate was my kind and beautiful maid who had an expressionless face directed toward me.
Her beautiful facial features displayed nothing but annoyance and loath in my presence.
She was a very cheerful maid when she was assigned to my service but the deeds I performed on her resulted in a complex relationship between the master and servant.
"What's that ugly face for? Aren't you honored to be greeted by your master's graceful appearance? I think I should better teach you something good, tonight."
Upon hearing my lascivious remark she sneered visibly but didn't lift her gaze. Since I already said enough to grant myself a point or two I didn't wait long and got out.
[Ding!]
[+2 points for inaudible curse]
Sure enough, I got the verification of my act.
Even if I said something like that just some moments ago, it wasn't like I have done something like punishing her or doing anything more than vulgar comments.
I still was a virgin and never dared to touch a woman who clearly holds nothing but resentment toward me.
Even though I was engaged past 8 years, I still haven't even held hands in that way with my fiancee, not to talk about kissing and stuff.
Walking elegantly I made my way inside the ceremonial hall which looked exquisite from the inside out.
Many students have already arrived and been enjoying the party.
The smell of fresh drinks and delicacies penetrated my senses as soon I stepped inside the hall.
The crowd of people glanced at me once but didn't come to talk to me, more like they just pretended to see pass through and ignored my existence entirely.
The two side goons of mine who were there with me in my bullying have also left my side knowing fully well, what my actions would cause them.
Since the choir already started playing elegant classic music, it signified that it was time for the couple dance.
Since the dance happens nearly at the end of the ceremony, I concluded that my arrival was too late.
But there was a reason for my late appearance at the ceremony.
And looking at my fiancè who was about to get on the dance floor with a man whome I have been targeting since day one, I knew my intention didn't go in vain.
Coughing lightly I changed my expression into a very ugly one before I walked up to my fiancè.
Lilia Von Verlin.
For a second, upon seeing her elegant figure which was so adored by her pink gown, I halted in my step. The happy smile that she was directing at the hero was too precious for me to destroy.
But at the end of the day, everyone lives for their own selfishness...
"What do you think you are doing Lilia!"
I shouted at top of my lung which gathered a whole lot of attention from my surroundings and naturally the person with whome I directed my displeasure, also turned toward me.
"Getting intimate with a man who isn't your fiancè and ignoring the one who actually is, don't think I will easily forgive this you man hunting whore. Leave him and kneel for forgiveness right now!"
With both hands on my waist, I glared furiously at the woman whome I swear to never hurt until the system arrived. But now, I was the one who has given the most pain to her.
Upon hearing my remark Lilia bit her lower lip and clutched the hold on the hero's arm more rigidly.
"I refuse."
Timidly she responded but since it wasn't enough for me to gain points I continued with my verbal garbage.
"Wh-...what did you just say...You are disobeying me? Your lord, your future husband? If you don't want me to kill that bastard standing beside you then beg for mercy right at this instance!!"
It was a baseless warning as I didn't have the strength to go against the hero of humanity in any way possible.
But looking at murderous gazes from the women around the hero and especially from Lilia, I was sure I accomplished my goal.
But I didn't expect even in my dream that the shy and tame Lilia would take this step.
**SLAP**
"Don't you dare touch Kyouki-kun!"
My cheek felt burning with a numb sensation spreading across my face. For some seconds I wasnt able to realize what happened as the world for me switched upside down.
It was Lilia who pulled me out of my stupor as her words again reached my senses.
"On the name of my father, I, Lilia Von Verlin from this very moment call off our engagement. I have already told my father about it so don't worry about the compensation. Now get lost from here and don't show that face of yours ever again!!."
Now did I come to understand, that Lilia who was so gentle and kind to me in the past had to take this harsh step because of my words toward the man she loves? And not only that she even annulled the engagement which I had expected but still it felt a little too soon.
And a little too sad...
I hung my head low as I knew my facial expression was ugly enough to unbecoming a villain.
The system was notifying me of the tens of points I was receiving but I turned blindfolded it.
It wasn't like I was hit in the face for the first time under the onlooking gazes of this many people. But this sole slap actually shook my heart.
Lilia was the only person in this life who had a friendly relationship with me.
After our engagement and before the time I received the system, we had a great time together.
We played together, went on dates, and we even cried our grief and supported each other at some point in our lives.
Until my fourteenth birthday, I had planned my lively future with my fiancè even though there was a chance of her being stolen by the protagonist. I made plans for it too.
But everything fell apart with the slap. And in all honesty, it was something I had completely foresaw after taking everything I have done to Lilia into account.
But why I was feeling so much hurt right now...?
Was I expecting something miraculous?
Was I expecting her to see through my act and forgive me in the end?
I didn't know and didn't want to think about it either.
The fact was I gained the score and voluntarily pushed the woman out of my life I once vowed to live forever.
Hanging my head in the lowest possible, I turned and started walking out of the hall while receiving mixed reactions of mockery and satisfaction from my surrounding.
The system panel was notifying me continuously about the single-digit points I was earning yet I didn't dare to even look for it right now.
I was scared to know how much people hate me and loved to watch me fall...
I was terrified...
...
Walking silently in the garden I made my way toward the bench where I usually sit alone at night to heal myself whenever I get injured by the hero or his party member. And also the place which helps me recover my will to move forward.
It wasn't anything special but a place that was the farthest situated in the school and mostly wasn't visited by anyone because of the creepy vibe it provides.
Sitting after loosening my necktie and getting rid of my boots, I opted for the system's notification for my rewards.
[Ding!]
[Weekly requirements have been fulfilled]
[Host will be granted the rewards shortly..]
[Calculating the surplus..]
[Creating the suitable rewards....]
[Ding!]
[You have received:-
Tears of Phoenix    ->   X10
Grappling Gloves -> 1 pair
Status point          ->  + 30]
[As instructed the rewards would be stored in the inventory and the default reward would be transferred to the entity, User has bestowed upon.]
Smiling at the last part of the reward I took something out of my inventory.
It was a smartphone that the system granted me upon its arrival.
The phone couldn't be used for anything but surveillance of a certain person.
This was the very reason why I trusted the system and started following the villain route.
Tapping on the screen a live video started displaying over the phone.
The screen was focused on a person who was currently lying on a hospital bed with multiple chords attached to her veins and an oxygen mask covering her nose and mouth.
"Doctor!! The patient just reacted right now!"
"Hmm? Did she? Impressive. Day by day her recovery is making me believe the impossible. Quick bring me....".
I smiled upon hearing the hustle around the hospital room which showed that the reward actually was transferred as I desired.
Maybe the system was fooling me all this time to make me do such hideous acts through this fake video. But until I have hope to save the person I love the most in the world, I believe it was worth it.
Since I had no limited time to watch these live videos, I soon curled up in a comfortable position and leisurely stared at the calm face of the girl on my screen.
She instantly healed my soul like she usually does, and helped me recover the sorrow I have built some moments ago.
With this, I think I could do it...
But what made my mind blank and heart go wild was a scent that I was somewhat familiar with.
I wasn't able to sense mana around me but the vivid fluorescent smell told me that someone was close and was watching me intently.
I would have found it weird being surveillance like this knowing my reputation but when realizing who this fragrance belonged to...I was horrified
'Why the heck she is here!!?'
___________...____________
A/N:- He is a little weak-minded and fragile when it comes to emotional stuff but dont worry. The strong Luna will help him grow up like a real man.
I know it would be irritating to see the Mc hide his abilities but endure it for a short while. After all, he has a reason for it.
And if you have liked the chapter then let me know in the comments~

chapters.title: Chapter 3: Her bullying!
chapters.content:
'What is this place...who is she...?'
Frowning I contemplated upon seeing the weird thing which was displaying an image of a black-haired girl.
Her mouth was covered with a strange transparent thing which I haven't seen until now. And her facial features also looked foreign.
Not to talk about the weird strings connected to her wrist and arm which made it look like her a puppet or something.
I wasn't sure why Austin was so relaxed upon seeing the girl when the person was looking in so much worse condition on the blue stone.
"Ah...I should now get going..."
Suddenly Austin awkwardly got up and started walking away in a fluster.
It wasnt tough to discern that he was pretending to not notice me as he even forgot his shoes to wear before dashing away.
"Wait."
Nearly shouting I pulled his attention toward me, in which I somehow succeeded.
His body jerked and soon the blue rectangular thing from his hand disappeared, more like it was sent somewhere.
"You...Do you know Space magic? Amazing."
I was aware that Austin was an elemental user but he or anyone in the academy using Space Time magic was still unheard of.
Excluding myself, I have never seen a teenage mage accomplish such a feat.
Another thing I found interesting tonight.
It took Austin time to turn toward me while I walked around the bench and got comfortable on it.
"Huh, so what? I-I know various things which your useless mind isn't capable of even dreaming. Just forget what you have seen and...and bye-bye.."
Fluttering his robe specifically to signify how haughty he was...or he pretended to be, he started walking again.
'Hmmm....why so soon?'
Smiling in a way that I haven't found myself with in so long, I drew a magic circle on the place where Austin's next step would have landed.
**Swish**
"Huh?"
Sitting just some meters beside me was a startling arrogant noble who somehow wasn't looking like his usual self at all.
Cute was the word?
Yeah, he was kinda cute at this moment.
"How I ended up here!! Di-did you do something you dumb bitch!!"
He again stood up while cursing me in a way that showed how tough it was for him to say something like that.
It was clear that he had always prepared himself to bad-mouth, anyone as not only today, whenever I have come across him accidentally he always blushed and only with a fake scowl dashed away.
I knew something was fishy with him that's why I followed him today and was reluctant to let him go too.
"No, just sit here."
Using the Diving magic [Nature's support] I pulled out two strings of prolonged grass to hold his limbs in place and make him back down.
"Ah!"
With a small cry, he was held back successfully before I grabbed his hand if he tried to use force again.
"Now stay here with me."
Staring intently at his emerald eyes I made my point clear even though I was sounding a little unusual right now.
This domination, this persuasion... I don't think I have applied toward anyone but with Austin, it felt the most natural thing to do.
Thankfully the prideful prince accepted my request and with redness covering his face, didn't struggle any further.
"I-If you are begging so much then b-but keep your filthy hands away from m-me..."
He was stuttering so much that it took him half a minute to finally complete a sentence.
His tongue was tied in a way like he was limited to only made-up words and the way he was reacting with his body temperature rising, made his arrogant impression crumble even more.
His unsteady glance and the reluctance to look at me straight definitely didn't justify how in the past, he violently cursed my looks and made fun of aesthetics.
Right now I could cleanly perceive how shy he was just even with the hand I was holding.
But I wasn't a sadist to let him suffer...
Or maybe I was.
"First answer some of my questions then I would release your hand."
Austin narrowed his gaze and resisted my advances entirely.
"Leaving this conversation is in my capabilities, Miss Luna Lastov. So don't force me to use violent means to get rid of you."
Being glared like that he somewhat seemed different.
Not that shy Austin was bad, but this determined Austin seemed even better.
"Then try it, I won't force you to stay. But the fact that you can use space magic and have a weird device which no one is aware of, might raise suspicion toward your origin, Sir Austin Wright."
His body jerked visibly as his glare turned into perplexion as he started roaming his eyes in ponder.
But I was only a Saint in the name. I don't like to give my target time to make something to counter before I launch my final blow.
"Won't your pretense would be ruined if they were to know how you always hold back whenever a fight breaks out and how every time you force yourself to say such hurtful comments?"
Now the haughty prince has completely shattered into pieces. The one who was in front of my eyes was truly a terrified being, who visibly wanted to just disappear from this place right at this instance.
But I didn't have enough...
"Not to talk about the ball event. You were clearly forcing yourself to say such a thing about Kyouki right? Don't think I didn't see how your lips were trembling and legs were shaking when Lilia broke off the engagement. Your anxiety your regret, don't assume I didn't saw that because under my watch you can't hide yourself at all. I can see right through you, master~Austin"
I whispered my thoughts from start to end mercilessly in his ears while enjoying the slow reactions he was giving in between my talk.
After I finished my declaration, I gawked intently at the man who was completely different from what I have seen until now.
His face was covered with his long blond hair but his palpitating body told me that he was beyond furious right now.
I was ready for any kind of violence if he advanced upon me, but what I wasn't ready for...
"...demon."
Glaring at me, I was bestowed by a sight that I might not be able to forget for my life, ever.
The arrogant and self-obsessed son of Count Vincent Wright who was famous for his hideous behavior and snake tongue was weeping right now?
His tame expression showed how wronged he was feeling right now. His flushed cheeks, his red nose, his moist eyes were so...
"Adorable".
His eyes became wider as he heard my unintentional voiced remark but before he could react, I moved toward him and wrapped my hand around his head before draping it over my bosom.
Keeping my head over his, I started rubbing his back gently to make this bullied child calm.
"Aw...I am sorry.  I didn't think that my poor Austin would get hurt to such an extent."
I patted his back rhythmically while grazing my hand over his smooth hair.
For some moments he was dead stiff but soon he started to relax enough to the point his whole body was supported by me.
I didn't know what he was going through in reality and what made him forced to do such an act, but there was something I was sure about.
I want to know more about Austin Wright.
This might be the first time for me to feel something like this toward someone but strangely I was happy to gain such a feeling toward Austin.
It was weird how a person who has tormented me for so long still made a place in my heart.
But I didn't hate it...
Remembering his pained look and his teary eyes just some moments ago, I felt something igniting inside me. Something I have kept dormant until now was emerging furiously.
But strangely I was welcoming all of it...
I was accepting myself.
____________.._____________
At the same time when Luna was pampering Austin, a certain figure was staring at the pair from far away.
Standing on a branch of a tall cedar tree a young and handsome youth with midnight shade hair looked at the scene with a complicated look on his face.
From the time Luna hugged Austin, he became utterly furious and enraged at the situation which he felt weird from the start.
The young man who has been bestowed by the goddess of Light and has been looked upon by millions doesn't hold any kind of feeling toward anything special.
Even though he had friends and loyal subordinates, he doesn't feel the spark he feels toward this certain girl who was in his clear perception, right now.
The hero of Humanity Kyouki doesn't have to create nor had built anything or any relationship which could hinder him from his mission.
But only a single girl, was the source of his wavering heart.
He had vowed to never kill any innocent in his lifetime nor have thought to bestow death upon someone just because of his own selfishness.
But looking at this sight, his promises seemed to be shaky and fragile.
Clutching his fist he broke a huge chunk of raw wood from the tree in agitation as a single thought emerged in his mind.
'You better be prepared for the consequences of your actions, Austin Wright."
____________..._____________
A/N:- Leme tell you one thing to calm your anxiety, Luna is hella powerful and could beat the shit out of the hero.
But she won't be the one to do such a thing, after all, Austin didn't gather so many points for the whole year, for nothing.
Anyway, if you liked the chapter then please comment and if you have time then please check the recent post I have posted on my profile wall.
Peace ✌️

chapters.title: Chapter 4: His stress!
chapters.content:
It's been four days since that night with the heroine, which changed my life in a complete U.
The time when she came to talk to me specifically and was reluctant to let go, I was sure I did some mistake in my performance.
But when she started confessing why she took an interest in me, I became speechless.
She didn't only see flaws in my act on the ball night but the main heroine, who had so many vital roles in the story, was actually keeping an eye on me since long enough to know my behaviors and fake words.
I was baffled and shook down the core.
From what I have read in manga, the main heroine was the most famous among the audience because of her cold and aloof personality which seemed completely shatter around me.
I was confused, beyond belief.
And not only that night. She even started meddling in my business more often after that.
Greeting me sweetly in the morning, joining me in battles, helping me in classes, and many other small interactions which I wasn't used to or wanted to happen.
I tried every kind of mockery and taunts in the start but looking at her unwavered determination, I soon accepted my defeat.
But backing down from separating myself from heroin was due to another reason too.
From the manga and what I have observed in this half year, I was sure that the protagonist, Hero Kyouki was in love with Luna.
I wasn't sure about the other harem member as he always seemed dense around them, but I have seen the gaze he directs at Luna.
I wasn't an expert in love matters but aligning the manga plot and the real Kyouki's partial treatment of the saint, it wasn't tough to conclude.
That was the reason why I wasn't resisting Luna as much in my whole capability.
I knew if heroin was to grow close to me, the hero would somehow confront me and that would be my high point to play the villain and provoke him, so I could gain the points.
I know using Luna for this wasn't something I would have usually preferred but at the end of the day, she was the heroine who was destined to be united with the hero.
Even if I don't use her and let things flow as they should have, nothing would change except for the fact that I would not get the chance to gain points.
So I grabbed the opportunity in the hope to clear the weekly requirement before Wednesday.
But...
[Weekly Requirement: 180/1200 VP]
[Time left:- 50h.12m. 26s]
I was doomed.
I only had two days to gain more than a thousand points, which I was never able to do in the past.
I never had missed the weekly hunt that's why I was unaware of failure, but I didn't dare to let it happen.
All this time I just wished her to get back on her feet and smile like she always did.
If my mistake could take the chance of her revival, then I wasn't sure what I would do to myself.
I was leniently letting things happen how they shouldn't have and before I know it, that confrontation with the hero never happened.
Since I was getting paired with Luna but not any harem member or Nobel personality, my points from sparring were also consumed by the presence of the saint around me.
'Fuck... this'd going to be hectic...'
Luckily I still had a chance to gain the remaining point in one go if things happen as I desire them to.
A one-day exploration of the Great Eastern Jungle would happen in which students have to pair with their party members.
I was sure Luna would ask me, which I would eventually accept.
And after that, I would start my plot for the perfect villain scenario.
The plan which immediately formed in my mind was whether directly or not would lead Hero's sword in my direction and it would be the best point booster I need.
I know after what I was planning to do, Luna would not see me in the same light again. Or to say, she would probably hate me in the end, but that would be okay for me.
Well, it would be a lie to say that I won't feel a little lonely without her being around me and such, but at the end of the day, I was nothing more than a minor villain after all, who was destined to be forgotten.
'Yes, it would be for the best for all...'
_______________________
[
Lilia's POV]
'It's strange...'
Making my way inside the base that Kyouki-kun have formed for the general team meeting, I thought of the sudden summoning notice.
Kyouki-kun often used this room for discussion for the future prospectus and how we would participate in lairs and such but at this hour of the night, it felt a little out of place.
Well, since it was Kyouki-kun I knew he wouldn't do anything to me and I was also not ready for it yet, and after seeing the other party members entering the room as well, my little bit of suspicion also vanished.
"Good evening, Lilia-san."
"Good evening Charlotte."
Greeted me with a sweet smile was my friend and comrade in battles, Charlotte Spencer, daughter of Baron Philiard Spencer.
She's a great mage in our team and also a rival I share in a battleground and in romance battles too.
"Oh hey, guys. I hope I am not late~"
The one who excitedly swung inside the room was Venessa Charles, daughter of the knight commander Sir Laviski Charles.
She's a high-spirited girl who generally doesn't get disheartened because of anything. Drawing out any real emotion from her from under her natural facade was only possible for Kyouki-kun.
In the team, she works as the shield of Kyouki-kun which generally makes me envy her being so close to him, but apart from that, I like her.
"Ohayooo*
The one who just yawned while greeting lazily was Sicily Seymour, daughter of Duke Reynold Seymour.
She's the most prominent figure in our team from a political point of view and even in battle evaluation, she holds the most importance after Kyouki-kun.
The versatile nature of hers which she uses in combat by providing any kind of support in need makes her the most dependable comrade and most lovable friend of mine.
Apart from Kyouki-kun, she generally doesn't seem to pay attention to anything or anyone, which we also have become accustomed to.
After we all were seated and were conversing casually, another person entered the room which made my heart flutter in an instant.
Sensing the silence around the room I was sure that every other girl also have been similarly looking at him.
Entered inside was the man I have found my 'first' love in, Kyouki-kun.
(A/N:- I will upload character design in an auxiliary chapter)
"It seems everyone is here."
Smiling sweetly he walked toward the head seat of the table before sitting down gracefully.
But upon hearing his remark my brows frowned slightly.
"Kyouki-kun...what about Luna-san?"
Expecting the healer and the vice-commander in our team to be present during the team meeting was the most general concern. And looking at others I was sure, I wasn't alone in thinking about it.
"Yeah, she should have arrived first from what I have seen so far."
Luna-san was the most diligent toward her duty and was very conscious about what people expected from her, so her absence did make things look startling.
Well, her recent 'actions' which were involved with a 'certain someone' did seem out of place but still neglecting her duty as a guardian wasn't something I expected from her.
All of our eyes were focused on Kyouki-kun who unlike usual didn't have a great expression right now.
"It's about her for which I called this meeting."
His serious expression made us straighten our backs also, as we knew our captain always becomes like this whenever the matter was something which required utmost concern.
Sighing Kyouki-kun leaned back which signified how tense he was about the thing he was going to say.
"It seems Luna has been cursed".
My eyes went wide instantly as I heard him clearly yet my senses weren't able to believe it at all.
"Cursed!? Are you sure about it Kyouki-kun, that it's related to that?"
It was Sicily-san who unlike usual, raised her voice.
Well, it wasnt her exaggerating the matter, more like she was expressing her thoughts most naturally.
Curse magic wasn't something that we were even allowed to talk about inside the campus and here Kyouki-kun presented that someone was under influence of it?
I was too shocked to even speak anything so I just chose to listen for now...
"Yes, I have verified it in these four days when Luna was straying from her usual self. Being involved in things she generally thinks waste of time and expressing her thoughts in a way that I never saw her in. If not for curse magic I don't think there is any other spell that could manipulate a Divinity-ranked Saint to such extent ".
Certainly, her recent behavior has thrown not only us but the entire school into a state of complete shock
The way she expresses her feelings reacts to remarks of a single person's words, and the way she smiles all the time when she stays with that person, never happened when she was with Kyouki-kun.
Her change of romantic preference was the best base to provide support to Kyouki-kun's evaluation for her.
"I trust you Kyo-kun with all my heart."
It was Sicily-san who got up and started her trust in Kyouki-kun.
"Sicily..."
Kyouki-kun smiled sweetly toward the determined Sicily-san making the latter blush excessively before I heard another announcement.
"I never lost faith in you, to begin with, so count me in too."
"Yes, Kyouki-sama I also trust your words."
"It's the same for me too, Kyouki-kun. I also believe in you."
Finishing my words I smiled at the emotional Kyouki-kun who was looking at us with a grateful smile making my heart race all of a sudden.
"Guys you..no, first of all, thank you for believing in me."
It was strange how this person without even noticing gives me butterflies even with his single glance.
Seeing how he generously behaves with us even though he has so many responsibilities, makes me sure that what I did during the ball wasn't regretful.
More like I am thankful to that man that his actions helped me to meet this great person whom I love the most in the world.
'At least you did something good for once...'
Sighing inwardly I sat down just like others when Charlotte-san brought up another matter related to the previous one.
"Anno... If Luna-san is cursed then who is the sorcerer?"
My mind went blank for a second as it wasn't hard to realize the answer to her question and it seemed, unlike Charlotte everyone knew the answer as they opened their eyes wide.
"Ky-Kyouki-kun...i-is it him..."
My shaky voice reached him somehow as I asked in a little disbelief and expectancy for a negative answer but it seems 'that man' was just made for every single evil deed in the world.
"It's Austin Wright who has conjured Luna."
____________________...
A/N:- Uh drama will surely commence.
Um...I wanna clarify something.
The MC would be like this, I mean being punched by others and pushed around with emotional breakdowns for some initial chapters before I will make a path for char development.
And do remember he won't turn hero just because the heroine would be his side. More like he would become what it actually means to be a villain.
Anyway, if you have time then check my profile wall and drop a comment too~

chapters.title: Chapter 5: Her silence!
chapters.content:
Note:- Evey Class of monsters carries three stages except for the last two. The general difference between the classes depends on the monster's strength and bloodline.
The basic idea of each class:-
Common - Those who could be found anywhere in the suburb or nearby forest. Most of the monsters that belong to the Common category don't carry any lethal force which could kill humans in one attack. However if not cautious the uppermost level of the Common category could wipe out an army of Novice Rank humans.
Rare:- Those who could be found majorly in lairs and rarely in the parameter of the jungle. A creature belonging to a rare class could compete with an Expert Rank Human and the higher of this category can go against the whole battalion on their own.
Unique:- Lair bosses/Masters. Generally doesn't wander in the outside world and a particular type could be found in certain lairs. This rank of monster can go against Legend Rank humans.
Terror:- Anonymous appearance at ancient ruins or sites of World War. There is no full proof evidence of how a terror-rank monster erupts but there was a saying that these monsters never left the surface since the disappearance of Demon Lord and are waiting for their peerage to return so they can run rampant again. A Terror Ranker monster requires Divinity Ranked Human.
Mythic:- Those beings who went extinct along with their liege, Demon Lord. The executive who served their lord until the final moment was the creatures who have been mentioned in countless tales and fairy books. A mythic rank monster can wipe a whole nation in one blow and require a full-fledged hero to defeat.
Demon Lord:- The one who holds the planetary level power and could wipe humanity from existence if nothing seemed to interest it. The sole existence whose roots no one has been able to configure nor anyone have been able to see its face except for one until now. Hero Maximus, who is also the blood-related ancestor of the current hero of Humanity, Hero Kyouki.
_____________________
Jungle Exploration.
The trial which every student after passing the first semester of the first year has to partake, once a month.
Even though it's named 'Exploration', the real motive of the trials was to let students know what the real thing they were training for.
The Eastern Jungle was filled with monstrosities and unimaginable dangers which could push a person to the brink of their extreme or help build their foundation.
The mission was to bring anything which one finds suitable enough to pass the Exploration Exam.
Whether it's a newly found herb or a monster's residuals, one has to bring proof of their achievement so the council could evaluate a student's potential.
In the manga, the Eastern Jungle despite being not the most dangerous one among the other jungles was a site where a full-fledged war took place and the shelter where greater demons took refuge.
There was a specific reason for such a future that I still wasnt ready to face or maybe I didnt want to face it.
In the manga, it was the first exploration when the hero saved the main heroine and made an extremely pleasant impression on her.
The same old Damsel in Distress troupe helped the protagonist to enter the heart of the main heroine, Luna and from there the main storyline initiated.
As I remember, there was only a couple of minor demon which were spotted during the first expedition of the hero, which eventually led humanity to know how monsters were close to them even without getting noticed.
There were pretty hectic things that would be taking place which would make the hero grow exponentially and of course, becomes the apple of humanity's eyes.
But I would be at a loss if the hero gets the attention as I still have to gain at least 3 weeks of Villains points to get 'her' back into condition.
I wasn't planning on playing villain after three weeks and would let the story progress as it should without my presence, but the problem was ...
'Will I be able to live until the end...?'
The hero was unfairly strong to the point he could go against the strongest warrior in the school and that was the headmaster. I wasn't belittling myself as I do have magic as my upper hand but Hero has the most dependable weapon with him, which could help him surpass any threats.
'Power of Love&Friendship'.
As he sees his harem as friends rather than lovers his trust in them and vice versa creates an inexhaustible fighting spirit in him which I would probably prefer to avoid.
'But I have to face him today...'
Currently, I was waiting for Luna who went to register our names as a party at the school records.
As I expected she wasn't aware of the hidden malice I was carrying for her.
In all honesty, I was feeling miserable doing what I have thought but this was my last shot to accomplish my weekly chore.
It wasn't something I chose but something I couldn't just ignore because of the fragile state of my mind.
"Did you wait long~"
Waving at me Luna shouted as she started walking in my direction with a blooming smile on her moon-white face.
Thinking that I would be betraying her in some hours made my heart clench. It reminded me of how miserable I have become and what future awaits me, but there was nothing I could do rather than accept such a destiny.
'I am sorry Luna...'
______________________________
[Kyouki's POV:]
'This might be my last chance.'
Clutching my fist, I stared at nothingness while thinking of the way I would be bringing Luna back.
The Luna I knew since day one and the Luna I fell in love with just upon landing my eyes on has left my side to be with a sinful man.
The man who since day one was targeting me for no reason and also was bad-mouthing Luna the most in the past had her on top of his palm.
I didn't know how it happened but Luna was conjured by that sick man.
Since Luna was a divine-level priest I had a clear base to prove that no illusionary or mind-mending spell would work on her.
That leaves only one path for me to lean on.
'Curse Magic'.
The magic which was created and affiliated with humanity's enemy was now being used by a fellow student whom I didn't think was anything more than a child throwing tantrum.
Never had I imagined the silly arrogant would fall into such a state where he would give up on his humanity to obtain the person I treasure the most.
'No, I have to take responsibility...'
As I resolved myself, my team members came inside the meeting room again as I asked them to.
Seeing them so diligently following my plan which was formed on just a hunch makes my heart delighted.
I could never repay the trust they have bestowed upon me.
That's why I had promised myself that whatever happens, I would protect them with my life on line...
...and of course Luna too.
"Let's revise the plan before we depart."
After the greeting, I proposed the idea to recollect the information and plan I have formed and told them last night.
Upon hearing me the four ladies nodded and became serious.
"The motive of our expedition would be to help Luna get back to her senses by separating her from Austin. Since he has manipulated her, attacking Austin would lead us to face Luna eventually. So our primary goal is to create a deviation between them and after that would the main plan begin."
Everyone nodded after passing glances at each other.
I was fortunate to gain such understanding partners who understood my motive and formed their own strategy on how they would hold Luna back.
Despite Luna's nature of magic being the Supportive one, we all knew she was hiding something. Something which could ruin our plan to baptize her, if we were to take a single careless step.
That's why I have organized all of my four party members to divert Luna's attention and give me time alone with Austin.
"Since we don't know what kind of spell Austin has cast on her we couldn't deal with Luna, rather I will use my [Christine of Light] upon the conjurer so we could free Luna and end the demon altogether."
It might be a hasty decision of mine and surely it was making me nervous a little too, but I have to end Austin as soon as possible.
I never had killed a human but unsurprisingly thinking about what he has done to Luna he doesn't seem human to me anymore.
He was a demon who needs to be exterminated.
"B-but what if he hasn't used curse magic on Luna-san? Won't Kyouki-kun kill that person even if he isn't a demon cult follower?"
Certainly, my [Christine of Light] was my ultimate spell until now which could deal with a horde of Unique class monsters in exchange for taking away all my mana, but I wasn't sure what kind of demon have taken over Austin, that's why the blessing of light was my only call.
But the problem was the wavering emotions of my certain comrade Lilia-san who seemed to still have some feelings for the man she once called her fiancé.
It wasn't her fault to have a soft corner for Austin but Austin has become someone which I nor anyone could help with, so resolving myself I went toward Lilia-san.
Holding her hand, I felt her trembling from head to toe which must have come from Austin's memory.
Looking at her red face I assured her.
"I know it must be hard for you Lilia-san to see your old friend and ex-fiancé dying on the battleground but you have to make your will strong. That man isn't a human anymore since the time he sacrificed his humanity for such deeds, so don't let your memories drag you down and help me kill that thing once and for all."
Upon hearing me,  she teared up a little before she asked something in a sniffling sound.
"Kyouki-kun....c-can you hold me for a bit..."
Coming from the shy Lilia I was really surprised nonetheless if it were for my friends and family I could do anything, so this hug was nothing to mind about.
I wrapped my arms around her before she started weeping more soundly this time.
Sharing a nod with everyone, my gaze fixed on my sword which was lying dormant for a long and now it would finally taste the blood it thirst the most.
_________________
[3rd Person POV:]
The exploration takes place in a 12-hour duration starting from 9 in the morning until the downfall.
300 students and more than 50 teams were ready with their weapons and armor intact as they gathered at the entrance of the jungle with a slightly older-looking woman facing them.
She was the instructor who was in charge of the on-field activity of today's class and was also assigned to have a closer watch on a particular Nobel man, or to say, Austin Wright.
"Okay, listen carefully. Whatever you do, wherever you go don't get into danger where you are not confident of winning. The wristband you have would signify to me instantly if you are in a grave situation by entailing me your psychological condition. But even without that, if you think you need help and want to withdraw from the test then just simply tear that band off your wrist. Any questions?"
Since the students were told about the expedition already in classes no one raised their hand before the instructor ran her violet eyes across the field.
Her gaze halted on two groups consisting of five and two people team.
"Okay then go!"
Hearing so, every student disappeared from sight as they jumped inside the jungle at a furious pace.
Everyone took a different route inside the dense forest to get the most loot and complete the test as soon as possible.
As planned Austin was leading Luna to the place where he have suspected uneven mana before, to get the demon's attention and commence his plan.
And the hero's party too, as planned was following the duo from a decent distance to sabotage them and separate Luna from Austin.
'This time I will save you, Luna. Just wait for me.'
_____________________________
A/N:- I know this chapter was kinda boring but the upcoming chapters would make you surprised, cry and even giggle in delight.
So look forward to it and let the comments roll ~

chapters.title: Chapter 6: His fear!
chapters.content:
'It eventually happened huh....?'
Standing in the middle of the jungle where some portion of the land was cleared stood me and my arch rival or I have made him, Hero Kyouki.
My plan was ruined in the first hour of exploration as suddenly I and Luna were ambushed and taken by surprise.
It wasn't hard to discern that the team who came to hold us was none other than humanity's greatest hope, the hero's party along with the embodiment of light, Kyouki himself.
I first panicked but as soon I realized what their motive was I became natural and even started cooperating by keeping myself away from their trap and leading my path completely different from Luna.
Last I saw, the dazed Luna was surrounded by the hero party which made me sad as how I left her behind. But knowing that Luna was their teammate until some days ago, I was sure that they won't hurt her.
Now that leaves me and his face to face.
I wasn't sure what he wanted from me, but when he started shouting something like 'curse' 'demons' I concluded that he has taken a ton load of bullshit as reality
But I wasn't complaining tho...
After all, this kind of confrontation was something I was planning all along, and even through a different route, we ended up the same as I wished.
"Your evil deeds would come to an end today, you monster! How dare you bear your fangs on my pure Luna!"
Shouting at the top of his lungs I saw the hero being in a rageous temperament which I never had seen until now even though I had done so many things to him
This shows what kind of emotions he carries for Luna.
In all honesty, it made me cringe a little...
"Hoh~ So you finally figured it out huh. Not bad~Not bad. And don't assume that I am just manipulating her, I am also using her at my disposal. Doing all kinds of the things which you heroes categorize as disgusting. Ah~ the way she tastes sends a shiver down my spine~"
I acted vulgarly as I felt an enormous amount of mana concentrating in a single place. It wasn't a doubt who was gathering such mana at this moment so I just prepared myself.
Bending my head up I saw the dark expression of the hero which told me that I was successful in ticking out the trigger.
Honestly, that side of his was a little frightening but coming this far I knew there wasn't any going back.
Hero clutched the hilt of his heavy sword before lifting it in midair and positioning the tip of the blade in my direction.
"You have asked for it, do not resent me in your afterlife!"
Suddenly his whole body started shining with radiant yellow light which was descending directly from the sky and getting absorbed in the hero.
My eyes widened in shock as after some seconds I finally concluded what kind of attack he was planning to direct toward me.
'I have to get away ...'
This was the only thought that came up as I saw the light covering Kyouki's blade to the point where it started to seem like a light saber.
'What the heck!!!'
My body which I tried to move wasn't listening to me at all. I was bound with golden chains which I was familiar with. Not only chains were restricting my movements but also sucking my mana at a furious pace.
Due to a lack of alertness, I never thought of this possibility and was getting cocky on my own until now.
"Don't think I will let you flee you maggot."
The smiling face of Kyouki blended with the amount of mana he was collecting at a single place giving the scent of something peculiar ...
...Yes it was of death.
"[Christine of Light]"
"Shit!!!"
A beam of light descended upon the surface as at a furious pace it made its way toward me, destroying every single thing in its path.
The light was so blinding that I wasn't able to see anything at all, before a burning sensation showered over me. I knew I would completely extinguish from existence if I didn't do something...
So I did what I never thought to.
"Lift all my limiters right now!!!"
...
...
[..ert!!]
'Mm...did I recover this soon?' Ah, why is this system shouting..?'
[Alert!]
'Huh...this is something new...'
Forcing my leads I open my eyes somehow after recovering a bit from the after effect of the flashing blow.
It was great that I lifted my limiter at the last moment or I would surely have perished. But what was making me surprised right now was the continuous alert notification flashing inside my mind.
Stabilizing my consciousness I focused on the notification which became more clear in front of my retina before my narrowed eyes went wide.
[Alert! The hero is in fatal danger!]
[Warning! Once the mortal thread of the hero gets severed, the Villain system would collapse entirely!]
This warning was self-explanatory and I wasn't able to conclude how such a thing happened. Fortunately, my body works faster than my mind, as while thinking tens of things, I was already standing on my feet.
My body was burning and aching in pain with my skin at its highest sensitivity.
Ignoring the sweat-building ache all over my body, I focused on my surroundings and got even more bewildered.
'How such a thing happened.'
____________________________
[Some minutes ago]
[Luna's POV]
I was getting surrounded slowly yet visibly by my old comrades once who shared the battlefield with me.
Honestly, I didn't have much sentiment attached to them but looking at how sloppy their formation was, I could not help but sigh in helplessness.
I pretended to not see but I was fully aware of how Austin was distancing himself from me, which made my heart ache but it was something I had assumed all along.
I let myself get bind up in their formation seal which could only be formed when there's an Expert Class Mage.
Lilia was the conjurer of the bind and others were just helping her maintain the spell by providing mana.
Technically I wasn't resisting at all, but looking at their struggle it seemed my mana was acting subconsciously which I also couldn't help.
"Please don't resist Luna-san. It's for your own good that you are away from that monster. Please stay like this and we will save you."
It was Lilia who made me annoyed with her words. I knew what bullshit they have formed by themselves regarding my favourability toward Austin in recent days.
But what made me more pissed was when that woman who only less than a week ago was the fiancé of the person she was regarding monster now.
Truthfully I wanted to obliterate each one of them from existence right at this moment but I held my anger for Austin. I knew acting violently would bring no good so I just stood there motionlessly while gazing in the direction where Austin left.
I knew telling these four morons anything right now would be counted as a complete waste, so I just chose to let them be the boss of the moment.
'Hmm...it took longer than I thought...'
Not so long after a huge beam of light descended upon the earth which was in my full expectancy but knowing who would be under its center made my heart go numb.
My mind went blank for a long second as I heard the things around me chattering again.
"Ah, how beautiful. Kyouki-san finally brought blessing upon us "(Venessa)
"Now Luna-san would be free from that monster's clutches. I don't know why but I feel a little weight lifting my heart".(Lilia)
"I hope Kyouki-kun didn't hurt himself ~"(Sicily)
I was hearing them...
Enduring them...
But not for long as I knew what was about to come so I lightly shrugged my shoulder which dismantled the bind from me, surprising the four.
"L-Luna-san....why are you still....don't tell..."
Without paying attention to the thing that was the shame on the name of a woman, I started walking steadily in the direction where my lovely Austin was.
The ground started shaking violently when I noticed the [Curse Veil] drawing over the sky and covering almost the northern side of the jungle.
I didn't halt there and used mana to stabilize my steps before I reached the spot where I was able to see the whole battle zone.
Beads of tears started forming in my eyes as I saw Austin's condition. He was burnt from head to toe. His fluffy and beautiful hair was black as charcoal was sticking to his head signifying how painful it was for him. His pretty eyes, his small nose, his beautiful smile everything was gone.
His body was trembling from tremendous suffering which I was also able to feel a little inside myself yet I could not comprehend how tough it was for him.
I wanted to touch him right now, but I couldn't.
I wanted to hold him...
To embrace...
To let him feel my presence...
Yet I couldn't do anything just because of the existence of a single damn person.
I was so agitated at the moment that I felt it almost impossible from stopping myself from killing that piece of human trash who regards himself as a hero.
Looking at his panting state I felt disgusted and anger welling in my chest as I resisted at the best of my ability to not let that accomplishing smile of his tear off his face.
I knew killing him would push Austin away from me forever, so I just did what I could.
[Hymn of Eir]
Using my best healing spell I helped Austin to get into a condition where he could move freely before I focused my eyes in the direction where a humungous figure just appeared.
It certainly was something that could be categorized as gigantic as its shadow made it look like the day has fallen.
My eyes despite facing a Terror Class being were still normal as it wasn't something I haven't come across, so I just studied its outer appearance.
Core made of an unknown substance stood a gigantic monster at a height of more than 70 ft. Its arms and legs were like that of a human except for the fact its whole body was made of a sandstone-like substance. Two ruby eyes stared down at us or more precisely at the hero as the monster finally growled its arrival.
"GUOOOOOOOOHHHHHH!!!!"
____________________
A/N:- Sorry for the short chapter. There will be an explanation for why Luna let him get hurt.
And also Luna will help Austin grow as a man and as a villain.
Her role is vital that's why I said this story is not centered on the only male lead.
Anyway, drop a comment if you are hyped for Austin in action~

chapters.title: Chapter 7: His strength!
chapters.content:
Monster and Demon.
As similar as they sounds, they aren't.
Monsters are those being who lives for only three functions.
Eat. Sex. Sleep.
A total animalistic habit that they follow from the time they open their eyes and join the world hierarchy.
Some are born in dungeons and use the core as their food and do everything possible to save their source of energy.
Those who are commonly found don't even get the sense of protecting anything as they just live on their desires and die just like that.
But demons are different.
Even though some of them look similar, they fundamentally carry something that monsters don't even compare to.
Curse energy.
The presence of this curse energy naturally came into existence from the monarch of Darkness, the Demon Lord who brought this sinful energy and planted the first root of darkness in the world.
The creatures who first adapted the curse and become the subordinate of the Supreme Monarch were now remembered through stories and those who came later continued their peerage legacy.
Unlike monsters, who grow at a very slow pace, demons live on their cannibalism and get stronger as they proceed to hunt all their life.
And also, unlike monsters, demons since they open their eyes have a single desire kept on repeating in their consciousness, and that was to...
Annihilate humanity.
The newbie demons don't carry anything other than massacre but once a demon attains a certain level they get their own consciousness and could think about how to proceed to end the human race.
In either case or in at any level, demons never change.
But for a thousand years, the high-class demons have gone dormant after their liege was subdued, so the possibility of one of the high-rank demons belonging to [Terror Class], appearing out of nowhere was thin as a thread.
Yet...
_._
'How the fuck something came up at this time ....?!!!'
As I remember the first time protagonist visited the jungle he was only met with a dozen of the lowest ranking demons which he naturally obliterated without breaking a sweat.
But this living golem was at least on the first stage of the Terror rank from any perspective I could perceive.
I have faced a Unique class once when I was exploring one of the lairs, but this was on whole another level.
The dense curse energy, the sheer murderous intent which was making my stomach churn, this humungous body that was oozing with danger was making my inner mind shout to run away at this instance.
But I couldn't run away when the hero was kneeling on the ground with his face paler than a sheet.
It was to be expected as the hero was far from ready to face something like this. Heck, not even the Headmaster would be able to defeat this alone, who's among the [Saint Rank].
Gawking at my surrounding I concluded the space has changed as I wasn't able to receive any kind of mana out of a certain range.
'Is this the veil...?'
Knowing full well, that no reinforcement would be arriving nor the hero would be of any help, I concluded that I had to face this demon alone.
'System how many villain points do I require for the week?'
Collecting mana in my right hand I commenced a spell that needed not more than a couple of seconds to form and looking at the unmoving demon I knew I had enough time.
[Ding!]
[Weekly Requirement:- 2800/1200]
[Due to the surplus host being granted a bonus reward other than the basic ones.]
[Does the host want to open the bonus?]
[Yes/No]
Being questioned about something related to rewards, I did what I usually do.
'No, throw it in inventory.'
Sighing I looked back at the towering figure of the humanoid golem-like creature whose whole body was made up of sandstone and the only aesthetic visible was its two ruby eyes, which currently was fixed upon the hero.
The receiver of such gaze was panting heavily because of the attack he used on me and also the heavy pressure he was receiving from the golem.
'Ah, it's been long since I let loose.'
Cracking my neck, I jerked my legs before a heavy breath smoked out my mouth.
Focusing my eyes on the thing, I activated my first skill in this whole half year.
'Gravity Manipulation'.
My feet rose in the air before I started ascending at a furious pace. It took me less than ten seconds before I climbed around 70 feet in height and now was matched with the eyes of the demon in front.
Strangely or not, the creature was still fixated on the hero which slightly irritated me but it's not like I unwelcomed it.
Soon my spell was in its dischargeable form covering my both palms with amber shade. With the temperature, I had right now at my disposal I could even evaporate a whole pond in seconds.
Naturally, I didn't feel anything from it, but it doesn't mean, my enemy would feel the same as me.
Circulating mana in my desired direction I shot toward the demon's head. Just when I reached some meter away from the demon's forehead I twirled abort and using the inertia landed my palm with more ferocity.
[Touch of Inferno]
**TINGGG**
Immediately where my hand touched the demon a loud vibration formed sending waves into the monster before I finally found the result of my labor.
**BOOM**
Half of the crown of the demon's head was obliterated with chunks of rocks falling on the ground.
The sound was so loud and vibrant that it shook the surroundings and finally the demon also got interested in my presence.
Surprisingly or not, the place which I broke just now regenerated immediately before I found a huge sculptured hand coming in my way.
'Fuck...is he taking me as an insect or something...?'
I dodged the hand flawlessly and used the same technique with my other hand on the rock demon. But same as the previous time it went futile.
'Since small attacks work on you...'
I made some distance from myself and the demon before I initiated another spell.
My mana without [Limiters] was high enough for me to fight with high-rank spells for a day or two. But still, I didn't want to let this continue more than necessary because of various reasons.
A huge black and crimson shade of blaze formed on top of my raised index finger. The size of it was the same as a two-story house with heat that could burn a small village without extinguishing even after annihilation.
I was using such high-class spells because I knew the monstrosity in front was nothing to take easy about so I went with my best.
[Hell Blaze]
I launched the attack toward the monster, who this time moved properly and not only with a sway of hand but it actually protected its face with both arms in guard.
My advantage was that the thing was made of sand, well not entirely but enough for me to devise my plan.
The hell blaze contains the heat of about 4000°C and when that temperature meets the sand, one thing happens...
"GUOOOOHHNHHH"
The demon's hands were shifted into a liquid state due to the effect of the blaze. I seized the moment and applied my other spell.
[Cetus]
At my command, a huge creature made of pure aqua emerged on top of my head before I pushed it onto the golem before it could flail anywhere else.
The natural phenomena worked and the liquid magma was cooled with the steam of hot gasses leaving the demon's arms.
The growls and agony of the Terror potential demon were resonating heavily to the point where my ears were going numb but I couldn't just sit back when I finally got the chance to hurt something finally with my full capability.
'Yes, this is it...'
After the steam was blown what came was a pure prismatic crystal which was reflecting some of the daylight diverting in seven different shades.
The demon was also fascinated by such sight even though it was the one who was getting toyed with.
I didn't waste my time and using gravity manipulation, I accelerated my speed in a whole different league with my fist clenched in a tight grip.
'Let's end this!!'
[Titan Thrust]
Using my body as a spear with my held fist as its tip, I breached through the arms of the demon shattering the glass on my way, before my attack was met the place where the core of the demon resided.
In between its eyes where I knew would be the end of this battle and as I expected my knowledge wasn't just a hunch.
**CLINNNG**
**CREAK**
A cracking sound erupted with the impact before I felt something crystalline breaking inside the tough surface of the demon.
In place of a loud cry, I heard nothing from the monster after I broke its core. Only its heavy body that was falling in my direction made me realize that I won this battle without taking single damage at all.
My eyes went a little wide when a sudden realization hit me hard.
'Ain't I too OP now...?'
__________________
[Venessa's POV:]
'What the hell just happened...?'
In front of my eyes, human's greatest nemesis, a demon and a high class at that rose and fell in a single hour.
A [Terror Ranked] demon was something I could not even dream of facing with my current strength nor I was confident of winning even if I was to fight with my whole team including Kyouki-san.
A monster that could bring chaos to a whole capital surely sounds highly tough to defeat, yet I saw its fall right with my own eyes.
Since the time I felt the space around me changing and this humongous creature rising from nowhere, a sense of death surrounded me with my will to even flinch leaving my soul.
I was ready for a gruesome death along with my comrades and looking at Kyouki-san's expression it was inevitable for us to get crushed here, yet something miraculous happened.
The person who should have been dead by now suddenly used levitation so brilliantly that I started doubting whether he was only using a Magic stone or did he have any artifact.
But his levitation wasn't the only thing that left me speechless.
The high-rank spell he used, the versatility he showed in the one-sided battle, and the sheer determination which backed his confront blows made my mind go numb.
I mean from what I remember he was only a single element user yet he was using two different elements consecutively and High rankers at that.
I was astonished beyond belief.
I have beaten him a couple of times in the past because of the vulgar comments and deeds he tried upon me and my comrades, but he never countered with any spell at those times. And that strength he displayed at the end was nothing I could compare myself to.
[....%?@?&%....]
Wait, was he holding back all these times when he could have wiped us with a single spell?
[℅®℅XX©℅&%@#@%]
But why did he showcase something like this today, when he clearly could have run away and left us to die here?
[%℅℅€%@&%%@&%]
Was it his plotting? Was he the one who called that creature to win our trust and become the hero!?
[....%&X....]
Yes, it must be that!
He must have wanted to show that he was more powerful than Kyouki-san so he could win over us and become the hero of humanity when he was the one who we should be terminating first.
Clenching my fist I bit my lips hard until a thick liquid didn't dye my taste buds as I stared at the haughty bastard who was clearly celebrating his fake victory with a disgusting smug plastered on his shitty face.
'Seriously, how low can you fall, you treacherous Austin Wright!!'
___________________
A/N:- Ah, some drama would be arriving and the commencement of the true story. And yeah don't worry I would add a lot of fluff shortly in the story.
Remember Austin never uses System's reward because of his righteous foolish thought process, which the evil Luna would break and make him go super OP in the future too.
Please support me on Ko-fi if you want regular chapters as I have to delay my work so I could write.
And do stop by the comment section tho...~

chapters.title: Chapter 8: His misery!
chapters.content:
'Ah'
Painful inaudible grunt left my lips as I twisted my forearm which gave a crisp sound given my physical condition after I received the blow from the hero. It wasn't hurting much but still except for my face I was like living charcoal right now. Thanks to the spell-weaved school uniform that I wasn't butt naked right now.
'Ah, here it goes'.
