After I defeated the demon in the jungle, the [Curse Veil] naturally got disrupted, and when it did, the bearded old man who also happened to be the headmaster of the academy, came toward the scene at a furious pace.
It was to be expected as the band Kyouki was wearing was severed slightly and since the veil was prohibiting anyone to come inside the whole school was in an uproar.
Seeing the greatest embodiment of Light trembling so profoundly on the ground like his soul have been sucked out of him, the audience which came to see him was highly stressed.
Kyouki's harem members also seemed to be in a great grief as they were crying and wailing floods upon seeing his state.
I never spotted Luna since the time I left her at the start of the expedition. I expected her to be with Kyouki again if things were to happen as I thought, but surprisingly she was just like disappeared from the face of the earth.
Now, who was left was me and the fallen demon who was getting inspected, and I...
....was getting interrogated.
"A [Terror Rank] demon erupted out of nowhere and you who are still struggling to break through your Novice rank defeated it? Even children's fairy tail would sound more believable than this."
The one who entirely disdained me with his high and mighty tone was one of the council officers who govern the school from the sidelines and was the link that connects the academy and the main capital.
Not only him, the other 10 council members, 48 instructors, and professors along with the [Saint Rank] Headmaster Merlin were present in the Principal office.
I was sitting solemnly on a chair while being weighed by those many stares who were trying to figure out the lie which I never told.
"Since there were four witnesses who saw it happening, we can't deny that Austin has defeated that thing in the jungle, but the fact a demon appeared out of nowhere is still highly concerning".
The headmaster was somewhat level-headed but the problem was I didn't want them to know that I defeated the demon as it would only become a pain in the ass.
Fortunately, they were more focused on the topic of how it happened not how it ended.
Upon hearing the headmaster's call, everyone seemed to drown in their deep thought which thankfully didn't concern me.
I was just waiting for everyone to know that demon never went away and the hero was the trigger that awakened its sleep from slumber. That's all.
But it wasn't like I could tell them knowing the fact that I shouldn't have much knowledge about demons in the first place, but flipping all my overthinking thoughts, someone unexpected brought a solution to this unwelcoming situation.
"I know how all this happened !!"
Shouted at top of her lungs was the red-headed warrior hero of the academy, Venessa Charles, and the person who despise me most in Kyouki's harem just because I don't engage in combat.
Well now maybe Lilia hates me most...or...maybe Luna...?
My internal monologue was broken as the boot clanking on the floor echoed in the room attracting every gaze toward the sudden intruder.
"Do you know how this happened student?"
One of the council members raised from his seat in anxiety as he asked the girl who was glaring daggers at me. I knew something was misunderstood but my hazy mind wasn't capable to discern anything at the moment so I just went with the flow.
"Yes, I know who brought that calamity upon us and made Kyouki-san like that."
Even the headmaster became serious as he supported his chin on his intervened fingers before leaning forward on his table.
The whole room was dead silent and waiting for the next word that Venessa would be saying as it would probably decide what course of the brutal act they would be bestowed upon the preparator.
'Ah, this is hectic'.
"The sole person in this whole campus who's able to use curse energy and the person who intentionally brought that demon on the surface so he could show his fake might and get accepted as a hero, is none other than the shameful human trash, Austin Wright."
______________________
'Finally, it ended.'
Steadily walking to my dorm I sighed in weariness.
Since I was labeled as a demon cult follower, naturally they would have caged me up and slaughtered me mercilessly.
But it wasn't like I could just accept anything thrown at me, so I made my point that I wasn't a demon worshipper.
It took me time but they finally accepted my plea only on the condition that I would get through a baptizing which the Pope of the capital would partake in two days from now.
It would eventually prove whether I was lying or Venessa misunderstood the whole situation.
Until then I was banned from classes and also was ordered to remain inside my dorm whatever happens or I would be labeled as a criminal or something.
Seriously, fighting like this for the first time in my life really did exhaust me so I nodded whatever they said just so I could get out of that depressing place.
Finally, my heavy steps reached my private quarter before I spotted my maid standing at the front gate with anxiety plastered all over her pretty face.
I naturally got out of my daze before I fastened my feet and asked with a frown.
"What happened Carol?"
The maid who usually stayed emotionless and cold-faced all the time was panicking like this meant only a few things, and expectedly my hunch was right.
"Young master...Lord Vincent has come to visit you."
My eyes widened in shock as I heard the name of my dad attached to visiting me. He never in this half-year contacted me even though many of my complaints traveled to the town I come from.
The all-time busy Count visiting me at such a sudden time of year meant only one thing...
'He got the news of that incident.
Merely four hours have passed since that incident yet my father was here proved two things.
First, he had one of the professors or staff as his spy, and given my father's position, it wasnt surprising much at all.
Second. To come at such a short time from such a long distance meant he used [Teleportation ] which wasnt commonly used by even high nobles, which signified how furious he was.
I gulped unconsciously as I thought of such a thing as even though I have done so many things past this year I never have come across my parent's anger.
Not to make him wait long I immediately went inside while checking my attire a little. Pulling my collar to hide my burnt skin I knocked on the door twice before I went inside.
"G-good afternoon, father."
Stood silently with his wide back facing me was undoubtedly the person whome I regarded as my parent in this life.
Count Vincent was a Knight Commander in the First Order of Capital in the past, so he usually spent his time on the field rather than at office work.
Due to his rigorous work in a battleground and the numerous experience he has gone through, his whole aura oozed with dignity and danger.
The mountain build which was adorned with cuts and bruises spreaded on his face finally turned toward my direction as the two narrowed eyes of my father landed upon me.
I visibly shuddered a little as I concluded that he was far from pleased to see me after this long, but I stood still with my head lowered.
"I heard about the incident."
His heavy voice resonated in the room even though he was just stating things in his normal tone.
Knowing already his reason to visit I didn't express any kind of reaction and waited for his next word which probably would be punishment for my unverified deeds.
Walking toward the sole big chair inside the room he sat on it before continuing.
"Since your birth, we never expected nor raised any hope from you. Do you know the reason for it ?"
Being asked about the reason why I was treated partially than my elder siblings for the first time, I was a little startled but nevertheless, I replied with my head still leaning down.
"No, father. I am not aware of it."
After a brief pause, he continued.
"When you came into this world a prophecy was bestowed upon you. The foresight was, that there would be a day when you'll become the greatest enemy of humanity. To change your destiny there wasnt anything in our capability we could have done except for killing you. But neither I nor Sophia had the heart to kill the offspring we brought in this world."
Throughout his explanation, I was dead and froze at my place with beads of sweat forming over my whole face and eyes at their widest range.
Prophecies weren't something to scoff about in this world and if I foresaw the way father was telling me, then I was thankful for how kindly they treated me until now.
But the problem was how such a thing was prophesied when I didn't have such strength or intention to go against my own kind in the first place.
'Wait...is it related to the system...?'
This conclusion was the only resort I landed upon as in my sane mind I would never do the thing which I hate the most.
"Until now whatever you did, I never meddled in that but today you showed what I feared the most. You became the thing I could never accept or associate myself with. Fortunately, neither I and my wife nor my children grew any feeling for you, or else we would have only regretted it at this point in life."
I knew what he was telling me was not all true as I wasnt a demon cult follower, but would it matter even if I tell him?
Being disdained and loathed since birth seemed to hurt but now when I know the reason for it..it still is hurting.
Doing my best to hold myself together I just stood silently waiting for him to finish.
"I never told you what to do as I could not restrict your actions. But there's one thing I could do which would save the name of my family from any future shame. Do you know what is it?"
My body jerked slightly as I held my face upward and looked at the man wide-eyed trying to not believe what he just meant and wishing that today was nothing but a dream.
But nothing goes as one wishes...
After my father rose from his seat he walked toward me, before he started to speak his conclusion which might change my life forever.
"From this day on, I, Vincent Wright, cease the authority of you to attach my family's title with your name. From this very moment, you are no longer part of the Wright family."
Since there was no way to turn the decision that the Count stated, I could just accept my fate.
Controlling all my emotions which were making my vision blurry and mind hazy I only replied in a single word, before the person I previously called father, left my room and my life forever.
"Understood."
_____________
[Carol's POV:]
I was walking to and fro around the door where young master Austin walked in some minutes ago.
I knew there would be consequences for the blames the young master has been charged with, but the Count visiting himself was still out of my expectations.
I was well aware of my young master's deeds for which he was getting tormented by the whole academy and also scorned by his own blood relatives, but there was something which was telling me young master wasnt involved in this matter at all.
He could be mischievous and a problem creator but being a criminal, I highly doubt such thought.
Even though he has used various means to torment me in the past, it doesn't mean I could see him the way,  others were assuming him.
**Click**
Suddenly the door was clicked open before the patriarch walked out of the room.
I immediately lowered my head and stood by the wall. His steps audibly came near me but contrary to my expectation he didn't walk away but stood just in front.
"Pack your luggage and along with other servants return to the main residence before tomorrow morning."
My closed eyes shot open as I heard him loud and clear but before even I could have raised my head, Lord Vincent already walked away.
I gawked at his back with my mind repeating his words and thinking about the reason why he asked me and the others to return when the young master's academic year was still in progress.
'No way...'
As soon as a clear conclusion formed in my mind, I was already in a rush toward the young master's room.
**Click**
"Young master!!"
My previous unsettling thoughts shifted to dread as I saw the naked upper body of the young master who currently was changing his uniform.
His whole upper body was burnt with every cell of his body in its worse condition. Even though I wasnt the one who was injured, looking at his current state I couldn't help but cringe in a fret.
"Ah, Carol. Sorry for this unsightly appearance."
He was more embarrassed to show me this sight of his rather than being pained about such physicality.
Large drops of tears subconsciously formed at the corner of my eyes as I walked forward to help him wear the coat that he was having difficulty putting on because of his condition
"Thank you for the help, Carol. So you coming here in such a rush means my fa- I mean Sir Vincent has already asked you to return to the main residence,  right?"
My hazy mind was so clouded after seeing him that I was only able to discern some of his words which also contained how he referred to Lord Vincent as.
My doubt was cleared at that very moment which didn't help but made tears from my eyes fall even more.
"Y-young...master...w-why..di-"
My words were interrupted by the young master as he brought his hand toward my face and gently wiped my tears.
"Why didn't I retort my charges and told him the truth? Well, to be honest, it doesn't matter anymore Carol. Count Vincent just needed a cause to disown me, so not now but anytime soon he would have done what he did today."
His words were reaching me yet I wasnt able to comprehend anything. I was continuously weeping while getting pampered by the young master who never had touched me so gently before.
I didn't know what happened suddenly to him. It might be because of this sudden visit of Count, but I could not find the same young master in him, whome I always loathed.
In front of my eyes was only an innocent teenage boy whose beautiful yet grieving eyes clearly told me how defeated he was feeling right now.
But I couldn't do anything for him now when I never even looked at him properly since I was assigned to serve him.
I felt so pathetic...
"Y-*sniff* young master.."
"Don't cry like this Carol when we are about to separate. It will only leave a bad taste afterward. Here take this..."
Suddenly he brought a heavy pouch out of nowhere before he took my hand and placed it on top of it.
"It's the earning I have saved from my adventurer work.".
My eyes went wide as I again felt the bag and indeed it had coins inside which by weight seemed a lot.
"I can't accept this young master...!"
I immediately tried to return it as in the first place for the work I have done I should only have received his usual taunts. Being rewarded like this didn't help but made my heart heavy.
"You deserve it, Carol. To be honest in these 18 months with you, I have felt alive and needed more than ever. You gave me the warmth I ever desired and yet I returned it in such a disgusting way previously."
His face suddenly took a regretful smile as he directed his words. Looking at his expression I thought about whether I really knew the young master.
Because in front of me, there wasnt the haughty prince I have been with this short time, but only a pure teenage boy who was confessing his wrongdoings and trying to do his best to compensate for his deeds.
How could I help but not feel moved by this...?
Honestly facing the previous young master who never spoke to me with a straight face, seemed easier than this honest young master who was making my heart sink and drowns in endless regret.
"Young master...cant I stay with you...?"
Upon hearing me he shook his head in all seriousness before her reminding me of what I had nearly forgotten because of my emotional breakdown.
"You mustn't Carol. Your family has been indebted to the Wright family which even you want, you couldn't get rid of. Leaving the family just for the sake of me is far from sensible, so don't even think about it ."
I nodded stiffly with my head hung low as possible as my face was miserable enough to not let show in front of my young master.
Suddenly my both hand were held by the young master before his gentle voice reached my senses as his words which I might not be able to forget ever, got engraved inside my mind and soul.
"Okay then, Carol. Even if it was for a short while I was happy that I got to know you and got served by you. I know I didn't play a good role as your master but please remember this, in this life I don't think I would have ever found a maid better than you. Thank you for being with me until now, Carol."
_________________
**Ding**
'Hmm... it's already midnight?'
I looked at the clock which had the needles aligned and pointing to zero hour.
Carol and the other servants which have been serving me, left the dorm some hours ago since they had to return to the main mansion before morning.
I didn't meet Carol when she was departing as I knew my presence would only hurt her and also it would pain me too, to see a dear person leaving my side.
But there wasn't anything I could do.
I was disowned by my family and had my surname snatched in just an instance.
Even though I never felt accepted in that family, still being told so directly that I no longer was their son nor the youngest brother of my siblings anymore, filled my heart with bitterness.
I no longer was crying as I was since evening. My skin has long lost regenerative capability because I didn't use any kind of potion on it, but I was in no mind to get concerned about it. I was a complete mess all over.
Maybe I was overthinking things, but it was so long since I felt this lonely in this world.
In my previous life, I still had a person who cared for me and always stayed by my side whatever happened.
But in this life, I never built a relationship that I didn't sever with my own hands.
The family I was gifted with in this life never thought of me as their own.
The person whome I vowed to live forever with also cut ties with me because of the way I treated her.
The first maid I had in my life and who genuinely cared for my well-being also had to go away because of certain actions of mine.
And also the person whome despite being the center of attention of millions of people, tried to get closer to me, and grew distant from me because of some unreasonable reasons and my own selfishness.
I might be whining right now but these thoughts were something I could not suppress as I desire.
I just needed someone with whom I can share my grief ...
Someone who cares for me and someone whome I can make smile...
Someone I can wholeheartedly show my affection for and receive the same....
...someone whome I can love and feel being loved..
I just...
Need...
Someone...
...
...
"What will you do without me, you poor child."
Suddenly I heard a familiar feminine voice of a person just some inches from my back.
Even without turning, I knew who she was just from her peculiar fluorescent but I had to turn my head to confirm that my anxious mind wasn't making delusions.
There stood the most beautiful person I have ever come across in my life, currently standing with a helpless smile adorning her moon-white face which seemed to shine even more under the dim light of the room.
My world which was getting darker passing each second seemed to lighten up just with her mere presence. I couldn't help but smile foolishly upon seeing her before my choked throat pushed only a single word out of my mouth.
"Luna".
_______________________
A/N:- Ah, this was long.
The main story of the MC transforming into a villain would start now onwards.
Remember he won't be a crazy ass villain who would slaughter innocent mindlessly but more like an anti-hero who would manipulate scenes for his selfishness and slap those who would torment him.
Anyway, I would upload 5 chapters in advance on Patreon so check it out and also please consider a donation on Ko-fi if you are liking my story~

chapters.title: Chapter 9: Her confrontation!
chapters.content:
People say those men who cry are weak-willed but in my perception, those men who cry are the most genuine people.
It wasn't like I haven't seen men cry before me for various reasons, but when the person I care for, wept his grief wordlessly while being dependent upon me, I felt very delighted for being needed by the person.
Not to boast, but many people would love to be with me, but I never found anyone worthy enough of my attention because of the greed they carry for me.
Lust and Power was the most common sin I was targeted with by the populace which made my heart solid rock and my resolve clear that whatever happens, I would never fall for anyone.
Yet when I saw a certain man who was hurting himself time after time, getting targeted by most of the people around him and loathed by these many people, just because of the fake act of a haughty noble he shows in front of everyone, but in reality, he was just a pure innocent boy. I felt my heart warming up a little.
It wasn't because of the weird thing I got to know about him, but the reason he was doing such. Well, spying on someone wasn't something I prefer but when it's about the person I was interested in for the first time, I just couldn't help it.
My heart was moved beyond belief. I was so much swept by the actions that being used by him as he desired didn't feel much of a deal, but only to the point where he wasn't hurting himself.
But when his plans brought him into such a pitiful state I decided to finally come out of the shadows and cooperate with him without holding anything.
It might be the first time I was getting involved in something so wholeheartedly yet I was loving the way I was thinking and behaving these days.
I felt alive for him and wanted to live for his sake...
I just only need him now...
"So what are you going to do from now?"
Gliding my hand across his fluffy hair, I asked Austin who was currently laying on my lap like a cute baby.
At the start he was reluctant but as soon I persuaded him with the teary eye technique I have practiced during these four days, he accepted everything I asked him to.
Well, asking him everything at this point would be a rushing thing so I only restricted myself from being intimate with him like this.
Who knows about the future...
"I will go through this baptize or whatever they want me to, and continue my daily life as a pretend villain."
Saying so he closed his eyes when I suddenly asked the thing which was hurting my stomach for a very long.
"But why do you have to behave like that Austin? Is there any personal goal of yours behind it?"
He clearly heard me as his eyes went wide open before he looked at me in shock. He abruptly got up from my lap making me all lonely, before he rejected my question.
"N-no such thing could be possible. Don't spout nonsense all of a sudden ".
His stutter was everything to tell me that he was presenting me with a white lie. I held his arm tightly in my embrace before I looked at him with a pained expression.
"Won't you tell me, Austin-sama? Ain't I a person trustable enough?
I purposely blinked repeatedly to show my pitiful expression which my past self probably would have died seeing such, from embarrassment.
Austin turned a deep red before he snatched his eyes away shyly. I doubted such a runaway strategy, yet again I also wouldn't have let him tell such an important thing without giving him some kind of assurance.
I closed my eyes and using the Holy Magic, created a contract that was regarded as the [Promisery Vow]. While I was at it, I also engraved the content required to be followed and the name of the parties.
Opening my eyes there was a faded brownish paper levitating in mid-air which was giving a faint purple glow ensuring that the content was written and the final acceptance was only required.
Looking back at my partner, I saw his eyes a little wide but from his not-so-amused expression, it seemed he knew what it was.
"I think you have an idea what it is, so I will go into the contract detail only ."
I handed him the paper as I started to dictate the clauses I have included in the contract.
"This contract prohibits the remarked party, from spouting anything which would be discussed in this room. The one who would be breaking the promise would have to compensate with their life. Now, is it okay to let you know my trustability, Sir Austin?"
I asked him while tilting my head and a natural smile across my face. Despite hearing me the caution prince still went through the whole contract before he asked me something.
"Hey, Luna....it only says the one who made the contract can't talk things outside. It doesn't include me...did you make a mistake ."
Shaking my head left to right I made his doubt clear.
"Of course not. I mean, how can I let my precious Austin get in danger with this contract? This contact is something you need to trust me so don't think about the useless stuff and fill out the form."
He pondered for quite a while before he finally seemed to let go of his reluctance as a defeated sigh left his lips before he pinched his lower lip and kissed the contract as in to fulfill the acceptance.
'Oof...how lucky...'
"I don't why I am telling you all this or what would happen if someone was to know what I am going to tell you, but somehow I feel I can't escape from you, can I?"
I shook my head without hesitation with my eyes crescent in elation.
I was glad that he knew I was a heavy woman whome he couldn't get rid of.
"Okay then... let's start from the start. I know my story would sound pure bullshit but please don't try to laugh in between okay?"
I nodded and immediately faced him properly with my legs going crisscrossed on his warm bed.
His eyes wandered at my exposed legs for a bit but soon he snatched them away. Well, it would have been better if he had stared at them all he wanted but of course, I could not say it, just like that.
His heavy breath seemed to calm down a little as he took a little time to collect his thoughts before he faced me and drew his eyes directly on top of me. I felt a little tremble running down my spine but looking at his serious expression I knew it wasn't time to flirt, so I kept my mouth shut.
"The fact is ...I-I actually am a reincarnated..."
And his story started from the time he died and was born in this world. He told how things were different from his previous world, and how he lived before he found this thing called the 'Villain System'.
I reminded myself to keep on giving him a shocked expression from time to time but in reality, I wasn't surprised at all.
How can I be when I actually knew all these things since four days ago when I sneakily read his mind when he was asleep?
Well, the night I saw his memory for the first time in my life I felt my Spell broken. It was too much for me to digest. For a second I thought all these memories of Austin were just made up and I was getting deceived.
But I knew very well what my Spells were capable of and aligning with the fact upon how Austin have behaved until now and the girl he was watching on that blue stone which was literally known as 'Smartphone' in his last life, I was sure that all these memories of Austin were a complete truth.
It took me almost 12 hours to digest all the information I saw in those memories.
Getting to know that I actually was a fictional character drawn on pieces of paper in Austin's last life's reality, made me feel insecure about my privacy.
But I knew it was all my thinking. The theory of the multiverse wasn't proven but it was unheard of.
I memorized everything and concluded why Austin's behavior was like that even though he clearly was forcing himself. From that day onwards my slight interest in Austin turned into a complete attraction or to say  I was on the verge to be called obsessed with him.
Knowing how hard his life have went until now and how lonely he was, the instinct of being his sole support ignited inside of me.
The reason I didn't kill the trash with the surname Sudou today, was because I knew Austin's villain system would collapse as soon I end the foolish hero, that's why I decided to stay hidden.
It was hard to believe something like System and reincarnation in reality but in the face of Austin, I could accept anything.
...
"So that's how is it. Until one month I have to pretend like a villain so I can save Saya, my sister, and get a normal life."
As I have seen he narrated everything perfectly except for the fact that he have seen this world in his previous life through a comic book.
Well, it wasn't that I could just confess now that I knew things he didn't tell me about, as it would make Austin wary of me, and also it would feel I was making fun of him by giving such reactions, so I held back my urge.
"This person Saya...was she close to you Austin?"
I knew the person from Austin's memory but how close they were was still not clear that's why I asked. Not like I was annoyed about her being dearest to him as that pitiful child was fighting death as we talk here now.
Yes, I was definitely not jealous of that little girl even Austin showed such a warm gaze when I asked about her.
I am definitely not...
"Saya huh. You can say that I was alive and moving forward in the last 20 years of my life was just because of her. Even though she was just a neighbor of mine she was close to me like a sister and always cared about my well-being. She always saved her pocket money to help with my necessities. She even saved her birthday cake and sneaked out a huge piece of it for me, so I can have such delicacy once every year. To say how much a person could grow close to someone, then for me and Saya we couldn't define. I think my love for her could not grow any more than it actually is."
Since childhood, I was a very calm and silent child who never got agitated even though someone was taunting me right to my face.
But hearing him, I feel all my past accumulated anger was wailing up and releasing out altogether.
I was constantly suppressing my mana so it doesn't go berserk and eventually hurt Austin while I heard his sweet words flowing out for his good sister.
Hmm..sister...?
'Yeah, she is just a sister and not even a person of this world ...why should I fear her? Fufufu...I was just worrying needlessly.'
"Um...Luna, are you okay?"
Suddenly being asked like that I fell out of my dark side as I nodded subconsciously.
"Y-yeah...I wasn't thinking anything insidious so continue."
I wiped the sweat off my forehead as I said my honest thoughts.
It seemed Austin went speechless for some reason as he started stuttering before he jerked all of a sudden as he asked me something which for a long time made me tongue-tied.
"That reminds me. I wanted to ask something for a very long that why Luna has had such a favorable impression of me to the point she forgave me even though I betrayed her? And how come, Luna was able to sneak inside my room like this even though she's just a Holy magic user? I wonder if Luna is also hiding something from me~"
**Gulp**
___________________
A/N:- Next chapter would be in continuation with the layout of a future prospectus.
Donate me on Ko-fi if you like my work.
And on your way back please type&post something in the vacant box at the end of the page~

chapters.title: Chapter 10: His Comfort!
chapters.content:
"To answer the latter part of your query, then I think I have to tell you something about myself first."
Spoken in a dimly lighted room sat the person and me, whom I had been terrified of the most for some days.
The person who was once my farm of points suddenly took an interest in me and started noticing those things which I wanted from my ex-fiancee.
To be honest, how much I tried to deny her advances and thought that her presence would hinder me in the future, her being with me like this genuinely makes me feel happy.
I have no such person in this life who, after getting tormented and even betrayed once, would come back to me like a stubborn kid who's reluctant to let go of their parent.
Well, even though I behave like a kid more than usual in front of her, it doesn't change the fact she returned for me.
For her, I was no one. Without me, she wouldn't have lost a single cent, nor being with me would have given her a whole life's fortune, yet she decided to stay by my side for whatever reasons.
I still was unsure why she was so persistent and understanding with all the stories I had told her about my life until now, but there was one thing I was getting a little scared about.
I was reborn here, lived as a noble, and acted like an arrogant asshole, yet my heart still belonged to a young adult.
Even though I had never been in a romantic relationship with someone before, I was very well conscious of those feelings. Being cared for like an apple of the eye, having such a beautiful girl's attention like this made me furiously terrified of something.
I may be reacting more than I should have, but these were my honest feelings that kept hitting the back of my head since Luna came into this room.
Suddenly, Luna inhaled deeply as some nervousness visibly surrounded her aura. I was a little tense, too, as the main plot I read in my previous life didn't justify any of the heroine's backstory.
I just knew that Luna comes from a royal family of far western lands and has been living low-key to achieve her goal without using her family's background.
"Austin...please don't hate me when I say it but...I...I am not a human ."
As she said, she opened her oceanic eyes, which were now radiating with a strange glint adorning her precious eyes. Her eyes were looking majestic at the moment.
I was so immersed in her eyes that I never noticed where she asked me to check.
"Mou~Stop staring already~ I'm serious here."
Her pout brought me back on track as I hurriedly put away my gaze with a faint 'Sorry' along the way.
I never intended to stare at her, but her eyes were so mesmerizing that I think they could fail a succubus in charm.
'Hmm'
My averted eyes finally glimpse the place she was trying to show me earlier.
Her hands, which in the normal situation should be silky white in the shade, were now white, but it was far from humanly.
She was practically illuminating. Her arms up to her elbows were glowing with serene porcelain white light like it was covered with some kind of oceanic fluid.
"Th-This.."
I was so flabbergasted that I never saw Luna's expression and asked while still trying to figure out what I was facing at the moment.
"As you can see, my humanity has been taken from me in exchange for a blessing I was granted with at my toddler's age. The reason I can use different spells and can handle mana so easily is this."
I heard her and found myself amazed thoroughly. From what I saw in the manga, Luna never showed any sign of being a god Apostle or sort of whatever situation arose.
Even in the face of the heaviest punishment or most incredible pain, she always remained the same like Holy Magic was the only thing she was taught.
But suddenly, that same Luna was showing something like a change in her whole trait and diverting her from the original self.
It sure would thrill me enough to stare at her hand like an idiot.
But I guess I was insulting her like that since she snatched her hands away not so long after.
"Sorry for showing you something like that. I know it looks disgusting."
Her dry laugh at the end and the way her beautiful eyes lost their shine made my brows frown and my heart clench in slight pain.
I hurriedly held her hand, which she was trying to retract, which made her subconsciously widen her eyes toward me.
"Aus-.."
"Don't make something up with your own assumption. Neither I am disgusted nor do you have to say sorry for anything. Rather than disgust, the only emotion I have right now is amazement and attraction toward these beautiful hands of yours. I might be sounding cringy, but these are my honest thoughts. Please don't reject my emotions like this."
I held her hand rigidly in my grip as I muttered all my mind out to let her know how I felt about these discoveries about her.
To tell the truth, I felt gratified to know something which Luna hadn't told many people, or maybe I was the only one.
"A-are you s-serious...Austin...you aren't making fun of me, right...?"
Hearing her staggering voice, I couldn't help but sigh in my heart. It was the first time I had seen Luna in a such terrified state.
I didn't know she held me this close, that my opinion would make her scared.
Holding her hand gently with my left one, I lifted my other arm and brought it over Luna's head before I started caressing her softly.
"Don't even think that I am making fun of you. I am indeed a little surprised right now as it's the first time I have seen something like this, but it's just that. As I said, these hands of yours and the eyes you showed me some moments ago only shouted one thing in mind; you know what is it?"
Her eyes blinked in innocence, and her small pouty lips shrank like a cute baby. Upon hearing my remark, she meekly shook her head while staring at me in astonishment.
Bringing my hand toward her fluffy cheeks, a smile formed on my lips before the word came out of my mouth, which I always think whenever I look at Luna.
"Beautiful."
Her dormant eyes shone more brightly than ever before as she stretched them at their widest point. Her mouth became slightly ajar, as it seemed she was trying to say something but failing miserably.
Involuntarily a chuckle left my lips which made her come back to life again as she again pouted with her cheeks puffed to the fullest before grabbing my hand roughly.
"Stop playing with me!!"
"Ah."
Suddenly Luna jumped over me, making us fall on the bed in intimate proximity. The distance between our bodies became non-existent with her head draped over my chest, and almost all of her body pressed over me.
The softness and heat I felt all over me was something I might never be able to define with mere words. But in contrast to what I was feeling right now, it would be heavens beyond belief.
Her intoxicating fragrance, which was so peculiar that I could now identify her presence without looking at her, was overwhelming in the air right at the moment.
I have hugged women in the past, but the heat of Luna's body supplying me wasn't even comparable to the warmth I had felt from someone else.
It wasn't uncomfortable. Far from it. More like I had never felt comfort this much before, to the point where my natural embarrassment, which should have flared up being in this position, never showed any sign of rising.
Strangely, this feeling was so solacing that I thought all my worries disappeared instantly
"It's comfortable hugging me, right?"
With her eyes narrowed in mischief, Luna asked me with her chin supported by my upper body.
As she said, I indeed was hugging her waist like I didn't want to let go of her at all. I immediately retracted my hand before I apologized.
"Sorry, but it's too comfortable for me to resist-"
Suddenly Luna grabbed the arm which was previously on her back before she muttered something to exhaust all my reasonings.
"Who told you to resist? Enjoy the moment, and don't let such formal thoughts hinder your desires."
Her words felt genuine, or maybe my mind was clouded enough to let me believe they were her honest thoughts of hers as I brought my hand back on her waist and snuggled even more closely than before.
I have been near a person of the opposite gender before,  but being in such an intimate situation with such otherworldly beauty was my first time through and through.
It was an unreal feeling.
The room soon fell silent as the sound of two hearts beating resonated in my senses vividly, with faint, heavy breaths coming just some inches below.
This serene silence with such a blissful cuddle made my mind blank for some moment until Luna brought me out of my stupor.
"Hey, Austin..."
"Hmm."
I hummed with my eyes still closed as I heard her slightly unusual, tensed tone.
"Don't let others hurt you anymore."
My eyes slightly parted as I tried to see her expression, but due to our current posture, I could only see her silver hair as her face was drowned on my chest.
"Please don't let others wound you anymore. I know I am in no position to say it, but seeing you like that, hurts me. I understand why you are doing such, but please don't let anyone give you such misery again. Won't you listen to me for this once, please?"
Her almost weeping sound caught me off guard as, for a moment, the thought of abandoning all my Villain system arose inside.
But soon, I slapped down such thoughts, and for some time, I only calmed my raging heart, which, after hearing such a fragile voice, was beating like an uncontrollable beast.
It wasn't the thing she said that tempted me. Instead, it was just her tone that, for even a blink, made me lose all my sanity.
I soon calmed down a little before I held her shoulders gently, and while straightening my back, I made her sit down just some inches apart from me.
Looking at her sad eyes, I couldn't help but sigh in worry and admiration at how beautiful she could look with any side of hers.
"You know I can't stop being a Villain until I don't fulfill the wish I desire the most right? Even if you ask me, Luna, it's beyond impossible for me to leave the role and start a new life now."
I told her what was true. Even after a month when my wish for curing my sister would be fulfilled, I was sure that returning to everyday life would not be possible because of the shitty behavior I had showcased until now.
Honestly, I was thinking of returning to my family mansion and help father in his work, but now that option has also resigned from the front. So being an adventurer was my only option.
But the following words Luna said pulled my full attention, which was getting diverting because of my future plans.
"Then do what a villain actually does."
I blinked twice in confusion as I stared at her aimlessly, trying to figure out what she had just said.
"Hmm?"
"Austin, do you think that being a villain only means getting trampled upon or getting cursed? Do you think if you get crushed by others, then only you would be called a true villain?"
Even though her words were a little cruel and disheartening, I nodded in bafflement.
What she said was all true, and that's what I have been following since day one after getting my Villain System a year or so ago.
But looking at Luna's exaggerated sigh, I thought there was something she wanted to tell me. Something that would change the path I have been walking and the life I have been leading. Something...
"Listen, Austin. From now on, what I am going to tell you would change how you have been treated until now, and not only that, your new self would make the whole Eden Academy know what an actual Villain is capable of. I promise to make you a being whom no one would dare to trample from this day forward."
...which might change my destiny.
_________________..__
A/N:- Luna's past would be revealed steadily, and her personality too.
If you liked the chapter and are hyped for the next one, then let me know in the comments. Sayonara~
And yeah, if you want to read advance chapter then visit
https://zetrotranslation.com/novel/isnt-the-wannabe-villain-too-cute/
I update there daily.

chapters.title: Chapter 11: His arrogance!
chapters.content:
In a brightly lighted hall, which has a width of more than 300m and a length double of width, stood tens of people varying in age and appearance.
By the background setting, the hall looked like a church because of a couple of white robes-wearing priests who stood by the aisle with solemn expressions on their faces.
Apart from them, some people were wearing black and red robes with the similar logo of a bright eight-stroke sun adorning their uniform.
These people mentioned above were the professors and instructors of Eden Academy, where the case of demons was brought up some days ago.
The crowd of teachers was standing on a different side from the priest as they stood silently, waiting for the person in question patiently.
Today, the baptism of the person who was alleged to be associated with demons would be happening in the church.
The person who, despite being on the threshold of newbie rank, actually defeated a [Terror Class] demon and also the person who sent the hero of humanity in a state of despair.
Austin Wright.
Since the capital partially controlled the school, and the news of demon appearance was by no means small to be concealed, which made the interference of the Capital became inevitable.
It goes without saying that if demons started popping up with a student as it's a catalyst when the most crucial resource of humanity was also part of that academy, the Capital wouldn't be relaxing from the sideline.
To have a firmer grasp on the situation, a single person was sent by the capital to surveillance the case.
The said person is the court magician of the empire and can defeat the headmaster of the Eden Academy if push comes to shove.
One of the most talented mages in the world and the most powerful in the nation was currently standing in the corner of the room and was gawking at the scene like a god looking down on puny humans.
This specific arrogant behavior of his made the whole surroundings awkward as well as tense.
Apart from the court magician Alex's egoistic behavior, what people feared was his judgment.
If, by any chance, Austin proved to be a demon cult follower, then the options of revolution in the Eden Academy would rise higher than most teachers' expectancy.
If a student had been studying in the most trusted academy in the nation despite being a follower of the cult, which was the nemesis of humanity, the situation would become severely dangerous to turn blindfolded.
There were tens of jobs as well, as reputation was on the line today, solely depending upon the innocence of Austin Wright, who still hasn't made an appearance.
"He sure doesn't have a sense of time, does he?"
Alex spoke with his eyes curved crescent with a voice clearly signifying how annoyed he was right now, standing up for more than an hour now.
"We have sent someone to look out for him."
Beside him stood the white-bearded wizard with a calm expression on his face, completely betraying his unsettling inner distressful storms.
The Principal was also well aware of how it would throw black ink on Eden Academy's name if Austin were to be proven to be an evil entity, but he couldn't just have let Austin roam like that.
But the unfortunate thing was that the headmaster learned about Count Vincent throwing Austin out of his family name after he announced the baptism.
If not for Austin's background, the headmaster would indeed have just kicked Austin out of the school and have asked some people to take care of him afterward, as being a responsible headmaster, he couldn't just let an evildoer wander freely in the world.
But nothing could be done now when everything was set up. It was practically impossible for Austin to escape until he was on school grounds, so what now the old man could do was wait for the inevitable.
**Tap**Tap**
Suddenly the footstep of a single person resonates in the big hall, naturally attracting every gaze.
Tall, handsome stature, correct walking posture like a bonafide noble, emerald eyes which in one glance could terrify anyone but upon closer look could make one immense in it, coupled with platinum blonde hair was all adorned by a single ex-nobility and the person with the most incredible popularity at the moment.
Austin walked solemnly without minding the gaze he was getting directed with from different sides of the room.
His affinity with mana was more significant than what he had shown until now, so even the Court Magician Alex, along with the headmaster, was hiding from normal perception; Austin was well aware of them.
Despite being thoroughly surprised to sense such an excellent mana presence in the room, he didn't have any motive to back now.
After what 'she' had asked him to do and taught him in these couple of days, he was sure nothing would go back as it was once he landed his feet in the room.
And strangely, he wasn't scared of it.
Maybe it was because Luna was on his side, or he was trying to find a suitable person to rely on until now, which Luna took the role of, but there was one thing he was sure of...
'There's no going back from now on.'
Being glared at by numerous teachers with a mixture of disdain and hope comprising those gazes, Austin made his way toward the podium where the prominent priest was standing.
"You finally showed up, huh...I thought the name of God made you piss your pants that you ran away."
Despite looking like a calm type of person, the head priest was a vicious man who loved to bitch people in their face, and when the person was a suspect of a demon cult follower, the priest wasn't even holding back at all.
Austin just shook his head with a sigh displaying how child-like behavior the head priest was showcasing, which made the latter one's veins pop in agitation.
But Austin has no intention of playing with the older man when he had another older man to throw into trouble.
"Before I turn myself in, I want to talk to the headmaster. If not, then forget about Baptising; I won't even think before bringing another calamity to school."
Austin's words were highly subjective, making the people present in the church gasp audibly with astonishment and subtle fear spreading like a sheet on their faces.
It didn't take a genius to guess what 'Calamity' Austin was talking about as something similar to catastrophe recently has appeared in the vicinity.
The fear of losing their job amplified; however, the terrifying thought of facing the Terror Class Golem or something similar was heavier than their jobs.
Even the headmaster was powerful enough to handle a terror class demon, but what if any two of them appear?
And what if a [Mythic Class] suddenly decides to show its face and starts to run havoc among humanity, starting with the Eden Academy?
Every being apart from Alex became pale just from the thought of facing Mythic Monsters, which a Hero could only handle. And taking the current power level of Kyouki, the populace couldn't help but sigh in worry.
**Swish**
Like a harsh wind, the white beard Wizard appeared in the center of the church. His raven eyes were fixated on the young blonde youth, with visible anger filled in them.
The all-time aloof and calm headmaster was getting agitated after so long didn't help but add more burden to the atmosphere.
The unconscious mana leak from the headmaster was making people breathless as they somehow held their ground and resisted the urge to vomit in the holy place.
"You! What do you want now!"
The headmaster's voice was low, but it echoed in the hall profoundly enough to reach Austin as the latter mentioned gestured to close his ears in response to the loud noise.
"Take it, easy old man. Don't come to complain if suddenly your pharynx chokes just because of your exaggerated reaction."
A few thick veins popped on the wrinkled head of the Academy's head Wizard as he heard the arrogant prick's disgraceful words.
But the headmaster's hair wasn't white for nothing. He knew Austin was trying to provoke him, but why? The Wizard was unaware of it, so he took the safe route and calmed himself down before asking.
"Tell me what you want, student."
He took a complete abort in his temperament as he asked Austin in a much calmer tone even though his aura was oozing with danger a couple of blinks ago.
Truly terrifying.
Austin raised his brows in fake astonishment before he coughed twice and stated the matter he was currently most amused upon.
"Since someone has dared to tarnish my reputation in the whole school, I want an apology if I came out innocent from the test you guys are putting me i-"
His sentence didn't even conclude when one of the senior instructors turned herself toward Austin with wide eyes as she shouted at the top of her lungs.
"You want the daughter of Knight Commander to ask for forgiveness?!"
It wasn't just a question but also a threat that Austin must take back what he said as what he asked was highly concerning and nerve-wracking.
The daughter of the Supreme Commander Charles was herself a very arrogant and prideful woman. If she was to ask to kneel in front of anyone other than her father, no one was sure whether the questioner would get out alive.
And even if Venessa agrees to plea for forgiveness in front of Austin, the person whom she calls 'Papa' would not let this thing slide at all.
Everyone knew what might the knight commander Charles carry and how terrifying he would become when it came to the reputation of his motherland or his family.
Even the aloof Alex, standing in the shadows, became pale as a sheet as a memory of Charles flashed in his mind of the time when Alex joked about Venessa in the past.
The whole room was terrified to even think about such a thing as an angry Knight was a disaster himself, not to talk about the Knight Commander himself.
Every eye wasn't leaving the blond youth, who was calmly standing by the shocked eyes of the Prominent Priest.
"Kid, think before you speak, or you'll lose your head in no time."
The sweating Priest muttered under his breath, which only Austin could have heard, but the latter one ignored like a buzz of a bee.
"Yes, I want just what you said, professor. I want Venessa to come and kneel in front of me to ask forgiveness for the blame she delegated to me. If you can't fulfill this wish of mine, then forget to even touch a hair strand on me."
The agitation, the agony for the possible insight, the fear of something irreversible was weighing the whole atmosphere like how water damps cotton.
The people praying for Austin's innocence some minutes ago suddenly took a 180° as losing their jobs was better than losing their head from the blade of the mad Knight of Royal Order.
"Do you think we will let you go away even if your wish isn't fulfilled, you bastard?!"
One of the instructors walked forward and launched chains of bind toward Austin with agitation and terror clouding his mind to think anything clearly.
Purple chains of mana advanced toward Austin at a furious pace. The bind was powerful enough to restrain a [Unique Class] demon, but no one has ever thought such a powerful spell would be played like this...
**FLICK**
Just as the front chain was about to touch Austin, he brought his left hand forward at a speed that was untraceable by various in the room before he flicked in the open air with his tightly held index finger.
**BANG**
In an instant, all the binding chains disintegrated into particles as the conjurer was thrown into the air with force applied in counter to his spell.
The instructor who attacked Austin crashed into the church's main entrance with a loud bang, followed by his pained groans.
A considerable gasp resonated in the church as everyone witnessed the true strength of Austin for the first time. But no one was aware that Austin didn't even use even 5% of his actual worth.
The previously tensed Alex was now looking at the scene with amazement and amusement covering his demeanor.
The raw strength of Austin's mana was able to dispel the magic of such a level wasn't something anyone had anticipated, which naturally put everyone under a strong influence of danger from the arrogant youth.
Looking at his front with cold eyes, Austin spoke in a voice that sent fear down the spine of every person who was previously looking at him with murderous intent.
"Any second misbehave, and I wouldn't ponder for even a blink before turning this place into a graveyard even I turn one of the dead souls in the process. So think before you act. "
His voice neither carried haughtiness nor agitation. He was stating his point in the most emotionless tone one could mutter.
It was the first time when someone had come across such an Austin who, without moving, was able to send such dreadful shivers to the listeners.
But strangely, it wasn't the headmaster who spoke his decision but the voice which only the Headmaster had heard until now.
"Agreed."
Every pair of eyes fixed on Austin turned subconscious toward the person who strolled toward the headmaster before he stood facing Austin.
His face had a wide grin as he adjusted his single lensed frame before he again spoke without even minding the consent of the head of the school.
"I, Alex Nuèye, the sole head court magician of the Gram Empire, promise you that once you proved to be an innocent here, I will personally bring Student Venesaa to the church right away and let you have your compensation for the humiliation. Is that okay?"
If Austin wasn't aware of Alex's presence or personality, then Austin might have been surprised by his sudden appearance and such a cooperative offer.
But there were some certain perks when someone already has lived the world once through drawings and text once before.
With a similar wide grin, Austin turned forward to the prominent priest, baffling the latter, before Austin spoke in a confident tone.
"Baptise me, old man. I can't wait for my juicy compensation~."
_____________...______________
A/N:- Drop a comment if you're liking the story so far~

chapters.title: Chapter 12: Her plans !
chapters.content:
[Luna's POV:]
'Everything is going as I thought...'
Currently standing at a corner inside the school church, I gawked at the sight, which was so profoundly pleasant that I found myself falling into a stupor quite a few times.
Even though I was meant to pay attention to the people engaged in the baptizing bullshit they would be performing on my Austin, I was getting distracted because of the unfair Austin.
The way he shut their mouth by warning them coldly, I found such spectacle nothing less than majestic and handsome.
The way he dispelled the spell and arrogantly intimated them nearly made me lose my mind and damp my nether region.
He was utterly domineering.
'Am again getting carried away.'
Slapping my cheeks, I again pulled my guard as the priest finally got done with his fifth baptist on Austin and the fifth time showed the same results as before.
"How can this be possible!"
"You are saying that a Newbie class defeated a Terror Demon single-handedly...? Bullshit! I won't believe it even if I die".
"But what we have choices? He easily disintegrated Professor Nil's binding chains like he extinguished a match with a quick blow."
"Nothing seems to be comprehensible today! "
The murmurs were flaring about Austin just as I wished.
It was undoubtedly quite notable how Austin dispelled such a spell with a flick and defeated such a high-ranking demon all by himself, but it would be surprising for those who don't know him.
Well, in Austin's case, there won't be anyone other than me who would know this side of his.
The fact that Austin's mana was so pure and overwhelming made things much more acceptable for me. Even though I was confident in my appraisal skill, the amount of mana Austin hid was way more than my expectancy.
And not only that, the points or something he gets from the system along with artifacts was still unused, which naturally could have provided a heavy load of power-up.
But the pure Austin didn't use such rewards because he thought those things were earned by making someone cry or sad.
'Oh, my innocent child...'
I sighed with my head shaking left to right as I thought about what I had to correct in my precious Austin to make him an absolute villain.
Well, what I wanted to turn him over wasn't a villain, but instead how a man should think and behave in this cruel selfish world.
Austin named it Villain, and so did I.
"Now Court Magician Alex-san. As you promised upon your name, please bring me my honor."
Austin commanded the court magician, who was grinning all the way until the baptizing didn't end.
The way he looked at my Austin was disgusting enough for me to let him get eaten by leeches as he saw his death with his own eyes.
But me, as well as Austin, was aware of how valuable that mage was for us. But that doesn't mean I would let him advance toward Austin more than necessary.
**Click**
The magician, without saying a word, bowed and left the church silently.
The old man headmaster was dead silent since the time Alex promised to bring Venessa to the church and look after baptism; his current self of his seemed justifiable.
It was decided from the time I told my plan to Austin that sooner or later, he would have to face Venessa's muscle-headed father to gain Nation-level popularity.
At first, Austin was reluctant, but my cozy persuasion made him surrender.
It was still unclear to me how [Charm] didn't work on him, but when I asked with puppy eyes, he accepted my proposal readily.
'Maybe it's because of his last life....no..'
The thought of Austin knowing my true powers felt unreal as even in the previous life, in the comic book he read about this world, there wasn't any mention of me using any other spell other than 'Holy Magic.'
I didn't know whether the real me and the comic me were the same, but I have resolved myself never to get entrapped in such depth of eternal hell by falling for such a scumbag human named Kyouki.
**Click**
The door soon swung apart as two people entered the church, followed by Alex.
As simpelton as ever, the hero of humanity couldn't just leave his harem member to go on such a challenging mission like just saying a simple 'Sorry,' alone, can he?
Sighing, I rested myself on the nearby wall before directing my gaze upon the scene.
'Well, let's just enjoy the show for now.'
____________.._______________
[Austin's POV:]
'Luna was right...'
I nodded inwardly as I witnessed the things Luna told me would happen happening right in front of my eyes.
As she said, Hero Kyouki didn't let Venessa come alone. To be honest, I had a high doubt about whether anyone would accept my desire to bring Venessa here, taking his father's position into account.
But thanks to the brain-dead Alex that everything was happening better than my expectancy.
Well, to be honest, I was a little scared...behaving like this and showcasing my power without restraints, but somehow it wasn't an unpleasant feeling.
First time I wasn't getting thrown like trash or receiving curses without flaring back.
Even though I behaved like a barking dog in the past, it doesn't mean I didn't have any self-respect. I just suppressed it for my villain's point.
But the Villain's Point receiving continuously on my tab made it clear that my approach was wrong. I could have preserved my dignity if I had thought of this method before.
But what happened was also good as if I behaved like I am right now, then I might not have drawn close to Luna as I have grown in this one week.
'Urgh! I want to see her really bad...'
Fighting my urges, I came across the angry couple who had been glaring daggers from the time they entered.
The people in the surrounding mostly has covered their mouths as they saw Venessa walking toward the aisle where I was standing.
Well, it has to be expected as the wild Venessa cooperating so sincerely was an unreal spectacle in itself.
"You...what trickery you used this time...?!!
It wasn't Veness who shouted instead, her savior.
The hero lunged forward and grabbed my collar quite harshly with his flame-filled eyes just inches apart.
The strength he was applying on my collar would have choked a Newbie ranked student until now, but unfortunately, I wasn't the person they had evaluated me until now.
From the perspective of raw strength, Kyouki was undeniably superior to me by many of the folds, but when it comes to mana supplement, I was sure he didn't stand a chance with his current strength.
'[Enhancement]'
I surrounded my arms with a thick layer of mana which amplified my strength quite a lot to the point where I was confident of destroying a 5-meter pillar with one punch.
Bringing both my hands on top of the hero's, I pulled them slowly apart.
'Hmm?!'
Even with my mana enhancement, it was incredibly tough for me to get off his hold while keeping a straight face, but in the end, I succeeded.
The wide-eyed hero who failed to maintain his hold on me looked so shocked that it felt like he had just lost arm wrestling to a toddler.
"Keep your hands in control, hero, before you lose them."
Saying so, I pushed Kyouki lightly by tapping on his chest. The shock of defeat didn't let him control his movement, and he ended up staggering by his own limbs and falling on his butt.
"Kyouki-kun!!"
"Hero-sama!"
The principal and beauty jumped to help Kyouki as the latter one finally got out of his stupor.
"You monster!"
Vanessa growled at me as she supported her beloved with murderous intent clouding her eyes.
But I didn't intend to see their lovey-dovey at the moment, so I called for the Court Magician.
"Sir Alex, isn't it time for you to fulfill your promise? I don't have all day to waste here. Someone is waiting for me too, after all."
The last part came out in the spur, but the heavy mana leak from the hero and the boost in my Villain's point proved my slip of the tongue as a good omen?
'Seriously, I feel like Ntr'ing the Hero.'
Shaking my head, I saw Alex walking forward with an amused look on his face just like I had before he whispered something in Venessa's ear.
I couldn't hear the content, but looking at the bitter expression on her face, it seemed he must have used some chivalry principles or her father's name to corner her.
"You don't have to, Venessa ... It's okay for me to have the blame".
The hero held the damsel in distress as she was about to walk forward.
"No, Kyouki-kun. I always thought that I was nothing but a burden on you and everyone else. So just this once, when I have the chance, please let me have it."
The pure and consensual act of sympathizing with each other while receiving tears and praise from surrounding felt...awkward to me.
But well, that's my opinion.
For what I was waiting for was finally happening as Venessa gave a last squeeze to Kyouki's hand before walking toward me with heavy steps.
Her eyes were still rebellious, but I didn't have anything to do with it. I was doing all this for my own selfishness, just like in the past, but I only changed the course of my approach.
Finally arriving some meters from me, Venessa lowered her head before inhaling deeply as some words flew along with her exhale.
"I...I am sorry."
"Eh? Did you say something? Sorry, the wind was heavy. Please repeat."
Well, what I said was my honest thought, but it seemed to flare differently.
Vanessa looked at me in a way where if eyes could have killed, she would have burnt me thrice already. And not only her, but I also felt heavy mana from the bystanders.
'Ah, it's getting tiring...'
Finally, after some moments, it seemed Venessa let go of her pride, and with a deep bow, she finally uttered the words I had never thought of hearing in this life from her.
"For the blame I put upon you, I ask for your forgiveness."
My eyes went wide as her words traveled up to me.
No, it wasn't her apology that shocked me but rather the white and black screen, which I have grown accustomed to seeing but not something like this has ever happened before.
My mouth parted as I read the content, only to feel disbelief shrouding my consciousness.
[Ding!]
[You have changed the main plot by an extreme margin! Due to the host's action, the real-time situation has shifted to a different conclusion. ]
[Congratulations, you have attained the completion of your second Quest]
[Destiny Manipulator]
[Reward:-
1. 1000 Villain's Point
2. Mystic grade Exterminist
3. Hidden Skill (Locked) ]
____________________...
A/N:- The chapter was a little fast-paced as I didn't want to drag this scene for long. I was first planning to merge the previous chapter with this one, but it would have become hella long.
Anyway, the arc of becoming overpowered and displaying the true might of a villain would be commencing, so look forward to it~

chapters.title: Chapter 13: Her Wild Thoughts~
chapters.content:
"You did great."
Currently lying on my lap was my precious Austin, who, after handling the church matter, returned to me obediently.
I didn't know that my obsession with Austin would enhance so much in so less time that not being able to touch him or talk to him would make me so much panicked.
Apart from my grandma, I never grew closer to anyone in my entire life.
But Austin was different, or to say if my grandma, along with the whole world, stands at one side and Austin on the other, I was sure which side I would lean on.
I wasn't aware of what made me so addicted to him, but who cares?
What I wanted was right in front of my eyes, enjoying my warmth and providing me with his presence. And that's all I could ask any more.
"It's all thanks to Luna that I was able to handle so many things with such ease. If you haven't trained me properly before, I doubted whether I would have withstood such amount of intent from my surrounding."
My love whispered some sweet words with his eyes closed as he enjoyed the caress I was providing him with my hand over his hair.
He likes it when I fawn over him.
I was fortunate that Austin doesn't open his eyes whenever he makes such an adorable face, or I might scare him...
"I just gave you the framework. What you said and how you acted were all your hard work. So stay silent and let me pamper you."
Austin sighed in defeat before turning his face toward my belly. The urge to rashly hug him until he doesn't go breathless and I end up accomplishing something irreversible rose inside me.
But thanks to the perseverance I have cultivated for so long, I was able to resist my devil and let the relationship nurture before I could partake my wild thoughts into reality.
It would happen; eventually, I just have first to build the road, so I don't push my Austin away.
"But Luna...was it okay to provoke Venessa like this? I mean, I did get a tremendous point gain, but what about the consequences? We both know that numerous professors would fill the capital with the news of the church, and in a day or two, the knight Commander would make his appearance."
Austin's a little worried tone made me clear that he was aware of Commander Charles' 'Blade of Despair', but because he had kept hidden the fact about knowing this world, he couldn't confess Captain Charles' secret weapon to me.
To be honest, I wanted to tell him about the fact that I knew Austin's secret, but there was a side of mine that still wasn't prepared for it.
Maybe I feared Austin's distrust toward me, or perhaps he might come to hate me...
'No, it's fine how it is...'
Subconsciously the hand on Austin's hair clenched as I thought of the possibility that I never would like to pursue.
"Luna, are you scared?"
Oblivion about my actual thought, my caring Austin held my hand as he directed his gentle gaze toward me.
I held his hand back with a clear smile returning to my face as what Austin has faced until now; stress would be the last thing I would like to delegate to him.
"No, I am not scared, my dear Austin. And you also don't have to worry about the Captain. Despite being so much famous for war God and whatsoever, there isn't a chance for him to come out victorious when I am standing right beside you. Remember, Austin, whatever happens, I will always be at your side, shielding you from any possible threat and pushing you always to move forward. So stop worrying and rely on me at times like these, okay?"
I gently brushed my thumb over his cheeks as I assured my beloved that in this world, even God wouldn't dare to touch him when I was by his side.
And I wasn't promising him baselessly. I had the confidence and strength to keep my words, and after meeting my love, I found the goal I had always longed for.
Now I had a reason for whom I could let go of my restraint and regret nothing in the process.
Now I had someone whom I could call mine...
"You sure sounds manly sometimes, Luna."
My brows frowned as I heard my sweety talking, not something sweet, but the giggle he let out after his words had already worked as compensation.
"Do I look like a man to you, Austin?"
The reason I complained despite not being angry or knowing full well what he meant was I hoped that he might compliment me...
"Who said? For me, no one could be more girly and feminine than you. Not to talk about the beauty you adorn which leaving any man, I doubt even any woman could behold. I meant it was the way you just committed things."
...Yes, I love you too~ ♡♡.
Sadly I wasn't able to confess back my feelings as fluently as he did because I knew Austin really didn't love me that much to choose me over his blue marble chick.
I want him to say, 'I love you the most, Luna. Please let me impregnate you' and I would go 'Khya! Please be gentle with me', types of scenario.
But he hasn't opened his heart to me until now, and I knew that would take time, so I was happy with my imagination alone.
"..What I really want to say was, you don't have to shoulder my responsibility. It's a truth that I am and will be relying on you, but that doesn't mean I would like to become a burden on you."
I became speechless as his words reached me.
The first thing that came to my mind was...
Can a person be this much, pure?
I highly doubt whether a person who, despite facing so many difficulties and shitty people in each life, would be so much gentle and considerate toward others.
If I didn't have my [Mystic Eye], which I used on Austin at the start of our relationship, then I might have thought of him using flowery words and faking his behavior.
But now, I was ashamed of why I ever doubted my beloved's word and thought anything otherwise. He's a kind and lovely person through and through which this world wasn't worthy of.
That's why I was hogging him all for myself...
"Don't worry, Austin. You won't become a burden on me, not today, not tomorrow, not ever. We will support each other while sharing our grief and enjoying our happiness together. So, please be with me until the end, okay~."
_______
On the same night, when the two love birds were conveying their feeling through words and enjoying each other warmth, a very chilly atmosphere surrounded the place miles away from the academy.
In the continent's center where the significant officials and most trade centers were based, along with the residences of some selected high nobles, the Kingdom of Gram.
The palace of the emperor was the only place in the world that was wholly made of Gold and rubies.
The main palace showed how resourceful and prosperous the nation of Gram is.
And there was a reason for such prosperity in the kingdom, as compared to other continents where losses have never left their sides; for the Gram kingdom, those losses have been minimized due to the presence of excellent troops the Kingdom nurtured.
In the Gold Palace, a person wearing a black uniform with his whole body covered and only some portion of his upper face up to his eyes visible sat in an extravagant reception.
The person was so hidden from the outside world that if not heard his voice, people might misunderstand him for a woman.
The reason for his thin limbs and soundless movements was due to the job he performs in his everyday life.
The person soon got up from the comfortable couch as he heard the guard on the door announcing the arrival of the person whom the shrouded man came to meet.
Upon sensing the incoming presence, the shrouded man turned on his heel before he landed his left knee on the ground with his right hand over his chest as he bowed respectfully.
"This lowly one greets the emperor."
The person whom he regarded as 'Emperor' passed by the kneeling man without batting an eye to the gesture before he plopped down on a big sofa that was kept aside from the normal couches.
"You may stand now."
Upon hearing the command, the shrouded man got up and faced his majesty with his head still little bowed.
"Rito...you know what's the time, right? Do you want me to get divorced or something?"
"I humbly ask for forgiveness for the intrusion, my lord, but this matter needs
urgent attention of yours."
While saying, the shrouded man Rito took out a piece of paper from under his black waist before forwarding it to the man with his brows up in surprise.
The emperor was well aware that his trusted spy would never disturb him if not for an urgent matter, but the problem was that the letter he took had a seal of the Eden Academy. The place which the emperor also never takes causally.
Frowning his brows, the middle-aged man tore the envelope before he started to read the content written on it, only to get his eyes stretched out in the process.
"Rito....this...?"
With disbelief clouding his mind, the emperor of the Gram Kingdom asked his trusted employee about the thing he found utterly absurd.
"I snatched it from the messenger in charge of reporting everything related to young lady Venessa to the Knight Commander Sir Charles."
The emperor's forehead was soon covered with bids of sweat as he thought of the possibility of what would have happened if Rito hadn't brought this letter away, and Charles would have learned that his princess was humiliated like this.
It goes without saying what the muscle head would do if he came to know such a thing happened in the knowledge of every instructor and the headmaster himself.
'That fucking Brat!!'
Cursing under his breath, the emperor retracted his gaze back to Rito before he began to command something which needed immediate effect.
"Arrange a letter to the 21st Battalion which Sir Charles is leading and hand them the remaining lairs of the northern Jungle. Whatever you write in that letter, make sure not to let him return before at least ten days."
Rito just nodded firmly as he waited for the following command.
"Ask that bastard Alex to return by tomorrow, or I will burn his office."
A none visible grin formed on the spy's lips as the thought of seeing the menace Alex running around to save his theories made Rito tempted, but he didn't dare to say such thoughts.
"And lastly, inform the school to make proper arrangements for the hero, so he doesn't get involved in all this. I will send troops for the fort defense."
The emperor, after saying such in an anxious manner, fell silent with his eyes fixed constantly on the spot, thinking of the possible preparation he could arrange so he could minimize damage.
Stopping Charles from visiting Eden academy was close to impossible that's why he wasn't thinking of such a route entirely and was focusing on the precautions.
Suddenly his train of thought came to a halt as he heard the low voice of his loyal spy.
"My lord...what about Sir Vincent's son?"
Upon hearing the query, the emperor sneered without blinking twice as he shrieked on his shoulder in hopelessness.
"That brat has brought death upon himself. And now, when Count Vincent has also abandoned him, I fear he won't be able to even have a proper funeral. Forget about him; just make sure you keep the hero safe and away from the scene. What will happen to that bastard prick won't be any of my concern."
________
A/N:- Ah, this sweet and bitter chapter.
Anyway, drop a comment if you are hyped for the couple's date ;)

chapters.title: Chapter 14: His training!
chapters.content:
Monster Lairs.
The place where inhumane reside and also the place where I would be training my skills for the upcoming battle with the Knight Commander.
Lairs, as the name sounds, were the inhabitance of monsters where they hid their treasure and mana stone.
I had gone to small Lairs before until I didn't get my Villain's System.
My first experience was not as scary as I thought since the rank I picked for my first lair was the third rank of [Rare Class].
Since I easily defeated the lair floors and also the boss monster, I pushed myself for more and increased the level.
But nothing, I repeat, nothing was even comparable to the lair I was standing right in front of.
"Luna...what...is this...."
