chapters.title: Chapter 20: His confusion?
chapters.content:
In an extravagantly decorated room which by furniture looked like a dining space sat four people in an arranged order around the table as they ate their respective breakfast in silence.
This was the mansion belonging to the father, who some days ago broke every contact and erased every relationship with his blood-related son, Austin.
Sitting with his sturdy built facing his family, Vincent Wright elegantly slid his knife across the perfect stewed meat before forking it from the middle and landing the piece inside his mouth.
Sat beside his right was the only wife of the Count, Sophia Wright, as she also gracefully ate food while watching over her children's worrying table manners once in a while.
The sibling was sitting opposite their mother as they feasted on their pancakes without minding the stares from their mother and enjoyed their time without any kind of regret of knowing that the chair beside them had been abandoned forever.
It was not only them, but even Sophia, who had carried Austin for nine months in her womb and shared the same blood as him,  didn't have much trouble after she found out that her son had been disowned.
Wright's family was moving at their usual pace with or without Austin's presence, as they always knew this change would arrive one day.
'Hmm?'
Suddenly the patriarch of the Wright family sensed something before he stood up with his sword pointed in the direction where he felt something approaching.
"Ah!"
"F-Father?!"
"Dear...what happened?"
Along with the servants, the three other family members become flustered upon seeing the big man pointing his sword in the open air without anything in front as a target.
But soon, they realized why such measures Vincent took, as a magic formation formed some inches ahead of the place where Vincent's blade tip was hanging.
Soon a bright purple light appeared in the corner of the dining hall as a magic circle of 2 ft in diameter formed instantly and soon disappeared too, with a small object hovering parallel to the blade.
The thing was flapping its wind like a bat before it approached Vincent, as the latter mentioned also withdrew his sword and raised his hand to catch the thing.
'Mana Mail..who could it be..?'
Since using such an advanced spell to send immediate emergency messages were rare, Vincent frowned slightly. The last time he received a mana mail, he detached a person from his family, so this time it didn't ring a good siren when such a mail arrived.
"What is it, Dear?"
Watching his back didn't turn for some seconds, Sophia rose from her seat before she walked toward the man only to get flustered when he suddenly turned around.
Vincent held the letter forward toward the middle-aged beauty making the latter baffled. Nevertheless, she took the note, which some seconds ago was flying like a creature, before she started to read the content, only to get her eyes wide in shock.
Vincent looked at his two children with a stern gaze making the teenagers shudder slightly before they heard the patriarch saying something, which made the whole room heavier than it already was.
"Prepare you both. Tomorrow would be the last day you would be able to see the person whom once you called your brother."
____________________________
[One day later]
[Real Time]
The news about Charles visiting the Eden Academy and still not running havoc spread like wildfire, and adding the announcement of the confrontation between Austin and Charles, made the piece of news even more noteworthy.
The letter for the brawl between two men, one a veteran War god and another just a school brat, flew around the empire, and the important figures were invited to witness it.
Since the court magician's letter wasn't something to scoff about, every invitation was taken as utmost importance, including the highest-ranked nobles.
Naturally, the news arrived at the royal palace too, which gave another round of headaches to the already occupied emperor. But since he couldn't control all his pieces altogether, there was no stopping this exhibition from happening.
The arena where the brawl would take place was built in the south-eastern jungle, where the most diminutive monster populace existed.
Since two superhumans would be involved in the fight, it was given, that the arena couldn't be made of standard bricks and stones.
Alex was in charge of supplying the materials and helping the engineers to build the arena in the span of two nights, pushing every magic builder to their worst.
The look the engineers and workers gave to Alex, was equivalent to the whips of a Snyther, which could kill without practically touching its prey.
But nothing worked on the freak Court Magician as he mercilessly threw work time after time on the poor souls.
Currently, the slave driver was standing in the stands while gawking at the stage beneath, which was destined to get destroyed even though he used almost 30% of his mana to enhance the material.
A sigh leaked his lips as he imagined the scenario which would be taking place in some hours before suddenly his eyes contracted like a needle as he heard a voice from some meter back.
"Why did you do this?"
Alex jumped on his toes before he faced the person who, without even leaving a single presence, approached Alex, and not only that, the said person was able to get on his back which practically was the most vulnerable part of any being.
Alex wasn't self-obsessed, but he was pretty confident in his mana detection, which has helped him escape various fatal situations until now.
But here, a kid less than half of his age was able to sneak up to him successfully, without even being proud about it at all.
"You scared the shit out of me."
Covering his chest in exaggeration, Alex complained as he saw Austin sneering at the sight.
Soon the blond youth walked forward before standing beside the court magician, with his eyes focused on the arena.
"What will you gain from this fight? You are well aware that in battle, I will also showcase my real might, which is far beyond what others know. But I can't figure out what would benefit you from all this?"
Being questioned like that, Alex stared at their side profile of Austin while contemplating something which was far from what Austin could ever conclude.
Soon, Alex retracted his gaze to the front before; unlike his typical flowery pitch, he spoke somewhat with seriousness blended with a hazy tone filling his voice.
"You will see when the time comes."
___________________________
At the same time, in the particular room inside the school premise, a group of three beautiful women and a single youthful man gathered.
These four undoubtedly were the member of Hero's party who had come to their meeting place regarding the matter, which was the most heated topic these days.
Kyouki, along with others, were sipping on tea as they asked Venessa about what was going on with Captain Charles and why he allowed such a brutal exhibition to take place.
"From what papa said, it's highly likely that he would be testing Austin first and, if not worthy enough, which, of course, Austin isn't, papa would ultimately kill that bastard in the battleground."
Unintentionally a sigh leaked Venessa's lips as she remembered what kind of standards her papa carries whenever he gets interested in someone.
Even though she wasn't sure why her father took notice of such a weakling, she was convinced that after the first blow between the person she admires the most and despises the most, the result would conclude with the end for one of them.
(A/N:- Flag?)
Sicily was silent on the matter as she contemplated something else, taking the future prospectus into account.
The most anxious and full of complications was Lilia, who wasn't sure what to think about the situation. She wasn't sure why she felt so much stuffed in her heart.
She wasn't certain why despite carrying so much hatred toward Austin, she couldn't let go of this feeling which attached her to him.
She wanted him to live so she could hate him as she knew if he dies, she would painfully regret something that she wasn't ready to accept.
However, whatever she thought, there was no way of stopping the brawl which would be happening in some hours from now. So she just left things flow as they were.
Kyouki was silent until now, but soon his voice echoed in everyone's senses as the hero rose from his seat while he stated confidently.
"What will happen between Sir Charles and Austin is not something we can or should interfere with now. What we can do is to ensure the safety of the audience and take measures so nothing like what happened in our first Expenditure would happen again."
Upon hearing his remark, everyone nodded, and after some quick reminders, the hero party started to depart for the arena.
Suddenly Sicily asked for some alone time with Kyouki, to which the other two women agreed after seeing the frown on the all-time cheery mage's face.
After Lilia and Venessa left the meeting room, Sicily brought the thing she had been thinking about for more than a week now.
Looking at her serious expression, Kyouki became attentive too, before he heard her asking.
"Kyou-kun....at the end of this month, we have to start venturing high-tier lairs to gain experience, you remember, right?"
Without thinking much, the raven-haired youth nodded as this was pre-planned how they would be challenging the lairs so they could prepare themselves for the upcoming dangers.
But being asked like that all of a sudden ringed a dark bell inside Kyouki's mind as he somehow understood what Sicily was going to ask.
And indeed, his fear became a reality.
"Since you are aware of my healing capabilities, I won't ask you to trust me in that field. And since Luna isn't a member of our party anymore, we might have to recruit someo-"
Before her words could have concluded, Kyouki interrupted her with a heavy voice with, his expression darkening for a mere blink.
"She hasn't left me."
Sicily's eyes widened as she heard Kyouki's unusual tone, which gave a shiver down her spine. She subconsciously held her breath as she hardly resisted herself from falling on her butt.
But soon, Kyouki's expression returned to normal as, with a dry smile, he assured Sicily and...
"I will bring Luna back Sicily-san. Don't worry, in some days I will complete our team as it was before. So don't think needlessly, and let's go."
.....himself too.
__________________________
A/N:- I will surely commence the fight in next chapter. Sorry for the delay.
Anyway, if you are hyped for the next chapter, then let me know~

chapters.title: Chapter 21: SS 1- Night of memories!
chapters.content:
[This was the time when Luna came to confront Austin after he was disowned by his father]
I heard people saying that those men who cry are not worthy of being a man.
But I don't share the same sentiment as them.
Those who hide their emotions from the world and expose them in front of those who they trust are the most genuine men.
Well, I wasn't concerned about others as I don't regard myself as anyone close enough to share their grief.
Neither any friend nor any family member grew closer to the extent where I could draw my real emotions out or lend them shoulder at their worst time.
But that was only until I met him...
The person who was continuously weeping like a child who had been bullied by the neighbour kids and was seeking the warmth of his parent.
How he hugged my body with his face draped over my bosom as he unrestrainedly wailed aloud made me utterly...
Joyous.
It was sad that Austin was in so much pain, but that doesn't help the joy I feel when I see him in such a miserable condition leaning on me completely. It generates an enthralling weird sensation inside me.
Like something was dormant, but after meeting Austin, it has been ignited.
But for this insignificant sensation, would I let my Austin suffer anymore?
Absolutely, no.
After perceiving what he has suffered and watching his current state, I have already formed my resolve that on my watch, I won't let anyone else in this world make my Austin cry.
"You okay now?"
Sensing his cute sniffs, I asked while still patting his back gently.
'Ah.'
Soon he let go of my embrace, leaving me all alone as  I somehow suppressed my grieving cry.
But what greeted my eyes worked as delightful compensation.
My heart melted at the sight as I imprinted the face of adorable Austin, whose face was covered with tear stains and along with his small red nose; the scene was enough to send shivers down my core and flame my urges to do something shameless.
'Hah...no...I can't...remember Luna..once you do that ...Austin will think you as a cheap woman ...but why is he so cuteeee!!'
With a straight face, I fought my inner demon as I helped Austin wipe the remnants from his face.
"I am sorry for the unsightly appearance."
Now that's what I love about him. Even in such a condition, he was more concerned about my impression of him.
This was one of the golden qualities which I admire the most, but it also was highly concerning.
"Don't mind about it. You aren't unsightly at all, Austin, so don't hide your face."
I gently placed my hand on his cheek as he was trying to turn himself away in embarrassment.
Upon my remark, I felt his face growing slightly warm as he ultimately went speechless.
'Fufu...shy Austin isn't bad at all.'
After some more minutes of my delight and console of my precious, Austin asked something as his gaze fell downwards
"Why did you return Luna?"
This was something I had been contemplating myself for some time.
I once thought that if I hadn't seen those memories of Austin and never came to realize what actual situation he was going through, did I would have returned to him after getting betrayed once?
Whenever I thought of this, only one thing came out as a conclusion.
Yes, I would have returned.
I don't love Austin because I sympathize with his past ,nor because I love seeing his pained expression.
I fell for Austin because of what kind of person he actually is.
The honesty he still nurtures inside him even though he came across only fake people until now who always left his side in the end.
The way he still was optimistic about his situation and was daring enough to move forward even though he practically lost everything in life.
The way he smiles carelessly and feel elated upon small to small things like even the blooming of a flower...
The way he hides his pain...
His caring nature...
His otherworldly adorable smile....
I fell all for it.
Maybe I was rushing things when I say, but at this point in my life, if I could see anyone besides me, the one on whom I could lean on and support wholeheartedly, then it would be none other than this man in front of my eyes.
Smiling, with my eyes filled with the image of my love, I answered his concern.
"I returned because I wanted to trust you."
His gaze, which was fallen with participation, lit up as he stared at me wide-eyed, unable to believe what I had just confessed.
"I know it would sound shady when I say it, but there was a side of me who wanted to maintain trust in you...something which told me that this person could do anything but break someone's heart. I clung to that thought of mine and resolved to confront you. And seeing you like this, I think I choose the right option."
There was no fabrication in my words. I said what I truly believed and wanted to follow to the end of my life. I want to nurture this relationship and let Austin know that there is someone who truly and unconditionally loves him.
Hearing my words, Austin's face and mouth parted as he stared at me in disbelief.
'Cute.'
"I know it's still not possible to trust my wor-"
"No, I trust you."
Holding my hand, Austin said in a stern tone as he stared at our joint hand, making me startled all of a sudden with his surprise attack.
"You know, Luna, I have bad-mouthed and said countless vulgar things to others as well as you too, but this was my first time betraying someone who put their trust in me."
Hearing his gentle voice while feeling his warmth through a single touch made my heart melt as I heard him continuing.
"The people who have left me never returned, and I also never expected something so too good to be true. But when I saw you, I found my whole world flipping upside down. The person I thought would never look at me again in the same light came back to me with a smiling face. I can't ..."
Due to crying so much, he suddenly choked on his breath and started panting heavily.
"Here. Take it easy."
I gave him water before gently rubbing his back to calm his breathing. Sipping on the bottle, he exhaled heavily as he tried to catch his breathe.
After some pause, he said something which I might not be able to forget even if the world comes to an end or eternity passes with my existence intact.
"You don't know, Luna, how I am feeling right now to talk to you like this, to feel your warmth, to assure myself that there is someone beside me who wouldn't judge me because of my acts but for the real me. I can't tell you, Luna, how important you have become to me, to the point where life without you makes me scared. So please, I beg you, don't ever leave me alone."
________________________
A/N:- I thought of adding such small sweet chapters so I could lighten the pace and flesh out the details which I would skip from the main timeline. It wont be often so if you are bored from the chappy you can be rest assured.
Anyway, if you like the idea, then let me know~

chapters.title: Chapter 22: The might of an underdog~1!
chapters.content:
The sun was shining brightly among the clouds and was reflecting the surface with a bright golden glow.
The time was almost the peak of noon when the heat was at its finest, and nearly every creature inside their shelter sought relief from the scorch.
Midst of all these, in the middle of the widespread jungle, gathered a massive crowd to witness something which, even without summer, could break a sweat with the chills of the event.
[Good afternoon, ladies and gentlemen. I am your host for today, yours truly Alex Nuèye, who is going to present you with the event which we will be witnessing in just some minutes now.]
Stood with his wand in front of his mouth, as in to display it as a mic, was the middle-aged court magician Alex who was handling the role of announcing the commencement of today's brawl.
Surrounding the host were the most prominent figures of the whole continent belonging to different divisions.
Apart from the Emperor of Gram himself, every other official noble who were of dignified rank was invited by Alex, which included Sicily's and Lilia's father too.
A crowd of almost 3000 were occupying the different sections of stands as they sat with their family members and respective servants. Since the seats were assigned per their ranks, the audience was comfortably accommodated.
The Wright family was also present on the third row from the top, with Vincent Wright along with his wife and two children sitting in an arranged manner, without any particular emotion on their faces.
The news about the Wright family disowning their youngest son already have talked about by those who were present in the arena, but looking at the family of four who might lose Austin forever in this battle and still didn't have any urge to meet the person, made the people around, quite shocked.
But it doesn't affect the Wright family as, in their eyes, Austin was already dead since the time Vincent paid Eden Academy a visit and severed every tie with his youngest child.
Apart from all these ranking nobles sitting on the varying stands sat a single person at the top of the hierarchy with a vapid expression on his charismatic face.
This person was assigned with the top seat in the audience benches as the person undoubtedly belonged to the royal family and carried the same blood as the Emperor of Gram.
Apart from the member of the royal family, the most attention-grabbing group was the party of four which was led by a handsome raven-haired boy named Kyouki.
Sicily and Lilia, after greeting their respective families along with Kyouki, returned to a separate seat that was assigned for the students.
As Kyouki commanded, everyone from the hero party had an eye on their surroundings and another one of the battle arena where the host seemed to continue.
Taking a pause and sensing everyone's attention upon himself, Alex continued.
[Today, the prideful brawl between two remarkable men, one regarded as the Supreme soldier and another as a rookie hunter who singles handily defeated a Terror Rank demon, would take place on this battleground. One would be taking compensation for his child's dignity, and another one would fight for his life. So without any further ado, I will like to call them to the arena.]
Upon completion of Alex's exaggerated welcoming speech, an inaudible footstep approached the arena as a figure of a boy in his mid-teens appeared from the shadows as he walked up to the center.
The boy, by looks, was far above an average face as his blond hair shined brightly under the sunlight with, and his turquoise eyes reflected the charm which was dangerous as well as enticing at the same time.
Austin was currently wearing a blue and brown vest over his upper body, which by appearance looked like made of leather. His lower half was covered with body-tight rubber pants, which naturally provided the user with unrestrained movements.
By outer appearance, the protective gear attached to Austin looked nothing extraordinary, more like it seemed cheap that even the lowest ranked adventurer could easily afford, not to talk about nobles who order their customized armor and equipment.
But even with such cheap quality appearance, there were quite a number of maidens who found the sight of a handsome man wearing such an appealing attire enough to bring a blush on their face and heart race to their wildest limit.
It was not only limited to unmarried maidens, but also those who had come here with their spouses were attracted to the young man, who was, even though looking fragile, gave a sensation of strange sensuality.
But it goes without saying that they didn't let their desires show on their faces and sat expressionlessly, not to expose their real emotions.
Austin ran his eyes among the audience, and instantly landed them on the family of four who, one way or another, gave him some resemblance.
His eyes only halted on the middle-aged blond woman sitting aloofly beside her husband, for a second before he snatched his eyes back to his front.
'She acts better than me.'
A dry chuckle left Austin's lips before he heard a pair of heavy steps approaching the arena from the other side of the ground.
Inhaling deeply, Austin readied himself before the figure of a burly man became vivid as the humungous human approached the center.
The man was undoubtedly Venessa's father, Captain Charles, who appeared two days ago in front of the school and, after allowing Alex to arrange the exhibition, disappeared from the face of the earth.
From what Austin remembers, Charles still was wearing the protective gear he was wearing two days ago, which was damaged from places with claw marks and severe cuts at some vital spots.
His stoic face had similar cuts to his armor as his raven eyes stared indifferently at the boy who had piqued his interest, and now Charles was expecting a good show out of him.
The audience, which was already low on noise, went utterly dead silent as Charles stood facing Austin as the two stared at each other without any particular expression on their faces.
From the stands, the two looked so mismatched that calling them a small canine in front of the Fenrir itself, felt justified.
The women and the maidens who were secretly fawning over Austin sighed in grief as once again they realized that it wasn't a regular exhibition but a death match whose results maybe everyone has concluded inside their minds.
Apart from the hero's party and Alex, no one was aware of what Austin might actually carry, so for the audience, this battle seemed already decided even before the commencement.
But whatever one thought, the brawl wasn't going to be interrupted by even the highest authority arrived at this moment.
Charles was a mad bull who knew nothing but to feed his blade with his enemy's blood and continue fighting until he doesn't reach his last breath. Because of his obsession, Charles doesn't allow anyone to restrain him. Not even God.
"Awaken, Gladius."
Spoke under his breath was the massive man in his late forties as a silvery glow covered his hand and illuminated the area significantly.
After the light was subdued, what appeared in the big hand of the knight commander was a long sword of length more than 60 inches.
The sword was lean with a width of only 20 cm, with a fine edge shining dangerously. The blade's hilt was long enough that even after being held by Charles, the slight leather covering was openly exposed.
The blade, even being only equipment, was oozing with dangerous intent like a bloodthirsty slayer , which made the surroundings heavier than before.
Austin, upon seeing the blade in Charles's hold, sighed in relief as what he expected became a reality.
As he assumed, Charles didn't bring out the weapon, which has become a deadly nightmare to countless beings until now and would perform a vital role in the future too.
Exhaling, Austin closed his eyes before a single two-worded phrase leaked his lips.
"Come forth."
Unlike the silvery flash which appeared before the long sword was summoned, a different black smoke emerged in front of Austin and soon covered his front.
After some seconds, the black fog disappeared steadily as Austin's eyes also lifted before he saw what he called for.
A long staff that had a transparent shade near to impossible to see until one didn't look closely had two small metal kunai-like designed metal attached at either end of the staff, giving a very close resemblance of being a spear, appeared in the hands of Austin.
A gasp resonated among the audience, not because they saw the weapon which appeared but...
"You can summon your weapons at this age, huh. Not bad."
Praised the Knight commander as summoning a weapon as per desire was highly difficult to attain, and taking Austin's age into account, which was similar to the hero who still hasn't managed to learn the summoning skill until now, Austin indeed showed something frightening.
"I am honoured, Sir."
Replied the blond youth as he twirled his spear with such accuracy that it already made various instructors of Eden academy quite troubled as, from what they remember, they had never seen Austin with a weapon before. And now, when he had such fine compatibility with a strange weapon, it astonished various.
Especially Venessa.
Alex, who was watching the small exchange of the two, finally stepped up as he announced the final call before he disappeared into thin air.
[Our both contenders are now ready, so without further blabbering, let's the battle commence!!]
As the figure of Alex disappeared, Austin also vanished entirely from sight like he also went away in the same way which Alex used.
**TIIIIINGGGG**
But only after a mere blink, a high-pitched sound of blade hitting blade, rose from where Charles was standing, echoing in the surrounding, which made the audience widen their eyes in complete shock as they gawked at the sight of something near to impossible happening right in front of their eyes.
And not only that, the person who was solemnly looking at the arena from the start suddenly smiled devilishly as he saw the scene in front.
'It seems I won't be bored as much as I thought~.'
___________________
A/N:- Let the chaos commence!!!!

chapters.title: Chapter 23: The might of an underdog ~2!
chapters.content:
Charles Sinton. The Knight Commander of Gram Kingdom's the Royal Order.
Apart from being the captain of the royal order for 15 years, there were numerous other titles that the knight commander won in his lifetime, by his utmost battle prowess and the greed of brawling on any possible occasion.
At the age of 10, he was thrown into the outside world to live life on his own and manage the things which at his age children don't even get aware of.
Fighting for bread to seeking shelter to spend one more night in peace, Charles fought all for it and survived somehow, the first seven years of being homeless.
At the age of seventeen, he started participating in regular military work majorly supplying water or helping the injured first, before he initiated to showcase his potential in weaponry and physical arts too.
Since his build was quite big from a young age, people got intimidated by him which resulted in him getting bullied regularly at the early stage of his battalion life.
That was when he killed for the first time and after that, he never stopped.
He didn't become a psycho murdered but a person who transformed into the worst nightmare for those who faced him with a weapon in hand.
He soon got promoted to a higher level in the military but he didn't care about it all and continued to seek the obsession he found in blood and gore.
His technique improved as he met strong opponents throughout his journey, and before he realized he already become the most strongest human in his birth land and got promoted to a post that no one could dare to look down upon.
After having a daughter he somewhat became a little steadier in life.
He had a wife at home and a cute little princess whom he could return to.
After creating his own happy family, the thought of death gave him chills which further made him turn a little tamer.
Further adding the point that no worthy opponents were appearing anymore made Charles think that with his old age he also would become senile and leave the battlefield one day.
But today...
**CLINGGG**
A kid of his daughter's age...
**CLANNNGG**
Was making his blood rush to this extent....
**TNNNNNGGG**
And making him remember how it feels like to be young again?!
"Yeah... that's what I like. Come on Austin, I know you have plenty in store."
Shouted at top of his lungs was the man in his mid-forties who currently had such vigor on his face that could pale the young veterans in comparison.
His blade which was still hot due to the interaction it had with Austin's spear, was making Charles' sturdy hand a little shaky. But he wasn't upset about it, rather he was feeling alive again.
The blond youth who had the tip of his spear pointed at Charles was panting slightly with a wide grin adorning his youthful face, along with the beads of sweat advancing his charm to the next stage.
For the past 15 minutes, Austin was exchanging blows with the knight commander continuously without break.
The huge man was holding his ground and blocked all the deadly attacks while practically without leaving the ground at all, in midst of the chaos.
The audience has long lost the sense of comprehensibility since the time they saw a mere newbie ranked Mage warrior landing a such decent blow on Charles at a speed that was even impossible for Kyouki to follow.
Even though Charles blocked all the attacks including the first one, it didn't change the fact that a young boy who still only faced one of his life's expenditures until now, was able to make Charles move to this extent.
The most shocked was the red-haired beauty beside Kyouki who was looking at the scene like she was watching the secret of the Seven Mysterious unravelings right in front of her eyes.
The other members along with Kyouki were thoroughly shocked too upon seeing this hidden side of Austin who was only called a good-for-nothing noble until now, but Venessa was not only baffled but also her pride was hurt severely.
Not because her papa wasn't able to deal with Austin in one blow but she was hurt to see how while exchanging blows with Venessa, Charles never had to move even an inch from his spot before he gives a clear-cut defeat to his beloved mercilessly.
And here, the person she loathed the most because of reason, that even being a man he never was able to wield a weapon properly, was now showing such skill which was not even comparable to what she have attained until now.
She was sure, that the current Austin would defeat her without even breaking a sweat. The way he was moving and inflicting his blows most efficiently, made it clear how above Austin have reached which Venessa couldn't even look up to.
She was hurting badly by this realization...
'When did he become this strong?! Didn't he use fake methods in the battle with the demon? How can he fight like that with papa with such efficiency ...WHAT THE HELL IS HAPPENING!!'
She was a mess...
Back in the arena, Austin exhaled deeply as he sensed that in between the blocks, Charles also gave some quite decent dents on Austin too.
'He ain't a knight commander for nothing after all...'
Focusing his senses on the person in front, Austin activated his [Silent Steps] and [Clear Mind] simultaneously to calm his raging consciousness which was urging him to let go of his restraints, and also tried to analyze the possible route to inflict real damage on his opponent.
(A/N:- Changed, Silent Mind -> Clear Mind)
'As I thought, this monster doesn't have any opening at all...'
A dry smile formed on his face as no possible route formed in his mind even after using the skill [Silent Step].
The reason was simple.
Charles, even looking like he was having the best fun of his life was still cautious enough to not let himself get damaged as per his enemy's desires. He could be laughing but his mind was actively working on his opponent's actions.
The two stood their places for slightly more than ten seconds before one of them again disappeared like a ghost before landing a heavy blow just above Charles' head which the latter one blocked masterfully using the hilt of his handle.
The tip of Charles' hilt and Austin's spear butt came in contact only for a mere a second before the latter one retracted his attack as he knew staying in a single place for a long time and Charles would entirely break him with his sheer strength.
The reason why Austin wasn't using his elemental skills which he has become quite confident in was...
Because he didn't want to ruin the fight he was enjoying this much.
He was sure that if Luna would have saw him being so careless with such a dangerous opponent, she might have went frenzy and instilled some senses for more than a day before she could have gained some sense of peace.
But he didnt has the time to think about her now when he was having so much thrilling fun that it was making his blood boil to this extent.
'Hupp!!'
Appearing with his extremely fast steps halting for a second, Austin twirled his spear and pierced it right toward the big wide open abdomen of his opponent.
"Not so fast, kid."
Since Charles wasn't able to bring his blade back in time, taking its massive size into the account, he used his bare hands to block the hard pointy tip of Austin's spear which made the latter mentioned baffled for a second.
'Got you!'
Smiling evilly, Charles brought his suspended sword at a furious pace toward Austin's exposed head, which if connected successfully could have opened Austin's skull like a watermelon.
But what Austin attained in the modified Lair was nothing to scoff about.
**DHAK**
The edge of the blade landed just on the flesh of Austin's forearm which he raised to save his skull. Since the blunt side of the blade was hammered on Austin's hand, apart from the numb sensation, Austin felt nothing serious to get concerned about.
However, the expression on Charles's face became severe as with a frown he asked the boy who was becoming more than he ever expected.
"You...are you really at the age which you seem?"
A smile formed on Austin's face which was far from gentle before he muttered under his breath as his hand went to flashy work.
"Why don't you find it...'
Lifting the arm which was blocking Charles' blade, Austin deflected the edge of the blade, which naturally brought Charles back to his senses, but it was too late.
Moving his lower body in a very frightening manner, Austin moved his body further pushing the grip on his weapon further down the staff, before he lifted his right leg in the air, and with all his strength gathered in one place, he kicked Charles' heel with the back of his leg.
**DHAK**
"SHI...."
The receiver of such a heavy unexpected blow was naturally unable to maintain balance as Austin practically utilized all the strength he has accumulated in the lairs at a single blow.
**BAAAAMM**
Naturally, if a heavy man falls on the ground, there would be quite a lot of noise in the background, but the heavy armor Charles' was wearing, created a crater upon his fall with Charles' humongous body as its center.
Just at the time when Charles' back touched the ground, Austin applied a massive amount of force at the spear and while coordinating with the fall he tried to utilize the momentum to his advantage.
"Hupp!!!"
Using all his strength, the veins on Austin's neck popped along with the heightened blood flow in his arms, as he applied an amount of force on his spear which could have even penetrated a Terror Rank Demon.
But the Knight Commander was far above those demons who Austin have fought and won over with. He was a being who wasn't regarded as the strongest in the whole nation of Gram, for nothing.
Blood dripped from the big palm of the big man, but Austin wasn't able to breach the block by a thin margin. The tip has mostly gone through Charles' palm muscles but wasn't able to pass through, before Charles finally came back to himself.
"Quite cheeky huh, but for how long...."
Smiling in a way that could frighten any human at this very moment, Charles' gave a very ominous vibe as he got a strong hold on Austin's spear end with his severed hand.
Austin's eyes became wide as he felt his weapon not listening to him anymore before a sound leaked from his mouth ...
"Uh-Oh."
_______________________
A/N:- I am taking pace too slow?
Well, I will probably end the fight in the next chapter, so don't worry.
And let me know if you are liking my work~

chapters.title: Chapter 24: The might of an underdog~3!
chapters.content:
"Uh-Oh..."
As the words that told that Austin has made a mistake, leaked out of his lips, a heavy flat blow landed on his chest.
**THAWWKKK**
Charles, with the bare palm of his free hand, slammed Austin's chest with a force that could have destroyed a meter pillar easily.
It goes without saying that Charles didn't apply his complete strength given his growing interest in Austin, but the blow was enough to send Austin flying back to the other end of the arena.
**BANGG**
His body collided with the perimeter of the arena with the supreme quality wall crumbling in an instant.
If Austin would have simply collided with the wall with that force, then the wall wouldn't have broke but just before Austin's back could have come in contact with the wall, he covered himself with mana to escape major injuries.
""Woahh!!""
Various heavy audible sighs flew from the audience as they saw this kind of brutish of attack for the first time since the battle commenced.
The fall of Charles and Austin receiving such a terrifying blow occurred in so less time, that those who were in the initial stage of their awakening, weren't even able to perceive what just happened.
In the arena, Austin's vision blurred just a mere blink as he felt the heavy pain from the back before he stabilized his consciousness.
'Fuck...I underestimated...'
Wiping the dripping blood from the corner of his lips, Austin rose back to his feet, with his narrowed eyes focused on his opponent intently.
"Use whatever means you have kid, or you won't be able to land damage on me."
Charles, who naturally wouldn't have been lying on the ground until now, spoke in a loud tone enough to reach up to the very last seat of the arena, as he commanded Austin to go all out.
Charles was aware, that apart from the magic attacks, there was something that the blond youth was hiding.
Instead of getting pissed because Austin was looking down on the might of the sole Knight Commander of the Royal Order, Charles was getting thrilled passing each second.
For him, his opponent's underestimation of him, makes Charles excited and for that, he could tolerate this sloppy behavior of the youngster.
Austin knows full well that the brawl, would not last long if he uses the spell which was even able to deal with dozens of Terror Rank demons now, so he decided upon his enhancing only his physical might, for now.
He knew until it doesn't get fatally dangerous, he could rely on his physical strength, that's what led him to a particular reckless conclusion.
'Distribute my points in strength and speed equally...now!!'
Shouting inside his mind, Austin felt a huge boulder dropping on his whole body, as an urge of collapsing right on the floor rose dangerously inside him.
The veins of his arms and nape bulged as the new sensation poured down his core with his eyes still fixed in front not daring to even blink at this moment.
Charles was also able to perceive that something was happening with the boy in front which didn't give much of a good vibe.
'I guess it's time.'
Readying his sword, Charles for the first time since the match commenced, lifted his leg from the ground voluntarily and pushed himself at a raging speed toward the struggling youth.
The audience gasped as they saw the huge body of the knight commander disappearing in a flash from his spot before he appeared just right in front of Austin, with his great sword held straight in direction of Austin's exposed abdomen.
But instead of feeling the sensation of piercing flesh, what made Charles frown was the resistivity he was feeling from his blade which wasn't listening to Chalre's command at all.
The raven eyes of the bulky man contracted to their thinnest as he finally got a glimpse of what the heck actually happened in such a mere blink.
"No freakin way!"
Alex was the one who cursed from the sidelines as he saw the unbelievable scene using his spell of surveillance. Not only he but the high-ranking nobles also gasped as they saw what caught the almighty Charles's blade in such an unbreakable manner.
"Now....I...got you!"
With his eyes blood red and a terrifying smile on his face, Austin held the blade with only his one hand before he tightened his grip resulting...
**CREAK**
*CLINNNN*
After a soft clinking sound of how a glass breaks, resonated audibly between the two participants, much to Charles' shock, before the long sword which Charles have used to slay countless beings before, broke into small pieces.
The hand that Austin was using to hold the blade suddenly turned into a fist before, at a frightening speed, he moved toward the big man and landed a petrifying blow on his big torso of Charles.
**DHAKK**
"Khak!!"
The big body of the knight commander was pushed back to almost 5 steps with his broken blade in hand, still trying to figure out what just happened.
But before Charles could have even stabilized his senses, a massive intent of fatal danger erupted at the back of his head.
Turning at a furious speed with his hand raised on instincts, Charles felt a massive blow landing at the center of his palm as he saw Austin's menacing smile just above his head.
Austin didn't let his fist get captivated by Charles before with lightning speed he erased his presence and appeared just on the back of the burly man, before he applied his strength in his leg and landed a powerful blow on the back of Charles' knee.
Charles wasn't able to keep up with the speed Austin was showcasing and coupled with the blow he was inflicting on such vulnerable parts, Charles was again forced to kneel on the ground.
'This boy is improving passing every blink!!'
This thought came into Charles' mind before he felt a massive boulder-like thing hitting just the center of his head before his consciousness became a little hazy.
Austin after landing his elbow on Charles' skull didn't even halt for a second before he raised his leg and tried to kick the big man's face only to get blocked just two inches apart.
"Now you got me heated up!"
Growled with an equivalent menacing smile like Austin was the man who if not for his exceptional might, would have become a grandfather until now, before he held Austin's feet in his grip and with his humongous strength, pulled his prey and threw him flat on the ground.
"Oraaa!!"
**THAKKK**
Some of the audience nearly felt their stomach-churning as the force with which Austin was thrown to the ground, the imagination of watermelon bursting after landing from the tenth floor, rose inside their mind.
But out of everyone's expectancy, just after hitting the floor, Austin was able to release himself from Charles' grip using the vibration of the collision as his advantage, before Austin appeared at a different spot with his tightly held punch only to get blocked at the end.
"Heh."
"Hahaha....interesting. Now come at me boy!!"
Giving each other the chills of life, soon the two men started exchanging blows which were so brutal that every person sitting in the audience felt death scythe approaching their nape even though they weren't involved in the battle.
The blows and backlashes of the confrontation between the two were enough to make the arena shatter at a very terrifying rate.
The way, Austin was dodging the indefinite incoming attacks and countering them with lethal blows of his own, made those who have taught until now in the Eden Academy contemplate, whether they were even worthy of teaching him at all.
The most terrifying expression was adorned by the very prideful warrior who never in her life thought that her father could be pushed back like this by anyone. Even though she had the utmost trust in Kyouki that he would become the strongest in the future, he still was far from reaching her papa's level.
And here a mere newbie ranked whom she only cursed of being a sissy and gutless until now, was showing such might that her reasoning capability was fading past each blink.
The way he was using strength, the way he was smiling all the time even though he was receiving such blows which could have killed her in just a single impact, and the way the unwavering wit he was showcasing of not backing down, made her feel like her world was drowning and she wasnt even able to call for help.
The expression on Kyouki's face wasn't any better as the thought of receiving one or two blows from the current Austin sent a deadly chill down his spine. The memory of when he threw Austin using a single punch, out of the school gate during the entrance ceremony, came into his mind when his body shuddered furiously.
'What if that time....'
Imagining such a terrifying possibility, Kyouki as well as others saw the sound of thunderous cries from the arena halting after more than 10 minutes since they started brawling for real.
The clouds of dust slowly lifted from the scene before the figure of the two battle maniacs become vivid.
However, just upon witnessing the condition of the two contestants, a huge wind of chatters mixed with heavy heaves resonated in the surrounding.
"No way!!"
"Am I dr-dreaming or is Charles..."
"This can't be true....this can't be true !!"
Stood with his lips covered with blood along with a couple of blue and black marks around his eyes and cheeks, and a dozen of scratches around his torso and chest was the blond youth who was currently panting heavily while maintaining his shaky legs from giving out.
But what made the majority of the audience, gasp in horror was the condition of the person who gained the title of 'Unbreakable' after he defeated an army of 1000 all by himself in a single day.
The person who was renowned as the strongest on the entire continent had his protective gear practically torn from every possible spot with his face covered with tens of bruise marks and blood stains.
Just like Austin, Charles was also trying it hard to breathe steadily as his mouth was parted while he tried to catch as much air as he could. The lid of his left eye was swelled with a bluish painful bruise puffed over it, making it tough for Charles to see clearly.
The debris of the stage has spread in the vicinity of both men standing on nothing but broken pieces of marble mixed with the raw ground, much to Alex's grief.
Turquoise stared at the raven pairs, as the two stood silently at their spot while glaring with a still wild grin on their lips like they were having the most enjoyable time of their life.
"You *huff* tired boy?"
"T-Talk abo*huff*about yourself."
The audience went dead silent as the feeling of something massive made them sweat buckets as they heard the two insane minds talking about something life-threatening so casually.
The sound of slow wind also was reverberated in high pitch, that much silence fell upon the previously roaring arena.
But everyone knew that it was the silence before a terrifying storm...
And looking at the two, their fear started to seem a reality.
"Don't die with this kid!"
"Same goes for you old man!"
Both of them shouted at the top of their lungs as they conjured a heavy amount of mana in their respective fist before both of them disappeared from their site for the next as well as maybe the final blow.
"ORAAAAA!!"
"UOOOOHHH!!"
**SLINGGG**
**BOOOOM**
A small explosion sent the two brawlers, sliding back on their feet without even being able to land their fists on anything.
Suddenly the emergence of a strange purple glow between Austin and Charles made the two baffled before they realized what just happened.
"Any more than this and our nation would lose a precious asset in vain."
Appeared from the brilliant light was the Court Magician who deflected the practically fort-breaking blows from either side.
Austin became slightly terrified upon seeing how strong Alex indeed was that he was able to counter both of the attacks simultaneously without any sign of backlash.
Soon the boiling blood from Austin's eyes subdued making him realize how frenzy he had become some moments ago. He didn't know what made his raging heart calm, but he was thankful that such a thing happened, before something irreversible would have occurred.
Charles growled at the court magician as being interrupted in between the battle was equivalent to asking for death.
But before Charles could have moved even an inch, he saw Alex gesturing with his eyes toward a high point in the stands.
Charles turned his head toward the direction since he wasnt aware of the people watching him, before he finally figured out who ordered Alex to stop the brawl.
'Tch...this brat.'
Looking at Austin's condition as well as himself's, Charles felt breaking the command from the royal blood would be not reasonable. After all, he would never go all out and kill such a fine young man who has broken all his expectancy and rose above the units Charles generally uses to measure someone's worth.
Retracting his overwhelming mana, Charles soon burst out in laughter as he walked toward the slightly panting young blood in front.
"Excellent! Excellent! You have made my blood boil and let me remember my old days after so long. I never expected that Eden Academy could have nurtured, such a fine piece of warrior".
A heavy verbal slap was thrown at those who were in charge of martial and weaponry training in Eden Academy, as they lowered their face in shame.
Not only them but every single student who has been taught side by side with Austin has such expression that said how different their worlds were until now.
The palest in the whole audience was the middle-aged man who carries the same genes as Austin who currently was looking at the situation with a face like his soul has been sucked out.
This reaction of his was something only those could understand who knows how brutally Vincent once was got beaten by the Knight Commander. At that time Vincent wasnt even able to land a decent blow on Charles and now...
'What the heck did I overlook....?'
Amidst everyone's shock and other similar reactions, suddenly the bulking man announced something which might bring a cold hell upon the Gram Empire.
"Seeing such might from this young man I have decided."
Putting his hand on Austin's shoulder giving the latter one, chills of something ominous incoming, Charles continued with his high-pitched voice to let the whole place know his decision.
"If anyone can hold the hand of my daughter, then it would be Austin. So from this day onward, I am announcing my lovely daughter Venessa to be engaged with my future son-in-law. Now, cheers everyone!!"
_________________________
A/N:- Take some time, and try to imagine Luna's smile when she hears about it.
Anyway, some of the things I would like to clear.
First, the sudden strength growth made Austin's mind go a little out of control which made him use all his strength without holding back.
Now why he was holding back in the first place?
Simple, he knew if he was to go all out then at the end of the battle he will kill Charles, which he didn't want, taking future events into account.
Anyway, if you guys have query then ask me on my server:-
.gg/2x6BA2Qm
And if you want to read advance chapters then visit:-
https://zetrotranslation.com/novel/isnt-the-wannabe-villain-too-cute/

chapters.title: Chapter 25: His taste in women!
chapters.content:
Smiling while gawking at the device which the system provided him, was the blond-haired youth who was the hot topic of conversation in the kingdom these days.
It's been two days since the memorable brawl between Charles and Austin took place and resulted in something which no one even dared to think of as a possibility.
After the shocking announcement Charles made about the engagement of Venessa and Austin, he disappeared in thin air before anyone could have objected to his decision.
Austin simply did not consent to the announcement, as in his heart there was only one woman, and the thought of having multiple wives didn't give him a good vibe.
But what he was completely unaware about, was that the woman he confessed his love to almost a week ago, would never even entertain the idea of Austin having a harem in the first place.
Until he was oblivious about that side of hers, he made a mental note to not think anything otherwise and focus on his single goal at the moment.
And that was to meet Luna.
His anxiety slightly increased when he received a mana mail from Luna which had mere three lines written in it, but it was enough for him to assume what Luna meant by those words.
So after that, he made a quick plan and the first step was for him to get involved with the northern kingdom as soon as possible.
"Ah, she looks so peaceful."
Currently, he was looking contently at the girl who by appearance looked to be in her late teens even though her skin was pale and her body mostly looked malnourished.
Strangely, after the duel ended Austin saw that the weekly requirement of his Villain's point was not only fulfilled but also, because of the heavy surplus, Austin was gifted with Mystic Ranked Artifact.
Since he didn't have the option to study any of the artifacts right at the moment due to the unavailability of the test subjects, he decided to postpone the idea.
Now he had almost two days before the Weekly Requirement resets, and more than nine days for him to attain the points so he could help his dear sister.
'Hmmm?'
Suddenly he heard a pair of footsteps approaching his room before he unhurriedly put the Tablet back in the inventory.
**Knock* *Knock**
Knowing full well who this person was, given the unique mana signature that she was emitting due to any overwhelming emotion of hers, Austin sighed in weariness.
Walking at a steady pace towards the door, Austin heaved a sigh again as he finally opened the door, his eyes landed on the pair of amber orbs of a particular woman.
It was none other than the prideful warrior of the Hero's Party, Venessa Charles who currently had a very complicated look on her face.
Austin stared at her with an expressionless face, and he was patiently waiting for her to speak about the purpose of her visit, but he more or less had a hunch regarding what it was.
Vanessa first glared at Austin due to his lack of etiquette, but soon she came back to herself and said in a heavy yet embarrassed tone.
"Can I come in? I have to talk about something."
She said in a voice that told that she was secretly doing all these which led Austin to ask his first query.
"You got your permission from your Hero-sama, to come here?
Without any particular kind of emotion blended in his voice unlike in the past when he spoke with a shrill tone that majorly irritated Venessa, he clearly spoke what was on his mind which made the latter mentioned glare at him even more intently.
"Do I look like a dog leashed to anyone? I love Kyouki-san but I am not a slave of him."
The grumble of Venessa didn't affect Austin as he continued staring at the girl while waiting for the conversation to end so he could enjoy the memories of Luna in solitary.
Vanessa finally understood that it was impossible to pursue the current Austin who has changed completely, from the previous arrogant bastard to someone fearsome and cold. So in defeat, she finally sighed heavily as she calmed her anxious mind.
Turning her eyes gentler than before she asked him politely this time.
"Can you please spare some of your time? I need to clear out something."
Vanessa respects strong people. Even though she wasn't applying such a principle of hers to Austin who still had her doubts, she wasn't foolish enough to dare shout at him.
Austin contemplated for a second and soon affirmed that indeed he also needs to be cleared out of this whole engagement situation before he leaves Gram, so with a nod he gave Venessa permission to enter inside.
Venessa sighed in relief and tried to enter his dorm room but before she could even land her single foot, suddenly a strange spell activated and because of its glow that blinded her vision she was forced to shut her eyes.
"Huh?"
**BOOOOOM**
A heavy explosion-like sound erupted where Venessa was standing before she was sent flying back into the corridor like a broken kite.
Austin's eyes went wide as for the first time he saw such an advanced magic circle, not to talk about, it was conjured in his own room!
He instantly darted to the place where Venessa hit her back before he knelt down beside her.
Without any word of concern, he decided to change their locations as it was better than trespassing the spell which was strangely placed on his doorstep without his awareness.
"Let's go to a different place. I don't think it's safe to talk in my room."
Saying so he held Venenssa's right hand before he pulled her up.
The receiver of such a terrifying blow, became senseless enough that she never realized it when she nodded to Austin's proposal and started to follow him too.
On the way to the place where Austin decided to have a chat with the amber-haired girl, he was continuously contemplating who possibly could have managed to build such a high-level spell without him noticing.
And in the first place, was there anyone around him who had such a level of skills that could deceive Austin's heightened senses?
There were only two people he knew and his mind was leaning upon a certain someone, really bad.
'Well, I will ask her the next time we meet.'
A smile was brought up on Austin's face as he walked toward the library with Venessa at his left.
When the red-headed beauty saw him smiling with such a gentle expression, for a second she became curious to ask what he was thinking. But as soon as the thought came, it also went away in an instant.
'Seriously what even am I thinking...'
Reprimanding herself, Venessa followed the blonde haired man towards the direction of the public library which was nearer than the central library built inside the school premise.
The unmatched duo naturally attracted many gazes as the rumors flared even more, with Venessa's engagement with Austin as the major backing of those baseless chatters.
Neither Austin nor Venessa heed a single mind about such rumors as they finally arrived at a place that was far from reception and was quite empty.
Soon both of them were seated while facing each other as Austin stared at Venessa solemnly, waiting to hear the words which were prolonged for so long.
Vanessa looked at the blond man's aloof approach towards the matter so she decided to end it as soon as possible.
Crossing her arms under her bosom which mostly gets covered by the armor she wears, was now giving away the completely healthy texture of her round breast.
Her figure indeed was a waste being hidden, given the sinful body she carries but Austin's interest in her body was completely negligible.
It wasn't because it was Venessa in front that he wasn't looking at her immoderately. For Austin, the only person he could enrage his lust with, was now thousands of miles away from him. And if not here, Austin had enough willpower to restrain himself.
"The announcement which my papa made after the event, don't take it seriously. I can't be with anyone except for Kyouki-san in this life so sorry but I am breaking the engagement."
Confessed honestly was the young beauty, as she expected even a slight change of expression from Austin. But to her utter perplexion, he just nodded like he actually wasn't able to hear it at all.
With wide-eyes, Venessa again reaffirmed so she doesn't leave any doubts behind.
"You heard me correctly right? I can't get engaged with you, since I love Kyouki-san."
Repeating the same thing Austin nodded twice this time, completely signifying that he heard her correctly and accurately.
But his actions slightly made the woman who indirectly got rejected so front-on, pissed enough that she extended the conversation which she planned to end at this point.
"You don't really care or you are just pretending to be calm?"
Since Venessa knew how perverted Austin was in the past, the thought of him leaving her without any complaint bothered her.
She never compared her beauty to Luna and Sicily since she knew how above they were in the field of appearance. But it doesn't mean, Venessa was under-evaluating herself.
She also received a dozen proposals in the past which she flatly rejected, so getting the same treatment for the first time from Austin that she used for the men in the past, made her quite unsettled.
On the other hand, Austin felt that the conversation was leading needlessly but from the teachings of his sensei, he has resolved to not let the matter get over him, so he decided to better resolve it here, right now.
"Two things, which made me accept this annulment of baseless engagement, without a single ounce of worry. First, I am already into someone. And second, you are not my type."
Thick veins popped on Venessa's forehead as she heard the second reasoning of Austin, as her womanly instincts flared in an instant.
Her aura started getting shrouded by her thick mana, as she glared daggers at Austin before a heavy voice leaked in between her gritted teeth.
"Say that again!"
Being glared like that, or feeling the heavy mana approaching him, Austin felt....nothing more than tickles.
Knowing full well what Venessa warned him to repeat, Austin rested his chin on his intervened fingers, before his cold eyes stared into the very soul of Venessa, as he spoke in a life-threatening tone.
"I said. You. Are. Not. My. Type. Since I know you heard me, get lost."
Feeling death scythe nearing her nape as a quick memory of the battle arena flashed in her mind, she retracted her aura and stood up in a fluster.
Turning on her heel, she hid her face as a low yet audible plea left her lips before she dashed away from the sight.
"I am sorry for troubling you."
_________________________
At the same time when Venessa went to meet Austin, a raven-haired handsome youth was swinging his blade alone in a garden-like background.
His thick veins which were protruding at different spots of his lean yet sturdy arms, coupled with the bare shredded upper body he was exposing could have made various maiden collapse because of blood loss.
It was not only today, but Kyouki has increased his training since the day he faced the slap of reality of where he stands.
But this was still far from enough...
He hasn't gone to lairs until now because of the absence of a healer from the team, which was making Kyouki anxious day after day. He knew Venessa and Lilia never said anything but just like Sicily, they were equally concerned about the future.
'Where are you, Luna....'
Suddenly Kyouki's senses received someone approaching him from behind. He didn't have to turn around to see the person as a familiar yet irritating voice reached his auditories.
"Isn't it the Hero-sama? Quite surprising to see you hyped up this early in the morning."
Spoke in a flat yet flowery tone, was the youngest court magician of the Gram Empire, Alex Nuèye.
"You need me for something?".
Kyouki without pausing his swings spoke in a clear tone.
A wide grin formed on Alex's lips as he spoke something which made the previously solemn expression on the hero's face interchange with complete shock.
"It's about Luna-sama~"
Only a mere four-worded sentence left Alex's mouth before a huge gust of wind erupted from Kyouki's blade as he turned on his feet toward the unbothered Alex.
Pointing his tip right in the middle of the bespectacled Mage's eyes, Kyouki's aura changed significantly as a heavy voice leaked from him.
"What do you know about her?"
Alex, who even after being at the end point of the legendary sword, was smiling playfully as he spoke without minding the rudeness at all.
"Well, I heard from the boy's dorm that someone would be using the teleportation portal this upcoming Weekend. I thought you might find your destination if you sail the unknown ship too."
Alex turned on his feet and before the baffled hero could have asked something, Alex already began to respond to it.
"Don't ask me how I found such information. We both have our secrets, after all."
Saying so Alex started stepping on the fresh grass as his feet moved forward with a satisfactory smile on his face.
Alex only walked some steps after he spoke the parting words, but suddenly the pleading voice from his back halted Alex's steps.
"Why did you help me?"
Hearing such a question from him, Alex couldn't help but sigh indifferently. He then turned and looked over his shoulder towards the perplexed hero as he quelled the hero's worries and concluded the conversation too.
"I am not helping you Kyouki, but the Hero I trust in. So act before it's too late~"
__________________________
E/D:- Zenon
A/N:- Drop a comment if you are liking the story~

chapters.title: Chapter 26: At his disposal!
chapters.content:
In Gram Nation, there are five teleportation centers in total located at important places only, the gates were mainly used by the nobility and those with higher ranks in the kingdom.
Two of them are built in the main town of Gram, known as Rundecall and Vimbisar.
The third one was located in the central church of the nation, which was under the control of the head Pope of the continent.
The fourth one was in the capital of Gram, built inside the main fortress for easy access for the king in case of an emergency.
The fifth one was where a young man with raven-hair in his mid-teens was standing and in front of him was the place where the portal was located.
With quick and soundless steps, Kyouki walked to a spot where he was able to see the entrance of the Portal Building, and as he had expected, the two guards were unconsciously lying on the ground.
Clenching his fist, he finally confirmed that the person he saw approaching the center, coupled with the act of breaching the place without permission, made Kyouki clear that Alex's words were all true.
Without wasting any time, Kyouki approached the entrance and, after taking a quick look around the premises, entered inside.
The inside of the building was dark and silence covered the whole place which was enough to give chills to an average human, but the hero was not someone who could be counted as the norm at all.
His heightened senses helped him to perceive the situation inside, which has been influenced by someone's presence.
Everyone inside the teleportation center was unconsciously lying on the ground, without showing any glimpse of waking up anytime soon.
Kyouki checked their breathing circulation and found that not only was there not any physical damage to the staff but also there was no problem with their mortality too.
Sighing, he rose to his feet when suddenly the feeling of mana circulating at a hefty and furious pace from the other side of the door, where the portal was situated reached his perception.
Readying a dagger in place of his legendary sword, Kyouki, without letting his movements give any single noise, approached the gate to the main room where the portal was located.
It didn't take long before he could peek inside the room because of the door's partition.
Upon seeing the mana circle forming at such a rate that it wouldn't even take ten seconds to get activated, Kyouki hurriedly pushed the door and shouted at the top of his lungs.
"Stop right there, Austin!!"
The light which was emerging from the mana circle evaporated in an instant due to the disturbance the conjuror suffered from.
Biting his lips, Austin, who was well aware of the person who carried such a tone, turned toward the source with an annoyed expression.
"Why are you here, hero?"
Without any further ado, as he could accept anything but to wait right at this moment, Austin asked without the mind being caught by the hero of humanity.
Breaching the school property and none other than the Teleportation center was enough to get rewarded with a termination letter for Austin. And it was applicable even if Austin was to be a noble as teleportation portals were no joke, which the capital of Gram handles directly.
The hero would have informed the headmaster about such an act of Austin, in normal circumstances.
But currently, he had his interest involved.
"You are going to meet Luna, right?"
Asking with his tone dropping to its lowest degree, Kyouki stared at Austin without having an ounce of shuddering even though he knew the difference between him and the current Austin was massive enough to be called incomparable.
The reason why Kyouki was acting so boldly and confronting Austin so head-on, which eventually was making him a criminal too, was a plain simple reason.
Love.
Austin stared at the hero in silence for a couple of seconds before he nodded in affirmation.
"I don't know who told you, but I am going to meet Luna. So if you will excuse me."
Saying so, Austin turned around to initiate the magic circle from the start when suddenly a big hand pressed on his shoulder, signifying the stubbornness of the other party.
"Take me with you."
Spoken in a heavy tone was the desperate hero of humanity who, in search of his love, was even ready to join hands with a person he utterly disgusted.
He knew that time was thin as a thread for him, and the need to recruit a member would be brought up again shortly if he didn't bring Luna back somehow.
And to conclude all his motives, he had no one besides Austin as a slight hope to meet the person again with whom Kyouki fell in love with.
Unlike the unsettled and continuously rumbling mind of the hero, Austin had a serene sense of reason as he looked over his shoulder and agreed with Kyouki's request.
"Since it would be tough to infiltrate some places alone, it's better I have you at my disposal."
Upon getting accepted so quickly made Kyouki a little baffled, but as soon he realized what Austin said, he narrowed his gaze upon the blond youth.
"You indeed are a shameless person, huh."
Brushing off Kyouki's hand, Austin again started preparing the magic circle leading them to the white continent.
Amidst the preparation, Austin's voice reached up to the cautious hero as the prior one warned him before they left for the Northern Continent.
"Eat this."
Forwarding a small green dry herb-like thing toward the perplexed hero, Austin continued.
"This is a Herb of Configuration. Your facial features would slightly get altered so that no one can identify you in the Northern Kingdom."
Austin's words made Kyouki even more confused and a little wary of the herb as he asked in a heavy tone.
"Why do I need to change my appearance? And in the first place, would anyone even be able to recognize me in that place ?"
Hearing Kyouki's blabber, Austin rolled his eyes as he helped the hero to get enlightened about his own popularity.
"The time you obtained your blessing from the goddess, your face becomes the brand enterprise of Gram Kingdom. Now the chance of people not recognizing the peculiar Hero is negligible, I guess."
Kyouki felt a little embarrassed being complimented indirectly as he brought his hand on the back of his head before he averted his gaze.
Austin, focusing his eyes back on the magic circle, sighed as he concluded with the hero's query.
"And I don't think you are foolish enough not to know what diplomatic disturbance would rise if the Emperor of Gram were to know that his precious Hero-sama is wandering in another land, or are you really willing to take that chance?"
Hearing Austin's reasonable argument, Kyouki accepted his defeat.
It goes without saying that, as Austin said, it would become hectic if the empire came to know about Kyouki's selfish actions. So without saying anything further, Kyouki, with his eyes closed pushed the herb inside his mouth.
A cringe expression spread on Kyouki's face as the bitter taste of the green grass covered his taste buds before he somehow managed to gulp it down.
The rapid effect of the herb started to show its sign of implication on Kyouki's face.
The healthy flesh on the hero's face became slightly dull before his cheeks puffed a little, and his eyes also became smaller.
In mere 20 seconds, Kyouki could feel every muscle on his face moving and modifying before he finally acquired his new look.
**SWIIINNNN**
The glow of the magic circle becomes vigorous, just like the time Kyouki
interrupted it previously before, Austin called for the dazed man.
"Hold my hand if you don't want to get left behind."
Wordlessly Kyouki nodded as he jumped inside the magic circle before he brought his hand on top of Austin's.
The two men held hands with heavy mana light covering the room brilliantly as the portal between the two junctions was finally established.
Side glancing at the slightly nervous Hero, Austin muttered under his breath before the two disappeared from the face of the earth for a small duration.
"Don't puke on me, hero."
Suddenly the scene around the two changed drastically as the previous stone walls changed into a stream of binding lights.
The surface on which they were standing previously also shifted into nothingness as Kyouki instinctively tightened his grip on Austin's hand.
The portal, which transfers a person from one place to another, travels through space and requires a considerable high amount of mana to activate.
But since Kyouki was unaware of such things, he only was conscious of his surroundings.
What felt like an eternity, only ten seconds passed since the portal activated and took the two to a far distant land, which was entirely out of Gram's jurisdiction.
The light soon started fading away from the surrounding when suddenly Kyouki felt Austin's hand getting away from his grip.
Subconsciously Kyouki turned his head toward his left when he saw Austin raising both his hands like he was surrendering to someone.
Perplexed, he was about to ask Austin for such a gesture when an authoritative voice alerted Kyouki before he finally understood Austin's evil grin, which he had previously missed.
"Freeze!!! Get on your knees right at this instance!!"
_________________________
At the same time, when Kyouki and Austin were caught up in something unexpected or not, in a particular room built on the same continent where Austin and Kyouki arrived.
The room was thinly lit with the holes on the walls and damaged material of the wooden house, reminding the residents how miserably cold it was outside.
But since they were accustomed to such harsh weather from birth, the group of men showed no sign of being troubled at all.
The person who was sitting at the head position of the table, which seemed for dining, was suddenly questioned about something troubling by the man sitting to his right.
"Chief...our resources are running out, and the way we are using our expenses for military maintenance and other things, I fear we won't survive by the end of this month."
The room suddenly became a little heavier than before, as the fact which everyone was aware of but still was neglecting for a long time, finally came to bite them at such crucial times.
The burly man who was sitting at the head seat heard his subordinate's words carefully before he fell into deep contemplation.
"What about the troops? Do we have enough men remaining to land a decent blow on the empire ?"
The head chief of the unknown group asked with his heavy voice as he finally seemed to come to some conclusion.
"Since the time people found out that the Emperor's eldest daughter became affiliated with Light Hero, most of the troops left our side and joined the empire so they could get protection from Gram eventually. So now we have only around 2000 soldiers in our arsenal, waiting for immediate release."
The one who spoke in a fluent tone was another man who, unlike others, was a little skinnier and shorter than the other humongous humans present in the room.
The chief heard the piece of news, which made him a little sorrowful but nevertheless, this kind of thing was expected in the military, so he didn't ponder on it more than necessary.
Rising on his feet, the chief extended his hand before he made the big announcement.
"Commence the preparation. Forty-eight hours from now, we will attack the empire and bring down the fort and the bastard Norsvolk with it!!"
___________________
A/N:- Mc will play from shadows and use Hero to fulfill his purpose.
And yeah, it's time to reunite the two love birds~
If you are hyped, then let me know~
Editor : Zenon

chapters.title: Chapter 27: Them Reuniting!
chapters.content:
There's a procedure that regardless of position or power, a person has to follow in order to use the teleportation portal.
First, they must inform the destination of the center where they would be teleporting, using the portal through the mana mail.
Second, they have to wait for acceptance for the allowance of teleportation, which generally doesn't take much time unless one does not have any misleading or unclear goal of visiting the other side of the portal.
Third, after a person successfully lands on the other side of the teleportation portal, they have to give a proper verification of their identity as well as the proof of their visit.
If any of the above mentioned requirements along with some other regulations were to be breached by anyone, either they are the mighty emperor or a measly slave, they have to face the consequences until not under some distinguish circumstances.
And when two teenagers, one with ugly features and raven hair along with a handsome youth but clearly not belonging to the northern empire, appeared out of nowhere using the portal, the situation became dire.
It goes without saying that the two, who the guards assigned at the teleportation center caught, must be sent directly to the head prison, which was built underground of the primary fort.
The reason why these two were sent to the central prison was, of course, due to the possibility of them being terrorists or a spy sent by an enemy nation.
So what leaves now was the two prisoners who were added to the central jail of the palace.
**SLIDEEE**
