"Waste an ounce of it, and you won't be seein' that for a week."
Spoke in a stiff tone was the jailor who, after sliding the cold food platter inside the cell, warned one of the newly added members.
Austin looked at the plate, and strangely, he found it edible.
'Seriously, it's better than what I can cook.'
Dragging his shackle bonded legs, he was about to take the plate and eat the stuff since he was pretty hungry already; when someone called from outside of the cell in a panicked voice.
"Hey, you! Don't dare to utter a single word! Someone you couldn't dare to offend is arriving shortly."
A smile subconsciously spread over the slightly tainted face of the blond youth as he comfortably took the plate, and after supporting his back on the cold wall, he readied himself for the show.
Austin heard a modest amount of footsteps from outside with a dense amount of mana leaking from the newcomers.
Amidst those crowds of signatures, there was a peculiar thread like a stream of magical energy that reached Austin's senses, further enhancing his smile.
The footsteps, along with loud salutes, echoed profoundly before the dark room in which Austin was locked lit up due to the outside illumination.
The heavy metal door lifted in an instant as the figure of a certain number of humans appeared in front of the cell.
Austin lazily looked at the crowd and identified that other than almost a dozen guards, two women were standing in the center of the group, receiving a considerable space from the guards in fear of disrespecting them.
The one wearing the maid's uniform had an expressionless face, entirely compatible with her overall aura, as she stared indifferently at Austin like she was watching something filthy.
But among all of them was only one person who made Austin's dormant heart beat like crazy, and the numb blood circulate like never before.
Even though he was elated beyond belief right now, he didn't let his gaze become obvious before he snatched himself back to the food.
The guards who saw the arrogant behavior of Austin, gritted their teeth in rage as such behavior was far from acceptable when such a prominent entity descended on such a lowly place.
Finally, the person who brought such unrest in the previously dead cold prison and the one who has gained the most popularity in recent months in the land of Aurora walked inside the cell.
"Young lady, it could be dangerous."
The maid tried to warn her mistress out of concern, as a prisoner like Austin generally carries secret weapons that they use to take someone important as a hostage or to end themselves.
Despite hearing that, the platinum-haired beautiful woman who, despite being in her mid-teens, was able to enchant men regardless of their age, didn't stop in her way as she walked only two steps to look closely at the person who continuously was chewing on the frozen jerky.
"What about the other one who came illegally through the portal?"
The quiet yet bone-chilling voice of the young lady resonated as the chief guard instantly came forward before he informed the eldest princess in a respectful tone.
"Since we weren't sure of their power level, I decided to put them separately for now, young lady."
Saying with his head constantly leaned forward was the head in charge of the central prison.
Luna nodded indifferently as she threw an emotionless glance at the man sitting near her foot before she commanded the chief to do something unbelievable which he never thought of.
"Send this man to my private interrogation cell. Since it seems he could be sly in any group he joins, I would take him on first."
Hearing such a statement, a gasp resonated in the background as they remembered the rumors about that chamber.
Only those who have been here for a long while know how everyone who goes to the young lady's interrogation chamber never returned.
The head of the prison also seemed entirely taken aback by the statement as he subconsciously raised his voice to reaffirm Luna's words.
"Y-young lady...is it already their time to send there?"
Luna, who was still silent verbally, released an intense amount of mana just on top of the man who dared to talk back at her.
"KHAWK!!"
**CRAACK**
The burly man knelt on the ground while trying not to choke out his life as the floor around the man started to break at a furious pace before the man fell flat on the ground with his body unable to move at all.
It happened in mere four seconds, yet the atmosphere changed drastically as the onlookers gulped hard after witnessing that the Saintess wasn't only proficient with her Healing Magic.
The Saintess could become a terrifying witch too!
Luna pulled back her mana from the top of the mana that was on the verge of leaving this realm before she turned toward the prisoner who had just bit on his last piece of jerky as she spoke in an authoritative tone.
"Since we don't know who from the main castle is involved with the rebellions, I don't want anyone talking about all these until I don't interrogate everything out of this man. Understood?"
Without pondering much upon the command, Luna presented, everyone joined their feet as they shouted in unison.
""UNDERSTOOD!""
________________________
[Austin's POV:]
After the flashy show Luna presented some minutes ago, she left in a hurry as I was again left alone for the time being.
It was fortunate that the hero didn't make a fuss and oddly remained on a low profile inside the prison without using his name as a hero, quite surprising coming from someone who is going through his rebellious phase.
I somehow knew the reason for his behavior, so I didn't bother about it and focused on the matter at hand.
I was surprised how Luna managed to act like that in front of everyone to the point where her act started to make me nervous. But when she asked for a personal interrogation session, I finally sighed that she hadn't changed.
Well, doubting her in the first place was rude of me, but again, when I saw her after this long and felt how prominent and respectful position was in among the masses, it made me slightly anxious about us being together.
It wasn't that I was deprecating myself, but when it comes to a perfect lady who doesn't carry anything which I could count as a flaw, it was natural for me to think that I was not worthy enough of her.
**SHLINNG**
My train of needless thought came to a halt as a prison in charge slid the door open before he commanded me in a heavy tone.
"Come with me."
Wordlessly I got up from my place before the guard went inside and unlocked the shackles from my legs as it was connected to the wall before he pushed me to walk forward.
With my hands still bound with the heavy chains I started my walk out of prison with my bare feet hitting the dead cold floor with each step.
'I should have used potion...'
Grumbling at spilled milk, I followed the two prisoners as they silently led me to a place further down the prison.
'Something like this was here?'
My brows raised curiously as we started descending toward the floor that was even down the basement. Like a double basement.
It didn't take more than two minutes before the last stair arrived as a massive metal door, even more significant than the cell lock, appeared in the center of the place.
The two men glanced at each other first, then at me with slight pity covered in their eyes before they knocked on the metal.
**CLICK**
The sound of something clicking, or to be precise, the sound of a handle twisting, resonated in the silent place before one of the two guards twisted the lock and pushed the heavy door.
**SCREECH**
The sound of high-pitched screech subdued not so long after as the scene inside of the room finally became vivid.
Apart from the utterly dark place, which was only illuminated with the help of a couple of candles, what made my eyes wide was the slanted platform, which had four handles, clearly not for something fun.
I gulped hard before the two big men made my fear come true as they followed the command of my not-so-lovely Luna.
"Tie him up and go out."
The two giants, without words, dragged me to the platform before binding my hands and legs with a special kind of ropes after they let go of my shackles.
As commanded, the two guards left the dark place after giving me the same pity look, before the door finally closed with only me and Luna present in the room.
Finally, from the darkness emerged the beautiful saintess who had kept me awake for many recent nights. But for some reason, even though we were alone, which I thoroughly checked through my detection, Luna didn't have much change of expression.
But I kept my useless thoughts aside and raised my voice calmly.
"You really scared me there, Luna. Now come on, untie me. I have plenty of things to talk about."
Luna was still silent as she walked up to me, making me slightly more anxious than before when I was in prison.
Standing just a feet apart from me, she raised her hand and started caressing my cheek fondly as she spoke in a voice that sent shivers down my spine for some reason.
"What's the rush? First, let me congratulate you thoroughly."
Her hot breath, which spread equally on my face and coupled with her elegant fragrance, which I wasn't able to smell these days, made my mind go numb but still, my subconsciousness allowed me to ask something concerning.
"Congratulate, but for what?"
Suddenly Luna stood on the edge of the platform as she pressed her supple body against me, giving me countless jolts of uncontrollable urges before she whispered something in my ears which broke all my wild thoughts in an instant.
"Of course, because of the new relationship you formed in my absence~."
Hearing her cold voice, which was far from pleased, my face went pale as only one thing landed on my consciousness regarding my current messed up situation.
'F*** My Life.'
____________________________________
A/N:- Only fate awaits for Austin as he witnesses the Yandere side of Luna. It's just her way of showing her love. The Yandere way of course~.
Drop a comment if you are liking the story!
Editor : Zenon

chapters.title: Chapter 28: Her grief!
chapters.content:
"You okay now?"
Austin asked as he had sensed Luna's trembling shoulder and small sniffs which halted for some seconds.
Even though Luna tied him up and seemed that she would be pushing him for the non-consensual engagement he was forced into, she did nothing significant to him.
Apart from the torn sleeves and red teeth mark on his arm and shoulder blades, which Luna served as a way to show her anger, there was nothing she did more than that as a punishment.
But for Austin, seeing Luna's crying figure because of him was the most painful retribution. He tried to soothe her after he forcefully tore the ropes, but Luna calmed down only after half an hour.
Currently lying in his embrace like a distressed damsel, Luna didn't lift her face as she confessed something in a meek voice.
"I missed you."
A wide grin, completely betraying the image that Austin which he has created nowadays in the Eden Academy, spreaded on his face as he slowly tightened his embrace than before.
"I know that's why I came here as soon as I finished my stuff."
Stating the utmost priority, he gave to his love, Austin again felt a tug on his clothes as a low, grumbling voice reached up to his ears.
"I hate you."
This time he sighed in awe as he saw the adorable pout adorning the beautiful Saintess, so he asked in his previous tone.
"Is it about the engagement?"
Luna instantly shook her head but didn't lift her face nor try talking again.
Austin, in the absence of hints, rummaged through his mind and thought of the possible reason which rewarded him with such cute pouts.
"If it's not Venessa, then is it about the fight? Wait, since you know about the engagement, then you must have seen the match, right?"
Luna, in an instant, nodded once, before she clutched Austin's clothes as a memory flashed in her mind, making her heart anxious.
But the oblivion Austin didn't notice her distress as he asked something casually.
"How was it? Did I impress you?"
After somewhat dueling with Charles, a sense of pride was born inside Austin, and knowing that the girl he wanted to pursue was also watching the match ....he thought he would at least receive some compliments and some kisses too....?
But life doesn't go as one wants it to...
"You were utterly reckless."
The previously anticipated smile of Austin faded in an instant as Luna finally shot her head upward, matching her narrowed gaze with him.
"Didn't I tell you, Austin, you shouldn't follow this chivalry and such if you want to survive in this world? If you had used your spell, the battle would have concluded within a minute, and nothing would have managed to damage you. Not to talk about the sudden power-up you used. Have you ever thought about what would have happened if your body couldn't have handled that much boost and fallen right there and then? Have you ever thought about what would have happened to me? What would I have done without you?! Have you ever thought about it?!"
As her words continued, beads of heavy tears started to form in the corner of her oceanic eyes. Austin was so occupied with her reprimanding and self-reflection that he noticed Luna's grief only after she nearly shouted at the end.
"Hey...hey...don't cry, okay? I am sorry. Look, I am not hurt from anywhere at all. That Knight Commander wasn't even able to inflict decent damage on me. I am completely fine Luna, so please stop crying; it hurts to see you like this."
Austin tried his best to hold himself together as he consoled the broken Luna gently. He knew that the way he fought was reckless, but still, even though he saw Luna like this, he wasn't guilty of his behavior in the arena which was strange.
Luna was also well aware of this side of Austin, which made her heart clench more for the possible future where he might use such incautious methods to win something, and sadly there was nothing she could do to stop him.
The only possible way to keep him safe from partaking in something irreversible, was something Luna had already formed her resolve upon.
The couple who reunited after so many long days (from their perception), held each other dearly while feeling the other one's warmth and keeping themselves solely occupied with the presence of the person they love the most.
Luna, after wailing out all of her accumulated emotions, seemed to calm down a little as she let herself get pampered by her beloved.
Austin used fresh tissues which he had stored in his inventory to wipe the tear stains off her delicate skin gently. Once again, Austin realized how fluffy and precious her cheeks were.
The thought of biting them rose instantly inside his mind, but soon, he shooed off his evil thoughts and finished cleaning her face.
Luna stabilized her back as she sat facing Austin with a slight guilty gaze because of the way she shouted at her beloved even though they had met after so long.
Her gaze instinctively fell on the shoulder, which had her own teeth marks designed with reddish clotted blood around the effect.
She instantly raised one of her hands to use her healing spell, only to get interrupted by an extensive and warm hand.
"Don't."
Luna became perplexed as she tilted her head toward Austin, who was smiling contentedly.
With worries clouding her eyes, Luna asked the reason, only to get surprised in the end.
"These marks prove how worried you were about me, and even if it sounds weird, this pain is a sign of love that I want to last long. So please don't ignore my intentions, Luna."
Luna, for a couple of seconds, became completely senseless as the overwhelming love she felt from the man she adores the most confessed his thoughts honestly.
'This man...is  not fair!!'
Complaining inwardly, an unfamiliar heat that she had only come to understand after she met Austin, covered her face as she hid herself in Austin's chest, digging herself in the deepest part, not to show him such a melted state.
She was dearly missing her previous indifferent and cold attitude she used to carry around as after meeting this unfair man, she has lost count of how many times she has fallen into his traps and shown such a typical maiden-like expression.
Austin, however, was thoroughly amused by such a sight, and he even let out tiny giggles as he felt how meekly Luna was trying to dig her face in order to hide herself from him.
"Spop lafin..."
(A/N:- Stop laughing)
With her voice muffled because of her current state, she complained before Austin felt another sweet bit on his collar bone.
Smiling contently, Austin brought his other hand over the silvery hair of his bullied Luna before he started stroking them as he whispered lovingly.
"There~there. My Luna is a good girl~."
______________________
At the same time, when the two love birds were dwelling in their pink world, a very profound meeting was being held in the central palace of the kingdom of Gram.
The vast room with furniture and decor looked like a reception hall, and there were two people who were conversing not-so-casually under the big chandelier, taking into account, the hall indeed seemed built for legal purposes.
These two men, varying in age, had a lot of resemblances in common, which was to be expected from the same genes they share.
The older one was the renowned Emperor of the most influential Nation of Gram, who was called for an essential purpose.
The younger one was the second prince of the nation and the most probable heir to take over the throne, Mikhail der Gramduör.
Some days ago, the second prince was ordered by his father to attend an event in his stead, which basically was a brawl between two unbalanced participants.
The only reason why Mikhail even bothered to stay until the commencement was the admiration he carries for Charles; that he didn't want to disrespect the battle by leaving abruptly.
But when he saw the whole match, he became utterly baffled and thrilled to the point where he requested a meeting with the Emperor right away after returning.
But since the Supreme entity of the nation doesn't get his time freed whenever he desires, it was only after four days, when the father and son were able to hold this long-awaited conversation.
Since William heard some part of the news about the battle already before this meeting, when Mikhail started to talk about the brawl, William's expression wasn't much different from a person who was listening to everyday events.
But as Mikhail's words continued to the point where Austin threw Charles on the ground and also when he was forcing the almighty Knight commander mercilessly, William's expression shifted to a brighter and enthralled end.
With disbelief clouding his comprehensibility, William asked in an anxious tone only after his son concluded his report.
"Are you sure this useless brat of Count Vincent did as you said? There isn't any fabrication in your words, right?"
Mikhail frowned slightly, being doubted but nevertheless cleared his words with utmost confidence.
"I vow on my name as the nation's prince that what I said is all true and verified. Captain Charles was pushed to a corner by a boy whom I didn't even know four days ago."
William, hearing the unbreakable remark of his son, fell into deep contemplation as he listened to his strangely over-enthusiast son continuing.
"Father, we need people like Austin besides the Hero. People like him would lead the hero toward humanity's greatest crisis while supporting him in every possible way. We need to bind him to the nation as soon as possible, father."
William didn't respond to his son's plea, but he thought the same. Since Count Vincent had severed his ties with Austin, there was a high possibility for such young talent to be stolen by other nations who were greedily waiting for the downfall of Gram.
"Do you have any suggestions, Mikhail?"
Asked in a rich voice was the Emperor as in his current fuzzy mind, which still hasn't recovered from the news of the battle, William wasn't able to draw any idea currently.
Mikhail didn't halt for even a second before responding as it seemed he had prepared the answer to such a query beforehand.
"How about Tiara, father?"
Upon hearing the eldest princess' name, William's eyes went wide. He turned his head toward the prince in disbelief but looking at the latter one's expression; it didn't seem Mikhail said such things casually.
But before William could have said anything in response, suddenly the reception door was pushed apart as a man wearing a black shroud all over, entered inside hurriedly.
The two seated men instantly turned themselves toward the intruder, who immediately bowed upon arriving.
"I extremely apologize for the sudden intrusion, my lord, but a matter requires your immediate attention."
Upon hearing his trusted spy acting in such an unusual way, William frowned before he asked.
"What's the matter, Rito?"
Hearing his master's approval to continue, Rito opened his mouth to speak the news he received just some hours ago, which made the two blonde men freeze in dread.
"This morning, Hero-sama, along with Sir Austin, illegally infiltrated the Teleportation center and used the portal to reach the Northern Empire."
_______________________
A/N:- Next chapter will be filled with lots of sugar.
Drop a comment if you are hyped~
Editor : Zenon#4120

chapters.title: Chapter 29: Her doubts and regrets!
chapters.content:
"Tell me if it hurts."
"Mmm."
Currently, in an elegant and peaceful space which by furnishing looked like a bedroom, inside of it could be seen two figures.
The room had primarily dyed covers all around with a blue color. From curtains to sheets, everything mostly belonged to a similar shade.
Apart from the reception area, which had several couches and resting sofas arranged properly, there was a separate space for bedding.
A blonde man was currently lying down on the comfortable queen-sized bed as he pressed himself flat with only a piece of short garment on his lower half.
The currently troubled man was none other than Austin, who was presently getting treated by Luna.
The part of his shoulder blades and arm where she bit were now covered with bandages after she washed it and cleansed it using antiseptic.
After that, she applied balm at the places where Austin received damage in the battle with Charles.
Since he departed for the Northern Empire only some days after the duel, his body couldn't recover from all the internal injury Charles inflicted on him.
After thoroughly inspecting his upper body, Luna went instantly to run the lotion on Austin's feet, which because of the unnatural cold of the place, had become blue and red.
The way she was gently treating him and applying the medicines seemed like she was handling the most significant entity whose life was the most crucial to be saved, made the title of her being a Saint feel worthy.
But there was one essential thing that Austin was contemplating since the time Luna took charge of healing him.
He, without a doubt, was more than happy being treated by such a beautiful woman with such gentle care, but this situation would have suited him more if this world was the same as his previous one.
Lastly, seeing her beads of sweat which she was paying nonexisting attention to and was continuously working hard to cover him in the greenish cream, Austin raised his voice in objection.
"Umm...Luna? Wouldn't it be fine to use your healing spell?"
Knowing what level of Healing spell she had in store, which eventually gave her the title of being the Light of Hope, Austin suggested the most accessible means to get over with the labor.
But when he received the cold glance of his beloved, he realized he spoke something wrong.
"Am I not allowed to see some of your skin?"
Austin, upon hearing the word 'Some of your skin', fell speechless, as he laid his back down on the pillow and let the lady do as she desired.
Luna, taking his silence in the way she wanted, smiled merrily as she continued applying the green gel on her beloved's precious skin gently.
Austin, staring at the ceiling leisurely, seemed to remember something as he called for Luna in a sheepish voice.
"Luna...did you read my memories without me being aware of it?"
Luna's moving hand halted for a mere blink which didn't go unnoticed by Austin, further making his doubt clear.
"Hmm...and why do you think so?"
With her voice still carrying the previous fluency, Luna asked in counter as she continued her treatment.
"The letter you wrote to me made it clear that you want me to change the Northern Kingdom and take it under my influence. But if you haven't been aware of my knowledge of this world, then I don't think you would have written such a letter to me at all."
Luna, after hearing his to-the-point remark, finally concluded her treatment as she turned her head toward the man who still was gawking at the ceiling aloofly.
"And what if I say that I indeed had read your memories even before you told me about your past? Will you regret loving me?"
Austin instantly frowned as he supported his back and got up, startling the other one.
"Do you really think, Luna, that I confessed my love just because of your sympathy that night? Do you believe my words and emotions are shallow, which makes you doubt my feelings? Please look into my eyes and tell me if you felt any of it, Luna."
Hearing his oppressive tone for the first time, Luna felt her heart shaking as she didn't dare to lift her gaze at all.
She knew Austin wasn't lying when he said that he generally doesn't make any relationships for fear of losing someone dear to him, but when he does build a connection, he does his best to keep things up.
And she was the first person in both his lives with whom he got involved romantically, yet she ended up doubting his confession and made fun of his feelings.
The blunder she made had no compensation even if she apologizes for the whole day, so she only kept her head leaning down in shame.
Suddenly to her utmost surprise, a big hand wrapped around her shoulder and she was pulled on the bed before she could even yelp.
"Now, stop making that face. I know you didn't mean to hurt me."
Without even letting her realize where she was landing, Austin planted her head on his chest as he patted her silky silver hair lovingly.
Luna instinctively brought her hand over Austin's upper body as she widened her eyes by being enveloped in such gentle warmth.
Austin silently ran his hand across her delicate hair as he also helped to calm her anxious heart along with his caresses.
After some moments, when finally her state of mind calmed down a bit, she whispered meekly while enjoying the pleasure.
"I am sorry for doubting your feelings. I promise I won't say such a thing ever again."
Austin sighed in relief as he felt slightly bad for scolding Luna, but in the end, what he said was all true, so in a gentle tone, he replied.
"Mm. It's fine."
The pair of two love birds were enjoying each other's warmth with practically significantly less amount of clothing over their bodies.
Austin was nearly naked, lying with Luna in his embrace, who only had a one-piece dress over her sinful body, which reached only up to her thighs.
Not to talk about the deep cleavage that her dress was exposing made it challenging for Austin to look at her properly. The most prominent thing he remembered from the one long glance he had at her partially exposed bust was the small mole on her left breast.
He wasn't a pervert, but with this much exposure, he couldn't just ignore it too.
Thankfully, before his focus could've been diverted strangely, Luna pulled him out of his stupor.
"What have you thought about the empire, Austin?"
The way she asked casually and the things she wrote in her letter were about an entire Nation's future, yet Austin was still calm as he whispered while staring at the white ceiling.
"Well, for now, I want you to do some things for me."
Without any contemplation, Luna hummed in response before she heard him continuing.
"First, help me to deal with the messenger who came to take you, as he is the only person who has seen me in Gram."
Upon hearing his request, Luna felt her admiration for him increasing, as such a detailed plan was no joke to form.
"Don't worry, I will deal with him."
For some reason, Austin didn't want to ask how she would deal with the man, so he continued his requests.
"Second, I want you to keep the record of mine and the hero's crime out of the emperor's knowledge at any cost, or this plan would shatter into pieces."
With a profound expression, Luna pondered upon something before she finally affirmed his words.
"Don't worry. I don't think the central council would ever take an interest in such minor matters as regulation treason, but still, I will lay around my wires to keep everything secluded."
Austin patted her head gently in praise, upon which, the severe expression of Luna instantly melted into a happy grin as she enjoyed the pampering.
"Last but not least, I want you to help me meet your long-lost uncle, who has been living in the shadows for some years now."
Luna, upon hearing the mention of the relative she practically had only seen when she was in the cradle, opened her eyes in concern as she informed Austin of something which he might not be aware of.
"Umm...Austin, I can arrange a meeting with uncle Nordeik, since I know where he is hiding but are you sure about it? That man, even being stronger than my father if it's about physical might, still wasn't able to overtake the throne just because of the absence of mana. Do you think he would be helpful?"
A slight smile formed on Austin's lips as what he had seen in the manga, which Luna also must have seen through his memories, the character of Eldritch's forgotten warrior wasn't appropriately justified.
Even though there was a brief appearance of Norsvolk's brother in the manga, Austin could perceive what potential the man carried, which helped him in forming this plan too.
"Don't worry; I have kept things sorted. If everything goes as I have planned, then within three weeks, the Nation of Aurora will greet their new king, and we will enjoy the show from the shadows."
_______________________
A/N:- Sorry for the short chapter, but adding info dumps isn't my thing. I will keep things moving at a decent pace and take at least around a dozen or maybe more chapters to clear this Northern Succession arc.
Drop a comment if you are hyped for the story~
Important note:- Since Austin wasn't multilingual, he used a translating artifact to be able to understand the guard of the jail and respond to them causally. Since this artifact is not visible to the naked eye, it wasn't snatched away from Austin along with his other equipment.
Editor : Zenon

chapters.title: Chapter 30: The only one she could love!
chapters.content:
In a colossal hall which was decorated with the most exquisite furnishing and tens of expensive-looking chandeliers, pointed downwards at the main entrance of the courtroom.
The unique gold originated materials, which were used to build the palace, made it clear to which nation it belonged to.
Currently, in the main hall of the Gram palace, where only high-profiled officials were allowed to enter, was now occupied by a relatively high-density of populace.
The hall had finely arranged resting sofas, where the nobles belonging to the high class were seated, according to their post.
Among those nobles, there was a blond man in his late thirties who had a more severe expression currently tainting his charismatic features.
And not only him, but the other nobles too, had some kind of similar expression as they fixed their gaze upon the person who was standing at the center of the hall, currently facing the supreme Emperor.
Apart from the adult nobles, there was a single girl too in the court, currently seated beside her father and the Grand Duke of the nation.
Undoubtedly she was the supporter mage warrior of the hero's party, Sicily.
After receiving the news about Kyouki's disappearance, her world seemed to flip upside down as this was the first time in six months that she wouldn't be able to ensure Kyouki's safety by herself.
When Sicily learned from the investigation that Kyouki had gone to the Northern Kingdom, her heart clenched even more.
She was aware of whom Kyouki could have gone to meet in the white continent.
The fact that Luna belonged to the Northern Empire was something Sicily was informed about since the first day she met the Aurorean Princess(Luna).
Her dad being the adviser and a close friend of the Emperor, gave Sicily some perks for herself too.
The reason why even after seeing Kyouki in such a miserable state when Luna suddenly left, Sicily didn't let herself confess Luna's whereabouts, which was, of course, because of her own selfishness.
It goes without saying that a woman in love would never want her man to pursue a woman who oozes with nothing but danger.
Sicily never trusted Luna since day one, as she knew Luna was hiding something and was far from completely honest with the people she shared personal space with.
The reason why Sicily was forcing new recruitment just after Luna's disappearance was also related to her distress in the Northern Princess, who didn't even find Kyouki worthy enough to let him know her origin.
Sicily wanted to end this chapter once and for all, and Luna traveling back to her birth land was the right opportunity, yet...
'It seems our love was not enough to stop you, Kyou. You indeed can't live without her.'
Smiling dryly while trying her best to hold her tears, Sicily focused on the courtroom again, where the main briefing was about the incident which happened more than a day ago.
In the center of current attention was the mage, who was the only person able enough to track the space and time magic that the teleportation portal utilizes to send people from one part to another of the planet.
Undoubtedly, the mage was none other than the supreme of Court Magicians, Alex Nuèye.
"My lord, I have thoroughly analyzed and studied the mana signature which the passage left as a trail. I am confident that the portal Austin and the hero used was set for the Northern Kingdom as their destination."
Those who heard this statement for the third time just because the Emperor couldn't trust the words of the court magician, remained speechless.
The Emperor, along with the second Prince Mikhail, was utterly baffled and profoundly disturbed too.
The hero is the greatest asset of the nation regardless of his current power level as, since the time the hero was bestowed with the Blessing, he was destined to shine over humanity one day.
Being the Emperor of the nation where the Hero was a resident, naturally brought countless fortunes and good wills of neighboring countries.
But it was also very well known, how those nations only wore a facade when they extended their friendship to Gram and were greedily waiting to snatch the Hero, using any of the circumstances necessary, and enjoy the downfall of The Golden Kingdom.
And looking at the current situation, Emperor William felt something which he feared the most had actually taken place.
Turning his eyes, William glanced at the man who was assigned the position as a foreign affair of Gram.
"Have we received any news from Aurora?"
Despite having zero hopes, William asked his employee only to get his expectancy fulfilled.
"Nothing, my lord. Neither any mana mail nor any physical letter has left the Northern Capital for Gram in these 36 hours."
The hall again fell into dead silence as the piece of information resonated heavily, reminding again how mysteriously everything happened right under their nose.
This time, adjusting his gaze upon his most trusted adviser, Duke Reynold, William asked in a heavy tone.
"Do you know how we should sort this problem, Rey?"
William's gaze, for a blink, also fell on his friend's daughter, whom he saw after quite a long time, but since it wasn't time to have a casual chat with her, William just focused on the lean olive-haired man.
Not only William but everyone for once turned their attention to the Central Adviser as they heard him confessing his thoughts not so long after.
"My lord, I don't want to disrespect Sir Alex, but I think before taking any particular action, we should first verify personally whether Hero-sama has actually gone to the Northern Continent or not."
Hearing such advice, many of the council members nodded in agreement as this matter wasn't a standard land dispute case. If things go as they seemed likely to be, then war wouldn't be much impossible to occur.
But Alex doesn't share the same sentiments as the Wise Duke.
"My lord, we all know Kyouki-kun's obsession with Saint-sama and coupled with the fact that the person hero took the portal with, was well aware of Saint-sama's whereabouts, given their recent growing relationship, I think this is the most arguable conclusion I can present."
Alex's reasoning was also on point, which various Council people agreed with too.
Now only two possible routes were drawn.
One, whether they follow Reynold's advice and request for an official investigation. This route was slightly problematic as since asking for a search of the hero in the Northern Empire when they hadn't mentioned about Hero's arrival at all, would destroy the trustability between the two nations.
And if, by any chance, Hero really does get found out being captive in Aurora, then a high probability of war would rise.
Now unlike the first option, the second one, which Alex was representing, doesn't include any trials or errors at all. From what Alex suggested, the war under the name Asset Dominance would flame between the two nations, eventually burning countless lives.
The risk was mutual in both scenarios, but the chance of avoiding the bloody battle only seemed possible in the route on which William ultimately walked upon.
"Rey, Alex. The job of collecting the proof whether Hero Kyouki-kun is indeed in Aurorean land or not, now depends on your shoulders."
Even Alex wanted to roll his eyes very badly at the stubborn Emperor; he stood straight just like Reynold and, with a slight bow, announced in unison.
""We won't disappoint you, my lord.""
__________________________
At the same time, when the particular confidential meeting was taking place in the nation thousands of miles away, a couple was having their sweet time inside a moderately decorated carriage.
The snowy lands were getting flat at a furious pace as the two giant wolves pulled the carriage in which three people were currently present.
"It indeed is delicious, Anna-san. I hope you can teach me some time too."
Austin complimented the maid, who was serving another cup of tea to her mistress, as she smiled sweetly at the blond youth.
"Thank you for the honor, Sir Austin."
Austin wanted to correct Anna again about him not being a noble but remembering how awkward things went when Anna found out who Austin actually was, he held himself back.
Anna, after serving the tea, went to a corner where she would not disturb the couple before she fell into dead silence.
"Don't mind her, Austin. She is guilty of how she treated you in prison."
"Well, she didn't say anything to me, and it was natural of her to be wary of me."
Austin tried to make things easier for Anna if she was listening but looking at her unmoving figure; he just sighed in defeat.
On the other hand, Luna seemed stressed about something else at the moment, as she eventually voiced her concern.
"Austin, I don't want to doubt your judgment, but that bespectacled bastard is trustworthy enough?"
Suddenly Luna pulled Austin out of his stupor as she asked something which was disturbing her mind since the time she heard Austin's plot for the upcoming events.
"Well, I don't trust him to the point where my life would become dependent on him in any scenario, but yeah, I think until I am helping him with his whims, he would not betray me."
From what Austin has perceived, Alex wasn't loyal to the hero nor to the place he was born. What he worships were knowledge and discoveries in which Austin was confident to be a help.
Luna fell into contemplation upon hearing Austin's remark when she suddenly felt a warm sensation enveloping her left hand before she lifted her eyes and met with the gentle gaze of her beloved.
"Don't worry, Luna. Whatever happens and whoever betrays me, I will never leave your side and will do my best to nurture this relationship, until the very end. After all, you are the only one whom I can't ever afford to lose."
A loud thump resonated in Luna's senses as she stared dazedly at the two turquoise orbs of the gentlest and most caring person she had ever encountered.
The way he calmed her racing heart and gave a sense of relief with just a mere touch was a mystery in itself, but there was something she was sure about....
This man was the only person she could ever allow herself to love.
Reciprocating his gentle touch, she closed her eyes in ecstasy before she replied.
"Mmm. I know. "
______________________
A/N:- That felt oddly long. I would write a side story about Anna's reaction to Austin's revelation.
Editor : Zenon #4120

chapters.title: Chapter 31: Alliance~1!
chapters.content:
"Are we done with all the preparation and final check-outs?"
Sitting in a very thinly lighted room, asked a burly man as he sharpened the wedge of his double-headed ax.
The ax, despite being plunged into a raw plain wood, had spilled the blood of countless enemies, which the man holding it had slaughtered to preserve his freedom until now.
"I briefed the Generals, double-checked the weaponry, and stretched out our movements among the troops as much as I could. Hopefully, we would be untied for the long term and could inflict damage on the enemy base strongly, this time."
The person who was working as an assistant and was the most trusted follower of the Rebellion Chief spoke in a confident tone about the battle preparation.
The reason why he mentioned, 'Untied for the long term', was because of the unmannerly and lack of training of the troops who didn't have acquired much knowledge about battle formation and team assistance.
The lean man, along with the white beard, fell into deep silence as they had the same kind of worries, but soon their train of thoughts was interrupted by a loud thud on the door.
The wooden door was almost about to break from its bracket, signifying how hurried the intruder was.
Both men inside the room instantly pulled their guards up but when their gaze fell on the sudden appearances, they became shocked, more than wary.
"Mike, what's the matter?"
The lean man walked forward and asked the guarding officer in charge of looking out of the main base.
Mike, despite being a guard, held great strength to the level where he could handle one or two Unique Class Demons all by himself, but looking at his current condition, the chief didn't have a good premonition.
The head watch guard raised his hand towards the place from where he came from while still huffing audibly, as some particularly unbelievable words left his mouth in between the gasps.
"Two peeps*huff* walked just *puff* inside the barrier*huff*."
The Rebellion Chief, Nordeik's eyes went wide when he heard the words of his trusted guard before he instantly went outside, followed by his assistant.
Trespassing a barrier that was conjured with the mana of more than 300 mages, and was boosted with the help of Unique Artifacts, was something Nordeik could only expect from the central Empire or any equivalent powerhouse.
The conclusion of whether indeed the Aurorean Palace had found their hideout or not was destroyed in a second as soon Nordeik walked out of his cabin.
The world was dyed in white as always, with death-freezing whips of cold blizzards making the scene even just some meters from a person, blurry.
Even though the time was nearing the downfall, and even if the weather was highly non-supportive, Nordeik could perceive that two people were walking right towards where he was.
He could hear the screams of soldiers who were doing their best to stop the duo but to no avail. Neither any spell nor any physical attack was working on the team; heck, the attack wasn't even reaching them.
'Is it a mana barrier?'
This was the most generic conclusion the burly chief could land upon, but even so, a barrier able to withstand so many damages was far from his expectancy.
It was close to impossible!
"Let me handle this, sir."
The assistant, an excellent mage in Nordeik's arsenal, let go of his shroud as soon his aura started to change with golden lightning erupting at a short range.
The man, even being smaller than most of the people in the tavern, was still a Saint Class Mage who had joined the faction since the very first day along with Nordeik and was determined to pluck away any obstruction which would come in before their goal.
But the Faction Chief had different plans.
Placing a hand over the shoulder of his assistant, Nordeik brought his ax forward with his other hand.
"We don't know what kind of monster they are, Bell. It would be better if you stay here as in any unforeseen cases, your life would be much more important than mine."
Bell's eyes went wide as he heard the honorable words of his leader, but before Bell could have rebutted his statement, Nordeik plunged into the sky with his ax held tightly in his clutch.
The figure of a more than 2 meters big man holding a giant ax and descending from a hazy sky was nothing less than utterly frightening.
Nordeik, even not being proficient in using mana, was still a superhuman who could go hand to hand with a Terror Rank Demon with the uncertainty of results. His strength was enough to give Charles a decent brawl which also helped him build this faction with his trusted assistant, up until now.
And now, when he was a step away from the possibility of raising his flag on the Northern Empire, these two intruders would be the last thing Nordeik would allow.
Using his enhanced physicality, Nordeik, after reaching up to a decent height, plunged like an unstoppable meteor towards the intruders, but little did he expect that someone could have sensed him from this range too.
One of the intruders suddenly disappeared from the barrier and before Nordeik could have changed his trajectory or thought of any better method, his darting figure collided with an utterly great force.
**BOOOOOOOOOM**
A heaven-defying loud explosion resonated in the middle of the sky as the two slammed into each other.
Nordeik's eyes went wide, as along the pulverizing sensation, he saw the blade of his ax creaking up to the base.
Nordeik's whole attention was diverted between his ax and the person who, in an instant, made him realize the gap in their power level before his big body slammed into the ground.
**DOOOOM**
The place where Nordeik fell flat was turned into a small crater with the man as its center.
Instantly the chestnut-haired mage, Bell, landed right in front of his chief with wide eyes as he also saw the single exchange between the two, and how plainly Nordeik was defeated.
"Sir, are you okay?!"
With his hand raised to help his leader, Bell asked panickedly, but instead of getting up, Nordeik just whispered audibly to warn the mage and take the immediate step.
"B-Bell...go and...hear...what they ha-*cough* have to say. Whatever hap..pens, just don't get involved in a battle with those...two..."
_______________________
[Bell's POV:]
'What is he thinking...'
Not sure what my lord thought, but inviting two intruders inside the base was nothing but an impulsive and careless decision.
We were mere six hours away from our full frontal war with the Empire, and now he had invited two people in whom one was, without doubt, belonged to the royal family and the other one by appearance, looked like a foreigner.
Even though they were doing nothing, except for the flirting and the sweet atmosphere they were creating disgustingly all around the place, I just could not turn my guard off against them at all.
(A/N:- Guess what they have been doing ;) )
Thankfully the man I wanted to question so dearly right now, entered inside the cabin, which was a little far from the place where the two intruders were seated.
"Chief."
I instantly held him at the entrance before he could move inside as I asked him in a slight panic.
"There's one of them confirmly from the Royal Palace. Are you sure this decision of letting them in was correct?"
I seldom doubt my chief's decision, but this was his most thoughtless one of them all.
On my remark, the Chief smiled only to increase my annoyance as I heard his reasoning.
"Those two would have infiltrated even if I hadn't permitted you."
Raising my brows, I couldn't keep my curiosity away as I hurriedly asked.
"How are you so sure about it? Maybe we could have won if we had fought together."
Hearing my argument, the Chief laughed lightly as he placed his hand on his back as he continued.
"You already have seen what level of mana that girl carries, that even using such a high barrier spell, she is sitting right here comfortably. Now, if it's about the blonde haired one then see this..."
Saying so, he brought his battle ax forward, which he used to attack the two intruders. Since I was in thorough distress then, when I saw him at the crashing point, my eyes never fell on his ax.
But looking at it now...
"D-does that fragile-looking guy give such damage?"
Upon getting a nod, I again inspected the axe I had seen by Chief's side, even before I joined.
His ax was made with a metal that was far more expensive and rare than the overcoat which the Northern Emperor wears, but looking at the big chunk of metal disheveled near the wedge and several cracks lining up to the base, for a second, I wondered whether this ax was really reliable?
I know doubting the quality of the ax was futile as I myself have seen its might being utilized by the chief before, but the problem was how such a mighty weapon broke into such a state just with a mere single blow.
"Did he use any artifact or Mythic Grade weapon to inflict such damage?"
This was the only conclusion I could draw upon seeing the miserable conclusion of such a minor confrontation, but the actuality was more terrifying than I could have ever thought.
"No, he didn't. That guy used his bare fist to break my Fenrir and the most shocking factor..."
Hearing that it was not all things to numb my reasoning, I heard something which might make me doubt my life experience until now.
"That boy...didn't even use a single ounce of mana, and just with his physical might made me realize that there is someone always stronger than you. He is a monster Bell, with whom we couldn't confront but only can converse for our own good."
______________________
A/N:- Told ya, he won't hold himself back.
Drop a comment~
Editor : Zenon #4120

chapters.title: Chapter 32: Alliance~2!
chapters.content:
In a big yet unfurnished room, sat a couple of figures varying in age.
The wooden cabin, which could hardly repress the harsh weather conditions outside, currently contained four people in total.
Among these four people, two were those who belonged to the rebellious group of the Northern Continent.
The term 'Rebellion' was delegated to them due to the reason of the opposition, the blood relative of Emperor Norsvolk, the second Prince Nordeik Eldritch, raised his voice against the way things were moving.
The Northern Empire shamelessly neglected the right of those who failed to awaken the mana. Also, the central authority didn't provide many opportunities to let common natives grow.
Being not well proficient with mana, Nordeik was able to understand how it feels to face partiality and live while always being compared to someone which you couldn't become even if you exhaust your whole life behind it.
He grew with those feelings and never complained but there times came when the most sacrificing personality would also flare back if cornered more than what they could tolerate.
The day Nordeik left the royal palace, he vowed to his life that the day he would return, he would change this whole system that the Northern Empire had adopted and would embark on a journey where no one would be treated indifferently ever again.
And now, when everything was going relatively fine, and the Rebellions were about to take their revenge from the capital, a young boy suddenly pops up and declares that they would lose...
"Watch your mouth, young man. You might be strong, but it doesn't mean you can insult the strength and courage of our soldiers too!"
Growled under his breath was the Faction chief's assistant, Bell, who, upon hearing the plain declaration of blond youth, that this war of succession would end up in a complete failure.
Nordeik was also slightly annoyed by the declaration from the man which his long-lost niece brought with her. But more than agitated, he was contemplating on the matter.
From what Nordeik could see, his niece was far more potent than what he heard from the rumors, and if counted from typical speculation, Luna indeed was an excellent mage.
As for the man who named himself as 'just' Austin, then Nordeik, in actuality, wasn't even sure what to say about the young man.
On one side, he used such brute strength to pulverize his war ax [Fenrir] to a state where Nordeik could only grieve about it.
However, on closer inspection, Nordeik could feel a vast amount of mana from Austin too, which he was doing his best to suppress. But the experience Nordeik has accumulated told him right away that Austin himself was a complete warehouse whom Nordeik would not like to meet on the battlefield.
Nordeik wasn't a coward, but he wasn't an idiot either. He knows when to provoke someone and when to keep his horses in control.
"You ...whatever your name is. Release your intent again on him, and I will make you realize how one can beg even for death too."
In a cold tone was the oceanic-eyed only female inside the cabin said as she sensed the heavy murderous intent proceeding towards Austin.
Even after hearing her, Bell didn't pull his intent and instead focused his gaze on Luna.
But fortunately, before any event could have occurred, a big hand dropped on Bell's shoulder as the latter mentioned instantly pulled his killing intent as he realized his chief's wish.
"Now-now, Luna. It would help if you also calm down. Bell-san just said what anyone would feel when someone out of nowhere intrudes on their place and tells them that the war is concluded even before commencing. So stop being so angry, okay?"
Luna grumbled under the sweet persuasion of her beloved as she retracted her cold gaze and, with a pout side glanced at Austin in complaint.
Austin was about to say something so he could soothe the cute Saintess somehow, when a loud yet gentle tone reached up to them from their front.
"I never thought that Luna, who even in her toddler age only let her mother be around her, would fall in love so badly that even some little flowery words would influence her mood to this extent. I am surprised and happy for you, Luna."
Luna, as well as Austin, stared at the man who was giving a very satisfactory smile, currently making the cold princess shy away a little.
But the other party had a more joyous expression on his face as he stared at the bearded man with sparkles filled in his eyes.
Luna also noticed such a thing which didn't give her a good premonition, and Austin's following words made her worries come true.
"You have seen Luna as a baby too?"
Austin asked with anticipation filling his voice, and fortunately, the frontman was much more helpful than Austin had evaluated before.
"Yes, I had seen Luna from the time when she was in her diapers, and you know one peculiar thing, when she -"
"Ah! Nooooo...Uncle, please don't tell Austin anything about those times; it's embarrassing to death. And Austin, you also don't ask, please. I won't be able to show my face to you ever again."
Cried in the plea was the cold and aloof Saintess whose personality was so famous for being indifferent every time that the current Luna would probably have falsified every single rumor about her.
"Don't worry, Luna; I won't do such a thing which doesn't make you feel comfortable."
Austin said in a gentle tone to assure Luna, but his devil side made his left eye wink toward the burly man, which the receiver also understood the meaning of, as he blinked in response too.
"Guys, can we move to the main topic? It will be dawn in few hours."
This time it was the troubled assistant who pleaded from the sidelines as he saw the carefree conversation happening when there was a war going to occur in mere 4 hours.
Hearing Bell's voice, the other three returned to their senses as Nordeik nodded and returned to the previous subject.
"So Austin, from your perception, this war would conclude negatively for our end, right? Is there any specific reason to support your statement?"
Nordeik, with a slight profound expression, asked the youth since, without any decent reason, he wouldn't just believe Austin because he was here with his niece nor because Austin was strong.
But Austin's following statement made every doubt of Nordeik, as well as Bell's, vanish in an instant.
"Hmm...I don't know whether you will believe me, but there is a weapon in Emperor Norsvolk's possession called, 'Limit Breaker.' Do you know what strength that single weapon may carry and how it would have influenced the war you were going to fight against them?"
Upon hearing Austin's explicit remark, Nordeik and Bell made almost identical expressions of utter disbelief.
"A mythical grade......."
A weapon that was forged by legendary blacksmiths and had been bestowed with blessings of Goddess, a mythical weapon was as rare as finding an oasis in the most incredible desert.
And since the Northern Kingdom didn't have many incredible ancestors , the chances of finding a Mythic weapon within the continent boundaries were as small as finding a needle in a mountain of hay.
Yet...
"Don't ask me where I found this out, but trust me, the emperor alone has so many resources that he could wipe half of your army all by himself."
Even Austin's words felt a little bitter to digest; both Nordeik and Bell knew what miracle a strong weapon could bring, not to talk about the unbelievably strong emperor himself.
Both the home parties fell silent as they thought of the way to handle things, but it was the tavern chief whose voice rose first.
"So Austin, tell us what would be the best course of action to partake now. Since you are fully aware of our situation, do you have any advice you would like to give which could benefit both of us?"
Bell was still reluctant to trust someone this soon, but the Faction chief wanted to follow his instincts and see how things went.
Never had he imagined that this simple decision of his, would save the life of countless and his own life too...
"Since it's like that, please listen to what I have to say. If things go as I have planned, then within two weeks, I will be seeing Sir Nordeik acquire the throne, which he always belonged to."
____________________
A/n : Drop a comment~
Editor : Zenon #4120

chapters.title: Chapter 33: Him jealous!?
chapters.content:
Inside the extensive courtroom of Gram palace, gathered a decent number of officials along with the second prince Mikhail and the supreme entity, Emperor William.
The meeting was called for the most concerning matter at hand, the disappearance of Humanity's greatest hope, Hero Kyouki.
The news of the Hero vanishing from the school abruptly has been widespread, but it wasn't known to the public that the hero used the portal to switch between nations.
Well, the speculation and rumors have been flaring that Kyouki and Austin went to pursue Luna, who previously went to her hometown; still, certainty wasn't backed to any of the rumors as no one was aware of Luna's background.
It goes without saying that the central authority would do their best to suppress those chattering and, in any scenario, wouldn't let general people know about such a terrifying occurrence that took place three days ago now.
The meeting was called upon the request of Alex and Duke Reynolds, who their Majesty gave the responsibility to collect evidence on whether the Aurorean nation was indeed hiding the hero or their doubts were just baseless.
It was sure that if the Northern Empire were found guilty of hiding the fact about Hero's arrival in the Northern Empire, then by hook or crook, Emperor William would do his all to take what belonged to Gram.
And what Alex was currently presenting, it looks like the chances of war starting seem probable.
"As you can see, My lord. I used the artifact I have created for spying to infiltrate the Northern palace, and here's what I found."
Currently, in the middle of the courtroom, a giant purple globe-sized screen was projected, which worked as a surveillance monitor for the device Alex made to find Kyouki in the Aurorean palace.
The device had stealth ability and if about size then; it was similar to a small butterfly that, even being seen, wouldn't make people suspicious.
Currently, the giant globe was displaying events which the device was recording. A clear image of a massive sword with a sun emblem crafted near the hilt and a red ribbon tied at the tip of the handle was on display.
Mostly everyone in the courtroom has seen the Hero's Legendary sword, and how it looks like.
And after seeing the sword on the purple globe, the expression of the officials turned ugly as they concluded that, indeed, Hero was being held in Aurora; as Alex said, this sword was stored in the prison storage room.
"Since nobody here knows Hero-kun's sword better than Sicily-san, I would like her to verify whether this sword belongs to Hero-kun or not."
Upon hearing her name, Sicily became flustered as she got up on the spur of the moment.
Under the heavy gazes of everyone around, Sicily stared at the screen for quite some time while trying her best to remain calm, before she nodded stiffly.
"Yes, this sword belongs to Kyouki-kun. The red ribbon and the deep scratch near the base are the same I have seen countless times. "
Her voice reverberated clearly in the hall, further making the atmosphere heavier than it already was.
"Father, we have to move quickly, or else I don't want to think what experimentation that Norsvolk would perform on Hero."
Spoken in a whisper was the second prince as beneath his main focus, which seemed to be on the hero, Mikhail was primarily stressed about Austin's whereabouts.
The frown on William's face couldn't be grim more as he massaged his temples while thinking of the possibilities that could have led to such a situation.
But whatever he thought, the end results were the same.
The Hero was captivated in a foreign land, and the Authorities of that place have not found it necessary enough to inform them at all.
There was nothing to ponder about anymore.
Focusing his gaze upon the Foreign Minister, William commanded in a deep voice.
"Send an official statement that if the Northern Empire doesn't release Hero Kyouki-kun within 24 hours, they can prepare themselves for an all-out war."
"It's as you say, Your Majesty."
The official bowed in response before the courtroom again fell in silence.
War never gives a good vibe to any nation regardless of their strength and manpower, but the situation was leading in a way that the massacre and slaughtering would rage again on the battlefield.
'I hope you still have some sanity left in you, Norsvolk.'
________________________
"Hey, Austin. Isn't the hero strangely silent on this whole matter?"
In a warmly lighted room, two figures could be seen, currently resting on a cozy bed, intimately.
Austin, after returning from the hideout of Rebellious Faction, checked on the hero once and found out that Kyouki was still unmoving from his position.
He hasn't spoken at all since the time he was imprisoned nor tried to use his name to create any fuss.
Luna wasn't bothered about his situation at all; rather, she was worried about what if Kyouki was planning something which might hinder the upcoming events.
Austin lying on Luna's soft thighs while enjoying her delicate fingers over his hair, replied with his still closed eyes.
"Are you worried about him?"
There wasn't any particular emotion hidden in his voice, nor did his expression show any kind of fluctuations when he said that, but  Luna immediately identified the emotion that Austin did his best to suppress.
With an evil grin, she whispered coquettishly.
"Will my Austin be jealous, if I say yes~"?
Austin frowned slightly as he covered his eyes with his arm without intending to answer.
The troubled Austin looked so adorable to Luna that the urge to tease Austin rose inside her mind, but before she could have said anything, two great knocks on the door brought the love birds out of their stupor.
"Young lady, can I come in?"
Undoubtedly it was the personal maid of Luna who was standing on the other side of the door.
In normal circumstances, Anna would have come inside the room after just knocking but knowing full well that Anna might see something unforgettable if she was to enter abruptly, the maid leaned on the safe route.
"Come in, Anna."
Luna commanded as she saw Austin getting up from her lap. She didn't want him to be so formal around Anna but knowing how he prefers to keep his private life with Luna separated from others; she could only sigh in defeat and let go of him.
"Sorry for disturbing you at times like this, but something came up which I thought was important to inform."
Instantly, Austin's dazed look changed profoundly as he focused his eyes on the maid with his brows slightly frowned.
"What happened, Anna-san?"
"An official letter from Gram has just arrived, and His Majesty has instantly called for an emergency meeting. I think it's going the same as what Master Austin predicted."
_________________________
A/N:- Their Lovey-Dovey scenes would be fleshed out more once this arc concludes, and also some school stuff would also take place where Austin would show who's the new boss of Eden Academy.
Anyway, Drop a comment.
Editor : Zenon #4120

chapters.title: Chapter 34: Her Confession!
chapters.content:
In a bright natural lighted hall of more than 200 meters in length, there could be seen several figures with quite a profound expression adorning their faces.
The courtroom, just like the outside world, was low on degrees as the man sitting on the throne let out a dangerous aura that was enough to make people shiver in fear.
The reason for the Northern Emperor's current mood was undoubtedly the letter that arrived some hours ago from the nation of Gram.
The mana mail had an official stamp and signature of the Highest Entity of Gram, Emperor Williams, which made the matter entirely the most important thing to pay attention first.
The content of the sudden mana mail wasn't something Norsvolk was able to believe; even the spokesperson of the courtroom read it three times loud and clear.
In the end, Norsvolk himself read the letter and found that, indeed, what the spokesperson announced was all true, but that didn't help to calm his anxiety at all.
The letter which arrived was far from formal greetings or an invitation to any ceremony; it was a plain and straight warning about something which Norsvolk had zero ideas about.
Naturally, the first thing he did was to order a thorough investigation of his palace as well the places around the empire to see whether the Hero had been hiding here.
But despite that, he found nothing related to Hero nor received any teleportation record of anyone from Gram.
It took him half a day to inspect the vicinity and do his all to find even a clue about the hero, but nothing came to light, leaving Norsvolk to rely on the last resort.
"Where is Hero-sama? I don't want to hear that you are unaware of his arrival."
Growling dangerously under his breath was the charismatic Emperor of Aurora, who currently looked like an annoyed beast who might engulf anyone if he didn't get his desired answer.
The person on whom he nearly shouted on the one in front of the whole court was his own blood-related daughter, Luna.
There was only one thing that could bring Hero Kyouki to Northern land if he had indeed come as the Gram was claiming, and that was his relationship with Luna.
Luna was the last hope of the Northern Supreme and those who were sitting with grim expressions on their face inside the courtroom.
If the hero really were in here, then the Aurorean government would, without hesitation, hand him over to Gram despite knowing that after this, the relationship between the two nations would be bittered entirely. But still, it would be better than the possible bloody bath on the battleground.
But things seldom go how one expects them to be...
"Hero Kyouki-kun? I haven't seen him in a while. Why are you asking about him all of a sudden, father~."
Stated without a care in the world, even though she was receiving the coldest glare of the century right at the moment, was the amused Princess who was enjoying her father's expression to her heart's content.
"You! Don't dare to play with me! The lives of countless are on line, and you are daring to say such a lie! Have some shame, Luna, and save your mother some face before nothing could be left to save."
**SWISSH**
"Khwak!!"
Suddenly after shouting his authoritative plea, Norsvolk felt a heavy amount of mana choking on his life as he saw the person he just yelled upon, in her most dangerous intent, glaring at him.
"Princess! Retract your attack, or I won't hesitate to suppress you!"
The one who came forward was a royal guard who was responsible for the Emperor's safety. Upon seeing Norsvolk struggling to breathe, the stress in the courtroom increased to another level as the Knight pointed his weapon at Luna.
Despite being at the tip of a Unique Grade weapon that was being held by a Veteran of the battleground, Luna's eyes were still fixed upon the man whose face was turning blue and red now.
The royal knight only waited for two seconds before he used his wooden staff to launch an attack on Luna, only to regret it in the end.
Luna, without turning her gaze away, just lifted her index finger right at the point where the butt of the staff was about to touch her before the staff, along with the knight, froze in an instant.
**CREAAAK**
The whole room gasped in horror as they witnessed the clear display of a chantless spell cast that took less than a wink to turn an alive and healthy man into a frozen statue.
It was a sight, terrifying beyond belief!
"Listen to me, Emperor Norsvolk! If you ever dare to put my mother's name to corner me, then I will eradicate every single thing which you consider precious right in front of your eyes before I slowly end your life! So beware of what you say."
Saying so, she released her pressure which slowly had crept upon the whole hall, as Norsvolk finally regained his breathing as he panted like a dog while crouching on the floor.
Luna, on the other side, was far from bothered about him or anyone inside the courtroom as she made her way toward the place where her most significant interest awaited her.
_______________________
"Hmm? You are earl-wait, what happened, Luna?"
Austin, who was about to turn around to greet Luna, who went to hear the inquiry about Kyouki, was suddenly hugged from behind.
It didn't take long for Austin to realize that something had happened in the courtroom, which covered Luna with such dark clouds. Since Luna wanted to face her father without Austin's help, he didn't go with her using the cloak and instead stayed in her room.
But looking at her now, he thought it would have been better if he had stayed by her side.
"Did they say something which made you sad?"
Sensing her head going up and down on his back Austin concluded that he hit the mark as he held her hand which was around his torso before he continued.
"Are you hurt?"
This time Luna hesitated for a bit but, in the end, nodded slowly.
With his hand going a little stiff on his hold, Austin's voice took a heavier turn as he asked in a deep tone.
"Should I destroy this emperor and acquire this nation by force rather than politics?"
Since Luna's height was about three inches shorter than Austin's, she was able to see his expression over his shoulder, and when she did, she became dead frozen in fret for a second.
"Austin..."
Luna gently whispered in his ear to bring Austin out of his dangerous stupor, which made Luna immensely worried as well as delighted to know that her love had become angry in her stead.
"I am okay and don't say such a thing. Remember, our primary goal is to help you score Villain's point, which might not result in the same if we were to use a forceful method to reach our goal. I am happy that you got mad for me, but we have to act calmly."
Austin felt slightly embarrassed that when he should have been consoling Luna, he was getting pampered instead.
He turned around and slowly held his favorite person fondly in his embrace.
"I know, Luna. But after I have fallen for you, everything involving you influences me too. I don't remember when I became so weak in controlling my emotions, but after meeting you, I have changed."
Luna, with her eyes closed, while feeling her favorite warmth, heard his gentle whisper before she also replied in the same pitch as she clutched the hem of his shirt in anticipation.
"Is that a bad thing?"
"No, of course not. I indeed am changing, but it's for a good cause. If before meeting you, I was a broken mess, then after meeting you, I feel like a complete man. If before meeting you, I was like useless trash, who could have tolerated the beating of any second person, then now I won't take crap from anyone, in order to look good in the eyes of the girl I love."
Halting for a moment, he separated himself from Luna as he held her chin with his finger and made her hazy eyes land on his, as he concluded.
"You are my pride, Luna. My arrogance. The cause of my grief and the reason for my happiness. If someone bad mouths you, I feel agitated, and if someone praises you, I also feel elated. These are my honest thoughts about you, Luna, and I am happy to have such a way of thinking, as apart from you, I don't have anyone I can or want to have such feelings for. So let me embrace these feelings and cling onto this new reality of mine."
Luna, who heard every word with a dazed expression, felt her heart tingling with a warm sensation as she felt how much his words had a dangerous effect on her.
Staring at his jade green eyes and feeling his slight warm breath reaching her face, Luna seemed to become more and more captivated by this unfairly perfect man.
"Austin."
Being called with such a small soft whisper, Austin raised his brows as he hummed in question before he was caught in complete off-guard.
"I love you."
Tiptoeing quickly after confessing her love for the first time, Luna planted her warm and soft lips on Austin's just for a blink before she got out of his embrace and went away in a fluster.
On the other side, the receiver of such an unexpected powerful blow was currently standing with his hand still raised in a way he was hugging someone, as with his big eyes he blinked quite some time while trying to understand what just happened some seconds ago.
Raising his hand slowly up to his lips, where lingered the sensation of what happened only for a blink, Austin concluded that it wasn't his hallucination at all, which also helped him to finally get out of his stupor as he muttered under his breath...
'Did...she ...just...accepted my confession...?'
_______________________
A/N :-Drop a comment~
Editor : Zenon #4120

chapters.title: Chapter 35: Hero’s belief!
chapters.content:
There are two kinds of war that occur under different circumstances.
First, Total Dominance.
This war is partaken to take the complete authority of a specific kingdom by going for an all-out war. This kind of war generally makes either country dry up with their resources and manpower as the war only follows the principle of do-or-die.
The war of complete dominance majorly happens within a continent which is not adequately organized or has such a policy that supports brutality.
The war of acquiring a whole empire never happened in the past, as an Empire meant an entire piece of land among the seven, which was nothing to scoff about casually.
To acquire a whole empire, a colossal level of war has to be undertaken with countless lives and millions of small battles exhausting in the process and sacrificing unimaginably.
The second type of war is for Asset Dominance.
This war happens on a smaller scale where a battle happens to acquire something forcibly or snatch back something which initially belonged to them.
These kinds of wars have happened before between Kingdoms, and the end results weren't something that could be written in history books, given the inhumanity those emperors stepped on to acquire something so small that the war seemed nothing but foolishness to partake in.
But for what Gram was about to wage war was nothing less than their whole treasury and other impactful assets.
The Hero of Humanity, who was destined to become the light of Hope and would extinguish the possible threat of the Monarch of Darkness in the future, who forcefully or not was currently captured in a foreign continent.
There was nothing left to ponder about. Since the Aurorean nation hasn't replied to anything at all in the last 20 hours, the central council has already announced the preparation of war which would be taking place in the upcoming three days.
Currently, in a thinly lighted closed room sat two dozen people wearing their armor that included the Emperor of the nation along with his second son Mikhail who was one of the greatest warriors of the country.
Along with these two nobles, the Knight Commander Charles and Court Magician Alex were also present inside the room, along with some other high-ranking officials.
"The mages from the Tower would take almost two days to teleport the army to the Northern Empire. Alex, keep a close watch on this side for any disturbance."
Since reaching the Northern Empire via physical route would take more than a month, mass teleportation was the best means to reach the destination without wasting many resources on the expedition.
"It's as you say, My lord."
Alex bowed his head slightly with a sly smirk on his face as William continued to the following command.
"Since the Northern Kingdom doesn't have any allied empire as a backer, we won't be facing any surprises, but even so, Captain Charles, I want you to be on the watch all the time. Please don't get engrossed in the battle more than necessary."
This time apart from Charles, various nodded, and the one who got directed by such pleas just grumbled and stiffly forced his head to go up and down.
"I want this battle to end as soon as possible to show the Northern Empire and the other enemies out there, what it means to go against us. We will snatch what belongs to us and help Hero Kyouki-kun to gain the freedom he deserves."
The flames of determination ignited among many, present inside the conference hall as they heard the bold and courageous statement of their liege.
Amidst the wave of determination and sheer resolution to achieve their certain goal, a heavy voice reached up to everyone as the Knight Commander began to speak.
"Ahm...has anyone thought about Austin?"
The sudden mention of the name, whom they hadn't paid much heed to since the hero's disappearance was everything they could care about, made many baffled as they looked at Charles with a complicated face.
"Austin...what about him?"
The one who spoke with sparkly eyes, even though his voice seemed to be doubtful, was the youngest person in the room, Mikhail.
