He was the most interested in the topic, and thanks to Charles, he could now bring it up without hesitation.
"From what I have seen, Austin isn't a person who can get caught by any of the measles of the North. Either Austin is willingly staying there, or the Northern Empire has something in store which we aren't aware of."
Hearing such a thorough evaluation of the matter from the muscle head Charles, many of the council members' mouths parted in astonishment.
However, William had a different reaction to the matter which Charles presented. William, with his eyebrows frowning, fell into deep contemplation as what the Knight Commanded said confirmed that Austin and Kyouki's inactivity seemed too suspicious.
Both youngsters were able to send at least some signal to notify the kingdom about their condition. But none of them were showing any sign, where they were or what, in actuality, happened after they jumped through the portal.
What made William more stressed was what would happen if, even after the war, the two assets of the Gram didn't agree to come back. Worst case scenario, what would be their stance, if the two stood against Gram in the war?
William became highly stressed to even think about such a possibility.
But before he could come to any conclusion, someone hurriedly stepped inside the conference hall, attaining the attention of everyone present inside.
"My lord! An envoy from the Northern Continent has arrived."
The atmosphere became heavier as William, followed by others, stood at an instant as they heard the guard about something they weren't expecting at all.
"So Norsvolk hasn't gone senile after all."
William's face lighted up slightly as he walked toward the entrance with Mikhail by his side. But before they could have exited the room to greet the envoy, the messenger again spoke up.
"Umm...your majesty. The envoy isn't from the Royal Palace."
William, in an instant, halted in his steps, making the messenger shudder in fear.
"Then who is it from?"
With his voice reaching up to a certain chillness, William asked the messenger only to get shocked in the end.
"I-Its from a different faction from the North, my lord."
______________________
"Okay, Kyouki-kun. It's time to change your temporary residence."
Entering inside the cell where Kyouki was sitting by the wall, Austin broke the chain restraining Kyouki's feet before he asked him to get up.
Austin was ready to face Kyouki if he was to struggle when he was migrating Kyouki to somewhere else. But strangely, Kyouki was listening to every word of Austin like he was just a puppet.
The reason how Austin was able to infiltrate the central prison as per he desired was the spell he used in the Eden Academy's Teleportation center.
Taking the still disfigured Kyouki out of the cell, Austin couldn't help but ask in curiosity.
"Why are you letting things go so easily? I mean, is there any motive you aren't resisting anything, even knowing I am using you for some evil purposes."
Austin had little idea why Kyouki was so silent since the time he was captured, and hearing it from the person himself, Austin's doubt cleared in an instant.
"If cooperating with your plans would make Luna happy, as you said before, then I am ready to be used for any means."
Sighing, Austin didn't speak further, just walked with Kyouki behind him toward the exit.
On the way out, a thought emerged in Austin's mind that he found necessary to occur for Kyouki's own good.
'I think I have to make Kyouki face reality, or this hero would be of no use in the future....'
_______________
A/N:- Short chapter since I was out of words. I will skip this war scenario since it feels a little stretchy?
Anyway, I hope my story hasn't become boring, so please let me know how you feel about it~
Editor : Zenon #4120

chapters.title: Chapter 36: SS2- Anna’s reaction!
chapters.content:
[It was the time when Anna walked into Luna's room when Austin was brought here after the interrogation]
"I am coming in, my l-"
Stood in complete dead silence was the hazel shade-haired maid as she stared at what greeted her was the back of her young lady. But what made her freeze was the man who was hugging the princess with his gaze now drawn upon the maid.
'Wait, isn't he..!!'
Anna just observed the scene for mere two blinks before she disappeared from her site and, with inaudible steps, appeared just beside the couple, as she moved her hand toward Austin's arm.
But before her hand could have grabbed and broken Austin's forearm, Austin grabbed Anna's wrist to the utmost shock of the maid, who was confident in her agility.
"Calm down, Anna-san. I am not an intruder."
Austin's calm voice brought Luna also back out of the stupor in which she seemed to be drowned since the time she hugged her favorite person.
"Anna?"
"My lady, don't worry. I will even sacrifice myself to save you from this monster."
Saying so, Anna snatched her arm back as Austin also separated himself from Luna since he knew Anna wasn't going to listen anytime soon.
But to Austin's surprise, the authoritative tone of Luna, who seemed to become annoyed when she heard her beloved being called a monster, calling out for Anna.
"Stop right there, Anna."
Unlike a standard command, Austin was able to see mana waves emitting from Luna's vocal cord as she quickly subdued Anna's movement like a heavy blow had pulverized her.
"M-my lady?"
And not only that, under the heavy gaze of Luna, with her mana continuously being directed at the maid, made the latter mention choked even to speak correctly.
Austin saw Anna's trouble as he hurriedly placed a hand on Luna's shoulder to wake her up.
"Luna, you are hurting her."
Luna, after hearing the familiar gentle voice, seemed to finally notice her nanny's struggle as she instantly pulled back her intent, giving some space for Anna to breathe.
Austin walked with a glass of water toward the gasping maid after leaving the pouting Luna, who seemed to be slightly guilty yet still angry that her sweet time with Austin was disturbed like this.
Crouching down in front of the maid, Austin offered the glass as he spoke in a mild tone.
"Here, Anna-san. Sorry for the late introduction, but I am the person who is currently dating your young lady."
"I haven't accepted your confession, tho~ Mister Austin."
Since Luna was still angry with Austin's reckless actions in the arena, she found this a chance to get back at him.
Austin, after hearing Luna's amused tone, rolled his eyes and corrected his mistake.
"Well, you can say I am dating her one-sidedly."
Anna, who received a glass of water from the person she assumed as a mere criminal some hours ago, was shocked beyond belief.
'Sir Austin...?'
Anna had heard this name about hundreds of times from Luna, so she became conscious of how this stranger could enter her young lady's room so quickly.
And when she finally seemed to realize the whole situation, her face became bright red, and she hurriedly jumped on her toes before she sat in dogeza and spoke in a fluster.
"I sincerely apologize for such unruly and rude behavior I just presented to Austin-sama. I wasn't aware of Austin-sama's identity, that's why...I...I am really sorry. Please forgive me, Austin-sama."
With her head rubbing on the ground, Anna hurriedly pleaded her apology, making Austin embarrassed as he tried to stop her, but she wasn't listening to anything at all.
Austin turned his head towards Luna in hopes of help, but when he saw her evil grin, he declared his defeat instantly.
'This sadist saint...'
Sighing, he concluded he had to do something about this himself as he slowly brought his hand on top of Anna's head before she finally seemed to pause in her movement.
"It's okay, Anna-san. You didn't show any rude behavior; instead, I am glad Luna has such a responsible maid near her who could protect her in my absence. So don't apologize for your duty as it shows you are feeling ashamed to serve Luna."
Anna's body jerked as she heard Austin's firm yet gentle tone, which made her realize that, indeed, she behaved like this because she wasn't aware of Austin's identity.
Lifting herself slowly, Anna, with her teary eyes, looked at the gentle gaze that Austin was bestowing upon her as she finally came back to herself.
Austin was a little taken aback by the peculiar expression of the beautiful older woman, but he held himself quite skillfully.
"Austin-sama..."
"Drop that -sama. I am not any noble, and since you are close to Luna, please consider me your little brother, okay?"
Austin spoke casually as he knew from what Luna had told him back in Gram, Anna was the only person who has stayed by Luna's side without any personal greed and she was the only person Luna trusted other than her grandmother.
But both Anna and Austin forgot about one thing: there was a person in the room who gets super jealous very quickly.
"Aren't you guys growing close quite intimately~"
Austin and Anna stared at each other in perplexion as they both blinked simultaneously before turning back and finding the source of this sudden chillness.
"My lady!?"
"Luna...wait!"
____________________
A/N:- This was the shortest chapter I guess, but side stories can't be stretched out more than necessary can they?
Anyway, if you are liking the story, then let me know in the comments.~
Author : Zenon #4120

chapters.title: Chapter 37: Their desire~
chapters.content:
The war ended.
Results were something that anyone could have guessed and expected.
The Northern Empire lost brutally under the lethal dominance of the Knight Commander, who solely ended the life of half of the army belonging to Aurora.
Ironically, Gram didn't lose even more than two hundred of their soldiers because of the excellent support their mages provided them.
With the most prominent figures on the battlefield in the form of Knight Commander and competent Court Magician, Gram ultimately ruled the battlefield and concluded it at the end of the sixth day.
Since the war wasn't focused on acquiring the Northern Empire, the Emperors didn't interfere in the battle; however, the resources and access to the main palace of Aurora were now accessible to Gram as per the Code.
A soft wind came and eradicated the peacefulness of Aurora and brought the Gram up to their neck before they could have even appropriately countered.
The battle, even brief, was impactful enough to leave an indelible scar that the upcoming generation would remember as this day embarked on the commencement of a new era.
"And so, now Majesty William would help you gain control over Aurora because you are helping him with the hero. Hmm...nice as I expected."
Spoke in a calm tone while being surrounded by some specific figures was the blond youth. He spoke with a smile before he glanced at the screen which appeared in front of his retina.
[Ding!]
[Weekly requirements have been fulfilled]
[Host will be granted the rewards shortly..]
[Calculating the surplus..]
[Creating the suitable rewards....]
[Ding!]
[You have received:-
1. Shape Shifter X1
2. Refining Pill X3]
"It's as you planned, boy. Gram's council is blind for the hero. They accepted my offer even though they were aware that I belonged to the same blood as the person, who, as they thought, abducted their hero. Well, their foolishness helped us eventually, so who's complaining."
The one who joyously announced was the chief of the Rebellious faction as what seemed impossible to achieve some days ago was now dancing over their palm.
Austin was the one who asked Nordeik to visit the Gold Palace and propose an offer they couldn't refuse.
The safety of Hero in exchange for the throne was a high price of the trade, but when Nordeik falsified information about Kyouki and told William the possible way Norsvolk uses to keep his prisoners hidden from normal speculation, William agreed instantly with Nordeik's proposal.
Risks were high, but Nordeik negotiation and some of the officials from Gram helped pursue the Emperor quite conveniently.
Currently, inside the room, Nordeik, along with Bell, were sitting with Austin and Luna as they celebrated their possible victory, which seemed just far from their reach.
After the celebration, Luna and Austin returned back to the palace using the portal, which Luna was able to conjure after she got complete familiarity with the Rebellion Faction's hideout.
Just like the past nights, they both changed into comfortable clothing before lying on the same cozy bed intimately.
Luna was currently wearing a one-piece night dress which had a deep cut around her neck, exposing a healthy amount of cleavage with her lower region only covered up to her upper thighs.
Her appearance was mostly revealing during the night, which Austin had grown accustomed to somehow, but still, it didn't mean he could hide his excitement when such an otherworldly beauty was lying on cuddling with him so defenselessly.
Her body warmth and natural fragrance were so enthralling that Austin found it quite hard to keep himself in control. He was, after all, a teenage boy mentally. Even though he has lived twice the worth of his age, he just couldn't brush away such temptation like a saint.
Heck, even eternal saints would find it hard when such a sinful body is right in exposure!
Unaware of the whirlwind of thought of her man, Luna raised her head and after supporting her chin on Austin's chest, she asked him in perplexion.
"Austin, I am happy you are gaining control over the North but can I ask why you suddenly thought of acquiring nations? I mean, I know it's for your Villain points but Empire dominance really came out of nowhere. "
Luna's curiosity was justifiable since what she wrote in her letter and Austin's resolve to conquer her birth land was far from aligning. She was elated to see Austin's increasing hold on the nations, but still, it made her slightly worried too.
"Well, you can say I have a hunch for which I plan to have a strong influence on all the seven continents."
Luna blinked twice as she tilted her head in astonishment, making some strands of hair fall over her eye.
Austin brought his hand and tucked her hair gently before he replied to the curious child.

chapters.title: Chapter 39: His familial fondness!
chapters.content:
"Mm."

Opening her eyes slowly, she felt relief that the room was primarily dim as it didn't take her to readjust her vision. Turning her eyes to her left, she saw the broad bare back of her beloved.

A shy smile made her way on her slightly flushed face before she hugged Austin from the back.
"Good morning, master~."
"Oh, you're awake."
With a soft smile, Austin looked over his shoulder as he clutched the small thing he was inspecting before, inside his fist.
Feeling Luna's bare body connected to his, Austin felt jolts of excitement running down his spine as the memory of something wild flashed in his mind.
Thanks to Luna's question, he was able to end his stupor before his inner beast could have taken over.
"What's that? You don't want me to know?"
Luna was clearly signifying toward the stone, which Austin hid instantly upon hearing her voice.
Sighing, he held Luna's hand before he placed the stone at the center of her palm, much to her perplexion.
"You know what it is?"
Austin asked as he had no idea what was the specification of the tear sculptured runic stone.
But in reality, she didn't hear Austin at all, as her current attention was wholly drawn upon the thing Austin landed on her palm.
Her eyes were slightly wide as she inspected the stone thoroughly about thrice in a row, and to her utter disbelief, all three times, the result came the same.
Turning her focus to the confused Austin, Luna spoke with her voice filling with excitement.
"Austin, you know about the moon goddess, Gracia?"
Being asked something that he read during his crawling age, Austin nodded without much thought as he said something in the flow.
"The mother of the three unfortunate children?"
His voice sounded a little dubious, but it wasn't for his lack of knowledge but the context of such a topic with stone.
But Luna's following words made him realize why she asked something like that.
"Yes, that's correct. The goddess who always lost her precious children every time she resurrected them. There were various unfortunate reasons and sometimes just mere coincidence, but in no life the moon goddess was able to lead her children to ascend to godhood."
Austin nodded with his mind still rumbling in bafflement as he was aware of all these facts, but not what Luna said next.
"That is why she created three specific stones which gave her children the opportunity to nurture their life and one day they could break their curses and become the deities whom people could look up to."
Austin's face lighted up slightly upon the new discovery but just that. His expression still told how this was all related to the piece of rune Luna had in her hand.
Sighing, Luna shook her head as she cleared the obvious doubt about her cute dunce Austin.
"My dear young master, this stone is one of the tears which dropped when the heart of the beautiful Moon Goddess clenched. This is one of the legacies that the three children of the goddess left behind. This eternal artifact is one of the rarest items to find. Austin, where did you get it from ?"
Facing the sparkly eyes of Luna, a smile formed on the blond youth's face, but when he heard the end of her query, his smile broke down.
Luna also got out of her reverie as she sensed the change in Austin's temperament.
With his eyes roaming at a far distant place, Austin sighed before he leaned back on the bed, leaving the perplexed Luna behind.
"It's a parting gift from my mother."
Luna raised her brows in astonishment as she stared at the Eternal Stone once again to check whether she saw the right thing. The reason why Luna doubted the stone's credibility was because of the person who brought it to Austin.
With just the history of the Stone, Austin was able to discern what importance it carries, which didn't help but increased the number of question marks.
Lying down on Austin's chest Luna encircled her hand over his upper body as she asked in a whispering tone.
"When did she come to meet you?"
Luna knew how Austin was fond of her mother even though she had treated him indifferently since birth. Maybe, it was confirmed that a man's first love would always be their mother, which made Luna slightly jealous.
But more than jealous, she was confused, just like the person himself.
"Before the match with Captain Charles."
Now Luna's confusion grew worse as she was sure about the resurrection feature of the Stone, which Austin's mother would also have been aware of.
That only means she came to give him something so precious because she was worried about Austin.
The proof was evident, and Austin was also aware of the fact. But more than gratification, what he was feeling was distress.
If his mother wouldn't have come to meet him or if she hadn't given something so priceless in the name of a parting gift, Austin would have completely forgotten about his family and treated them as strangers.
But now....
'It seems I have to meet you for the last time, mother ...'
(A/N:- Don't curse him for this since he always has a weak side for his family.)
____________________________
At the same time, when the intimate couple had their morning filled with surprise and realization, a particular group of people consisting of three beautiful girls were gathered in a closed room.
The evening sun was drowning in the sky, reaching up to the horizon, with the golden hue spread like a beautiful cover across the nation of Gram.
These three women were the remaining party members of the Hero's group who, in the absence of their leader, seemed to become aimless these days.
Vanessa mostly spent her days on the training grounds while trying to calm her racing heart, so she doesn't rush up to the Northern Empire herself.
Lilia was spending her time in libraries and recreational centers to get a hold of herself as she also trained her spells while she was at it.
And as for Sicily, then she was completely drowned in her world, separate from the others and unwilling to meet anyone since the time Kyouki left.
The reason why they came to meet, in the room which they haven't turned to since Kyouki left, was a very joyous one.
"Finally, tomorrow, Kyou-kun will return to Gram. To us!"
Sicily, with her eyes filled with warm tears, said in a heavy voice that signified how pleased and excited she was.
"Yeah, I can't just wait to see him and ask him how he dared to leave us so alone."
Trying her best to hold her tears, Venessa spoke while sniffing slightly as she stared out the window.
"Don't Venessa-san. First, we have to see whether Kyouki-kun is completely fine or not, by staying in such a place. We can't let him suffer more than he already has."
Lilia reprimanded the warrior as she said worriedly with tears of joy also adorning her precious eyes as she imagined Kyouki's smiling face making her anxious to meet him even more.
The room, which consisted of the three women who were currently on cloud nine since the time they heard the news of their beloved's return, fell silent for some seconds.
Sicily was the one who broke the peaceful silence as she brought up a matter which concerned her most at the moment and which she wanted to resolve before Kyouki's arrival.
Turning herself toward the two, she naturally grabbed their attention.
"I don't know what you guys think about Austin, but I am sure he and Luna genuinely love each other."
Lilia became flustered as she heard Austin's name, but Venessa voiced her thoughts first.
"Why bring their matter up so suddenly ?"
"Because, after visiting Aurora, I am sure Kyou-Kun must also have become conscious about Luna's choice over him. Now can you imagine how Kyou-Kun would have been feeling after he had seen the person he loves in someone else's arms?"
Hearing Sicily's remark, Venessa and Lilia blinked profoundly as they registered the words and also became conscious of the fact.
It was close to impossible for Austin to have curse energy now when these many things had happened, which meant Luna's affection toward the blond ex-noble was genuine since the start.
Now, this fact indeed leaves them in guilt, but what made them more worried now was the thought of Kyouki's current state of mind.
Focusing their gaze upon the eldest person in the room, they heard Sicily speaking something which carried their utmost attention.
"Listen, Kyou-kun's will to move forward lies in our support, so when he returns, we have to do our best to make him forget the past and lead the future with us. Whatever happens, we have to make sure Kyou-kun doesn't get involved with Luna anymore."

chapters.title: Chapter 40: Being Interrupted!

Outside the teleportation center of the Eden Academy, stood a vast mass of crowd with similar kinds of expressions on their faces.
In these faces, the prominent ones were the Emperor of Gram himself along with some other officials, The Headmaster of the Eden Academy along with every professor standing side by side, and along with other students stood the three fairies who had been dying to see a certain someone.
Just like the three beauties, every other on the ground had been waiting for a person's arrival for an hour now.
**DHAK**
Finally, the center door, which had two nervous-looking guards standing on either side, parted steadily before the image of a raven-haired handsome youth emerged.
Kyouki, with his eyes, narrowed, signifying the difficulty he was having adjusting to the blinding natural light, walked just two steps out of the gate when he heard the loud roar of cheers reverberating.
""WELCOME BACK! HERO-SAMAAAAAAA""
Kyouki nearly fell back on his butt when suddenly the scream reached up to his senses, but when he finally looked down at the vast crowd, he became a little calm at the same time touched too.
Tears of joy, cheers of victory, and cries of relief resonated among the people as they finally caught a glimpse that faded along with the hero more than a week ago.
The three who were standing at the front rushed toward Kyouki in an instant, without minding the shame of being seen before they lunged on the hero, without holding back at all.
"Kyouki-kun!"
"Kyou~"
"Kyouki-san!"
"Woah...easy there."
The three called for him as they hugged him dearly like Kyouki would disappear once they let go.
Bringing his hand on top of their heads, turn by turn, Kyouki said in a very gentle tone as he tried to soothe their anxiety.
"There~there. I know I have made you guys worried, but I swear this would be the last time I would ever leave you all like this."
"You better *sniff*."
The one who replied with her voice slightly hoarse because of the tears was the red-haired warrior as she finally was able to feel the warmth of the person she had ever fallen in love with.
The people around them felt awe and admiration toward the group who were showcasing such a beautiful bond of their love and friendship.
Everyone entirely ignored the fact of Venessa's engagement as they saw the warrior fawning her love openly toward the Greatest Human of the century.
…….
Away from the pleasant atmosphere, which was centered on the reunited group of Hero, stood two figures in the shadows as they gawked at the scene with varying expressions.
"Oof. How touching. I might cry like this."
Mutter, under her breath, as she wiped her non-existing tears in exaggeration, was the silver-haired saint as she looked down at the crowd while standing beside her beloved.
"Don't make fun of them, Luna. Kyouki is someone equivalent to god for them."
Standing beside him was the blond ex-Nobel youth who was looking at the scene with a dry smile as he held Luna's hand lovingly.
The duo also left just behind Kyouki, but as one could expect, the protagonist's halo made the duo shadowed, much to their relief.
"Should we go?"

"And where will master Austin take me~."
Luna was very well aware of Austin's mood, and even though she sounded so calm, her mind had been racing since the time she felt his gentle hand peculiarly pressing her.
"Umm...to my room...if it's okay?"
Austin slightly became nervous as the sudden consciousness of taking Luna to his room to do something unspoken made him a little flustered.
The beautiful Saint saw right through his anxiety as a sly smirk formed on her lips before she brought her lips toward his ear and coquettishly whispered her thoughts.
"If master Austin wants to take me to his room, then shouldn't he be a bit more forceful~."
_____________
**THUD**

Luna's legs were locked on Austin's back as she violently responded to her beloved's greed in her own way.
The two love birds played with each others' tongues as they fought for dominance.
"Mm~"

Luna, who saw every thought of her not so considered lover, pouted before she got down from his embrace, snatching Austin's attention in the process.

chapters.title: Chapter 41: Strategic Meeting!
chapters.content:
In a bright lighted hall which had several wooden chairs placed around a big round table, seated around a dozen people wearing the same kind of uniforms.
Despite being schoolmates, the groups were divided from the time these students of Eden Academy walked into the hall.
The first group consisted of six people, with four of them males, as they seated side by side while continuously glaring at the other two groups.
The person who was at the center of this group and relatively also the spokesperson of their party, was a sakura-haired warrior mage who had attained the level of Unique rank in recent days.
(A/N:-  A quick heads up:- Newbie rank> Warrior Rank> Unique Rank> Veteran Rank> Legendary Rank> Mythic rank> Hero.)
The boy was the first student, apart from Hero's party, to gain such a power level in so little amount of time since he joined the school,  and not only him, but the team he leads also has also gained a relatively good amount of boost due to the exploration they venture.
The second group consisted of four people who mainly had the spotlight in the room.
Sitting while chatting noiselessly was the Hero's party as they were also the ones who were invited just after the day of Kyouki's return.
Since the call was from the central authority of the Gram, the hero's party gave the meeting their utmost attention and gathered, among others, without delaying an extra second, unlike the person himself who called them here.
The last group, or to be precise, the duo, who were chatting in a way that seemed they were ignoring the whole surrounding, consisted of Luna and Austin.
The couple was getting eyed by various among people who came here because of the same purpose as them, but nothing seemed to affect them at all.
Strangely, Kyouki was also completely unbothered by Luna's intimacy with Austin, like he had forgotten about her entirely or something.
Sicily had a close eye on Kyouki's behavior, and after sensing his aloofness toward the Saint, she became pretty perplexed, at the same time, elated.
Nothing she would wish more, than if Kyouki actually gets over Luna, but at the end of the day, that 'if' was everything to make her worried about the hero's future as well as herself's too.
Suddenly amidst the chattering and gossip, the main entrance of the meeting hall slowly parted before the figure of a charismatic young man appeared on the other side.
The man, who visibly by facial aesthetic looked in his early twenties, had platinum blond hair with pair of blue orbs adorning his carved eyes. His chiseled physique was absolutely stunning with the height he walked on.
The man walked with his boots making a slight clanking sound on the ground, before he halted his feet right before the group of students.
"Hello, dear students. Myself, Mikhail der Gramduör, the second prince of the empire and currently working as a militant organizer."
Suddenly the sound of chairs being pushed back resonated as the group of students stood up after they got out of their trance.
""We greet you, your highness.""
Apart from Luna and Austin, everyone stood up as they bowed simultaneously to the person who held the most authority after the Emperor, on the whole continent.
Mikhail glanced at the duo, who were staring at him indifferently as he had just interrupted their sweet times before he gestured for everyone to sit down.
"Please make yourself comfortable since we aren't here for any official ceremony or something."
Brushing off the etiquette, Mikhail took off his overcoat before draping it over one of the empty chairs. As his lean physique became more exposed, a sigh of awe left the lips of the two girls who belonged to the explorer group. (The group of six)
After taking the chair he used as a hanger, Mikhail sat straight back on it before he glanced over the group of students, and after halting on a particular entity just for a second, he continued.
"This matter which I am going to tell you, please try to keep it to yourself until it becomes pronounced to hide."
The expression of various became profound as they heard the remark of the second prince before several nods flowed in response.
Sighing, Mikhail finally gave out the piece of information, which made the almost audience shocked in a fret.
"A number of more than seven thousand cursed demons above the Unique Rank are approaching the Eden's Academy at an indefinite pace. The front line has been arranged around the academy, but still, I want you guys to perform as a backup if some mishappening occurs."
A gasp resonated in the hall as the group of teenagers, mainly from the explorer groups, heard the prince loud and clear.
Most of them had some kind of expression except for the blond youth and the Saint.
Mikhail studied their reaction and concluded that, indeed, they were already informed about the terrifying news as a soft inward chuckle erupted inside of him.
'This court magician really does have a loose lip.....'
"Above Unique Rank, that means..."
It was Kyouki who asked the thing he feared the most to get affirmed. With his serious expression turning grave, he, as well as others, heard the terrifying part of the intel.
"Yeah, there are Terror ranked too, among the demon army."
This time the hall fell into silence as the piece of information was far from what they could digest so casually.
A low-grade Terror Rank demon was far more potent than a horde of high-grade Unique ranked. Even if they could team up altogether, the group of the six wasn't sure whether they could even inflict damage on a Terror Rank. Not to talk about, there would be loads of those demons.
Leaving them, even Kyouki wasn't sure whether he would be able to take more than one Terror ranked with his ultimate light spell. And thinking about the danger of being attacked by other demons when he would be at his vulnerable stage after the Spell, he and his party members felt cold shivers running down their spines.
"Your highness, how can we even face such numbers when we wouldn't be able to even handle their curse energy in the first place? Leaving the vanguard of school, we won't be able to save ourselves even if we all work together, which is most unlikely."
The sakura-haired boy, Riley, spoke in a heavy tone that most others agreed with too.
Leaving the working together part, there was no chance of them withstanding the heavy miasma of the curse energy. Even if they used buffs provided by top healers, it would not make any sense if they would just become fodder in front of the disaster-level beings.
Mikhail heard the words of the person who spoke for most of them before he opened his mouth to calm their anxiety.
"Don't worry. You will be provided with the support of the professors and the headmaster too. And along with them, you will be using the artifacts and weapons directly exported from the Capital's treasury. Now, how about it?"
The eyes of various, including the three women from Hero's party, sparkled as they heard about the privilege that very few people could enjoy in their lifetime.
A single piece of material belonging to a national treasure was equivalent to a person's whole life fortune. That kind of thing fills the treasury of the palace. And the thought of using the weapons which have been preserved since ancient times, made the young blood boil in excitement.
Amidst of the enthrallment and exhilaration, a deep voice reached up to everyone's senses as they turned their attention instantly toward it.
"Can I ask something related to the battlefield?"
Austin's first word in the matter wasn't related to reward or the treasures since he wasn't interested in them from the start, but something which would determine whether he would be cooperating with the others or not.
"Yes, Austin. Please ask freely."
Mikhail nodded non-hesitantly as a slight relief spread across his chest that the blonde youth was actually paying heed to the matters which, in actuality, required his utmost attention.
"On the battlefield, would others command me, or can I enjoy my freedom without restraints?"
The matter which concerned Austin was also felt by others since being ordered around at times when their life would be on line, didn't gave a good vibe.
On Austin's query, and knowing full well what depended on his responses, Mikhail's face soon got covered with a wide grin as he spoke without letting the listener wait more than necessary.
"It's the same as you wish, Austin. No one. I repeat, no one would have the authority to command you all when you will land your feet on the battlefield. So rein free and protect your school without holding back. "
____________________
A/N:- The interaction of Luna and Venessa before this meeting would be spicy, no?
Should I write a side story?

chapters.title: Chapter 42: Friendly Spar~1!
chapters.content:
It's been only two days since the announcement about the incoming catastrophe was made to some selected students of Eden's Academy.
To say, the groups were shocked would be an understatement. Petrified would be the exact emotion, most of them felt after hearing something beyond belief.
During these two days, the front line from the Royal Palace was arranged at a distance from the Eden Academy, with elites of the warrior and mages working day and night to ensure the safety of the next generation.
Students were also disallowed to leave the school territory in the name of the practical test, which would be happening in some days. This decision discontented students, but in the end, no one wanted to breach the academy's rule and get rusticated.
Except for the chosen twelve students, along with the professors and Headmaster Merlin, no one was aware of the possible danger which could reach up to the school gates in the worst-case scenario.
Naturally, the twelve chosen ones weren't forced to join classes at these times when the primary activity they should be doing was to enhance their skill and try to gain as much boost as they could before the big possible event.
And for the exact same purpose, the group of twelve was invited to an indoor practice gym of the academy without letting the other students know about the session.
The school gym was a big hall of more than 300sq ft. Since Space Magic was utilized to build the gym, the exterior of the building looks like standard house size, but from the inside, it was colossal.
In a separate corner of the vast hall stood a certain amount of people with varying expressions on their faces.
Apart from the twelve chosen students of the academy, a humungous man was standing at the height of 198 cm and face filled with minor and significant scars.
This person was a high-ranking Knight from the Royal order who came to the academy to delegate the weapons and artifacts which the capital decided to invest in the vanguard unit, temporarily.
The Royal Knight handed the relics and the weaponry to each student without much evaluation since it wasn't required.
Everyone received the treasure directly exported from the treasure, with open hands, except for a peculiar duo...
"Saint-sama? Sir Austin? Are you both sure you don't want the vault items? I mean, I know you both are exceptional warrior and healer, but still, the incoming threat isn't something you should take lightly."
The Knight was aware of the level of Healing magic Luna carries, which also has helped her gain the title of 'Humanity's Hope', and the fight with Charles made it clear what potential Austin brings. But the thought of them jumping on the battlefield without the support of such high-grade items felt too absurd.
"It's as you head, Sir Rachael. Luna and I don't need artifacts since we like to use what we already have."
(A/N:- I know Rachael is a feminine name, but I just wanted to use it)
Kyouki side glanced at Luna and found her aloofly agreeing with Austin's words without any desire to speak for herself.
On the other hand, upon hearing Austin's remark, the Royal Knight frowned slightly before he rubbed his chin while studying Austin's equipment.
The blond youth was currently wearing a standard leather vest with a cross belt over either shoulder, making a cross on his chest. The two holders on each belt sheathed daggers, which Austin had seen most using in battles.
Rachael thought for a moment, and in the end, he wasn't able to hold his curiosity, as he asked with an embarrassed smile.
"Umm, sir Austin. Just to assure myself, can I check your equipment?"
Austin's eyes went round because of the suddenness of the request before he nodded non-hesitantly.
"Yeah, sure."
Saying so, Austin took out one of his daggers before throwing it in a reverse grip toward the Knight.
**SWISH**
As expected from a Knight who has made his way to the royal army, he was able to catch the dagger fluently without showing any sign of discomfort even the speed with which Austin threw his weapon made various wide-eyed.
Rachael, after receiving the dagger, frowned slightly as the energy which the blade was radiating was not something he expected to feel from such a standard-looking weapon.
The blade was made of an alloy that Rachael wasn't able to identify since its texture and shade were utterly different from standard metal.
The black material used at the handle made the weapon strangely stable and quick to wield. Not to talk about the hilt with the grip, which seemed to gripping the user itself, further subduing the chance of slipping away during the battle.
'It's an artifact? Or demon material-manufactured?"
Rachael tried to the thought of the daggers forgery, but in the end, he could only let out a dry laugh accompanying his defeat.
"Here, Sir Austin. It seems I am not experienced enough to discern your arsenal."
The room became extremely silent as they heard the casual remark of the soldier who, despite being a veteran of the battlefield and a person who undoubtedly has seen various things throughout his life, admitting defeat for such a typical dagger.
Austin, on the other hand, wasn't bothered as he knew the material which was used to make the dagger doesn't belong to this world, so Rachael's lack of knowledge seemed justifiable to him.
"Then why not, you hand over Austin and Luna-san's portion of weaponry and artifacts to us?"
The one whose voice reverberated and gathered everyone's attention was a cemented shade-haired boy from the explorer group, named Kevin.
This thought also came up in the minds of some others in the Explorer group, but the slim long-haired boy was the only one who voiced his intention.
Upon hearing the clear greedy thought of the student, Rachael rolled his eyes before he turned himself toward the center and, while looking at particularly no one, asked in a loud voice.
"Does anyone know about the term 'Overload Dysfunctioning?'
Upon being asked about something out of nowhere, everyone seemed to be taken aback as this term was indeed unheard of by them. Only a single hand was raised from the audience, grabbing everyone's attention.
"Sir Austin?"
"If my memory serves correct, then it is a phenomenon which a warrior might face if they overload themselves with weaponry and potions which exceed their capability. In a minor situation, the over-bearer might suffer from partial paralysis, but sometimes death comes out as a conclusion of tolling themselves with something they couldn't handle."
Dead silence surrounded the atmosphere as Austin's explanation concluded.
Kevin, along with those who were with the idea of testing Austin and Luna's weapon, backed away in an instant as their head drowned in embarrassment.
Only the silver-haired saint had a smug adorning her charming face as she felt utter proud of her man's range of knowledge. She herself wasn't aware of the term but was confident that whatever Austin said must be true.
"The level of weapons I have brought have been evaluated in the main palace first under the close supervision of high appraisers. Every weapon and relic is assigned according to the user's capability. So I think your suggestion, student Kevin, was futile since the start as what Master Austin and Luna-sama have been granted isn't something anyone other than Hero-sama could wield."
The look in the eyes of the hero's party other than Kyouki, made it clear that they felt insulted by the remark, but in the end, no one spoke regarding the matter.
After checking everyone's silent expression, Rachael began to speak about the main event of today, for which he himself was pretty excited.
"Okay then. Since you have held your temporary battlefield partners in hand, let's get along with them, shall we?"
As Rachael said, he snapped his finger before, with a clicking sound; a battle arena became ignited just behind him.
The people who saw the battle arena became thrilled at once as they knew what was coming, and Rachael's following word made their expectations clear.
"The best way to know your weapon is to use it in battle. So, without further ado, I would like to call a volunteer who would commence today's practice session."
Without waiting, Venessa raised her hand before she rushed toward the arena without even waiting for Rachael to affirm her participation.
Since everyone was aware of the battle-loving trait of the red-headed warrior, no one objected to her advance as they waited for Rachael's continuation of the announcement.
"Okay, then. Who would like to be the opponent in this first friendly spar?"
Before anyone could have even thought of rivaling Venessa in the arena, a pale white hand raised high as an authoritative yet elegant voice resonated among all.
"I will take her on."
_______________
A/N:- Guess who;)

chapters.title: Chapter 43: Friendly Spar~2!
chapters.content:
"Saint-sama? A-are you sure-".
Rachael tried to pursue Luna from participating in the spar with Venessa considering Luna's attribute, which was mainly focused on healing.
But he was abruptly interrupted by the platinum-haired beautiful girl, who had a blank expression adorning her moon-white face.
"I think being restrained wasn't something I was told by the Second Prince. Or should I reconsider my participation in this whole mess?"
Devoid of any kind of emotions blended in her tone, Luna voiced her thoughts which made the listeners slightly shiver in a fret.
Even Austin gulped upon hearing her current voice, which clearly told her inner emotions.
The receiver of such words felt tremors running down his spine as he heard the voice of the person he had never thought of being so scary.
'Aren't all healers jolly by nature?'
Questioning his past knowledge, Rachael didn't say anything else before Luna walked towards the arena where the red-headed warrior stood, looking at the scene with a complicated expression.
The expression on Kyouki's face was in between being troubled and hesitant, which didn't go unnoticed by Sicily just beside him.
Lilia also had a troubled expression adorning her usually calm face, as she didn't want to see her two friends sparring for some reason.
And as for Austin...
'I hope she just doesn't kill her....'
He was the only one who was aware of Luna's absurd might, which made the blond youth worried about the possible conclusion of the battle.
"I hope you aren't doing this because of the baseless engagement my father forced upon us..."
Vanessa muttered under her breath as from what she sensed from the conversation they had two days ago; Luna was clearly affected by the meaningless betrothal.
"Well, won't you find it yourself, why I came to destro-oops! To spar with my dearest friend?"
A thick vein bulged on Venessa's forehead as she clearly took the provocation before she readied the spear that she obtained from the capital treasury.
Swirling it masterfully on her hands, a golden hue spread around Venessa before she pointed the tip of the spear towards her opponent before she called for the commencement.
"Come at me with your strongest."
Luna smirked slightly before she manifested a thin sword made of crystalline ice in each hand.
The figure of Luna, who was currently wearing the black battle suit with her alluring hair tied in a ponytail as she held the ice sword just like her clear blue eyes, made her look nothing less than a battle goddess descended upon the lower lands.
Various from the crowd, regardless of gender, felt their heart skipping a beat as they saw the current Luna, who, unlike her calm self, looked more domineeringly charming.
With a confident smirk on her face, Luna disappeared from her site like a gust which made those below Unique Rank astonished and unable to track Luna's movement.
**CLANG**
The sound of metal colliding with some similar material, resonated heavily as Luna appeared in mid-air just behind Venessa's back.
The heavy staff of the spear, which Venessa brought on her back without turning, trembled as she blocked Luna's ice sword, putting unexpected pressure on the amber-haired warrior's arm.
"Not so fast, girl."
Luna instantly backed away as she felt Venessa charging at her with the momentum.
Vanessa's spear slashed through the air as a massive gust of dust erupted right beneath the place she swung her weapon.
"Woah..."
Vanessa enjoyed the sensation she felt from her weapon responding and synchronizing with her expectancy even though she had been wielding it for the first time.
Clutching the neck of the spear, a dangerous grin formed across Venessa's face as she launched herself toward Luna, who was standing solemnly at her place.
**SWISSH**
With her body darting at a far higher pace than Luna primarily moved, Venessa launched her whole body with her spear at the front toward her opponent.
'Huh...?'
Just as Venessa's spearhead was about to come in contact with Luna's right arm, which indeed would have impaled the receiver, Venessa's vision blurred as a cloud of snow emerged from nowhere.
Before she could have realized it, Luna had already moved from her place using the illusion before she appeared right beside Vannesa as she kicked the warrior right at the base of her abdomen.
"GAH!!"
The impact was heavier than one could expect from such a delicate-looking saint as Venessa flew to a distance of more than thirty meters before she dropped to the ground.
"Ohh!"
Someone from the audience gasped as they saw the fighting prowess of Luna, who, despite being a healer mage, was able to draw hand-to-hand combat so skillfully.
The most shocked was Kyouki at the moment. He has spent almost half a year with Luna and always paid his utmost attention to her. But never did he expect that the Healer he always thought of working as a supporter and the woman he always thought of protecting was actually this strong.
Venessa, on the other hand, being humiliated to this level, became serious for the spar, as using her spear as a support, she pushed her body up.
"Don't regret this, Luna."
With a heavy tone, Venessa muttered with a slightly unsteady breath before relaunching toward Luna with her utmost speed, reaching up to the other side in less than two blinks.
**CLING**
**CLANG**
The exchange between the two women initiated with the sound of heavy material colliding and releasing spark across the arena.
The figures of the two warriors disappeared from the site before appearing at different corners, all while exchanging their unwavering blows, which seemed to be in complete sync.
Neither Venessa was pushed back, nor Luna, but the damage from the exchange was getting inflicted on both.
The audience was so mesmerized by such a sight that they weren't daring to blink in order not to miss even a single moment of such a captivating battle.
**TNNNG**
With a heavy glass-breaking sound, the two warriors separated from each other as they slid apart for some distance.
The condition of either one was not the same as they initially were. Both women were panting slightly with their porcelain faces, dyed in crimson due to the excessive blood flow across their bodies.
Venessa's armor was slightly scratched at some points, but other than that, she was completely fine with her weapon, still steadily waiting to exchange another hefty round.
But on the other side, Luna had an evident injury across her right cheek as crimson blood dripped down from the slash like an unstoppable stream. Her armor wasn't significantly damaged, but the wound on her face stated clearly how the first round went for her.
But looking at her indifferent expression, it seemed she was not bothered by such things at all as she readied her still shining ice sword in Venessa's direction.
But before the two could have engaged in battle again, a heavy and authoritative voice resonated in the hall.
"Luna."
Naturally, every gaze was snatched from the arena toward the voice as Luna also turned her head toward the person she only turns to.
Standing there was the handsome blond teen with his eyes exposing something that Luna was only able to understand. For others, he was just looking at the Saint with a straight gaze, nothing peculiar.
Luna, upon receiving the words of her beloved, pouted slightly before she turned away, but not being able to ignore his gaze, she finally gave in.
"Fine. "
Grumbling, the injury on Luna's cheek soon got covered in a greenish hue before the wound completely disappeared from existence.
While at it, Luna also disintegrated her twin ice sword, naturally attracting her opponent as she asked with her brows raised.
"Already done? I thought I could play for some more time."
There was complete amusement on Venessa's face as she directed her own provocative words toward her opponent.
But little did the warrior imagine that Luna would not pay single heed to her provocations before she would feel the chills of her life.
Luna strengthened her body with mana and disappeared from her site at a pace that was equivalent to Austin's before she crossed more than 50 meters in less than a second and stood with her body slightly stretched forward, just before Venessa.
With her five fingers connected to Venessa's chest, Luna muttered under her breath before concluding the match.
"This isn't the end."
**BOOOOOOMM*
Like the enormous air cannon blasting in a silent war field, the place where Venessa was standing a moment ago was now occupied by Luna as the prior was thrown out of the battlefield with just a single push of Luna!
The people who were able to see Venessa blasting away were only two, in which one of them instantly left his place to stop Venessa before she crashed into the gym wall.
**DHAAAAKKKK**
Rachael was somehow able to catch Venessa's body which was flying like a broken kite in the air at a furious pace.
The force was so extreme that even Rachael was pushed back for several meters in mid-air before he finally halted his and Venessa's momentum.
With every eye becoming wide at the unexpected and beyond belief spectacle, there was only a single person who was shaking his head in defeat as he saw his lover returning from the arena like nothing sort of mentioning happened.
'I hope Charles just doesn't land again for a battle.....'
___________________
A/N:- No more confrontation. The next chapter would be leisure before the commencement of a big event and Austin's last mandatory week of the Villain system.
Editor : Zenon #4120

chapters.title: Chapter 44: Is Sicily Next?!
chapters.content:
"I am gonna rip that smug apart from her! Leave me!!"
Nearly shouted at the end of her intentions was the red-haired warrior Venessa Charles who, after losing to Luna, was brought to the infirmary since she lost consciousness from Luna's blow.
The training session was called off after the first friendly spar(?) as the situation went out of hand already during the commencement.
Rachael told the chosen ones that he would be present on the school grounds until the incoming danger didn't vanquish, so the chosen ones were free to come and spar with Rachael anytime, and the chosen ones also wanted to get used to their newfound arsenal.
Currently, in the infirmary, apart from Venessa, her other party members were also present inside the cabin, which was granted for Venessa's treatment, considering her position in the school.
Vanessa, as soon after regaining her consciousness, jolted to dart at that very moment as she dearly desired to return what she received from the saint.
It was the second time she had been humiliated like this, yet she wasn't able to do anything!
"Let me go!"
She flailed her limbs as she tried to break the binding chains which Lilia had cast even before Venessa woke up since the three other members of the party were aware of her personality.
Last time she kept her mouth shut because Kyouki would have been affected if she was to hurt Austin. But this time?
"Venessa-san. Please calm down and listen to me."
Seeing her struggling both physically as well as mentally, Kyouki sat beside the agitated woman before he placed his hand on her restrained hand.
Vanessa immediately halted her struggle as she felt the warm sensation upon herself before she directed her eyes toward the gentle gaze Kyouki was emitting.
*BA*DUMB*
Lilia and Sicily sighed in relief as they saw Venessa finally calming down, thanks to their leader taking the lead.
"I know you must have been feeling frustrated. I know you want to get back at Luna, but is it really worth it? Luna has changed; she has forgotten all our relations but are you also the same? Do you not consider Luna as your friend anymore?"
Throughout his persuasion, Venessa kept her mouth closed as her clenched fist loosened slowly upon hearing the conclusion of Kyouki's reasoning.
Her heart fluttered violently as she somehow understood why Kyouki was going out of his way to make her understand this, which made her enthralled.
'How can a person be so caring for someone like me.'
On the other hand, Sicily had a complicated emotion rummaging inside her heart, which she didn't let show on her face.
There was a side of her that knew Kyouki was inwardly trying to stop Venessa for her own safety.
It seemed apart from the victim herself, the rest of the three in the party were now aware of Luna's actual strength, which they weren't aware of until now.
'How would she react if she gets to know the truth...'
Sicily shivered slightly as the thought of letting Venessa face the silver saint again, made the olive-haired supporter mage conclude only one result.
And that was the end of Venessa.
"Kyouki-Kun. What about the practice with your new artifacts and weapons? Will you train with Sir Rachael?"
Lilia asked the thing which concerned not only her but the entire Eden's academy as the hero's participation in the vanguard would be very crucial. And to ensure the hero's safety at his best, practice spar was necessary so he could become used to his newfound armaments.
Kyouki thought for a second before he replied with a long sigh.
"Even if I want to practice with Sir Rachael, I highly doubt he would be able to help. I need someone above my level to feel the challenge and grow exponentially. And, I don't think there is someone like this on the school grounds."
Vanessa, despite wanting to help Kyouki, remained silent since she knew the difference between their power level.
For instance, Lilia wanted to bring Austin's name forward, but in the end, she kept her mouth closed since it felt wrong to bring her ex-fiancè's name as it would sound like she was praising him.
It was Sicily who came up with an idea as she spoke in a slightly doubtful tone.
"If it's about swords...then I think I can ask for help. But don't take my word since I don't know whether I would be able to pursue that man."
Kyouki made a complicated face as, without a word, he nodded.
__________________
At the same time, when the meeting of the hero's party was undergoing in the infirmary, a specific duo was sharing their loving time in a cozy, dimly lit room.
"You went too far, Luna."
Austin applied ointment at the place where Luna's face was hurt as he spoke with a helpless sigh. He wasn't frustrated with her; instead felt her actions cute?
Of course, he won't tell her, or she might blast Venessa again without telling the person what happened so suddenly.
"Are you worried for her?"
With her eyes staring continuously at Austin's expression, which she seems found tough to discern, Luna asked in a cold tone.
"Of course not. I just think your anger is worthless to someone like her."
Luna, upon hearing his remark, narrowed her eyes before she asked in a colder tone.
"Who is angry with whom? And why would I be mad at that muscle head?"
Luna's remark displayed that she was just participating in the spar for training and such, even though she didn't acquire any weapon. But Austin was very well aware of the meek saint's hidden side.
"You aren't mad at Vanessa?"
Upon being targeted so directly, Luna rounded her eyes before she gazed away from her not-so-fair lover.
"Luna...?"
Austin, with an amused smile, pursued the escaping Luna as he narrowed his eyes in pure glee.
Luna, after being gazed at for so long (three seconds), finally lost her temper as she turned her face toward Austin before she opened the box of her complaints.
"How can I not be angry?! That woman got engaged with you in my absence, and even responded to you shyly when you greeted her. I mean, I ain't a blind ass who can't see her wavering bitchy emotions! And not to talk about that ex-fiancé of yours who just doesn't know how to control her tits at all. Did you see her troubled expression when I pressed myself on you? Hah! She even glared at me! How dare she! I mean, I know she was connected to you before, but now you are her ex! Freakin ex! Can't she just ride one boat for once? First, that midget Lilia got engaged with you, and now this muscle brain. Now I fear about that Sicily girl. Everyone is getting engaged with you, and here I haven't even gone on a date with the person I love! Haha...isn't it hilarious? I might end every woman from this world like this!"
Concluding with her crowd of words, Luna started panting slightly with her face dyed in red due to the momentum she spoke with.
Austin heard every word of her while caressing her hand to calm her, but nothing affected Luna because of the frustration she had accumulated since Aurora.
After some seconds, Luna realized that she had spoken more than necessary as she slowly turned her head toward Austin with fear of being hated rising dramatically inside her mind.
"Luna..."
Hearing his slightly cold tone, Luna's heart trembled as she felt something irreversible had taken place because of her whining and heavy emotions.
But little did she imagine that Austin's following word would be centered at a particular part of her complaint.
"Let's go on a date."
"..."
_____________________
A/N:- Yandere side kicking in...
Luna is just like that, so pls don't hate her.
And drop a comment
Editor : Zenon #4120

chapters.title: Chapter 45: Date~1!
chapters.content:
[Luna's POV:]
'I am nervous...'
The last time I felt nervous was when I first came to Austin's room after the Jungle expedition.
And that time too, when he came to meet me in Aurora.
And that too, when he kissed me...
And when he did this and that with me...
And when...
'Argh! Why am I getting nervous like this so often?!'
I facepalmed myself as I thought how I was getting highly strung by a single person in so little time.
Even though that single person is someone I adore, I think I am getting really sloppy these days, which I strangely don't feel much bad about.
Well, displaying my nervous self to the world would be unacceptable, but Austin would not mind this messy me who gets nervous just because of being invited on a date.
'Yeah, and maybe Austin would like this nervous side of mine…but he likes my domineering side too ...what if the perfect wifey aura disappears just because I won't be able to get myself together..'
I plopped down on the ground while thinking about the various possibilities.
It wasn't that I like to whine like this, but since I have fallen in love with Austin, I have become a woman who just couldn't control her emotions at all when it comes to the man I want to spend my life with.
'Will I end up ruining our first date like this...?'
A dark cloud emerged inside my mind as I slowly lifted my head and saw my face in the mirror I was sitting in front of.
My gaze fell at the place where still lingered the gel that Austin put on me. The sensation of his warm hand blended with the cool antiseptic made me warm from inside.
Before I could help, I was already missing him, so after exhaling deeply in determination, I got up from my place.
Walking toward my wardrobe, I resolved to make this date the best of our experience.
'Just wait for me, Austin. Your Luna will make this date memorable enough not to let you forget about it even in your sleep.'
______________
Despite promising and steeling her resolve for more than two hours, when Luna finally came to the place where she was meant to meet Austin, Luna became nervous again beyond belief.
The place where they decided to rendezvous was near the Library entrance around 4 in the noon. But Luna arrived at 2 and stood still with an invisibility shroud over herself to avoid unwanted gazes.
She wasn't sure why she was not nervous at this point when they already had sex, not once but twice now!
'Mm...what should I do...'
Sitting on a bench near the library backyard, Luna thought of the possibility that she might unintentionally do, which could ruin the date.
**Sigh**
A long sigh left her lips as she drowned in her world, when suddenly a voice called out for her?
"Luna...you are here, right?"
She almost jumped to her feet when she heard a ridiculously familiar voice just beside her ear.
"Au-Austin? You can see me?!"
She subconsciously called for him, even though she found his eyes unfocused, signifying he really wasn't seeing her.
"No, I just caught your fragrance."
Luna didn't reply because she fell into a daze upon seeing Austin's current appearance.
He was wearing a long crimson coat that reached up to his upper thighs with a plain white shirt along with high waist black trousers. His hair, unlike usual, was combed neatly at one side with a slightly flushed face, signifying the healthy tone of skin that was affected by the sunlight.
The current Austin entirely mesmerized Luna. She loves the usual Austin, too, as he seems the most adorable person to her. But the present Austin looked more adult and charming.
"Luna? Are you there?"
As Austin sat on the bench, he asked with his gaze still, trying to perceive at least the silhouette of his date, but as expected of such a powerful mage. She doesn't leave any loopholes.
"W-why is Austin so early when we planned to meet at 4?"
Despite being in complete contemplation since she came here, Luna still had some sense of time left in her so she could prepare herself appropriately.
"Well, I believe it's rude to let a lady wait, so I arrived early. But what about you, Luna? Why are you sitting alone like this?"
Being asked so suddenly, Luna became flustered as she replied in a slight rush.
"I-I just wanted to take a summer bath."
Austin, even without seeing her face, was somehow sure that currently, Luna was blushing as her voice seemed to be forcing her false reasoning.
But he didn't point it out, since he knew it would make her angry.
Soon, silence fell between the two as the time passed.
For passersby, only a young, handsome boy was visible, who was sitting alone on the bench wordlessly. Some wanted to approach him, but something told those passers-by that approaching Austin would result in something ominous.
Austin, was the one who broke the silence in between as, while gawking toward his front, he muttered with a hazy voice.
"Are you nervous?"
If someone gets hit with something they were most concerned about, then getting flustered would be the least thing that could happen.
And Luna was the same...
"Hah! Me and nervous? Of course not. Why would I be?"
Luna crossed her arms under her bosom as she announced in a slightly shaky tone.
"Well, to be honest, I am really nervous right now. It's my first date, after all."
Luna's eyes went wide as she heard Austin's honest remark. In the chaos of her unsettling thoughts, she completely forgot about Austin.
"You know, choosing my clothes and thinking about what I should do to make this date perfect made me restless at the same time, so excited that I fought that urge to come here even earlier. Even though I am sitting with you right here, my heart is pounding like crazy to think that I am on a date with such a beautiful girl."
Luna, from start to end, was so flabbergasted that she even forgot to breathe. What she was feeling since morning was also felt by Austin, which made her delighted as well as idiotic, not to be honest with him.
Bringing her hand slowly on top of Austin's, she found him turning toward her before she undid her spell.
"To be honest with you, Austin, I am also at the edge right now. Just like you, I was also having trouble with what to wear or what to say. And right now, when I saw you looking so dashing, I felt my heart beating like crazy. So don't assume you are alone in this. I am equally nervous too."
As Austin saw Luna for the first time today, his sense of reasoning evaporated as with his mouth agape; he stared at her for quite a decent time when he finally realized his rude behavior.
Holding her hand back, Austin gave a bright smile before he muttered in a soft tone.
"Since we are feeling the same, then why not take things slowly and enjoy our date on our one way?"
Luna, upon hearing Austin's positive remark, smiled instantly as, with her eyes growing hazy, she nodded.
"Mm. Let's do that."
___________________________
A/N:- Both are newbies to dating, just like the author.
Anyway, drop a comment~
Editor : Zenon #4120

chapters.title: Chapter 46: Date~2!
chapters.content:
"So, where are we going?"
Under the lazy sunlight, a couple consisting of a stunning woman and a handsome Nobel-looking youth strolled on the stone-paved path near the Academy Library.
Austin was having quite a hard time keeping his gaze straight because of Luna's current appearance.
Her silver-platinum hair was tied in a ponytail, which gave her a sense of peculiar charm and made her look a little younger than her usual self.
There was a frilly floral top on her upper body, which exposed a lot of her finely shaped moon-white arms. Her lower body was dangerously exposed up to her lower thighs as above; she wore a coffee-brown skirt which defined her perfect figure exceptionally.
The light make-up on her face, with a very thin redness adorning her supple lips, made Luna look like a doll from fairy tales, whom Austin couldn't help but gawk from time to time.
And not only Austin, but the other students and even faculties, upon witnessing Luna's current appearance, which was far more youthful and fluffy than her usual attire, became speechless for several seconds.
It would be a huge understatement to say that Austin was nervous, walking with such a beautiful girl whom he could have only dreamt of even talking to once in his previous life.
"Hmm...how about we go to the market in the nearby town?"
Austin suggested as any place he knew inside the Eden Academy wasn't entertaining, nor any place nearby, as the whole school was surrounded by jungles and lairs.
"Hmm, if it's like that, then I can take us to a place. Although it's not near, but I think you might like it."
Since the whole school was barricaded and leaving the perimeters of the safety line was prohibited entirely, Austin was planning to use levitation to escape, but he nearly forgot that Luna was proficient with space magic too.
"Please lead the way, my lady."
Austin wanted to take charge of the date, but he wasn't a stubborn idiot who would get reluctant to let his woman handle some of the things.
A small smile formed on Luna's lips before she closed her eyes, only to open them when a huge pale blue magic circle enveloped the couple.
**SWISSH**
The wind howled as the magic circle swallowed the two, only to transfer them to a place where Luna undoubtedly visited enough to get that place embedded in her memory.
________________
The next place, the duo opened their eyes after a concise journey, was a dark alley.
Austin looked around quite curiously as he studied the place, but since it was only an alley, he wasn't able to discern anything.
"Here, Austin. Eat this."
Austin saw the algae-colored herb, which looked similar to what he gave to Kyouki when he was leaving for Aurora with him.
"This...?"
As Austin asked, he saw Luna already ate one of those herbs which she gave him before her hair shade drastically shifted to a darker tone.
"Don't worry; it won't change your facial features but only your hair color. Since we both have a peculiar shade which might raise suspicion, we better not take the chance."
Austin understood her intentions before he nodded and gulped down the bitter herb, which tasted like raw coffee powder.
Same as Luna, Austin's hair also took a darker shade and only halted before converting his blond hair into a midnight raven.
Luna, who saw the change, was smiling quite happily before Austin asked her the reason for such.
"We have something in common now."
A slightly shy smile formed on Austin's lips, too, as he heard something which he also noticed but was embarrassed to point out.
"Shall we go?"
Luna extended her hand toward her beloved as she smiled brightly.
Austin, without making her wait, joined hands before he muttered softly.
"Yeah, let's go."
Intervening his fingers with hers, they both walked out of the alley before an incredible sight greeted them both.
"Woah..."
Austin's eyes sparkled as he saw the town they had just walked in, which was so colorful and filled with joy that he felt he had just entered a new world.
There were a lot of markets arrangely working on either side of a wide stone path. Since it seemed that this place was indeed quite far, the current time of the place was also nesting dawn.
Under the slight reddish-orange hue of the drowning sun, the place looked even more cozy and best for a date.
Luna, upon seeing Austin's reaction, smiled heartily as she felt satisfied with inviting Austin to this place.
"Let's go. We aren't here just to stare, right?"
Luna dragged the dazed Austin, as the latter one responded in a flustered as he let himself get pulled by the cheerful Luna.
The people around had slightly foreign facial features, with most of them having the same raven hair, as they seemed to be busy in their business.
Some were selling jewelry, some short weapons and other stuff. The smell of live barbecue, along with the richness of alcohol from the nearby bars, made the market quite engaging.
Austin's earlobes sparkled for a second, before an artifact that helped him interpret language appeared in the shape of ear studs. The relic came with a non-visible device that allowed him to speak the language he would be hearing.
"I like them on you."
Luna, upon seeing the black stud-designed Artifacts, commented with a shy smile, as the studs made Austin look really badass.
"Well, if it's like that, then I might get piercings real soon."
Luna didn't comment on it, as a blush came up to her face before she heard Austin asking her.
"How did you find this epic place? I mean, I have gone to different markets while I was at my adventurer jobs, but those places majorly felt dull and lifeless."
Luna inhaled deeply as she remembered something from the distant past before she replied in a longing tone.
"When I was a kid, I used to come here with my grandma. After I turned ten, we stopped hanging out. So you can say, it's been a long time since I came here. And I am glad you are the person I returned to this place with."
Seeing her slightly sorrowful smile mixed with genuine satisfaction, Austin became lost with words as he stared at Luna's face for quite some moments.
It wasn't the first time Austin heard Luna mentioning her grandma, and seeing her current expression; he really wanted to ask about her.
But considering the place and time, he felt it would be better to take things slow as it seemed this person(grandma) matters a lot to Luna.
Squeezing her hand slightly, Austin also smiled back as he muttered sweetly under his breath.
"Thank you for bringing me here."
Soon the duo, who, despite being dyed in the native shade of the place, was gathering quite a lot of attention, started strolling around the area.
Enjoying the delicacies and buying some random things once in a while, Luna and Austin proceeded to the market, before suddenly, Austin's feet came to an abrupt halt as he saw a specific store around the corner.
"Eh? What happened, Austin?"
Luna, after seeing Austin's wide eyes, followed his line of sight before she saw a store with a black and white label boldly written over the store.
It wasn't the store that made Austin freeze in shock; instead, the name of the place...
[Ramen and Miso Corner]
________________________
A/N:- This kind of leisure chapter would be relatively short, but I will try to maintain the quality.
Anyway, drop a comment.
Editor : Zenon #4120

chapters.title: Chapter 47: Another existence~1!
chapters.content:
"Eh? What happened, Austin?"
Staring at a strange store that Luna had never seen when she came here in the past, Austin made a face like he just has seen ghosts wandering in daylight.
But not only that, his expression spoke more than his stutters, much to Luna's astonishment and slight worry.
"L-Luna...that place...!"
Now Luna was becoming extremely worried by these short glimpses of the main thing as she cupped Austin's face suddenly before pointing his eyes toward her.
Austin became flustered as the shocking scenery changed into a beautiful sight; as he saw, the worries blended with an annoyed expression of his date, which made him realize how dazed he was.
"Tell me what it is, before I freak out."
Her intent gaze made Austin slightly amused, but he definitely wouldn't say it.
Placing his hand on hers, which was cupping his cheeks, Austin returned to his usual self as, with a smile, he whispered softly.
"It's nothing to worry about. Just the store is named after something which belongs to my previous world. That's why I fell into a stupor."
Luna wasn't aware of Austin's whole past as she had frames of his memory and had only focused on significant events.
Her eyes went wide, when she came to realize that the place which made Austin so shocked actually was related to his previous world, which made Luna slightly excited, too, as she dearly wanted to know about the things associated with Austin.
Turning his eyes, Austin again saw the giant board which had written the store name in his native language, but in the corner of the store board, there was Kanji dialect, too, signifying the origin of its owner.
"Should we check it out?"
Austin asked hopefully, as he really wanted to check the store. More than knowing about the eatery's owner, he was more tempted by the food he had been missing for more than 15 years now.
Luna was more than thrilled to know about the place, so without waiting, she nodded with sparkly eyes as the duo walked toward the store.
**TRING**
"Irrashaimase~"
A bell rang as they walked in the store before Austin's ear received something damn nostalgic as he heard a feminine voice probably belonging to the store manager.
Turning his head, he saw a woman in her early twenties busily preparing ramen in the kitchen as the customers placed orders one after another.
The whole store was almost filled with various customers enjoying the delicacies, which made Austin's mind fuzzy, before homesickness got him hard.
The servers and even the chef who greeted them in Japanese were interacting with the customer in the native language of this place, which made him complicated, but he didn't ponder upon it much as he saw a waitress approaching them.
"Can I show you guys a table?"
"Yes, please."
It was Luna who replied with a smile as she knew Austin wouldn't be speaking anytime soon because of the whirlwind of emotions she was sensing from him.
The waitress, upon receiving such a gentle smile, blushed slightly as, in a fluster, she turned on her heel before she muttered in a shaky voice.
"P-please follow me."
The table, which the midget waitress led to the couple, was placed in a corner that was slightly secluded and gave a sense of pleasant atmosphere.
The wooden table, along with the serene lightning, gave a vintage blended with romantic taste as the couple occupied the seats and sat while facing each other.
The waitress gawked both at Austin and Luna from time to time as the slight blush never left her cheeks. And the reaction was justified since the pair of a handsome man and an otherworldly beauty weren't commonly spotted around the town.
"What would you like to order?"
The waitress asked in a slight meek tone as she held a notepad in her hand.
"You take charge, master."
Luna spoke in a defeated tone, as she had no idea what was being served here.
