But little did she realize that her casual remark to Austin would leave a significant misunderstanding with the midget waitress.
'She's enslaved?! Isn't she so beautiful? I wonder what price this man has paid for her.'
"Um...two miso ramen and a side serving of your taste. Thank you."
Austin smiled at the end of his words, much to the waitress' limit, as she nodded and, without even noting the order, darted away.
Austin blinked perplexedly at the disappearing sight of the slightly younger-looking woman, before he heard Luna's voice.
"So, is that chef from your previous world?"
As Luna said, she cast a barrier around them in case of being eavesdropped as she heard Austin replying in an affirming tone.
"Yeah, it seems that's the case. The way she greeted us and coupled with the dishes this restaurant serves, I am now sure that this place is related to my real world."
Luna, who was hearing his words, suddenly halted her movement before she blinked toward Austin.
Her aura suddenly turned dark as her hand slowly made its way on top of Austin, surprising the latter mentioned.
"Luna?"
"Austin...isn't this your originality now? Why are you still saying that place as your real world when you belong here?"
There was a slight smile on her face, but Austin knew she wasn't smiling at all.
Austin, in an instant, sensed her unsettled thoughts before he expressed a loving smile before holding her hand in a warm hold.
"I know, Luna, that I belong here. It's just that, my life being so perfect with you, makes me think that this life is still a dream which might break at any moment."
Luna's expression softened drastically as a blush lit up her face. Austin sighed inwardly as he concluded that it was almost impossible to understand Luna's mood swings, which led him no choice but to use flowery words sometimes.
"I-Is that so. Then it's okay."
Shaking his head in defeat, Austin saw the fidgety Luna, who was stealing gazes because of her blush.
Soon their order was served with two big bowls of ramen and some cucumber and chili salad. The nostalgic smell of the ramen made Austin already full for the day, before he saw something out of place beside the bowl.
"Umm...are only forks available to eat ramen?"
Austin wasn't sure whether using the direct word would be good, so he just asked subjectively.
The maid's face instantly brightened up as she shook her head in an instant.
"No sir, we have another culinary which madam has invented along with these peculiar noodles. Since nobody knows about it, we generally provide a fork with ramen. Should I get it for you, sir?"
Austin nodded as he replied, "Please."
But before the waitress could have dashed away, Luna suddenly spoke up.
"Please bring two, whatever you are talking about."
The waitress blinked for a couple of seconds before she nodded and walked away.
"What?"
Sensing Austin's amused gaze, Luna asked with a slight frown as she hid her embarrassment behind her tone.
"Nothing~"
And to add fuel to the fire, Austin giggled at the end of his words, much to Luna's annoyance upon how she behaved right now.
The waitress didn't make the unique customers wait more than a minute before she brought two pairs of wooden chopsticks toward the table.
"Please enjoy your meal."
Saying so, the waitress left the two alone as the couple continued their date with an unexpected turn of events.
"Should I help you, Luna?"
Austin was thoroughly amused by the site of the clumsy saint who was trying hard to intimate him but failing miserably.
"Please do."
Luna sighed as she accepted her defeat before she saw Austin blowing over the ramen, which was stuck between his chopsticks, with a smile not leaving his face at all.
Luna pouted about being made fun of before she saw the chopstick being extended towards
her.
"Here. Enjoy plentiful~."
"Hmph!"
Grumbling, Luna extended herself forward a little before her small mouth received the noodle as she tucked her hair behind her ear to avoid disturbance.
The casual gesture of Luna made Austin mesmerized for a long time that, even though Luna slurped the serving, his hand was still frozen on his spot.
Luna blinked upon seeing Austin's dazed look before she raised her brows in query.
"You are beautiful."
**Cough**Cough**
Luna instantly coughed upon being attacked suddenly as she glared with teary eyes towards the unfair man.
Austin extended water with an apologetic smile on his face.
"Don't come at me so suddenly. It's bad for my heart."
"Hai....hai."
For the rest of the next twenty minutes, the duo enjoyed their couple time as Austin lovingly fed Luna and also ate the delicious ramen while chatting casually.
It was only after they finished, and the waitress cleaned the table, that Austin requested something out of nowhere.
"Can you pass this to your madam?"
What he extended was a tissue paper on which he had written something before. The waitress, despite being flustered, nodded as she went away in a daze.
Luna raised her brows in perplexion as Austin replied in a calm tone.
"Wait for a few seconds."
Luna was still unsure about the situation, but soon her eyes sparkled in alertness.
As Austin said, a presence darted toward them at a pace that made Luna nearly activate her spell.
Appearing while panting heavily was the chef who was preparing dishes by the counter as she raised her voice in a hurried tone.
"You...!"
____________________
A/N:- Next chapter...big revelation.
Editor : Zenon #4120

chapters.title: Chapter 48: Another Existence~2!
chapters.content:
"You! Who's the one who wrote that compliment?!"
As her words flew in a very clear path even though she was panting heavily, the long raven-haired woman asked the couple sitting quietly at their table.
Her voice contained anxiety along with some hopefulness as she studied Austin and Luna, turn by turn in such less time before she heard the boy speaking in a calm tone.
"It was me, owner-san. And again, the ramen was really perfect to our liking. Please keep up the good job."
Austin compliments honestly, as he saw the woman smiling gleefully before she shakes her head, probably realizing that she was getting diverted from her primary focus.
"That would be for later but are you really not from this world? Though, you look like a foreigner, but your face doesn't seem to be Asian?"
(A/N:- Austin wrote that compliment in Kansai)
Subconsciously or not, the woman was speaking in Japanese, which the artifact wasn't interpreting since Austin was utterly familiar with the language.
"First, can you tell me about you? How did you come here?"
Austin decided to talk in his native language since he didn't want to leave Luna out of the conversation.
It seemed the woman also sensed something off with Luna's expression when she asked Austin about his origin; that's why her following words came out in the town's language too.
"I will tell you, but is it okay to continue the chat elsewhere? You see, both of you are already grabbing a lot of attention, and if I, too, start conversing with you even though we have this barrier, I might get a summoning command in the court."
There was a lot that made Austin frown. Like at the conclusion when she said that she might get a summoning issued, or the attention-grabbing part.
But it wasn't him who spoke first; instead, the saint who was sitting quietly until now.
"You can see my barrier?!"
Luna nearly shouted as the statement that the shop owner released was too unreal for her to believe.
A mage's ego was what it called, which ignited inside Luna as she asked for an explanation of how her such high-level spell was seen through.
The woman smiled awkwardly as she heard Luna's expression of her disbelief upon the thing which most of the mages felt around her.
"Well, it's not like your spell has a fault, miss. Instead, I would say it's the most beautiful and flawless barrier I have ever seen. But unluckily, you met me, an irregular appraiser who can see right through almost every spell and trap."
Luna blinked in slight perplexion as she heard the woman's words as her anxious mind calmed down a bit.
Luna's slightly exaggerated reaction was justifiable as it was the first time anyone was able to breach her barrier. Not even Austin could see through Luna's spell, which made him realize what kind of anomaly this unexpected existence was.
__________________________
The trio soon left the table and the restaurant entirely as the woman in her mid-twenties led the duo to her room which was on the second floor of the complex.
It seemed she ran a motel too, as there were quite a number of people on the second floor, as they made their way toward the very end of the corridor, which was the most secluded.
"I know it isn't very great, but please make yourself comfortable."
The room in which the lady brought the couple in was pretty big if compared to the inn that Austin rented back in his adventurer days.
There wasn't any decoration, just a single bed, a small coffee table, and a simple wooden wardrobe along with some small furniture like a stool, etc.
Inviting them both toward the table, the owner of the room brought a stool from beside her bed before she sat with her eyes roaming in between them.
"You guys seriously compliment each other, now when I take a closer look."
An insuppressible smile erupted on the quiet saint's face as she fought the urge to grin gleefully.
Austin just smiled while scratching his cheek in embarrassment as the woman giggled in satisfaction from their reaction.
"So, who are you, if you don't mind me asking?"
The woman asked as she twirled her finger before the pot resting on the shelf by the coffee table suddenly levitated toward them as it also started heating up.
Neither of the two missed such a high level of psychokinesis as Austin responded while keeping his gaze straight.
"I am Austin, and she is Luna. We aren't natives of this town, as you can guess. And if it's about me knowing Japanese, then I would rather hear you out first."
Austin spoke in a serene tone as he saw the woman blinking a couple of times as she became perplexed.
For the next few minutes, only the small whistle of the kettle resonated in the room, as it seemed the woman was contemplating upon something.
Austin understood her insecurity as, just like her, no one would give away the information about being a reincarnate just like that.
But little did he expect that, unlike him, the woman in front would not be a reincarnated being but...
"Okay, first, let me introduce myself."
Speaking in a neutral tone, the woman poured the content, which smelt like lemon tea, as she continued.
"I am Shirata Akiko as in 'Autumn child'. I am 43 this year and currently working as the manager and owner of this eatery and motel."
Austin raised his eyebrows as he heard Akiko's actual age but again, he couldn't expect less from someone who carries mana in them. Just like his mother.
The two took the cup, which Akiko extended toward them as she continued.
"Now, as per how I came here...then I was summoned here through a magic portal."
The eyes of both listeners went wide as they glanced at each other for a second before focusing their eyes back on Akiko.
Summoning to a different world was a mere myth written in an ancient fairy tail; that's why Luna's reaction felt justified.
But what made Austin flabbergasted was something he could not speak as if now....
Sensing the mixed reaction, Akiko continued.
"About a year ago, I, along with three others, were transported to this world through a cross-dimension teleportation portal. The summoning was something incredibly new to me, but the two of the guys among us four reacted like it was something they awaited or they were aware of."
The expression on Austin's face changed significantly as he heard Akiko's words which seemed genuine enough.
The way she has been saying things, it became clear to Austin that the two summoned beings were aware of this generic isekai troupe, or maybe there was something more.
But despite his curiosity growing over the bay, he stayed silent and let the lady continue.
"Since I wasn't interested in the heroic stuff, I left the royal palace and started the business which I always dreamt of in my last life."
There was a sense of pride and satisfaction in her eyes as she muttered how fulfilled she was in this life of hers.
Austin smiled as he was also happy about Akiko's achievement, whereas Luna just sipped on her tea which she found strangely addictive.
**Sip**
"What about the other three? Are they adventuring, or have they also started something independently?"
Austin asked as he thought it would be good if he could meet some people who share the exact origin as him.
"Hmm...as I remember, the stout boy from the group left to build his harem while adventuring around the nation. And about the other two, then the spiky-haired boy is pursuing the hero girl who was summoned alongside us. But as I remember, his chance with that stern and overpowered girl is close to zero."
Akiko rubbed her chin as it seemed it had been a long since she had left the people she came here with.
Suddenly it seemed Austin realized something as he asked with a slight perplexion.
"Akiko-san...is this girl which you said is a hero...Is it just by name, or does she have a class of hero?"
This was a rather complex question as a class of hero was extremely rare, or to say it was nearly impossible for someone randomly to be bestowed with the blessing of becoming a Hero.
This was the reason why Kyouki was so famous across the nation, as he was the only being born in the past two centuries who received the title of hero because of the Blessing he received from the supreme deity.
"It's neither her class nor just in the name. What makes her a hero is a strength she carries. I know I shouldn't tell you guys, but do you want to know what class the first time she got appraised with?"
Upon hearing such a deep tone, even Luna became interested as both nodded simultaneously toward the woman before a shocking reservation was brought forward.
Akiko smiled with a sigh as she leaned back on her chair before only a two-syllable word left her mouth.
"Demi-god."
______________________
A/N:- Here comes a new char. I hope you guys like it, and don't worry; Austin wouldn't be nerfed since everything has a limit...kekek…
Editor : Zenon #4120

chapters.title: Chapter 49: Another Hero!?
chapters.content:
"Are you sure it's Demi-God and not something else?"
Austin was a little startled upon hearing Luna's calm tone as he didn't expect her to question the credibility of the word; rather, he thought whether surpassing a Hero Class and entering the domain of Gods was even possible?
From what he has learned and seen in the manga, the hero class was sufficient for Kyouki to defeat the Demon Lord. Although it took a lot from the human side to let Kyouki face the Monarch of Darkness, in the end, a hero was destined to slay evil beings.
And since the main motive of a hero was to eradicate the demon lord, Kyouki never grew stronger than he already was at the end of the manga.
And now, suddenly, this strange woman with a strange background brought a class that was unheard of until now, and not only that, this class was already granted to someone who still wasn't known to the world.
'Is it a secret weapon or something more...?'
Austin was sure that this summoned hero was kept secret from others as a hero surpassing the Light of Humanity, Kyouki, would become the piece of the world's attraction within a night.
But for Austin, it would not be good. His system recognizes Kyouki as a hero and gives Austin points in accordance with the hero's involvement. What if, the center of focus changes to the new summoned hero and some alteration happens to Villain's System Points Requirement?
It was fortunate that Austin just had to care about his system for this week on a necessity basis. After that, he doesn't care whatever happens.
Akiko, upon hearing Luna's profound query, smiled before she sighed in defeat.
"I haven't seen it myself, but the level of strength and the peculiar mana she carries, is still the most terrifying thing I have ever appraised."
Luna nodded indifferently as it seemed she wasn't much entertained by the answer. What was going through her mind when she heard the existence of a human with demi-god potential, was something she only knew.
However, on the other hand, Austin has his other worries.
"This person...is she interested in being a hero in the future?"
If things were to change on a scale that he never had thought before, then there were various things Austin needed to prepare in order to keep his life with Luna peaceful in times of possible future events.
"I don't know her intentions as she only spoke, I guess, two or three times to me or anyone else. As I said, she is quite a stern and cold-headed beauty. But there is something which makes me believe that in the future she will shine brighter than anyone."
Luna, who had already lost interest in the topic of any random existence, just took the kettle and helped herself with another serving. Although she pretended to be uncaring, she was thoroughly studying the fluctuating emotions from Austin.
And she didn't have a good feeling about it...
"And what is it Akiko-san?"
Austin asked as his curiosity grew even more.
Akiko knew she shouldn't be telling these many secrets about what was happening behind the castle doors, but in the end, she was a woman who loved gossiping.
She conceded.
"If there is someone I have seen being the most diligent and hardworking despite being strong enough to annihilate hundreds of Terror Demon, then it would be that girl. People think she is working hard so she could counter the demon lord in the future but I believe there is something more to her interest. What my eyes tell, that girl isn't here to help humanity or something like that but to pursue something or someone by becoming strong enough, so she doesn't get restrained."
______________________
"Austin."
"Hmm..."
After having some more casual chatting, Luna and Austin left the place before the night sky greeted them both.
The atmosphere already has taken a prettier shade as the stars enveloped the sky like a beautiful blanket.
Walking hand in hand, Luna asked in a slightly anxious tone; even her face seemed to not care about the thing she was going to ask.
"When you heard about the hero summoning, you thought about your sister, right?"
Austin's mind froze for a second as he halted his feet, naturally bringing a stoppage for Luna, too, as she casually looked at him.
Since they were walking on the sidelines and the market wasn't busy as it was in the evening, they didn't bring much attention to them.
Austin was about to ask how she knew about it, but soon he realized that it was useless as if they were now; nothing was left for him to keep hidden from her.
Sighing in defeat, he continued their steps as he confessed the thought that first came to his mind when he heard about the possibility of bringing people from another world.
"Yeah, I thought about her. But soon, even before Akiko-san told us about the impossibility of re-summoning, I concluded it wouldn't be good for me to bring her here."
Luna wanted to believe him, but when it came to the person whom Austin holds dearest to his heart, she just couldn't refrain from asking.
"Even though you love her so much, you still won't look for ways to bring her here?"
Luna was sure that she would do her best to stop any possibility of summoning Austin's sister to the world where Luna had already claimed Austin all for herself. But she wanted to know his thoughts.
She knew Austin's answer would break her heart, and she was prepared for it. But little did she expected that Austin would respond to Luna's anxiety in such a manner.
"Well, even if I get the chance to summon her, I won't do that. First, I don't want to pull her into a place where these many dangers are roaming. And second..."
Saying so, he halted their steps as he turned himself toward Luna, making the latter quite flustered.
Tucking her free fallen hair strand behind her ear, Austin held her cheek as, while directing his gentle gaze onto her, he whispered his honest thoughts.
"...I don't want the love I hold for you to be divided. She indeed is a precious person to me, but you, Luna. You are and will be the only one whom I can love, and this fact won't change, whatever happens."
(A/N:- Flag?)
_______________________
A/N : Austin is aware of his good sister's feelings toward him. That's why he said what he said.
Drop a comment.
Editor : Zenon #4120

chapters.title: Chapter 50: The beginning of the End~1!
chapters.content:
"Hupp!"
On a grassy field, two men of distinctive age could be seen.
The sun had already lost its scorch as it descended on the horizon, with gentle breezes reverberating through the atmosphere.
"Haaa!"
"Yeah, just like that. Keep that form, and you will leap in your swordsmanship even without the use of mana".
The one who was currently instructing the hero was an elderly man in his late sixties, or so did he seem.
The man came here upon the request of his granddaughter, Sicily, to train the hero Kyouki for some 'certain' unexpected purposes.
Since the old man, Hachi, didn't have any objection to teaching such a fine young man who happened to be a hero too, the old man teleported here from a faraway place and initiated the training.
After sparring with Kyouki and identifying his flaws, the old man used his experience to instill some of the stances and ancient techniques in the hero so he could stay standing in the long run.
Since Hachi wasn't much proficient with mana, he doesn't train using magical enhancement to his technique, thus teaching Kyouki too, how he should handle things if somehow mana disappears from the world.
Currently, Kyouki's upper body was completely exposed, which showed a lot of cuts and bruises, which he felt like a trophy to adorn.
There were quite a number of women and some faculties who came to sneak on Kyouki and enjoy the scene, which in normal circumstances, they couldn't.
The party members of Kyouki were also training on their own weaknesses and sharpening their strengths with the help of Rachael and headmaster Merlin.
Back on the grassy field, the black eyes of the hero, despite looking determined and concentrated on his training, his mind was not focused at all.
'I can't sense either of them....'
Kyouki, after returning from the northern empire, seems to be distant from Luna, but in reality, he still cares for her.
During his stay in the foreign lands, he realized that Austin wasn't using any dirt to keep Luna by his side. Even he hates to admit; he has seen how much love Luna carries for the blond youth.
He wasn't a shameless bastard to keep meddling in their business when their love was consensual, but he just couldn't move forward from the love he had nurtured for more than half a year.
It was Kyouki's first love after all....
'Will my hard work make any difference, Luna? Will you ever look at me again?'
He was in a daze as his body moved subconsciously. It wasn't the first time, he got lost in his imaginary lane where only ruled a single woman, but he didn't let it show in front of his other party members.
Even steadily, Kyouki has started to realize what kind of emotion his party members carry for him. And he knows better than anyone what it feels like if the person you love loves someone else.
Kyouki wouldn't stop loving Luna. He can't. But he would do all to reciprocate the emotions that his party members have been nurturing for him.
'Maybe that way, you might find me worthy...'
Suddenly his train of thoughts and the movement of his blade came to a halt, which naturally attracted the old man's attention too.
"What happened, boy?"
From the look on Hero's face, it seemed something grave had just taken place as he slowly turned his body in an aimless direction.
**SWISSSH**
Like a gust of wind, Sicily arrived just beside Kyouki with a worried expression spread across her flawless face as she called out for him.
"Kyou-kun...did you feel it..?"
Her heart was racing to the point she completely ignored her grandfather. The anxiety blended with a glimpse of fear made quite an amount of ripples in her usual calm mind.
Kyouki looked at the distant sky while judging a lot of things, and from what he sensed, even he became a lot anxious.
"Yeah. The front line has been ambushed. I can feel the dense miasma and the evil intent from this far. Sicily!"
"H-Hai!"
Being called so suddenly, Sicily stood straight as she replied in a fluster.
"Gather the others and tell them about the situation. Since headmaster Merlin must have also sensed the danger, he would take care of the school fortification. So we better do what we can. "
Sicily nodded with a profound expression before she chanted a spell underneath her.
"I will meet you at the front gate, Kyou-kun. Please be safe."
"Mm. I will, Sicily."
Smiling reassuringly, Kyouki saw Sicily drifting away as he heard the hoarse voice of the man beside him.
"You better not make my granddaughter cry, or I will hunt you down by all means."
Without turning toward the voice, Kyouki kept his gaze in the direction Sicily left as he muttered under his breath.
"I promise."
____________________________
"Has everyone assembled?"
"Yes, Commander!"
Rachael nodded upon hearing the report as he focused his gaze toward the northern forest while standing on the fort wall of the Eden Academy.
"Do we have that many soldiers to cover the whole perimeter?"
Kyouki asked as he glanced around the vicinity.
"Well, we can't cover this humongous place which is slightly less inbuilt than the royal palace.  But yeah, we have eyes all around the school for any unexpected ambush."
The school was built with 25 kilometers of sq ft in dimension. The number of soldiers from the royal capital wasn't any less but providing utmost security in each corner was close to impossible until not every soldier from Gram gathered around the fort.
The northern side was under the watch of the hero's party with the amount of five hundred soldiers in hand. The Eastern side was being guarded by the explorer group along with the Headmaster, with the same number of soldiers as the Northern Vanguard.
The Northern and Eastern areas were the most critical sides of the school as the intent from the monsters was at its peak from those two cardinals.
"I just hope that the explorer group does-"
Suddenly Kyouki's words broke down abruptly as his eyes widened in utter shock.
Rachael also seemed to notice the same as Kyouki, as he also felt his heart going cold for several seconds as both men faced the front simultaneously.
"Kyouki-kun...is that what I am thinking?"
Lilia, with a deep frown adorning her slight baby-like face, asked as she tugged meekly on Kyouki's sleeve.
With a resolute face, Kyouki nodded as he announced the scariest revelation, much to everyone's fret.
"The front line has been breached. I think it's time."
_________________
Amidst the chaos that spread among the masses who were standing to protect the Academy after they heard the news of front-line failure, two figures enjoyed the scene far above anyone's perception.
These two silhouettes, just from outer appearance, seemed inhuman, and adding the leakage of slight miasma, it became certain of what origin they belonged to.
"Waah~ How amusing is it to see the human preparing to counter something inevitable~."
Shivering in delight was an inhuman woman with a petite figure as she hugged her curvy body while staring at nothing but only the group of humans standing on the fort.
Her blood-red eyes were staring intently at the human figure of a black-haired boy who was wearing golden armor all over his body and a great sword hanging on his back
"Don't take this lightly, Philia. That blond human boy and that Headmaster are dangerous beings."
The tall muscular undefined inhuman, spoke in a stern tone as he eyed the vicinity; as he failed to spot one of the humans the demon was wary of.
"Well, yeah, they are~ But without their blessings..."
As the female demon said, a skull-shaped artifact appeared right in the center of her palm as she continued.
"...They are nothing more than ants who are destined to be trampled upon~"
________________________
A/N:- Let the chaos commence
Editor : Zenon #4120

chapters.title: Chapter 51: The beginning of the End~2!
chapters.content:
"Something feels wrong."
Amidst strolling around the city with his lover's hand intimately being held by him, Austin suddenly muttered under his breath as his steps also came to a halt gradually.
Luna, upon sensing the sudden change in her beloved's temperament, frowned slightly before her eyes glimmered strangely.
The cyan shine of her eyes only covered her gaze for a couple of seconds before a profound expression spread across her face, which didn't go unnoticed by Austin.
"Luna?"
His question was unheard as Luna was already in the process of chanting a spell.
Soon her eyes returned to normal before a magic circle drew around both of them, illuminating the dark street in the process.
"Austin....be prepared."
This was the last thing Austin heard before the teleportation took place.
The atmosphere around their perception turned completely white, which made Austin close his eyes abruptly.
"Huh?"
Even before he opened his eyes, he felt the hand that was clutching Luna fall down, signifying that the person beside him had just fallen.
Opening his eyes in an instant, Austin saw something unbelievable. The person he believed to be the strongest was kneeling on the ground while panting heavily like she had lost all her vitality.
"Luna?!"
Austin, without caring about the distorted surrounding, knelt just before Luna as he supported her while trying to figure out what had just happened so suddenly.
He also did feel something was wrong, but to the extent that could throw even Luna into such a condition?
Her body was trembling, with the natural redness of her face fading away. Austin was growing nervous, passing each second as he heard Luna's weak voice all of a sudden.
"T-There is somet-*cough*thing blocking the blessing of gods. *Hah* I am okay, Austin; just the lack of mana *huff* is making me dizzy. O-once you destroy the thing which is causing this change *cough*."
"Shh, It's okay. I got it."
Austin held her body closely in his embrace as he concluded the unnatural feeling around him.
Taking out a capsule-like thing from his inventory, Austin threw it on the ground, before the capsule emerged as a giant round globe.
The outer surface of the globe seemed to be made of something hard and unbreakable, with a blue and red light shining at the central belt.
Austin got up with Luna in his arms before he tapped on the red light.
**SWIIISSH**
The upper half of the globe instantly parted up before comfortable bedding with some necessities like water and food supplies appeared inside of it.
Austin looked at the weak and trembling body of his most precious person, before he resolved himself and gently brought Luna over to the bed.
The capsule was one of the rewards he got from the system, which in general words, was a Survival Pod.
The globe has the capability to withstand any kind of atmosphere and condition and provide the resident with the best condition which they prefer. The supply of necessities was limitless inside, which ensured that the survivor could even spend their life inside of it.
Since the open air didn't feel to be working well on Luna, Austin felt the capsule would be the best solution.
"Just wait for me here, Luna. I will solve this one real quick and come back to you before you wake up from your nap."
Despite him acting hard, seeing Luna in such a miserable condition, his heart was clenching hard like never before. This wasn't the first time he was witnessing his beloved one in their worst, but this pain he was feeling currently was nothing compared to what he had experienced until now.
Gathering the last of her strength, Luna lifted her hand before Austin swiftly took it, not to let her exert any further strength.
Smiling weakly, Luna muttered under her breath.
"I-Isn't it hilarious that I never get to help you at the m-most critical times...I-Is it destiny or god just hates the idea to let our happin..ess last long..."
"Don't say something like that. You already have helped plenty enough. Now it's time for me to work and make my woman proud of my achievement. So don't think foolishly about destiny or god. Until I am here, I won't let anyone decide what we deserve."
A beautiful smile spread across her lips as she nodded feebly. Before she could have lost consciousness, Austin hurriedly pulled back the cover of the globe to not let her suffer anymore.
Austin kept his gaze on the globe for several seconds, thinking about the person who was just behind the surface before he somehow came back to himself.
Turning on his heels, he took out five wooden dolls from his inventory before throwing them on the ground.
**KRRRRR**
Suddenly five humongous figures emerged out of nowhere with the appearance of faceless wooden demons. Despite their outer surface, each one of them was a veteran fighter of high rank.
These five were also the artifact that the system rewarded Austin in the past. Since he had never felt the need for bodyguards until now, he never considered touching them.
"Protect her."
Without any expectation of a response, Austin left the five dolls around the globe before he walked some distance away from them.
Turning his front toward the five figures and one substantial black globe, Austin suddenly landed his palm on the ground before a magic circle of 200 meters was invoked around the place.
**TREMBLE**
The ground shook violently as soon a cage of more than 400 meters in height emerged all around the five wooden dolls who were surrounding the capsule globe.
The cage was built with natural material but what Austin added from his inventory, made the cell stronger than ever before.
Around ten long pieces of white paper, which had some Japanese calligraphy imprinted on it, appeared around Austin, hanging in mid-air and waiting to be planted.
Austin, using his will, directed the ten pieces on the walls of the cage.
The calligraphy pieces were, in actuality, seals of spell negation. Any mana-originated attack would be suppressed even if the attack reaches up to Legend Rank.
Next, he did was to use an invisible bubble barrier that had the capability to neutralize any kind of physical attack and also reflect them in a destructible manner.
'I guess this would do...'
Austin stared at the place cage for some minutes. Took his time to calm his raging heart, which urged him to forget all about the ongoing situation and take the capsule away from here.
Finally, after more than a minute, he came back to himself before turning toward the place he was receiving such grave sensation for.
'Wait for me, Luna.'
______________________
[5 minutes earlier]
"Commander Rachel! Help Kyouki and leave the things around here to us!!"
Shouted at the top of her lungs was the supporter warrior mage, Sicily, as she used her battle axe to slay a Unique Grade Demon in one slash.
Despite losing the blessing, the supporter warrior was able to keep up with the pace and help the front lines in holding the fort steady even though the ambush commenced more than 20 minutes ago.
After the disappearance of blessings from the warrior, what was left was only the physical might of the warriors and the old ways of dealing with things.
"I will move at once!"
Saying so, Rachael, in a far worse condition than other soldiers, slayed a demon using his sword, before he looked for the presence of the hero.
'The heck...!'
Rachael's body shivered as he finally got a glimpse of what was resisting the stampede of the monsters. The small number of demons that the lower line of defense, including Rachael, was handling were those demons who escaped from the front line.
Now, who composed the front line when the majority of the hero's party and Royal Knights were on the lower line?
Only two people.
"Y-You hanging there, boy!!"
Asked in a loud, hoarse voice was a bald old man in his late sixties, as he swung his twin sabers and annihilated a pair of reptilian Unique Ranked demons in the process.
"Yeah...somehow!"
Replied in a fluster was the raven-haired handsome youth who currently had an enhanced body armor covering his whole body with a two-meter shield in hand and a longsword moving at a furious pace and eradicating various demons along with slashes.
Kyouki was thoroughly terrified, after witnessing the change in the air, which practically sucked the greatest strength of any mage, their blessing, out of them like suddenly Gods have pulled their hands off their worshiper.
Mages like Lilia and other conjurors from the Royal Capital, became completely powerless as their blessings were the only thing they majorly relied on.
Despite having mana to evoke spells, without blessings, those spells would be like a slash of a blade but without sharpness at its edge. Blessings were the source that helps a chanter to enhance their spell and support in the redirection of its evocation.
Without such resourceful backing, the mages were only working as minor support to the front and back line by utilizing whatever they could under such unexpected circumstances.
'Shit!'
Being a little diverted from his surroundings, Kyouki felt a massive blow landing on his back, which resulted in his front fall.
"Kyouki!!"
Vanessa roared as she saw Kyouki getting overwhelmed by the number of demons, as his figure soon disappeared among the black and gray sea of anguish.
But despite wanting to rush toward his beloved, Venesssa was pushed back by a group of demons as she held her ground somehow.
Sicily and Lilia had similar intentions, but the lower line got overly crowded because of the fall of Kyouki, resulting in the failure of reinforcement to the hero.
Rachael, who saw such a scene, bit his lip in frustration for not being able to help Kyouki, but suddenly, his eyes went wide like something life-threatening had been picked up by his senses.
Taking the minuscule of time in between his battles, he looked into the air before he muttered under his breath, which only he was able to hear.
"Something terrifying is incoming."
______________________
A/N:- Heroic entry of a Villain?
This war would take time, maybe like five chapters. Let me know your thoughts on this chapter~
Editor : Zenon #4120

chapters.title: Chapter 52: The beginning of the End~3!
chapters.content:
"Something terrifying is incoming."
As the whisper left Rachael's lips, a humongous amount of mana serged around the atmosphere, before a figure covered in flames rained down from the sky, attracting almost every gaze upon it.
The demons who were crowding over the place where Kyouki was a moment ago, were suddenly lit up by the silhouette as it landed right in the middle of it.
**BOOOOOOOM**
The heavy blow that the strange flaming figure created upon landing at a furious pace shook the ground and made the air around the battlefield tremble at a violent rate.
Every eye was now focused on the place where the heavy cloud of dust emerged all of a sudden, as the demons too changed their projectile and started moving toward the explosion site, in greed of the mana which everyone felt from the burning figure.
The eyes of various people were wide open as the realization of the hero's death with that explosion, made them shocked beyond belief.
But the most shocked were the three beauties who had their eyes fixated on nothingness, as what they saw made their minds go numb.
'Ky..ou..ki...'
Sicily dropped to the ground as she stared at the scene like her life had been cut off by that explosion. Beads of tears clouded her ruby eyes, as she felt her world collapsing right in front of her, but there wasn't anything she was able to do in order to stop it.
But as soon as the cloud of dust started to fade away, her world regained its color as she saw a spectacle that she might not have believed unless she wasn't witnessing it herself.
The one who appeared from the cloud of dust was a blonde youth with a stoic expression spread on his face as he supported the ragged yet alive body of the hero.
"It can't be..."
"Is he Austin..?!"
"Did he just save hero-sama?!"
"Idiot! He saved all of us!"
The demons around the two men were about two and a half dozen, which signified that the other demons who were suppressing Kyouki earlier had been vaporized entirely from existence. These still visible demons were those who rushed at them after hearing the explosion.
Not only that, even the old man Hachi, was freed from his battle as he panted heavily while kneeling on the ground. The demons around him also disappeared like they never existed in the first place.
'Is it even possible ..?'
Rachael's mouth was agape as he was the only stable mind who was able to perceive the situation entirely, and from what he concluded, he still wasn't able to recover from it.
Austin soon disappeared from his site and appeared just beside Sicily, who was kneeling on the ground with some drop of tears still adorning her charming eyes. But these tears weren't of grief; instead, of relief.
Austin didn't wait for much longer as he dropped Kyouki beside his girl, as he also pulled out something from the inventory.
"Sicily."
"Ah."
She was about to check on Kyouki's condition when suddenly the person, whom Sicily has very seldom conversed with, called out for her.
"Take these."
Saying so, he threw five containers of potions toward Sicily, which the latter one caught somehow in her embrace before she saw something more coming out of thin air.
Something interesting.
"A-Austin, this..?"
Her eyes were continuously fixated on the mage staff, which Austin pulled out of the air. The magic wand, by outer appearance, had a brown stick with a black snake-like sculpture running around the shaft. There was a big eye that was dormant at the head of the staff with feathers connected on either side of the eye.
"This wand will help you draw your mana circles efficiently and boost your mana up to 30%. There is an additional feature that comes in handy when you run out of mana, so don't hold back and handle the front lines."
Without waiting for a response, Austin grounded the staff on the dusty surface as the staff stood straight.
Sicily, being flustered by the absurd amount of features, suddenly got called again by Austin as she stared at his back while he spoke.
"Get him up. I will need him real soon."
Without any further ado, Austin levitated slightly in the air before he launched away, leaving a speechless Sicily along with an unconscious Kyouki at their spot.
The next place Austin flew toward was a group of soldiers fighting side by side while trying to protect the small framed girl at their back. The sole female in the group was trying her best to enhance the soldiers using her mana but was failing each time awfully.
**DHAK**
**SWOOOSH**
As Austin landed on the ground, a deep amber-like flame erupted from his hand before he burnt every demon who was crowding the group of soldiers.
It only took less than half a minute for him to deal with around 30 demons with just a single attack, much to everyone's shock.
Lilia's eyes were wide open, too, not because of the attack but the person who had suddenly appeared.
"Regroup with Commander Rachael and help those who have been injured on the way. Now keep moving!"
He commanded in an authoritative tone that no one dared to deny as they instantly joined their legs and saluted simultaneously.
"Sir, Yes, Sir!"
Saying so, the group of soldiers started marching toward the center of the battlefield, where stood the main force of the rear vanguard.
Lilia was also about to move, thinking the command was for her too, but suddenly when everyone left, Austin called for her.
"Lilia. Come here."
Being called like this when no one was around, even if it was a battlefield, made Lilia quite flustered as she meekly looked at Austin's very changed temperament.
Walking slowly toward him, she saw Austin taking out something from thin air before a wooden stick appeared in his left hand.
'Wait...that...'
Her eyes glimmered strangely as she felt deep and profound energy leaking from the wand, which she felt to be inviting her as now her feet moved toward Austin, subconsciously.
"Take this and try to forget about the blessing for some time. Draw your mana as you used to draw before you were bestowed, and let this wand be the channel."
Lilia got out of her daze as she heard Austin's words, which contained a bit of their past. Before the time when Lilia and Austin weren't baptized in the church and received their blessings, Lilia often showed her proficiency with mana and enjoyed the praise which Austin showered on her.
Hearing him talk about those times, Lilia's mind drifted strangely as she stared at Austin's face for quite some moments in a stupor.
If it wasn't for Austin, she might not have gotten out anytime soon.
"Get out of your thoughts before you die."
Without waiting for her response, Austin handed the wand before he went away from the spot.
"Ah ...thank you for saving m.."
Her words slowed down, and at the end, her voice turned into a whisper as she stared toward the open air, which still gave her a sense of Austin's presence around her.
The last place where Austin landed was at the center of the rear line of the guarding units, which Venessa and Rachael had been handling until now before Austin arrived.
Just using his overwhelming mana, Austin annihilated the demons like they were nothing but ants, on which he trampled without even noticing.
"You know, after seeing you overpowering them so easily, it kinda hurts."
The one who voiced his thoughts was the current on-ground commander Rachael as he felt sighing in amusement at his own foolishness to think how confidently he invited Austin to spar without holding back.
Now he was thankful.
"Sir Rachael, how many soldiers are we left with?"
Austin asked without any intention of responding to Rachael's defeated reaction, as he saw the latter contemplating before answering.
"Around two hundred, more or less."
"Okay, then gather them at a place and protect the rear line as you were but with the help of these things ."
Saying so, Austin swung his arm before tens of potions and artifacts appeared on the ground, which made the spectator gasp in shock.
There were swords, daggers, shields, and other equipment too, which gave a strange kind of energy that no one had ever sensed before.
"Come on, grab them. We don't have all day to waste."
Austin urged in a slight irritation as he felt everyone around him falling in a daze since earlier.
"Yeah, right. Hey, come here and help the injured one with the potions and..."
As Rachael actively commanded the soldiers, Austin walked toward a specific warrior who had torn armor on her body which hid her natural charm. Her beautiful face was slightly pale from the battle she had faced in such a short amount of time.
Seeing Austin's approach, Venessa straightened her back as genuine respect for Austin emerged out of her subconscious self.
"Throw that sword ."
"Eh?"
Being asked to throw her weapon was way out of what she expected as she stared at Austin in perplexion.
Only after he followed his words did Venessa realize why he asked to discard the blade.
"Without blessing, that sword is nothing but steel crap. Rather use this...."
Saying such, Austin pulled out something from his inventory which not only Venessa but everyone around them made freeze in a dead fret.
"A-A-Au-Austin...this...?"
__________________
A/N:- Next chapter = Op moments.
Editor : Zenon #4120

chapters.title: Chapter 53: The beginning of the End~4!
chapters.content:
"A-A-Au-Austin...this...?"
Vanessa's eyes were at the point where they couldn't get stretched anymore as she saw the weapon Austin pulled out of nowhere.
It was a black metal composite sword that was lean at its base and broad as it reached its head. There were several conjunctions along the blade, showing the range it could whip.
The pommel of the hilt had a round strange runic engraving which gave the sword an ancient look. The handle of the strung connected weapon had a silvery white patterned grip which seemed comfortable to wield and easy to handle.
The reason why everyone, including Venessa, got startled upon witnessing the composite sword was the strange frightening mana it emitted and not to talk about its quirky design, which no one had seen until now.
But what followed was the terrifying thing they could have expected, witnessing from the blade.
**CRACKLE**
Austin swung the blade in a particular direction, which naturally separated each edge compartment and made the whip reach up to 30 meters from Austin. But the terrifying thing was the lightning which the sword gave out with the whip, destroyed the incoming demons in one blow.
The audience was so stunned by the overwhelming performance of the weapon that, for some moment, they forgot where they were. The smooth handling, the terrifying impact, and the beautiful lightning made everyone captivated by what they saw.
"Here, take this."
Austin, who wasn't much habituated with swords, let go of the weapon without much care, but the receiver wasn't taking things so casually.
"W-wait...why me? You can have given this to Sir Rachael too."
Vanessa asked just on reflex as she was more concerned about her being not worthy of using such a divine and nightmarish sword.
But Austin's following words gave her a reality check, which she needed at a time like these.
"Don't get strange ideas. I just gave you that sword because I think you are the most flexible in getting accustomed to something new. So try to be useful."
His words, despite being a little rude, were still comforting, as hearing flowery words wasn't something Venessa liked. She better preferred this honest side of Austin.
He was arrogant in the past, and it's still the same as now, but the current Austin had the strength backing his arrogance which Venessa felt admirable.
'Wait...what am I...'
Getting out of her stupor, Venessa inhaled deeply. Nodding with her eyes focused on the blond youth, she gripped the handle of the sword and, with a light whip, made a crackling sound as her determined words followed behind.
"I will not let your support go in vain. Leave the responsibility of the rear line to us."
Austin didn't have many doubts about Venessa's potential, so without thinking anything unnecessary, he nodded and activated Gravity Manipulation and flew away from the site.
After reaching mid-air, Austin glanced around the battlefield to have a better view of the situation.
Before arriving at this vanguard side, Austin checked the Eastern flank where Headmaster Merlin, along with the Explorer group, was holding the fort somehow without many losses.
The headmaster was a mage who had been mastering his techniques for more than 50 years now. Abruptly getting the blessings snatched away threw the line of defense in a panic, but the professors and warriors weren't there merely for show.
Since Austin felt that the ambush of the demons was far less than the forefront that Rachael led, he concluded it would be fine to leave the Eastern side on Principal and the others.
The demons from the forest started swarming again, and in some minutes, they would initiate their stampede towards the battalion.
But Austin's main focus wasn't on them. Instead, he was searching for the thing which caused the blessing to disappear so suddenly.
And also, the fact that the blessing's absence made Luna so weak when Lilia and other mages weren't in such a bad shape made Austin troubled.
'I better find the conjuror first.'
Thinking such, he glanced at the forest where a dense amount of heavy miasma suddenly approached towards the front. This curse energy Austin, as well as others sensed wasn't from the high crowd of Unique Ranked.
It was far more terrifying. Reeking with the chills of death, the miasma made everyone freeze in a fret as they stared towards the forest, completely ignoring the Unique Ranked demon who was approaching at a furious pace.
It wasn't that they were not wary of the swamp of demons; instead, the blood-draining sensation wasn't letting them feel anything else currently.
**THUD**
**THUD**
The heart of more than two hundred people sank as the figure of something ominous walked with heavy steps out of the darkness of the shadow.
Due to the low sunlight, which was practically under the horizon, various low-ranking soldiers couldn't see what was incoming, but those who did saw, felt no better than the ignorants.
**THUD**
With a final thud, the demons finally appeared in a clear vision before the miasma reached its peak point, making various soldiers drop to the ground because of dizziness and intolerance.
**GRRRRRR**
What growled with its fangs peeking out of its giant jaw was a humanoid demon with a size of more than three meters in height and a build which could even leave Charles miles behind.
Unlike the other demons and monsters, these four entities had black and purple armor and vest cladded over their gargantuan body, with the face being the only visible part from normal perception.
The demons had almost identical features, with two big teeth protruding under their lower jaw and sharp needle-point fangs peeking out their mouth. In place of hair, the demon had live flames adorning their heads.
Two ruby eyes, which contained a glint of mortal danger, stared at the surroundings as if the human in front weren't worthy of their attention.
**ROAAAAAAAARR**
One of the demons roared in frustration as it failed to find the source of mana which they felt some moments ago and was the reason why these identical demons, who were undoubtedly the strongest ones, appeared all of a sudden.
"A-are th-they Terror Ranks!?"
"T-they definitely a-are! Can't yo-you feel that absurd energy!"
"F-fuck! My legs are trembling."
There was an unhidden sign of fear among the human group as they caught a glimpse of such beings whom they could never in their wildest dreams have prepared to confront, even if they would have given a year or two.
The look on Venessa and Rachael's faces, who were the most befitting for the battlefield currently, wasn't good either, as they gulped their saliva in anxiety and evident fret.
Feet started retreating, hearts began beating rapidly, and death seemingly felt nearer to their throat as they watched the demons roaring for unknown reasons.
**Tap**
Suddenly to the utmost relief of many, a figure landed on the ground with pure elegance as he stood between the two groups.
Raising his left hand in mid-air, the ground underneath the stampede of Unique Ranked Demon started trembling.
**CREAK**
More than five hundred demons who were just some meters apart from Austin, disappeared from the site as they fell into the pit which Austin created.
With his eyes focused on the Terror Ranked Demons, Austin drew strange infernos on the tip of his index finger before throwing it in the long pit.
**SWOOOSH**
Like a living hell which had descended on the surface, flames burnt every demon with such ferocity that the heavy cries even terrified the soldiers.
Without waiting for the flames to eat away the demons, Austin again raised his hand and covered the pit with stones that he created solely with his mana.
(A/N:- Conjuror and Manipulator have a significant difference. Conjurors can create elements out of nowhere, but Manipulator can only control the existing elements. Well, Austin can do both, so yeah.)
Staring at the demons who were looking at him like they had found their prey, at last, Austin didn't give any kind of reaction.
For him, every demon in front might be the reason for Luna's miserable condition, so he wasn't going to let any single demon live on his watch.
As if now, he didn't have the system or the Villain's point in mind. The surroundings or the people watching him with varied expressions, he cared about none.
What he wanted was the remedy for Luna's discomfort, and if it could only be brought through annihilation and chaos, then he wouldn't hesitate to show this world what a true nightmare looks like.
____________________
A/N:- Well, if you think Austin wasted his artifacts on others, then you are in for a surprise since he has hundreds of those things dusting in his inventory.
Anyway, if you like chaos, then you might love the next one.
Editor : Zenon #4120

chapters.title: Chapter 54: The beginning of the End~5!
chapters.content:
The sun was already drowned beyond the horizon, but the sky was strangely not dark enough to block an ordinary perception.
Dusty wind flew furiously, blanketing the atmosphere and giving an ominous vibe just by witnessing such an unnatural sight.
On a bloody battleground which was not so far from Eden's Academy stood quite an amount of figures currently in an attentive state.
The battalion of humanity that has been given the responsibility to guard the Northern front of the School has been staring at a scene with their eyes shrank in fret and hearts trembling passing each second.
Among these crowds, there were some people too who had their resolve still strong enough that they had their weapons pointed toward the threat in case the first line of defense falls out.
The front line of defense basically consisted of a single human who had the guts to face four Terror Rank demons without showing any kind of particular reaction at all.
His eyes, devoid of any emotion, stared at the identical inhumans as he patiently waited for them to take the initiative, like he was judging their worth.
The demons, despite being creatures who only pursued chaos and massacre, still develop some kind of reasoning after reaching a certain level.
And the demons in front had been on the threshold of the third stage of Terror Rank for an unknown amount of time.
But despite having the ability to reason things and evaluate their opponent, Austin's attitude toward them, made the chaos seekers furious beyond tolerance.
They were here to hunt humans. The beings which the intelligence-carrying demon, considers nothing but a source of raw mana and object to trample upon.
And one of those humans was mocking them like they were some lowly presence?!
Unacceptable.
Communicating among themselves using telepathy, one of the demons, which was on the right most of the group, started marching forward, much to the human group's dread.
Vanessa's grip on the composite sword tightened as she resolved to jump into battle; if things go west. Not only her, but Rachael and even Lilia had a determined look that expressed their willingness to help Austin if the need arose.
However, no one expected what would happen a minute from now...
The demon, which had raven flames adorned as a crown on its head, just like his brothers, walked with hefty steps toward Austin without any care about those in the background.
(A/N:- Remember. Demon= It)
Its heavy steps made the ground tremble as it approached the blonde youth with a wide grin plastered on its horrifying face.
**THUD**THUD**
Upon reaching approximately, 5ft apart from Austin, the demon finally halted its feet.
Austin's eyes were still fixated on his front like he was seeing through the demon, or to say Austin didn't actually pay any heed to the nearby existence, since his target was someone else.
Not being able to draw any reaction from the human, even if it was bringing out its miasma to the maximum, the demon roared in agitation.
"GRRRRRRRRRROORRRR"
Along with the mighty roar, which made various people from the human side cover their ears in pain, the demon lifted its left arm higher than its height and, with lightning swiftness, pulled it down toward Austin's skull.
**DHAK**
Those who saw the hand of the demon falling over Austin, closed their eyes in fear of seeing something gory but little did they expect that Austin would counter the attack so casually.
"GRR?!"
The demon felt its arm being clutched in an unbreakable grip before it could have landed on its destination.
Perplexion spread across its face, as the demon tried to snatch its arm from the human's grip but failed to do so.
Landing its feet on the ground heavily, the demon applied all its strength on the arm to pull it away from the unnatural hold but to no avail. And more to it, from Austin's expression, it seemed he wasn't even putting his strength at all.
"ERRGGGGG!!!"
Using its other arm, the demon applied the very last ounce of his strength; as it let out a struggling voice while pulling itself from Austin like it was stuck in an ice pillar of thousand ages.
Craters started forming around its feet, with the raven flames dancing wildly on the demon's crown. The struggle made the other three demons, and the human side flabbergasted upon witnessing the overwhelming might of the frail human.
Austin wasn't able to tolerate the whining of the demon anymore, as he directed his gaze upon the demon just before he muttered under his breath.
"Annoying."
Lifting his left leg at a frightening speed, Austin kicked the abdomen of the demon without letting the other party counter the incoming blow at all!
**BOOOM**
The blow was heavy enough to throw the demon meters away, but that wasn't the focus of the audience at all.
"Th-That..."
"Buoog!!"
"He tore it...Just like that...?"
Blood spurted out of the arm of the demon,  which Austin tore away with his blow.
The demon with wide eyes felt the numbing sensation spreading from its left side as it saw the human holding the arm that some seconds ago was attached to its body.
**SWOOOSH**
Without letting the demon even growl properly, Austin burnt away the arm using the strange infernos, much to the Terror Demon's agony.
"UOOOOHHH!!"
The demon roared in pain as it felt the burning sensation from its detached arm, but unfortunately, Austin intended not to let his ears go numb again.
Using gravity manipulation, Austin launched in an arc with the fallen demon as his destination. Clenching his fist tightly, Austin pushed himself mid-air using the skill [Indefinite Leap], and darted toward the demon like a small meteor.
Just when he was about to get in contact with the gigantic body of the inhumane, Austin pulled back his punch and using half of his strength, landed his fist right at the center of the still dazed demon.
**BOOOOM**
Purple thick fluid along with flesh and brain matter of the receiver of such a deadly frightening blow, scattered around the lifeless demon as it got eradicated with the heavy impact.
Some people from the human side felt the urge to vomit right there and then as they saw the brutality of Austin, which was far worse than anything they had witnessed until now.
Even Rachael, who was the most experienced warrior on the battlefield, cringed at such a sight where a teenage human was able to punch the life away of such a terrifying demon without hesitation at all.
Austin, who was unbothered by the gore or the blood he was painted in, rose on his feet before directing his gaze toward the three remaining demons.
"Make me wait, and I will make your deaths more miserable than this one."
His voice, despite not being spoken aloud, reverberated on the battlefield clearly, which naturally landed on the demon's senses too.
Without taking the risk of assuming their enemy was weak, the three demons launched from different directions, with Austin as their target.
Surrounding him within a couple of seconds, the three demons conjured flames from their crowns before parting their mouths at the same time.
The raven flames filled their mouths wide agape before the three identical demons launched their attack simultaneously.
Austin had plenty of time to activate his spell and avoid the attack, and so he did. Naturally, he wasn't an idiot to take an attack head-on. Levitating in the air he saw the spot burning where he was standing a moment ago.
[XXXX-XXXXXXX-XXXXX]
Using his spirit tongue, Austin gathered Water spirits around him, before manipulating the elements and creating an icy hue around his levitating figure.
It only took him three seconds to build his magic formation, and before the demons could have redirected their flames on Austin, the latter mentioned rained down his spiritual spell, mercilessly.
"Avalanche."
Suddenly, an icy catastrophe descended on the surface and enveloped the part of the land where the three baffled demons were standing with their mouths agape, not because of their flames but in astonishment.
**SWOON**
With a serene sound, the heavy snow poured down like an endless stream, freezing everything around the diameter of a hundred meters.
The human faction also felt the growing chill from the attack which Austin conjured as they witnessed the sight converting into white paradise in less than twenty seconds.
Austin halted his attack not so long after since he sensed the fading curse energy from the triplets.
Turning his gaze toward the forest, Austin sensed the sign of strange miasma he was feeling some minutes ago disappearing, which brought a frown to his stained face.
But he didn't have the time to ponder since there was a massive army of demons comprising both Terror and Unique Rank approaching the battlefield.
Sighing heavily, Austin gathered mana on either hand, as he landed again in between humanity and inhumanity, as an unbreachable barrier.
________________________
At the same time, when another massive battle between a horde of demons and a single human was about to flame, two figures landed at a particular sector inside Eden's Academy.
These two were the same demons who came to scout the battlefield and caused the sudden disappearance of blessings.
"Is she inside of that?"
The female demon asked with a sneer as she stared at the large cage made of stone which had a peculiar globe inside of it.
"Yes, I am certain."
The male demon responded with utmost confidence as he also stared at the scene in front, which would change in just some moments.
Hearing her partner's remark, a wild grin spread across the female demon's face, revealing her sharp teeth as she muttered under her breath.
"Then let's get the reward we came here for~."
_____________________
A/N:- Drop a comment~
Editor : Zenon #4130

chapters.title: Chapter 55: The beginning of the End~ End!
chapters.content:
"Mm...Sicily?"
**SWINNN**
Blasting away one of the demons who trespassed the first line of defense, which consisted of only a single person, I looked at my beloved.
"You can rest some more time, Kyou-kun...I have got this."
Replying with my best smile, I again gathered mana before directing one of the most impactful offensive spells, and eradicating three demons from existence.
Seeing the astonished look on Kyou-kun's face, I thanked Austin for providing me a chance to impress my beloved.
"S-Sicily t-that...when you became this powerful?!"
His eyes were drawn to the battleground where I blasted away the monsters. The way he asked in pure confusion seemed utterly adorable~
"Well, I got some power up, I guess."
I hugged the staff to show my precious, what caused such a leap in my strength.
"What the fuck!? Is that Austin there!?"
With his fingers trembling, my restless Kyou-kun pointed toward the front where the big war was undergoing.
Well, Kyou-kun's reaction was legit since the scene in front could have made anyone shocked beyond belief. In that sense, his response felt a little underwhelming.
The spectacle, which I couldn't help but only sigh upon witnessing, was still giving me shivers even though I was pretty far from the scene.
Austin, whom I seldom conversed with, in the past, considering his disgraceful and foul temperament, was showing such might, I haven't seen from anyone until now.
Currently, even being surrounded by hundreds of Unique Rank and tens of Terror Rank demons, Austin's eyes were still devoid of any emotions.
Even though I believe my Kyou-kun is strong, I was sure that being surrounded by that many creatures, would have made him lose his will to fight at once.
But there, a person the same age as us was defeating the numbers which could have brought catastrophe not only to Eden's Academy but to the whole Gram Capital.
I wasn't sure what caused such an attack, but I was thoroughly glad Austin was on our side; otherwise...
**SLASH**
Suddenly a slashing sound, came from my right as I hurriedly moved my staff toward it, only to find Kyou-kun fighting with a reptilian demon.
I didn't help him since it might have hurt his ego. Instead, I hunted the other couple of demons who got away from Austin's line of defense.
It was me and Venessa who were working proactively in the rear section since others were either scared or had lost their strength to battle anymore.
Lilia was helping the injured with the potions, Austin had left us with. Strangely, the potion he gave us, differed from what I have seen until now.
But since there were already various mysteries about Austin piling one after another, I just treated it as a blessing of gods.
"How long was I out?"
Turning my head from the battlefield, I saw the complicated expression on Kyou-kun's face as he stared at the main battleground, which Austin was one-sidedly leading.
"Around ten minutes."
I was very well aware of what Kyou-kun was thinking at the moment, but I didn't think it would be considerate of me mentioning it.
Kyou-kun's rivalry with Austin was due to the love he still carries from Luna, and looking at his rival being so dangerously powerful and overwhelming, I can somehow understand Kyou-kun's trouble.
But this wasn't something I could console him about. Since Kyou-kun couldn't move forward, he have to break the shell by himself.
We would be here to support him, but support couldn't make a person overcome his incompetence.
"Hmm?!"
Suddenly I felt a surge of energy from inside the school, which undoubtedly wasn't mana, but instead...
"Sicily. Lilia. Conjure a barrier, now!!"
My ears received the shout of Austin, who still was around the battlefield, but unlike a moment ago, he was now levitating in mid-air.
My senses shouted to run away from that place as I sensed the terrifying accumulation of mana from Austin.
"Sicily-san, get out of your daze!!"
Surprisingly, Lilia approached my side even without me noticing as she shouted, which helped me get out of my stupor.
Extending my hand, I chanted the spell of the best barrier I have learned from my father as I felt the support from Lilia, who was enhancing and strengthening the veil at a pretty furious pace.
It seemed what I was feeling from the battlefield was judged by others, too, as there was a pin drop silence from my rear.
Even Kyou-kun had his mouth wide agape as he stared at the ascending figure of Austin.
I don't know what made Austin use such a frightening spell, but whatever it was, I had a feeling it wouldn't end rather well for the demons.
'I am pitying demons, now...?'
_____________________
Gathering the most potent elemental spell on either hand, Austin took the help of the fire spirits, too, in order to enhance his attack to another level.
While he was at it, Austin drew the power of the Infernus Lantern he had stored in his inventory and ignited the spell to brighten at a terrifying level.
His hands were covered in live and wild flames as he stared at the group of demons who had mutual feelings despite varying in class and intelligence, as they sensed the amount of mana gathering over their head.
The identical emotion which surged through all demons' consciousness was...
Fear.
But Austin didn't have the consideration, nor the time to let the creatures run for their lives.
"Sea of Flames!"
In a little hurried manner, Austin didn't wait to let the mana complete his spell, as he directed the intense and overly absurd attack on the group of more than a thousand demons.
**BOOOOOOM**
A heavy explosion erupted from the place where the attack landed as soon the battlefield, along with a vast portion of the jungle, got covered in live fire.
The audience from the back felt sweat dripping endlessly down their forehead as they felt the heat from such petrifying waves of flame, even though the human side was about five meters away from the main battlefield.
Austin's attack went on and on for more than a minute as the sea of flames enveloped the greenery and ate away whatever came along the waves.
Only after he felt that every single life signature have been erased did he halt his flames.
More than three kilometers of the northern jungle, along with the demons and low-rank monsters lurking around the forest, got annihilated, with most of them not even knowing what caused their death.
The ashy scenery in front didn't bother Austin as he was already in a rush to reach somewhere real quick.
The reason, why Austin went with the harsh way and ended the battle in such a manner,  was because he felt his barrier being breached, which had been drawn around Luna.
His heart had been in trouble since that moment, but he knew that leaving these many demons up to others would inevitably result in the worst way.
Leaping in the air, Austin darted toward the place, where he had left his most precious person.
For some reason, he didn't have a good feeling about this whole situation which had been happening for some hours.
As some knots started connecting, he finally could see where Luna was, only to get shocked in the end.
"!!!"
__________________
A/N:- Next chapter will conclude this arc. I want to ask whether these action-filled chapters are boring since I don't know what you guys feel after reading these kinds of chappy.

chapters.title: Chapter 56: Venessa for him?
chapters.content:
"Woof! This barrier was one heck of overwhelming. I wonder how humans got their hands on such ancient ruins."
Sighed exaggeratedly was the male demon who came along with his partner to capture their target.
It goes without saying that the target they were aiming from the start and the reason why they left their soldiers leaderless amidst war, was none other than the Saint of Humanity, Luna.
The whole attack plan on the Gram borders and infiltration inside the perimeter with the help of an 'insider' was centered on the abduction, which was ongoing right now.
The male demon was the one, who used his terrorizing curse spell to break the barrier Austin had built around the black orb.
It took almost 70% of his miasma and around ten minutes to finally break through the first and second layers of defense.
The female demon helped with the wooden dolls, who lunged at the creatures just after the barrier was breached, which she handled somehow.
Finally, after their prolonged hard work, which exceeded their expectation, the destination came into their view.
The strange black globe was floating in mid-air as the demon sighed simultaneously as the completion of their job seemed to not so far, however...
"You feel that?"
"Hmm. Our soldiers are getting annihilated..?!"
The female demon, who responded in a calm tone, ended with an exclamation as she sensed the absurd mana surge from the battleground along with the vanishing life signatures of her soldiers at an astonishing rate.
"T-They aren't getting annihilated...rather someone is massacring them.."
The male demon felt chills of death reaching up to his throat as the scale of mana they both received was far from what they could have expected from someone from the human side.
"W-we should hurry up!"
"But it's already too late."
The female demon, who was about to turn toward the black globe and take it away wholly with the person inside, halted her movements as she heard her partner's call.
Turning her head in the direction where the male demon was eyeing, she felt cold water running down her whole body as she saw someone approaching toward them at a furious pace.
"Philia, you stand back. This one doesn't seem to be a talkative type."
The male demon grinned slightly as he gestured for Philia to step aside since the incoming human, just from the temperament, looked too aggressive even to have a word.
And that's what the demon wanted too...
Philia, obediently nodded, and made space as a smirk also adorned her inhumane yet charming face. The reason why her demeanor was still non-wavering even though she sensed every soldier had disappeared from existence was simple ...
'Facing off strength with Velak? I pity this human already~.'
But little did she expect that the end result would be something so unbelievably unexpected ...
**BOOOOOOOOM**
At a terrifying pace, Austin shoots toward the male demon Valek before colliding his fist with the demon.
The blow was so frighteningly loud that the people on the battlefield, along with every student inside the main school building, heard its after effect.
The ground underneath the two trembled before a crater of 100 meters was formed with the colliding figures as its center.
Shock would be the emotion that mostly those who heard the reverberation of the clash, felt. But the female demon who was witnessing such sight felt herself in a greater astonishment than being merely shocked.
The partner she knew was a genuinely terrifying First Rank Terror Demon, whose physical might could even rival some of the Mythic Rank. But right now, he lost to a mere puny human boy?
"Khwakh!"
Valek knelt on the ground just in front of Austin, as he felt his whole arm going numb due to the absence of any usable bone underneath the skin.
In just a single punch, the human, who by build was half of Valek, took away his high-grade armor along with his whole arm, and looking at the human's expression, it didn't seem, he felt a single ounce of pain out of it, at all!
"W-What are you..."
Asking with his voice slightly shaky was the aforementioned confident and egoistic demon who had his previous belief shattering just like his bones.
Austin, without bothering to reply, turned himself toward the female demon who still hadn't recovered from the shock, as a bone-freezing voice reached up to her senses.
"Are you the cause of the Blessings' disappearance ?"
The female demon jerked as she looked at Austin in pure bafflement, unsure what she had just heard. But when she finally realized the cause of this unnatural human's agitation, a grin formed across her face.
"Fufu~ Yeah, it's me who-"
**SLING**
Before her words could have reached it's conclusion, a flash suddenly passed through her before she felt what she had never thought of letting happen.
The thread which connects a being from their mortality was shrewd by the human even before she could have reacted.
Her eyes went wide as she saw her vision dropping toward the ground, with the lights of the day fading at an unnatural pace.
'Huh? Am I...'
"Philia!!!!! You bastard!"
The male demon, who just sensed the life of his beloved reaching its end, enraged furiously before rising to his feet with dark miasma covering his aura.
Austin whipped his spear once to wipe the little blood stains, as he stared solemnly at the furious demon.
The demon, without hesitating even, for instance, launched his still intact hand toward Austin's face, which the latter one didn't confront this time, rather....
**SLICK**
With a smooth footing, Austin titled his body to get out of the demon's trajectory, before he slashed the blade of his spear and cut off the demon's hand in a clean cut.
**Splurt**
The demon stared at the dark purplish blood gushing out of his arm like a faucet as his attack never met its destination.
"Don't struggle."
Austin was keeping this demon alive since he needed information, or he would have sent this one to the other side as well, along with his lover.
The demon still had enough rage left that he tried using one of the spells on Austin, only to get negated even before he could have conjured it entirely.
Feeling powerless to take his vengeance, the demon contemplated deeply as he kept his gaze straight on the human.
