Valek's strength was nothing compared to what humungous might this human carries. His spell was being played like it was the easiest thing to suppress in the world.
His lover was dead. The mission was on the verge of collapsing. His life wasn't in his control anymore. All the routes seemed blocked when an unexpected path came to his rescue.
"Austin."
___________________
A/n:- Sorry for the short chappy.
Editor : Zenon #4120

chapters.title: Chapter 57: Sparing shoulder!
chapters.content:
[Venessa's POV:]
**BOOOOOOM**
As the thunderous shockwave reverberated across the battlefield, our movements halted altogether.
From what I sensed, Austin was the one who went in that direction just some moments ago, and adding the sudden explosion into account; I was sure it was Austin who was the center of it.
It was beyond believable how he annihilated that many demons single-handedly using a spell that was far from what I knew was possible to derive through mana.
I mean, I have seen a legendary mage in action, but the elemental attack Austin released in so less time made me doubt whether we were living on the same plain or not?
"Kyou-kun, wait! You haven't healed enough to use levitation."
Turning my head, I saw Sicily-san holding Kyouki-san as it seemed he was about to take off toward the place where Austin went.
Well, I could understand what he must have been thinking. Kyouki-san was a very prideful man, and I highly respect this trait of his.
Being helped by Austin in so many instances but not being able to pay back even once must have put weight on him.
But if he was a prideful man, I was a woman who would take every responsibility of his as mine. I have taken a vow to help him at every step wherever he leads.
"Kyouki-san."
Walking up to him, I supported his front as I gazed caringly at my slightly childish hero, before speaking in the gentlest tone.
"If you have trust in me, then rest well. I will help Austin in your stead."
"Vanessa..."
His eyes shone strangely with complicated thoughts spreading across his face, as he stared at me with slight reluctance.
But I wasn't ready to let him continue his persuasion, so with a slightly firm squeeze on his shoulder, I concluded my parting words.
"Don't worry, Kyouki-san. I might not be competent enough, but I still carry the unbreakable will to face anything with a confident front. So please be obedient and stay here."
_____________
Not so long after, I parted from my faction and left a still half unwilling Kyouki-san, who was reluctant to let me go alone. But since nobody else could face high-rank demons other than Sicily, who was healing Kyouki-san right now, I chose to depart solo.
To my utter amazement, the blessings which seemed to have disappeared from existence, returned to me, and I was sure it was the same for others too.
'Well, this sure helps.'
Using gravity manipulation, which I had confidence in previously until I witnessed Austin, I levitated toward the inside fort of the academy while keeping aware of my surroundings.
It's not only Levitation but also various other things I have realized, how inferior I was if compared to a monstrous entity like Austin.
But even with that, I never lost my spark to move forward. If before my target was to reach up to Kyouki-san's level, then now I had a different goal.
A goal that might make me a person whom no one would ever dare to look down upon.
If a person like Austin, who had no backing from his family, was able to pull it off, then with the help of my papa and friends, I believed it would become doable if I give it my all.
'Hmm?'
Finally, I caught a glimpse of the section of the premise from where the massive explosion erupted a minute ago.
'What the....'
Apart from rumbles and a strange humungous black orb, what astonished me was a beheaded demon lying lifelessly on the ground.
From just the looks of it, the demon seemed to be the reason for the blessing's banishment since the other was still alive, despite being in a miserable condition tho...
The demon with a considerable build was facing Austin with one arm severed and another one loosely hanging like it was broken.
In all honesty, I didn't feel any kind of threat from it, so I called for Austin so I could help him in any way possible.
"Austin!!"
But little did I expect that it would end up like the worst foolishness...
_____________________
At the very instance, Venessa called for Austin as she tried to draw her sword; the demon found the chance and used the last ounce of his strength in his still usable limbs, before darting toward the descending figure of the amber-haired warrior.
"Huh?"
Vanessa wasn't even able to exclaim properly before her vision got covered, and her body weight increased by high folds.
**DHAK**
Vanessa, along with the demon entangled with her, ultimately fell to the ground at an astonishing pace making an audible sound upon the impact
Austin turned his eyes without much of a reaction as he saw the demons on both hind limbs intervene around Venessa's torso, with his sharp teeth just above Venessa's nape.
The reaction after getting captivated arrived slightly delayed, before Venessa flailed her body to jerk away the disgusting creature.
**SPRUT**
"Don't struggle, girl. I won't hesitate to tear off your neck in one bite."
After piercing her skin slightly, the demon spoke in a hoarse tone as the maroon liquid poured down Venessa's collarbone and stained her vest.
Gulping hard, Venessa didn't try to move as due to the sudden presence wrapped around her made her terrified beyond tolerance.
Her face became entirely pale as she closed her eyes in anxiety and fear.
Austin's eyes were cold as since the time he joined the battlefield. His temperament was as natural as ever while he treated the situation like he was on a walk in the park.
The demon sneered as he felt Austin's aloof approach toward the whole scenario was fake and superficial.
"Let me go human with that globe right there, or I won't let this woman see the lights of another day."
Valek spoke his mind as he made the offer clear since he still wanted to accomplish the mission so at least he could remain alive after returning.
But little did he expect that Austin would reject the offer so outrightly!
"Kill her but forget about even touching that globe."
His voice resonated clear as day, which made Valek, as well as the previous terrified Venessa, quite wide-eyed.
The demon could discern when someone was having a hard time keeping their word, but looking at this peculiar human's expression, he might bring catastrophe if someone touched the black orb.
Valek kept his rubric gaze neutral for some moments before he finally decided to end this banter once and for all.
"Since you really don't feel anything toward this woman, then I will be taking her life as compensation."
Stabbing his sharp fangs in the soft flesh of the human, Venessa bit her lips as she felt the scorching sensation from her nape, as drops of tears dared to fall out.
The demon's eyes were focused on the blond youth as he inflicted pain on Vanessa and would have killed her in some moments now since Valek knew Austin needed him for the intel.
But suddenly a thick black fog covered the vicinity, and even before the demon could have bared his fang deeper into her skin, the body he was clinging to disappeared like it was all an illusion.
"Huh?"
The demon exclaimed as he felt the fog fading away not so long after, and not only that, his body wasn't listening to his command at all.
"Last chance. Struggle any more than this, and I will throw all my concerns about your background and end you right here and now."
The demon heard Austin's voice, but since he couldn't even move his frozen body from the ground at all, how was he supposed to struggle anymore?
Austin turned blindfold toward him before he glanced at the weeping figure of Venessa, who still was clinging to him since the time Austin saved her using his skill.
The way Venessa's arms were wrapped around Austin's torso while she grieved in silence due to the death she felt some moments ago, made it challenging for Austin to separate himself abruptly.
**Sniff*Sniff**
Folding his hand on his back Austin sighed as he let Venessa calm down first, but little did he remember that someone else was also present beside them.
"Austin~ Care to explain~."
_________________
A/N:- Drop a comment~
Editor : Zenon #4130

chapters.title: Chapter 58: Does my body excites you?
chapters.content:
Currently, in a thinly lighted room could be seen two people sharing a very intimate space.
The sun had long vanished from the sky with a serene white lonely moon hanging with pitch darkness spread like a heavy blanket making the night grimmer than usual.
But the outside world or the current situation around the Eden Academy couldn't justify the pink atmosphere surrounding these two love birds.
"What are you doing, Luna?"
The person who, throughout the massive war, remained poker-faced and did everything calculatingly was now smiling like a fool as he allowed his lover to do as she pleased.
Austin's room was currently filled with a peculiar floral fragrance because of the company of the person whose odor Austin loves the most.
"Erasing that thot's smell from you."
The one who was clinging to Austin with her front pressed on him and legs intervened around his torso was none other than the beautiful maiden popularly known as the Saint.
Austin sighed before he made his grip on Luna's back more firm as they sat at the edge of the bed while hugging in a way that didn't even let a single gust pass through them.
Luna was currently rubbing her cheeks on Austin's chest and kissing him time after time to make it clear who this man belonged to.
Even though she kissed him while they were still on the battleground in front of Venessa, Luna couldn't just rest well when there were so many man-hunting bitches roaming out there.
Austin was utterly delighted to see Luna fawning over him, but he was more concerned about her health first. But looking at her reluctance to let go, he could just accept his defeat and let himself get pampered by this adorably jealous Luna
"Ah..."
Austin felt Luna's sucking extremely hard near his collar bone which made him let out a slight sound on reflex.
"Hah...now this looks perfect."
As Luna grinned, Austin sensed he had been marked with his fourth hickey, but since he wasn't afraid of anyone seeing it, he didn't complain and just patted her back before asking.
"Satisfied?"
"Not completely, but this will do for now."
Saying so, Luna redirected her gaze on her man, only to find him gazing at her lovingly without an ounce of annoyance even though she had been behaving like a whining child since they had returned.
Crossing her arms across Austin's neck, Luna tilted her head playfully as she asked.
"You don't complain even if I behave so spoiled. Is it that master Austin has fallen sooooooo deep in my love, that this side of mine doesn't bother him~."
She asked what she knew the answer to already, but as she said, she wanted to be spoiled. And hearing her beloved expressing his love never feels short of enthralling.
Austin was also aware of her thoughts, so, with a serene smile, he obliged with his lady's unspoken request.
"It's not only you with whom I fell in love with. Your temper, your mood swings, your spoiled behavior, your jealousy. I love all of them. So you can say I am foolishly drowned in your love to the point of no return."
Luna giggled playfully as she enjoyed the affection her beloved showered her with.
Tilting her head to the other side, she felt Austin leaning back on his arms as he kept his gaze unwavering from her.
"Then what about my foul mouth? You love it too?"
Austin smiled and, without any hesitation, replied as he collected Luna's precious hair and tucked it behind her small ear.
"Yes, I do."
"Then what about my hair? I remember when you acted like an arrogant noble, my hair was your primary source of target."
Austin felt a sigh leaking from his lips as he remembered a not-so-distant past before he cupped Luna's left cheek.
"I love them the most, that's why I couldn't help but talk about them in the past, although in a harsh manner."
Enjoying his warmth, Luna leaned her face as her next question seeped out reflexively.
"Then what about my face? Do you like it?"
Austin shook his head as he heard the adorable query of Luna, which seemed to be unworthy of being answered, given how popular she was among the nations for her looks.
But then again, she doesn't care about the world; instead, she wants to hear what Austin feels. And since he has started to realize her thought process, it didn't take him time to respond, in all honesty.
"It's the most beautiful and charming face I have ever seen. How could I not fall in love with it?"
With her eyes slightly narrowed, Luna smiled with her lips at their greatest peak, before something popped into her mind as she took Austin's hand, which was on her face, before gliding it slowly down her neck sliding inside her cleavage.
"And...what about my body? Does it excite Master Austin?"
There was a glint in her oceanic eyes, which Austin had become familiar with as he gazed at her before his brows raised subjectively.
"Should I answer it verbally...or..."
Without even being guided by Luna, Austin's hand already started roaming immodestly as he began to target some of the sensitive areas on her bosom.
"Mm~ Well, I ah~ would have liked that b-mm~ but it's okay for you to be rough~."
_____________________
At the same time, when the love birds, consisting of two young youths, were drowning in a night filled with love and lust, an entity sat on a chair with a grim expression on his face.
This inhumane presence was none other than Valek, who, after losing his lover and failing miserably on the battlefield against Austin, got captivated by the Professors under the guidance of Headmaster.
The supreme pope of the church chanted the barrier inside which Valek was captivated.
But looking at Valek's miserable condition and shaken state of mind, it seemed highly unlikely that he would have run away. And taking the failure of the mission into account, Valek's chances to return to 'that' place fell down to zero.
He could now just wait for someone to end his suffering and send him to the other side where might await his beloved.
**CREAK**
The wooden door of the small room parted before the figure of a middle-aged human appeared from the other side.
Apart from his purple and golden robe covering his one-and-a-half meter body, the golden single-framed round monocle seemed to be his striking feature.
Entering inside without minding Valek's presence at all, Alex arranged his things on the small table just beside the barrier-covered wooden chair, on which Valek was tied.
"You thought you avoided Sir Charles, then you might achieve your mission flawlessly, yet you failed in front of a seemingly more brutal monster. How unfortunate~."
Valek didn't react, but deep inside, he indeed felt the most miserable to think that after dodging that battle bull on the border, they would face such a terrifying being in the face of a frail human.
"But why do you even try to sidestep Sir Charles when you could have killed him with that many demons?"
Alex tilted his head in astonishment as he asked himself. The reason he didn't direct the query to the one who could answer it was simple.
Alex knew that it wasn't easy to drill information out of someone until he doesn't dirty his hands.
Turning toward the demon with a chilly smiling face Alex muttered in a flowery tone, much to Valek's fret.
"Well, we have a long night ahead, so I hope we can enjoy each other's company, Mr. Demon~."
______________________
A/N:- Will upload R-18 on Patreon real soon. Be sure to check it:-
/Svneighter
Editor : Zenon #4120

chapters.title: Chapter 59: Interrogation reports!
chapters.content:
Lying on a cozy bed with a warm blanket draped over their naked body was the loving couple who, just by looks, seemed to have a very intimate last night.
Austin's eyes were still closed as he enjoyed the warmth his love was providing. Embracing her small yet huggable body, Austin felt fulfilled as he stayed half-asleep.
Luna, on the other hand, had her eyes clearly open but lazily, as she gazed upon the man who had kept her awake till daybreak.
Just like she planted her marks on him last night, now her body was labeled with his rough yet sweet love.
Her heart was now at peace when she gawked at the relaxed face of her man. The slight eerie feeling ignited inside of her yesterday, was now fading away since she trusts Austin more than she does herself.
Taking out her hand from the blanket, she felt Austin's hold on her belly tightening since he might have thought of her leaving his side.
Luna almost giggled upon sensing his childish yet adorable gesture, as she brought her hand on his cheek.
Her delicate finger traced Austin's features as she gently ran them along his tender cheek down to his sharp jawline as she enjoyed the sensation wholeheartedly.
"Mm m. Aren't you taking advantage of me?"
His voice was hoarse, displaying how sleepish he was as he lazily parted his lids to gaze upon the mischievous saint.
"You touched me shamelessly at every corner last night. It's just a minimal compensation."
A smile made its way on Austin's thin lips as, with a strong inhale, he brought Luna closer to him, practically enveloping her in the process.
Getting a full whiff of her natural body fragrance and enjoying the suppleness of his beloved wrapped in his unrestrained embrace, Austin responded with a grin.
"Well, didn't you enjoy it as well?"
A slight blush rose in an instant as Luna remembered the scene which she might not be able to forget even in her death, that level of embarrassing it was.
Austin enjoyed her reaction as he let Luna hide in his embrace as deep as she desired.
Silence befell in the still thinly lighted room as the two drowned in the world that they share with each other only. Feeling each other's warmth, they transferred emotions that didn't require the support of words.
Amidst the loving silence, Luna seemed to remember something as she lifted her face from Austin's chest before asking in a slightly expectant tone.
"Is your Villain's requirement fulfilled?"
Since the war was a massive turn of events and adding Austin's impactful participation, Luna hoped that the days of being a pretend villain would end and she could live freely with Austin from today onwards.
But looking at Austin's troubled expression, her hopes crumbled, and his following words made her worried too.
"Well, I didn't receive the completion notification, and looking at the system screen..."
Turning his gaze toward his front, Austin checked the necessity of Villain point, which brought a frown on his face.
[Villain's Point]
[Weekly Requirement :- 1570/2800]
[Time before reset :- 3 days 16 hours 8 min]
"....I got only three days to fill almost half of the requirement."
Despite saying it with such a casual tone, Luna was well aware of what was in actuality, going through his mind.
This was the last week; Austin needed to care about Villain's System since, after this, his sister wouldn't need any kind of supernatural support to return to her healthy self.
But the most crucial factor on which Austin relied, the war with demons, only provided him with half of the points. And adding the previous points he had before the war, he didn't even gain a thousand points from this battle.
"Austin...I think the theory we had about this system is slightly misleading. It's not only about your participation but the impact it has on the world."
Austin raised his brows as he failed to discern what Luna had just said, but thankfully her following words made her point clear.
"Like this sudden war wasn't brought by you, but you were just part of it. Umm...like the source of this whole event wasn't even related to you; that's why the system just threw some small points. However, the event with the Terror Demon in the expedition. That bastard launched his attack on you, which worked as a catalyst, and the system evaluated that the whole scenario occurred because of your presence."
Austin's eyes went slightly wide as he somehow understood the essence of the theory Luna brought up.
It's as she said. The baptism and the way he insulted Venessa were all of his own accords. He wasn't part of it. Instead, he was the centerpiece.
Various knots unraveled with just a single explanation of her which made Austin realize something.
"So I have to do something on my own initiative to gain the last remaining points…huh."
Luna didn't say anything since even though she was the one who eventually brought Austin to such a conclusion, she didn't want him to take any unnecessary risk.
Austin kept on contemplating the matter for more than ten minutes with his eyes fixed on the ceiling as he thought about the possible route he could pursue to end this struggle once and for all.
But whatever he thought, he couldn't strike a war when the Gram nation was already in turmoil and the hero was on the verge of being half dead.
All left was only a single path that could fulfill the requirements and also help him pay back the possible loss he could have suffered.
"Let's see what that demon has to say. My next move will be on his testimony."
_____________________
Around ten in the morning, the couple left the bed as they had a peaceful bathing session which eventually led to another hour of love-making before they left Austin's room.
Since various professors were injured and the inside fort was also damaged, the classes were suspended for the next three days.
Strolling lazily under the sun, which was covered with heavy clouds, Luna and Austin made their way towards the Cathedral where the captive demon was stored.
The school was near to empty as most of the students returned to their homeland for this short vacation. Most of them had a sense of fear which made them not stay in the academy for the time being. But little did they know that until this couple was in the Eden Academy, there wouldn't be any safer place elsewhere.
The church was also non-populate as some of the priests roamed in and out to help the survivors and help with the funeral ceremony too.
The place where Valek was restrained lay under the surface, in the basement.
Austin and Luna descended the stairs without permission before a single wooden door greeted them at the end of the steps.
**Knock**
Austin knocked softly on the door before the doorknob was twisted not so long after.
The one who emerged from the other side was none other than the bespectacled court magician, Alex Nuèye.
His eyes had heavy bags underneath, signifying how long it's been since he had a good night's sleep. But it wasn't the eyes on which the duo's attention fell onto.
"You killed him?"
The reason why Austin asked in a casual tone about the demon, was because Alex currently has his face covered in purple liquid, which undoubtedly belonged to Valek.
And not only that, Alex's left hand was holding a long skewer too, which made it look like he had a lively interrogation session with the pitiful demon.
"No, but it will probably die, if a high-profile healer doesn't bestow their blessing on that creature."
Luna sneered visibly before extending her hand as a cyan glow covered her palm. The process took only three seconds before Luna retracted her hand, signifying how brilliantly she healed without even looking at her patient.
"Subarashi~ I can't get enough of such young talent~."
Alex shivered in delight and wholly ignored the death glares he was receiving from Luna.
"Well, I got to know various things from that creature, but there is one piece of information that intrigued me."
Luna and Austin glanced at each other for a second before Austin looked back at his front and asked in a slightly heavy tone.
"And what's that?"
Sighing, Alex leaned on the stone wall before taking out his monocle as he answered Austin curiously.
"Unlike the demons, we have heard and seen until now, this war and the abduction of Saint-sama were all planned by a human. Strange as it may sound, but demons were actually working for humans like us."
The listeners' eyes went slightly wide as they heard the shocking revelation, which they could never have guessed to be the case.
Demons are born to bring chaos to the world, and apart from the Monarch of Darkness, they obey no one.
And suddenly being told that those half-minded beasts were following someone's command who belonged to the race which demons consider nothing more than their source of mana?
"Alex...who was it who sent this army and ordered to abduct Luna?"
Austin's voice became a little fiercer as he realized that it wasn't demons who were pursuing the endless mana pool of Luna but rather some sly human who had their distinguished goal fixated on her.
"Ah...the Xylex Nation in the South. The place which has been nurturing their own summoned hero in secrecy. I bet you have heard about it, right?"
______________________
A/N:- A new arc, a new character. Let's goo…
Editor : Zenon

chapters.title: Chapter 60: Real hero!
chapters.content:
From what Austin and Luna heard, there were various things that became clearer than before.
The demon who was on the verge of dying had already spilled every bean he could have, so what would be happening to him after this, solely would rely on Alex.
The major points which were revealed from the demon's testimony had two notable facts.
First, the person who helped the demons with the information related to Charles's whereabouts and the private Intel of the territory, was none other than Riley: Leader of the Explorer faction who was guarding the Eastern Side of the fort along with the Headmaster.
The Sakura-haired mage warrior had a tremendous potential to become a knight of the Royal order in the future. But the teenage fool in love made a grave mistake and sold his own nation's security.
His blind love for Sicily made him bring this catastrophe since the enemy nation promised him to reward Sicily if the plans went well and the demons achieves their goal.
But in the end, what Riley got was imprisonment in the underground jail of Eden Academy.
No one other than Alex, Headmaster Merlin, Luna, and Austin was aware of Riley's betrayal since it would eventually make the Emperor know that the demons were working under Southern Nation's order.
The reason why Alex chose to hide the aforementioned information, for the time being, was only he knew. Still, Headmaster Merlin only agreed to keep his mouth shut until the problem on the borders doesn't get resolved.
Luna and Austin didn't have a problem either, as the prior one couldn't care less what her schoolmates conspires. And as for Austin, then he wanted to achieve his system points, so this silence of the nations was perfect for him to do everything in secrecy.
The second interesting thing they found from the demon's memories was that this whole war and the demons involved in this were sent by the same nation where Austin and Luna went for their date.
The same place where Austin met the ramen shop woman belonging to the plain where Austin belonged in his previous life.
It seems the King of Southern Kingdom, Xylex, was preparing for something massive as even having a true powerhouse in the name of Summoned Heroes; the Emperor was planning to take Luna's strength for himself too.
Austin's temperament wasn't much good when he heard about it. On the other side, Luna was merrily smiling upon seeing how her man was getting worked up for her sake.
"The weird part is, why they didn't end the war on the border and infilterated forcibly. If the first line of defense, Sir Charles, would have fallen, then the front-on war would have been more advantageous for the demons."
Alex's slightly grumbling tone echoed clearly in the spare room in the cathedral, as he served tea for the duo.
Luna became perplexed upon hearing Alex's unsolved query which by looks seemed genuine. Turning her head, she saw Austin with a similar expression as her, signifying he also seemed to find Alex's trouble, strange.
"You don't know about it?"
It was Austin who asked, much to Alex's perplexion as the bespectacled mage blinked his eyes before asking.
"I don't know what exactly?"
Looking at his reaction Austin and Luna concluded that Alex indeed was oblivion about Charles' secret. From Austin's memory, Luna came to know Charles' true might. That's why she was worried about the arena battle between the two.
'It seems I over-evaluated you.'
Without any intention to talk further, Austin left Alex hanging in the middle of the chat, much to the latter's frustration.
_________________
After some more chattering, the duo left the church hand in hand as they strolled their way to the cafè to have their breakfast.
While walking with her hand intervened with Austin's arm, Luna seemed to feel worried about something. She tried to hold this conversation for after they ate, so the date doesn't get ruined, but her worries got better of her.
"Austin...you are planning to go there today?"
It goes without saying that Austin needed to fulfill the Villain's point anyhow since he wasn't sure what consequence would occur if the requirement fails, which he hasn't let happen in the past.
And for that, Austin leaving for Xylex was the best route to pursue as there would be many instances for him to change the world occurrence and future prospectus.
But what worried the silver-haired Saintess was the summoned hero whom the Ramen Shop owner mentioned to be in Demi-god class.
Despite not fearing even a person was demi-god or not, Luna strangely had a horrible suspicion about this whole situation altogether.
Hearing Luna's question, Austin felt wavering for a slight moment, but the resolve he had made was far more substantial than Luna's unspoken persuasion.
"Yes, I have to, Luna. I know what you are feeling, but I can't stop. More than my Villain's point or anything else, I want to get back on that Emperor for what he tried to do to you. So stop worrying needlessly and put on a face which suits more in this situation."
Austin squeezed Luna's hand as he spoke in a rich tone, making her startled all of a sudden.
Looking at his smiling face, which shrouded the determination he had resolved upon, Luna's mind became muddled, but in the end, she suppressed all her concerns, and with a beautiful smile, she replied.
"Let's do our best together."
_______________________
At the same time, when the duo was heading for a lovely date time, in a courtroom of the palace, which was miles away from Gram, sat a group of people who, by appearance, looked like high-class nobles.
The room was thinly lighted with a centric round table placed in the middle of the room with twelve preoccupied chairs arranged neatly.
"I hope you all have heard about the demons' failure in Gram."
The person sitting at the forefront of the table spoke in a casual tone even though he was talking about the failure of war, no less.
The people he addressed, nodded without much contemplation since the news had already arrived hours ago, which led to the occurrence of this emergency meeting.
"My lord, but we haven't received any official alert from Gram nor any mana mail from our spies."
A man wearing a brilliant golden robe asked in a slightly confused tone as even after the demons failed miserably for unknown reasons, it was still unclear why Gram was so silent.
"Well, that vile ass Valek has been captured, so he must have spilled beans, but the person who interrogated him was none other than that bespectacled bitch, Alex. What can you expect from a sly fox? He must have been planning something behind the scenes."
The look on everyone's face, other than the speaker, became slightly ugly as they heard their lord mentioning the talented Magician of Gram's Court who was infamous for his dark deeds.
"What would be our next move, Sire?"
Another man asked in a slow voice as the matter seemed to be more complicated than it first sounded when they heard the news of the demons' loss.
"Now what? Summon the hero; we will send her to get the Saintess anyhow. Whatever happens, I can't let this upcoming offering ceremony be stalled just by some measly creature incompetence."
A gasp resonated in the room upon hearing the mention of the hero. Ignoring everyone's reaction, the Emperor of Xylex leaned his chin on his intervened finger as, with a cunning smile, he muttered under his breath.
"It's time for the world to know what is the true might of a real hero. "
_______________
A/N:- A massive event is going to occur with some world-shattering revelation. Stay tuned~

chapters.title: Chapter 61: Vanessa’s wavering thoughts!
chapters.content:
"Are you really okay, Venessa?"
"Yup, I am fine. Thanks for worrying about me, Kyouki-san. Please go and see Sicily."
I lied.
The person to whom I vowed never to lie and be honest under any circumstances, I lied to that person.
And the reason was so measly that I am feeling like an idiot right now.
**SLIDE**
As Kyouki-san left the infirmary room, I laid back on the bed. Staring at the white ceiling, I thought about the events that had happened some hours ago.
The whole war, the frightening battles, and the overwhelming fear didn't leave such a significant impact, which I felt from that particular incident.
My biggest foolishness made me captive of that red-eyed demon who could have been handled by Austin even if I hadn't intervened.
But me and my big mouth led to such a turn of events, and I was taken as a hostage by that creature.
I still feel chills running down my spine as the memory of my body being entrapped by that vile creature flashes down the lane.
That foul smell, that creepy sensation, and the ominous sense of danger still lingered like an inseparable leech to every inch of my skin.
I had never felt something like that before, even though I have gone through life-threatening battles and have seen the way papa fights.
I know it was disgraceful for a warrior like me to say it, but at that moment, I wanted nothing more than just to run away and hide to save my life.
At that moment, the chivalry I had been taught, the principle I had instilled, the vows I had taken, nothing remained in my consciousness. I just wanted to get away from that demon anyhow.
When the demon pierced his teeth in my skin, I felt death ringing heavily and binding my senses at an alarming pace.
The chance of my survival started to seem equivalent to negligible.
But suddenly that happened...
I don't know what conversation happened between the other two beside me on the battlefield, but after just ten seconds since I had lost my hopes, someone came to rescue me.
And that person was none other than the same boy whom I loathed the most in the past.
The boy whom I constantly taunted for being a sissy and a shame on mankind, pulled me back from the death door.
I didn't know when he became so strong, but he was able to overwhelm the battlefield one-sidedly, and here, he even saved me without even breaking a sweat.
At that instance, I didn't know what came over me, but before I could have thought anything else, I was already hugging Austin as a baby clinging to their parents when bullied.
The tears I shed and the fear I felt slowly started fading in the warmth I found from a man whom I never even imagined talking to with a straight face.
If it had been my past self, then I might have felt disgusted with myself, but now strangely, I wasn't feeling anything out of place.
Even though my mind was a lot calmer now, if compared to that time, I still wasn't having any discomfort thinking about my actions at all.
I know it would be shameless of me to even think about it when I already have surrendered my love for Kyouki-san, but I somehow liked how I felt when I was embracing Austin.
It indeed was an eventful day when I gained so many sensations and memories that I wasn't aware of in the past.
Some were horrible, some were confusing, and some of them just soothe my heart whenever I think about it.
Whatever they were, I was sure I wouldn't be able to forget a single thing that had made my mind mess and forced me to lie so I could just sort out what was wrong with me.
'Seriously...it's all because of you. Who said to change so drastically and make a mess of my emotions? I will blame it on you. Hmph!'
_______________________
At the same time, when Venessa was fighting with her own emotions and figuring out what had gone wrong with her, a duo stood outside a metallic door as they whispered something silently.
These two women, by appearance, looked like typical maids with black and white maid uniforms covering their bodies and raven hairs braided elegantly in the same design.
The door before which they were standing by the outer surface looked like a heavy vault-type room that could store some catastrophic-level monsters.
The sound of heavy winds and occasional blows reverberated even though the metal door was far away from the source of such noises.
"How long has she been doing that?"
One of the maids with slit eyes and comparatively taller than the other one spoke in a meek tone like she was hiding her voice; even the sounds of blows from the inside were heavy enough to suppress even a shout.
Tiptoeing, the other one peeked through the small window built at the head of the door.
The shorter maid, with a round face, sighed upon seeing the scene inside still the same as she had seen a day ago.
"More than 27 hours already. Three hours more, and she will break her own record of doing nothing but to swing a blade continuously at the same spot."
The taller maid also sighed as she heard the beyond believable fact about the person who was training inside the room.
Before the two could have chatted any further, someone approached them or, to be precise, went toward the metallic door.
"Is she inside?"
A heavy tone fell inside the waiting space as the two maids looked at the tall man who appeared to be in his early twenties, arising out of nowhere.
"Yu-Yuuske-sama!? Y-yes..hero-sama is inside."
The maid, who, after witnessing the man's grave expression, became flustered beyond belief as she somehow managed to utter the response the man needed.
With a nod, the lean young man clicked the door open before a heavy gust threw the two maids away like a broken kite.
""AHHHHHH!!"
The man didn't bat an eye on the plea for help before he walked inside without feeling any difficulty at all.
Closing the door on his back, the expression of the man whom the maid regarded as Yuuske shifted to a brighter end.
The frown on his charming face immediately switched places with a smile that could make women fawn over it with just a glance.
With his eyes focused on the single person inside the colossal hall, which was devoid of any particular color or any furniture, Yuuske advanced without minding the shockwaves in the slightest.
His rubric eyes shined as he saw the woman's sinful figure, which looked highly enticing with the sweat she was covered in.
Without letting the woman notice his gaze, he withdrew his eyes and walked elegantly toward her.
"It's been long, Mina."
Suddenly the black katana, which the woman was swinging in a different direction, changed its trajectory before its tip landed just in between the two eyes of Yuuske.
"It's not my name."
A bone-freezing voice that contained no definite emotion left the woman's pale yet attractive lips as she stared at the man with the explicit intention of disapproving of his whole existence.
Without minding the blade, Yuuske tilted his head before he spoke in a merrier tone.
"But you never told me or anyone your name."
The raven-haired woman didn't reply; she just pulled her sword and was about to continue swinging when Yuuske hurriedly interjected.
"Umm...the Emperor has summoned you. It seems he finally wants everyone to know about your presence. "
The woman kept her head turned slightly toward the man until he finished before she went back to face an indefinite space as she brought her katana to swing aimlessly and continue her training.
But Yuuske seemed to have a rare mood swing, as he didn't intend to let go of the conversation so shortly.
"Why are you persistent, Mina? Why are you not accepting me and dreaming about someone else who might have been dead-"
**CRACK**
Suddenly Yuuske's voice choked in his throat as he felt the terrifying killing intent from meters apart from him. The room, which seemed colossal some moments ago, felt extremely small under the overwhelming pressure the woman was releasing.
The ground underneath her feet cracked before a crater of 200 meters formed because of the single step woman took to warn Yuuske.
Her eyes which generally seemed devoid of emotion, were now overwhelmed with rage as she stared at the man as if he had just taken away her most precious thing.
"Do not ever think of associating that word with my Nii-sama! I will slice your tongue along with every fiber from your body while keeping your consciousness awake. So keep your business away from me before I lose my restraints and do something which you might not be able to reverse!"
_____________________
A/N:- ?

chapters.title: Chapter 62: Arrival and Departure!
chapters.content:
Xylex.
The continent, situated in the South and is mainly known for its trade and agriculture.
Despite being the densest continent and, from land mass perspective, the biggest one, Xylex wasn't much resourceful at any time, world crisis erupted.
In the past, the continent, which had the divine protection of the heavenly beast Scylun, seldom actively participated in any conflict.
Like the ancestors, the current emperor of Xylex, Thannath Seiya Exylam, doesn't interact much with worldly affairs, although they have a friendly relationship with the other six continents.
Given the rate of superhumans and magicians, Xylex brings up every year; the rest of the world has considered this land of granary as the weakest continent of them all.
But very few people know that the continent, which adores the tag of being weakest, has taken a step that would result in a leap in its power equilibrium. A single lead would shake the world hierarchy and unsettle the world balance.
Hero Summoning.
The ancient myth, which now has become a part of children's tales and storybooks, has been reanimated.
The folklore verifies that in the distant past, there came a time when the darkness over the world spread beyond the capability of any human, then came the idea of Hero Summoning.
The ancient Runic technique, which requires a sacrifice of hundreds of offerings and a colossal amount of mana, ignites the spell and calls the hero from an indefinite space.
Since the techniques required sacrifices and runes, which weren't found in ages, no kingdom took an interest in it. And the Morach of Darkness being dormant past these many years also negated the need to summon a hero.
How Xylex was able to recreate the Mythic Grade spell and summoned not one but five heroes at the same time was something only the kingdom's top council was aware of.
Now why the summoning hero was so overly evaluated and required such a high grade of investment?
Simple. It's the power boost the summoned heroes are bestowed along with the transfer of worlds.
The monstrous strength and unparalleled skills they get with the summoning ritual, makes them unique commodity who can easily overwhelm every battlefield they step upon.
Now the question arises, at what price did Emperor Thannath bring so many catastrophic entities into this world?
_______________________
"Please remind me, why these two are here?"
With annoyance clearly blended in her voice, the platinum-haired saint asked the person beside her as she looked at a duo in front.
"Because I need the hero's face so all the blame can be drawn upon him while I do the work from the background."
Austin, with a wry smile, explained to his not-so-happy lover, as the trip to Xylex was primarily planned for only Luna and Austin.
"It's rude to use my Kyou-kun as a puppet, Austin."
The one who pouted was the olive-haired girl Sicily as she countered Austin's non-fabricated words while clinging to the man beside her.
"It's okay, Sicily. We both know what he meant."
Kyouki tried to calm Sicily down as he also understood why in the first place, Austin told him about this plan and asked them to come along, unlike the last time when Austin deliberately manipulated him into going to the Northern Empire.
Luna was also aware of Austin's plan and how he wanted to work, but being unable to enjoy their honeymoon made her mood extremely sour.
But then again, she had an eternity to spend with Austin, so these kinds of chances would come again.
'But still, I wanted to be alone with you...'
Wiping her non-existent tears, Luna asked Austin which was most concerning in hand.
"What's our next move, Austin?"
The room, which was lively for some seconds, turned heavier with Luna's query as it indeed wasn't a causal trip of these four in this foreign land.
They were here to initiate a war. To take vengeance and to accomplish something. It might sound childish to think that a group of mere teenagers was trying to rival a whole nation, but neither of these four was going to back down; when they reached this point.
"Hmm...plan, huh."
Austin got up before he lifted a round table from the corner of the room and placed it in the center for everyone's convenience.
Gliding his hand over the round table, a brownish sheet of paper which by texture and designs carved on it, looked like a map, appeared out of nowhere.
Sicily's eyes sparkled at such fluency and peculiar affinity with magic, before she asked subconsciously.
"Austin.I never got the chance to ask...but are you proficient with Space Magic too?"
Kyouki had the same question, but sensing the ominous stare from the left of Austin, he held back his urge to ask.
"Aren't you getting too interested in someone else's man?"
Kyouki felt daggers piercing his heart as he heard Luna committing herself for Austin but naturally, he didn't let it become evident from his expression.
"Wha-me? Of course not! I don't look anyone other than my Kyou-kun!"
Kyouki felt some of the holes in his heart getting healed from Sicily's gentle words as he smiled thinly.
Austin, on the other side, was silently watching the banter as he thought whether it was really okay for him to bring the duo along.
But as he said, he needed an identifiable face who would take the final blow on Xylex and can get the fame all for himself.
Austin wanted vengeance but being in the spotlight wasn't his thing.
Well, what happened back in Eden Academy was the result of his clouded mind which became like that after he saw Luna in such a state.
But now, things were different, and so would Austin's approach.
"Listen carefully...."
______________________
"Has the hero left the territory already?"
"Yes, sir. She didn't use the portal; instead chose to run all the way to Gram."
Two men adorning extravagant attire walked into a massive hall as the man walking at the back answered the high and majestic, Emperor of Xylex.
The heated topic around the palace and in the upper echelon of the kingdom was their Summoned Hero's departure for Gram.
It was the first time when the Hero, whose name no one had heard until now, went outside the territory since her summoning.
It wasn't that she didn't want to go out; instead, she was shackled with the kingdom and only can move out on command.
"Hmm...well, she is a freak then she-ah!!"
Suddenly Thannath's steps came to an abrupt halt as his eyes started illuminating with a greenish glow, and his mouth parted like something was about to be released.
The man beside Thannath looked at his majesty's sudden change before he chanted a spell and erected a barrier around the Blond-Haired Emperor.
"Guards!!! Protect the king!"
The man shouted in a heavy pitch before from the shadows emerged a group of more than a dozen black metal cladding warriors as they stood with their back facing the barrier and front focused on their surroundings
The way the Nobel commanded the guards and invoked the spell, signified that it wasn't the first time for Thannath to fall into such a state.
But it doesn't mean that these occurrences rang any fortune bells.
'I hope my lord returns safely...'
____________________
Infinite space.
That was the only thing Thannath could see in the space he gets forcibly pulled toward often these days.
His eyes were normal here, unlike his original body, which still was in the main hall of his palace. With his breathing slightly unsteady, signifying the anxious state of mind, Thannath heard the voice he could never get used to.
[I warned, yet you failed.]
The heavy and condemning tone, which by such a glimpse, anyone could tell that it didn't belong to a human, resonated in the void space.
Thannath shuddered upon hearing the voice of the creature he had been interacting since not so long.
"Should I kowtow in apology?"
Even though he tried to sound casual, his shaken parts of speech made it evident how scared he was currently.
And it was to be expected from someone who hasn't even breached the territory of Unique Rank until now.
[Dare to talk back, and I will make sure what you cherish would cease to exist.]
Thannath didn't speak nor sneered as he knew what the voice told was all in its capabilities.
For a deity, Thannath's whole kingdom would be a speck of dust that could be wiped anytime desired.
[At least not everything went wrong.]
Thannath's eyes blinked in perplexion as he stared at his front, even though there was nothing to keep his eyes on.
"What?"
[Celeria's descendant is here. Make necessary preparation and lure her to me...]
The Emperor's eyes went wide in shock as he hurriedly asked the first thing that came to his mind.
"The Saintess of Gram is here?!!"
But before even his word could have been uttered completely, the white space around him started fading.
Thannath gritted his teeth in frustration as his vision darkened just before he heard a familiar voice calling out for him.
"My lord...are you awake now?"
Slowly parting his lids, Thannath caught the nervous gaze of his trusted minister. Still, instead of quelling the bespectacled minister's worries, the first words he spoke made the minister even more anxious.
"Summon Yuuske and send our spies to the town. We have been ambushed."
_____________________
A/N:- Mystery would be unraveled, so don't worry and keep hanging with it~

chapters.title: Chapter 63: SS3- Talk between rivals!
chapters.content:
(A/N:- Warning! I don't support the consumption of tobacco or any similar product. There are multiple mentions of those harmful things in the chapter. So beware!)
_________________
"What's that?"
Under the starry night of the spring, with gentle breeze flowing lazily around the surface, stood two boys leaning on the railing of a small balcony.
These two men were the subject of the most heated topic in the nation of Gram currently, with one being famous for existing as a natural hero and the other surprising the world with his unparalleled strength.
'Hmm?'
As Austin heard Kyouki's voice from his left, he took the cigarette from his lips before a small white cloud was released on the hero's face.
"Fu*cough* what's this!"
Kyouki's face contoured as he got covered in the smoke and hurriedly swayed his hand to get the peculiar disturbing smell out of his face.
"Well, nothing much."
Austin faced forward before he continued to smoke out the last vape before throwing the filter down the balcony.
It was a gift from the System when he turned 15 that he would get a supply of any single thing from his previous world infinitely.
Since he had everything necessary available, he chose the thing which reminded him the most of his good old depressing days.
Cigarette was a kind of source which reminded him from where he had come from. It keeps his feet on the ground and helps his sanity to remain stable from all these things happening in so less time.
(A/N:- I hope you can guys won't judge him on this basis)
"Well, for some reason, I think that's harmful to health."
Austin was amazed to see how observant Kyouki was, but his remark would have been suitable if mana wasn't operating Austin's internals.
"You can say, it helps release me some accumulated stress."
Gawking at the night scene, Austin muttered under his breath.
The city where they were taking shelter was on the outcast of Xylex. The reason why Austin and Luna didn't go to live in the motel which Akiko runs, was simple.
(A/N:- Akiko= The owner of Ramen shop)
They just couldn't trust her.
It wasn't that the last meeting left any dark impression of Akiko, but the squad of four was here to rival the country, which Akiko has considered her home now.
So they preferred to play safe than to feel sorry.
"Then can you give me one too?"
Austin's eyes went round in perplexion as he heard the sudden request of the hero.
Turning his head, Austin saw the expression which told that, indeed, Kyouki was being a lot troubled about something.
He didn't have to look anywhere else when the reason for the hero's concern was only some meters behind them, sitting in the room.
Grabbing the packet from his inventory, Austin tapped the bottom twice and took out one for himself, too, since he was at it.
Passing one to Kyouki, Austin gestured to place the filter between the lips, just as he did.
Kyouki, just like a curious child, did what Austin taught and grabbed the tip of the stick with both his lip and held the crook between his index and middle finger.
Igniting the tip of his index finger, Austin lit his and Kyouki's cigarette before the enthusiastic hero inhaled without much thought.
*COUGH*X8
"Fuck! It's gross!"
Kyouki spoke in between coughs as he looked at the burning cigarette with a look of disgust.
On the other side, Austin lit the tip and smoked it like an elegant prince, like he was in some kind of advertisement.
"Well, this is for grown-up men, so that I can understand."
Austin spoke with a casual tone without putting much mind to it. But the hero didn't take it as 'just a remark.'
Sliding the filter back in-between his lips, Kyouki gathered all his willpower and inhaled the maximum amount of smoke he could, ashening almost the whole cigarette.
Austin looked at the scene with his eyes twitching before a huge cloud erupted on Austin's face.
"*Huff* See *Huff* I am a man as well."
With a small exhale with elemental backing, Austin wiped away all the clouds before seeing the red-eyed proud Hero who was huffing like a dog in heat.
Austin chuckled slightly, much to Kyouki's perplexion.
"You are extremely competent, aren't you."
Kyouki blinked thrice before he realized what Austin was talking about.
It didn't take long before Kyouki calmed his breathing and threw away the filter with a flick.
Sighing, the raven-haired youth rested his forearms on the ledge before leaning his back to align with Austin.
"From the town, I come from and the things I have seen, drilled me with a single mantra."
Titling his head to the left, Austin asked with his brows raised.
"And that is?"
"Compete if you want to grow."
"Hmm..."
Austin took the last vape as he hummed in response. With a strong wind, his platinum blond hair swayed gently, before Kyouki followed with his words.
"Since childhood, I have only dreamt of becoming a man who can shoulder the world's responsibility and give a good life to everyone living beside me on this plain. Before I received my blessing I used to compete with my friends. After being bestowed, I took my town's guild master as a challenger, and after reaching Eden's Academy, every professor became my competition. This is how I want to grow in the future as I move forward and leave my rivals behind."
There was an evident glint of determination and optimism in Kyouki's eyes which made Austin somewhat startled since he could never make such a face at any time of his life.
But then again, Kyouki was the bonafide hero material through and through. Having such encouraging emotions was in his blood and fibers.
"So, who's your current rival, Hero?"
Kyouki, without hesitation, replied like he was waiting for the question to arrive.
"It's you, of course."
Austin wasn't much surprised by the statement since he knew what made Kyouki so much aware of him in the first place.
"And what're the chances of you surpassing me?"
Austin was somehow amused by the conversation so much that he felt like prolonging it a little longer.
"Well, who knows, maybe tomorrow I might outshine you and prove my worth to Lu- *ahem* to this world?"
Austin felt like shaking his head in defeat as a dry chuckle left his lips before he walked away from the balcony, leaving his parting words...
"We'll see about that...."
________________________
A/N:- There's a talk between Sicily and Luna too, but since it would have made the chapter too long unless I have rushed it, I left it.
Well, if you guys comment, then I might write another side story~

chapters.title: Chapter 64: Idiot Hero!!
chapters.content:
"How's it?"
In a thinly lighted room that, by flooring and indoors, looked like a wooden cabin, sat two people facing each other.
Currently, Austin was supplying mana in an artifact, he obtained from the female demon. It was the same artifact that was being used to snatch the blessings away and push Luna to such a miserable state.
When Austin asked Luna why she was the most influenced by the artifact, she said:
'Others have only the blessings, but I carry the essence.'
Austin wasn't able to completely discern what she said, so he made necessary preparation to counter if such things happens again.
"Well, I do feel my mana restricted, but I can use my spells to some extent."
The two bangles on either hand of Luna illuminated with golden light signifying how they were defending her from the effect of Blessing Snatcher.
It goes without saying that the ornaments which Luna adorned, were also an artifact that Austin gave her, so she doesn't suffer again.
"Well, that would do. And Luna, only exert your strength until things aren't going out of hand. I will do my best to wrap it up by myself b-"
Luna squeezed Austin's hand and glared subjectively, which made him halt in his words.
"Don't say such things. I am finally getting a chance to fight side by side with the person I love. How can you snatch such an opportunity from me?"
Her eyes glimmered with utmost determination and slight excitement, as she made her point clear.
It was true that Austin and Luna both were powerhouses in their own way, but they never fought together on a battlefield.
Truth to be told, Austin himself was looking forward to seeing Luna in action, but what happened in Eden Academy and the thing with the artifact made his mind a little narrow to let Luna go out of his sight.
'Am I becoming an idiot in love...'
Even though he thought that, there was a gentle smile on his face as it seemed he accepted being silly since the person in question was his precious Luna.
Bringing his left hand over her fluffy hair, Austin tilted his head and whispered his immediate thoughts in a soothing tone.
"Is my over-protective self, not acceptable?"
*BA*DUM*
Luna's heart leaped in beats as she saw the gentle gaze of her beloved blended with such sweet, tempting words, turning her face amber in an instant.
She softly bit her lower lip as she stared at Austin with a hazy gaze.
Her breathing became slightly heavy and unrhythmic, as she sensed Austin advancing his face toward her.
Soon his hot breath reached up to her as she smelt the mixed fragrance of mint, signifying how near he had arrived.
If it was any other time, then she might have jumped on him, but for some reason, the current Austin was dangerous for her heart.
So she played maiden and closed her eyes, as she waited for the final result, but....
**KNOCK**X6
Six consecutive heavy knocks rang from the door, before Luna glared at it, with her mood instantly turning sour.
But to her utmost surprise, a rough warm hand, grabbed her chin, and with a slight pull, a warm sensation spread on her lips.
With her eyes widened, Luna saw two emerald orbs warmly gazing into her oceanic eyes.
Luna instantly closed her lids, as she felt Austin cupping her cheeks before he deepened their kiss to a further extent.
The knocks kept banging on the door, but Austin never halted his movements, and with his face slightly tilted, he enjoyed the sensation of Luna's fluffy and supple lips, which always tempted him to suck on them.
The wet sounds of their intimate lip-locking echoed, which got suppressed by the knocks, as Austin played with her either lips by taking his time.
Her fruitful taste, her softness, and the warm sensation which spread on her face, made him enthralled to do something more, but the time wasn't right.
Separating his lips slowly, Austin saw Luna huffing audibly with her face completely flushed from head to chin.
Austin knew if he looked for more than a second at her face now, then he might lose his calm, so instantly, he got up and went to open the door.
"Ah!"
Sicily, who was continuously knocking on the door, became startled when it abruptly swung.
"What?"
In normal circumstances, Austin might have flared up on Sicily, but right now, he was in a very colorful mood.
Upon seeing Austin's current expression, Sicily fell into a daze, but soon she shook her head and confessed her concern hurriedly.
"Kyou-kun! He...he went to buy something from the down market, and he...."
Austin's eyes stretched as he realized what she was saying, before he darted away from the room.
'This idiot!!!'
________________________
[Some minutes ago]
[Around the place where the group of four has been staying]
As the sun peeked from the horizon and daybreak illuminated the surface, Kyouki felt like moving out of the shelter and roaming in the market for the time being.
And since he wanted to eat something, too, he told Sicily that he would be checking the downtown market for a bit.
Sicily was reluctant to let him go, so she placed the Vitality Thread on him so that she could be assured of his safety.
Currently, the raven-haired handsome youth was venturing into the lively early morning market while munching on a fresh apple.
The surrounding was getting busier passing each second, with shops lifting their shutters and town people leaving their house to go to their work.
In a sense, it reminded Kyouki of the town where he grew up.
This simplicity, this harmonious atmosphere, and the lovely calmness made his morning unforgettable.
"Please, don't break my store! I beg you, Onii-san."
Suddenly Kyouki's ear perked with a childish voice from not so far.
Redirecting his gaze, he found a group of men wearing ragged clothes and cuts on their faces, breaking the outer structure of a bread shop.
A small girl was pleading with her hands joined in front of the men, with tears flowing out of her eyes.
Kyouki's breathing became heavy as he subconsciously mushed the remaining apple before he moved his feet toward the scene.
"Hey, assholes!"
Kyouki shouted at the top of his lungs, which gathered the attention of the onlookers as well as the goons who were breaking the shop too.
"Eh? Ye fed up of living..heh?"
One of them glared at Kyouki with murderous intent covering his demeanor.
But it wasn't enough to make the hero surrender, as he moved his feet at an inhuman speed, much to the goons' astonishment, before two heavy blows resonated in the surrounding.
"Khwhak!"
"What the..."
Both of them fell to the ground while clutching their torso as a single heavy blow was enough to push them off the edge.
"Can you even call yourself a man after hurting such an innocent life?"
Kyouki's eyes were devoid of any emotion as he felt loath toward the group who evidently were committing such sin, which required more than a punch.
But he forgot that there was a third one too who was still turned toward the store until now.
"What a statement. It almost sounded like what a hero would say."
Hearing the word, 'Hero, ' Kyouki became flustered as he turned his eyes to the front and saw that the little girl wasn't there anymore, before he felt a tremendous amount of intent pouring down his consciousness and surrendering him to kneel.
"Khak!! W-Who are you!?"
While struggling not to let himself fall any further , Kyouki asked the man in front.
"Me? Well, you can say I am somewhat of a hero myself~"
_______________________
A/N:- Hero and his heroic traits~
And yeah, if you guys want to read advance chapter, visit: -
https://zetrotranslation.com/novel/isnt-the-wannabe-villain-too-cute/

chapters.title: Chapter 65: Saint and the Monster~1!
chapters.content:
"Did you find him?"
As Austin returned, Sicily got up and immediately barged for any news about Kyouki.
Austin, whose hair was raven, now signifying that he had used the herb to not look suspicious in the market, shook his head with a sigh.
"A ruckus did occur an hour ago, and from what I have heard, Kyouki must have gotten involved in it."
Austin muttered to the bed as he plopped down beside Luna, who had a solemn expression spread across her face. But deep down, she was extremely frustrated because of Kyouki's action, which definitely would raise problems in the plan.
The air around Sicily oozed with worry and concern for Kyouki as more than the plan or anything else; she was worried about his whereabouts.
As for Austin...
"Well, there's no point crying over the spilled milk. Now we have to think before we move."
He was so calm and collected at the moment, that even Luna became baffled, not to talk about Sicily, who feared to face Austin's rage.
"You...leave it. What do you have in mind, Austin?"
Luna halted her words, before she asked what concerned her most at the moment.
Sicily also looked at Austin in a way like he was her last hope who could help her regain Kyouki.
"Kyouki, despite being not much powerful in comparison to Alex or Sir Charles, was still a hero of light. From what I know, the military of Xylex isn't capable of restraining him. Then the only option left is...."
"The summoned heroes."
Luna completed his words, on which Austin only nodded before he continued with his words.
"Well, in a way, we know that rumours about The Summoned Heroes aren't just rumours. And since that Vitality Thread is still intact, it means that Kyouki has been taken, hostage."
Sicily nearly forgot that she had the thread in her hand, which tells the condition of the other half bearer. Some strings have died down, which said that Kyouki was injured but still in good condition.
She heaved a sigh of relief, as she also plopped down on the chair before she heard Austin continuing.
"Well, I am 99 percent sure that Kyouki has been taken by Capital's guard but to be on the safe side...Luna, can you track him?"
Without responding, Luna went to work as soon as her eyes were illuminated with a cyan hue.
It didn't take long before her oceanic eyes returned, along with a negative answer.
"No, I can't. Something is blocking my senses after a definite reach."
Luna had a profound expression on her face as she said her concerns. It wasn't the first time she was restricted like this, and neither time had she had a good premonition about it.
"Well, that is understandable since Xylex works with demons and their cursed items."
It sounds absurd every time they remember how a nation was able to co-operate with those beings who know no obedience and considers humanity as their nemesis.
Austin suddenly got up from the bed, attracting the gaze of the ladies before he took out something from the inventory and threw it inside his mouth.
"A-Austin? What about tracking Kyou-kun?"
Sicily asked hurriedly as she was suffering from anxiety passing each second.
"Am *nom**nom* af if..."
(A/N:-  I am at it)
Due to the heavy load inside his mouth, Austin's voice became slightly funny, which made Luna giggle. Austin playfully glared at Luna, which the latter ignored entirely.
Sicily, looked at the flirting couple with her eyes twitching before finally, her patience resulted in something meaningful.
**SPIT**
**GUFUU**
As soon Austin spat the thing, he was chewing, a white cloud formed at that place.
Sicily and Luna looked at the scene with curious gazes before a small brown figure emerged out of the cloud.
**Baff*Baff*
With its short tail wagging left to right, a small dog of the size of fewer than 50 centimeters appeared at the spot as it stared at its master with a joyful gaze.
""Awwwww""
If only Sicily would have reacted like this, then it would have been understandable, but Luna being so expressive about something made Austin startled.
Both of the beautiful women went straight to pet the tiny creature, which they hadn't seen until now.
The little being, too, accepted its master's acquaintance with its eyes closed and tail unstoppably swaying left to right.
Austin rubbed his eyes with a heavy sigh, before his voice reached up to the trio.
"Come here."
The creature, just like a remote control device, left the parts of the two onee-san and marched toward Austin.
Austin looked at the dog before his eyes focused on the two maidens in front, who had their gaze still fixed on the creature like they had found their new obsession.
"Hello, guys? Remember, Kyouki, summoned heroes, Xylex? Does it rings any bell?"
Luna, as well as Sicily, came out of their stupor as they saw Austin's frown, much to their fret.
"Seriously. Anyway, Sicily bring me something which had Kyouki's scent. We will go hero hunting now."
______________________
At the same time, when the trio and a newly added member initiated their search for the hero, two peculiar men walked steadily in a dimly lighted hall.
The place was by no mean extravagant or luxurious, which one could expect from a hall built inside the palace.
There were guards aligned by the wall who motionlessly stood at their place even though the Emperor was walking through the foyer.
"You sure that Saintess would come after this defective hero?"
The one who spoke with a sneer was the spiky red-headed, summoned being, Yuuske.
"I don't know if it is true or not, but the saint is in a relationship with the Light Hero, so she must come."
A wide grin spread across Yuuske's face as he thought about the rumored beauty of Saintess, who was the most charming woman in the nation of Gram.
'Well, until Mina doesn't accept me, I might enjoy something fresh and raw instead?'
With such wicked thoughts, the duo proceeded further inside the hall, which, in actuality, was an underground prison where Yuuske have stored Kyouki.
The metal bars showed the figure of a boy in his mid-teens, currently being bound with two chains as his upper body looked completely ragged with tens of blood marks and bruises all over.
"Why did you beat him up? He might become nation's asset in future."
Thannath glared at the carefree man, who shrugged his shoulder before answering.
"That kid ain't any hero. I just did what I felt like."
Thannath soon left the matter since he knew how crazy-minded Yuuske was, to begin with.
Instead, with a profound expression, he almost pleaded the hero with the concern which was making Thannath, worried the most.
"Whatever you do, keep the monster with Saintess alive. He alone handled a whole army of demons single-handedly. So by hook or crook, you have to take him to our side, understand?"
__________________
A/N:- Well, let's just pray for the new hero now.

chapters.title: Chapter 66: Saint and the Monster~2!
chapters.content:
In a semi-crowded street, three suspicious figures could be seen striding through people as they followed a small creature, that was attracting more attention than the trio.
It's already been three hours since Kyouki disappeared, and the three started their journey to find him.
There couldn't use levitation since the creature couldn't track its target in mid-air, and also, the [Camouflage] Luna has drawn upon themselves would become vulnerable in the skies.
So walking on foot was the last option.
"These things are clinging so much to my body."
Sicily grumbled again as she complained about the pants, that Austin gave her, for the third time.
Since it was something Austin took out of his inventory, it goes without saying, that it wouldn't be just a pair of pants.
But the ojou-sama, who had only worn elegant skirts and gowns until now, was having trouble wearing men's apparel, all of a sudden.
"Don't complain or run naked."
Luna growled in annoyance as Sicily was whining unnecessarily. She also had some kind of attire, with frill centered white shirt and black high-waist pants, but looking at Luna's fluent movement, it seemed she was used to wearing it.
Sicily teared up in grief as she closed her mouth and followed behind the two.
"We are nearing. Spread your senses."
Suddenly the look of annoyance and misery on the two ladies' faces disappeared as they heard Austin's remark, before they did what the man asked for.
The reason why Austin was able to conclude that they were nearing the capital, was the lessen populace around the vicinity.
Xylex capital was built in two parts. The first was distributed to commoners and traders along with low-ranking nobles, in which Austin and co. were staying last night.
The upper town contained the main palace along with the residence of high-ranking nobles and also, and the main Cathedral was built here.
The two towns were connected in more than one way, which helped Austin, Luna, and Sicily to blend in the crowd and approach the higher end, comfortably.
"Hey, stop!"
After reaching a certain point, Austin halted the dog since it was moving forward while sniffing the path, constantly.
The reason why Austin stopped it was because in front of the group was a lean bridge made of castle stones with two guards standing on either side of the entrance.
Beneath and beside the bridge was a lake with apparent blue water spread like a serene sheet, and unlike the upper town from which they passed by, this place was utterly unpopulated.
The trio stood at a distance where the guards and any other surveillance wouldn't have been able to see them.
Keeping a look out of their surrounding, Austin asked in a calm tone.
"Luna...is it the same for now too ?"
Luna bit her lower lip in frustration as she felt so useless for the second time in her life, before responding to her beloved.
"Yeah. Something is blocking all my senses after a certain point. I am sorry, Austin."
Seeing her downcast expression, Austin smiled gently, before he brought his hand above her head and spoke lovingly.
"Don't apologize, Luna. I know how it feels when you have the capability yet can't utilize it, but we have to think straight here since this won't be the last thing, I will ask you today."
Luna, upon hearing such considerate remarks from the person whose words matter most to her, became a little calmer as she smiled with a nod.
Sicily wasn't trying to eavesdrop on their lovey-dovey conversation, but since she was so close to them, she couldn't miss the part in which Austin spoke about himself, which naturally made her remember some of the things from the past.
The pink atmosphere remained only for some moments before; Austin directed his gaze upon the green-eyed girl.
"Sicily, do you have any way to peek inside without getting found out?"
Upon hearing Austin's subjective remark, Sicily frowned slightly.
"Why do I feel like, you know about me more than I am aware of?"
[Ding!]
[+100: Villain's Point]
[The plot has been slightly altered by your interference.]
Austin suppressed his smile and shrugged his shoulder in response to Sicily.
The receiver of such an aloof response fell into contemplation but not for long as she extended her hand toward Austin.
"What?"
"Give me that staff."
Austin remembered what she was talking about, before he grabbed the thing from inside the inventory and passed it to the excited girl.
"Wahh!"
Sicily was almost seemed to be jumping in elation as she finally reunited with her beloved partner in crime. Hugging the mage staff dearly, Sicily gave an accomplished look.
Luna was glaring at the scene because of not being aware of the whole event which happened back in the Eden Academy.
"*Ahem* Please don't tell Kyou-kun about this spell at all, or I won't be able to show my face in front of him."
Both Luna and Austin were aware of why Sicily said such a thing, so they kept their mouth shut before Sicily finally began to work.
Closing her eyes, a strange greenish hue covered the mage-warrior before some movement happened on the middle of her forehead.
**SQUELCH**
Like muscle being torn, the flesh on Sicily's center forehead parted before a small eye came into existence.
The eye , unlike usual, wasn't vertical in shape but rather horizontal, with a thin black pupil moving around restlessly.
It took almost five minutes for Sicily to establish the network between the third eye and her consciousness before she widened her perception and took the survey inside the palace.
Very soon, a deep frown contoured her beautiful face as it seemed she saw something seemingly horrible.
Coming back to herself, the third eye disappeared from her forehead before Sicily parted her lids and spoke in a serious tone.
"There isn't any army of humans or demons; instead, what stood guarding the palace is just a single man."
Luna's expression also turned severe as she heard the cause of her senses of restriction, which didn't help but leave her with sourness.
"Anything more about that person?"
It was Austin who asked, and by his expression, it seemed he was expecting such a thing to be the case.
"To be honest, I never had seen such tremendous mana presence from anyone, which that man was reeking with. I can't be sure, but it seems that he was above any of the demons who came to attack Eden Academy."
Upon hearing that the vanguard was a man but not a woman, Austin concluded that this wasn't the person whom the ramen shop owner mentioned as demigod ranked.
But the main trouble was, the whereabouts of that female summoned hero. Since another Summoned being was in charge of guarding the palace, this only meant a single thing...
'Emperor Thannath is taking us lightly....'
Austin fell into contemplation about the next move, for a long minute before it seemed he finally drew his conclusion.
"Sicily, take this."
"Ah.."
Austin threw a white pearl-like pill toward the baffled girl, before he started narrating what he have thought....
"Listen carefully. This pill will help you avoid any kind of surveillance, appraiser, or high-level detection spell, for an hour. After Luna and I draw out every hidden arsenal from Xylex, you have to infiltrate inside and find Kyouki, understand?"
There were various things to register, but in the end, Sicily just nodded with a profound expression as she clutched the pill.
"I won't disappoint you both."
Nodding, Austin turned toward the lovely raven-haired saint who looked pretty in every attire or appearance she adores, before he held her hand and spoke in a whisper.
"You ready?"
Reciprocating the smile with a blend of determination in her eyes, Luna spoke in the same tone.
"Been since ever."
____________________
A/N:- Is it going slow paced? Leme know~

chapters.title: Chapter 67: Saint and the Monster~3!
chapters.content:
Under the bright sun, with chirps of volant and the slight rustle of cool breezes, stood a singular figure in the whole compound of the front palace.
The man, by appearance, looked in his early twenties with spiky crimson hair and raven dye at the edge of the tips. His facial features were of those devilish charmer types with a high nose, and seductive lip currently drew in a wide grin.
His two rubric eyes stared into the distant sky as the man waited for something or someone with great excitement.
This man was none other than Yuuske Shinma, one of the beings who have been summoned from another world to Xylex in order to accomplish something.
