Yuuske, before he was summoned, lived a miserable life where he was betrayed or abandoned by everyone. Either his parents or his friends, everyone for one way or another, left his side, never to return.
He lived in the darkness where he feared nothing but to trust and get close to someone.
That's why when suddenly he found this frightening strength, with his features developing into a dangerous charm and wealth that wouldn't be exhausted even if he spent it with both hands, Yuuske became blinded.
He felt like the world was beneath him until he found out that there were others too, who found such fortune like him.
But he didn't stop there.
Slowly yet surely, he strengthened himself, by different means, became the most influential entity of the kingdom, and eliminated everything which could have bare their fangs at him.
He believed that until he doesn't anger the being who had brought them here, he would become the ruler of this plain and do whatever he even never dreamt of.
But he was unaware of the fact that he only has become overpowered in the face of demons and people he has met until now.
The real catastrophe has yet to come...
...
"Ah, you guys are finally here. I was about to run havoc in the town to search the Sai...."
Yuuske's words came to a halt as his eyes landed on the raven-haired woman beside the man, who, just with one look, made Yuuske go speechless.
His eyes were drawn entirely up to her as he ignored the presence other than the beauty whose rumor didn't fail his expectancy.
Since Yuuske knew that the Saint of Gram was widely known for her peculiar Silver hair, he concluded that she must have been wearing some artifact or had consumed some herbs.
But even with the midnight crown, Yuuske felt his heart racing just upon catching a glimpse of her perfect figure and slim waist, which urged him to go forth and hold her at this instance.
The tight-fitting of her pants exposed how fine meaty, and fluffy her thighs were. Not to talk about her bust, which Yuuske found unfairly big for someone belonging to that age. All in all, her body made him extremely enthralled.
Yuuske shamelessly eyed Luna all over, but just avoided her eyes. It wasn't that the Saint was looking at him with disgust; instead, her oceanic eyes contained no emotions at all.
He avoided that gaze since it reminded him of a certain woman who he had been pursuing for months now.
"You do look more beautiful than I had heard, Saint-sama."
Yuuske bowed with an honest compliment, but in response, he heard nothing. But since he wasn't hoping for anything in return, he got back up instantly.
Finally turning his head toward the emerald-eyed boy beside the beauty, Yuuske raised his finger before asking in an innocent tone.
"Umm...I was informed that I would be facing a Saint and A monster. But you are a kid tho...you sure you didn't let someone like your Onii-chan, behind?"
Yuuske, this time, hoped to hear some hot-blooded threats or at least some agitated reaction from the boy, just like the hero he captured this morning.
But then again...
'What's up with this weird duo.'
Yuuske found it annoying to see the scene progressing so blandly. Concluding that the two intruders weren't going to talk, Yuuske decided to finalize the matter and wrap up for the day.
"Okay, here's the deal. Hand over the saint and we will give your broken hero back and even let you run away from the terri-"
**SWISSH**
**BOOOOOOM**
Suddenly the figure of Austin disappeared from his spot like he was an illusion. With a pace that might defy the eyes of the highest ranking appraiser, he launched toward the blabbering man before landing a tightly held punch right at the center of Yuuske's face.
An uneven dent formed on Catles' wall where Yuuske crashed just after three seconds of being hit. The distance between his initial and final positions was more than two hundred meters, so one could imagine how heavy, Austin landed the blow.
Yuuske's eyes were always open since he felt the unavoidable blow. With a wide grin, he wiped the drops of blood spilling out of his nose before he got out of the crater.
Stretching his body and cracking the tensed muscle, Yuuske spoke enthusiastically.
"Omoshiroi~ So the rumors about Gram weren't all false, huh? Well, since you landed the first blood, I hope you can handle the consequences."
Saying so, Yuuske's aura started to overflow with a strange kind of energy with, his eyes glittering with murderous intent as he maniacally looked at his target, before muttering under his breath.
"Leme show you what a true hero is capable of..."
_____________________
At the same time when all this ordeal was undergoing, somewhere far away, a more profound event had already taken place.
Burning trees, broken walls, and injured people, made the surroundings look like it had faced a massive war and hadn't recovered from the after effect.
But only the sufferers knew that this disastrous result happened just because of a single human.
"Khwak!"
As the person responsible for this catastrophe on Eden Academy, lifted the red-haired warrior Venessa, the victim struggled to breathe properly.
"Where's Saint Luna Lastov?"
(A/N:- Luna uses a fake surname to hide her real identity.)
Vanessa, with her one eye bruised and the other one focused on the raven-haired bitch woman, growled under her breath for being so hopeless before she shouted in rage.
"F-fuck of-"
**DHAK**
The woman didn't wait to hear Venessa's curse before throwing the pitiful warrior to the ground before she lost her consciousness.
Examining around the vicinity, the woman eyed the whole surrounding but wasn't able to find a single useful person who could help her find the Saint she had come to take Xylex.
Suddenly the woman heard someone's voice from far above before a figure came into her heightened vision.
"May I help you, lady?"
Descended at a steady pace was a bespectacled purple-robed man in his thirties, as he finally landed his feet just some feet apart from the woman.
'Sir Charles would be super mad....'
Alex drew a mana circle and used as much healing as he could on the senseless Venessa, who still hadn't recovered from the battle with the demons.
The eyes of the woman didn't waver even though Alex was actively healing the girl, since it didn't concern her at all.
With her voice taking a colder blend, she gave away her judgment.
"Speak before I turn this place into a graveyard."
_______________________
A/N:- Drop a comment~

chapters.title: Chapter 68: Luna’s way!
chapters.content:
**SPRT**
On a broken ground with rumbles of stones and craters deforming the surface, stood two men while facing each other.
One of them had a neat appearance with raven hair adorning his head and a calm demeanor wearing his aura as he stood solemnly like he wasn't a contender of what just some seconds ago.
The other one had a more profound expression on his face as he spat blood once in a while as he bled from various corners, actively.
Vitality from his rubric eyes seemed to have exhausted away, as the man faced such blows and unavoidable hits from his opponent, that the initial thoughts of wrapping up for the day, felt to be prolonged more than he expected.
"You really are good for someone to be at that age, eh? You sure, aren't chya the real hero or somethin?"
Yuuske asked in a hoarse tone as he gawked intently at the teenage boy who had made him remember what pain was, after so long.
He, who has dreamt of becoming the mightiest being, whom no one could ever be able to defy, has taken damage from a mere brat?!
'Unacceptable!'
Suddenly, Yuuske's whole aura started to turn heavier with his eyes regaining the glint which oozed with murderous intent. A peculiar golden magical essence started enveloping his body, seeming to signify the activation of some kind of spell.
"Enhancer!!!"
As the shout left Yuuske's mouth, he darted at Austin at a completely different pace, denying all the stats he had shown until now.
Only five seconds and Yuuske was positioned on Austin's back with both his palms clasped and ready to turn Austin's head into a bloody pulp.
"Die!!"
**BOOOOOOOM**
A massive cloud of dust broke out after an ear-numbing shockwave erupted from the place centered on Austin.
The land around that area was, despite being covered with the hue, evidently turned into a massive excavation as Yuuske landed his blow, using his strength to the fullest.
Luna, who was still near the bridge end, felt her heart leaping slightly as the hit indeed was terrifying for even her to stay calm. But she didn't go to help since she knew Austin was, by all means, fine.
"!!!"
When Yuuske didn't feel the hot liquid, he was expecting after opening Austin's skull with his attack; his eyes widened in shock.
And more to it, when Yuuske's vision cleared from the dust, what he saw, made him flabbergasted beyond belief.
"You really do talk a lot."
For the first time, Austin's voice leaked out before the rubric-eyed hero felt a massive life-threatening intent pouring down his consciousness.
With his forearm still blocking Yuuske's adjoined blow, Austin clenched his fist and covering it with [Hell Blaze]; he punched Yuuske's torso without exerting much of force.
Well, that was a held-back punch from Austin's perspective...
"KHWAAAAAK!"
Yuuske's eyes turned white for a moment as the fatal impact on his torso, which nearly took away his life with it.
But he wasn't provided with much leisure to even get over the after effect, before Yuuske felt his wrist being held in a rigid grip with unbreakable strength.
With his palm wide spread, Austin didn't give a single shit what was happening with this self-claimed hero, before the teenage youth started showering the man with heavy slaps.
**THWACK**
Each hit was worthy of putting a lower Unique rank Demon into eternal slumber. The sharp noise of flesh hitting flesh made even Luna cringe as Austin continued beating the hero mercilessly.
"STO *slap* STOP IT *THAK*"
The most crucial part of Austin's rain of blows was, that he only targeted Yuuske's left side of his face, resulting in a swollen mess.
After what seemed like an eternity for Yuuske and those who were watching things from the background, Austin finally got done with his chain of slaps; and with the last firm whack, he released Yuuske's hand.
**DHAK**
Yuuske's body was thrown not so far away before it hit a pillar near the palace entrance.
The loud shrieks and painful cries finally came to a halt with a thud.
The battlefield was distorted as if a full-fledged war had occurred in such a small arena.
The expression on Thannath's face wasn't very significant as he saw the scene in front.
From start to end, he could only catch one thing, which was how miserably Yuuske was getting beaten down by the raven-haired youth.
Thannath knew that his strongest warrior was the female hero who had gone to Gram currently, but he didn't have any fewer hopes from his second best either.
He has spent fortunes for Yuuske, after all.
'Damn it!'
Gritting his yellowish teeth, Thannath spoke agitatedly toward his minister.
"Send Reinforcement."
"But my lord. Yuuske-sama said-
"I don't give a fuck what that weak ass bastard said! Do what I say and capture that Saint before the matter could grow any severe."
The minister became flustered being scolded by the king, before he bowed and darted away to his full capability.
With a heavy sigh, Thannath faced the front as with a frown, he muttered, under his breath.
"Let's see how long you can endure."
...
Back on the battlefield, Austin sensed something massive approaching just by the change in the flow of mana, but since he didn't have any artifact to resist spell formation, he let whatever was happening.
The castle door finally parted after so many deathly exchanges before a group of men wearing church robes and black-cladded warriors stepped out.
By mana evaluation, Austin concluded that no one was above the Veteran Rank. But what gave him this strange vibe was something else...something more ominous.
'Oh..so that's why...'
Appeared were two dark reddish portals just on either side where Yuuske landed earlier before some specific figures started walking out of those gateways.
The priests who came from inside the palace also focused on healing their hero with the guards working as a barricade around him.
Those who appeared with heavy miasma overflowing out of them were undoubtedly demons of mixed Class of Terror and Unique.
The amount of demons were so many in number, that the whole atmosphere started turning dark, with clouds disappearing behind the haze.
Austin was a little anxious about the scene since Kyouki hadn't been retrieved yet, but he knew standing there would result in nothing.
But just before he was about to take a step forward and land his first blow, someone hugged him from his back.
Austin concluded that there was none on the battlefield who could have reached up to him without getting noticed, other than a single beautiful person.
"Master~Austin~ Won't you let Luna have some share of fun while you admire her beauty on the battlefield?"
Spoke in a seductive tone was the person whose voice he could recognize even in sleep.
For the first time after arriving at the Xylex main palace, a smile made its way to Austin's handsome face before he nodded with his reply.
"My eyes will only be on you."
"So I better do it in the most flashy way~."
Saying, so Luna let go of Austin before she stepped forward.
What her parting words actually meant, would be realized by Austin very soon, and when he would, he might realize what side of Luna he actually was unaware of, until now...
____________________
A/N:- Leme know if you liked the chap~

chapters.title: Chapter 69: Luna’s way~2!
chapters.content:
Since childhood, Austin only has come to respect two people based on their strength and capability.
The first one is the Grand Master Merlin Finser, the one and only headmaster of Eden's Academy since anyone could remember. The Saint Ranked mage does contain that potential that gained him the name engraved in the golden history of Gram and also built an admirable image in Austin's memory.
The second is the Knight Commander of the Royal Order, Charles Sinton. The war god had experienced so many deathly battles throughout his life that had instilled a fear in other nations, that if they wanted to harm Gram, they had to face this battle maniac first.
Austin has felt natural admiration toward these aforementioned beings, but that was until now...
**CREEEK**
"!!!"
The hair strands on Austin's arm stood up as he stared at the scene in front.
It's been only ten minutes...
Ten freakin minutes!!
And Luna have turned the battlefield which was already in a distorted condition, into a complete graveyard of demons.
Whatever walked out of the portal regardless they were Unique ranked or Terror. Either they were volant creatures or underground threats; nothing survived.
The mixture of Elemental, Spiritual, and Inheritance types of formation sparkled from Luna's ascended figure as she dominated the battlefield with the sheer use of raw mana.
Due to the fact that there wasn't any Blessing Snatcher involved in the battle, she was able to draw out her true potential, while remaining unfazed even though she was using that absurd amount of magical energy.
Not to talk about her coquettish laugh in between the battle, which would have sounded seductive if not for life she was seizing past each second.
"Fuck..."
**RUMBLE**
Austin couldn't help but exclaim upon seeing the earth-shattering thunder raining down from the sky as Luna fried down seven Terror Ranked demons in one go.
Even Austin requires a minute to put a Terror Demon into sleep unless he doesn't use his artifact and spiritual blessings. And here, the saint who was known for being caring and motherly by nature was pulverizing the demons like they were mere ants.
To say, Austin was shocked would be an understatement. He indeed was proud of being the lover of such a talented warrior, but the dread of angering Luna in the future rose steadily inside his mind.
'Well, she won't kill me even if I were to anger her...right?'
Shrugging his unnecessary thoughts, Austin turned his head toward the group of men who had long lost their vitality because of the fear; Luna unintentionally instilled in them.
Only a single Veteran Rank pope was healing Yuuske back to health, while sweating profoundly.
Catching Austin's gaze, Yuuske pushed the pope away as he intently glared at the raven-haired youth.
Yuuske was indeed frightened beyond belief upon feeling Austin's might, and now when he caught a glimpse of what this rumored Saint was capable of, he had already lost hope of winning this battle...
....In his human form.
'Well, better than dying..'
Thinking to himself, Yuuske brought up a small purple pill that was oozing with condensed demonic energy.
Austin saw the ordeal, but he didn't have much time to proceed since he might come in Luna's way, so Austin stood right at his point and let the hero do whatever he desired in his final moments.
Yuuske sneered at the weak response, before he threw the pill inside his mouth while keeping his gaze fixed on Austin.
'Blame your luck, bastard, for pushing me to this point...'
Thinking at his final instants as a human, Yuuske felt a massive surge of strange energy penetrating every part of his body, overtaking his mana and hijacking his senses.
"KHAK!"
Dropping on his left knee, Yuuske saw his hand bulging before his limbs started expanding dangerously. His armor started tearing up as soon his whole body converted into a savage state.
Crimson condensed blood covered his whole body, with the previous handsome feature changing into a distorted shape as Yuuske's overall size bulged disturbingly.
"KUAK! KHAAAK!"
The tone of growls shifted to a heavier phase as the small human frame, converted into a humungous 5-meter demon with limbs similar to humans yet massive to be called humane.
His head was now bald, with two sharp fangs protruding from the lower jaw. The previous amber eye was turned into a maroon without any sign of fixed pupil, as the formerly handsome man wholly turned into a crimson monster.
"UOOOOOOOOOOOOOHHH"
Former summoned hero, roared in agitation, sending tremors throughout the battlefield as it took his massive step forward.
Austin also walked only a foot when both demon and Austin halted because of varying reasons.
The demon stopped because his body was restricted with pure mana to even let his single finger move. And the reason Austin halted...
"Sorry, darling. Just a second, and I will wrap this up."
Luna's beautiful hair, which had regained its original peculiar shade, swayed freely in mid-air as she pleaded Austin to wait for some time since she didn't want to interrupt him mid-fight.
Austin raised his brows for some reason, before he nodded for Luna to continue.
Luna smiled before landing between the crimson demon and her beloved, as soon her eyes got covered with a cyan hue.
[Hymn of Celeria]
A small vortex, with a whirlwind actively erupting out of it, formed on Luna's palm as she stood calmly at her spot while maintaining the mana terrifyingly.
With a smirk, she released the vortex toward the two portals from where the new group of demons was about to exit.
The whirlpool of greenish-blue wind engulfed the demon along with the whole two significant gateways before everything disappeared within a moment.
The whole thing only took twenty-second as Luna turned toward Austin with a big grin on her face.
Austin's lips twitched as he thought, why didn't Luna use such a spell since the start? Then again, the way she expectantly came up to him, he could not just break her heart, could he?
"How was I?"
Luna's face was slightly red due to the overuse of mana, but other than that, she was completely fine, both mentally and physically.
Austin sighed with a smile, before bringing his hand over the shy Luna as he praised her.
"Hai..hai. My Luna is the best."
"Hmmm~"
Luna giggled with a toothy smile plastered on her charming face as she enjoyed the pats of Austin.
**GUOOOOOHHH**
Another loud roar erupted from the only demon available on the ground, which made Luna extremely annoyed.
"Should I dispose of this one too, darling?"
Luna immediately chanted a spell and was about to release it toward the demon, before Austin stopped her.
"No, Luna. If it would have before he had eyed you with such a disgusting gaze, then I would have let you take him down. But now..."
Luna's eyes widened in surprise as she blinked at her darling, who seemed to be more handsome currently, as his aura grew fiercer before he concluded his words.
"Now, it's personal."
____________________
A/N:- I will wrap up the fight in the next chapter, promise.
And did you guys like the way Luna calls him now?
Leme know in the comments~

chapters.title: Chapter 70: Luna’s Drunk?
chapters.content:
In a thinly lighted hall could be seen a feminine figure of a raven-haired woman as she stealthily made her way inside the palace of Xylex, without letting her presence become evitable with her steps.
The pill she got from Austin, helped Sicily, avoid the sensors and those who were guarding the indoor palace. Fortunately, there weren't many guards left inside the castle doors, and the disaster outside has kept the residuals occupied.
Sicily currently had a slightly pale face as after all the reinforcement arrived on the battlefield; then only she infiltrated the fortress.
Naturally, she witnessed the brutal strength Austin displayed to overwhelm the battlefield while facing Yuuske. But since she already has seen how Austin fights back in Eden Academy, she wasn't frightened by him to the extent she was showcasing right now.
What made Sicily bathe in a cold sweat was the traumatizing might that the woman displayed, who was known to be a Saint Healer, yet inflicted irreversible damage on her enemies, just contrary to her title.
If Sicily didn't had seen it with her own eyes, she might never have believed that Luna could be so ruthless and overpowering in battle. The blend of different kinds of mana channels and how she redirected it, made Sicily believe that she was by no means comparable to her.
'I better take my Kyou-kun far away from her...'
Thinking so, Sicily fastened her feet and walked toward the direction from where Kyouki's energy was faintly leaking out.
____________________
Back on the battlefield, the sky was still dark due to the miasma leaking out of the dead bodies of the demons, stood three figures varying in the race.
Two of them were humans, and the third has lost his humanity, some minutes ago.
Luna was sitting on the wall by the bridge end as she kept her gaze fixed on her beloved darling with a smile never leaving her face.
Austin was facing the distorted red demon with his eyes solely focused on his enemy as he waited patiently for it to move.
The demon, after getting liberated from Luna's bind, was already so much agitated that it didn't let Austin wait for long before it conjured a black orb on top of its massive palm, which was purple lightning sparkling all over.
(A/N:- Yuuske(demon)= 'It.')
The black orb was indeed made up of raw curse energy that only an actual demon could possess. But an entity that was previously human and wasn't born like this using curse powers, made Austin a little perplexed. Nevertheless, he kept it aside for now, and awaited the blow to be released.
With a high-pitched roar, the crimson monster released the orb, which grew up to seven feet in diameter, toward the raven-haired youth.
"UGOOOHH!"
The dark orb broke the surface as a trail from where it passed and moved toward Austin. The sphere was by no mean agile since it could have been traced with normal human eyes, but the dark energy it was releasing and the impact it would inflict, could have put a whole town into eternal slumber.
But despite sensing such energy, Austin didn't waver from his footing, and raising his hand just when the orb was some feet apart from him; he activated a specific part of his spell.
"[Gluttony]"
Suddenly a black ink shadow erupted from the center of Austin's palm like it was freed from a long restrain before the unshaped shadow covered the whole curse energy along with the globe and disappeared from existence.
"Feuh~ Impressive, darling~."
Luna, in a bizarre yet energetic mood, shouted in praise like she was enjoying the show her beloved was displaying.
Austin smiled wryly as he concluded that Luna indeed was mana drunk before he sensed the demon again releasing a heavy mass of curse energy toward him.
This time not only one but two dark orbs of the same density glided toward Austin only to get eaten by his spell.
The demon who, formerly named Yuuske, launched these deadly spheres on Austin in hopes of pushing the human to his limit, while repeating its attacks restlessly.
Austin's Gluttony was indeed a powerful energy-oriented spell negater, but there was a limit where he could absorb with his current physique.
Disappearing from his spot by utilizing the agility stats he has accumulated until now, Austin got out of the barrage of attacks and appeared just above the bald head of the demon.
**DHAAK**
Using his adjoined palms as a hammer, Austin landed a trembling blow on the demon's crown but to no avail.
As expected of a demon whose aura was evidently higher than the second degree of Terror Rank. Its head was still intact, without even a dent.
Austin's eyes were still unfazed as this much was in his capability.
Raising his right hand, Austin blocked the incoming punch of the demon, without much trouble.
**DHAK**
An audible shockwave was generated from the collision of the big fist with Austin's bare palm, but the halt was so brutal that the creature couldn't move even an inch further.
With Austin's left hand still on its crown, he channelized his mana and conjured one of his elemental spells.
[Infernous]
Like a curtain of flames, the whole figure of the crimson demon got covered in Austin's most proficient spell.
However, it seemed that the creature's skin was a lot thicker than it appeared. Even Austin didn't use his harshest degree of flames, it still could have blown away a horde of Unique ranked demons.
"GUOOOOOOOO"
Roaring like a beast, the demon threw his forelimbs in an indefinite direction, trying to attack the human anyhow.
Austin darted away from his position before launching another set of fireballs to keep the demon busy.
**BOOOOOM**
**BOOOOOM**
Heavy amount of explosions erupted with the crimson monster at the center. The ground school violently, with the mana in the air fluctuating tremendously with the chain of attacks, Austin was hurling.
The reason why Austin wasn't releasing the curse energy he had deposited from his gluttony was for the safety of the hero.
The accumulated dark energy by no means was small. From what Austin could sense, this final attack might end the monster along the whole vicinity, engulfing the entire Xylex main palace.
That's why he needed to be sure of Kyouki's safety, and fortunately...
[Ding!]
[+300 Villain's Point]
[Host's presence has changed the Hero's destiny.]
A wild grin formed across Austin's lips as he read the system's content, signifying that Sicily had accomplished her job, and now he finally could let loose.
Halting his bombardment, Austin ascended in mid-air before calling out for the girl who was amusingly watching the battlefield with her oceanic eyes, never leaving Austin's figure.
"Luna."
"Yes, darling~."
"Created a barrier around the area. Don't let the aftereffect harm the city."
Luna nodded with a smile as she loves to be useful to her darling , before she obliged with his wish~
Austin sensing the terrifying use of mana from Luna, which she was utilizing for creating a barrier, sighed in defeat.
Focusing his senses to the front, he cracked his knuckles before he commenced the preparation of the spell, which would become an opening to a massive upcoming event.
'It's time to pay back.'
_________________
A/N: - Drop a comment~

chapters.title: Chapter 71: Onii-sama~1!
chapters.content:
"A-Austin...Isn't it a little too much...?"
Luna, who was previously having a little hangover from the overuse of mana, came back to herself after witnessing the absurd length Austin had utilized inside a single spell.
Not only did the condensed demonic energy he accumulated through his gluttony, but he also added his spiritual energy to form a single giant orb of nothing but raw mana.
It was a feat to accomplish itself, that Austin was able to channel the curse energy and keep it integrated along with his own spell, as the miasma was far greater for any human to endure and keep their calm.
The crimson demon wasn't able to move because of the ferocity he faced with the heavy showers of fireballs from Austin, and right now, its limbs were restrained with Luna's bounds.
But even if she didn't restrain the demon, there was no chance of it countering the thing Austin had formed in such less time.
The inside of the palace was dead silent itself since they knew death was nearing.
Many tried to run away, but the barrier Luna drew didn't only suppress energy from leaking out, but it goes for humans too.
Thannath's expression, by all means, defined hopelessness.
His eyes were entirely drawn upon the huge dark sphere which was hanging in mid-air just above the human; he never thought to hold much threat in the first place.
The Emperor of the Southern Continent, was informed that the hero of Gram was a potential carrying youth who was the only one in the past two centuries to have attained the blessing of the Goddess of Light.
There was talk about the Saintess, too, that she has transcendental healing prowess and has a great affinity with the hero that she even subdued a Terror Rank demon in her first expedition.
But the news about a monster living in human flesh, who solely took all the demons sent to Gram, was still fresh, so Thannath didn't pay much attention to it.
But now he regrets his carelessness...
'That damn Saint first and now this...Is this really the end for us...'
Thannath was expressionlessly looking at the dark sky, which was shadowed by the humungous orb of 10m measuring one end to another.
It goes without saying, that other than the Hero, Thannath has sent to Gram, no one in Xylex could face such catastrophe in the face of two humans who were shattering every expectancy and trespassing every limits a mortal should have.
Back at Austin.
Austin thanked Luna inwardly since she had been healing him and providing the blessing support, so he doesn't collapse due to the heavy amount of curse energy he has chanted.
Austin wasn't able to foresee this much details that the toll on his body would become this severe.
'It seems I have so much to learn from her..."
Adjusting his breath, the raven-haired youth looked at the colossal palace underneath him.
There were about a hundred soldiers and other nobles along with Emperor Thannath and the demon.
Austin indeed felt bad massacring these many people, but in the end, he didn't have a system of Righteous Hero, but of a Villain's
He knew he had to make a tough decision in order to fulfill the desire he had been pursuing since the time he found this system.
'I hope you get well with this, Saya...'
Muttering under his breath, Austin finally let go of the giant orb.
The ground shook violently, the air trembled in real-time, and the mana from the surrounding seemed to be shaken up with the sheer shockwave of this single energy bomb, was creating.
The eyes of most of those who were on the ground, shut down as they awaited the miserable death they had never thought of experiencing until this morning.
The crimson demon, who still had some of its human wits remaining, also kneeled on the ground with fear and hopelessness hazing its eyes as death neared.
Thannath, without any peculiar thought in mind and particular emotion on his face, sat on the chair that he generally used to watch the outside scenery, but now what he asked was his demise which seemed to be inevitable at this point.
'In the end, that guardian bastard never actually helped...'
When every expectancy of Xylex's survival seemed to fade out, something unexpected happened.
"!!!"
**SLIIIING**
**BOOOOOOOOOM**
The orb, which only had glided some inches down from its initial position, was cut in clean half before it detonated not so far away from Austin's front.
And not only that. Before Austin could have blasted away with the shockwave, something kicked on his torso with a strength that far surpassed his own.
"KWHAK!"
With a faint cry, Austin has blasted away like a beam of energy, before he collided with the barrier Luna has conjured around the vicinity.
"AUSTIN!!"
Luna screamed upon seeing such a shocking turn of events, before she activated her levitation to go toward him, only to be interrupted in the end.
**SWIIIIN**
The tip of a lean blade approached Luna's left eye, which she was able to block with her index finger, just an inch apart.
The holder of the blade was thoroughly shocked to be countered in such an effortless way; nevertheless, she didn't let her mind become fuzzy as she tried to pry the tip through Luna's skin.
The silver-haired Saint, who was already on edge after seeing Austin getting hurt like that, felt this woman was nothing less than annoying.
"I don't know who- Wait aren't you the..."
Luna's eyes widened in utter shock as she finally got a perfect look at the face of the woman who harmed Austin just some moments ago, and now she was trying to take life of Luna.
The woman didn't wait to hear Luna's words, before she slanted her katana and went for the nape of her target.
Luna sneered at such an attempt, as she held the blade before it could even have touched her, and clutched the metal hard enough to result in its crumble.
"!!!"
The beautiful raven-haired woman made a face of utter disbelief as she stared at her broken katana like she had seen her biggest nightmare.
"Like I said, lets tal-"
"You whore!"
**SLAP**
Luna, who was trying to have a decent conversation with the woman, was unexpectedly slapped on her left cheek.
The woman was huffing in rage as she stared at Luna like a prey which she could put an end to, any moment now.
With her head tilted right, Luna stared at the ground with her eyes turning lifeless, as she spat out the blood which gushed out from her tongue.
This was the second time she had been slapped in her life. The man who hit her for the first time, was already in grave. Now this second time, she was thinking no less compensation at all.
'I am sorry, Austin....'
_____________________
A/N:- Hey wait...I know this smell.
Oh yeah. Its time for drama muhahahahah!

chapters.title: Chapter 72: Onii-sama~2!
chapters.content:
[Luna's POV:]
Choices.
I had many choices in life until now.
Whether it was to pursue a simple lifestyle or give up on my humanity to attain power. To love a simple man and marry like a typical woman or pursue a man who walks toward trouble yet looks unbelievably adorable all the time.
I always chose confidently whatever seemed right to me.
But at this moment, I had rather trouble determining upon which choice I should resolve.
In front of me was the panting black-haired woman who was bleeding from various places due to the damages, which I inflicted just in self-defense.
I didn't know what came after I broke her blade, but she seemed to go berserk or sort. However, it didn't mean I would just take a hit from her, even though she was close to someone precious to me.
Now the problem where my decision wasn't reaching was what I should do about this woman.
She undoubtedly was the girl I saw on Austin's device, but the woman I am seeing right now, by all means, was older than the person I saw over the screen.
Well, the summoning spell is a part of Space and Time magic, so she might be from the future of the universe from which Austin's sister still wasn't healthy.
As Grandma said, Space and Time are the two of the most twisted topics which no entity has been able to unravel entirely until now.
Well, back to the present.
What was revolving inside my mind was two options.
First, I let this woman meet her brother and see my precious Austin smile in elation which he undoubtedly would direct at his long-lost sister.
Second, I kill her right here and now to keep my Austin for myself.
It goes without saying that this girl wouldn't be just a transient disturbance in our relationship. She is a very important part of my darling's life.
Since Austin hadn't seen her, most probably, and this woman also hadn't recognized her brother, I was the only bridge who could connect them.
So killing her wouldn't leave any damage to our relationship. Austin would never know what happened to his sister when he would be done with the system. And my life with my precious would remain happy and peaceful for the countless upcoming years.
This would be the best course of action. My Austin was only for me, after all.
I can't share him with anyone.
I can't see him smiling at anyone other than me.
I can't let his love get divided...
I want Austin all for myself.
Austin is mine!
AUSTIN IS MINE!!
"H-Hey you..."
Suddenly my chain of thoughts broke down as I heard the voice along with painful groans from the woman.
Tearing something silvery from hanging around her neck, she extended it toward me with her hand still quivering from the barrage of attacks she launched earlier.
"C-Can you give this to my Onii-sama, please?"
Wordlessly I took the thing from her, which was carved in a heart shape and seemingly looked like a pendant.
Clipping the center lock, a picture of a smiling boy appeared, which I very well knew was of whom.
With my eyes sparkling, I asked the woman.
"And why did you choose this as your last wish?"
Maybe, I was trying to find a reason for something I wouldn't accept. It might be the reason I saw Austin's past face that my mood elevated like this as I heard her answering my question.
"The reason I am alive right now. The reason I can *cough* move fo-forward each day is in your hands. My O-Onii-sama is everything to me. Since it would not be possible to see him again, I *huff* I want you just to let him know that I still love him..."
Saying so, the woman fell unconscious with her face flat on the ground.
Now, how was I supposed to kill her?
Portraying such love for the same person I love, in a way, made me happy since there was someone who acknowledged how great of a person my beloved darling is.
Even at the moment, which could be counted as her last blink before her death, she was trying to reach out to her brother.
Not to talk about Austin, who even try to hide but still look at his sister over his device in the middle of the nights or sometimes makes a face which evidently tells how badly he was missing someone dear to him.
Now, how was I supposed to keep these two away?
I know I would regret it or might hate myself for this, but this is the last thing I could land my resolve upon...
'I am so gonna regret this...'
___________________
In a place that was covered with natural greenery and sounds from varying creatures reverberating profoundly, could be seen two figures.
First was the woman who had long silver hair currently tied in a bun as she stared at the person cozily sleeping on her thighs.
The person whom she was giving her lap as a pillow was a blond youth who had a charming face adorned with very sculptural features.
"Mm. This feels nice..."
As Austin mumbled in his sleep while enjoying the comfortable thighs of Luna, the latter giggled in amusement as she saw the childish expression of her lover.
Austin parted his lids as he heard the beautiful giggle of the person whose voice he could pinpoint, even from a crowd.
"Luna! Are you fine?! Thank god, you are safe."
Austin instantly got up and hugged Luna in a tight embrace as the last thing he remembered was the collision with the mana wall before he fell unconsciously because of the effect he felt from the barrier.
Luna was startled by being showered with so much love, but she would never reject such gestures if it's from the person she adores.
"I am fine. Thank you for worrying about me."
Luna patiently waited for Austin to calm down as she patted his back to help him overcome his anxiety.
Austin kept clinging to Luna until he wasn't satisfied that what was in his arms wasn't a dream but reality. And a very beautiful one at that.
"You okay now?"
Luna passed him a water bottle after they kept on sharing warmth and assuring each other of their presence for a long ten minutes, before separating.
"Thanks. What about Xylex? Did you finish what we intended to?"
Austin gulped on the water after asking as, from what he could sense, there wasn't any barrier around the vicinity anymore nor any miasma emitting from the palace side.
Upon hearing Austin, Luna took a heavy sign like she was resolving something before she asked for something, which made Austin confused.
"Well, before that, I want you to meet someone."
Austin parted the bottle from his lips with perplexion evidently spread over his face.
"Are they someone special?"
"Well, you can say so. Come on; you will love this."
___________________
A/N:- Well, Luna's dark side was something you guys must have expected. Anyway, drop a comment.
And sorry for the short chapter. I will compensate in next one.

chapters.title: Chapter 73: Onii-sama~3!
chapters.content:
I love my big brother.
Since childhood, I have had very few friends, and in name of relatives, I did have cousins, but they barely talked with me straight-faced.
And given my introverted nature since childhood, I also never felt like growing closer to anyone except for one person.
He was a high schooler living in the same neighborhood, except for the fact that he lived alone. I was two years younger than him, so after getting acquainted while on my commute, I started calling him Nii-san.
He was a nice guy. He liked the band I used to hear, and also, he was a fan of the same idol group I follow. We quickly grew really close.
My mom, didn't like my Nii-san, because he was older than me and also he was an orphan, so she thought that my brother would be unruly and mannerless. So disgusting way of perception she had.
That's why me and my Nii-sama hanged out at his place. I sometimes gave him food, too, by sneaking out of the house since Nii-sama didn't have much money, and his part-time job paid significantly less.
Reading manga lazily to going to the aquarium. From cooking together to spending weekends. We were having the best time of our life.
These small things were more than enough to make me fall for him.
His caring nature. His carefree smile. His polite behavior. His adorable gestures started making my heart tingly all the time whenever he was around.
Even though I called him my big brother, I was already seeing him as a man.
I also planned my future with him, where I would make him stay home and look after our kids, and I go to a job to keep our lovely family happy.
I had my plans, and since I was confident in my skills, I knew I would mend my Nii-sama to enjoy life with me without turning toward any strange path.
But everything came down to hell when that day...
**KNOCK**
"We are coming in."
_________
As the black-haired woman heard the knock, the figure of a silver-haired woman who had captivated her in this cabin emerged from the other side.
"Why did you capture instead of ending me?! And if you really don't intend to kill me, then return my pendant right at this instance!!"
The woman growled as she tried to break free from the chain binders which Luna had conjured before leaving her in the small cabin in the forest of Xylex.
Upon seeing such a futile try to break free, Luna felt sighing, but she suppressed her weariness and spoke in an indifferent tone.
"Well, I gave it to someone."
The raven eyes of the woman went wide in disbelief as her face went to Luna's nape before she found that, indeed, the silver chain wasn't there anymore.
"W-Who did you give it to..."
Her mouth was wide agape, finding it difficult even to mutter the words that made her mind numb.
That pendant was the last thing that her Onii-sama gave her before she lost him and fell into a comma. If she were to lose that last piece of the memorandum, then there wouldn't be anything that could connect her with him.
But thankfully, Luna's following words made her calm down a little but soon baffled too.
"Don't worry; I gave it to its rightful owner, whom you wanted me to pass it to."
The woman blinked in quite a perplexion as she tried to find the meaning behind her words, and when she did realize what Luna said...another round of shock passed through her comprehensibility.
"You...ca-can't be serious."
"Then why don't you see by yourself."
Saying so, Luna made space at the entrance before a figure of a teenage boy appeared inside the room.
The first thing the captive woman noticed was the platinum blond hair adorning the person's head before her gaze fell upon his emerald orbs which were staring at him with a complicated look.
"S-Saya...."
The person whom Austin regarded as Saya, felt her senses betraying her since the silhouette she often saw in her dreams while she was in comma belonged to the man in front.
And not only that. There was not a single person whom she told her name after being summoned into this world. A foreigner knowing her name whom she had a complete doubt to be familiar with...
Her heart was going terribly anxious, passing each second.
"O-Onii-sama...?"
She wasn't even able to utter words properly because of the tears she was wailing up with. Her hazy eyes were soon filled with hot liquid, just like the person she called her big brother.
Neither of them noticed when Saya's bind disappeared or when the third person left the room.
Exiting the cabin, Luna sighed heavily as she tried her best not to go inside for the time being.
She knew if she was to see Austin near another woman, even if the woman was his sister, she might lose it with her current state of mind.
"Let's see where those two are."
Activating levitation, she flew away while tracking the mana signature of the hero and Sicily, who left the palace quite sometime early.
It didn't take her time to pinpoint Sicily's location, which was just on the other side of the bridge which connected the outer city with the palace.
Descending, she saw Kyouki getting treated by Sicily as she band-aid his shoulder, and helped him relieve his pain.
Luna sighed once again, and used her healing on the ragged hero before the two realized someone was approaching them.
"Luna-urgh!!"
Kyouki, who, after seeing Luna all of a sudden, energetically tried to get up only to feel the internal damage all over again.
"Stay still, since I won't be using my mana on you again."
Luna stated coldly, which made Kyouki speechless.
Sicily was facepalming at Kyouki's behavior, who couldn't seem to remain calm just upon catching a glimpse of Luna.
"So, what were those terrifying blasts some time ago? And what about Xylex and the demons?"
Sicily slightly shivered as the memory of Luna fighting the masses emerged in her mind, as well as the massive explosion she heard while running away with Kyouki.
"Well, everything was sorted out. Now Xylex won't take the initiative or, more like, can't. Anyway, should we grab something to eat?"
Luna proposed as she started walking forward, before the two also stood up steadily to follow her.
Both Kyouki and Sicily had a perplexed expressions on their faces as they blinked toward each other for a moment before Sicily asked the obvious.
"Umm, Luna? Where is Austin?"
Luna, without changing her expression nor her movements, spoke in a serene tone.
"He...he has went somewhere, but would surely return. Let's go."
______________________
A/N:- Next chapter would contain Austin's and Saya's conversation majorly.

chapters.title: Chapter 74: Onii-sama~4!
chapters.content:
"S-Saya....?"
"O-Onii-sama..."
Both pairs of eyes were staring at the person in front like this wasn't real but just a wishful imagination.
For Austin, there were countless things to contemplate upon.
Like, as how she could suddenly appear when Austin watched her over the phone, which the system provided. The Saya, which Austin watches over with surveillance, still belonged to his previous world; how did she come here?
And how was she looking so mature when in his memory, Saya was only a naive little child, which Austin loved to spoil?
But in actuality, Austin wasn't thinking any of the things he should be at this moment, since the person in front was making his comprehensibility go numb and senses blank to oblivion.
The woman walked baby steps just like the man but all of a sudden, Saya halted in her actions and raised her voice.
"No... It can't be. It's not real... You are not real. You can't be my Onii-sama..!!"
Tears were flowing down her cheeks as she cried her grief like she was pushed into a fantasy where her heart was shouting her to embrace the man and wail out all her sorrow, but her mind was warning her not to believe whatever her eyes spoke.
Her legs were shaking, with her heart going colder and colder passing each second as she closed her eyes and let the tears fall continuously.
All of a sudden, a certain warmth enveloped her frame, without her even noticing someone approaching.
Shooting her eyes abruptly, she saw the man who was feet apart was now embracing her.
"Shh..... It's okay. Nii-san is here."
"Let me go... You are not him! You are not him! Let me go!"
Saya was flailing her limbs while trying to push away Austin but taking her natural strength into account; she evidently wasn't trying to push him away.
Austin kept on embracing his little sister like a precious glass doll that would break if he was to apply a little force.
"You are..not... You are.. *sniff* Waaaaaaahhh!!"
Lastly, Saya surrendered.
She might not believe her eyes or heart, but this warmth. This warmth, she can only feel from a single person.
Letting go of all restraints, and bringing out all the accumulated suffering and longingness, Saya hugged her beloved Onii-sama, like a small kid clinging to their parents after being bullied.
[Ding!]
[Weekly requirements fulfilled...]
The system popped in front of Austin's retina, but in his current state of mind, he didn't bother with the message.
There were tears in Austin's eyes too, but seeing his sister's miserable condition he held back himself and helped her calm down first.
He didn't know how such things took place, and he was reunited with his long-lost sister, but there was no way he would complain since this unexpectedness was more than welcome.
In the cold wooden cabin in the middle of a dense forest, sat two figures while embracing each other like there was nothing left for them in the world and what they required was only each other's presence.
Saya cried for a long time, and Austin started to get worried. He helped her wipe her tears, and gave her water, so she doesn't dehydrate, but only after half an hour, she seemed to calm down a little.
It was a sight to behold, where a mature woman with an incredible figure was weeping like a kid while clinging to a boy much younger than her.
"You okay now?"
Austin asked as he arranged Saya's midnight-long hair and tied them neatly in a ponytail, just like he did back in the past.
"I hate you, Onii-sama. You left me all alone back there. Have you thought about what would have happened if I didn't get summoned here?"
With a slight smile, Austin replied.
"So is Saya going to leave her Onii-sama again, since she hates him?"
Saya instantly shook her head as she lifted her face to look at her Onii-sama, only to see his amused smile spread across.
"Mou~ Ani no baka!"
(A/N: - Brother's stupid)
Saya pouted before turning her head away from Austin.
Austin wasn't able to control it as he burst into a small laugh while patting the bullied Saya.
Hearing her brother's hearty laugh, Saya also smiled as if she wasn't angry in the first place.
Even though his face was different, his hairs were now dyed, or his eyes were painted in a different shade, she could still see her old Onii-sama in Austin.
His gentle care, melodious laugh, and tender touch were similar to what she was used to and desired to experience all her life.
"Okay now. Are you hungry? Should we get something to eat?"
Austin asked as he stood up while supporting Saya.
Once again, when she stood almost half feet taller than him, Austin noticed how much she had grown up in so little time.
"Hey, Saya... What age did you turn in this year?"
Austin asked, still unsure how Saya turned like this when he saw her teenage image on screen just half a day ago.
Another pout made its way on Saya's cheek as she complained.
"Onii-sama. Asking a lady about her age is no good!! "
"Ah, yeah. Sorry."
Austin apologized right away for his insensitivity; however, soon Saya smiled as she quelled her brother's query.
"It's okay, Onii-sama. And I am turning 24 this year."
Austin nodded as he thought of something for a long half minute before extending his previous idea.
"So, should we go out?"
Extending his hand, Austin asked. Saya blushed heavily before grabbing her brother's hand immediately as she nodded.
"Mm-mm."
Both of them left the cabin hand in hand, as the greenery entered their vision just upon stepping out.
From the sun's position, it seemed that it was about 2 in the noon as they started strolling through the forest while chatting about various things.
"So Saya. How did you get here? I mean, haven't you fallen into a coma because of your Terminal Illness?".
From what Austin remembers, the system alerted him about the completion of his weekly requirement, which meant that the Saya over his phone must have reached a state where she could recover all by herself.
Now, whether the system was conning him all along, or this might be some kind of time travel. And Saya's following words made Austin conclude with his second option.
"I did fall into a coma just after the day you... You left me. But in my subconscious mind, I always felt you were watching over me but with a different appearance. And soon, not so long after I got up from my coma, my illness disappeared like it wasn't there in the first place. You should have seen the doctor's reaction."
Now, he was certain that he Saya he used to watch over the screen was the same Saya he was witnessing right in front, but just the time has leaped.
'Time and space magic... It always makes me dizzy. '
"And what about your summoning? Did it happen just anonymously, or you were together with the other summoned?"
Like what he read in the manga, people generally get summoned altogether, but Saya's next words made him baffled.
"No, I don't actually know the others and where they came from. I was just told that if I want to meet my beloved then I have to step in the illuminated circle in front, and so I did. And now, I am glad I took this step."
Intervening her fingers, Saya confessed with a blush heating her face as it was really a dream-like scenario for her to be able to be with her Onii-sama, again.
Austin smiled at Saya, but his mind was rumbling around the last words she spoke.
The Xylex Kingdom was the one who summoned heroes and from what the interrogation stated, it seemed they used their divine beast's mana to activate the ritual.
But neither the beast nor the Xylex kingdom should be aware about Austin's past self or his relationship with Saya.
There were so many things to solve but anytime Austin thinks that he has unraveled a knot, a whole dozen new mysterious erupts from nowhere.
'There is someone or something working in the background, which I have to know about, as soon as possible... '
______________________
A/N: - Drop a comment~

chapters.title: Chapter 75: Sister meets Lover~1!
chapters.content:
On a clear day of spring, could be seen two figures currently flying through the sky while sharing a very intimate space.
Since Saya didn't know how to levitate, or as she pretended to, Austin was left with no choice but to carry her in the bridal hold, all the way toward the lower town so they can eat something.
Saya was hugging her Onii-sama dearly as she enjoyed the gentle breeze along with the warmth she could get never enough of.
Her eyes were closed in bliss, as she spoke in a melodious tone.
"Where are we going, Onii-sama~."
Saya had created a barrier around them which not only provided physical and magical protection but also gave them stealth along with enough silence so they could converse comfortably.
Even if she asked about the place they were moving to, Saya couldn't care less about it since she would be fine until her Onii-sama was with her.
Austin, who had a slight smile on his face, was completely unaffected by the space he was sharing with Saya, which made the latter a little disheartened, too, as he spoke in a serene tone.
"A particular hotel in downtown. Since you didn't usually leave the castle, you might like this place."
From what Austin heard from her, Saya generally stayed at the palace since she was bound with a curse that didn't let her disobey the orders of the divine beast.
Of course, it was removed by a particular saint; that's why Saya was fine even though she was leaving the main castle without permission.
Saya, after responding in a rhythmic hum, heard her brother continuing what he had left to say previously.
"...and I want you to meet someone special to me."
This time Saya didn't respond as her smile broke down instantly too.
Saya muttered under her breath as she saw her brother's gentle expression, which became even more charming just as he mentioned about someone Saya really does want to meet again.
'Now finally, you have pricked my interest, Saint~.'
______________________
While descending into a secluded alley, Austin asked his sister about something concerning.
"You sure no one would recognize you, right?"
"I told you, Onii-sama, I never left the palace usually, so no one knows that this face belongs to the hero."
Saya, even being dissatisfied, got out of Austin's arms as she assured him about her identity in the town.
Since there wasn't any issue with the capital spies now, Austin didn't use the herb and got out of the alley while still in his original aesthetic.
It was bound to attract attention when a charming foreigner boy walked on the street with an amazingly curvaceous and beautiful woman beside him.
Due to their height difference, one might misunderstand them as brother and sister, but Saya's timid demeanor so she could hold Austin's hand, made various doubts about this relationship.
But in the end, no one interrupted the duo before they made their way to their destination.
'Ramen and Miso Corner.'
The name of the shop made Saya's eyes sparkle as she followed Austin inside the restaurant.
"Welc-huh?"
In the middle of the musical welcome, the shop's owner halted suddenly, as her eyes fell on the customers just entered inside.
"Hero-sama?"
Akiko, the shop owner's eyes went wide in disbelief as she immediately shot out of the kitchen counter under the shocking gaze of others, before she bowed deeply in front of the duo, or to be precise, in front of Saya.
"I welcome you to my unruly abode. I might not be able to provide the best hospitality, but disappointment would be the last thing you will experience once leaving this place."
She nearly shouted her welcoming speech, which naturally the others, too, heard.
"Did the madame say, 'Hero'?"
"This can't be...that infamous hero...?"
"Her babies are big... I wanna feel them~*hic*. "
"This can't be possible for that* hero to come here, right? "
Whispers and chattering started to revolve at a furious pace with the tall raven-haired young woman, in the center of it.
"L-let's go in first. Akiko-san, please excuse the misbehave."
Leaving the still bowed Akiko behind, Austin pulled Saya's hand and walked in a rush.
Saya blushed slightly upon seeing how her brother protected her from the world despite being already able to destroy everyone present inside that hall.
Soon Austin led his sister inside the eatery, which was a little less to almost non-populated, with illumination on a dim level since special guests are only allowed to this section.
Naturally, the person whom the owner regarded as a hero wouldn't be interrupted by other maids; heck, they didn't even dare to come to light in fear of angering Saya.
Austin's eyes went toward the table where solely a woman sat while gulping on something like she had been thirsty since a very long.
His heart became calmer after catching her glimpse, but before he could walk forward, an olive-haired girl appeared right before him.
"Where were you, Austin?"
"Sicily. What happened?"
Saya narrowed her gaze at the mage warrior who was speaking to her brother quite intimately, which she naturally didn't like much.
'It seems there are more than one to handle... '
"I don't know where you went and who this woman is...but Luna seems in a terrible temper. She has been chugging down since forever even though she couldn't get drunk. Her unspoken agitation was so high, that even Kyou-kun had taken a strategic retreat. Whatever you do, please don't make her even angrier or we might not return home today."
As Sicily continued, in between Austin ran his eyes and indeed saw a small black-haired figure of a boy waving meekly at him.
**Gulp**
A strong gulp made away down his throat as he again looked at Luna and found that, indeed, her eyes belonged to the Saint, which he was used to glared with, before the ball night.
But he wouldn't back out now. In the first place, there wasn't any reason to be nervous since he and Saya had no such relationship nor any plan for having anything in the future.
But just to be on the safe side, he asked something from the girl in front.
"Sicily, can you create your best barrier around this hall, and also can you ask Akiko-san to evacuate the place."
This time Sicily gulped hard as her eyes went to Saya for a second, before she nodded in agreement.
"Best of luck, Austin. I hope you a great future."
"Thanks Sicily."
________________________
A/N: - Sicily and Austin can be good friends no? Anyway, drop a comment.
And yeah, since the next chapter would be long, I pardon for this one ?

chapters.title: Chapter 76: Sister meets Lover~2!
chapters.content:
(A/N: - Before you guys start the chapter, I want to clarify one important point. The fact Saya was behaving so oblivion about the world and didn't react to Luna's appearance is simple. She didn't read the manga. Now enjoy the chapter~)
-----------------------------------
In a tranquil hall which by, furniture and atmosphere looked like a cozy restaurant. However, the atmosphere around a particular table made breathing extremely dangerous.
On a separate table, sat Kyouki while sipping on his drink while glancing at the table in front, and some time toward his party member who was standing near the entrance.
The party member mentioned was the olive-haired mage warrior, Sicily. She had a very nervous look, tainting her slightly mature yet charming face as she stood beside the shop owner.
Akiko also had the same expression as Sicily since the time she heard about the outer covering of the matter.
For Akiko, Saya was a tremendously terrifying being who could blow mountains with one hit, and from what the girl beside her told, it seemed the silver-haired saint was no bad either.
'I just hope my shop survives at the end of the day. '
...
Back on the round table at the corner of the hall sat three figures with varying expressions on their faces.
Saya and Luna, were sitting just opposite while facing each other, with Austin to their side in between, while glancing at the two with a dry smile.
(A/N: - Like C)
It's already been more than a minute since they sat, but neither Luna nor Saya have broken eye contact with each other and staring like they were evaluating each other's worth.
Austin concluded that he had to take the initiative as who knows how long this staring competition would go on.
"*Ahem* Luna."
Upon hearing her beloved's voice, Luna broke her contact as her gaze turned to a complete abort, and with a softness blended in her eyes, she looked at him.
"Yes, darling~."
**CRACK**
The glass which Saya was holding cracked before it broke into small pieces; as she apologized right away.
"Oops! I just got a little careless. Anyway, carry on, Onii-sama."
Looking at her chilly smile, Akiko standing far away, broke into cold sweat since it was the first time she saw the hero smiling, yet it didn't give a single good premonition.
"Hey, did it hurt? Lemme see."
Austin moved with an antiseptic and cotton appearing in his hand as he checked Saya's palm.
**CREAK**
Another cracking sound came from his left before he heard another glass breaking sound which naturally came from Luna before he saw the beer mug in her hand disappear into pieces.
"Oops! I also hurt myself. Care to heal me too, darling?"
Austin felt sighing since now he realized what was going on.
He sat back without treating either of them as he spoke in a stern tone.
"Can I have a decent chat with the two of you, without these small banters, please?"
**SWISH**
Upon hearing their beloved's plea, both of them used a similar kind of spell and cleaned the place along with themselves before nodding simultaneously.
"Okay now. Luna. She is the sister I always talked about and the person who helped me survive my last life. I know I have already told you, but she is the only person I have ever known as a family. So please try to get along with her."
The expression on Saya's face was nothing less than ecstatic, as with a blush, she looked at her Onii-sama in a way that Luna by no means liked.
But she endured.
She couldn't act rashly here.
** Inhale **
** Exhale **
"And, Saya. This gorgeous lady is my lover, Luna Eldritch. Despite having so many options and routes she could walk upon, she chose me at that time when I was nothing more than trash. If someone understands your brother in this world, she would be the only one. I want you to respect and listen to her, just like you do to me."
A smug was adorning the not-so-mature Saint's lips as she directed her amused gaze upon the raven-haired woman in front.
"You call Austin your big brother, no? Then you might call me sister-in-law or maybe onee-san for convenience?"
A thin vein popped on top of Saya's forehead as she heard the taunt, which made her regret why the battle in Xylex's arena didn't go in the way she desired.
The unspoken cold war continued when suddenly a peculiar warmth covered the hands of either woman before they heard Austin speaking again.
"I know the way you guys hadn't a great start, and it's kinda tough to accept each other so abruptly, but I want you both to know that without you guys, I won't have been here where I am right now."
Maybe it was meeting Saya after so long or the insecurity he felt from Luna; Austin was speaking those honest thoughts he didn't intend to bring up.
"Onii-sama..."
"Austin..."
Both of them looked at his smile, which spoke more than words, as they whispered while altogether dropping the previous expressions they had.
Luna realized how she was avoiding Austin's feelings since he came inside with his sister, which made her utterly guilty.
That same goes for Saya, but she was more concerned about something she might ask him afterward.
"Okay then. From the looks, it seems Akiko-san won't be coming near our table, so I will go real quick and order something for us."
Just as he stood up, Austin kissed Luna's cheek, which the latter accepted wholeheartedly.
As Austin went toward the two ladies who had been looking at the scene with curious eyes until now, the table again went dead silent.
Luna's lips were curved in a full blooming smile as she fidgeted left to right in elation.
"Don't think Onii-sama called you his lover; I will allow you to be with him. If you don't know, then let me tell you this. I love my Onii-sama more than as a brother."
Luna's smile didn't break out as she replied with a nonchalant expression.
"Look into my eyes, Imouto-chan. Do you think I take you even as a rival? For me, you are nothing more than another pest I can trample upon and continue my life with, my darling, just like before."
There was apparent arrogance blended with provocation, in her words, as Luna stated in the utmost confidence. And her statement wasn't only barks, since she already had shown the might she carries and the love she holds for Austin.
But instead of getting agitated, a smirk came up on Saya's seductive lips as she muttered in a similar tone.
"You lost the chance, Saint. Now, if you get rid of me, do you think my Onii-sama would love you the same way he does now?"
Luna's smile broke down in an instant as what she heard from the minx in front was true. If Luna wanted to end Saya, then she already got the opportunity, but now when Austin has reunited with his sister, there was no chance for her to break this bond.
It would be disastrous if Austin came to hate her!
No, she might end herself if that happens.
With a sharp gaze, Luna asked in a crisp tone after imagining what she had never thought about previously.
"What do you want?"
"Isn't it obvious?"
With the smirk still spread across her face, Saya leaned back as she crossed her arms under her bountiful assets before she spoke.
"You won't come in my path, and the same goes for me. Until the end of one year from now, if I won't be able to make Onii-sama see me as a woman, and make him fall for me, then I will lead the role of a good sister until the very end of my life. But in this one year, you can't take him away, or I might not give up on him, ever."
Luna registered the word not long after it was spoken as she fell into deep contemplation.
But Saya wasn't generous enough to give Luna time to think.
"Ara~ Is it fear am I sensing from the almighty Saint? I wonder if my dear sister-in-law doubts whether her love is enough to keep my Onii-sama bounded~."
Luna's eyes went cold in annoyance as she threw all her worries and extended her hand as she spoke.
"Just one year, and after that, I will make you my bride's maid."
"Well, we will see about that~."
_____________________
A/N: - Two beautiful sadists are fighting, eh? Well, this is what I like... Hehe~

chapters.title: Chapter 77: Let’s go back!
chapters.content:
In the same hall where some significant decisions and agreements were concluded previously, sat the three while feasting on a similar kind of food.
Since, Austin knew Saya's choice in ramen, he asked for one and ordered a different flavor for him and Luna as well, since he took the liberty to be confident in his taste.
Akiko, prepared all the dishes by herself and also cooked something for herself, Sicily and Kyouki too.
Currently, these three were sitting just some table apart from Austin's group since they didn't want to be in the immediate danger zone yet couldn't leave the juicy conversation either.
"It's delicious, right?"
"It surely is. It's been so long since I have eaten garlic ham ramen~."
Saya said in a satisfied tone since, as just like her brother, she was a bonafide addict to ramen, and since she didn't mingle with anyone after summoning here, Saya regrets what she missed.
"You should say thanks to Akiko-san. She also is from Japan but from a different timeline."
While Austin waited for the food in the kitchen, he had a small conversation with Akiko which led him to know that Akiko belonged to the '90s, which was why she was utterly oblivion about isekai and stuff.
Upon hearing her Onii-sama, Saya turned her head toward the black-haired woman who also was looking at their side.
Just founding Saya's eyes, Akiko choked on the rice she was eating, as Sicily patted the pitiful owner for being so nervous.
"Well, I might hold the gratitude for now."
Saya spoke with a wry smile, as she continued eating her appetizing ramen.
"Ah, wait."
Since Luna was having quite a trouble handling the chopstick, she was clumsily making her lips and sometimes cheeks covered in ramen soup.
Austin helped her wipe up, since the saint was already having a hard time keeping up with the other two.
"Anyway, Saya. Have you thought, about what you will do from now?"
Austin would undoubtedly be in touch with Saya if she chose to stay in Xylex, but he knew that decision would be improbable, and Saya's following words clarified his doubts.
"Of course, I will follow Onii-sama, wherever he goes. Anywhere is fine until I could be with Onii-sama."
Austin fell into contemplation as to what ways he could let Saya stay in school. Given her age, she couldn't become a student of Eden Academy, and other than teachers, staff, and students, no one was allowed inside.
Sensing his obvious worries, Luna brought her hand over Austin's as she spoke after finishing her meal.
"Don't worry, Darling. I will handle it."
A smile made way on Austin's lips as he nodded contentedly.
"That reminds me, Imouto-chan.."
"Don't call me that!"
"..weren't you appraised Demi-God rank? How come while fighting you, I didn't feel you being above than a Legendary Rank? Or is it just you putting up airs before?"
Saya's eyes turned cold, but only if her brother didn't have spoken, she would have a gave a really great answer to this sharp tongues saint.
"Yeah, Saya. I am also curious about this Demi-God rank since this is the first time I heard that something between Hero and God exists."
Every rank has three grades. Above Unique rank, every grade of every Rank gets its specific name like; the third grade of Legendary Rank is called Saint class, in which Headmaster Merlin and Luna belonged.
Luna was certainly under-evaluated since she didn't want to gather attention. But to have another Legend Rank on campus would surely bring a lot of curious gazes toward her.
"Well, Onii-sama, truth to be told, I do feel I have a lot of potential, which I can discover as long I don't stop. My mana reserve is undoubtedly more than I store inside. But it's been only months since I came here, I didn't get that much time to witness my own limits."
It was miraculous in itself that Saya was able to become this strong in so less time since it takes a lot to get used to in this newfound atmosphere, and also, as easy mana usage sounds, it's definitely not is.
A new sensation. A new kind of energy. The summoning ritual might have provided support, but still, the level Saya has reached was still outstanding for someone to attain in so less duration.
If compared to raw strength, Austin would definitely lose to Saya, but Austin's fortè is in mana manipulation, in which he could easily leave Saya miles behind.
"Hmm, so you need just to enhance your skills and develop your foundation, huh? I think your physical might and weapon handling are going well, from what I have heard. As in for mana, then there is no one better than her."
Austin gestured toward Luna, who had a faint smile on her face, as she followed just behind Austin.
"Do give yourself a little honor Austin. You are also a brilliant mage who has come so far all on your own. I did have my grandma but you... You are a self-made warrior."
"Yes, Onii-sama. From what I heard, you single-handedly pulverized the whole army of demons, and also, you were able to chant such a high-level spell, which I.. Anyway, I know you are amazing, so do give yourself some credit."
Austin, upon being praised so openly, scratched the back of his head as he blushed slightly.
"Is that so? Thank you both."
A blush made way on the ladies' faces too, but it wasn't because they were shy or embarrassed, instead...
**GULP**X2
(A/N: - You know if you know ;)
_____________________
After finishing another round of ramen since a superhuman diet exceeds way beyond a normal appetite, everyone gathered in the main hall as they sipped on the tea which Akiko brewed for them.
"Can I have some tea leaves of these? I really like the taste."
"Certainly, Saint-sama."
Akiko nodded as she brought a kilogram packet of tea which she herself grows and sells in the market.
As Luna took the pack, Austin took out a pouch filled with gold coins, and he passed it to the owner.
"Here, Akiko-san. I think it will cover our food costs and also the inconvenience we provided to your guests."
Akiko shook her head and was about to decline such a heavy amount when a hand came on top of her shoulder.
"Take it, Akiko-san. You deserve it."
Akiko's blood went cold as she recognized whose voice it was as the hand which was pushing Austin's pouch suddenly pulled it.
"I-It's as you say, Hero-sama."
Saya smiled wryly as it seemed she had made Akiko terrified in the past, which led this temperament of hers toward Saya.
"Okay then, guys, it's time to go back. Remember what we have to say, and especially Kyouki, don't stir misunderstanding by following an honest path or sort."
Kyouki sneered yet nodded since what Austin had asked them to tell would be better for everyone.
"Very well, Akiko-san. Thanks for the hospitality; I hope to see you again."
As he concluded his thanks, Luna also got done with the teleportation spell.
Soon the scenery for the five changed significantly before the destination, which was, of course, set at Eden Academy, appeared not so long after.
But when everyone saw the sight in front, their eyes went wide except for Saya.
"Why do I feel I have visited this place recently..."
______________________
A/N: - There will be leisure chapters and fluffy chapters for some time along with intro of new characters and the arrival of new events.
Let's jump to the next arc~

chapters.title: Chapter 78: Is Hero Worthless?
chapters.content:
[A day ahead of present time]
"Alex Nuèye. Not only have you kept the fact of demons cooperating with the Southern Continent, but you also let Hero Kyouki-kun leave the academy. And if it was not enough, the summoned hero who appeared out of nowhere, you told her about our nation's pride, Saintess-sama's location, too. Can you give an appropriate reason for your actions?"
In an extravagantly decorated courtroom of Gram palace could be seen several figures with the bespectacled mage in the center of every gaze at the moment.
There weren't all the courtiers present currently, but only the high-rank nobles, along with the second prince Mikhail and, of course, the Emperor himself.
The chain of events that had been happening for more than a week now had made everything riled up. The war on the border finally ended with solely Charles left on the battlefield.
Gram lost thousands of elite soldiers along with a tremendous amount of resources. Still, fortunately, the entity with the surname Charles was way beyond any of the demons' capability to subdue.
The news about Eden academy was a great shock to the kingdom since they didn't have much preparation to counter such a high degree of war.
But the appearance of a single human, whom no one scaled more than a mere Newbie ranked previously, made a massive difference from what could have happened if not for the presence of this single blond youth.
Mikhail's chest was pumped with pride since his statement about Austin being an asset for Gram had been proven with this all-out war.
But the problem arises from the involvement of Xylex, which made this whole issue a diplomatic matter.
William's cold gaze was fixated on the court magician as he patiently waited for the accused to speak.
"With due honor, my lord, whatever I attained, I take full responsibility for it. The reason I didn't choose to inform the Council about Xylex's involvement in the matter was simple."
Without any change of expression, William, this time, spoke instead of the prime minister who spoke the accusations before.
"And that is."
"Trust, my lord. I don't believe everyone I share space within this capital. I feared that if any of the spies from the foreign kingdom was to know about the situation, then they might doubt our foreign relations.
