If I had, I would have kept this whole attack on Eden academy under the sheets since it might show Gram's vulnerability."
Gasps resonated in the court as the words concluded from Alex's lips. It wasn't just about his doubts about Gram's integrity but also the possible threat that might be advancing while they held this meeting ongoing here.
"I apologize for being rude here, your Majesty, but I would like to ask whether Court Magician Alex-sama doesn't trust on upper echelon or does he has lost faith in Gram entirely?"
The one who asked was a Count of territory near Gram, just like Vincent Wright. His query was justifiable, but it didn't make the audience any less shocked since the matter was leading to an internal conflict.
"Oh please, Count Snyset. Don't mend my words and make me a rebellion. What I mean is that I can't differentiate who is trustable or who is a bastard imposter in the council. In the case during the Northern conflict and also a student from Eden Academy betrayed his own comrades just for the sake of his love. I have not only two but many other past incidents which prove that not everyone in the capital is worthy of leaving our backs to."
Deep silence befell as Alex concluded his honest belief. What he said was, in a way, tangible to the current situation, but it didn't help that even one of the strongest nations wasn't safe from its own people's hands.
Suddenly the olive-haired duke stood up as he, after taking the permission to speak, raised another concerning query toward Alex.
"But still, your statement doesn't justify why you chose to speak Saint-sama's location to Xylex's hero when you were aware of the fact that Light hero-sama was together with her."
Gazes again fell on the purple-robed mage as they anticipated a good reason for such rash action, which could have led to Kyouki's death.
But even under so much intent, there was a smirk on Alex's lips as he confessed truthfully.
"Sooner or later, the hero from Xylex and Kyouki-kun would have faced off, and if Kyouki-kun doesn't have the might to protect himself, then is it really worthy of him being called the Hero of Gram?"
"Be within your limits, Court Magician!!"
"Don't slander the name of Hero-sama!!"
"He is only in his teenage. What do you expect from him!"
"Alex, you are speaking more than your authority!!!"
Various nobles stood up and confronted the Court Mage, but he had no interest in bothering with them.
Alex's eyes wandered toward the second prince, who was looking back at him with a subjective smirk.
The expression on Reynold's face was slightly ugly too, as in his mind, he already had accepted Kyouki as his son-in-law. But unlike those enraged Courtiers, he chose to think first since it's not about his daughter or his son-in-law's pride. What he cares about the most is Gram's prosperity.
"With your permission, my lord, I would like to ask Alex-san about what future prospectus he has thought regarding this matter. As for what I expect from the wise Grand Master Alex, he must have prepared everything already as soon he had observed the severeness of this situation."
Reynold spoke with a bow, on which William agreed without delay. The agitated Nobles also quieted as they received glares from the Prime Minister, standing beside the Emperor.
"I respect the trust Duke Reynold have in me. Well, it's just as he said, I indeed have thought of an idea. A new system which would not only help us find great assets which could prove as a strong Line of Defense for Gram but also help the public once again believe that our nation was, is and will stay strong even in the absence of the Light Hero."
Every attention was fixated upon Alex as they waited for his following words. The silence was so profound currently that even a pin drop would have sounded like a hammer.
Finally, after some moments, which felt like an eternity for others, Alex concluded his words.
"The tournament of Heroes."
___________________
[Present Time]
"What did you do to our school?!"
Sicily, as well as others, had similar reactions as they saw the disastrous state of Eden Academy.
Even though the war took place, the situation wasn't this hazardous. But right now, the Academy looked like ancient ruins except for the fact that people still could be seen moving in and out.
"Onii-sama..."
Saya tugged Austin's sleeves since she felt guilty for her actions.
Austin knew she was just following orders, so he didn't say anything, and squeezing her hand, he reassured her.
"It's okay. I will do something about it."
Austin was thinking about using his earth Golems to rebuild the castle and also supply portions and artifacts to assist the laborers, but Luna halted his train of thought.
"I have got this, Austin. Just stand here and enjoy the show~."
As Luna said with a smile, she began to levitate.
"Ah..."
It seemed Austin wanted to say something, but Luna already took off to a decent height as her figure grew distant.
Halting at approximately 100 meters from ground level, Luna raised her hands and initiated her spell.
"[Infrugent]"
Suddenly a vast magic circle which was illuminating with a silvery glow, covered the whole vicinity before the magic circle started ascending at a snail's pace from the surface.
It was undoubtedly a Time oriented magic, which was the reconstructing the school in real-time under the shocked gaze of everyone around the area.
Merlin, who was sitting in his office previously had his eyes wide in utter bafflement, but as soon his gaze fell on the person who was chanting such deity level spell, he returned to his work.
'It's fortunate she is on our side... '
"It's so beautiful."
Sicily uttered under her breath as her eyes sparkled with the glow that the mana circle was releasing out.
It only took less than five minutes, and the whole castle was once again rebuilt like how it was before the war commenced.
Cheers echoed from the inside of the school as well as from those who were working diligently around the perimeter.
But Austin's gaze was only fixed on the woman who was partaking in such a miracle before suddenly she started to fall from her spot just after she concluded the spell.
"She is spent."
Austin snatched his hand away from Saya, which made the latter utterly stunned, before he flew at a high pace and caught Luna just when she was about to reach the danger zone.
"Hey, you okay?"
Austin saw an ecstatic smile on Luna's face with a fresh blush covering her pretty face. From what seemed, Austin doubted whether Luna again was...
"Daaling~"
....Mana drunk.
____________________
A/N: - A tipsy Luna in the next ep, or should I skip it? Comment to let me

chapters.title: Chapter 79: Tipsy Luna!
chapters.content:
Mana Drunk.
A commonly known sickness in which a person overuses their mana which the person generally doesn't utilize. Like when you have a tank of water, yet you always drink with a glass, and suddenly what if you were to drink with buckets?
Until not very severe, there would be mainly side effects of a hazy mind, polluted thought process, and slow understanding of things. Some sudden emotions start to overflow more profoundly, which the sufferer generally suppresses.
Just like the one we could see right at the moment.
"Daaling~Am I beautiful?"
As Luna flailed her arms in Austin's embrace, the blond youth smiled sweetly toward his beloved as he walked inside his dorm room while still carrying Luna in the bridal hold.
"Yes, you are the most beautiful woman I have ever met."
Hehe, ~ Liar. But since I loved the way darling lied, I will give you a reward~."
**Chu**
The third kiss of the evening got marked on Austin's cheek as he slowly put Luna on the bed.
The ecstatic Luna fell on the bed with a blooming smile never leaving her face as she felt her darling feeding her something.
"Have some water first, Luna. "
He had a small container which he was extending toward the Saintess only to receive pouts in the end.
"Don't wanna~ Only if Darling feeds me. "
"But I am feeding you, right? "
Austin tilted his head in perplexion as Luna's pout bulged even more as she cleared the difference of understanding.
"Not like that, stupid. Mouth-to-mouth~."
Austin blushed slightly as these kinds of things were still new for him. It was the same for Luna, and she would have reacted the same as Austin if only for her drunken mind clouding her reality.
Finding no other option to get Luna to drink the water, Austin accepted his defeat before pouring down the content into his mouth.
As he leaned toward Luna, she giggled playfully.
"Ehehe~Austin no Ecchi! "
Austin's brows twitched for quite some moments as he saw the saintess having the best fun of her life.
'This minx.'
Austin grabbed her chin, and, forcibly parting her lips poured down the water, without minding the surprised gaze the oceanic orbs were directing at him.
He used his tongue as an anchor to let the liquid pass through her throat comfortably as he stared at her in the process.
Parting his lips from her, both of them panted slightly as this wild feeding procedure wasn't in either of their expectations. Austin just moved due to being provoked.
"Kyaah! I can't get married now! Austin tainted my purity. Now you better take responsibility for your actions, young master. "
Austin felt like saying that they had already partaken in various things more than kissing. Saying it took her purity would be nothing less than a laughable accusation.
But he didn't laugh but sat beside her before he started unbuttoning her shirt.
"Is daaling going to do this and that with Luna? "
The innocent face Luna put to ask while hiding the seductive smirk behind the covers tempted Austin to do something which would immediately pull her from the drunken state and throw her to oblivion, but he had something primarily to take care of.
Undoing the upper three buttons, Austin uncovered Luna up to her upper chest.
Her pale skin, along with cleavage peeking out from her hand-stitched bra, made Austin distracted for quite a long.
Her flushed face, along with the heavy breath she was exchanging, made her bountiful chest heave up and down in an unsteady rhythm. Not to talk about the air blowing out her supple lips, which seemed like hot steams puffing out.
"You look incredibly erotic, Luna. "
As Austin sighed to calm his raging heart, he took out an antiseptic, a knife, and cotton from his inventory.
"Is that so, darling? Well, I like when you are the one who feels like it. I feel proud of this body of mine when you feel attracted to it. "
As Luna expressed the thoughts she genuinely carried, Austin heated the knife before burning the venom which was plaguing around Luna's collarbone down to her chest.
It seemed the venom was highly toxic since, although Luna tried to negate its spread and effect, the mark and the outer impact were still actively working on her skin.
"It makes me look ugly, no? "
Luna asked without glancing down, nor did her facial expression change; even a heated knife was operating on her right now.
"Nothing can make my Luna ugly. Don't dare to insult my Luna; you drunk Luna. "
Austin complained playfully as he finished cleaning up real soon, and after applying the special antiseptic, he covered her with a band-aid.
As he was about to get up and get rid of his equipment, Luna hugged his torso, as after hiding her face, she mumbled under her breath.
"Darling."
Austin sensed the peculiar emotion blended in her voice as, with a defeated smile, he sat back and let Luna get comfortable in his embrace.
"Do you like that woman? "
It wasn't a mystery to know whom Luna was talking about since he could sense the insecurity Luna had been suffering from since Austin reunited with his sister.
"I don't think Saya is anything more than a little sister. I can't deny that she is precious to me as you are, Luna. But your place in my heart is unmovable. I love you and will do until my last breath, that's what I promised you before, and this statement hasn't altered the slightest bit. "
Austin's tone was unwavering, as well as his words which made the point he stated to feel more certain to anyone who would have heard.
"Then prove it..."
Austin raised his brows when suddenly Luna held her head toward him and said something which Austin wouldn't have imagined in his dreams until now...
"Tonight, impregnate me. I want to become the mother of your child Austin, and this is not something I am saying in a fuzzy mind since it's crucial for me too. So tonight, let's make a lot of love and give birth to a sweet little life. "
_______________________
A/N: - I know they both are teenagers but let me remind you, Austin was in his twenties back in his previous life, and as for Luna then, she is waaaaaay older than Austin. So don't complain and let the story continue~

chapters.title: Chapter 80: Austin being honoured?!
chapters.content:
"For whatever you have done, the help you provided, and also for saving my life, I want to thank you, Austin."
In the dining hall of Eden's Academy could be seen several students gawking near the eatery's entrance as a beautiful red-haired woman bowed in front of a blond youth.
Besides Austin, Luna was also present, who looked at the scene with an indifferent look since she didn't like how Venessa's temperament was shifting day by day for Austin.
The reason Venessa thanked Austin was legit since not only he provided assistance in the war, which they would have lost by every mean if not for his presence, but he also saved Venessa from the verge of death.
Austin had a thin smile on his face as he urged Venessa to quit the formalities.
"Let's end the conversation. I received your gratitude, so please join your friends."
Austin gestured toward the group of three consisting of Sicily, Kyouki, and Lilia, before he took Luna's hand and walked away.
It seemed that Lilia also wanted to walk forward and thank Austin, but she was too nervous to utter a single thing, so she stayed behind Kyouki's back with her gaze only fixated on her ex-fiancè.
It was strange, but Austin has changed in a way that makes Lilia believe that either the previous Austin, who always behaved savagely, was fake or he just have developed as in person after meeting Luna.
She leaned on the second possibility.
'It seemed you aren't the one unworthy of me rather... '
Halting her useless thoughts which she knew would lead to nowhere, Lilia along with the others, went to have her evening tea as they chatted about various things.
Luna, along with Austin, sat at the last dining table, which was devoid of students. Since due to the war and what happened because of Saya, almost 90% of the student have returned home for vacations, so the cafèteria was practically barren.
"Wait here. I will get something to eat."
Luna just nodded weakly since she seemed to be exhausted for some reason. If one was to look closely around her nape, then one might guess what activity kept her awake for 13 long hours.
Only after they were spent in various ways did they snuggle closely and sleep for only some hours before hunger awoke Luna around five in the evening.
Austin returned not so long after with two trays full of food which Luna liked.
Her oceanic eyes sparkled upon gazing at the delicacies as her previous grogginess swept away in an instant.
"Thank you for the food."
As she said, she grabbed the fork and instantly pierced it through some lettuce and pieces of grilled chicken pieces, and after dipping it in some peculiar sauce, she started munching it merrily.
"Yum~Yum~."
This side of Luna, who enjoys small things like she has been having the best time of her life, was only limited to Austin since she didn't like to show her real self to anyone.
Austin enjoyed the sight while sipping on his roasted bean coffee when suddenly the fork which was being used to feed Luna was extended toward him.
Austin accepted such lovely gesture as he also admitted that, indeed, the salad was excellent.
"We shared an indirect kiss, fufu~."
Luna giggled as she continued eating the other things, and also, in between several bites, she didn't forget to feed Austin too.
Austin being fed like this did feel like something a couple does, but he was more concerned about Luna's appetite, so he asked after the seventh serving.
"I can get myself something if I feel like it. So don't worry about me and eat."
"No... No... No. This onee-san ca-"
Luna was about to say something, which she usually does whenever she serves Austin in some ways, but her voice broke down because of something she remembered from the last night.
Austin was perplexed only for a second, but after seeing the reddening ears of the girl, he also realized what had come over her.
"What happened, Onee-san? Did you, by chance, remember something?"
"Don't say it, Austin!"
Luna was on the verge of tearing up as she hid her face behind her palms as the image of something embarrassing kept ringing in her mind.
"But I thought you like to take the lead-"
Austin was about to say further when he saw Luna's drooping gaze, which had small tears on the corner, as she tucked his sleeve in a cute plea.
"Please don't talk about it, Austin. I will die of embarrassment."
Austin's heart leaped as he saw such a vulnerable sight of Luna, which was very rare of her to show.
And as expected of a man who is weak to cute things.
He sealed his lips.
Thanks to the sudden change in everyone's movement around, the awkwardness between the couple subdued within a second.
The students, along with the cafeteria in charge and Kyouki's group too, stood up from their seats like someone prominent had entered the hall.
Only after, when the golden armored soldier appeared in front of Austin and Luna, they realized this sudden weight in the atmosphere.
Even identifying the bellman from the royal court, neither of the two stood up.
The messenger wasn't bothered by such misbehave as he didn't have the authority to point it out, so he carried out the duty he was bestowed to.
"Sir Austin. Your highness has summoned you to the Royal Court with the subject to extend gratitude for saving Eden Academy and providing assistance in difficult times."
"Okay."
"Eh? Yes, thank you for your time."
The royal messenger became baffled by such an instant response from Austin, but soon he coughed, and after bowing, he marched away along with the two soldiers who came with him.
Every gaze was fixated on Austin as being called to royal court was no joke. Even Kyouki only had been called once when he entered the Academy, but now someone who was previously disowned from his family was summoned before the Emperor.
It was indeed a memorable day.
"You nervous?"
As Luna sliced the honey bread, she asked Austin in a serene tone.
"Well, to be honest, no. I knew this day would come, when the first time, I decided to go into the limelight. What about you? Want to tag along?"
Austin felt what he said. He didn't have much expectation from Gram, nor was he hoping for something. He did everything to fulfill his desire to save Saya, and now, when everything was over, he cared about nothing other than those who were close to him.
"I want to see my Austin getting honored, but I won't be around for some days."
A frown appeared on Austin's face as he tilted his head in perplexion.
"You are going somewhere?"
Without turning her head, Luna answered with a slight smile.
"Yes. Grandma has called me."
_____________________
A/N: - A new phase.

chapters.title: Chapter 81: Farewell Luna!
chapters.content:
"Hey, Luna. Didn't you say that you consider your grandma as your sole family member?"
The unusually silent dining hall of Eden Academy, which was filled with not more than thirty students, sat the couple consisting of a charming blond youth and a beautiful silver-haired maiden.
Austin already had his fill from the serving Luna fed him. But Luna was far from finished as she asked Austin, to get her another filling of salad and dessert, which the latter obliged without any trouble.
(A/N: - A little spoilt Luna is cute too;)
Austin asked this after almost twenty minutes since the announcement from the envoy of the royal court. Luna said that she was summoned by her Grandma, which threw Austin into deep contemplation, resulting in this sudden query.
"Hmm..yeah, I did. Why do you ask?"
Luna finished the last fruit tart as she asked, even though she had some idea what Austin was thinking.
"I mean, shouldn't I introduce myself as your lover? If it's only okay with you to let me meet her."
Austin wanted to offer his formal greeting to the only person Luna dearly adores since he wants to take things thoroughly with her. But to become an unnecessary burden on Luna would be the last thing he wants; that's why he added the last phrase.
Luna saw through his worries and determination, which moved her heart and brought a smile to her face. But sadly, she has to decline him.
"I do want to let you two meet since you both are very important parts of my life, but sadly Grandma has only called me. Knowing her, I am certain she knows my relationship with you, but the reason why she specifically only called me is still a mystery. So sorry, darling. "
Luna held his hand as she apologized since this matter wasn't something she could bring Austin into. Until she wasn't sure what her Grandma thought about him, she couldn't let Austin come in front.
It wasn't about Austin's worth or anything related to it. Instead, her grandma has a twisted personality which even Luna fears; that is why she decided to keep things up to her for now.
"Is that so? Well, no problem. I will wait for her to call me so I can take you from her."
Luna's inner thoughts, which were turning a little heavy, lifted all of a sudden as she heard her darling confessing so boldly, which made her face lit up.
"...no fair."
"Hmm? You said something?"
"Nothing. Ah yeah, what about your system? The mission was accomplished, right? Did something happen after that?"
The time for weekly requirement would have collapsed today, but thankfully it was attained at times when Austin never expected it.
"It was filled when Saya recognized me as her brother. I don't know why such a thing happened and also...
As he said, his eyes went toward the system screen, which he brought up with a single command.
[System Evolving]
[83.85%....]
[All the Active skills would be frozen until the system doesn't evolve. Inventory would be accessible.]
"..it seems something is changing in the system. "
Austin was slightly worried about the skills he earned from the system, like the [Silent Mind], which always helps him keep his cool, but even if they don't return, he won't become vulnerable since his elemental trait doesn't derive from the system.
"Well, that's that. Since you don't intend to play villain, which I still think you never became, the system's concern is now fruitless. "
Austin narrowed his gaze, but Luna ignored it since she was confident with what she said.
But soon, he sighed in defeat since he knew Luna's standards were high, which he didn't want to attain in this field. Bringing his hand toward her face, Austin cupped her cheek.
Luna wholeheartedly accepted the caress as she leaned her face and enjoyed her favorite warmth.
"Are you leaving soon? "
"Hmm.Just some minutes. "
Another sigh left Austin's lips which Luna knew what was about as she parted her eyelids and spoke in a loving tone.
"I know you will miss me, so don't look at other girls. And until I return, don't venture into a strange place, okay? "
"Hmm."
"And don't forget to send me mana mail every hour when I leave. I will send you too. "
Austin raised his brows upon hearing the absurd request.
"Isn't it too much? Make it once a day. "
"No, at least once every four hours. And that final. "
Even her words sounded domineering, her eyes were moistened and finger pinching his shirt hem, like she was begging for it. Austin was astonished at how someone could betray their words by making such undeniable expressions.
Leaning forward, he closed his eyes and let his head connect to hers as he whispered their parting words.
"I'll miss you, Luna. "
"I'll miss you too, darling~."
________________________
"Waaah! Onii-sama is going to get a medal. I am super hyped for it! "
After Austin bid his farewell for a short period to his beloved, he walked to the dorm where Luna lived. Since Luna was practically cohabitating with Austin now, Saya was given Luna's room.
After Saya ate the food Austin brought from the cafèteria, he told her about the envoy and summoning message from the royal court.
Being an ideal sister, Saya was naturally thrilled to hear his brother being honored in front of others and his actual worth being praised.
"Well, I really don't like being the center of attraction, but since I am doubtful of something, I better check it out. "
Saya shrugged the severe kind of stuff his brother brought up as her whole attention was centered on the glory Austin would receive and how handsome he would look while wearing the formal clothing.
Wait...
"Onii-sama. Do you have that heavy and formal attire for the ceremony? "
Upon hearing Saya's query, Austin raised his brows, but soon he concluded his answer.
"No, I don't. "
Suddenly Saya's eyes sparkled as it seemed she had found the prettiest treasure right in front of her doorstep.
Holding Austin's hand, she spoke in an energetic tone.
"Then tomorrow is a date. It's a promise, okay? I am so excited~."
_____________________
A/n: - Some bonding time.

chapters.title: Chapter 82: Is Luna human?
chapters.content:
"The weather is so lovely~ Even the Sky God is supporting our date, Onii-sama!"
As Saya chimed while holding Austin's arm, the people in the surroundings glanced at the duo with confusion clouding their minds.
Saya was undoubtedly a mature beauty with a great figure equally proportionate, but when walking with the blond youth, she gave an impression of an older sister.
However, her spoilt behavior, along with the way she called Austin, made various wonder whether this couple was into some perverted play?
"Well, I am happy that you are enjoying it."
Austin wasn't bothered at all by what the others were thinking or the looks they received. Seeing his sister smile was the most he could keep his attention upon.
The market they came to today was in one of the Gram's cities, Seneur, under the province of Duke Snyset. This place was near the main capital and Eden's Academy, too, just like a junction. So Austin chose the place where he could reach using levitation in minimal time.
The marketplace of Seneur was famous for textiles and the delicacies it serves. And since this duo was interested in both specialties, this place worked as a golden coincidence.
The shopping district was in hustle even though it was only 10 in the morning. It felt like not only Austin got the idea to shop today, but various others were also preparing for something.
Most of the public came here in their carriage or royal transportation, signifying the grandeur of the shopping hub.
"Should we take a tour before moving to the clothes department?"
Austin proposed the idea, which Saya wholeheartedly accepted while nodding her head in a strong momentum.
With his forearm still being held dearly by his sister, just like she did in the past life, they both started walking deeper into the market.
Even though her appearance was different and also the aura she possesses now, these small gestures made Austin elated that even though so many things happened, Saya hadn't changed in person.
"What happened, Onii-sama?"
Finding her brother's eyes on her, Saya blushed slightly as she asked in fear that her makeup might have been unsightly.
"Nothing. I just realized that you still are my little Saya."
Upon hearing her brother's not-so-pleasant remark, a slight bulge appeared on Saya's left cheek as she subconsciously pressed her bountiful bosom on Austin's arm.
"Mou~ Calling Saya kid is no fair, Onii-sama. I am angry here, you know!"
The pout changed into the complaint as she now voluntarily tried to make Austin embarrass by pressing her breast until his arm wasn't engulfed in between them.
Austin was laughing at the sight as he genuinely didn't pay single attention to the warmth spreading on his arm; rather his whole attention was fixated on his sister's cute protest.
"Okay, Saya isn't little anymore. Come on; I think you will like it."
Saya, still being a little grumpy, followed her brother's lead before a paradise greeted her.
"Waaaaaaahhh!"
Austin bought something from the shop, which had a front counter.
From outer covering and texture, it looked like crèpe, which got better of Saya'a patience as she took the first bite.
"Mmmmm~Yummm~."
She was extremely thrilled with the soft cream filling along with the sweetness of fruit jellies and also the crunchy outer wrapper. It was just too good to exist.
Little did she notice the reaction of the people around, who got so mesmerized by the sight of a beautiful and charming woman enjoying the confection.
Slowly, the amount of customers started increasing as in to experience what threw the raven-haired into such an ecstatic state.
Fortunately, Austin was already done paying as he also bought one for himself, which had the fragrance of bitterness of coffee blended with the essence of vanilla.
'I can't tell what actually is it... '
Austin was about to taste it when he saw the current expression on Saya, which completely betrayed the face she had some moments ago.
"Do all girls like sweet things, or you and Luna are just the special case? Confection really does put you both in a good mood."
Saya blushed heavily upon showing such a childish side even when she protested against it some minutes ago. But she couldn't deny her love for sweet things; that was why she loved her Onii-sama too. He's the sweetest, after all.
"Don't put me in the same category as that woman, Onii-sama. Ah, by the way, where is she?"
Saya was happy that Luna didn't interrupt their date and stayed away for the time being, but knowing how crazy Luna is for Austin, Saya found it a sign of some hazard incoming.
"She...she has gone somewhere for some days."
There was apparent grief in Austin's voice which Saya also noticed, but she wasn't a naive girl to declare herself as a substitute for Luna. Austin would hate her if she said something like that.
So, Saya chose to ask something which she had been contemplating about since the day she reunited with her brother, in order to change the flow of conversation.
"Onii-sama...please don't mind if you don't want to answer, but can I ask what Luna-san's origin is. Like I am confident in my strength and especially when it comes to combat, but that day..."
Since Austin had his arm intervene with Saya, he could feel the shiver running down her body as she continued after a slight pause.
"She practically was toying with me. For the first time, I had to doubt whether I was living in the same world as this entity in front. I felt utterly hopeless, Onii-sama. Luna-san isn't just any mage, that's for sure, but I doubt how a single human can even hold that much strength altogether?"
"So you are suggesting that Luna isn't human?"
Saya's eyes went wide as it seemed her curiosity made her words utterly rude which led Austin to draw such a conclusion.
"I am extremely sorry, Onii-sama. I didn't want to say such a thing about her."
Austin wasn't upset in the first place, and truth be told, he also have thought something similar to what Saya just suggested.
But...
"Well, even if she is a human or not, I love her regardless. Luna is an existence who cannot leave my heart even if I have to face the whole world to stay by her side."
The shine in his eyes, the honesty of his words, and the determination in his voice made Saya a little sad since it wasn't directed at her, but she was proud of her brother nonetheless.
Saya does respect Luna since she carries the strength worthy of being the strongest and the love she holds for her brother. That was why Saya even accepted to back off after a year since she knew that if not for her, Luna was the only one who could make her Onii-sama happy.
"Y-You stop right there, big-booby demon!!"
A feminine yet enraged voice came from the duo's back which naturally gathered the attention of the others too.
Turning toward the source of voice after glancing at each other in perplexion, they saw two women standing there.
Austin knew one of them, as he muttered under his breath.
"Vanessa?"
_____________________
A/N: - Drama incoming.
And yeah for advance chapter: -
https://zetrotranslation.com/novel/isnt-the-wannabe-villain-too-cute/

chapters.title: Chapter 83: Mother-in-law~1!
chapters.content:
"Battle me, right here and right now! You hear me!"
As Venessa approached the brother-sister duo, she shouted at the top of her lungs with rage filling her amber eyes without minding the gazes she was receiving from the surrounding.
Austin raised his brows toward the woman on the back, who looked like the adult version of Venessa, as she seemed to calm her daughter down but failed pitifully.
Saya had a blank look on her face as she saw the little girl approaching her before she asked in genuine curiosity.
"...Who?"
Vanessa's steps came to an abrupt halt as a look of complete disbelief instantly dyed her face.
As soon she registered, the raven-haired woman just said, a thick vein popped on her forehead, with lips twitching in annoyance.
"Y-You!!!"
Before Venessa could have launched toward the arrogant woman in front, Austin came in between before anything irreversible could have taken place.
"Calm down, Venessa. We are in a public place. Not everyone is used to experiencing intent here."
As his word traveled, Venessa was pulled out of her stupor as she realized that, indeed, the marketplace was filled with a variety of people who might not be a mana-user.
Instantly self-reflecting, she pulled back the blood lust she had been drawing subconsciously.
"It seems you both know each other, so why not take this conversation somewhere private?"
Austin proposed the idea since it seemed she wouldn't let go of Saya this easily.
"Fine by me."
"Me too, only if Onii-sama is also coming. "
Saya was utterly unbothered and chimed like an energy ball, making Venessa irritated and baffled simultaneously. Not so many days ago, Venessa saw the complete emotionless war doll, but now the way Saya behaved seemed she was seeking her brother's attention.
'Wait, when did he become a brother of her...?'
Vanessa held the question to herself as she, with Saya beside her, started walking to the nearby cafè.
Austin turned toward the woman for the first time as he saw her sighing toward her daughter.
"It's an honor to meet Madame Elizabeth Charles in person for the first time. My name is Austin. Pleased to meet you."
Austin brought his hand on his chest before bowing slightly and greeting the woman he once saw in a book in the school library.
"You seem to know me. A warrior being interested in herbs is quite rare. Anyway, it's nice to meet you too, Sir Austin."
The reason she said so was simply the field in which she was famous. Herbs and potions were her fortè, and before marrying Charles Sinton, Elizabeth worked in the Eden Academy as a professor.
Without any further words, both of them exchanged a glance before they also walked inside the cafè.
Elizabeth, by appearance, looked gorgeous enough to stand out in the crowd with her long fiery hair, which was depicted like an actual burning flame, with a figure completely denying her real age, which was around early forties.
Both Charles and Elizabeth loved each other since their teenage even though they didn't attend school together, and only after they became well accomplished in their life make the decision to marry and have a child the very next year.
Various thoughts about how such a delicate-looking woman married such a burly man, but there are those too who thought of them as a perfect couple who compliments each other in various ways.
In contrast to the mature beauty both Saya and Elizabeth carried, Venessa was entirely shadowed as every gaze was glancing at those adult females every once in a while.
Unbothered by all this, the group of four took a table at the corner, which was slightly less noisy and comparatively less in the populace.
"Wh-what would you like to order, dear customers."
It seemed the midget waiter was intimated by the women as he stuttered those lines, which he practically pronounced a hundred times daily.
"I will take a coffee without sugar, thanks."
Austin made his request signifying how used he was to order the same beverage.
"Me too, same as Onii-sama."
"I-If she's going to order, then me too. Coffee, please!"
Saya orders the same thing to match Austin's taste and have same things in common. Vanessa's order was simply just to compete with her rival.
"No, Venessa, your stomach cannot handle caffeine. Mr. Waiter, put a simple chocolate shake for her and for me a cup of tea."
"Mama...."
Vanessa tried to protest as she sensed the sneer coming from the person opposite her, but Elizabeth wasn't in the mood to listen to her daughter at all.
"And you too, Saya. I remember you lose your appetite after drinking tea or coffee. So put a fruit juice for her. Thank you."
"Onii-sama...."
This time Saya pouted as she received a smirk from opposite her. But Austin as well, just smiled at her; however, he didn't have any intention to change the order.
In the end, the two silently accepted their guardians' outright rejection.
"So, how come you both know each other?"
Austin asked since he wasn't sure when Saya left the dorm or whether she had met Venessa before reuniting with him. He completely forgot about the fact that before meeting him, Saya came to Gram for her mission.
"I really don't know her, Onii-sama. I just have a vague recollection of someone cursing me with the same face as her."
"Rejoice that I was injured that day, or instead of a curse, I would have directed something more lethal that day."
"Yeah... Yeah. Whatever."
"Huh?! Are you taking me as a fool?!"
Seeing the rising temperature around the table, Elizabeth pulled her daughter before she could have jumped to fight.
"Calm down Nes. You still aren't properly well, so leave the fighting and brawling after you recover."
Vanessa didn't say anything just crossed her arm under her bosom and turned her head in frustration.
"So, you both are here to shop today?"
Elizabeth, to lighten up the mood, asked Austin, which the latter understood very well and answered with the same motive.
"Yeah, preparation for the ceremony. And what about you two?"
"We also are shopping for Nes' formal gown for the ceremony. Since it's her first time in the royal court, I plan to decorate my daughter like a doll."
"I am not going to dress like that!"
Vanessa protested, but the smile on Elizabeth's charming face told how lightly she took the plea.
"You are invited too, Venessa?"
"Umm... Yeah. And not only me but all those who contributed the most in the war. You didn't know?"
Austin slightly shook his head since he wasn't aware of anything about it. In a way, he was thankful that he wouldn't become the only piece of attraction in the court.
"Ah, that reminds me, Austin..."
Suddenly Elizabeth tapped on the table before the surrounding became utterly frozen.
Austin's eyes went wide as he sensed that other than him and the mature beauty in front, everyone was unmoving as time had halted for them altogether.
'Time magic barrier? '
Austin gasped in astonishment since all these things happened so suddenly that he never got the time to registered it completely.
Only did Elizabeth continue to talk did Austin come back to himself, but when he heard her, Austin's mind went blank.
"...when are you going to marry my daughter?"
________________________
A/N: - Dangerous mages popping out of nowhere. The whole plot has shifted and taken a massive turn. In some chapters, we will see a power boost in Kyouki and huge events unfolding.
Excited? Drop a commentt~

chapters.title: Chapter 84: Mother-in-law~2!
chapters.content:
"Pfft. I am just joking, Austin. Don't be so stiff."
It was fortunate that Elizabeth laughed off to clear the joke before it could have become a misunderstanding.
Austin was so stunned by her words that he completely forgot about the barrier surrounding them.
Even the crimson-haired woman laughed off the topic; Austin felt it an opportunity to clear the matter since he found the chance.
"Madame Elizabeth, I know it would sound rude, but -"
"You can't marry my daughter since you love someone else. I know that already."
Austin nodded just in affirmation and thanked the fortune that, unlike her husband and daughter, Elizabeth was quite understanding and cool-headed.
"First of all, I would like to apologize for my husband's irrational decision, which forced you into this relationship."
Seeing Elizabeth bow in apology, Austin became a little flustered since even though the engagement was non-consensual, being apologized by such a prominent figure was still over the top.
"Please raise your head Ma'am. I know under what state of mind Sir Charles took that decision, so I don't blame him. Also, Venessa and I already had a conversation about this relationship, so you don't have to feel burdened."
Austin spoke in a little hurry before Elizabeth finally looked toward her front with a warm smile adorning her charming face.
"You really are a nice person Austin, just like Nes told me about."
On just reflexes, Austin raised his brows toward Venessa before he muttered under his breath.
"She did? "
"Well, in the first four months of school, she told me that there's a perverted bastard she hates dearly, but in recent days, her statement has started to shift, Austin. "
Hearing her remark, which seemed genuine for some reason, Austin became a little surprised since Venessa might be the person from whom he had received the most Villain's Point until Luna didn't enter his life.
"Maybe my little warrior judged someone from their face value; that's why she came to know your true self after you saved her. But what can we expect from someone in her teenage youth? Anyway, Austin, I have a request to make."
Her voice was warm and subtle from the start as she told what she felt in all honesty. Being a good judge of people is something that comes from experience. That's why her daughter couldn't see what kind of person Austin was before.
In the end, her voice grew deeper and desperate as Austin also frowned slightly before nodding for her to continue.
"Can you just, for this ceremony, act as Nes' fiancé?"
Austin's eyes went slightly wide since he wasn't expecting such a request when Elizabeth just apologized because of the same thing.
But he wasn't impetuous to just outright reject her, so he chose to hear her out first.
"Can I know the reason?"
"I know this is nothing but just my utter selfishness, but I want to protect my husband's pride. I promise on my name, that once that idiot returns, I will make him cancel this engagement by taking full responsibility for this occurrence, but for just this social gathering, can you play the role of my future son-in-law?"
Austin, from start to end, heard each syllable and registered it accordingly. It wasn't tough for him to discern what she was protecting here.
To keep Charles' words which he declared in front of practically the whole Gram through the well-known figures of the empire, Elizabeth was asking Austin to act, which he never actually accepted.
If he would never have received the system or have met Luna in his life, he might have agreed to the request. But now...
"I understand what you just said. But I have to kindly decline your request since pretending to be your daughter's fiancé would make me feel like I am betraying the person I love. So sorry, madame Elizabeth, I won't be able to maintain this lie."
Elizabeth's expression visibly shifted, but instead of disappointment, it was more than she just did something horrible.
With her head slightly leaning down, she understood what she wasn't able to before.
"I am incredibly shameful for pushing you to the edge, Austin. It seems to be with that muscle head, I also have lost some sense of reasoning. In blindness to save my husband's pride, I never realized what boundaries I have tried to breach."
Austin again thanked God for conversing with such a thoughtful person despite having the surname Charles.
"It's okay, Madame Elizabeth. Since I know what heights one goes to in love, I can fully understand how you feel."
Elizabeth didn't respond immediately, but with a smile, she tapped on the table to dispel the barrier as she spoke something which she only was able to hear.
"I hope I can find someone like you for my daughter as well, Austin."
_______________________
At the same time, in a faraway place which was covered in the pitch white of snow, could be seen a figure of a teenage girl walking through the cold blizzard, but completely unbothered by the weather.
This person was none other than the one who was bestowed with the title of Humanity's hope and the famous Saintess of Gram, Luna Lastov, or currently Luna Eldritch.
Luna was presently in her birthland since her Grandma strangely called the meeting place in Aurora.
Finally, after reaching a certain distance, Luna's eyes sparkled in a cyan radiance before she could figure out the illusionary barrier surrounding the vicinity.
With a smirk forming on her pale yet beautiful face, Luna chanted the Dispell before a gateway was created for her to breach inside.
If any other barrier had faced her Dispell, then it might have disintegrated without leaving a trace, but this barrier wasn't conjured by just any mage.
'Woah! '
Luna's eyes sparkled as the scenery inside the barrier was too good to be true.
Since she had seen only pitch white after entering the Northern Territory, and until the time she found this place, the greenery inside the barrier made Luna gasp in admiration.
Not only that, even a lake was formed in the middle of the place, with some creatures roaming in and out of the forest while observing the intruder in their world.
The atmosphere was so calm and serene that the first thing that came to her mind was...
'I must come here with Austin next time. '
Her train of thought came to an abrupt halt as she felt mortal danger approaching her with a furious pace before she elevated in the air and dodged whatever came from her back.
When Luna's eyes fell on the thing which passed from the place where she was standing, she sighed in defeat.
"If thrown with the intent, even a leaf can become a lethal danger."
The voice from her back made Luna enthralled since she very well was aware of whom it belonged.
Turning enthusiastically, Luna saw a woman in her early twenties standing in mid-air just three inches apart from her; even her voice sounded so distant just now.
But she wasn't surprised by it all, as the cold and indifferent Saintess jumped in her grandmother's embrace just like any other normal child does.
"Grandma!"
"Ah, I missed you so much, Luna."
_______________________________
A/N: - Sorry, for the short chapter. I will prolly compensate in the next one.
Drop a comment if you liked the chapter;)

chapters.title: Chapter 85: The unknown entity in the shadows~1!
chapters.content:
[Luna, 's Pov:]
When I was six years old, I came to Gram for the first time in my life, and also, it was the first time I left the castle which made me suffocate the most.
As I remember, it was the tenth birthday of the second prince Mikhail, for which the three of the neighboring continents were invited to the central Empire to celebrate the big event.
I wasn't enthusiastic about it since I wasn't sure what I was getting dragged in. I mean, what could you expect from a six years old child? I was already happy to see the greenery and new kind of people as our carriage moved for days and nights toward the Golden City.
(A/N: - Gram is also called the City of Gold because its palace is made up of nothing but gold.)
But on the route toward the capital, an unexpected occurrence stirred up the situation and also my life from then.
A horde of nomad monsters engaged in a gory battle in which Northern Emperor, Norsvolk had also to cross his blade in the end.
I was frightened when the defense started falling out as I got out of the carriage since anxiety was clouding my reasonability.
I still could vaguely remember the scene which was unfolding before I ran away in the jungle as a loud eruption also started flaring from the battle side for some reason.
As I remembered, none of the monsters were capable of causing such massive explosions, but somehow the battlefield became a sea of flames before I lost sight of where I was heading to.
I was too scared at that time. It was my first to see such brutality, after all. I was naive to believe that the world was a fairy tail where my prince would rescue me at times of trouble, and we would get a happy ending.
But nothing goes how one desires them to.
What happened afterward, I couldn't remember. Some animals were chasing me, and my uncontrollable tears and the fear I felt were only hazy in my memories since something more prominent of that day have deeply engraved in my remembrance.
The meeting with my grandma.
She came into my life as an unexpected support which helped me again to stand up and face the reality.
I didn't know where I was or what had happened to my father since I met grandma, nor I actually cared. The space where we both were, simply defied a general human's comprehensibility.
But since this was far greater than the palace where I lived, my chicken-sized mind chose to stay with grandma and listen to more stories she had in store.
I thanked that I was less calculating at that time. That's why I was able to accept the middle-aged woman quite easily.
Well, there was something that made me connect to her.
Our loneliness.
Even though she said to stay for some days with her in that unnatural space, I never imagined it would end almost a hundred years.
At first, I only ate, slept, heard stories, and repeated. But soon, I started playing with the mythical creatures inside the jungle. And without me realizing it, I was getting proficient with mana even though I didn't have officially awakened at that time.
I wasn't aware that I was growing up since my body was still the same, but from what Grandma told me when I left her, I actually trained my mana along with the creatures for more than ten years.
How absurd it sounds; I actually just cultivated mana and regulated it through each cell of my body in the span of one decade.
Once I started getting aware that something was wrong with the compatibility of my mind and body, I was thrown by my grandma into rigorous training.
For the next fifty years, Grandma did nothing but forge me into a warrior. I still can remember how days and nights passed when I was given tasks. Sometimes I fought unknown things for days in order to accomplish my goal, and sometimes I got beaten down until I fell on the verge of death.
Grandma was ruthless, and so she was making me too. And for some reason I didn't hate that.
I was aware that as time passed and I accepted the unnatural mana of the place, I was losing my humanity. But it seemed the incident which led me met my grandma left a great impact on my mind since I thought of the outside world as nothing but filled with brutality and blood. And that belief helped to never stop.
Without even a moment of boredom, hundred years went by, and I was completely ready to face the world which I had created my fear against.
But little did I expect that the outside world was still the same as I left it...
_________________
"Someone is smiling quite a lot today."
In the same forest where Luna came to meet her Grandma, in the Northern Empire, sat two women under a humongous towering tree.
The older one was currently braiding Luna's long silver as she saw her granddaughter smiling wordlessly.
"I was just thinking, what would happen if I tell Austin my real age."
Luna was at least had that much faith in her love, that Austin wouldn't hate her if she told him what the difference between their actual age was.
"Don't be silly, girl. That guy is completely drowned in your love. I doubt if there's anything related to you that can make him hate you, now."
Luna smiled with her eyes unfocused as the image of Austin's smiling face came into her vision as she thought about what he might be doing now.
Another reason for her happiness was her acceptance from her grandma for Austin.
Luna took a whole night to tell her over-protective grandma how reliable and caring her man is and how much they love each other. Fortunately, her Grandma had already accepted Austin as her grandson-in-law before Luna's arrival.
"You think so?"
A blush made way on Luna's cheeks as she asked what she already knew. But to hear that Austin is crazy for her would never be enough for her.
"Of course he is; otherwise, who would have ignored such lovely temptation when you aren't around."
Luna's eyes went slightly wide as she turned toward her grandma, only to see her eyes shining with illumination, which made her realize what the heck actually was going on.
"Grandma, stop spying on him!"
The Sakura-haired woman smiled heartily to see such a reaction from Luna before she disconnected the channel.
Looking at Luna's troubled expression, which her grandma undoubtedly knew what was about, she spoke in a meek tone.
"You want to know?"
Luna averted her gaze when she realized that she had been found out. But in the end, the shy maiden in love couldn't endure, as she asked in a small whisper.
"Yes."
"Fufu...Don't make that face, Luna. He is pretty much ignoring his sister's temptation like a pro and also has rejected a proposal that genuinely has impressed me."
Despite being curious about the proposal thing, Luna decided to hear it directly from Austin, as she sat back with a full-bloom smile on her face.
"You really love Austin, don't you."
Luna didn't reply, just kept her face drowned in embarrassment with a shy smile not leaving her lips.
But suddenly, her grandma spoke something which made the atmosphere grow heavier, and her mind went blank at once.
"But Luna, I want to warn you something related to that boy. I fear that maybe you might have to leave him one day."
"!!!"
__________________________
A/N: - This chapter will continue from this point. The day Luna met her grandma would get a side story since it contains significant relevance to the main plot.
Until then✌️

chapters.title: Chapter 86: The unknown entity in the shadows~2!
chapters.content:
Third eye.
An ability that has the potential equivalent to the depth of oceans. But as it suggests, one could only dive until they don't suffocate.
This is an inheritance skill that allows users to foresee the future. Enable them to surveillance specific surroundings according to the user's capability. Also, it works as a top-notch appraiser. There are various other use of Third Eye which the mage warrior Sicily and also Luna's Grandma carries.
There are very rare cases of someone possessing Third Eye since, as stated earlier, it is an inheritance which the bloodline could only carry. Thievery and transplant were never an option.
Now what, Luna's grandma saw in her vision about Austin. And what made her suggest that Luna should stay away from her love for her own safety, was yet to be told.
---------------
"Gr-Grandma?"
"I know how you are feeling, Luna, but please hear me to the end."
The middle-aged woman calmed her granddaughter as she saw Luna panicking as soon those words left her lips.
It was understandable from Luna's reaction that being apart from Austin is her worst nightmare. If anyone had said it, Luna would have ignored them or might have shut their mouth forcibly.
However, these words weren't spoken by not just anyone but her own grandma, whom Luna couldn't ignore.
Nodding her head, Luna sat while facing the woman as she heard what she never was aware of.
"It wasn't the first time I have spied on that blondie, but the first time, I still couldn't forget about it."
Luna frowned severely as she heard the all-time cheery grandma speaking in such a profound tone.
"There is a shadow roaming on his whole presence. Since his birth, this presence having a close watch on Austin. Not only that, the reason why Austin has been misunderstood since quite early in his life is also because of that strange presence. It seems that the dark existence can manipulate others too, to think that whatever the blondie does, is with evil intent."
Luna's eyes were slightly narrowed with minimal space between her brows as she heard each syllable of her grandma and registered it accordingly.
Luna already had done a full body scan of Austin at times when they were in Xylex, but she never found any kind of curse or invisible artifact present on him.
Suddenly, the sakura-haired woman dispelled an illusionary spell from her left hand, which burnt her skin until it turned into wrinkly dark matter.
"Gr-Grandma th-this...?"
Luna's eyes went slightly wide as she saw the change in her grandma's perfect hand, which undoubtedly came from the effect of something severe.
'But what entity could hurt... '
Luna was unable to discern since, in her perception, her grandma was currently the strongest being she had come across.
"That thing is commendable more than I thought. Do you remember the incident when the Terror Rank demon suddenly erupted during your first expedition?"
Luna nodded twice since it was a memorable day when she and Austin came closer.
Upon seeing her nod, the woman continued.
"It wasn't spontaneous. It was intentionally awoken by force. And also the red-haired girl, Charles' daughter... What's her name...?"
As she pondered to find the name, Luna filled the gap hurriedly.
"Vanessa."
"Yes, Venessa. That girl had her thoughts turned complete 180 that day because she was under the serious effect of that thing attached to Austin. Not to talk about Austin's parents and also the Gram's Emperor himself."
Luna's breathing turned slightly heavy as she, one after another, found the answers to those questions she was never able to unravel, until now.
Her eyes wandered aimlessly for a second as she joined the knots which were missing until now when her grandma continued with her previous explanation.
"Thankfully, I countered that thing for the time being. Our battle was quite tenacious, and I also got this ugly scar because of it, but in the end, it was settled."
With a shine of hope rising in her oceanic eyes, Luna asked in an optimistic tone.
"So, did you end its existence?"
The woman sighed upon seeing her granddaughter's expression as she patted her head before a disappointing answer left her lips.
"No, not likely. I just pushed it into a dormant stage. But I feel like the shadow had backed off temporarily on its free will and would again overwhelm people around Austin at the most vital point."
Luna's heart was throbbing wildly as it seemed that the unknown entity was compelling enough to even rival her grandma. It was indeed becoming a situation where she didn't have her reach.
If the people surrounding Austin hurt him because of the strange shadow thing, then Luna cannot fathom how far it would have gone if she didn't come into his life.
How far would he have suffered? How long had he stayed in pain and let others judge him wrongly?
Luna didn't want to even think about it. Not now, not ever.
He has her now. She won't let him see any darkness until she would with him. Not on her watch; anyone or anything could hurt her darling.
"Grandma, is there anything to counter this piece of shadow shit?"
" Well, you carry my essence. Being around him is hefty to keep that shadow weak, but Luna, I want you to decide this carefully."
The look on the woman's face turned more severe than any time as she held Luna's hand and asked in a serious tone.
"Following that boy would lead you to a great catastrophe, and at the end of those events, the world might be seeing you both with hatred. There might not be any place to run since every single person could be on your back. Despite knowing this, are you sure you want to be with him?"
"Yes, I do."
Luna's answer came so abruptly that even her grandma's eyes went slightly wide in astonishment. And not only that, the sheer determination and resolute demeanor covering Luna's aura signified how certain she was with her decision.
"You said Austin is drowned in my love; then I am not any better, Grandma. I also love my Austin to the point where life without him makes me shiver in a fret. Even thinking about such a future where I couldn't see his smile, or feel his presence around makes me terrified. I don't know when it happened, grandma, but before I could stop myself, I already was madly dwelled in that man."
The older one liked the non-hesitant confession as she nodded affirmatively. She was undoubtedly proud of her granddaughter.
But there was still something she needs to fulfill.
"If that's your decision, I must provide you with my greatest support. So how about a decent training session, my dear Luna~."
Luna's shining eyes faded in an instant as she heard a specific word before a hard gulp passed through her throat.
"Please go easy on me, grandma."
________________
In front of an extravagantly decorated and shining palace stood a handsome blond youth with nervousness evidently plastered on his face.
The passing people were glancing at Austin once in a while since he was looking extremely eye-catching right now.
A long coffee-shade coat with a white shirt inside it and ankle-length formal trousers of of the same shade as coat, made the youth look charming and slightly older than his actual age.
His usual messy hairs were now combed with a specific gel keeping them in their place. With his natural emerald eyes complimenting with his blond hair along with the formal attire made Austin the center of various attractions.
But the slightly dense Austin felt that his sister had made him a fool with such makeup and get-up, that was why he was getting glanced upon.
'Should I just go back? '
As the thought came in his mind, someone suddenly called him from the back.
"Aren't you, Sir Austin?"
___________________
A/N: - Drop a comment~

chapters.title: Chapter 87: Austin being an Escort?!
chapters.content:
"Aren't you, Sir Austin?"
Turning on reflexes since Austin had never sensed anyone coming this close to him, his eyes found a girl not older than him, standing there with a bright smile adorning her face.
She was about an inch shorter than Austin with shiny platinum blond hair over her head, tied in a proper braid. Wearing a beige shade gown, the girl looked extremely adorable, just like a doll, with her fluffy cheeks adorned with a slight flush as she gawked at Austin like she was witnessing something marvelous.
Austin became slightly awkward being seen like an antique, as he asked in a neutral tone.
"Yes, I am. And who you could be?"
Since the ceremony has already commenced, given the slow music flowing from inside, there weren't many people left near the entrance, where these two were standing currently.
Upon hearing Austin's question, the girl's eyes went round before she smiled subjectively before introducing herself.
"Sorry for the late introduction, Sir Austin. I am Tiara der Gramduör. First princess of Gram and also a big admirer of yours."
Austin's back straightened as he learned her identity before formally introducing himself.
"Sorry for being rude until now, Your Highness. My name is Austin. Please to meet y- eh? Admirer?"
Austin's words broke in half as he raised his head with perplexion currently spread on his face. In the fluster of greeting a royalty, he registered Tiara's words quite late and so reacted accordingly.
Hearing such a late response, Tiara broke into a small laugh.
"How amusing you are, Austin-san. And yes, I have been an avid admirer of you for a not-so-long time."
Austin tilted his head slightly to the right since he never understood what made her admire him in the first place. Austin never liked the spotlight. That's why he did everything using Kyouki's name except for the war against the demon on the Academy's ground.
He was pretty numb-minded at that time.
So being praised by such a prominent figure made him confused.
"Me?"
"Yes, you, Austin-san. There are so many reasons that it will take a looooot of time for me to tell you. So why not we discuss it over tea sometime in the future and go inside first?"
Austin wasn't sure whether he would meet this princess again or not, so he just nodded casually, and as she walked up to him, Austin turned toward the entrance.
"Are you nervous, Sir Austin?"
The curious voice, which was devoid of any hidden intent, came from the princess as Austin halted before responding.
"Well, not now when I talked with your highness, strangely."
Speaking of his honest thoughts, Austin was about to ask Tiara to lead the way when she entangled her arm with his and marched forward without minding Austin's perplexed expression.
"Y-Your Highness, wait!"
Despite looking frail, the princess walked with such force that she pulled Austin up to the red carpet taking advantage his bafflement.
"Knowing your personality, I knew you wouldn't have escorted me, Sir Austin, but when we are already under so many gazes, will you really leave my side and let my name get shamed off?"
The princess whispered with her sapphire eyes shining in innocence.
Austin's lips twitched since he felt like snatching his hand away from this plotting minx. Still, as she said, indeed, various people have already watched them, so being disrespectful here would only become a pain.
"I will take this honor as a gift from my avid fan, Hime-sama."
The princess just giggled in response as she saw the troubled expression on her escort's face while they entered the celebration hall.
The choir was playing very calming music with the bright lights spread like a beautiful sheet.
People were chatting in a shallow tone to maintain the decorum of the hall as they sipped elegantly on their drinks.
The lighting, the decorations, and the exquisite-looking people made Austin blinded for a second before he lost when the person beside him disappeared.
Well, even though he noticed, he was somewhat relieved.
Standing in the middle of the hall, Austin felt a bit out of place as he walked with quiet steps toward a corner; he took a glass of fruit beer while he tried to fix his gaze on the blinding surroundings.
'As I thought, it was a bad decision. '
His train of weary thoughts came to a halt as he sensed someone approaching him from his left. Turning his gaze, he found an extremely beautiful girl he was acquainted with walking in his direction.
Her crimson dress was complimented by her amber-shade hair, with the one-piece dress adorned by her sculptured body. Her curves moved in the best way a woman could portray as she made her way beside Austin.
"You came alone? Where is Luna?"
As Venessa asked with her eyes focused on the front, she secretly calmed her heart which seemed to beat slightly faster after seeing Austin in his current appearance.
"She has gone to meet her relative. What about you? Isn't Kyouki around?"
Celebratory event without a hero was close to impossible when it concerns Eden's Academy, so Austin's question wasn't baseless.
"He came with Sicily. See..there they are."
As she gestured with her eyes, Austin saw a couple consisting of a handsome black-haired youth and a charming girl who was chatting with others in quite a harmonious mood.
"They blend with people, quite comfortably."
Austin sighed as the words leaked in slight admiration for the two since what he was bad with was his social skills. The lack of normal interaction with high-class people made him someone who instead prefers to disappear in a crowd rather than become the centerpiece of their attraction.
"Well weren't you a noble before? These kinds of social gatherings must be quite normal for you, no?"
Vanessa's question was legit since before the ordeal during their first expedition, Austin was a proud son of Count Vincent. But even before that, he barely attended any gatherings since his parents didn't want to introduce him to many people.
Reason. Obvious.
But he wasn't going to bother telling such details to the girl, so he just countered with his own query.
"Isn't it the same for you? Sir Charles's social status is equivalent to an Arch Duke. Why you're in a corner with me?"
A blush erupted immediately on her face as Venessa glared quite timidly toward the blunt-tongued guy beside her.
But soon, she gathered her thoughts as she sighed in defeat and decided to speak truthfully.
"Well, you can say, on the battlefield, I am pretty a big-mouth, but these kinds of events just make me feel heavy. Like I don't belong here. Sometimes I feel everyone is watching me, and sometimes I feel lost even with many familiar faces around. Hmm....now I realize I am pretty strange."
Austin, from start to end, felt Venessa wasn't describing herself but reading his personality and pouring them into words.
With his eyes slightly wide, he looked at her for quite a long half minute before he responded in a serene tone.
"Well, you aren't alone who thinks like that. I somehow can relate."
Vanessa just hummed in response before silence befell in between them.
The music was still flowing across the hall, with slow chattering along with occasional clinking of cutlery resonated as these two stood silently with no words traveling in between.
Suddenly with her eyes unfocused and mind wandering in a strange direction, Venessa muttered under her breath.
"Hey Austin, can you tell me something honestly?"
Austin raised his brows for a second before answering in a neutral voice.
"If only to a certain extent, then yes."
Vanessa inhaled deeply before she asked something which she had been contemplating for a long time now. The thing which has made me quite muddled and guilty about.
"Were you always like this?"
_______________________
A/N: - Should I continue this chapter from this point or should I just skip the event?

chapters.title: Chapter 88: Farewell!
chapters.content:
"I can't really tell what you are referring to."
In the brightly lighted ceremonial hall inside the main palace of Gram could be seen several prominent figures conversing comfortably as the choir bestowed the hall with their calmest notes.
The event was organized to celebrate the memorable victory over the demons on the Gram borders as well as the overwhelming conquest on the war field of Eden Academy.
Both of those events were quite tenacious and something which would be remembered in the golden history of Gram, where a war Veteran and newbie student protected the place they call their home.
Those who have provided their aid in times of catastrophe would be honored by the Emperor of Gram himself just after the celebration.
Amidst this crowd and their slow chatting stood a pair of the incredibly bewitching amber-haired girl along with a handsome blond youth.
Hearing Austin's question Venessa sighed slightly as she knew Austin was aware of what she asked. But since he tried to play it safe, she wouldn't remain in her shell anymore.
"I mean the current you. The Austin who the world is looking upon now. The Austin who fights bravely in his battles, and instead of words, who shows the might he holds in his arms. The Austin who had spoken so gentlemanly these days with me and the one who has shown such considerable behavior. Were you always like this, Austin?"
Austin was genuinely a little taken aback by so many heavy words all of a sudden. He did have a hunch about what Venessa tried to ask with her prior question, but still, she had so many things in store...
Not to talk about, Venessa's lack of conversation skills was the prominent feature that made her most popular after Luna in the manga Austin read in her previous life. Her being so talkative was startling in itself.
Collecting his thoughts, he replied after a long pause.
"Why are you interested in knowing it?"
There was no obligation for Austin to answer her, but when they were having a normal conversation with no way of him running around, it's better he prolonge it until the main event doesn't commence.
"Well, you don't have to answer if you don't want, but I want to know whether the way I behaved with you, the curse I voiced, and the behavior I showed. I want to know whether I was doing such things with the current Austin?"
"And will that make you guilty?"
Austin's answer came so sudden that Venessa became slightly startled as it took her time to register his words. But in the end, she has resolved to speak truthfully, and so she did.
"You can say that, yes. I will be less burdened if you say that you changed over time; rather, you have been the same ever since. I know I will sound hypocritical, but I do respect who you are now, but your previous self would still repulse me."
Vanessa's every word were spoken consciously and after a thorough contemplation.
After what she had seen in the war in the Eden Academy and have heard about Xylex from Sicily, her admiration and respect toward Austin have indeed reached the point where she might not look him in the eyes while talking.
Austin was aware of Venessa's inner storm of thoughts, but he really didn't want to drag this conversation nor any further relations with her.
"Just think I never changed. It will be beneficial for both of us, Venessa. We both don't have anything to do with each other, then why not we live in our own worlds?"
His words were straightforward and slightly rude. If any other boy had stood beside such a gorgeous girl, then these disheartening words would be the last thing they would have said.
But Austin wasn't tempted with her beauty nor her interest in him. For him, Venessa was still the same as she was before. Just the intention to gain points from her has vanished.
Vanessa took a long pause as it seemed she was collecting herself after hearing out Austin's words. With her voice slightly heavier, she tried to speak in a serene tone.
"Flowery words aren't something I generally prefer but right now, I would have appreciated it if you had just lied to me. Anyway, Austin..."
Suddenly with a smile adorning her face, Venessa turned toward him, and so he did before she extended her hand, which Austin took reflexively.
"Even though we had a bumpy ride until now, it was nice meeting you."
Austin was unsure why they were shaking hands and why it seemed that Venessa was about to cry, so he just nodded in the end before Venessa left his side.
Austin's eyes were focused on her, distancing back as without breaking a word with anyone else, even some of them called for her; Venessa left the hall like she had just lost something.
Suddenly his own image, when Lilia broke the engagement with him, flashed in his memory, and for even a second, he felt he should follow her. But in the end, he didn't.
'I hope she gets normal by tomorrow. '
With a sigh, Austin sipped the remaining fruit beer. Little did he know that tomorrow would bring such shocking news, not to him but to the whole Eden Academy.
____________________
A/N: - Am I the only one who felt bad for her?
Anyway, I am really sorry for the short chapter but adding anything extra would be lighten up the significance to the main scene. I hope you guys are liking the story so let me know in the comments~

chapters.title: Chapter 89: The Guardian Deity!
chapters.content:
"Ah, grandma, I forgot to tell you something."
Under a humungous 30 feet, dense tree sat a pair of otherworldly women as one of them caressed the beautiful hair of her granddaughter.
It's already been two months since Luna came to meet her grandma, but in the real world, only been two days.
During these two months, Luna trained in those fields in which she was either unaware of or was weak compared to other areas.
Luna, as usual, got immense in training to the point that she read mana mail of Austin after a day of its arrival. She just loved to train, and when she's at it, she forgets the world.
Fortunately, her grandma was kind enough to remind Luna to reply to the mails so her lover doesn't get worried. Coming out of her battle freak temperament, Luna regretted a lot and sent him a lot of love in apology.
To her, Austin is her foremost priority, but whenever she dwells in insane battles, she just loses focus from reality and gets lost in the chaos.
Currently, after a thorough yet small training session, the duo sat leisurely under the tree when Luna suddenly remembered something she had to tell.
"Hmm?"
"Actually, when I was threatening the Xylex's emperor...umm...I forgot his name. So when I was giving him the ultimatum, suddenly, a voice reached up to me."
The older one didn't interrupt her granddaughter even though she realized whom Luna was going to refer to. With a hum, she asked Luna to continue.
"That voice was creepy and carried a very intense mana presence, even if it was just a voice. That voice referred to me as Celeria's descended and told me it would come after me whatever it takes. I wonder why it called me such? "
Luna knew what she was saying so causally was a matter to concern about. The name which was attached to Luna by that voice wasn't just any name.
But Luna wanted to ask her grandma to tell herself about it rather than her asking it directly.
After a short pause, the older woman spoke in her naturally soothing tone while running her slim and pale finger across the platinum falls.
"Are you aware of the seven deities who protect the seven divisions of lands?"
Luna, without thinking much, nodded.
It was an elementary grade knowledge that every continent has its Guardian Beast protecting the piece of land they have voluntarily formed millions of years ago.
The mythical beast who has taken charge to look over Gram is the strongest of the seven, or to say, he is the only being who can even rival a God.
Gram's backing isn't just the hero or the resources which the ancients have left. The Guardian Deity doesn't appear so normally, but if a catastrophe-level threat befalls Gram, the world knows what being would arise.
"The voice you heard belongs to one of them and a very idiot one at that."
"Well, I figured that much from its words but Grandma, why did it mention the Guardian of the North-Eastern continent, Eleanor?"
Luna had complete knowledge of what she had just asked, but since her grandma had opted to hide this fact until now, Luna would let her do the honors instead.
Her Grandma was very well aware of her beloved's tease, but she also thought it was best for her to take the lead now.
"I know it's late when we have spent so much time together already, but Luna, I am the guardian deity of Eleanor, Celeria Eleanor. And the reason you were called my descended is simple. You carry the mana I have imbued inside you slowly through the training. And don't worry about that lecherous deity; I will make him pay in the most vital times."
The glint in Celeria's eyes was dangerous enough to make Luna wonder what kind of divine punishment would be bestowed upon that specific being.
But in the end she didn't care since her goal in Xylex was just to make her darling's reach wider. She knew she wasn't on the level to rival a Guardian until now, but until her grandma was on her back and Austin by her side, she could face any danger in the world.
'Gosh! I miss him so much! '
_______________________
Back in Eden Academy, the talk about the honorary ceremony was in full blow since there were students involved in it, and also the rumors about Austin being spotted with the First Princess.
The second topic was majorly gossiped about since Austin had been secretly gaining a lot of followers along with more haters.
