Being paired with the idol Saintess wasn't enough, and now he was also hagging the princess, and rumors were that, an incredibly hot black-haired woman had been secretly dating him.
Many people have been planning to get proof of Austin being with other women and showing it to their goddess(Luna)and set her free from the Wolf's(Austin) claws.
Amidst the hot gossip, a piece of certain news broke out that the famous warrior of Eden Academy who left the ceremonial hall yesterday, even without receiving the honor, has dropped out of Academy.
Someone said, that this morning Venessa was seen in the principal office before she left the school premise without any expedition given.
She was also not seen dining around breakfast or lunch. Her seat was empty during classes, and most of all, she was absent from practical training too.
It was more than enough to flare up the rumors of Venessa leaving the school, but the point was, why?
Why did such a brilliant warrior who fought so well in the war and had a bright future ahead with the path she was walking upon suddenly leave the school?
"Kyou-kun, has Venessa really left the academy? I didn't find her at the dorms."
During the tea time, two girls of similar age entered inside the meeting room, which Kyouki and his party members shared.
As Sicily came inside, she asked Kyouki in a slightly hurried tone since, just like Lilia, Sicily was extremely worried about Venessa's whereabouts.
Kyouki was sitting on the meeting table with his gaze fixed on the drowning sun, as wordlessly he extended a paper toward the duo.
Perplexedly, Sicily took the paper as she along with Lilia, started reading the content.
[Hello guy, I hope you all doing good. Umm..you must have found that I have left the Academy this morning. Sorry, for not meeting you all before leaving, but I knew I wouldn't have taken this step if I had met any of you. Don't worry; I am not going like for forever but for some months or maybe years, who knows. The reason I am disappearing so suddenly is to either become strong enough so I can face myself in the mirror or get eaten by some strange beast, hahaha. Anyway, I wrote a lot already, so goodbye for now. I hope we meet again sooner than later. See ya~."
"K-Kyouki-kun...this? "
Sicily's eyes were damp as she read until the very end, and Lilia was no better. Both of them had tears blurring their vision as they looked toward Kyouki in the hope of finding some answers.
Kyouki sighed before he got up from the table, and after leaning his back against the wall, he spoke in a neutral tone.
"Vanessa has taken this step to prove, not us or anyone but only a single person, that she is worthy to stay by his side. "
"Don't tell me... "
Sicily's eyes were wide as she covered her mouth with the other hand. Disbelief, blended with shock, covered her expression.
Lilia's eyes fell slowly to the ground as she also realized who was the person for whom Venessa had taken this challenging path, as a sense of admiration and awe erupted inside her.
"Vanessa has taken the step for someone else, but isn't it okay? At least she is trying, but I am just playing around. "
Sicily got out of her stupor, but there was no way for her to calm Kyouki now since he had been frustrated about this matter for very long.
Rather she chose to take another approach this time...
"Kyou-kun, even though we are only three now, let's do our best and become the strongest. "
Lilia also stepped forward to encourage Kyouki.
"I agree, Kyouki-kun. Let's do our best together. I know Venessa-san would also want us to become strong so the next time we meet, we can walk shoulder to shoulder with her. "
Seeing his partners being so considerate toward him, a smile broke out on Kyouki's face as, after a slight pause, he also spoke in a spirited tone.
"Okay then, let's do our best and show this world what's the real might of Hero's Party."
____________________
A/N: - It really pains to write cliché dialogues. Anyway, I will write Venessa's monologue before the time she came to this decision, in a separate side chapter.
Drop a comment if you are hyped~

chapters.title: Chapter 90: SS4- Venessa’s true desire and ambition!
chapters.content:
Austin Wright.
A name that has been in my mind, willingly or not, since the first day I entered the prestigious Eden's Academy.
I had a lot of dreams, a lot to pursue, and the Academy would have been the first step toward the greater future I envisioned. So I decided to spend my three years in the best way possible by learning many things and making reliable connections.
But just on the first day, I saw a haughty and arrogant noble behaving like a scumbag and talking vulgarly to his fiancee.
I wanted to get over there and beat him to a pulp since I hate those people who boast about their background, but in actuality, they are nothing but gutless weaklings.
Fortunately, there was a young student just like me who took charge and punched the blond noble right in the face.
I was satisfied with such results since I carry the same emotion as the man who became my friend real soon after orientation.
Not only Kyouki-san but the scumbag's fiancee and also my old friend Sicily joined the team.
There was also a girl in our group who mingled in the group affairs the least, but she was a good person, so we got along somehow.
Everything was going fine. Our party was training together, developing together, and before I knew it, I was already falling for the person who was bestowed with the blessing to become a hero.
Primarily, I only looked at Kyouki-san as a rival since his, and my fighting style was very similar, but soon, my rivalry took the direction of what one pronounces as love.
But my maiden feelings didn't become an obstacle in my training, and as things were going, I would have become the person I once dreamt of. Someone my papa could feel proud of and someone who could walk beside the hero.
But my life took a massive turn during the first expedition the school sent us to.
It was a massive event since we had a goal to turn Luna back to what she actually was before she suddenly got intrigued in Austin.
But one thing led to another, and we suddenly saw the rise of a Terror Rank demon in the jungle, which for the first time made me realize how it felt to be helpless.
Unexpectedly it wasn't our party who handled such catastrophe, but the person whom I only regarded as trash and coward until now.
That was one heck of a day of my life when I repulsively took some heavy shit decisions, and in the end, I had to apologize to Austin for blaming him for something he never did.
It turned out that Luna wasn't cursed either, and Austin's sudden change in temperament was because of the relationship they had built-in, so less time.
Kyouki-san was depressed, but in the end, he couldn't turn someone's feelings for him. I, Sicily, and Lilia had complicated feelings about such development, but there was one thing I realized from the expedition event.
Austin isn't the same as he pretended to be.
He wasn't weak or gutless as I always thought since even standing in front of Terror Demon takes a lifetime of courage, yet not only did he stand before that creature, he also defeated it single-handedly.
After that day, my perception of Austin changed from hatred to curiosity.
Slowly I realized how differently he could behave when Luna was around. Like he was a totally different person. I doubt whether even Kyouki-san could treat someone like Austin gentlemanly behaved toward Luna.
And not that he also ceased the vulgar acts he used to perform.
Austin was a changed man.
Soon, the Northern Empire incident took place when my anger toward Austin started igniting again, but the gap between Austin and me at that time made me realize that it doesn't matter what I think anymore.
He was getting far as I only moved at a slow pace.
Maybe in the consciousness of chaos, my rivalry shifted toward Austin since he was able to nearly defeat the person I thought was the strongest in the world. My papa.
One thing led to other, and I was getting more and more eager to know about Austin.
I still have my heart for Kyouki-san, undoubtedly, but for Austin, I was getting immense in him even without letting him know.
The war which happened in the Eden Academy and the way Austin saved me, triggered something inside my mind, and since that day, I came to know that I was lying to myself.
I never loved Kyouki-san, actually. I just adored and respected him since he came from a small town and rose to such a position.
So was I in love with Austin?
I didn't know, and I didn't want to find either.
Just my feelings were getting entangled day after day as I thought of him. Maybe I was a greedy bitch who loved only strong men, but sometimes I felt that if Austin had stayed weak with his current personality, then I might have been stayed by his side and protected him?
Well, I knew thinking such things were fruitless now.
Austin had such an otherworldly Luna, and he clearly told me I wasn't his type of woman. Heck, I felt whether he even saw me as a woman or not.
I had made plans that if not by his side, then at least I could be any help to him in the future, and while staying in Eden's Academy, I couldn't grow to such length.
I had to take a more significant step.
But for the last time, I wanted to meet the person who had made my mind a mess for a long time now.
If someone's appearance have made me baffled to the point where I felt the world disappearing around me then it was also because of the same unfair guy.
Austin was looking extremely dashing in the ceremonial hall, almost like he was making it difficult for me to leave.
Even though I put on the make-up for the first time and wore such a revealing dress, Austin didn't look at me for more than a blink.
Well, I was expecting this since someone beautiful as Luna and charming as the woman who called his big brother was fawning over him. In comparison to them, I felt my scars and stiff muscles a little embarrassing, but it's not like I would attract Austin even if I looked a little more womanly.
He might hate someone like me.
I didn't want to have a depressing talk with him since I was leaving the academy already, but in the end, I couldn't hold myself and asked what had been weighing on my mind for a very long.
I was interpreting my words like I was trying to uplift my guilt by knowing whether Austin was the same as ever, but I never imagined that Austin would conclude this talk in such a way.
"Just think I never changed. It will be beneficial for both of us, Venessa. We both don't have anything to do with each other, then why not we live in our own worlds?"
I realized what kind of fool I was to muddle in a world where I never belonged to.
How selfish and ugly a personality I have to approach the person whom I have shamed so much.
Why did I say such a thing and put Austin in that place where he had to remind me, we don't belong to each other.
He was different from me.
He didn't need me...
I am nothing to him...
I knew it but hearing for him...
....it hurts a lot.
My feet were moving out of the hall with my mind blank like I had lost something today.
Someone like me...was dreaming to....
I can't even laugh at myself, but at least Austin made me realize where I stand.
I did feel hopeless for some time after coming out of the palace. I even cried after such a long time, yet I never lost hope that I couldn't bounce back.
I am a warrior, and a warrior knows the best how to stand back after being forced to the ground.
I know I was acting selfish again by leaving my friends and family behind, but if I don't take this step then, I might never be able to see myself in the mirror.
Stubbornness?
Yes, I was being stubborn that one day.... at least for even a second, I will make Austin proud of me and get the look that I have only seen directed toward someone else.
Maybe, it will all go in vain, and I might lose something precious in the process of my journey, but who cares.
Warriors are famous for being muscle-head, and I am taking advantage of being such.
'Wait for me, Austin. I will become worthy of being with you. '
__________________
A/N: - I don't know if you guys liked the chapter since it carried no development toward the plot, but I felt Venessa's thoughts must be displayed since she has a vital role in the story.
You might see Venessa being contradictory in this chapter, but that's how I wanted to portray her thought process.
(This slightly unedited so sorry about that ?)
Well, drop a comment~

chapters.title: Chapter 91: System 2.0!
chapters.content:
[Ding!]
Hearing the loud ringing voice inside his head, Austin's consciousness slowly started to wake as he frowned slightly before lifting his back with his eyes still closed.
Unlike the gentlemanly looks he adorned in the ceremony or the aloof Austin everyone sees in the Academy; the current him can make many girls fawn over his child-like appearance.
Unlike the other noble kids, Austin didn't like to wear robes and cardigans while sleeping, so he put on the tailor-made pajama, and coupled with the slightly swollen face he had now, Austin seemed truly like an adorable child.
The notification from the system had halted since the time Austin fulfilled the weekly requirement by reuniting with Saya before the system went under development break.
Hearing the mechanical ring once again after what felt so long, Austin didn't help to hold his curiosity as, while rubbing his eyes, he called the system in a grumpy voice.
[Ding!]
[Villain's System 2.0]
[New features: -
1. Quest tracker
2. Level evaluation
3. Emergency Retreat]
[Status: -
Name:- Austin
Level: - 48
Age:- 15
Race:- Human
HP :- 2800
MP:- 5500
Str:- 1350
Spd:- 1250
Stm:- 1000
Attributes:- Flames(99)
Wind (83)
Aqua (64)
Earth (78)
Spirits(22)
XXXX (0)
Skills:- Infernous Conjuror (A)
Gravity Manipulation (A)
Silent Steps (B)
Sprint (A)
Pain Infliction (S)
Tongue of Spirit(SS)
Dark Escape (B)
Silent Mind (A)
Indefinite Leap (A)
Chaos of Destruction (SSS)
Stats Points:- 845]
Austin stared at the screen for a long time and realized that his stats had grown even though he didn't utilize Villain's point in it.
Well, it was understandable since Status Points doesn't just grow when Austin uses points at them; instead, it also tracks the development of Austin goes through real-time.
The surplus of available stats points must be because of the completion of last week's requirement. Well, Austin never thought that the weekly tenure system would vanish along with the surveillance tab as soon Austin's wish to heal Saya gets fulfilled.
But since the current Saya was in front of his eyes, he could rest assured about the sister who still was in the hospital bed.
'New feature, eh....'
The first two functions were self-explanatory, and Austin felt it would be bothersome to learn about them, so he opted for the strange option, which felt like a skill by name yet was posted as the system's function.
[Emergency Retreat: - A function that allows the host to leap back in time to some certain extent by utilizing a minimum of 500 Villain's Points and fulfilling a requirement that the System would release. TnC applied.]
Austin's heart grew a little heavy as his sluggishness exhausted in a second.
'Time travel....is it even possible? '
Austin didn't want to pretend he didn't believe in leaping through time which was impossible for any current-day magic to attain.
The System was real so did the skills and power boost Austin have received from it. Not wanting to trust the newly added feature was nothing but a futile try to ignore the serious death flag that has been raised right now.
Five hundred Villain's Point was something he could keep if really something that dire situation arose, but the problem was the second requirement.
'It won't ask me to help the elder cross the road, right? '
A dry smile formed on Austin's lips as he also realized that it wasn't a child's play to deal with the devil.
It was Villain's System, and so would be the tasks given accordingly.
He was required to perform a task that could change the plot, but the highest bump was Austin's change of approach. With Luna's help, Austin could change the story without gaining hatred more than he already had.
Who liked to be scorned all the time?
But Austin felt that the System didn't like such a loophole. That's why it suddenly took the evolution and ceased the weekly requirement plan and placed something which naturally would make him do something audacious.
But in a way, it was beneficial for Austin, too, since he found a chance where he could reverse back the damage he might regret losing through the new feature.
He didn't like to be hated, but it didn't mean he would do anything out of his way to avoid it.
If worst comes to worst, he will go to any length if the situation become severe. Until he has Luna by his side, he doesn't fear being targeted by the world.
'That reminds me... '
Austin looked around the room and found a small brown envelope resting on the drawer case, besides his bed.
A smile bloomed on his face erasing all kinds of discomfort he felt after reading the content on the system screen, as he gently unwrapped the paper and saw the words written inside.
As soon he read the small phrase, which was not even a complete proper sentence, his heart became warm.
[Luna's coming back♡ Darling should prepare his heart since I am going to pounce on him real soon♡♡~]
Strangely Luna becomes bold in her letters, but in person, she still shies away like a pure maiden who has newly discovered the fruit of love.
'Well, she's the best either way... '
____________________
In a not-so-distant place could be seen a maid in her early thirties walking through the hallway of the Gram palace as she held a cloth basket in her hand.
The way other maids and servants greeted her along the way signified the post she carries as the handsmaid of the first princess.
(A/N: - Handsmaid = Personal maid)
The maid didn't have to walk more than fifty meters before she reached somewhere in the corner of the palace as she entered inside a big room.
The room was dyed in white all around with a big square pool built in the middle of the room where stood another maid as she washed some clothes in the pool.
This was the laundry of the Gram Palace, where the clothes and other textiles were washed by some specially appointed maids.
The maid who entered inside walked toward the woman who also got up after seeing the handmaid of the first princess.
"Another one? These ceremonies makes me tired."
The laundry woman grumbled as she took the white bed sheet from the basket before spreading casually.
Suddenly her eyes went wide as she saw a wet mark printed on the sheet, which definitely wasn't because of water or anything but...
"A-Aina-san? Has the first princess already found a partner without even getting married?"
The maid had a clear idea of what this wet mark was since she herself was a young adult who had recently married and had come to realize what this musky smell and sticky substance actually was.
Hearing the laundry woman, the handsmaid
Aina, sneered as she spoke in a confident tone.
"Do you think anyone has the capability to slip inside my lady's bed just like that?"
"Then these marks?"
As the laundry woman asked, Aina, glanced at her surroundings and affirmed that no one was around before she grew closer to the woman in front as she whispered in a low tone.
"Since you are my friend, I will tell you this, but dare to leak a word, and you are dead. "
The other party nodded with stars in her eyes as, being a woman, she naturally loved to gossip, especially regarding these matters.
"Young lady Tiara was spotted at the ceremony hall being escorted by ex-Noble, Austin, Count Vincent's son and also the person who received the bravery honor recently. From what I saw, after leaving sir Austin's side, the princess ran back to her room and prohibited anyone, including me, too, from entering inside. Naturally, I couldn't leave her like this, so I was standing in front of the door all night when I heard it..."
The sheet was wrinkled in the listener's clutch as she urged Aina to speak further.
"What you heard?"
Aina blushed slightly but after a brief pause she let go of the hesitation.
"Sh-She was moaning and begging Sir Austin, who undoubtedly was only in her imagination, while she did such things which have results in your hands. I don't know whether Young Lady Tiara is in love with Master Austin, but she is kind of extremely obsessed with him."
__________________
A/N: - Drop a comment~

chapters.title: Chapter 92: First Quest!
chapters.content:
"See. You can do it too, if you just take it slow."
"Sorry, Onii-sama, for troubling you like this."
Currently, Austin was in Luna's room, training his sister on how to live normally without breaking things around her.
Saya's physical might was undoubtedly greater than Austin's. However, since she never got the time to orient adjustment of her physicality to her surrounding, she often broke various things like the doorknobs, stationery, and other small items.
Austin very well understood how it feels to control their own strength at such trivial things, but fortunately, he had his limiters which allowed him to move freely, unlike his sister, who didn't have a system.
So apart from tutoring her, there weren't many options.
"It's okay, Saya. Don't rush it, and take your time."
Austin patted the sulky Saya when suddenly he received notification over his system.
[Ding!]
[New Quest!]
[Degree: - Red!]
[Objective: - Save Sicily Reynolds]
[Time left: - 59 min 36 sec]
[Reward: - 100 Villain's Point]
[Penalty: - None]
'Huh? Sicily? '
It was the first time Austin received a quest from the system and was already thrown into a dilemma. Austin knew that the system mustn't be joking with him, but the problem was, why so suddenly? And what's with the penalty panel?
But since there wasn't much time left to complete the deed, Austin put his legs to work and left the contemplation for later.
"Saya, continue your training. I will be back."
"Ehh? Onii-sama?"
Austin didn't take Saya together since he wasn't sure about the situation. Despite knowing that his sister was more substantial than him, his brotherly instincts got better of him.
He knew that inside the school, there was no one other than headmaster Merlin who could push Sicily to the edge, especially when she had the staff he gave her. So he initiated his search from the outside.
Leaving the school premise just after exiting the dorm, Austin circulated his mana and tried to search in the forest situated on the Northern side of Eden Academy.
One has to remember that Austin doesn't have mana detection like Luna, where he could search over kilometers in one go. His range of detection was only limited to a hundred meters.
Mana detection doesn't depend on the skill or mana reserve; instead, it's a basic skill that runs on one's experience.
'I wonder... '
The time was passing rather briskly, but Austin didn't find a single trace of Sicily nor any of her party members. And since he didn't know whom he could ask in Eden's Academy, Austin's labor was the only option left.
Austin wouldn't have bothered much if not for someone he knew and was acquainted with; after all, he wasn't a hero of justice.
'At least give me the location, you damn system! '
Austin shouted in frustration but little did he expect that the system would hear his voice and respond such kindly.
[Ding!]
[Map feature Unlocked!]
[Click to locate Quest's Objective:]
Austin's eyes went slightly wide as he halted mid-air and saw the abrupt notification popping in front of his retina.
It was like the system was just complying with his request and releasing new features accordingly. Well, he wouldn't complain since time was already running short.
Opting for the tab with a grin blimp, Austin was met with a vast square illusionary sheet that contained the map of the whole territory of Eden Academy, including all the jungles, lairs, and nearby markets.
But Austin didn't intend to check them out since his mind went slightly numb as he saw the place where the red dot, signifying Sicily's position, was located.
'Eden's Academy... But how Sicily... don't tell me she went into the labyrinth!'
Suddenly a cold chill passed down Austin's back as a thought emerged in his mind that most likely would be the reason for Sicily's life-threatening situation.
Austin closed the map in a little hurry before he darted toward the school at full speed.
The labyrinth which made Austin so flustered wasn't like any other lair or monster nest that most of the populace is aware of.
The labyrinth situated beneath Eden's Academy is a terrifying place, to the point that even in the manga which Austin read in his previous life, the abyss-like place wasn't cleared by Kyouki.
The monsters roaming inside the labyrinth were mentioned to be so strange that even the hero, in his full potential, wasn't daring to step in because of the absurdity it contained.
It was weird why the author and mangaka put such a thing in the story when the hero wasn't going to clear it until the end, but it's the same reason it made the labyrinth so mysterious.
Even a single chapter was drawn on the labyrinth where Luna and Kyouki tried to venture independently; Austin realized what difficulty the Labyrinth had in store.
The reason he never tried to train inside the labyrinth before today was headmaster Merlin.
He wasn't just a headmaster but also a gatekeeper of the labyrinth, which was engraved under the Academy even before the fort was built.
Now why the headmaster would allow a mere student to enter the abyss when he himself doesn't dare to go inside was something Austin didn't care about since he didn't have time.
Looking at the watch on the system, he has already used up his twenty minutes due to moving to and fro.
He reached the fort and didn't bother by the monitoring unit, which was warning him for flying at such speed as he landed on the peak of the castle-like academy.
Resting his feet on the ledge of the topmost window, Austin observed the glass, which was restrained with dozens of mana spells.
'Well, it's the headmaster's office after all.... '
Austin removed the limiter from his strength, and after applying his fist with amber shade infernos, he pulled his arm before punching it down on the frame.
**TING**
A bell ringing sound came as the glass, along with the spells, was broken instantly and also gave quite a heavy backlash to Austin's right arm.
His muscles went numb for a second before he took out a potion from the inventory and gulped it down.
The glass, indeed, was conjured with a high-degree spell. Even applying all of his strength and utilizing mana as a backup, Austin felt a heavy impact like he just had punched an enormous mountain with his fist.
Austin already confirmed that Headmaster wasn't inside his office since his peculiar mana signature never came into Austin's detection. Instead, Austin, while breaking the windows, felt something ominous coming from inside.
And after jumping inside the office, his premonition became a reality as he stared at the vast black hole dug in the middle of the room.
Massaging his brows, Austin muttered in a grumpy tone before jumping inside.
"This is going to be hectic."
_________________________
A/N: - The story isn't progressing too fast, right, I am trying to detail as thoroughly as I can, but if you guys want, I can write more leisure chapters in between arcs?
Lemme know

chapters.title: Chapter 93: Serpent Queen!
chapters.content:
The Abyss.
A labyrinth named after the realm of darkness since it is the only labyrinth that still was not completely discovered yet or, to say, not even 10% was explored until now.
There was a reason why even such legendary warriors like Charles Sinten, Alex Nuèye, and also the great sage Merlin were available as a pioneer; the high echelon of Gram didn't allow them to venture the darkness.
There is strange energy inside the labyrinth that oppresses any kind of mana; even if the energy isn't released out, the peculiar sensation weakens anyone who carries magical energy inside them.
Naturally, no typical human could be pushed off the edge to let them inspect the Abyss and find what was inside. Not to talk about the first creature which Headmaster Merlin encountered made it clear how dangerous this darkness carried.
From that day onwards, the Labyrinth was ordered to be sealed away, and not only that. The Eden Academy's foundation was also built over it so the strongest mage of the continent could always watch over it.
In a way, it was putting the lives of students in danger, but if the creatures inside the Labyrinth really get out, then there was a high chance that everyone inside the territory of Gram might cease to exist, or maybe the whole plain?
No one knows the depth of the Abyss, but if the first floor carried such a terrifying being that could make Master Merlin's frightened to death, it was uncertain what catastrophe it stored in its deepest layer.
The seal which was applied over it was undoubtedly of the highest grade with seven Unique Grade and one Legendary Grade Artifact provided as the security lock over it.
Except for master Merlin, there would be very few mages in the whole world who could operate the seal without getting noticed.
But in front of Austin that near to impossible task has been accomplished.
Sicily was inside the Labyrinth, which means she defied the seals somehow and entered at a time when Merlin wasn't around.....
__..__
The topmost office of Eden's Academy was built in a way that its underneath would lead directly into the labyrinth.
Basic architecture skills.
After jumping inside the wormhole, Austin descended at a steady pace for more than ten seconds without any kind of intent or unnatural presence on the radar.
But after some blinks, he started feeling severely uncomfortable, like his insides were twisting and something was getting numb passing each second.
Despite his face covered in sweat, Austin didn't panic as he finally landed on the tough ground before taking out the little Lamp, which actually was an artifact from his inventory.
The small flame was enough to ignite a decent area around Austin as he commanded the system in a slightly hoarse tone.
"*Huff* Limit my *Hah* MP to 100".
The action was taken in a blink before the heavyweight over Austin got lifted like it never was there in the first place.
'So it really worked, huh... '
Austin gave himself time to settle down before he held the lamp high to his face level before walking forward.
The reason why after limiting his mana, Austin was able to breathe freely was simple.
This place was the nemesis of mana that Austin came to realize from the manga. The heavier amount of mana one carries, the greater this labyrinth would affect them.
In the story, Luna was more influenced than Kyouki since she has the most condensed form of mana running through her veins. As this also became a reason why Kyouki didn't dare to move forward since he didn't want to hurt Luna by any means.
'Somehow, I am feeling a little pissed now....'
Austin resorted to not remembering the manga anymore for 'various reasons.'
Fastening his pace, he saw less than thirty-five minutes were remaining now as he tried to widen his senses and observe the surrounding.
The red blimp, which was showing Sicily's location, has fixated on the place where Austin was. It didn't show a precise location, but it was fine since he already got the gist of where she could be.
"Hmm?"
Suddenly his ears perked with the slow sound of something sliding along the dusty ground. The sound was minimal, but he could discern that it was about ten meters away from him.
He halted his steps since he knew there wasn't any point in going anywhere to find the monster which was seen on the first floor as he sensed himself being surrounded slowly but surely.
He didn't dart away since he knew it would mean nothing until he doesn't utilize mana and levitate from his spot.
Using a simple command, Austin applied a single ounce of mana inside the lamp before the flame danced merrily as it left the steel cage and ascended in the sky for 50 meters before lightning up the vicinity like a mini-sun.
[KHEEEEEEK!!]
A pair of dull golden eyes, which had slit pupils positioned in its center, intently stared at Austin as the latter finally realized what he was facing.
On a rough scale, the creature was almost 9 meters in total length from its head to the end of its tail.
Black scales, which looked unscratchable with regular blades, spread all over its body, and a slick tongue whipped the air every now and then.
[Another mortal dared to step into my domain! Are you tired of living human?!]
Austin's ear lobes shined as the translating artifact activated instantly and helped him understand the monster's tongue.
"So you can talk, huh? Well, I'm not here to play. Return the girl, and I will go back silently."
Any being other than a human could only talk after reaching a particular stage of their life. Like the demons get their vocals when they arrive at least Terror Rank or higher.
But the problem was that the being in front wasn't a demon since no curse energy was involved. And a natural monster ascending to that level was seldom heard.
Suddenly the air surrounding the blond youth because heavier as he felt the chills that oozed with life-threatening danger, but when he had come this far...
[That Green Apple which I ate? That stubborn brat is still in the process of getting digested, so why not you help me push her inside and also get dissolved along with her?]
Austin felt like the monster was talking a lot, and he didn't have much time left, so he took the initiative to abandon the chattering.
The ground beneath Austin's feet crumbled slightly as he gathered strength in his feet before jumping at a furious speed toward the gigantic serpent.
[Huh?]
The creature could only sense something approaching at a furious pace before it ducked its head to avoid whatever it was.
**DHAKKK**
The wall just behind the place where the snake's head was a blink ago broke brutally before big chunks of rock started falling on its body.
With disbelief shrouding its reasoning, the reptile looked at the place and found the human was the source of such a destructive blow.
[Y-You.....how can someone...without mana....]
The monster fell into a stupor since the mana in the human was lower than the average, yet it had such colossal strength!
"Am I getting sloppy? Well, you aren't just any snake after all."
Hearing the boy's daring words, the serpent queen got enraged as she let go of all the hesitation before charging up her mouth with the attack she planned to direct next.
[Blame your luck, kid...]
**HISSSSSSS**
A purple smog erupted from the creature's tubular long one, meter fangs before covering the whole vicinity and entirely covering the illumination that the dancing amber was spreading.
'[Now what would you do, human? This smoke is nothing you can escape, even if you have that strength. Neither do you have the mana to get rid of it.]'
The creature moved silently along the ground with its senses wholly focused on the frail human standing in oblivion.
'[Now you are mine!] '
But before the queen could have lunged on her prey, a pecuilar whisper reached her senses and made her freeze in extreme dread.
[XXXX-XXXXXXX-XXX]
________________________
A/N: - Drop a comment~

chapters.title: Chapter 94: Spirit User!
chapters.content:
Spiritual Magic.
A magic that primarily isn't oriented from the users' core; instead, they become the channel of the strange energy which originates from thin air.
It's mentioned thin air for those who don't have a spiritual tongue. Not to talk about that, having the talent to bend and utilize the spirits is extremely rare, to the point where an entity in every hundred years is born with such skill.
As generations passed, the existence of the Spiritual Tongue became a myth since no promising generation showed signs of being in a friendly relationship with the small things revolving around the planet.
Primary functioning of spirit-based attacks.
Spirits are being who get along pretty well with anyone who keeps their company and acknowledges their presence. There are some certain egos of some specific spirits, too, like the Space and Time spirits are the rarest of the rarest to get in contact with.
It's said that whoever gets surrounded by all six types of spirit would become the first Spirit Monarch of history and capture the world in his fist.
...
Back to the present.
The serpent queen wasn't a newly born monster but far from it. She was an existence who roamed the outside world since ancient times and fed herself every hundred years.
Naturally, she has seen various kinds of beings and also has fought against them.
But having the ability to oppress mana gave her superiority over those who tried to stand against her and not to mention her own might, which was not less than those demons.
However, what made her feel the sensation of being scared for the first time in life was a spiritual user which she met around five hundred years ago.
That was the first time she came to know that there was still something she couldn't go against, so after thinking wisely, she took a strategical retreat but killed the human once she found the chance at his most vulnerable time.
From that day, she found the spiritual users and killed them to cease the existence of all those who could pose a danger to her and like others from her birthplace.
But suddenly, a puny human who had mana not even in comparison to those warriors who came here before, willingly, started whispering in the same tongue which had given the chills of life to her before too.
[This can't be happening! Stop mumbling, you insane human!!]
The enraged serpent queen lashed at Austin, which the latter dodged quite easily as he gathered wind spirits around him before generating a heavy whirlpool on the center of his palm.
Under the shocking gaze of the creature, which saw such proficient use of spiritual energy, Austin threw the wind pool as it started sucking the poisonous gas from the surrounding.
**WOOOOOOOSH**
The gust was heavy enough to push the humungous demon to a corner and also made it difficult for Austin to keep his feet steady at his point.
[Ding!]
[Quest Update!]
[Degree: - Red!]
[Objective: - Save Sicily Reynolds]
[Time left: - 26 min 36 sec-> 3 min 12 sec]
[Reward: - 100 Villain's Point]
[Penalty: - None]
Austin's retina contracted as he saw how the remaining time decreased absurdly before he turned his head toward the creature and realized what had just happened.
'Due to the crash, Sicily must have suffered.'
Gritting his teeth, Austin waited for his vision to get cleared before he decided that it was better to end it here before his first quest fails.
'Well, let's go with the challenging route. '
Bringing out a slim object of one and a half meters in length, which by appearance looked like a traditional sheath, Austin stood while facing the monster.
Bringing the hilt near his waist, Austin extended his left foot and brought his right hand over the handle of the katana. Austin flicked the hilt of the blade with his thumb, releasing the katana slightly out of its cover.
With his eyes fixated on the snake in front, Austin felt the incredible sensation from the blade he had used only once before.
On the other side, the serpent queen collected herself from the hurricane as she felt the chilly sensation from the human who suddenly summoned a blade from thin air.
[Is spiritual energy allows him that too!]
The queen had no good feeling coming from the blade, which seemed to be charging up with a lethal attack as she immediately attacked Austin first.
**KHEEK**
A mouthful of venom was spat out by the serpent toward Austin, which the latter received without any problem since his body wasn't that sensitive to be affected so easily.
**KHEEK**
**KHEEK**
The reptilian queen continued spitting the dark purple tar in the hope of melting the human under it, and she would have succeeded if she had done it continuously for one day, but Austin didn't have that much time to play around.
After supplying his mana, bit by bit, he finally took out the katana from the sheath and slashed it in a horizontal cut before putting it back on the cover.
"Tachi no shokei."
The slash came at such a violent pace toward the creature that she was only able to see a blue illumination passing through her throat.
Wait, pass thro...
**KACHAK**
With a flesh-splitting sound, the massive head of the serpent separated from her body before it fell to the ground, along with her lifeless rest of the self.
Austin heaved in relief since he wasn't sure whether he could do it perfectly, even though he didn't have the full mana he had for the first time. But all went well as he kept the katana back in inventory.
"Fuck! It's only a minute!"
Austin ran toward the massive body, which was devoid of vigor now, before he used his sheer strength to split the snake skin in two as he proceeded in a rush.
It didn't take him time to finally find the magic staff that Sicily stubbornly took from him. The staff was standing straight with either end piercing the inside of the serpent muscles.
There knelt an olive-haired girl with her eyes numbly closed and no movement in her body; even the open air met her skin after so long.
Austin hurriedly pulled her out before placing her over his bent knee. As he patted her cheek softly while calling out for her.
"Hey, Sicily. Come on, wake up. Hey!"
He called and called, but no response came. Along with the fact that the countdown on the system was still going on, and also the fading impulse he felt from the girl made Austin sure that she was going to die in mere twenty seconds now.
'Seems there's no way... '
Concluding that he didn't have many options; Austin took out a small glass container that had a peculiar red fluid inside; Austin gulped half of it.
'Sorry, Luna.... '
Closing his eyes, Austin connected his lips to hers before using his tongue as a server and pouring down the content past her throat.
[Ding!]
[Congraturaltion]
....
Austin wasn't able to check the notification since a life-threatening voice reached up to his senses, making every strand on his body stand straight.
"Aus~tin~ Care to explain~."
____________________
A/N: - Run boy run.
Drop a comment and let's pray together!

chapters.title: Chapter 95: Desire for Luna!
chapters.content:
"Luna, I said I am sorry. There wasn't any option, and if I had delayed even seconds, she would have died."
Austin asked for forgiveness the seventh time after returning to the dorms. Sicily was safe but not to the point where she could regain consciousness, so Austin deposited her in the infirmary and returned to his room, only to see the upset Luna.
She wasn't enraged; she was just....silent.
And that made Austin more worried since she wasn't speaking at all. It was fortunate that she didn't disappear and was willing to hear him out. That's why she waited for him in the room.
But looking at her, sitting while facing the window without any intention to speak, made Austin's heart clench as he knelt in front of her.
Taking her hand, which felt extremely cold for some reason, he spoke gently.
"At least say something. If you want to get angry with me, then it's okay. It's okay to slap or shout at me, but don't just stay silent, Luna. I want to hear what's going on in your mind."
Austin spoke earnestly since he wanted her to let go of this grief that arose from him. He thought if she yelled at him or cried her emotions out, then he could coax her until she didn't forgive him. But...
Luna steadily directed her gaze, which carried no peculiar emotion, toward Austin as she voiced her thought in a mild tone.
"Imagine our roles are reversed. You are returning from a long trip to see me after such a long time, and when you do see me, I am 'helping' a man in the way you did to Sicily. How would you react?"
It didn't take him to register her word as a syllable leaked out reflexively.
"I..."
Austin wanted to say something, but when he indeed thought of such a scene where Luna was in such contact with another man, his heart throbbed with a strange sensation building inside of him.
Clenching his fist, he dropped back with his legs folded without any intention to speak any further because he did not know what to say anymore.
Leaning his face down, Austin saw Luna getting up from the bed as she spoke in the tone which generally used for others but not him.
"When you find the answer, then only come to me, Austin."
Luna walked some steps when she felt her hand still being held by Austin, albeit nimbly.
Luna waited for some more seconds, but Austin didn't move nor spoke any word, which brought a frown on her brows as she finally snatched her hand away and walked out of the room.
In the dark room where Austin generally enjoys his private time with Luna, he sat all alone while contemplating various things.
But after a long time, what made him feel so nostalgic was the silence and darkness that greeted him.
He nearly forgot this sensation, but unlike before, he just couldn't sigh and let it go. This time this loneliness was weighing on him.
Unlike in the past, when he did not have anyone, he might have lived in such darkness without complaint, but now he had someone he dearly loves. There is someone whom he could not afford to lose. Someone, he cannot think of living apart from.
Rising on his feet after what seemed like a minute, Austin clenched his fist as he cursed himself for not taking this step before.
'Fuck! What a sore loser I am! "
____________
"So you failed again? "
In a terrace balcony built inside the Gram palace sat an adorable young lady with shiny blond hair as she sipped on her milk tea.
The person she asked the query whose answer she already knew about just bowed his head slightly in shame.
The man was in his early twenties with similar hair and eye color as the girl who bit his lips in frustration.
The girl who spoke in such a soft tone even though she was pissed more than her brother was none other than the eldest princess Tiara.
"First, you failed to get that Red-haired bitch, and now Sicily also slipped out from the labyrinth. What a wasted bastard in the name of brother I have. "
Tiara's venomous words, along with a gentle smile, made her look terrifying, and looking at the prince's face, it seemed he knew what happens when Tiara gets in the mood.
"I-I am sorry, Tia. "
Seeing her brother's dejected expression, Tiara sighed as she held his hand after putting the cup on the table.
"Brother, you want Luna or not?"
Hearing the name of the person whom the man has been yearning to hold, he nodded without hesitation.
"Unlike Brother Mikhail, you aren't recognized as a competitor to the throne despite being the eldest. Do you know why?"
The firstborn of the Emperor thought for a second before shaking his head in denial.
"It's because you don't give you 100% to anything you do. Whether it's showing your worth or erasing some obstacle from the path, you can't seem to strengthen your resolve. "
The blond man registered his sister's words carefully and indeed agreed that there was a single hesitation restricting him from doing his all to gain what he desired.
"Listen, brother. If you don't let go of that restraint, then the Luna you always dream about and want to make your own would never look at you. And eventually,y in some years, she would leave this nation. Do you think you can misuse your power in other countries too? Do you think if she leaves you will get together with her? Do you think she would ever love you if that happens? "
Tiara's eyes were fixated on her brother's profile as she whispered the thoughts she carried and found enough to enrage the sleeping beast inside the first prince.
And she succeeded in her provocation.
Clenching his fist, the man got up and muttered under his breath with determination flaming his eyes and aura being shrouded with a strong resolve.
"Nothing can stop me now from making Luna mine. Thanks, Tiara, for pushing me. Now you will see what your brother is capable of. "
________________________
A/N: - They will make up in next chapter and yes the Red-haired B*tch Tiara mentioned is Venessa.
Anyway, drop a comment if you are hyped for next one~

chapters.title: Chapter 96: Passionate Night~
chapters.content:
'What did I do... '
After leaving Austin's dorm, Luna didn't teleport nor use levitation to return since she wanted to think while walking.
She couldn't have stayed there, nor could she return to her dorm.
The reason she didn't choose to go to her room was simple since Saya was there. If Saya learns that she and Austin fought, that bro-con will take the chance to comfort her brother.
And Luna didn't want to let that happen.
But now the problem arose with where she could go. Since it was already night, she didn't want to sit in the garden too.
'Well, I haven't been there in ages, so why now... '
Her answer came not so long after as she started marching toward the place where she enjoyed her peaceful silence before meeting Austin.
Along the way, she remembered how she behaved with him because of the incident in which Austin had no option but to partake.
But even so, she didn't like seeing her man kissing someone else, even if it was for saving her life. People died, and so Sicily could have.
In a way, she knew it was wrong to treat this matter in this way, but she couldn't calm her heart so instantly. And truth be told, she would have doubted her love for Austin if not for this bitter feeling that had arisen after seeing him like that in the labyrinth.
And not to talk that Austin didn't even persuade her to stop. Even her heart was clenching in pain when she saw his sad face but even so...even so...
'No, I shouldn't. Don't fall weak now, Luna. You have to be angry with him... Hmph! "
Determining not to waver from her resolve, Luna made her way to the academy's main building after shrouding herself with invisibility to avoid attention.
Central Library.
When Luna entered the Eden Academy and joined the hero's party, she often spent her time reading books here and enjoyed the silence she was provided with.
Apart from the world, under the layer of darkness, where no one gaze upon her nor gets disturbed by anyone's presence, she enjoyed such an atmosphere.
But unlike in the past, she wasn't alone in the library.
"H-How are you here?! "
With a look of complete bafflement, Luna asked the person who was sitting at the table right opposite the entrance.
Due to the chaos rumbling inside her head, she couldn't detect even such a familiar man who seemed to be waiting for her.
"I knew you would come here, so I just dragged my feet a little faster. "
Austin detached his back from the table before making his way toward the perplexed Luna, who had never thought to meet Austin this soon.
The way she left him, Luna thought it would take him time to reflect on what he did but to her utmost surprise, Austin was already here to confront her.
Walking silent yet heavy steps toward her, Luna instinctively stepped back as she gazed at Austin's slightly fierce gaze. It seemed the roles had reversed where she would have been on the aggressive side, but now, Austin seemed annoyed for some reason.
"A-Austin, don't come near me.... "
Luna wanted to disappear for some reason, but under his sharp gaze, she nearly forgot that she was a mage, not a damsel.
"And what would happen if I come near you, Luna? Will you attack me or run away again?"
His voice neared, and so he did. Slowly and steadily, under the flustered gaze of Luna, Austin made his way toward her before he slammed his hand on either side of the girl, caging her in the kabedon*.
"Auu... "
Luna, like a small child, felt herself frail in front of Austin's broad figure as he gazed upon her with the same eyes filled with a strange glint.
Leaning his face, his hot breath made Luna's face flushed.
"You know you have hurt me by telling me to think up something like that. You know I have seen you having romance with Kyouki in my past life, so you could guess whose face would have popped into my head when I tried to imagine what you asked me to. "
Luna's mouth parted since she never thought Austin would take her word so seriously and also would get hurt in that way.
She herself was embarrassed to see her drawing self being intimate with the hero, but that wasn't the real Luna. She wouldn't do such a thing when she has Austin for her!
But she forgot that primarily she was angered because of him, but now it seemed Luna was in the wrong.
"I-I won't do such a thing with anyone, Austin."
Luna brought her hand to his chest as she spoke in a hazy voice and pleaded with her eyes glittering slightly.
"And if I tell you the same that I won't do it again ever with anyone, would you believe me."
Luna instinctively was about to nod when she realized that it wasn't her who should be confronted, as she was the victim, not him.
Turning her bead with her gaze shifting to a colder tone, Luna answered after collecting herself.
"No, I won't, and I will not forgive you too. "
Austin didn't back away since he never intended to accept defeat here.
"Then look at my eyes and tell me that you won't forgive me. Tell me that after leaving this place, you would stop talking about me and soon would also come to hate me with the time. And since we are at it, tell me that one day you will forget about me and leave my side. "
As Austin spoke, Luna became flustered as she turned her head with her eyes wide open.
"I won't do that...why are you speaking like this, Austin. It's hurting me to even think about it. "
"Yes, now you understand how mere words can affect someone? Now you understand how painful it was for me. "
Luna lowered her eyes in shame as she understood what he said and why he was so agitated.
In a whispering tone, she asked in a sweet voice.
"What can I do for Austin's forgiveness? "
"Simple. Kiss me."
Luna shot up her head in surprise but seeing Austin's gaze unchanged; she figured it was the least she could do as compensation.
Closing her eyes tightly, Luna leaned forward and pressed her lips against him. Separating her cushion, she pecked the second and third time.
Austin found it cute how she initiated the kiss, but he was far from satisfied.
Resting his left arm on the door, he tucked his finger on either side of her ear before leaning for a deep kiss.
Luna was caught off guard, but she didn't reject him; however, she wasn't cooperating either. She just stood there at the mercy of her lover.
Austin sucked on her lower lip before separating for a second and leaving an audible wet sound along with it. He did the same for her other lip while gazing at her without a blink.
Tilting his head, he entered inside her mouth and hugged her back along the movement.
Luna was utterly captivated by him as she felt her legs going noodles under such heavy love; Austin was pouring on her.
The vulgar sound of wild and continuous kissing resonated in the silent library as Austin grabbed Luna's ass and made her jump on him, which she did on the spur.
Pushing her back on the door, Luna also got lost in the kiss as she violently nailed his back and grabbed the back of his hair because of the exciting sensation she was feeling.
Austin only halted his attacks when he felt Luna going short on air.
Separating their lips, a silver thread was still connected, signifying their passion and desire for each other.
Witnessing Luna's gasping mouth and moist eyes which seemed utterly erotic, Austin leaned forward before whispering in a hoarse tone.
"Tonight, I won't be making love. I will fuck you hard, to show you how angry I am. "
**Gulp**
With her breathing getting heavier, Luna muttered in a soft tone as her heart thumped violently.
"Please try to be a little ah~! "
__________________
A/N: - They weren't making sense in the chapter but doesn't people become silly in love?
Anyway, I will be writing R18 of this night so if you want they, you can visit my patreon: -
/Svneighter

chapters.title: Chapter 97: Headmaster’s Request~1!
chapters.content:
"Mm..."
After frowning for some seconds, Luna steadily parted her lids which still seemed a little reluctant to let her awake.
The first thing which entered her vision was the most desired sight she could ever wish for.
"Why are you staring at me..."
In a slightly groggy voice, Luna muttered under her breath as she saw Austin's warm eyes gazing upon her.
"Your sleeping face looks adorable."
Luna's half sleepiness was exhausted by just that as she parted her lids clearly this time and glared at him in the complaint.
Suddenly she realized what position she was in, which made her perplexed.
"Why are we in your bed?"
Last night they made a mess out of the library as Austin never halted his attacks nor bothered to take Luna to his bedroom. He wanted her there, and then, so he took what he desired without restraint.
Hearing her confusion, Austin turned himself toward her before hugging Luna in between his arms and replying in a soothing tone.
"After you passed out, I thoroughly cleaned the library and took you here. Sorry for pushing you that hard last night."
Luna's face was already red due to the remembrance of the activities she partook in last night.
The vulgar begging she did, the things she admitted to be...and....and....
"Ahhh! I hate you to make me like that."
Austin blinked upon being hated so early in the morning, but soon he realized the reason, which made him grin ear to ear.
It was fortunate that Luna was hiding her face in his chest, or she might have gotten more irritated by seeing him being so delighted upon such a shameful thing.
"You didn't like it...or are you just shy to admit that you loved it?"
Austin teased the girl who was fidgeting in his embrace because of the nervousness and shame.
"Don't ask me, baka! I can't possibly answer to such thing."
With a strong 'Hmph! ' Luna firmly hugged Austin to show her anger before the room fell silent.
Austin had a soft smile spread across his face as he soothed the embarrassed girl by running his fingers across her hair.
After a slight pause, Austin spoke about the discovery he had made recently.
"Luna, my system has been updated. And now it gives me a short mission along with rewards."
Luna blinked twice before separating her face from the warmth, and after directing her gaze toward him, she asked what seemed plausible after tomorrow's incident.
"So saving Sicily was your mission?"
Austin responded with a nod.
"Hmm...now that's interesting. The system changed its functioning. So did you get any reward from it?"
Austin nodded as he was about to tell her about the new features added to the system, along with the time leaping function, when they heard two strong knocks on his door.
**KNOCK**KNOCK**
Austin sensed it was a familiar person, so he got up hurriedly before draping some clothes and turning the doorknob to let the person in.
"Offo, Onii-sama. How can you leave me like that wi-"
"Wait, Saya."
Austin held Saya's shoulder from letting her step in; as he suddenly remembered something, he turned toward Luna with a dry smile.
"Luna. The barrier."
Luna and Saya blinked in perplexion before the prior one finally realized what Austin was speaking about.
Pulling her hand out of the sheet, Luna snapped her finger before the entrance of the door shined with a greenish hue before the illumination turned into small butterflies and disappeared in a couple of blinks.
"....amazing."
Saya couldn't help praising such a fine mana spell. Since Saya had not met high ranking mage until now and also given her low proficiency with mana, it made her marvel at such a sight in pure admiration.
"I can teach you if you want, imouto-chan."
Saya got out of her stupor as she heard the voice of her rival before she turned toward her brother, not caring about the person in the background anymore.
"Why did Onii-sama leave like that yesterday? Saya was very worried. "
Austin brought his hand over his beloved's head as he soothed her anxiety.
"Sorry, Saya. Yesterday so many things happened that I forgot that I left you hanging."
Saya received the pats wholeheartedly as she side glanced at the beauty sleeping on the bed before Saya muttered under her breath.
"A lot of things, huh...I bet it's all because of her."
"I can hear you, Imouto-chan."
Saya sneered before she felt the warmth over her head disappear.
"What's in your hand, Saya?"
Austin asked as he saw an envelope in her hand which had Eden Academy's seal on it.
"Uh-yeah. It was at your doorstep."
Saya handed the envelope before Austin studied it for any trap or curse spell but found nothing.
Scratching the partition, Austin took out the small paper from inside before reading it in thoroughly in seconds.
"Who is it from, Austin?"
Luna became impatient to know as she asked after straightening her back on the bed. Saya was always eager to know the content, but she chose to wait patiently.
"It's from the headmaster. He asked me to meet ASAP. Wanna join Luna?"
"Yes, sure."
"Onii-sama...me?"
Saya sulked pitifully since she had spent a day without her brother, and now too, he has only asked Luna, not her.
"I can't, Saya since you aren't an official admitted to the school, so bear with it; I will do something about it soon."
Saya dropped her gaze since she knew it already, but still, it was disheartening to know that she couldn't be seen in the school with her brother.
Austin understood his sister's trouble, but for now, he could do nothing.
"Get ready, Luna. Let's see what he has to say."
___________
A/N: - Can anyone let me know whether I should keep the pace or should I speed up?
It might take out some detail but I can surely fasten the plot.
Let me know in the comment section~

chapters.title: Chapter 98: Headmaster’s Request~2!
chapters.content:
**Knock**
"Come in."
As the grumpy voice of an older man responded to the knock, two young youths stepped inside the room, which by furniture looked like an office.
The two who entered were the most gossiped couple of the Eden Academy currently, Luna and Austin.
After having breakfast with Saya in Austin's room, they changed after taking a shower and arrived at the headmaster's office because of the summoning letter Austin found in the morning.
It was the first time Austin was stepping here officially since he never did something worthy enough to be called by the principal, but yes, he did receive a warning notice from the bearded mage.
A sense of reminiscence arose inside as he remembered how things changed in so less time.
The white-beard magician, Merlin, gestured both of them to sit as he also took the big chair at the front desk.
"Please have a seat."
After they sat, a set of cups plate along with a teapot levitated and landed on the table softly.
"What tea would you like to have?"
"Lemon tea."
Luna replied instinctively since she was already craving the tea she tasted in Xylex. She didn't expect it to be the same, but if it could be near to it, she would be delighted.
"The one from the Ramen shop, huh?"
Austin and Luna blinked at each other before the prior one asked slightly perplexedly.
"Have you been there, headmaster?"
Akiko's ramen shop was famous but not to the point where it could become a landmark. Merlin knowing about such a place and even so when the shop hadn't been started working for that long, made the discovery a little questioning worthy.
"I just stumbled at that place while observing the aftermath."
His words were entirely subjective, with lots of trails here and there.
Austin understood what 'aftermath' Merlin was talking about and how he could have 'stumbled' upon the shop, which belonged to a summoned being.
On the other side, Luna was...just waiting for her tea.
She doesn't like to use her brain much this early in the morning.
Merlin poured the content after it was heated into three cups before placing it with some fluffy bread toward the two.
"So, why did the busy headmaster have to take some time to invite me?"
Austin came to the end of the chase since he already had an idea of what it was about, and Austin also wanted to talk about it relatively sooner than later.
Merlin sipped his tea before nodding in admiration toward Luna's choice as he brought up the conversation he could only have with these two.
"You already have figured about this..."
**TAP*TAP**
As he spoke, he tapped his mage staff on the ground signifying the wormhole which was unknowingly opened yesterday.
"Can I ask what you saw after you infiltrated the office?"
Austin nodded before he peeked inside his memory to search for any evident fact he might have seen but failed to pay attention at that time.
After a minute or so, Austin spoke with a bit of uncertainty.
"Well, I did feel an unnatural remnant of mana presence, but it was faint enough that I wasn't able to discern the first chain of the spell. Other than that, I don't have anything else."
There are several circles drawn to cast a spell. The first mana chain is the first layer of magic that construct a structure of the magic formation.
What Austin felt was only the outer layer, which couldn't e used to analyze who the person was or what was his mana signature.
"Well, it's surprising you were able to catch even that since my mana detectors were just lying idly, and also the professors I have assigned this room to."
Merlin muttered under his breath as he thought of the two secretive guards the Capital has assigned to protect Headmaster.
"How the Eight Patch Seal got broken, old man? I am still surprised here."
Luna spoke in a neutral tone as she poured herself another cup of tea without minding the courtesy.
Merlin forwarded some piece of bread cake to his student before he responded to her not-so-curious query.
"There is a nemesis of everything. Mana seals aren't vulnerable to any kind of magic other than Curses. But this wasn't just a seal, so I presume it was a high-ranking mage engaged in the treason."
"Then what about Sicily? How come she was here at that moment?"
As Luna asked, she thanked Austin, who wiped the small chunks of bread from her cheek as she heard the older one speaking.
"I still haven't been able to ask her because of her condition. But I don't think it would matter."
Austin was staring straight, but his mind was spacing out for some seconds as he deeply contemplated about something after he finally got the time inside the office.
"Headmaster Merlin. Where were you, yesterday?"
Austin's query came so abruptly that the bearded mage became a little baffled, but he responded not so long after.
"I was called by Your Majesty for some confidential purpose."
"Hmmm...Headmaster, have you hired every professor after checking their background?"
As Austin's words left his lips and Luna's cake got dropped in her tea mistakenly, the room went silent for several seconds.
Not so long after, with a grim expression, the cols voice of Merlin reached up to the blog youth opposite him.
"Are you suggesting that someone from inside the school is involved?"
Austin, on the other end, wasn't bothered with such a tone as he spoke nonchalantly.
"I have an artifact planted at every corner of the school which lets me know if someone trespasses its boundary if they had even an essence of curse in them. Since it has a limitless range of tracks, no one, I repeat, even Monarch Level curse users, wouldn't be able to hide their presence. And from what you are telling me, I didn't sense any person carrying curse energy entering inside after you left, so what's left is..."
"....Insiders."
Austin nodded as the headmaster concluded right.
Merlin's wrinkle-weighing eyes were visibly spread wide as he heard such absurd deduction, which seemed plausible for some reasons.
It was hard to believe that such a ridiculous artifact really does exist, but Merlin didn't dare to sneer at Austin.
From what he had seen, Austin wasn't the regular person whom he seemed to be past six months. To take the youth's words lightly would be the last thing Merlin would allow himself to do.
After a brief pause, a sigh left the older one as he rubbed his eyes and brought up the request he mainly called Austin for.
"Austin, I know I am in no position to request something like this when I have treated you like that....but Austin, can you fulfill two requests of mine. And before you outright reject, please hear me out, what I have to offer in return."
Austin wasn't going to reject it before hearing it, but when the compensation was mentioned, the conversation became a whole lot more interesting.
Seeing Austin nod, Merlin exhaled deeply first before uttering the idea he has thinking about for a while now.
"Can you..teach the professors and students of Eden's Academy."
______________________
A/N: - Will continue the next chapter from this point.
Drop a comment~

chapters.title: Chapter 99: I will always be there for you!
chapters.content:
"Can you repeat that again?"
With his brows raised in astonishment, Austin leaned slightly forward as he raised his voice to confirm whether he heard the Headmaster's request right or not.
"Austin being a professor with a stick in hand...hmm~."
Luna, after finishing her tea, got a new time pass as she started imagining some of the things which children should better not know about.
(A/n: - Luna and her kinks*sigh*)
Merlin focused on the boy in front, and after thinking again about the decision, he spoke with a little more certainty this time.
"You and Luna both are very well aware of what kind of catastrophes are rising at such consecutive rates. It feels that monstrosities are developing, but we aren't. The rate of demons' appearance has risen so much recently that I fear we might lose our footing without even being able to counter properly."
What Merlin said was all true.
Since the time Austin started his academy life, the incidents with demons have leveled a whole lot.
From minor stampedes or large massacres, the demons have actively gotten involved with humans in one way or another.
Not to talk about the incident with Xylex where it was clearly exposed, how demons submitted to humans. It was a terrifying thing to witness that monsters who only have loyalty toward their liege, Monarch of Darkness, were following the orders of those beings, who were way weaker than them.
"You and Luna are the irregulars among the irregular. But you both can't protect everyone, and since they are not your responsibility, I won't either ask you to help them. But Austin as a student of Eden Academy, can I request you to teach the students a little something so, at the very least, they could protect themselves to some extent."
Grandmaster Merlin wasn't an everyday mage or principal. He's a renowned magician who has been standing at the top tier of hierarchy since the time Austin didn't even exist in either world.
For such a person to plea in front of a mere teenager was a sight that could make thousands gasp in shock. But here he was, utterly devoid of any ego or any other emotion other than genuine desperation for Austin's help.
More than saving humanity from fall, Merlin cared about none.
"Hmmm.."
Austin fell back on his chair with his eyes relaxed as he thought about the request for a brief moment.
It was true that he wouldn't bother to save everyone's arses if some unexpected event unfolds this very moment. But he might help the students to at least learn how to retreat safely from a situation that seems impossible to deal with.
There wasn't any gain, but there wasn't any drawback too. And since he needed a favor from Headmaster , this offer would be perfect bargain.
"Okay, I will do what I can. But in return, headmaster, I want permission to let a relative of mine stay in the school. I hope it will be fine, right?"
"Che! Sis-con."
Austin ignored Luna for now as he made his request since it would help Saya to move more freely in the school.
Merlin didn't even think for a second, before responding in affirmation.
Another set of tea was served as in to congratulate the admission of the new professor before Austin brought the next matter to light.
"What about your second request, Headmaster?"
The room suddenly went a little more silent than it already was as Merlin, after putting back the cup on the plate, sat upright while facing the two.
With a long exhale, the bearded man tapped his palm on the table before lifting it steadily and conjuring a thing beneath his palm.
It was a purple cube with thin golden lines drawn at uncertain points. Even Austin and Luna tried to sense it; they didn't feel any kind of mana from it; even the cube looked nothing less than a high-grade artifact.
"This...I want you to keep this in your protection. What's inside this definitely would benefit you, but I would request not to try opening it until it doesn't naturally split up."
Austin took the cube and examined it before passing it to Luna.
The Silver Haired saint appraised the thing with a top-tier spell but didn't find any trap or hidden danger in it, so she handed back the box to Austin.
"Don't worry, headmaster. I would fulfill both of your requests."
________________________
[Some days earlier]
A day ago, before the labyrinth incident in the Eden Academy, a similar occurrence happened in a forest far away from the academy.
In a vast forest where nothing than greenery could be seen stood two people, covered in the purplish fluid, which by density seemed like blood.
One of them, by physique looked like a massive man with dark raven hair covering his face as he held his sword in a tight grip while surveying the surrounding.
The other one, despite being in such a horrifying state, still could be defined as a beautiful girl whose charm was only enhanced by the blood she got covered in.
"I could have handled it on my own, Papa."
Vanessa spoke in a low tone as she swung her composite sword to splash the fluid away, which she got from a certain someone.
"Don't try to act tough in front of your father, little one."
Charles planted his blade on the ground before ruffling his daughter's hair, much to the latter's annoyance, but still, she didn't reject it.
"So why did my little princess decide to leave the Academy suddenly?"
Vanessa knew it was coming, but she didn't want to answer him. However she also knew it was nearly impossible to just say bye-bye to her father from this point.
"I just want to become strong."
"That is a half-truth. Come on, tell me what it is or I would pick you up and drop you in the Eden's Academy and will only after ensuring that you won't leave the premise before graduation."
Vanessa pouted since it was too unfair of her papa to treat her like a child when she finally took such a serious step in life.
But again, she knew it was her parents who cared for her without any hidden intent. To leave them without words, would not be fair on her part.
"I-I want to become worthy to stand beside Austin."
She felt fortunate that her face was practically hidden behind the blood since her blush would have made a fool out of her.
Charles fell silent for several seconds, when Venessa slowly raised her face before asking.
"Are you disappointed in me, father?"
It seemed Charles suddenly got out of his stupor as he replied with a big smile on his face.
"Of course not. I can never be disappointed in my daughter. It was just I felt like seeing myself in you. Just like you, Venessa, I also became stronger than anyone in order to hold your mother's hand confidently."
Vanessa's eyes went slightly round in astonishment as she felt Charles patting her head before he spoke the parting words.
"Do whatever you want, Venessa. Strive to be the strongest and pursue what you desire. And if ever you feel like there might be consequences of your action, then don't worry. Your father would always be standing on your back."
Vanessa smiled brightly before she nodded with her eyes closed in elation as her resolve become even stronger.
After a little more chat, Venessa parted ways as she moved in an uncertain direction, leaving the big man Charles all alone at the site.
"*Sigh* Kids really does grow too quick."
With a sigh he turned his head, before his gaze became sharp as daggers as he looked in a certain direction.
"Now let's see who the fuck dared to harm my princess."
____________________
A/N: - Drop a comment. And tell me, whether I should be keep posting about Venessa? She would return after a while but keeping her out of the story would be a little unfair.
Please suggest me in the comments

chapters.title: Chapter 100: Professor Austin~1!
chapters.content:
Its been a week since the meeting between Austin and Headmaster concluded with certain requests being accepted by both parties.
Sicily also recovered from her injuries with the top-notch healer providing their services in the school infirmary.
Luna could have healed Sicily within minutes, but why she didn't even spare a glance at the olive-haired mage supporter was only known by Austin.
From her testimony, it seemed that she found a letter stating that the headmaster had summoned her.
Since the notice was to report within an hour, Sicily didn't inform others and went there alone, only to get pushed into a hole in the end.
As one could guess, Sicily didn't see the person face who nearly took her life by throwing her into the labyrinth. Even the Cerebral Interference spell wasn't able to dig out any valuable clue from her.
Saya was extremely delighted these days since she got permission from her Onii-sama that she could wander in the school without restraint now.
Some students tried to talk to her, and some even dared to take her as her fiancee only after seeing her for once. Given how peculiarly beautiful Saya is, the teenager's reaction was justifiable to some extent.
Well, only until they didn't cross the line and tried to get physical.
"Suddenly, why the infirmary looks so populated more than the classroom."
That was one of the nurses who spoke as she saw the number of injured students being dragged after getting knocked out by the Raven-haired beauty.
Some had the intent to take revenge, some still hadn't given up on the woman, and for some reason, a lot of boys had ecstatic smiles on their faces.
Slowly but surely, every student had returned to Eden's Academy after a short break to avoid the war and the repercussions of its aftermath.
Parents of various have asked for assurance from the school about their children's safety which the school didn't even try to bother.
Eden Academy never invites students to study here, nor do they ask for any basic tuition fee. The Academy is solely based on the motto to develop the youths into such fine young warriors that they never have to seek anyone's protection in the future.
On the path to becoming an entity worthy of being known across lands, one has to take some pains and risks so, in the future, they could shine the brightest.
-----------------------
Inside a wide auditorium could be seen hundreds of students crowding near the stage as they chatted leisurely while waiting for the event to start for which they got summoned.
All three years were called into the hall, where they stood in groups.
The first-year uniform consists of a dark blue and white combination. The male had a white blazer with blue stripes along with, the same shade of formal trousers, and a necktie. Females were given a one-piece uniform with a white top attached to the blue skirt, along with a thin belt on the waist and a red bowtie.
The second year's had a combination of Amber and Raven shades. And third, years wore similar texture clothing with black and white coloring.
Third-year uniforms looked a little adult-like since they depicted formal suits and gave a majestic feeling to the wearer.
