Among the first years stood the hero's party, too, with Sicily, Kyouki, and Lilia being the only ones left. Luna was also nearby, standing alone, but her aura was so dense that no one dared to approach her.
It was a rare occasion for each year to gather in one place. Although not certain, students got a gist that this was about the war which occurred some days ago and also might be the appearance of the new woman who was suspected to be a professor.
After half an hour or so, a man in his late twenties stepped forward with a stern expression on his face.
This person was a renowned professor of Eden Academy and also in charge of the homeroom of all the elite batches in the academy.
Professor S. Leone.
Walking to the podium, he tapped his wand twice on the wood, which made a low yet heavy voice across the hall and brought everyone's attention to the stage.
"Good evening, class. I know you all must have plans for the weekend, but this matter needs your immediate concern, so here we are."
His voice, despite being slightly shrill, gave an authoritative vibe as every eye got fixated on the lean man, who continued after a slight pause.
"I know you all are aware of the war which took place on the outlines of Eden's Academy. Some of you witnessed the catastrophe, and some of you only heard about it. But what makes all of you a single unit, is the powerlessness you carry. And it's not limited to only students. The guards, the professors, including me, and even the Grand Master Merlin isn't capable of dealing with that amount which we faced some days ago."
The faces of most students leaned down in shame, and some were plainly astonished since the speaker casually degraded the headmaster. But little did they know that Leone spoke only after what he had seen on the battlefield.
The professors standing in the aisle didn't waver from the bold statement since they also accepted their weakness against the hordes of demons.
The hall suddenly went dead silent before ever. Only after a couple of seconds, the ice was broken by Leone as he continued with his speech.
"This time, the Eden Academy became the battlefield. What about next time? Maybe the whole nation could become a division of red alert? Where will the students hide then?"
The slightly aggrieved tone made those who ran away from the fear of war, shiver in a fret as they didn't dare to lift their gaze.
But even with the shame, they knew what Leone was saying held credibility. If a horde of demons was able to shake one of the most strongest forts in the whole Gram nation, then what about an army of demons?
Students were unable to even imagine about it, and the same was for Hero's party. They were getting stronger, but with this development speed, they might not be able to withstand another war.
"So what are we supposed to do, professor? We are learning what we have been taught in the Academy. More than this, what can we do?"
One of the third year, who happened to be a student union member, spoke in an audible tone across the auditorium.
"You are correct, student Lewis. You all are doing what you can, but that wouldn't be enough from now. We all have to do something more to become a better version of ourselves. And for that, we need support which can uplift not only the students but us, professors too."
The noise of little chattering erupted from the groups as they heard Leone's words.
The assistance he spoke of wasn't just for Academy students but for the professors too. That meant teachers would also be learning along with the students!
After a small pause, Leone finally brought the topic for which this whole event was organized.
"Please welcome the newly appointed professor of Eden Academy who will be teaching us various arts from now on. Sir Austin!"
_______________________
A/N: - This is going to be a little awkward. Should I write chapters of Austin tutoring students or just explain it briefly along the lines?
Lemme know in the comments~

chapters.title: Chapter 101: Professor Austin~2!
chapters.content:
The hall was dead silent.
The quietness was so sharp in the auditorium after a certain someone appeared on the stage that teeth gnashing might have been heard if listened closely.
Every eye stared at the handsome blond youth standing at the center wearing a red robe which undoubtedly belonged to the typical uniform which every professor wears.
Coupled with the statement that Professor Leone threw earlier about students leveling up and all, it was undeniable that Austin was the newly appointed tutor.
Some students had look in disbelief. Some were like that they expected such a conclusion. But the problem arose from those who got utterly aggrieved by the fact that a mere teenager would be teaching them.
"Is it some kind of joke?"
"Isn't he just a first-year newbie rank?"
"Are we going to get instructed by such a noble disgrace?"
Small murmurs started erupting from the audience before a bold and scornful voice was raised as in to voice the thoughts of other chatterers.
"Isn't it disgraceful to put such a shamed noble above us all, Professor Leo? Or is it that Eden Academy has lost all their confidence in a single war?"
"Isn't it better if we just go back and study from our servants if the Academy is no longer capable of providing with a proper teacher?"
"Why is that person on stage when I can beat him anytime? I don't know what I would gain from learning from someone who's weaker than me."
Those who were shouting such baseless accusations and contempt were mostly third-years who didn't believe about Austin's contribution to the school protection.
Austin, on the other hand, anticipated such development. That's why he didn't even react a single bit, even though he was getting disdained from all around. He just felt fortunate that he already had convinced Luna not to react if something like this happens, but now he worries about how long she could hold.
'Her expression doesn't look good. '
**CLING**
Suddenly a blade slashing noise erupted from the stage which quieted down the crowd in the process.
Focusing his gaze on the front, Austin never noticed that someone from the audience had advanced to the stage as the person stood with his back facing Austin.
What the groups of students saw was the massive remarkable blade that was only built for a single entity, the hero.
With his back straightened, Kyouki stood with his hand placed on the butt of the handle and the tip of the blade on the wooden stage.
His eyes were cold enough to share a frightening shiver among the third years as they heard a heavy voice resonating from the person in front.
"If anyone doubts Austin's capability, then duel with me. Only any of you can beat me; you will find the chance to take Austin on since, by any means, Austin is far stronger than me. So make it quick and come at me."
His voice was stern, unlike his usual self, which stays cheerful and bright all the time. Not to talk about the severeness in his gaze, which explicitly told how serious he was with his words.
Those who were shaming Austin and those who were thinking of him as a weakling halted their mouth in an instant.
Even though the hero wasn't a warrior to face a whole army alone, but it doesn't change the fact he still is way above than average students.
Challenging a hero would not only bring disgrace from the outside world but also the chance of getting killed in the process lies in the possibility.
No one dared to utter a single word from that point onward.
Kyouki surveyed the audience for once before turning toward Austin.
The blond youth had a surprised look on his face as the verbal taunts were lopped smoother than he thought.
"Thanks, man."
"No problem."
With a nod, Kyouki walked away from the stage as he stood at his previous spot.
For some reason, Kyouki felt Luna was glaring at his back intently, which made his forehead covered in sweat since he knew why she was annoyed with him.
Walking with a steady step, Austin moved forward before the first of words were spoken.
"Okay then, let's get over with this real quick."
___________________
At the same time, in a beautiful garden where various colorful flowers, along with the pleasant evening sun peeking from the horizon, sat an incredibly gorgeous girl.
By looks, she seemed to be in her teenage but the aura she carried around made people think that they are greeting a prominent noble in the appearance of a girl.
This woman was none other than the eldest princess of Gram, Tiara.
Her platinum blond hair which covered her forehead and braided on her back, shimmered elegantly in the sunlight as she sipped the milk tea.
It was one of her habits to sit alone in peace and think about the person whom she desired most to have.
'I wonder what he is doing right now... '
Might be the lady luck has blessed her today, as the spy which she has been planted on the Eden Academy suddenly arrived near her, before kneeling on the ground with his fist thumped on his chest.
"Greetings, Your highness."
"Tell me."
Tiara didn't bother looking at the man as she asked in between her sips before she picked the cookie in her hand, only to break it in the end after hearing the report.
"I just got the intel that Sir Austin would be now teaching in the academy for a temporary basis."
Her eyes widened as she dropped the broken cookie and looked at the man with astonishment.
"Are you completely sure, about what you just said?"
"My neck would compensate if my words come out untrue."
Complete silence fell in the garden as Taira instructed the spy to go away.
Tiara rested her back on the chair as she thought about the information she had gotten.
A sadistic smile formed on her lips as she thought of something truly unladylike before a an idea emerged in her mind.
'Seems it finally time for me to get proper academic knowledge~.'
___________________
A/N: - Now here comes the yandere in light. I wonder what would happen if she and Luna comes face to face.
**Tremble**
Drop a comment if you are hyped~

chapters.title: Chapter 102: Step on me Goddess~
chapters.content:
Eden Academy.
The first pillar of the school was established at the time when Gram was going through its worst time. War was undergoing, to be precise.
At that time, a fine young man emerged with the support of the First Emperor. That young man was the pioneer of the Academy and grandfather of the current headmaster of Eden Academy.
The timeline of the family of Grandmasters was so imbalanced that in the period of ten Emperors' lifetime, only three of the Grandmasters appeared and helped Gram in various means.
The recruitment of faculties in the Academy isn't done on a diploma or achievement basis. Principals themselves take the role of appointing who is worthy of teaching at the academy.
That goes for students too.
Whoever has the talent and strength to pass the entrance exam can only enter the gates of the ultimate temple of learning.
From the beginning, no one thought there would be a time when a student would take charge of tutoring dignified professors and elite students.
The piece of news that a mere student previously evaluated as Newbie class no less would be appointed at such a position and provide tutelage so the members of Eden Academy could prepare for any unforeseen danger in the future made various from the outside world go insane.
But that didn't stop things from taking place inside the Academy.
After the announcement, the students were divided into four divisions.
The first group consisted of 400 students who have proficiency with Elemental Type Magice.
The second group had 700 students who had the ability to conjure their spells. This and the first group were differentiated by a lot of trouble, but after Austin thoroughly told them the theory behind the conjurors and element users, groups were formed without much hassle.
The third was the Inheritance type group, along with the Cerebral field of magic and Healing type. This was the least populated group since not many get something from their ancestors in their bloodline, and if about Psychic Wizards, then one could even count on fingers how many are them.
The last group contained those who excel in physical prowess. The augmenter and warrior class students, who rely primarily on their limbs and weapons, joined the group and made this team the densest with a number of a thousand students.
The first and second group was monitored by Austin himself, but as one could expect, he isn't a supreme deity being who has reach in every field.
So what he did was ask for help.
The third group was supervised by the Saintess of Humanity, Luna.
And for the last group...
"I am so lucky that I chose this group. Ah...I wish she steps on me someday..."
"Hey, look at those...I wonder they would fit in my grip..."
"Like hell, you could even touch our goddess. She isn't for only one. Goddess is for everyone!"
These kinds of awe-filled conversations were flowing among the students as they saw a black-haired, amazingly proportionate woman walking onto the stage, built in the field.
Unlike with her brother, when her eyes contain nothing but genuine love and gentleness, her current self of Saya was looking extremely domineering.
Wearing a sleeveless top that exposed her toned stomach along with black pants, which helped her move unrestrainedly, Saya halted in the middle of the wooden platform before turning her head toward the crowd.
Kyouki was on the front row as he saw Saya, but unlike in the past when he had seen her fawning over Austin all over the place, she seemed utterly different.
"So you are the lot which I have to teach how to hold a steel, eh..."
Her voice, despite not being backed with mana, resonated heavily around the field, reaching to everyone as some of them became shunned in astonishment to hear their goddess speaking for the first time.
"Before that...first, you have to show your worth to be here."
Some of the students frowned in perplexion as they heard something they had never thought of. An exam to be in class was simply absurd, but before anyone could have voiced their thoughts, something massive happened.
A sheer pressure that felt like a heavy boulder weighing on their shoulder, made the warrior shudder in a fret.
It felt like their worst nightmare had arisen right before their eyes as a black shadow above the stage appeared with its blood-red eyes staring into the very soul of each individual.
Various from the third year knew it was just an illusion of the raven-haired woman's aura. But who could stand still when death was seemingly felt this close to their mortal thread?
"Wield your weapon, and I will consider you my student."
Saya's voice amidst the mental chaos reverberated as she planted the tip of her blade on the platform and dared the students to take upon the challenge.
In all honesty, she wanted everyone to back away so she could enjoy her time with her brother. And in the first place, she didn't have much experience in teaching someone other than her brother, who is a good listener.
But against her expectations, someone pulled his sword and took an impressive stance with a hulking roar.
"Haaaaah!"
It was Hero Kyouki who took the sword and stood without much difficulty. The amount of intent Saya poured was far from her best, so Kyouki didn't have much difficulty to stand against it.
Slowly some of the other students, majorly those who solely practice their martial strengths, succeeded in pulling out their weapons one after another, through great trouble.
There were those too, who were falling on their knees because of the tremendous pressure which they had never felt before.
The number of fallen students was increasing vigorously when the intent suddenly was pulled back before a masculine voice reached up to the students.
"I told you not to overdo it. These are just students, Saya."
Uplifting their gazes, what they saw made various mouths open in utter shock.
The woman who looked almighty and arrogant a second ago was now bowing in front of Austin as she pleaded her apology.
"I am deeply sorry, Onii-sama. I got carried away."
With a sigh, Austin accepted his defeat before he brought his hand to Saya's head, much to everyone's gasp.
Saya felt butterflies erupting in her belly as she enjoyed the caresses of her brother so openly.
So bold~
"Go a little easy on them, Saya."
Saying so, Austin levitated away, leaving a disappointed imouto behind.
Regaining her composure, Saya again turned her head toward the crowd as she spoke a little softer this time.
"Okay, now let's get onto the real thing, shall we?"
______________________
Austin didn't go to check on Luna since he knew, Luna was a better teacher than he could ever become.
He already told those included in his class to manipulate their mana and convert it in an identifiable shape. That was the most challenging thing one could achieve as a beginner mage.
Since he has read various novels and manga in his past life, mana manipulation was the first thing he learned at the age of ten. Now he has become a veteran in playing with his natural energy.
He was about to land in the gym where the elemental-type magician was practicing when an eagle-like paper flew up to him.
Catching the bird, Austin realized it was a mana mail from the headmaster.
Scratching the seal, he read the content before a confused frown grew over his brows.
[-Austin
Meet me at my office. Someone from the Royal Palace has arrived and wants to meet you in person.
-Merlin.]
_____________________
A/N: - I am taking this phase a little fast forwardly since it really doesn't matter to the main plot, to that extent.
A little drama will surely ensue but don't worry nothing would ruin their relationship.
Drop a comment~

chapters.title: Chapter 103: Spell formation~1!
chapters.content:
**Knock**
"Come in."
As Austin knocked twice on the office door, a familiar voice allowed his entrance inside.
"Excuse me."
Saying so, Austin stepped inside before closing the door on his back.
It didn't take him long to judge who came here to visit him, since he had already sensed this particular mana signature a week or so ago.
But just to his visual affirmation, his eyes went to the person who stood up from the chair upon Austin's arrival.
Platinum blond hair, azure eyes, and a petite yet well proportionate stature stood the first princess of the nation, Tiara der Gramduör.
With a bright smile currently adoring her lovely face, she pinched the hem of her gown before bowing elegantly.
"Even our first meeting wasn't the ideal one; I hope we can get along, Sir Austin."
Remembering the hassle created in the ceremonial event due to Austin's entrance with the Ojou-sama, his brows twitched slightly.
Regaining his composure, Austin also bowed before extending his greetings.
"Pleased to meet, Your Highness."
"Please trim the formalities, Sir Austin, since from now on, we would be sharing a relation which would make you my superior. "
Perplexed, Austin thought about what she said, before turning himself toward the white-bearded mage sitting across them while sipping on his tea.
"Headmaster?"
"Umm....yeah. Princess Tiara wants to learn sorcery from you since she believes no one in the grand palace is capable of handling her."
Austin blinked toward the principal in bafflement before turning his gaze toward the princess, and saw her still smiling, like being indirectly called spoilt, which didn't bother her.
Austin knows that the mages in the capital aren't that high rankers, but still, they were way above the professors teaching in Eden Academy. Especially those magicians of the Royal Order who works under the supervision of Alex Nuèye.
Well, it was understandable since the Royal Order doesn't generally get free time to do anything other than protect their nation. Whether it teleportation center's monitoring or surveillance of foreign countries, the court magician grinds all year long until they don't die because of exhaustion.
"I don't have a problem. Join whichever group suits your proficiency, Your Highness. You can ask for details from the principal. "
Austin bowed again and was about to excuse himself since he had various things left hanging back in the gym when Merlin spoke up.
"Austin...if possible, can you tutor her personally?"
Being the highest nobility of the Gram, it was justifiable that Tiara wouldn't want to be seen being taught by some ex-noble teenager. There was a chance that the spies from the foreign lands might suspect the inner strength of The Gram palace crumbling, which resulted in the princess leaving her home to study.
No child of Emperor William, has left the palace to learn anything other than life experience. So this exception might bring some unwanted chaos.
But...
"Aren't you getting a little demanding, Headmaster?"
It would be a lie to say that Merlin didn't expect such a response, given how much he had asked from Austin already. The case of Gram's reputation is one thing, but for that, he couldn't put all the burden on Austin.
And in all honesty, Merlin wasn't sure when Austin would get up and leave the school since there isn't a single thing, this blond youth is gaining here whatsoever.
"I understand. I apologize, Austin."
Tiara seemed to be panicking because of the development since she never asked for private tutoring. Tho she wouldn't have minded it, but being alone with Austin might lead to her heart failure, so what Austin said, was in her interest too.
"Ano ne, Austin-san. Please treat me like others too, and I also apologize in Merlin-sama's stead."
Saying so, Tiara bowed her head deeply as she also apologized for being so imposing, even though she just wanted to be near Austin.
Seeing the two figures who were higher than him socially, Austin felt his brows tightening as he massaged his temple.
With a heavy sigh, he called his defeat as he spoke in a mild tone.
"Join the class I would be giving to the professor. By that, you won't get seen by students, and the chances of rumors would also fall off to some extent."
Raising her head with surprise spread like a white sheet, Tiara blinked like an innocent child before a heart-warming smile curved her lips.
"Hai."
_____________________
After some hours, inside a room which by setting looked like a typical classroom with a blackboard attached to the wall and desk-benches arranged in a three-row divisions, sat numerous people.
But unlike from what one could expect, they weren't teenage students who were occupying these seats, but adult-looking men and women.
These people were the professors of Eden Academy who gathered in the classroom to get taught by someone they had always looked down upon.
Some professors were annoyed at the start, but after remembering the war which occurred some weeks ago, they let go of their pride and sat obediently.
Princess Tiara also came to be taught by the professor as she sat separately from the others so the teacher could look at her particularly.
Amidst the silence, a young youth walked inside the room.
Austin got rid of his long red coat before hanging it on the pole along the way as he was getting heated up quite a lot in that new add-on of clothing.
Walking up to the aisle, Austin naturally felt a little nervous since the position of the people inside has plainly swapped.
But it was just for some days, so he can manage somehow.
"Let's initiate today's class of basic spell formation."
Since he had no idea how he should be commencing the lecture, he stuck to the straightforward method.
And looking at the older one's expression, it seemed they didn't mind about such trivial things at all.
Austin exhaled heavily before he unbuttoned his cuffs and folded his sleeves.
Little did he know that a certain someone was almost drooling on the sight as she somehow remained poker face while her inner mind screamed otherwise.
Turning toward the audience, Austin formed a mana circle that had four rings drawn. The outermost ring was one meter in diameter, and the innermost measured 30 centimeters across.
"This formation is conjured for the spell Fireball beginner level. I know you all have realized it already."
As one could expect from the veteran mages, everyone nodded along with the princess as the fireball was one of the spells, one learns as their primary.
"How much time do we require to form such an average spell? From what I have observed, four seconds is for those who have been a mage for years or are simply talented, just like professor Emily."
The young brunette professor blushed slightly as she lowered her gaze and nodded along with the others.
Tiara didn't miss the reaction, but she kept it aside for now.
Four seconds was a stretch for some professors, but if focused like a monk, they could pull up such spell in four seconds or even less.
Getting everyone's affirmation, Austin continued.
"There are four mana circles, and the time required is four seconds. So does that mean each ring takes a second to form?"
Austin waved his hand before the illusionary mana circle got drawn upon the blackboard so that he could get a clear look at the students.
He didn't have to wait when one of the professors, who happened to be Austin's homeroom teacher, too, answered in a mild tone.
"No, it doesn't work like that. Every mana circle has its own roles, and it takes different times to create and regulate them to extract the best results."
"Correct, professor Blake. Each circle takes a different duration to get enchanted. But what if one of the circles gets skimmed over, but still the result concludes the same?"
The room fell silent on Austin's subjective question as the professors looked at him in disbelief.
What he said explicitly told that he intended to remove a mana circle but still would reach the same goal, albeit in a little less time.
It wasn't just close to impossible; it might cause havoc!
"I-Is that even possible, Sir Austin."
Tiara raised her voice since the older ones were too shocked even to utter a single word.
Hearing the meek tone, Austin smiled for a second before he displayed something which would change a whole lot of things from this day on.
_____________________
A/N: - I am trying to build the background through this chapter which I think is necessary. Please let me know if you enjoyed the chapter.

chapters.title: Chapter 104: Spell Formation~2!
chapters.content:
There are different kind of spell humanity have witnessed since ancient type. Not all those magic miracles need a typical circle to show their effect.
The skill of changing the natural phenomenon by utilizing the essence one is born with, known as mana, and converging that energy in a runic circle is commonly known as Conjuring.
Unlike the Elemental type Magicians, who take the help of their surroundings to summon a spell, Conjurors doesn't rely on the uncertain background or any element around.
Conjurors create something out of nothing. And for that, any magi is required to form the mana circle, which determines what kind of spell they desire to release.
There are various kinds of spells that Conjuror type of magicians can cast but not available for elemental type. Not to mention the only necessity is to remember the spell formation, and the magi could survive in any kind of condition.
Now about the Mana Circles.
The ancient language, which most magicians learn as their basic course, becomes the base of the spell formation.
Since there isn't a single field of the spell, the number of mana rings varies according to the complexity of the enchantment.
The basic spell like [Fireball] or [Stone Wall] requires four rings to construct the formation and release the spell.
The first and outermost ring is the structure or, to say, the outline of the spell that the user wants to create according to their requirement, like how an architect draws the blue map of a building. If the building(spell) is complicated, the circle might increase.
The second ring is where the magician imbues mana to the spell. It's common sense to know that different kind of spells varies the requirement of mana. This part is crucial since if the imbalance of magic energy occurs, the user might face severe backlash.
The third and the most descriptive ring. Unlike the other two, this mana circle requires nothing but a sane mind. After getting an outline and mana as the material for construction, the third ring helps in giving the spell a definite shape.
One has to remember that if the spell doesn't get molded in a particular shape, the whole mana circle might obliterate at once.
And the last and innermost ring. This work is done by users' senses as they target, where to utilize the spell and release it in accordance.
This is the essential procedure of conjuring that the magi needs to follow in order to extract their potential and invoke the art of spell.
________.
"You all must have a great command on mana, right? Can anyone create a bird through flames?"
Austin asked the students who previously used to teach him as he leaned on the ledge of the blackboard.
The older ones glanced at each other before the brunette beauty, Emily, swirled her index finger and formed an aggressive Phoenix within half a second.
"Excellent professor. Now, I seize the liberty to assume that everyone present here, takes the same time to conjure something trivial like this?"
Austin glanced at each corner and significantly halted his gaze on the first princess, who nodded, albeit being a little flustered.
Receiving the affirmation, Austin continued his lecture.
"Now, as I assume, Professor Emily must have just pictured the bird in her mind for almost a tenth of a second and created it using the blaze element, right?"
Emily did what Austin just stated, so she nodded without hesitation.
"Now, back on the track. Does everyone know what this ring does?"
Pointing at the third ring drawn on the blackboard, Austin asked the students as everyone nodded affirmatively.
Tiara was also aware of the magic circles to a decent extent, so she also shook her head vertically.
"Unlike the other circles, this one takes a whole lot of time since magicians have to picture the shape and figure; they want their spell to blast out. But what if we erase this circle and let our subconscious do the spell molding as what Professor Emily did with the Phoenix? What if the most time-consuming ring gets prepared when we create the blue print, imbue the mana, and get ready to release it? Can you imagine what margin of time we can save like that?"
Audible gasps resonated in the classroom as various teachers looked at Austin like he just has chanted the worst curse in front of them.
Some of the older professors, among the others, fell into deep contemplation upon hearing the theory syllable by syllable.
Indeed it was confirmed that the third circle takes the most time, and skipping that laboring task would not only help the mage release the spell at a lesser time but also decrease some burden from them.
"I-Its absurd to even think something like that! A single mistake in a circle formation and the chanter would die using a mere fireball!"
One of the white-bearded Professors of Potion Brewing spoke with a slight sneer as he completely disregarded the thesis that Austin presented.
"Well, you won't change until you keep on doing the same thing. If you don't risk your safety, then it's better to leave the class and do what you believe is right, no?"
Mercilessly, Austin suggested the professor leave the class if he doesn't like what Austin was teaching. But the bearded one didn't even flinch from his position but only turned his head away.
"But how do we erase the circle but still cast the spell, Sir Austin?"
Tiara raised her voice as she still was unclear about the long explanation Austin gave before the buzzing of professors started.
But it wasn't Austin who responded, but...
"By mastering, every spell one knows about...right?"
"Absolutely correct, Professor Leone. You have to become proficient in the spell you know, so your mind creates a reflection of the spell in a corner of your memory. In that way, you can just replicate that piece of memory without needing to form it every single time."
The class fell into deep silence. As long the students kept on thinking about the hypothesis Austin provided, the more it started to seem plausible.
Amidst the silence, suddenly, the door of the classroom swung open, much to Austin's annoyance since he liked the act of being a teacher.
But before he could have said anything, Austin's breath got choked as he saw the person standing there with a grim expression adorning her face.
"It's already four hours, Dear Professor Austin~ Are you planning to go all-nighter?"
____________________
A/N: - She is just like that. Demanding and domineering. The next chapter would be fluffy.
Comment down to let me know whether the story is progressing alright.

chapters.title: Chapter 105: Are you seducing me?!
chapters.content:
After Luna's arrival, all the professors left the class wordlessly since they didn't want to get mingled in a lover's quarrel.
Austin announced the next class would be after three days, so until then, all the students were given the task to at least master one spell and use it in the way Austin described in the class.
It was a tough job to accomplish, but in the end, no one complained and accepted the challenge with a bold front.
Now in the classroom were left only three people. Two undoubtedly were the famous couple, Luna and Austin. And as for the third one...
"It's a pleasure to meet you, Luna-san."
Pinching the hem of her gown, Tiara elegantly bowed and greeted Humanity's greatest hope and the dear girlfriend of her professor~
Luna also stood straight before returning the gesture.
"Likewise, Your Highness."
Austin, who was just to the left of Luna, took the coat off the hanger before draping it over Luna's shoulder as he spoke in a concerned voice.
"Aren't you cold in that?"
Tiara's eyes went round as she saw the considerate gesture from Austin. Even though her face was smiling, a very frightening thought emerged in her mind, which she probably would keep a hold on.
On the other side, Luna felt a smile blooming on her face but remembering that she was currently angry because of Austin, she held back herself.
"It's nice to have a man like Sir Austin as your lover, no?"
Luna's attention fell back on the princess as she heard her query, which genuinely didn't feel like Luna was getting asked. It seemed Tiara was stating the fact on which Luna couldn't agree more.
"Yes, it is. Even though he is a little careless at times and forgives people easily, he is a good person to have by my side."
Austin smiled, being praised by the person he loves since her compliments were something he could never get tired of.
Meekly he extended his hand and held hers. Luna tried to brush it away but soon conceded after seeing his innocent eyes.
'This guy.... '
"Okay then, Princess. We would be heading off."
Saying so, Austin bowed slightly before pulling Luna away from the room. Luna apologetically looked at Tiara for a second before following her persistent man.
Left alone in the cold dark room, Tiara thought about various things. There were numerous plans circulating in her mind, but amidst the chaos, a single drop of pearl-like tear dripped down her cheek as she gawked at the distancing back of the man she adores.
Her legs gave away as she plopped down on the ground with a train of thoughts muddling her head.
'Why does he smile like that for her, not me...Why you held her hand, not mine...Why we didn't meet earlier...Why do you love her, not me...Why it must be her...Why? Why? Why? Why? WHY?!'
"I...also...want...you
_______________________
"I said I am sorry... "
"Don't talk to me! You said we would have dinner together. Now it's already ten! "
Luna grumbled as she walked ahead of Austin, but still, their hands were connected with fingers intervened like an unbeatable bond.
Austin promised her to conclude all his lessons by eight, and then after, they would have dinner in the cafeteria and spend the night without a talk of the outside world. Just him and her.
But professor Austin got so immense being a teacher that he ruined the first part of their date resulting in Luna's current mood.
Seeing that regular persuasion wouldn't work on the current Saintess, Austin decided on the rougher option.
Austin suddenly grabbed her wrist and pressed Luna on the corridor wall.
"Ah! "
Luna yelped slightly as she found herself caged in between the sturdy arms of the boy in front.
With his left-hand pressing Luna's wrist on the wall and the other one grabbing her back, Austin lowered his head and whispered his words.
"You know your angry face looks incredibly enchanting, right? Are you trying to seduce me? "
A blush heated her ears as she felt the hot breath hitting her face along with the robust arm holding her waist like he owns it, made Luna gulp in excitement.
But she couldn't accept her defeat now.
"You...and your sweet talking. "
Turning her head, Luna pouted, but the redness her cheeks getting dyed in, exposed her true feelings.
"You know what, Luna... "
Bringing himself toward her, Austin almost pressed her against the wall, as her supple breast got mashed against him.
"I have decided my dinner... "
Luna's breathing became ragged as she lowered her gaze as Austin bit on her earlobe before chanting what he desired the most currently.
"I am going to eat you whole until you beg me to stop... "
(A/N: - R-18 on Patreon;)
______________________
The next morning, Luna felt the warmth beside her distancing as she parted her lids slowly and let the slightly illuminated room get adjusted to her view. There was a peculiar smell in the air which made her brows frown as her daze finally got exhausted.
The first thing that came to her view was a lean yet sturdy back that had visible scratch marks, which she inflicted in the heat last night.
Extending her hand, she healed Austin's back which made Austin aware that she had woken up.
"Sorry for disturbing you. "
Austin extinguished the fire serpent from the top of his index finger as he also threw the cigarette he had in his other hand.
"You again smoking that...I don't like its smell... "
In a groggy voice, Luna complained before Austin took her in his arms and, while embracing her fondly, laid down on the bed.
"It just helps me think better."
Austin was aware that the smell of smoke annoys Luna, so he always did it when she wasn't around, but early in the morning, a thought troubled him, which arose his urge to smoke a real quick one out.
"And what were you thinking? "
Feeling her favorite warmth all over her naked body, Luna became calm as she asked in a soft tone.
"About the labyrinth."
Luna's drowsiness depleted in an instant as she heard about the place, which nearly freaked her out some days ago when she returned from Aurora.
It was the second time that Luna felt her mana being weakened to that extent, but unlike the demon artifact, the effect of Labyrinth was profoundly terrifying.
"It seems we have been ignoring something which would bite our back in the future... "
____________________
A/N: - Austin has learned that the best defense is to attack that's why he has switched roles with Luna.
Anyway, the next chapter would reveal some of the massive facts about the main arc of the story.
The novel is far from completion, but the beginning of it has already commenced.

chapters.title: Chapter 106: Second Favorite!
chapters.content:
"How did you feel, Luna? Inside the labyrinth?"
Basking in the little sunlight peeking through the curtains, a couple consisting of an otherworldly silver-haired young girl and a handsome blond youth laid down on the bed while embracing each other.
Their naked body squeezed in an intimate space as Austin asked in the context of his previous concern.
Luna thought for a second about the peculiar sensation she felt for the second time in her life. Straightening her posture, she rested the back of her head on Austin's arm before answering.
"It was a strange feeling. Unlike the demonic artifact which suppressed my life energy, the chills from the labyrinth made it seem that I never had something called mana inside of me. Like the connection from the actuality was getting severed inside that hole."
Austin nodded as he also felt that the reach of mana became scarce in the depth of the labyrinth. It won't be weird to say that the wormhole built underneath the Academy was restricting mana entirely.
It was like a vacuum space.
Even Austin had limited his mana; he could still feel the disability like a prominent limb had been snatched away from him.
Since he believed Luna had a unique kind of mana, he wanted to hear her opinion on this, and strangely or not, the conclusion came out the same.
"Might be some kind of divine artifact again?"
Luna sensed Austin's uneasiness since he gets bothered by something he isn't completely aware of. She was also troubled by the peculiarity of the labyrinth, but she didn't pay much mind until Austin brought it up.
"Might be, but I think there's something more to it."
Austin whispered in a profound manner before he took something out of his inventory.
By outer appearance, it seemed a pouch that carried some fluid as Austin brought it closer to Luna before asking.
"Can you assess this?"
With a perplexed frown, Luna looked at the pouch before nodding as her eyes shined with a cyan hue as she appraised the thing inside within ten seconds.
"Grade 'S' venom, which might put sleep to this whole school if another of those pouches gets mixed in the next meal. Highly resistant to Holy Magic and belongs to a serpent which I have never assessed until now. Other than these, the most concerning fact is that the venom doesn't contain an ounce of mana."
Austin nodded and gave an admirable smile to Luna, making the latter shy away. Putting the bag inside the inventory, Austin arranged the strands of her beautiful hair before tucking them back of her ear, as he further commented.
"That's what I thought. The creature that I battled in the labyrinth, wasn't utilizing mana and was just relying on its physical characterization. It was the first time I faced someone without essence or curse energy yet so decently powerful."
Venom, despite being lethal, couldn't harm superhumans like Austin until mana isn't injected into it. But here, the thing which came out of the serpent queen was dangerous even to Mana-wielding humans, despite being completely natural.
"How can such a being doesn't have magical essence in them? And even if they had, I guess that environment in the labyrinth would become their deathbed."
Luna muttered under her breath, which Austin was also thinking, but soon he brushed the matter off as he calmed Luna's growing curiosity.
"Well, we won't find answers until we dwell inside the abyss. And for that, we have to make various preparation so halt those thoughts for now."
Saying so, Austin turned toward Luna before hugging her fondly in his embrace. Luna also didn't hold back in snuggling close as she smiled in delight.
But soon, her eyes parted before she narrowed her gaze toward the man as she asked in a suspicious tone.
"Austin~What's this hot thing sticking to my belly?"
Austin grinned as he replied, "Why don't you appraise it too?"
___________________
"Why are you guys so late even though we talked about eating breakfast together? Now it's already mid-noon."
Inside the semi-crowded cafeteria of the Eden Academy grumbled a charming raven-haired woman as she chewed on her prawn salad.
"Ask your brother. He didn't learn the word restrain, I think."
Luna also grumbled as she felt the stings on her neck which, despite getting healed, gave a burning sensation. Not to talk about her butt.
Austin, on the other side, had an apologetic smile on his face as he passed mixed herb soup to his lover and got up to get a lot of sweets to fix her mood.
Saya wasn't a child to not understand what could have made these two's arrival delay. But there wasn't anything she could do other than lower her gaze and accept the reality.
Luna's eyes observed the troubled storms inside Saya's mind as she asked in a bland tone.
"Don't tell you've already given up, dear Imouto-chan~."
Saya didn't have the mood to retort the teasing as she continued eating her salad which started to seem a little tasteless now.
"Will it even make any difference? Onii-sama would never look at me as a woman."
Said in a defeated tone was the girl who had almost lost hope in making her brother see her in a different light. Whatever she tried resulted in nothing.
"Well, you didn't approach him properly."
Hearing Luna's remark, Saya narrowed her gaze before she asked in a heavy voice.
"And what is that?"
"Lean your head forward."
Despite being baffled, Saya did as Luna asked before she started whispering something which Saya had never expected to hear from her.
**WHISPER**WHISPER**
"A-are you serious about that?!"
With wide-eyed, Saya asked after she listened to every detail Luna gave her.
"Of course, it would. I know your brother the best in those departments, after all."
Luna confidently announced as she resumed her soup while she waited for the treat Austin had gone to get for her.
Saya remained silent for several seconds before a natural query came out of her lips.
"Why are you helping me seduce Onii-sama when you love him so much? Won't you fear that I might snatch him away?"
Luna answered in a way that it seemed she anticipated such a question.
"I just pity you. I wasn't with Austin for long before we became a couple, and you spent years with him yet failed even to make him see you as a potential love interest. And about that snatching away part. You might get some of his love, but at the end of the day, I will always remain his first woman, dear Imouto-chan~."
All of her words were spoken with utter confidence, like she believed Austin's favorability on her more than anything. Saya was astonished for a second before she smirked.
"Well, don't blame me if I become his second favorite."
"What are you guys chatting about? Here it's yours, Saya. And the rest belongs to Luna."
Austin appeared all of a sudden as he placed a plate of Apple pie in front of his sister and half a dozen of different desserts for his angered lover.
Just as he put down the last plate, he sensed something approaching him before he twirled on his toe and caught the little thing in his grip.
Loosening his hold, Austin found it was a mana mail as the two women asked almost in unison.
""Who is it from? ""
Austin's eyes were solemn with a little spark hidden behind his emerald gems as he whispered under his breath.
"Mother...."
____________________
A/N: - Yay!
We reached a century of chapters.
Thanks for all those who have been reading my story and will come across in future.
This is my first novel in which I have came this far.
It's all thanks to those who always support me and help me to keep moving forward.
Love you, guys❤️
I hope we can share this relationship for a little longer until we don't reach the end of this journey.
Anyway, thanks a lot and please do drop a comment ~

chapters.title: Chapter 107: Sophia Wright!
chapters.content:
[Sophia Wright POV:]
(A/N: - Austin's mother)
Being a biased mother was never in my plan since I learned what the terms marriage and children meant.
I come from a high noble family where we get educated about everything related to the man we would be marrying, or how we should raise our child.
When I got betrothed to my husband, Vincent Wright, I vowed to do my all to support this man in whichever means I could and do my best to raise our child to become a responsible pillar of the Count family.
Despite being less expressive about his feelings, I know Vincent loves me dearly, which fulfilled my life.
Within a year, the fruit of our love resulted in a baby, making our already happy life even more joyful. It might be one of the most touching moments when I felt my baby inside me.
Fortunately, without any massive trouble in our life, nine months passed and I delivered our firstborn. It was really a memorable day for Vincent and me as we saw the little baby lying cozily in his father's embrace.
Our little Austin.
But even before I could have adequately held my child for the first time in my arms, a prophecy was bestowed that snatched our happiness at once.
I still couldn't remember the accurate words, but the voice told: one day, this child would become the entity who would stand alone from all—the one who would accept the world as his enemy.
I was devasted to the very end of my soul. It felt like the perfect picture I had imagined was tainted.
We didn't lose hope there and called for the pope from the capital. From what he said, it seemed Austin indeed had a dark future that would lead him to complete solitary.
We jumped from Saint to fortune tellers, but the conclusion was the same. Austin was a cursed child.
When I felt that every route was getting blocked, Vincent proposed an idea that I still couldn't believe I had heard from him.
'Shouldn't we just get rid of the future threat until we have the time... '
I still remember that day when the man I thought to be the kindest person out there said such cruel words, which made my heart shatter into pieces.
We had a huge argument that day, but I somehow convinced Vincent that no matter how much of a monster he thought of my Austin, he still was our child.
I suggested that we would treat him indifferently, so he could naturally leave the name of Wright. It was a tough decision for me, but getting my child slaughtered would be the last thing I wanted.
That little thing hadn't even opened his eyes, and here his own father was about to put an end to him. That day, I first time regretted my marriage to Vincent.
Soon Vincent decided to have another child since it would help to carry the liege without having the chance to let Austin get involved in throne succession.
I accepted all of it. I just wanted my little Austin to live.
Even I could never tell my son how much his mother cares for him. Even I could never embrace my child and give him the warmth he deserves. Even though I could never enjoy his achievement or share his grief, it was okay.
Until Austin lived, I was ready to accept anything.
I gave him my family's heirloom in the name of a parting gift; even Vincent didn't want me to meet Austin. But how could I have restricted myself?
I knew Austin might lose his life in the fight with Captain Charles, so my meeting with him became even more necessary.
No one knew about the moonstone I gave Austin since it would have created an unwanted hassle.
The image of Austin's hopeful eyes before the battle is still vivid in my memory. Even though he has grown up all noble and handsome, I still saw that little Austin in him, who used to crawl all around the house at the age of only seven months.
That day, I cried over and over again after returning mansion. I was glad and proud that Austin not only survived the battle but also gave almost defeat to Captain Charles.
But that feeling of pride wasn't able to suppress the grief I felt after seeing that expectant gaze my son directed at me. His beautiful eyes, which held the wish to talk to me even for an extra second, made my heart clench.
I am his mother, for God's Sake!!
Yet... I... I...
"Madame? What happened?!"
"Ah..."
Suddenly I heard the call of my maid as she moved toward me before wiping my cheeks with a soft cloth.
It seemed I still wasn't able to suppress my emotions completely.
"My lady, are you missing Master Austin?"
My handmaid, Sufi, who came from my old house, knows everything about the things I have gone through. Other than my assistance, she serves me as a true friend too.
She is the only person who calls Austin in such a respectful manner since she also has seen how unfortunate that child's life has been.
"Well, even though I wear the facade of an uncaring woman, this heart still seeks the child who called me Mama for the first time."
A smile curved on my lips as I remembered the day Austin spoke for the first time when he was only a year old.
Such a brilliant child.
"Ah, my lady...that letter?"
Looking at the desk, I realized that I subconsciously had sent the letter while I reminisced about Austin.
A look of horror spread like a sheet as I thought, what could I have written on that letter?
'I hope I didn't mention something shameless.....'
____________________
"What is it written inside, Austin?"
With a perplexed gaze, Luna asked as she tried to peek into the letter that Austin received some seconds ago from his mother.
But before she could have caught a glimpse, Austin folded the paper back as he looked at the two with a delightful smile, much to Luna's curiosity.
"What happened, Nii-sama?"
Even Saya had a little idea about Austin's parents in this life; she could see how happy her brother was after receiving the letter, which made her smile too.
After a slight pause, he spoke in a cheery tone.
"I might be gone for some days."
_____________________
A/N: - Some drama. Some tears. Some relevance. Let's see where this goes~

chapters.title: Chapter 108: No professor Austin?!
chapters.content:
Inside a classroom sat numerous adults, along with a pretty princess currently adorning with a beautiful smile across her face.
This class was under the supervision of none other than the infamous noble Austin, who had been teaching the teachers about Conjuring for the past ten days or so.
Various professors, along with the brilliant mage, Tiara, had gotten a hold of the passage of chanting a spell in a much lesser time, as for what Austin explained.
It was a slow start since the theory was entirely foreign to the old-timers, but it was their experience that helped the professors to learn the absurd way of casting a spell.
The class of Conjurors went in a three-cycle period. First was the explanation. Austin clarified the theory of how to erase the third circle of different kinds of spells. Not everyone uses the same element, so the idea needs to be altered. Therefore this stage contains the most significance.
The second step was to practice what they had been taught. One could only become a bookworm if the theoretical knowledge isn't implicated in real life. Mana manipulation, along with mind training through meditation and whatnot, is processed in the second stage.
The third stage was to show the results that Austin asks for in the next class. Everyone was tasked to at least master one spell in two days. Once a person gets a hold of how to erase a circle yet accomplish the spell, it becomes a lot easier to do it repeatedly.
Things were going smoothly from the other two sides, too.
Luna was teaching the lot in her own way, which was bringing out results, albeit a little slower than Conjurors. Well, it was understandable since Luna was teaching amateur teenagers.
Her patience in coping with such worthless students was also a miracle in itself. If not for Austin's coaxing and fawning all night, she might have left the job on the second day.
The last class of physical training was under the control of Saya. She was doing a remarkable job tutoring the maggots on how they should be wielding steel.
At the start, she was pretty harsh, to the point even Kyouki was sent to the infirmary in one of those trials. But with time, as Austin persuaded her, Saya began to understand how she should be teaching.
Now back to the present...
Under the curious gaze of the students who entered inside the classroom was the headmaster Merlin?
A wave of shock flew throughout the room as they were expecting someone younger than the Principal.
Tiara anxiously stood up before asking what others were thinking too.
"Merlin-sama...is Sir Austin not going to provide his lecture today?"
Merlin sighed as he saw the impatience from the girl and almost everyone in the room, signifying how unwelcomed the Grandmaster was.
In so less time, many of the students and professors have become a fan of Austin's way of teaching. This reaction was the reason for such favorability.
Positioning in the center of the aisle, the bearded wizard stomped his staff to gather the attention and halt the chattering, as he spoke in a neutral tone.
"Austin wouldn't be available for a few days due to his personal issues, so until then, I will be teaching you all."
The class became a little noisier as some of them even sighed in shame or 'Tch*ed', bringing a thick bulge on the headmaster's forehead.
With a twitching smile, an ominous idea emerged in his mind in regard to today's class.
'It seems I have to show them, why I still hold the title of Grandmaster... '
___________________
In a faraway land, almost a thousand miles away from the Eden Academy, could be seen a luxurious carriage currently steadily trodding through the bustly market.
The way people were giving space for the carriage made it clear what social status the people inside carried.
This market, this town, and various places are somewhat engraved in Austin's memory since he has wandered these streets all his childhood.
Yes, this was the piece of land under the administration of Count Vincent Wright, Heideith.
Currently, inside the carriage, the highest nobility of the town, Countess Sophia, along with her daughter Eleanor, were going to shop in the local complex.
It wasn't a rare occasion for the duo to go out shopping, but the crowd still treated the carriage like the Emperor of Gram himself had arrived.
Unlike in the past, there wasn't any security carriage following the Royal transport since it seemed the guards got muddled in the crowd.
"Your father would get angry if he heard about this, Eli."
Sophia scolded her daughter lightly as it was Eleanor who pleaded to leave the guard carriage behind so they could rush toward Eleanor's favorite tea shop.
"Mou~ How can I help mother? That aromatic tea arrives once a month, and the tea owner also doesn't give patronage to nobles. Rushing is the only option left."
Sophia sighed with a smile as this side of her daughter seemed incredibly adorable, unlike most of the time when Eleanor, stays severe and determined for her future.
With her eyes focused on the outside, Eleanor enjoyed the scene as her platinum blond hair which had a radiance just like her mother, swayed freely in the air.
Amidst her enjoyment, a strange feeling emerged inside her, as her brows grew narrower.
"Hey mom....isn't the market growing a lot crowdy, yet we aren't halting at all?"
Sophia, who was reading one of her books, suddenly heard her daughter's voice before she looked outside.
A severe frown also clouded her charming face as, indeed, the market was getting populated like there was some kind of festival celebration, yet the wheels were rolling like it was passing through them.
'Something is fishy... '
"Dolton, stop the carriage."
Calling out the coachman, Sophia seemed to be a little hurried as her heart grew suspicious severly.
But against her command, the carriage kept moving as it had been under a spell.
Spell...?
Sophia's eyes went wide as she moved to the little window at the front of the cabin before sliding it apart.
Twirling her finger, a small water orb formed on top of her index before she launched at the man she had called Dolton earlier.
Much to her horror, the water sphere passed through the man before a cloud of smoke emerged out of nowhere and engulfed the whole cabin.
"Mom!"
____________________
A/N: - This is going to be dramatic. But I am lovin it!
Ah, yes. I am going to start an alternative to the story on Patreon. Well, I have thought to.
So if you want to ride a different kind of coaster with the same characters and Austin having a harem(evil laugh), do check my Patreon.
/Svneighter
.gg/cvKBKV3u3e
P. S-
I am writing Austin as harem protag in patron Alternative Side Stories, that doesn't mean the main canon couldn't go harem. As I said I am uncertain where this will go so don't worry harem lovers. ;)

chapters.title: Chapter 109: Desire!
chapters.content:
'Mm... '
With a severe frown, Sophia's eyes trembled before she parted her lids after who knows how long.
The last thing she remembers is when the carriage got ambushed by a strange kind of spell. Since the occurrence took place soon after Sophia discovered the illusionary spell of the coachman, she wasn't able to counter what came at them.
The first thing her vision searched just upon stabilizing was her daughter, Eleanor. Fortunately, she didn't have to look around since she could sense her daughter was tied to her back.
"Eli, are you alright?"
Trying to measure the strength of the rope, Sophia tried to twist her wrist, but it was utterly unmovable, which told how brilliantly sealing magic was applied.
"Yes, mom. What about you."
Eleanor's voice, just like her mother was extremely low, as she asked in concern. It might be the first time for Eleanor and Sophia to face something like this, but that doesn't mean they weren't prepared.
"Can you use your dagger here?"
Knowing her daughter's attributes with weapon manipulation, Sophia thought it might be the best course of action at the moment. But as she expected, the kidnappers weren't amateurs at all.
"They have taken it away. Even my pendant."
Eleanor gritted her teeth as she realized how thorough the abductors had kept them tied up. Very few people could notice how her pendant could be used as a weapon, but it seemed her ace card was already blown up.
Sophia sighed as she felt the agitation from her daughter before she cast a spell underneath their feet.
The spell formation only took ten seconds before two puddles of water formed in front of both ladies.
"Eli. Break the nail on my index finger and throw it in the puddle."
Eleanor wasn't sure why her mom said such a thing, but in this situation, she wasn't an idiot to ask for the reason.
Breaking the nail, Eleanor flicked her thumb as it flew inside the puddle before the light blue shade into radiant purple.
The same happened on the other side as Sophia also mixed her nail, which was coated with a special kind of venom, into the pure aqua, making it a lethal consumer.
Thanks to the surrounding, which was covered with heavy smog, the movement of puddles didn't alert the criminals.
"They look like slime."
Eleanor made a disgusted face as the little things climbed her body before they moved toward the back of their hand. The slimy feeling of something sucking on her wrist was irresistible, but Eleanor somehow held herself together.
"What fruit such handwork would bear, My lady Countess Sophia Wright?"
Suddenly much to both blond beauties' shock, the heavy cloud dispersed before a silhouette appeared out of nowhere.
The man, who by outer appearance looked in his late twenties, walked steadily toward them. His violet hair was neatly combed on the back with a formal three-piece suit adorning his lean stature.
Sophia's eyes went wide as she saw the person.
"S-Sabes?"
Eleanor frowned as she realized that her mother was aware of the man's identity as she surveyed the surrounding. As the smoke disappeared, Eleanor was able to feel multiple presences around.
"You do remember me, my lady? I am honored."
'Remember you, huh... '
How could she forget about her childhood friend who used to play at her parent's house? He was Sophia's best friend, and being the son of Gardner; he always had to chance to be with her.
They grew up together while being on good terms, but suddenly, at the time of her marriage, Sabes disappeared like a ghost.
Sophia wasn't a child to not know the reason why he left. But apart from friendship, Sophia didn't find anything in Sabes.
Naturally, she didn't tell about this to anyone, and after marriage, she nearly forgot about him. Until today...
"Why are you here? What do you want?"
Sophia could sense a strange kind of mana presence from Sabes, which gave ominous vibes. And coupled with the fact that her magical energy seemed to be suppressed under his watch, made her terrified.
"Before I tell you what I want, let me tell you something I have already done."
Sophia gulped in nervousness, but her facial expression was as stern as ever. On the other side, Eleanor felt incredibly uncomfortable because of this foreign sensation blocking her mana channels.
"Your son, Benjamin Wright. Right now, he is getting sword training from an instructor called Collon. You know, that instructor can anytime stab the sword at your son when he is vulnerable the most?"
Both women widened their eyes as they heard about the person they had a close relationship with. But little did they think that there was more to reveal.
"Your husband, Vincent Wright. Currently, he is in office, signing a bundle of documents. He may ask for a coffee, and what if one of the maids, blends some kind of drug in that coffee? He sure has strong resistance, but is he immune to everything?"
As his words concluded, Sabes was already some feet apart from Sophia. Despite holding her stance, one could see how profoundly it was getting tough for her not to fall on the ground.
But Eleanor didn't have that much resistance as she fell on her knees while panting like her life force had been sucked out.
Looking at the man whom she once called her dearest friend with hatred and aggression, Sophia heard what didn't surprise her at all.
"Now, what I want is simple."
Walking some steps, he lowered his head before whispering in her ears.
"I want you to be mine, my lady."
Sophia closed her eyes as a heavy pearl-like tear dripped down her cheeks. All her weak nerves are under Sabes hold. Her daughter is struggling to survive just some inches apart from her. All the possible routes seemed to be blocked by a single person.
But just as an unimaginable resort emerged in her mind, a voice that seemed utterly familiar echoed in her senses, giving her a jolt of hope.
"It's been a while, mother..."
____________________
At the same time, in an extravagantly decorated room could be seen two figures adorning contradictory demeanors currently.
The handsome boy in his early twenties was undoubtedly aggrieved because of something as he threw stuffs here and there.
**PNNNG**
The last piece of decor, was an expensive flower pot that was thrown to the ground before it shattered into pieces. Not able to find anything, the person turned toward the other one inside the room.
The other one was a girl in her teens with pretty blond long hair as she sipped on her tea elegantly while sighing at her brother's tantrum along the way.
"Are you done?"
The man snickered as he replied in a disdainful voice.
"Why do you care? I am dying to even catch a glimpse of her, and here you are getting your time with that bas-"
"Big Brother Cain~."
The mouth of the first prince wasn't able to conclude the curse he was about to throw at Austin as Tiara released a heavy amount of killing intent toward her brother.
A drop of sweat dripped down his head as he plopped down on the couch under the fret of offending his sister.
Tiara sighed again before pulling back her intent. She really can't hold herself when someone disrespects her professor.
"Okay, listen. Tomorrow night, I will do the preparation. Take 'that' thing and go for your Saintess when the time is right, okay?"
Hearing his sister, Cain felt a little perplexed but soon, a big grin formed across Cain's lips as he finally got the consent to use 'that' and a chance to claim what he desired the most.
'Finally, I can hold you once again... '
____________________
A/N: - Remind me if I have mentioned the first prince's name before. Things will be chaotic on either end, but nothing unspeakable will happen.
So drop a like if you are hyped~

chapters.title: Chapter 110: Mama~
chapters.content:
"The bastard child of Wrights. The prodigy who defeated an army alone. What an honor to meet such an entity in person."
Sabes turned toward the blond boy who was walking up to them with his eyes hollow as a black hole with his gaze remained only on the woman.
Completely disregarding the man, Austin stood before Sophia as he brought his hand toward her cheek before collecting the pearl-like tear on the side of his index.
Sophia was utterly astonished by so many developments, along with the fear she had felt some moments ago, which left her speechless.
At that moment, she had forgotten all the facade she had maintained in front of her firstborn as she raised her hand and pinched Austin's sleeve while shedding more and more tears.
**SWIISH**
A profound amount of intent rose and covered Austin, making him look wrapped in flames of radiant shades.
Keeping his mother and sister in a safe space, Austin let loose of his aura, which made the violet-haired man tremble in a fret as he fell on his butt because of such coercive intent he felt for the first time.
The feeling of death just from someone's aura was something Sabes had felt for the first time. His forehead was drenched in sweat while he retreated slightly back with his eyes wide, staring at the back of the unexpected appearance.
'I-Is he re-really a human anymore... '
On the other side, Sophia tucked Austin's sleeve a little stiffly as she realized Sabes condition. Austin knew what it was about, as he sighed with a smile.
Taking her hand, he spoke gently to soothe her mother.
"Don't worry; I have taken care of Sir Vincent and Benjamin."
Sophia felt relieved hearing about the safety of her beloveds, but the way Austin called his father made her a little sad as she looked at him in disapproval.
Austin swept his glance away before turning toward the person on the ground.
"I will be back."
Saying so, Austin released Sophia's hand before he started walking toward Sabes with heavy steps. The look in his eyes was completely different compared to how he looked at his family.
Sabes shivered all over as he communicated with his troops waiting on the sidelines if something like this occurred.
But as soon he tried to connect with them, a blank response came in return, throwing Sabes into despair.
His eyes trembled as he realized that not only a mere teenager had breached his illusionary barrier, but also, all the elite soldiers he had trained to take part in this single job had been slaughtered without Sabes noticing.
"This can't be..."
His belief in actuality has been fading since Austin arrived, but the feeling of death nearing his throat helped Sabes to escape his stupor as he released a mind manipulation attack on Austin.
[Enslave]
Austin swatted the incoming spell away like a fly, much to Sophia's disbelief. It was indeed astonishing to see Austin playing with such high-grade magic like it meant nothing to him.
Sabes had a much uglier expression as, while gritting his teeth, he cast his second spell.
[Mana Bind]
A set of purple chains augmented around Austin before restraining his movement but only just for a second...
**CLICK**
With a slight jerk of their body, Austin broke free before his body disappeared from the site into thin air.
"Earlier, I heard you were giving choices to my mother?"
Sabes eyes contracted until they reached the thinnest similar to a needle, as he heard the bone-chilling voice just inches apart from him.
Turning his head stiffly, while trembling all over, Sabes was met with a pair of emeralds looking inside his very existence, as Sabes heard the boy...no the monster speaking again.
"Let me give you some options too. First, you run away right now; then I will blow your father's workshop, where he is working diligently, and shred your friends while they are chugging in your hang-out places."
"The second option is to go and rub your head in front of my mother before I give you a slightly less painful death. Oh yeah, the first option does contain your death, albeit after you lose your loved ones."
From start to end, Austin's voice remained emotionless and stoic as ever, like he was chanting a mantra.
The expression on Sabes face changed significantly when the people he only cares for in life were mentioned by the boy he never planned to meet today.
It might be just bogus, but Austin was right about the places where his father and friends could be at this hour.
"Y-You can't kill innocent people! Sophia's child couldn't be such a person!"
Sabes tried to reason about the falsery of Austin's threat. But little did he think Austin wouldn't be like the other two children of his parents.
"Look into my eyes, Sabes. Do you believe I would hesitate a second before ending anyone's life, regardless innocent or not?"
Sabes gaze involuntarily fell on those bottomless orbs, which were too deep and lifeless that made the older one shiver uncontrollably before his eyes turned white, and with a bit of foam gushing out his mouth, he fell unconscious.
Austin shook his head in disappointment as a whisper left his lips.
"Guess, you weren't ready for your own medicine, eh."
Hoping on his toes, Austin walked back to his mother's side, who was looking at the scene until now in utter disbelief and slight pride?
Along the way, he received the notification of something he was expecting.
[Ding!]
[Second Quest]
[Save the Members of Wright's family]
[Status: - Complete]
[Reward: - 300 Villain's Point
A set of Dragger and Cloak(A)]
...
Yes, the reason why Austin was able to save the two men of the Wright family was the system's quest which gave not only their location but also information about the impostors.
Austin had no idea why the system suddenly turned out like this. First Sicily, and now his ex-family was put up on the quest bar. In either case, he would have helped because of two different reasons but the System providing such a generous reward made him baffled.
Well, he wasn't going to reject tho. ..
"Are you okay, mother?"
Austin checked all over, but apart from the rope marks on her wrist and slightly shaken-up emotions, she was fine. And same goes for Eleanor, who was lying unconscious on the ground.
"They are really safe, right?"
Sophia asked while glancing at fallen Sabes as she heard the affirming voice of Austin.
"Have I ever lied to you?"
Sophia's pure eyes blinked several times as she looked at her son, who had grown a little taller than her. She now has to lean her head to look at him.
Finding the warming gaze filling in those eyes, Sophia felt she might lose the left-over fake front. She instantly turned her eyes away.
"Why did you call me here, mother?"
"I never called you? Why do I even call such a child whom I don't have a relation with?"
Austin smirked as he heard the not-so-believable harsh words of his dear mother before he took out something from his inventory.
"Then why did you write this letter saying: Mama misses you, Aussie~ Please come back to me. Mama wants to see-"
"Don't read anymore!"
Sophia tried to snatch the letter away from Austin with her face completely dyed red. But the little minx of son wasn't kind enough to let her erase the piece of embarrassment.
"Will mother talk truthfully now?"
Austin asked with a big grin as he received a complaining pout from the mature one. Finally, after grumbling for some seconds, Sophia spoke in a meek tone.
"Fine...but don't dare repeat that letter again! Do you understand!?"
"Hai... Hai... I promise I won't, mama~."
_____________________
A/N: - Drop a comment~

chapters.title: Chapter 111: Prince Cain!
chapters.content:
Emperor William, who has a judicial range on the whole continent of Gram, has four children from two of his wife.
The first Empress of the nation, Irene, has two children with her husband. The eldest prince Cain and the eldest princess Tiara.
The second wife of William, Tasha, gave birth to the successor of the throne, Mikhail, and the youngest of the family, Princess Catherine.
Except for Tiara, the other three don't get along with each other or say; Tiara is the only one who interacts with her brothers and sister more often.
Despite being siblings, Catherine and Mikhail also doesn't share a close bond due to some reason. But since the latter had hefty jobs to handle already, he couldn't sit and ask his sister what had gone wrong.
There was a reason why Mikhail, despite not being officially announced, was still called the prime successor of the throne, even though there was a competent and worthy first born too.
Mikhail undoubtedly was a worthy warrior who had proficiency in Elemental Magic, and coupled with his wits and sense of justice, he became a proper subject for the next Monarch.
But Cain also had the same qualities. Although he was weak with mana, he still had a lot of potential in the arsenal. Then why he wasn't considered next to the throne?
The reason is Cain's vulnerability to manipulation.
From very thorough observation, it has been conceded that Prince Cain's judgment can be influenced if the influencer is slightly good with their words.
The First Empress did try to get his son educated about such weakness, but all futile. He is just too easy to fool. He quickly trusts someone as their ally and might consider a friend a foe if convinced.
The choice became clearer with Mikhail's day-by-day achievements in different fields and the stupidity Cain introduced.
One of those deeds he did, in someone else's words, was to pursue a woman with whom Cain never belonged to.
Without him knowing, his sister Tiara had been manipulating him for a very long time, and tonight, too, she has molded his anger and given him free rein to get together with the Saintess of Humanity, Luna.
It was around eight in the evening when Luna returned to Austin's room. Since her dorm was given to Saya, she has practically started cohabitation with Austin. Even though he wasn't present today, she had other ways to cover herself in his presence.
Strolling lazily through the garden, Luna suddenly felt someone approaching before a voice called out for her.
"It's been a long, Luna-san."
The voice was unfamiliar but not the face. Luna did have to ponder a little, but soon she recognized who the person in front was.
"Greetings, Your Highness."
Luna bowed a little while lifting the hem of her skirt as she greeted the first prince of Gram.
Cain's heart fluttered violently upon seeing Luna from this close after a long time. He instantly felt the urge to walk forward and hug the beauty who had made such a mess of his heart, but he held himself for now.
"You have become gorgeous, Luna. Even more from the last time, I saw you."
Luna didn't recall when she met him last, so she just smiled in gratitude. She wanted to end this conversation and run back to Austin's dorm, where his manly scent awaited her.
But...
"Would you care to join me for a cup of tea? You see, I came here to meet Tia, and I don't feel like traveling in a carriage late at night. So I thought, why don't we have a chat when we get the opportunity?"
Cain had some resorts prepared in case Luna rejected his invitation, which he was expecting more as an outcome. However, it seemed Luna also was interested in talking with Cain.
With a bright smile, Luna didn't contemplate for long before responding.
"I will be delighted to."
_______...
The two of them moved toward the reception hall built on the western side of the main building. Since it was close, they, or rather Cain, chose the place.
On the way, neither of them spoke because of their own reasons.
Cain was incredibly elated, but the anxiety was blended in his feelings as he tried to suppress his grin and escorted Luna toward their destination
The reason why Luna was silent....was rather complicated to define.
The guards at the reception hall entrance immediately became alert as they greeted the royal highness in unison.
""We pay our greetings to the Royal Highness, Prince Cain-sama! "
"Hmm. "
Cain didn't bat an eye at the guards before he walked toward the door, which parted from the inside upon his arrival. If observed closely, one could see how hurried he was to invite her inside.
Without hesitation, Luna walked just some steps behind the prince as she also entered the hall solemnly.
