However, just after the doors closed on her back, an ominous feeling made her heart numb as a chilling sensation ran through her spine.
Her facial expression was indifferent until now, contoured in anxiety and perplexion as she felt a familiar sensation weighing down her existence.
Looking at Cain's back, Luna heard him saying something which made it clear who was behind all this.
"I apologize for doing this, Luna but... "
With a big grin that showed his inner desires, Cain turned toward the panting Luna as he marveled at such a sight before speaking in an excited tone.
"....I can't hold myself any longer."
___________________
A/N: - Sorry for the short chapter. I will compensate in the next one.
Drop a comment~

chapters.title: Chapter 112: I am here for you.
chapters.content:
[Half an hour ago]
"Why did you give this to me, mother?"
After the thing with Sabes was handled, Austin picked Eleanor up and escorted his mother to a nearby shelter which h was devoid of the populace.
It seemed Sabes didn't carry this abduction in a spur. The place he directed Sophia and Eleanor through the carriage was far from the main town, near the eastern border.
The civilization around the region has long left the area since the other side of the border is covered with a high density of monstrosities and Dungeon Lairs.
Eleanor was still in a state of comma since it seemed Sabes's mana was far from what she could handle now, which genuinely made Sophia pitiful toward her daughter but proud to see how strong her son had become in so less time.
If before Austin seemed like a bright light for her, now he depicted the sun itself. Not only has his appearance changed, but also his strength and prowess.
"Mother?"
"Uh?"
It seemed Sophia, after seeing her son after so long, fell into a stupor before Austin pulled her back by shaking her shoulder lightly.
Looking down at his hand, she could see the same pendant she had given him before his contest with Captain Charles.
"You haven't worn it yet."
Sophia whispered as she felt her son might have suspected her gift; that's why the locket was in hand, not attached to his neck.
But Austin's following words made her realize her misconception.
"I didn't tie it since I know the runes on it would attach to my very soul. But before I do that, I wanted to ask mother....whether it's okay for me to have such a valuable thing?"
Moonstone, as per what Luna informed him before, grants the wearer a second chance in life. It can resurrect the holder once after their death, by whatever means the user reaches their end.
The pendant undoubtedly was a priceless asset that the Emperor of Gram himself would pay fortunes to buy, and also, there was Vincent Wright too, whom should Sophia might want to grant this stone.
Austin was ready to hand over the moonstone since he knew his mother gave it because of her fear of Austin's death in the brawl with Charles. And now that the match has been settled, it might be better if he returns the stone.
'Well, it's my fault why he thinks this way... '
Sophia didn't lift her gaze to see Austin. Instead, she tucked his sleeve while she sat with her face leaned down.
"Austin, can you kneel?"
Austin blinked in perplexion before he did what she asked.
But as soon his gaze fell on his mother's eyes, his heart felt warm in an instant.
Those eyes he only has seen being directed at his siblings, not him. The gaze which he always sought yet never attained. This sensation, which makes him delighted yet scared that what if it's all a dream?
It seemed ages for Sophia to look at her son without wearing a mask of hatred. She had forgotten when the last time she held her son's hand or saw his precious self.
Caressing his tender cheeks, Sophia's eyes became moist as, with a smiling face, she spoke in a gentle tone.
"Do you think anything is more valuable than my son's life?"
Her soothing voice, which calmed Austin's long-built anxiety, was only audible to him at the moment. He might be an orphan in his later life, but hearing such a thing and feeling the warmth of the woman in front, he could confidently say he does have a person he could call his family.
Without him knowing, a droplet of tears slid down his cheek as he stared into her eyes and prayed this moment for last as long as possible.
"Give me that."
Sophia asked for the moonstone, which Austin handed without a second thought.
Circling the thread around Austin's lean neck, Sophia whispered her honest thoughts, which she never could tell him before.
"I know I haven't been a good mother until now, but remember this, Austin."
Hooking the knot on his back, a silver illumination sparkled near Austin's upper chest, which he didn't mind and only heard his mother's words.
"I love you as much I love my other two children. Even though I never told you, I treasure you a lot, Austin. On your every achievement, I felt proud. On your days of failure, I wanted to boost your spirit but couldn't do such a thing. Every happiness and grief, your mother cares about it all, Austin. Sorry for being late for saying this...but if you ever feel lonely and want to share something, I will always be there for you."
Relying on someone was something Austin had learned from Luna, but this maternal warmth was something neither Luna nor anyone in this world could provide him with.
Hugging his mother like a small child, Austin murmured under their breath.
"Mm..."
__________________..
[Present time]
Inside a thinly lit room stood two figures with varying expressions adorning their remarkable faces.
The one near the entrance of the massive hall was a pale silver-haired beauty who currently had her hand raised and mouth slightly parted as heavy breaths escaped the gape.
It was clearly visible how she was struggling even to stand properly while trying to maintain the frail mana barrier around her to forbade the man in front from approaching her.
The said man was smirking wildly as he enjoyed the fragile view of the girl whom he desired to attain the most. With a sigh, he spoke in a defeated voice as he didn't want to let the woman feel any more discomfort.
"You know, struggling here is futile, my dear Luna. You cannot win over the Demonic Artifact, which is made to suppress your mana specifically."
Luna's eyes went wide as she heard Cain's statement, which would have been unreal to believe if she hadn't been present here, herself.
In between the harsh gasps, she tried to voice her thought which had been making her troubled since the time she realized her situation.
"Y-You couldn't have done all the-this on your own...tell me... *hah*...who is behind you..."
As she spoke while trying to maintain the barrier, small lines of blood drew down the corner of her lips. Her body was trembling all over, with the mana barrier getting thinner, passing each second.
Hearing the query, Cain's grin disappeared, but as his sister had instructed, he didn't speak about anyone, especially about 'that' being even he wanted his Luna to know.
Running low on patience, Cain finally decided to end this banter and get what he wanted. Snatch what he deserves and win what always belonged to him.
"Enough of the talks, Luna. Now let go of the resistance and come with me."
Under the horrified gaze of Luna, Cain walked toward her as, with a sway of his hand, he shattered the barrier.
Luna fell back on the door as Cain inched slowly toward her, with his previous disgusting grin returning across his face.
Just as he was about to hold Luna's arm, a loud boom echoed in the room as, from the ceiling, descended a person who looked somewhat just like Cain.
The first prince's eyes stretched to their widest spot as he recognized the unexpected arrival, before a frightening voice echoed in the hall.
"Never had I expected something like this from you... Big Brother."
________________
A/N: - Explanation would be provided, and don't worry, Cain would die in the hands of our Wannabe Villain.
Until then~

chapters.title: Chapter 113: Step on me Luna~
chapters.content:
Inside the reception hall built inside the premise of Eden Academy stood three prominent figures of the Empire with varying expressions spread over their faces.
The second prince and probable next Emperor of Gram, Mikhail, had a frightening look on his face as he coldly looked at a bastard named his brother, Cain.
Those who closely knew Mikhail would have been shocked to see the all-time serene and calm-headed prince being in such an agitated state, like he might burn an ice pillar with his mere emotional flux.
On the other end, Cain's expression was a blend of terrified and repulsive as he never thought of someone intruding at this hour when all the preparation was already done.
The chicken-brained First Prince wasn't able to discern that a single person did this whole game plan, and that person was the only one who could ditch Cain at such a point.
Cain, indeed, was strong enough to obliterate a Unique class Demons horde single-handedly, but in comparison to Mikhail....he was far below.
"Don't you interrupt Mikhail! This is my personal matter. You stay out of it!"
Cain growled in a high pitch while trying to put a bold front and, if possible, get things under his control.
Hearing the words Mikhail wasn't expecting after so many things happened, the blond prince's face contoured to an even darker shade as his anger reached its boiling point.
But before he could take action, another voice but this time feminine, resonated from Cain's side.
"Yeah, why are you interrupting, Prince Mikhail!? I was about to make this idiot blabber the important intel!"
Luna's annoyed voice made the previous furious Mikhail blink in perplexion, and it was the same for Cain, too, as he turned his head to see the person.
"Lu-Luna-san...are you alright now?" (Mikhail)
"No...am dead."
With fake amusement, Luna replied as her previous miserable condition had vanished like she had never been thrown into such a state. Unlike before, her skin has regained its natural tone with no sign of her being struggling even to stand.
"H-How this can be..."
Cain's eyes were at their widest point as he concluded that all this time, Luna was playing around to make him confess about the person who helped him in this whole situation.
Mikhail had a resigned expression as he somehow could digest Luna overpowering the demonic artifact, but her acting skills indeed made his heart move previously.
"No... No... No... No! This can't be happening!"
"Hey, do you wanna live?"
Amidst his self-mumbling, Luna spoke in a low tone to Cain, upon which the latter blinked in utter disbelief.
"If you tell me who gave you this artifact, I will ensure that you leave this place alive today."
There was a reason why Luna wasn't resorting to the brutal way to know the information she had been eager to find for a while.
So what was left was only the game of words. She said she would let him escape safely, but what would happen after running away would be uncertain.
Mikhail's raging mind thought for a long minute as Mikhail also waited for this development since he trusted Luna's wits and sense of reasoning.
He had ways to restrain Cain outside the hall, so he was pretty much calm about the things happening.
"I will speak...but in return...can you... Can you step on me, please!?"
With his voice mending in an utmost plead, Cain bowed in front of Luna, making the latter's mind blank for several seconds.
Mikhail facepalmed on such a shameful display of a high noble. Still, there wasn't anything he could say between them when he pretended to be oblivion about Luna's proposal.
Luna was wholly weirded out, but she didn't think it was too much to grant, so she nodded and urged the man to speak.
Cain was delighted to the core as his dream to see Luna from that point of view seemed near reality. Standing back, he breathed heavily before he began to speak.
"Th-The being who got me this artifact and the one who has interfered various times in the school affairs in the past is the same person. Like the labyrinth, which was unsealed, and the two high-ranked demons during the war were also sent by that being."
From start to end, Cain's expression shifted quite a lot as he muttered while reminiscing probably about the person he was talking about.
Mikhail and Luna didn't interrupt him as they awaited to know more about this person who had been playing cards from the background for who knows how long.
"I don't know his name, but if you want to fi-KHAKK!!"
Suddenly all natural color from Cain's face faded as a red runic spell circled his neck, seemingly choking him from talking any further.
**Cough**Cough**
Cain dropped to the ground while coughing violently as the bind didn't kill him, but it seemed he wouldn't be talking any time soon.
**SLING**
With a frightening speed, Mikhail launched a mana rope, which tied around Cain's arms and legs before he stepped forward. Amidst choking, Cain fell unconscious due to the effect of binding twine.
"Luna-san, for whatever problem my brother has caused, I beg your forgiveness. Tomorrow, an official apology, along with compensation, will be delivered to you, and I will make sure Prince Cain gets the treatment that a criminal should."
Mikhail bowed deeply as he pleaded for forgiveness which he knew was impossible to attain for what his brother had done. But contrary to his expectation, Luna gave a completely unpredictable answer.
"It's alright; I have gained from his foolishness to try to touch me. And about that official apology. If possible, send some lemon tea leaves as compensation."
Her voice was strangely serene since she knew, from the start, Cain had no control over the situation, and she came with him because she knew there would be something useful she could discover.
"I will send the best quality of tea. Uh... Luna-san. I also have a request to make. I know it's imprudent of me to-."
"Just say it."
Luna's mood became light as she heard about her favorite beverage, so hearing the request became a little bearable.
Mikhail inhaled deeply before he spoke in a meek tone.
"If possible....can you not tell me about this matter to Austin-san for the time being?"
Luna's eyes rounded in perplexion before she looked at Mikhail's expression and saw that he genuinely was worried about Austin's awareness of the matter.
"Well, I must disappoint you since I don't hide things from my husband, but can I ask why you are so worried about his knowledge on the matter?"
Mikhail smiled bitterly as he replied with a defeated sigh.
"When it's about you, Luna-san, Austin practically loses his cool. Were you sheltered at the time of war right? Because of being weakened by the demon? What you missed was the wrath Austin-san bestowed on the battlefield and showed me what strength a human could harbor. If he suddenly turns like that toward Gram... I don't know what would.. "
Mikhail still couldn't believe what he saw that day through the device, which was projecting the live scenario of war grounds.
The look in Austin's gaze and the way he dominated the other side, which comprised of Terror Rank demons, too, made Mikhail realize what asset Gram was overlooked until now.
"Is that so~Fufu...I didn't know he would get that angry~."
Amidst his recollection, Mikhail heard small giggles before his eyes fell on the blushing Luna who was fidgeting at her place while muttering something he probably shouldn't hear.
Looking at such a display from an all-time cold-faced maiden, Mikhail realized that the emotion called love was still early for him to learn.
___________________...
A/N: - There is a critical conversation part of Sophia and Austin. Should I write it down in the next chap or show it through Austin's talk to Luna?
Comment down~

chapters.title: Chapter 114: Sad Luna~
chapters.content:
[Tuesday, November 18th]
[4.30 pm]
**SLING**
It's been eleven days since the student-teaching teacher's session commenced and almost a week since Austin left.
Currently, on a grassy field that was specially built for students' practical training stood numerous faces varying in age.
This class belongs to the swordswoman who has been unknown until recently, but once she stepped into the teaching line, she shocked various onlookers.
The steel-hitting steel noise erupted from the center of the ground as the blade of a handsome raven-haired youth named Kyouki clashed with none other than the in-charge of the Weaponry and Martial class.
Saya proposed an idea after she got requested to increase her teaching hours.
She challenged any of the students or professors to push her even a step away from her spot using their martial skills then she would instruct them an hour more than usual.
The challenge was taken by many, including the adults, but none of them was able to even cross their blades for more than two minutes with the battle goddess.
Saya not only repelled their attack, she even countered with each blow so their morale could degrade, and they give up upon the thought of extra classes.
But on the third day, since the challenge was brought, Kyouki finally came forward wielding a regular blade making everyone gasp and excited for the dual between the two supreme warriors.
Saya admits that Kyouki's agility and precision were better than most of the lot, but still, she could quickly see his next move since most of the attack becomes predictable after some time.
**CLING**
Blocking Kyouki's slim blade on the back of her own katana, Saya was able to discern the struggle Kyouki was going through since it's already been an hour; they had been engaged in this spar.
"Not bad. You are able to point out my blind spots and hit them with almost the same accuracy as your front ones."
Kyouki released the hold since he knew being this close to Saya would be nothing less than disastrous for him.
Jumping from his position, he stood some meters ahead of Saya as his gaze fell on the spot where she was standing, but alas, her feet hadn't moved an inch even though he had given his all.
""WOOAH**
The gasp and cheering from the audience finally subdued as it seemed Kyouki had finally reached his limit. From his outer appearance, one could tell how exhausted he was, with his lips parted and heavy breaths continuously leaking out of his mouth.
"What happened, Hero? Already reached the end? Sad, I was expecting more~."
Saya teased slightly as she finally started to heat up fairly with the ferocious onslaught Kyouki introduced after so many days. Apart from the one-sided battle with Luna, Saya hasn't fought much, so this little display of authentic swordsmanship delighted her somewhat.
"I have a final attack, but I have to back it up with mana."
"Then you should. I never forbade using mana, but you have to apply your limbs or a weapon in your strike."
**GASP**
The surroundings held their mouth as the words spoken by the instructor was incredibly startling.
Soon, small murmurs and confident statements started erupting from the crowd.
"If I could have used mana, I definitely would have pushed Saya-sensei down."
"My [Crash Assault] would have undoubtedly worked if only I had known."
"Hey, isn't Saya-sensei getting a little partial here?"
Saya ignored all those muttering as her gaze was fixated on the promising young man in front; as she felt a golden hue gathering around Kyouki.
"If it's like that, I won't hold back any longer."
With a smirk, Saya readied her sword and made a stance for the first time as she replied in a voice that was oozing with the credence she held in her skills.
"Come at me with your strongest."
With his blade now shining like a bright sun, Kyouki pushed most of his mana to the edge as, with a long shout, he darted toward the lady.
"[Saberax]"
_____________________
"Hey, doesn't Luna seems a little downhearted today?"
It was the beautiful olive-haired mage supporter, Sicily, who whispered in her party member Lilia's ear while they trained their mana under the supervision of the Saintess.
The class was mainly based on converting a simple object into a Mana Capicator Artifact.
At first, the theory seemed absurd since only alchemists and Sages can conjure the ruins and spells to build an artifact.
But to their utmost surprise, Luna not only showed them how to construct the spell but also demonstrated a live conversion that even Elite Alchemist would find challenging to accomplish.
Amidst charging up a teapot with mana, Sicily asked before Lilia looked toward the stage and saw that, indeed, Luna's face was somewhat covered with dark clouds.
More like she seemed to be sad.
"Well, Austin's absence must have made her lonely."
Lilia sighed with her words as she felt the sentiment Luna had. She doesn't miss Austin but his being around gives her a sense of security. Of course, she wouldn't say this to Sicily.
"Even so, she looks incredibly pitiful. I wonder if there's something important today."
Just as Sicily predicted, today was Luna's birthday which no one other than her maid back in Aurora and her grandmother knows.
She wasn't grieving because no one wished her or wasn't celebrating her birthday. On the contrary, she doesn't actually like to be reminded that it's her birthday. But today, she desperately wanted to be with a certain someone.
Luna knew she wasn't a child anymore who should throw a tantrum about not being able to spend the day with her lover, but it was not like she was a doll who could control her emotions all the time.
After the classes concluded at nearly eight, she didn't go to eat dinner; rather, she chose to stay alone for the time being.
Saya asked her what was wrong, but Luna smiled and brushed off the topic. Saya also didn't ask any further since she herself was missing her brother that's why she could understand what Luna was going through.
The best place Luna finds to enjoy her solitude is the corner most resting benches in the school garden, where very few people wander.
Yes, it is the same place where Luna first time came to talk to Austin on her own initiative and from where the two started to know each other.
In a few words, this specific bench was the witness to the advent of their love story.
With a smile, Luna caressed the place Austin was sitting that night while grieving alone.
That night he was sad, and she tried to give him support, albeit in a peculiar way.
But now, when she is feeling down, he isn't here to console her.
"What a sore loser I am..."
Wiping the droplets which involuntarily dripped down her cheek, Luna was about to get up and walk back to the dorm when a familiar voice halted her movements.
"Where do you think you are going?"
___________________
A/N: - Did anyone say fluff? Well, the next chapter would be yours, then.
Drop a comment, if you are hyped for the next chap~

chapters.title: Chapter 115: Happy birthday~
chapters.content:
There was a day when Austin sat lonely on the bench when he felt all hope for him had vanished, and he had to spend the rest of his life in solitary.
At that time, Luna was the person who approached him with the distinguished purpose of just knowing this strange guy and what goes in his mind that he tries to act like a villain.
Now this time, it was Luna who was feeling down on the day she arrived in this world. Back in her birthplace, her birthday was celebrated only by her maid.
Her mother's illness made it impossible for her even to remember Luna's identity; her father never paid much heed to anything other than his power and reach.
But she could endure all of it until the man she loved stayed by her side and gave the support she was greedy for.
She wouldn't have complained to him whenever he arrived since her birthday didn't seem worth mentioning, but still, she was sad for today.
But who would have thought that, like everything in her life has been changing since she met her first love, this special day of hers would also change.
"Where do you think you are going?"
Luna's senses wafted with an incredibly familiar scent as she roamed her eyes and finally settled on the figure of a person she could identify, even from a mass crowd.
The same dazzling eyes, beautiful hair, and the kindest smile she had ever seen were adorned by none other than the person who had made her stupid in love.
"By that look in your eyes...I guess you missed me a lot more than I thought. "
With his hands behind his back, Austin approached her as he spoke in a slightly teasing tone.
A smile dared to spread across her face, but she instantly held herself back and turned her face with a pout.
"Who said I was missing you? I didn't even notice your absence. Hmph!"
"Is that so? Then I might leave you alone for some more days."
To her utter astonishment, Austin vanished from his sight, and Luna's eyes widened before she turned herself in that direction but failed to notice where he went.
But before she could think or move, her face lit up with the illumination of candles that were decorated over a birthday cake. Startled, she heard Austin's voice, this time a lot closer than before.
"Do you think I would have forgotten?"
Turning on her back, she found her favorite eyes looking at her warmly.
Luna looked at the cake again before her eyes turned slightly teary as she felt Austin's warm hand circling her waist.
Leaning her head on his chest, a beautiful smile crept on her lips before her hands hugged his abdomen, not wanting to let go anymore.
"Let's sit now. This cake has already gone through a lot."
Austin led Luna to the bench before cautiously putting down the small confectionary as he took the other side of the seat.
"Where did you buy it from? I have never seen this kind of flavor."
The cake was, by looks, seemed made of chocolate with a lot of choco chips sprinkled over it, but for Luna, it was foreign since choco chips hadn't been introduced to her until now. Not to talk about peculiar icing...
Austin halted for some seconds before he scratched the back of his head and replied with an embarrassed smile.
"Actually, I have prepared this one myself..."
Luna blinked in surprise before she raised a query related to a confession he had made long ago.
"Didn't you say you were bad at cooking?"
"Don't worry. I learned from a master chef back in my hometown before I made this. Now blow the candles, already."
Luna didn't miss how bashful Austin had become as a teasing smile spread her lips. But for now, she kept her mischievous thoughts aside and blew gently over the cake.
"Happy birthday, Luna. May your upcoming years of life remain happy and peaceful."
Turning her gaze, Luna spoke with a giggle.
"Then wish I always stay with you. That would make me the happiest."
Austin just smiled in response before he brought a small knife out of his storage and cut a small piece of cake before extending it toward Luna.
Luna parted her lips wide, but in the end, she could only bite one-fourth of the piece. It was adorable how she tried yet pecked like a bird.
Austin took the rest of the piece of himself, but his face slightly contoured just upon receiving the taste.
"The bitterness of the chocolate is still there."
Even though he tried to make the cake sweet since he knew Luna's favorability toward sweet things, he somehow failed to accomplish what he desired.
Luna narrowed her gaze as her chewing instantly halted upon hearing Austin's words.
Leaning forward, she grabbed his chin, and without letting him prepare, she connected her lips with him.
Austin's eyes widened as it was rare for Luna to take the initiative, but he was far from unwelcoming.
Taking Austin's astonishment as a leeway, Luna violated his tongue with hers and intervened and played with him to her heart's desire.
The cake in between the steamy kisses melted. Before Austin could fight back, he was already at the mercy of his dominant lover.
Parting her lips, she saw the vulnerable expression of her beloved, who was panting raggedly with his slightly swollen lips parted.
"Was it sweet enough, now?"
Unlike Austin, Luna's voice was fine as she marveled at the sight and spoke in a slight coquettish tone.
Austin nodded mindlessly as he was too overwhelmed by the unexpected attack.
Luna's breaths also became rough as her excitement increased upon seeing Austin in such a state. Licking her lips, Luna leaned forward as her hand made its way to a particular region of Austin, making the latter gasp.
Nearing her lips to his ears, Luna whispered in a tone that might corrupt the holiest saint alive.
"Today is my birthday. So why don't you leave everything to me and let this Onee-san show you something new~."
Austin gulped hard as he heard the dangerous words, which instantly made his reasoning numb and his mind blank.
Turning his head slightly, he spoke in a meek tone.
"I will be in yo-your care, then, Luna-sama."
__________________..
A/N: - Ah, they and their kinks.
Drop a comment if you are liking the story and are ready for some action ~

chapters.title: Chapter 116: Detachment!
chapters.content:
"Hmmm....so prince Cain is in prison now. And that tea leaves are compensation."
Under the cozy blanket laid an exceptionally charming couple consisting of a handsome blond youth and a young silver-haired otherworldly beauty.
The sun hadn't risen behind the curtains, signifying that dawn was still far away.
The chillness of November has made it necessary for one to have covered at night, but looking at the couple, there seemed to be no need for blankets to warm them up.
With her head resting on Austin's well-built chest, Luna's hands were draped lazily as she enjoyed the early morning warmth of her beloved.
With her eyes closed in sleepiness, she narrated the whole event which occurred a week or so ago in the reception hall. Her curiosity lay in the reaction Austin would give upon hearing First Prince's attempt toward her.
But contrary to Luna's expectation, Austin stayed silent for several seconds, which in turn made Luna worried before she parted her lids and supported her chin on his upper body.
"What are you thinking?"
Austin seemed to be in a stupor as hearing Luna's call; he hurriedly pulled his gaze to her with a soft smile spreading on his lips.
"Nothing much... Ah, that reminds me."
Luna wasn't unfamiliar with the man. The way he shifted the flow of conversation and stole his gaze away told her how uncomfortable he got to hear about the incident. Even slightly, she could feel his hold on her tightening as he spoke in a rushed tone.
"Did you find anything on the demon responsible for these peculiar mana-suppressing artifacts? This teaching and returning home kept me quite busy these days."
There were many incidences which has proven that, unlike in the past, demons have started cooperating with humanity for some uncertain reason.
Many, like Austin, had knowledge that demons are bound with their Liege, mainly known as Monarch of Darkness, Demon Lord. Them betraying their master and serving their nemesis was a frightening discovery in itself.
This not only increased the level of Demon's reach but also gave a sense of cautiousness on whom to trust or from whom to be wary.
"I did get some clue but not much. I have to investigate through my sources and see where this goes."
Replied with a sigh; Luna fell on Austin once again as she didn't like how such a small matter was getting prolonged day after day.
She has a hunch that every human involved with Underworld, whether the student of Eden Academy or the ex-hero of Xylex, has been in contact with a singular existence.
But until she doesn't get the full proof evidence, she can't play her cards and dig that mole out of its hole.
"Then there is a labyrinth too. I doubt that there is something in there we should be worried about. But there's a hassle about mana restriction."
Austin also sighed at the weird feeling he suffered inside, which was still vivid in his mind, and before things got ugly on the land, he wanted to clear the mystery of the labyrinth.
There was a brief silence in the room as the two understood that in order to accomplish these two goals, they had to go separate ways.
Luna was a remarkable mage, no doubt, but inside the labyrinth required more combat work. And as for investigation, Luna hasn't really told Austin about all of her secrets, and neither does he ask.
Austin knew when the time come, she would tell him everything. But the essence remains in their detachment once again, even though they just met.
With her eyes tightly closed, Luna hugged him even more rigidly as she didn't like the idea, yet she understood why this was important.
Knowing well how Luna was feeling at the moment, Austin smiled in defeat as he patted the sulky Saintess' head softly.
"Once we get free from all these...let's go on a vacation, okay?"
Luna instantly shot up her head before glaring at Austin despite her heart being lighted up with joy.
"Not vacation but honeymoon..."
Luna poked his chest with a pout to warn her husband about the slip of words.
Seeing such an adorable gesture, Austin couldn't help but grin as he replied while rubbing her head.
"Hai. It will be our honeymoon."
_________________..
Nearly at six, when a cold wisp of breeze was howling around the vicinity, stood a beautiful woman in her early twenties swinging her blade toward particularly nothing.
Her build was tall and lean but well-proportioned. Along with a warrior's physique, the woman had the charm a female dreams of having.
As sweat dripped down her chin, the woman readied herself to take the sharp slash bisecting the falling leaf in front. But before she could have moved, an incredibly familiar voice came from her behind.
"As diligent as ever, huh, little sister."
Saya's eyes widened as, after a week, she became extremely anxious about her beloved's well-being, and suddenly, hearing his voice made her flustered.
Dropping her blade, Saya turned on her heels before her eyes found the image they sought desperately.
"Onii-sama...!"
It seemed Saya was about to embrace her big brother, but soon her excitement subdued as she held herself back.
Austin made a puzzled expression before he spoke in an unsure tone.
"What happened? No longer want big brother's hug?"
Saya slowly shook her head with her eyes tightly shut before she confessed something embarrassing even though they had met after so long.
"I am sweaty right now, Onii-sama. Once I freshen up, please hug me for a long while."
Saya could never reject her Onii-sama, but in her current state, she might give him an unpleasant experience, so she should endure for now.
But little did she think her Onii-sama would be so bold and unfair to attack her without warning.
With his hand on her back, Austin draped Saya's head on his chest as he patted the silly little girl before scolding her.
"When did you become so formal with me? You used to see me at my worst when I used to get sick often, and now you are getting conscious of such trivial things? Oh lord...what I will do with this child."
Saya's face flushed to the point where steam started erupting over her as she hid by snuggling close in her brother's warmth.
After the touching reunion, they separated as Austin asked about the past days, which Saya reported without fabrication.
They chatted for almost half an hour as Austin came to know Kyouki's progressive development and the information related to the thing he asked Saya to keep an eye on.
"Well, since it's an hour before the cafeteria opens, why don't we have a spar or two in the meantime?"
Saya's eyes lit up instantly as she raised her hand and called out her sword through summoning. Sparring with her brother was one of the things she had yet to try, and when there was a chance, she wouldn't let it go.
'I hope I don't disappoint Onii-sama.'
____________________...
A/N: - There would be an arc or two in continuation. The plot will now leap with various pieces joining the fray.
Let's see where this goes~.

chapters.title: Chapter 117: Resolve of a hero!
chapters.content:
"Look at those...I can feel the chills even though they are so far away."
Currently standing on the highest tower of Eden Academy stood two figures consisting of an olive-haired young maiden and a handsome youth as they saw the scene taking place in an open ground.
The youth, named Kyouki, had his eyes constantly fixed on the two warriors who were clashing blades with such fineness and accuracy, that made him immensely in the spar without a blink, daring to interrupt.
Even Sicily was wonderstruck after seeing Saya and Austin crossing blades at such a violent pace yet having a defensive stance not to let harm each other.
She preferred heavy weapons more, but she couldn't deny how beautiful it seemed to see the such fine art of swordsmanship.
Early in the morning, Sicily and Kyouki decided to have combat training. Since Lilia wasn't proficient in physical work, she was asked to cultivate her magical capacity just like she had been doing past weeks.
Since that time, Kyouki has witnessed how inferior he is if compared to the challenges yet to be proposed; he has been diligently training in secret.
Even though they were left with only three, the Hero's party took risks and ventured High-Rank Lairs to grow strong so they don't die worthlessly in front of future threats.
"How long would it take me to reach that level...."
Kyouki muttered under his breath as his eyes followed only Austin's movement.
From what he had heard from Venessa and seen these past few days, Kyouki could confidently say Saya was way out of his league. She's on a level he could only dream about if he practiced swordsmanship for more than five or maybe more years.
But what bothered him was Austin.
It was widely known that Austin was an Elemental Mage through and through. And generally, Mages don't move the way Austin was.
Was it the training he went through that Kyouki neglected? Is he a natural-born warrior who is destined to surpass everyone? What he lacked that Austin mastered?
Kyouki indeed had such thoughts and doubts, but there weren't obstacles that would be stopping him now from walking on the path of being the strongest.
If before he wanted to grow to fight evil, an add-on of surpassing Austin became the second last step of it.
The last step to accomplish all his hard work would undoubtedly be the demon king for whom Kyouki was born to fight and slaughter.
Knowing apparently what was going through her beloved's mind, Sicily held his hand before leaning her head on his shoulder.
"Let's do our best together, Kyo-kun. It might be a rocky path, but I promise to always stay with you."
(A/N: - Flag?)
_________________...
[3 days later]
It's been three days since Austin returned to Eden's Academy and reunited with his two beloveds, albeit a little peculiarly.
These days apart from teaching, Luna and Austin have been together all the time like they were glued to each other. Apparently, it was Luna who didn't want to let go of him since she knew 'the time' was nearing.
Saya after realizing what her big brother had planned and how she could be with him, Saya left the Saintess to have her Onii-sama all she wanted for now.
The class has taken a trail with Austin, Luna, and Saya's exceptional teaching. Just some more days and they would at least reach a level where a group could face Terror Class demon.
What they require are perseverance and rigorous training, and for that, regular professors would be enough for the students—concluding that the three didn't need to play instructors for more than a little longer.
In the evening, Austin, after having a peaceful chat with Saya and Luna on tea, went to meet the headmaster to talk about the labyrinth.
Just as he was about to knock on the highest door of the academy, a familiar voice approached from his back before Austin turned toward the source.
"Oh my~ Pleased to meet you again, Professor."
Tiara greeted Austin just like she did on the first day. Even though they have been in contact through class, Tiara's etiquette never faltered.
Austin also greeted the princess with a slight bow.
"Likewise, your highness. And please refrain from calling me professor in person."
Tiara giggled upon seeing how Austin gets troubled being called in such a manner but who would like to miss such an adorable reaction?
"That won't do, professor. Teaching for once, being a teacher for life. I have learned various valuable things from you, so no one could stop me from admiring you as my mentor."
Witnessing the tease in the cheeky princess' voice, Austin resigned in pursuing before he asked something more relevant to their situation.
"Were you going to meet the headmaster, your Highness?"
"Yes, I was, but if it's something confidential you want to talk with him about, I will come back later."
Erasing her mischievousness, Tiara spoke serenely as she didn't want to interrupt where she wasn't supposed to. Of course, she would know the content of what he would be talking about inside, but Tiara has to keep a good face in front of her beloved.
Austin thought for a second, but soon, he came to a decision and spoke in a certain tone.
"No...on the contrary, I would like you to hear what I am going to say."
____________________...
A/N: - Pace is good?
Lemme know in the comments~

chapters.title: Chapter 118: Helping her male God!
chapters.content:
**Knock**
"It's me, sir. Austin."
As he informed, the person on the other side replied in affirmation to enter before Austin twisted the doorknob and gave space for the lady to enter first.
"Oh my~ Thank you, Sir Austin."
Closing the door on his back, Austin saw the two prominent faces greeting each other before he walked to the center and offered his own greetings.
"Thanks for making time for me, headmaster."
Undoubtedly the Grandmaster of Eden Academy, who plays various roles in the upper echelon of Gram, too, doesn't stay leisurely in general.
Upon hearing Austin, Headmaster smiled warmly as he replied, "No, it's quite acceptable. Instead, I wanted to meet Austin too, to extend my gratitude."
Merlin twirled his finger before a teapot, and a plate of confections got served on the table. Preparing the tea, the white beard continued speaking.
"It would not be appropriate for me to say, but in all honesty…the things you, Luna, and Saya-san have taught the people in the academy…I might not have even reached there in all three years. Or to say, I myself don't know various things which my students now know. You brought them to such a stage that I could never have. I know it won't be much, but if in case you need my support, then, please don't hesitate, Austin."
As the old man concluded, the freshly brewed herbal tea, which had a strong aroma, invited the princess to taste it instantly.
Seeing the impatience from the all-time composed princess, Austin couldn't help but smile since the gesture was quite familiar to him.
"Is something the matter, Sir Austin?"
Tiara perplexedly tilted her head, but Austin just shook his head and looked forward to the headmaster.
"Regarding that. I was expecting favor from you, headmaster, and that's the reason I came today. "
Tiara sipped crisply as she looked at the scene with curiosity filling her gaze. On the other side, Merlin also brought his attention toward the young man as he nodded for him to continue.
Taking the tea, Austin took a sip, and indeed it had a peculiar taste of herbs. Placing the cup on the saucer, he spoke the rest of his words.
"I want to venture the Abyss."
*Klrk**
"Sumimase."
Tiara's cup made an audible sound since Austin's words made her incredibly startled. The same reaction was expressed by the bearded man, too, as he looked at the blond boy in astonishment.
The place Austin mentioned was undoubtedly the labyrinth hidden under their feet. The only place where even Merlin frets to dwell and the pandora's box, which has the world's knowledge-shattering beings hidden.
Even Emperor William had halted every matter concerning the ancient wormhole, which his predecessors also didn't leave any information about.
Despite being so near to them, the labyrinth is entirely mysterious up to the date.
"I won't ask the reason, nor would I encourage such a dangerous notion, but to let you inside the labyrinth, it would require official permission from the Majesty himself. I might send a letter to request approval, but there's no guarantee of how much time a response will arrive. May days, weeks, or even months wouldn't be surprising."
It was undoubtedly a matter which would require a thorough inspection and analysis before Emperor William would conclude.
And there was the uncertainty of acceptance for Austin's proposal too.
"Damn! Only if there would have a faster method."
Clenching his fist in annoyance, Austin muttered under his gritted teeth since he didn't want to prolong this trip any longer due to specific reasons.
"There is nothing I can do about it, Austin. I am sorry."
Merlin also resigned calmly since he couldn't force the Majesty to do anything in haste, nor he had the authority to let Austin dive into the wormhole without any permission.
At times of hopelessness, suddenly, a voice lightened the expectancy.
"Please rely on me, Sir Austin."
Suddenly a determined voice belonging to the eldest princess of Gram, Tiara, resonated before she assured her dejected male god.
"I will discuss this with my father and get you the acceptance within three days. You might be asked to meet my brother Mikhail first, but I assure you, I will not let this wish of yours get postponed any longer."
Her voice contained a strange glint of resolve like it had become a mission to accomplish so she could make her beloved happy.
Austin grinned as he thanked his fortune that Tiara bumped at such a golden hour, and as he expected, she would help him get her father's consent.
On the other side, Tiara, along with being resolute, had elation filling her inside as it was her first chance to be beneficial to Austin.
Turning toward the lady with a bright smile, which made the receiver's breath choke, Austin spoke his gratitude as he held her hand gently.
"I will never forget this favor of yours, princess. Thank you for the generosity you bestowed."
⁠ ⁠◑⁠ ◑_______________⁠◑⁠ ⁠◑
[9.13 p.m]
[Austin's dorm room]
"So, Onii-sama is going to venture in the abyss in the upcoming four days, and he wants my assistance. Of course, I am on it. Why is Onii-sama even asking."
Saya spoke in a tone that said there wasn't any room for hesitation. She had a hunch, and now when she finally got her brother's confirmation, she wasn't going to let him dwell in such a dangerous place alone.
Austin smiled as he expected such a response but still hearing his sister's strong words made him feel how quickly she has grown up.
"Try to keep your paws away from my husband, okay? If he gets dirtied because of you, I will spank you until it's red."
Luna, who was currently sitting in Austin's lap, growled while glaring at the raven-haired girl, much to Austin's perplexion.
Saya smirked for a blink before she made an innocent face and spoke in bafflement.
"I don't know what are you talking about.."
With a 'Hmph! ' the annoyed saintess turned her head and dipped her face in her favorite warmth, and while she was at it, she took Austin's hand and put it over her head.
Yes, she's spoilt! So what!?
"Onii-sama… if mana doesn't work there…won't that go for mana-potions too? Not to talk about medic and storage."
Austin held his sister's hand while patting his lover before he helped her calm down.
"It's okay, Saya. Nii-chan got everything sorted."
_________________
A/N: - Drop a comment~

chapters.title: Chapter 119: SS 5- Hand me the Prince!
chapters.content:
[It was around the time when Austin returned from his hometown. After Luna told Austin about the incident in the reception hall with Prince Cain, he paid a visit to the royal capital.]
♣-----------♣
"Have the tea been sent to Luna-san?"
"Hai, My lord."
In an extravagantly decorated hall that was shining with the radiance of its natural golden color walked two remarkably charming people varying in gender.
The girl who just replied to her master was, by appearance, a female in her early twenties with long auburn hair neatly tied in a ponytail that bumped with each of her steps.
Her facial features were undoubtedly above average, with a high nose and sharp hazelnut-shade eyes, which could make one nervous about glancing upon yet too inviting to ignore.
The man she was following and regarded as her lord was the most probable successor of the throne of Gram, Mikhail.
The woman he asked various things along the way to his office was his assistant and bodyguard, Jeanne. The only person on whom Mikhail trusts and relies entirely.
"Let's see how First Emperess reacts when she hears about it… "
What happened some days ago has put a heavy boulder on him since it wasn't just any measly person who attempted to do such an offense with the Saintess of Humanity.
Nobody knew that the first prince, Cain, could be so treacherous to lay hands on someone, using a demonic artifact, no less.
The facts, despite being bitter, Alex introduced in court at times of the War of Eden Academy, have been becoming a reality, day after day.
Not only students or soldiers have been getting involved with the nemesis of humanity, but now the royalties too. It really was uncertain now whom to trust or from whom to be wary.
The First wife of Emperor William and the mother of Cain haven't taken any action regarding the news of her son's imprisonment. But the silence was more deadening than any reaction.
For now, Mikhail has to look out for one person since he knows what depends on that person's response to this whole incident.
"Keep a close eye on the Academy, and let me know when Austin arrives."
"Certainly, my lord."
As Jeanne responded, she entered the office with the prince only to get startled at her first step.
With her hand falling on the hilt of her sword in reflex, she narrowed her gaze and stood in front of Mikhail to shield him from the possible threat sitting lazily on the office chair.
Mikhail's eyes widened before he grabbed Jeanne's hand and shook his head in denial.
"Don't, Jeanne. We can't afford to further offend him."
Mikhail spoke in a whispering tone before he walked away from his overprotective bodyguard's shadow, despite her pleading not to.
"My lord, but…."
"Don't worry, Lady Jeanne. I came here to talk."
The person who happened to be the most significant concern Mikhail had recently said in a tone that sent a shiver down the lady's back, but she held her ground and kept her eyes on the intruder.
"There's a procedure to meet the Prince, Sir Austin. If you may, you should also feel obliged to them."
Hearing the stiffness in her voice, Austin shrugged his shoulder as he replied, "Well, I will keep it in mind from next time."
Jeanne glared at the blond youth before following Mikhail to the head seat opposite Austin. Pulling the chair, she helped the man before standing on his left with her guard pulled all the time.
Mikhail had an apologetic smile on his face as he greeted the guest.
"It's been a while, Austin-san. How have you been."
Mikhail had no idea when Austin returned, but there was no doubt why he came here for. For even a minuscule, Mikhail had hopes that Luna wouldn't tell him about it…but nothing goes what one expects them to.
For now, he could only hope to get things through without making their relationship any more bitter than it already has.
Mikhail has an eye for powerful entities and in front of him was someone with the colossal potential to become one of the strongest pillars standing at the frontiers of Gram in the future.
When he gets on the throne, Mikhail needs people like him so he can run the empire way better than his father. Now, one could guess why Mikhail gives such importance to an ex-noble boy.
"Let's get straight to the point, Your Highness. That would save time for both of us. "
"!!"
Jeanne's glare became even denser as she felt utterly agitated hearing how prudently Austin was toward her lord. But nothing of that worked on the receiver as Austin's gaze remained on the front man.
Mikhail took a sip of water between the chilling gaze of two people before he nodded for the guest to continue.
"Hand me, Prince Cain."
Mikhail brought his composure back, leaning his chin on the intervened fingers as he responded in a serious tone.
"What if I reject?"
Jeanne had no respect or loyalty toward Cain, but still, when Austin asked so directly about the man who, despite being a perverted criminal, was the first prince, it made the woman amazed.
But upon hearing her lord suggesting a possible rejection, her body stiffened before she readied herself in case things went South.
And looking at Austin's change in temperament, her alertness has proven to be justified.
"It's not a question about whether you permit me or not. Prince Cain is already dead, in my perception. Either you make the route easy by agreeing right here and now, or I bring down the fortress and fulfill what I desire. I don't mind the chaos, but would you sacrifice your men to stop the inevitable?"
His voice, from start to end, remained emotionless, with a peculiar intent filling his hollow gaze. Austin didn't care even if the front man was the next Emperor. For him, anyone who dares to touch his beloved has no other way to compensate rather than death.
Mikhail understood the stance of the matter and how serious Austin was with his words. Of course, there were elite warriors in the Gramanian court and veterans like Charles and Alex, but it was uncertain which side would receive more damage.
Mikhail already has seen, through two events what capability Austin carries to the point he handled multiple Terror Ranks one-sidedly. Not to mention the high-tier artifacts he holds, which not even the Royal Treasury could match.
If Mikhail rejects the boy now, not only would there be a disastrous mayhem break out, but also all the possibility of taking Austin as one of Gram's assets would completely vanish.
After ten minutes or so of deep contemplation, it seemed Mikhail finally concluded. After gulping down the water, he directed his gaze back to the boy with a small smile spreading on his face.
"Tonight at 10.30. You might want to check the southwest exit of the palace. And yes, please be a little less flashy if you may."
Jeanne's brows raised in astonishment upon witnessing the exchange. From outer observation, one could never guess what kind of trade has taken place at the moment.
On the other side, Austin nodded as his expression eased a little before he stood up and extended his hand.
Mikhail followed the suite and, after standing up, held the hand in a shake.
"I will remember this consideration, Your highness. Farewell."
With that, Austin left with the attainment of what he came for, leaving a troubled Prince behind.
Dropping on the chair, Mikhail's mind went through various thoughts as he asked his assistant to prepare a strong coffee.
'I better talk with Alex before this news breaks out….'
________________
A/N: - And so, the eldest prince's story concludes here. I know it was short and dramatic, but what can we do? There might arise a case of social tension between Austin and Gram, but well, he doesn't care about such things anymore.
Drop a comment if you are hyped for the Labyrinth arc~

chapters.title: Chapter 120: Meeting with Mikhail….again!
chapters.content:
It's been two days since the meeting took place in the headmaster's office, and Tiara took the role of relaying Austin's request to her father, mainly known as the Emperor of Gram.
Since then, Austin has been preparing the items and weapons he needs inside the labyrinth and sorting them out inside his inventory.
A quest in between the days arrived for hunting some demons but other than that, the system has been staying silent ever since.
Well, Austin didn't bother with it more than necessary since he knew, other than a few skills and inventory, the system couldn't take anything from him. And as for the things he has in inventory, Austin has made a backup for that, as well.
Finally, the day arrived for his meeting with Royal Highness Prince Mikhail, for which Austin used Teleportation this time, unlike the last visit, where he flew all the way from Eden Academy to the Capital.
Arriving at the palace, his treatment by the officials and guards has become incredibly bothersome. They salute with high-pitched greetings at every corner.
""WE PAY RESPECT TO THE HONORARY WARRIOR!! ""
Like this one.
After the ceremony, an image of Austin as a war veteran had been getting widespread in significantly less time. There were those too, who still didn't believe that someone without Goddess' Blessing could be so mighty and such.
But then again, in a way or another, Austin was getting the attention that he never sought. If only not for his mother's request, Austin would have left Gram after sorting out this Labyrinth issue.
'*Sigh*...another year in the academy is it…. '
Sighing in weariness, he made his way to the office he had visited some days ago, only to be halted by a beautiful woman.
"It's been a while, Jeanna-san."
The person responsible for Prince Mikhail's assistance and protection, Jeanne Calight, stood in front of the door with guards stationed at either side.
Just like the last time, Jeanna still was wary of Austin but what changed was her perception after what she saw happening with the first prince, Cain.
Never she thought that a mere boy in his teenage years would not even hesitate to slaughter a High Noble like a pig to the point, even she vomited on the spot.
Of course, she didn't have sympathy for Cain, but to think that only attempting to touch this person's girlfriend could result in such death…
She, indeed, was shaken up to the core.
"I apologize for the impolitic behavior I displayed the last time, Sir Austin."
Rather than greetings, what Jeanne chose was to ask for forgiveness as she realized what position Austin might be acquiring in no time in the court of Gram.
She respects strong people despite not trusting him even a bit.
"You were doing your job, Lady Jeanne. That's not something you should be feeling regretful about, no?"
With a thin smile, Austin entered inside, leaving a stunned Jeanne on the spot as she understood her mistake. But what was spoken couldn't be taken back, so she chose to follow him inside.
…
"Pleasure to meet you after so long, Austin-san."
Austin was a little perplexed why Mikhail said 'after so long,' but soon realized the reason.
'We are being tapped….'
It didn't take long for him to survey the office before he located three artifacts placed at distinct places, which probably would have been built to transmit the talks they would be having now.
Following suit, Austin also extended his hand and offered his greeting with a wry smile spreading on his lips.
"I am honored to meet you after so…long, Your Highness."
Shaking hands wasn't a greeting someone in the position of Austin should use for a high noble like Mikhail. But neither of them minded such courtesy and treated each other like equals.
After offering the seat, both men sat facing each other as the beautiful sharp-eyed woman stood beside her lord while keeping an eye on the surroundings.
What amused her was the not-so-believable acting Austin had just presented. But, well, she would keep it to herself…for now.
"My sister, Tiara, has proposed a request to Your Majesty regarding your permit to enter the Abyss. Am I on point?" (Mikhail)
Austin nodded without hesitation before he saw Jeanne walking to the door since they heard two consecutive knocks on it.
A tray filled with baked snacks and two cups was slid inside before the lady brought it up to the table and served the men while maintaining the silence.
Austin did a quick survey and found no suspicious add-on in the coffee, fortunately. As he took the first sip, he heard the Prince continuing.
"As per our history, you must have known how many elite warriors have lost their lives in that place since the labyrinth doesn't support the essence of our strength, mana."
"I am aware of those facts."
Enjoying the bitterness of the beverage, Austin replied in an unconcerned tone making the Prince even more anxious.
Exhaling deeply, Mikhail continued, "And you want permission to venture into that lair of mystery without even letting us know your goal? Is that what you desire, Sir Austin?"
His anxiousness was building from the probable consequences which might arise if Mikhail permitted Austin to dive into that hell hole.
But just as he expected, Austin is a tough nut who couldn't be cracked with mere words.
"It's exactly what I want, Your Highness."
Sipping on the last drop, Austin concluded his words which had no room for negotiation or possible way of stopping him.
Mikhail observed the boy for some seconds, but in the end, he couldn't find a single uncertainty in his resolve.
Sighing, he accepted his defeat.
"Okay then, Austin-san. You will have permission to dive in the Labyrinth, but there's a condition you have to agree to get this deal settled."
Austin expected something like this from the start. Royalties, letting a teenager have all the fun without getting their nose stacked in it… was unlikely to be the case. And Mikhail's words confirmed that speculation.
"You have to take someone from the court inside the Labyrinth. . I assure you that the person would only be helpful to you, and the last thing she will become would be a burden."
Austin blinked in perplexion as this twist came out of nowhere before he saw Mikhail pronouncing a name, which tingled a part of his memory.
"Cordelia."
A black shadow emerged on the right of Mikhail before the figure of a young woman appeared out of nothingness.
Before analyzing anything about her, what made Austin astonished was the identity of the person.
'How can I forget about her…
_______________
A/N: - Drop a comment if you are hyped for the next chapter.

chapters.title: Chapter 121: End of preparation!
chapters.content:
Everything was resolved from the Capital. Austin received a written confirmation that he may dive into the Ancient Labyrinth built beneath the Eden Academy, under the close supervision of a Gramanian Court Official named Cordelia.
Inside a small meeting room where the hero's party generally gathers, could be seen several figures with varying expressions on their face.
From all of them, the ugliest expression was adorned by the olive shade-haired mage supporter, Sicily, as she saw the sight in front.
Lilia also didn't have a pleasant face when she saw her beloved in such an intimate space with another woman, but she somehow pulled herself together.
Saya and Austin stood at a different corner while chatting about various things. Well, it was Saya who mostly talked and told her Onii-sama about some of the things related to their past life and such.
These two were entirely unbothered by the reunion happening in the middle of the room.
The reunion of two childhood friends…
"Oh lord, you can't imagine how worried I was all this time, Kyo-chan. Thank God, you are safe and healthy."
The raven-haired girl whom Mikhail delegated to take along inside the Labyrinth, Cordelia, was currently hugging her childhood friend, Hero Kyouki.
And yes, she is one of the late-introduced heroines of the manga Austin used to read.
She's a person who the Royal Palace scouted at an early age due to the skill she carries, called Shadow Manipulation. The talent, as it seemed, was unique enough not to let Cordelia get mixed up in a town of commoners.
At the age of 10, before Kyouki was bestowed with his blessing from the Goddess of Light, Cordelia was taken to the Royal court, and unfortunately, she had to get separated from her best friend.
It was quite disheartening for the girl, but she had the ambition to become strong so she could protect Kyouki.
At times she heard Kyouki become a hero, she wanted to go and congratulate him, but the strict orders of the Upper Echelons restricted her from roaming outside.
What she has been doing for seven years is rigorous training and honing her skills so she can work as a battle tool for Gram and also be helpful to her childhood sweetheart.
Even though she was introduced more than half of the story had already progressed, she had a significant impact on the audience's perception.
Reason?
Cordelia is a yandere.
She doesn't only see Kyouki as a friend but even more than a husband. She worships him in a way.
In the manga, she had a great rivalry against the others, especially Luna, since Kyouki had all his attention converged on Luna most of the time.
Thanks to Venessa's interference in the matter, Luna was saved from being assassinated once. After that event, Kyouki slowly started realizing everyone's feelings, and they got their happy endings.
*BAM**
"E-Ehhhh? Onii-sama!? Nande?"
Austin suddenly slammed his head on the wall, which made a small crater at the place. The noise naturally brought everyone's attention to him as Austin spoke with a wry smile.
"I just needed to keep something out of my head."
The picture of Luna marrying Kyouki have popped up in his head twice until now and by no mean was he delighted from his shitty mind about it. He knew it was all a fictional thing to happen, but still, it annoyed him.
After assuring his worried sister that he was okay, Austin looked at the four with their gaze fixed on him. The most noticeable one was from Cordelia, who was glaring daggers at the person who ruined her reunion.
"It's nine right now. We have to depart in less than fourteen hours. Kyouki, I hope informing you beforehand would have been useful."
Without minding the intense stare, Austin asked the boy who would be this venture's fourth member. Since Kyouki has the ability to store Light Energy inside him and from what Saya told him, he has become more proficient with his sword; the hero becomes the prime subject to take inside the Abyss.
Austin might be confident in his skills, but what's not known could be dangerous even for the mightiest being. So he chose to be safe rather than to be sorry.
"Yes, I have been preparing what I need and will report strictly at 11 near the headmaster's office."
Austin nodded in satisfaction before he turned toward his sister.
"Saya. Get all the things I asked, along with the herbs and antidotes, and meet me at my dorm around eight in the morning."
With a resolute face, Saya nodded as she said, "Understood, Onii-sama."
Back to the front, Austin looked at the teenage girl who, by appearance, looked slightly older and stood just beside Kyouki.
"Cordelia-san. I hope you can bring yourself on time."
"Before that. Tell me one good reason why you are acting like a leader when we have a hero in the team?"
Austin had expected such a trivial thing to be raised. A hero is destined to lead people on the path of prosperity and *blah*blah*.
But it wasn't Austin who replied; rather, a heavy voice resonated profoundly in the room, sending shivers down the listener's spine.
"Keep your tone in check, girl, before I mute it forever. Again, if you dare to talk like that with my Onii-sama, I will help you feel a new sensation called dread, understood?"
Saya's voice contained no particular emotion, unlike the times she talks with her brother. Her violet eyes which never left Cordelia, held an intent that made the latter back away in an instant, with sweat accumulating on her forehead.
(A/N: - Remind me if I had mentioned Saya's eye before.)
Even Sicily and Lila were taken aback by such a shift in temperament. At this moment, they made a mental note about their behavior toward Austin.
Austin shook his head in helplessness before he patted the little sister of his, who worries a lot when it comes to him.
"There…there."
Saya pouted as her severe expression vanished in a second. She didn't like how her brother doesn't let her get angry at those who disrespects him, but by no means could she reject his pats.
After calming down the child, Austin looked back to the others as he spoke his concluding words.
"Okay then, guys. Sleep well for tonight since who knows how long we will be missing our beds. And yes, don't forget to farewell properly to your loved ones since inside the Labyrinth, no one knows what awaits us."
_____________..
A/N: -Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 122: I might kill you!
chapters.content:
After Austin and Saya left, who remained were the three of Hero's party and the new temporary recruitment, Cordelia Calight.
Cordelia wanted to be with Kyouki alone, but looking at the other two women's expressions, she understood that would be close to impossible for now.
She indeed thought that after becoming a hero, Kyouki would become popular with women. Still, just after entering the Academy, he had three beauties fawning over him, which now had come down to two.
She was well-informed about Venessa, Sicily, and Lilia. And the lady called the Saintess for whom her Kyo-chan did so many things in foreign continents too.
Despite not being in the picture, Cordelia had her ways of digging out information that concerns her beloved.
"I will prepare tea for everyone."
Lilia understood that there was going to be a serious discussion in the meeting hall, that's why she went and readied the refreshments first.
The others sat on the round table with Kyouki on the head seat and Cordelia on his right. Sicily, as always, took the left seat, where she always belonged.
"Kyo-chan. What's with that woman? Her features tell me that she is also from a commoner society, yet the aura she carries surpasses everyone I have ever faced altogether. And the strangest part… Why does she regard Austin as a big brother?"
Cordelia was stressed about the last part because it reeked of some kind of kink which she might want her Kyo-chan to stay away from.
Her raven hair which most commoner children get from their parents, made Cordelia believe that Saya was also one of them. But not those eyes.
Those life-threatening, soul-freezing eyes.
"I am not certain about her origin, but she seemed to be Austin's relative, and other than that, she's incredibly strong, that I can say."
Kyouki didn't disclose that Saya first met them in Xylex since he didn't trust Cordelia entirely. She has been inside the fortress of Gram for seven years. Who knows what political drama might erupt once the Upper Echelon knows about Saya's summoning and the other heroes?
Sicily also stayed silent and just nodded to support Kyouki's statement.
Cordelia pondered for a long second before she raised her brows and asked in an unsure tone.
"How strong are we talking about here?"
There's a possibility that in the future, Cordelia might be standing against Austin as per what she has gotten the intel from Austin's hometown and such. If that were the case, then she better enquire about her potential enemy and his allies.
Kyouki, upon hearing Cordelia's question, thought for a long minute before asking something in context to his response.
"Do you know Captain Charles?"
Cordelia's brows raised as she nodded and answered instantaneously.
"The honorary Knight Commander who one-sidedly overwhelmed the War of East. I have never fought him but have witnessed what brutality that man contains."
Charles' name was not only famous in Gram but also in other continents because of the battle he fought against the South Eastern continent while being the sole defender left.
Kyouki leaned his back on the chair as he spoke solemnly.
"I also haven't fought Captain Charles. But from my observation… if the whole Gram Royal Order under the command of Sir Charles stand against Saya-san…our nation might become defenseless in a mere half a day."
_____________
"...and now just the wait for tomorrow morning."
After leaving the meeting room, Austin dropped Saya at Luna's room before he returned to his own, where he awaited his beloved.
Since she felt it boring to be in the discussion, Luna enjoyed her own company while sipping on the lemon tea.
After he returned Luna heard the brief of what happened in the gathering while sitting in his lap with his arms embracing her in a tight hold.
Strangely, Luna now loved being hugged like a baby while she heard his heavy yet gentle voice from inches apart. Maybe it was the familial absence she sought from her lover…but whatever it was, Luna felt happy to be held.
"This new girl is troublesome. Why don't I go and kill her? You can take her body double inside the labyrinth."
Austin smiled wryly upon such a nonchalant remark as he shook his head in denial.
"It's okay. I can handle it if things go South. And her skill doesn't work on mana, to begin with, so she surely would get useful."
"Unlike me. "
Austin's brows raised as he heard her complaining tone before panicking to pamper her.
"Everyone has their strength, Luna. You might not be good with combat, but you are the strongest when it comes to mana. So don't belittle yourself."
Austin patted the troubled child when with her cheeks bulging profoundly, Luna grabbed his hand and shouted in annoyance.
"Don't pat me to subdue my anger!!"
Turning around in a swift motion, she strangled Austin down as she sat on his waist while glaring at him with her cheeks reddening.
"You know how it feels to be always useless to you?! I am super mad right now, Austin! Super mad! You know my anger could even burn you at the moment! You might die, so run away from this troublesome me!"
It might be the first time Austin has seen such anger from Luna, which wasn't aimed at him but herself.
Even Austin was also irritated by his helplessness regarding the matter of the demonic artifact investigation. So he completely understood why she was so upset regarding the matter.
But as Luna herself said earlier, they can only do those things which are within their capability. Trying to be helpful in repulse would result in nothing but regrets.
Extending his hand, Austin held her face before he spoke in a soothing tone.
"If death can be so beautiful, I might embrace it with my arms open and a smile on my face."
(A/N: - I know how you guys felt, but endure it.)
Luna's expression instantly switched as her cheeks loosened at a tremendous rate. With her ear reddening, she plopped her face down on his chest as she mumbled.
"Baka…always saying something so embarrassing."
Punching his chest lightly, Luna whined. A grin spread across Austin's lips as he gently caressed Luna's precious hair.
The two didn't speak for a long time. Only feeling each others' presence while enjoying the warmth which they forbade to share with anyone else, Luna and Austin spent their peaceful moments in the way which seemed best for them.
After some minutes, Luna called for Austin in a soft whisper.
"Say, darling."
"Hmm?"
After a slight pause, Luna concluded her words, albeit a little hesitant along the way.
"After yo-you return from the Labyrinth…let's get married, okay?"
_______________
A/N: - Shame on you, Austin. She proposed first.
Drop a comment if you liked the chapter~

chapters.title: Chapter 123: Demand from wife!
chapters.content:
Last night, Austin stayed awake until the sun didn't start reflecting his and Luna's naked body, muddled into each other like they were glued with an unbeatable seal.
And that was inside a time barrier that Luna made to slow down the period by half an hour. Before she fell into a slumber of deep exhaustion, she broke the barrier with her remaining energy.
Austin wasn't able to sleep much due to the words Luna spoke or the way she wept many times across the night. He somehow managed to coax her but made a mental note about what should be done first, after returning from the labyrinth.
Amidst his contemplation and partial drowsiness, Austin heard two knocks on his door before his eyes instantly shot open.
Getting out of the comforter without letting the princess wake up, Austin draped a shirt over his shoulder with a pair of boxers on his lower body.
He didn't bother buttoning up since he knew the person on the other side was familiar enough to mind such things.
*CLICK**
"Morning, Saya."
"Good morning Onii-....."
Saya's words trailed off as her gaze fell on Austin's body which held every muscle at the exact point which could excite a woman. Not to talk about the red and blue bruises, which display how wild play must have taken place last night.
Being stared at like that, Austin became conscious of the hickeys Luna planted all over his body last night before he turned around and invited Saya inside.
"Sorry for the display, sister. Come in. I will make some tea. "
"Ah.."
Saya wanted to complain since she definitely liked what she saw, but that would be too shameless if she suddenly begged her Onii-sama to let her ogle at him.
Austin guided Saya to the round tea table as he went to boil water and excused Luna's current condition.
Saya didn't mind since, looking at Luna's peaceful sleeping face, she could somehow understand how tired she was to sleep such soundly.
While pouring the tea leaves, Austin's voice again reached up to the raven-haired beauty, but this time, his voice contained a bit of profoundness.
"I want you to promise me something, Saya."
The listener also became serious as she saw Austin walking back with a tray containing two tea sets over it. Saya stood up and took the tray from him before Austin nodded and sat back on the chair.
As Saya poured milk into each cup and added sugar, she heard her brother resuming.
"If any situation arises where you get the chance to save any one life of yourself or any of the three of us, you have to promise you'll run away without even considering a second option."
Saya's eyes widened as she sat facing her brother while pondering why he suddenly brought up such a matter. She was strong enough to protect her Onii-sama from any danger, then why…
But even in a case, something like what Onii-sama spoke really does happen, Saya would probably save her brother without even thinking a blink.
How could she promise something which she couldn't fulfill?
"I have my ways to come back from death, my dear sister. So, don't think uselessly and say you promise."
Holding her hand dearly, Austin caressed her cheeks, making the latter blush as she felt like getting cornered by her brother's unfair persuasion.
Closing her eyes shut, she utters her words in between the warm shivers she felt down her spine due to the sensation she felt on her face.
"O-okay, I promise."
"Good~."
Austin pulled back his hand, leaving a wobbly Saya behind as she lay back on the chair while panting as she had gone through a marathon.
She just couldn't take this aggressive Onii-sama of hers!
_____________
Nearly at half past nine, both of them finished their chats and sipped on another serving of tea before Austin went to freshen up.
Austin talked about some of the things he had thought regarding the labyrinth and precautions they might take according to the situation.
Saya also gave her speculation and listened to everything her brother had to advise.
"Okay, then. You go ahead and wait for me in the dining hall."
Saya bowed before she departed from Austin's room and went to arrange breakfast for the two.
Austin took a short bath before he changed his clothes into a black shirt and a free-size high-waist pair of black pants. His feet were covered with high boots and a special kind of white gloves on his hand, with a sapphire stone planted in the center.
Tying his long-grown hair in a short bun, he felt annoyed with some strands which weren't getting pinned in one place at all, so he left them hanging over his forehead.
Stepping out of the dressers, he first felt a hot gaze peeking at him up to down.
Walking to his cupboard, Austin spoke in a gentle tone.
"You woke up? Sorry for being noisy."
Austin grabbed some sets of his clothes and started packing them in a bag. He doesn't like to put anything which he wears and eats in inventory since there are some nasty things stored inside.
Well, he does have emergency backup kept in the system storage, but until it doesn't come down to that, Austin prefers fresh apparel and nourishment.
