Austin's movement suddenly halted as a pair of pale yet beautiful hands circled around his waist before he felt a familiar fragrance wafting around him.
The warmth on his back undoubtedly belonged to the woman who had the capability to sneak behind him without getting noticed.
"You sure going to dive in that Labyrinth but not on a date with some bitchy woman? What's with this dangerous look?"
Austin didn't actually have many ideas when it came to dressing up and all, so Luna's compliments always made him perplexed.
"You think so? Well, I can dress up like this for you, too, if you want."
Austin suggested as he finished packing and turned around to look at his favorite eyes. Hugging her waist, Austin leaned on the cupboard as he saw Luna standing there stark naked.
It was getting up worked up; where to keep his eyes when he heard her seductive voice.
"Something which no one can see my Austin in. I love your birth suit more than anything."
Saying so, Luna brought her hand to tuck his hair which was giving him a dangerously attractive look as she spoke in her previous tone.
"I can't say sissy words like stay safe or eat regularly. What I want is for you to return to me alive and healthy. This is not a plea Master Austin but a demand from your future wife."
Austin raised his left brow upon hearing such assertive words from her before he circled his arm around her waist and pulled her to lean upon his body.
"And you too. Dare to put yourself in danger, and I will spank your ass until it doesn't remember the size of my palm, you understand?"
Luna didn't reply but, with a smirk, stared at his eyes intently while she received the same approach from him.
Amidst steamy silence, both of them suddenly burst into soft giggles as their heads leaned upon each other.
How aggressively they tried to mask, they couldn't hide how hard it was for both of them to get separated.
With her eyes filling with moisture, Luna spoke with a soft whisper.
"Come back as soon as possible, darling. I am so going to miss you."
"Mm. Will do."
______________
A/N: -I hate to separate them, but the plot needs to move. The next chapter will introduce the labyrinth and the real demon side that has been hiding.
Stay tuned~

chapters.title: Chapter 124: Dive into the darkness!
chapters.content:
Around eleven in the morning, the group of four who were going to dive into the labyrinth, along with the headmaster Merlin, the other two members of Hero's Party, and Princess Tiara, gathered at the head office.
Kyouki, along with his three friends, had already reported an hour early. Only Austin and Saya arrived at the last minute.
Standing at the center of the room, Merlin didn't engage in conversation as per what Austin requested and went to commence the unsealing process while the others witnessed in silence.
The art of ancient magic was genuinely magnificent, on which even Austin hadn't gotten his reach. Drawing every circle physically through mana while chanting the spell was a sight to home a memory in the audience's mind.
Amidst the silence, the pretty blonde girl whispered in Austin's ear without turning her gaze.
"Strange not to see, Luna-san here."
Austin raised his brows since it was the first time Tiara talked about Luna to him. In the same whispering tone, he replied truthfully.
"The last thing I would want to see before diving in is to see her saddened face; that's why I asked her to stay back."
Austin was sure that Luna would grieve or even cry if she saw him jumping in the labyrinth, and that scene might weigh him down and his future decisions.
The best course of action was to not take Luna with him, and the latter also preferred the same since she also knew how hopeless Luna becomes when Austin gets involved in dangerous things.
Despite speaking in an incomplete phrase, Tiara understood clearly why Luna didn't come. And by no means was she pleased to hear that. Well, it was good that the Saintess left Austin for Tiara for some moments, but what made her pout was Austin's concern was directed only to Luna!
She was also dying of anxiety since she realized how she helped Austin get the permit of the Abyss. Not in a hundred years would she want to let Austin descend into that hell hole, but now the ship has already left the port.
Now what she could do is to pray for his well-being and beg her god that he returns safely to her.
**SHWISH**
With a whipping sound, the center of the room started disintegrating, with seven purple stones illuminating from different corners.
Those stones are the artifacts that Headmaster Merlin himself developed to strengthen the sealing magic. Everyone believes that the Barricade Grandmaster has drawn over the labyrinth is powerful enough not to break by even a Mythic Rank demon.
But well, that's just a rumor since some weeks ago, the seals were broken, and no High-Rank entity ever entered the Academy's premises.
'Woah… '
Kyouki's eyes went round as he saw the never-ending darkness dug just at the place which was vacant some moments ago. It truly gave the sensation of an Abyss, sending shivers down the spine of almost everyone inside the room.
Even Saya gulped in slight fret since she wasn't much good with darkness, and being in a situation where her Onii-sama would be watching her, made the woman restless.
"Okay then, Headmaster. I don't know how long we would be out, but on my way back, I would make sure to bring souvenirs."
With those words, Austin jumped inside only after he held his little sister's hand, much to the latter's astonishment.
"Don't use levitation since it won't…
Austin's shout trailed off since it seemed he had already reached a certain depth.
The expression on the others' faces reflected nothing but shock as they witnessed such a careless approach of Austin, or maybe he was too confident?
"Kyou-kun, here. "
Sicily suddenly took out something from her pouch and tied it around Kyouki's neck.
Lifting the small pearl at the adjoining point, Kyouki didn't have to ask before Sicily cleared his confusion.
"It's a family treasure that father asked me to delegate to you. He said, 'At times of darkness, this stone shall help you seek the right path. ' "
Kyouki nodded with a serious expression before he thanked the girl who had her eyes red forever he could remember. The same was for Lilia, who had been crying like a child even though Kyouki tried his best to coax her.
Giving a final hug of farewell to both, Kyouki was called by Headmaster as he saw the bearded mage extending a ring to him.
"This is a Spatial Storage ring that contains things you might find helpful inside the Abyss. Feed it your blood, and it will connect to your soul. "
Kyouki was surprised to receive such valuable gifts from both as he took the gold ring from Merlin.
After collecting his thought, Kyouki clenched his fist before he held Cordelia's hand. With a resolute nod, he spoke in a confident tone.
"I will not let these invaluable blessings go to waste. Okay, then. I will see you guys in a bit. "
Glancing again at Sicily and Lilia, Kyouki fell inside the hole with his hand connected to his friend in a tight hold.
The sizzling blizzards, along with an ominous sensation, spread through both of their consciousness as their body traveled at a controllable pace downwards.
Straightening their bodies, they gathered the remaining mana in their feet since, as Austin said, this place indeed suppressed their magical resource like a precious part of them was eaten out.
**DHAK**
After falling for more than ten seconds, Cordelia and Kyouki landed safely on the ground only to get stunned by sight, which emerged almost spontaneously.
With their grip on each other growing stiffer, they saw the rise of a being whom, despite being aware, they couldn't help but shiver upon witnessing.
[You mere mortal dared to enter my domain!]
____________…
A/N: - This labyrinth would bring out many secrets and mysteries which would connect to the future and origin of Austin.
Well, let's see where this goes~

chapters.title: Chapter 125: Serpent Queen Again…?
chapters.content:
[You mere mortals dare to enter my domain!]
With their body growing stiff and breathing choked in their throat, what welcomed Cordelia and Kyouki was a massive reptilian creature.
Just by its outer appearance, Kyouki could discern how tough it would be to penetrate those massive scales. Not to talk about the fatal thin whipping tail, slithering at a corner alertly.
Its golden eyes seemed to peek just inside their souls as Kyouki studied as much as he could in fractions of seconds, before letting go of Cordelia.
"Back off and assist me from the shadows."
Cordelia wasn't an amateur to remain in a daze for long. Hearing Kyouki's words, she wanted to protest, but soon she understood why he asked her so.
Nodding, she gave his hand a last squeeze before her body got covered in black smog, camouflaging her with the background.
The creature didn't move since it detected the human standing cautiously in front would strike, if it went after the human girl.
[That essence… Aren't you a Hero? Excellent ~ It would be the first time to have some holy flesh.]
The serpent moved steadily while eyeing Kyouki head to toe. The essence inside a human glowed most peculiarly and had the mana which shone the brightest.
The serpent queen hasn't encountered a God before, but that doesn't mean she doesn't have a record of those who carry their will.
Those who receive blessings of Omnipotent beings are naturally strong to the point even the Serpent Queen hesitated to approach blindly.
But at the end of the day, this human Hero also relies on the same thing which others did.
Mana.
**HISSSS**
With a swift movement, the creature moved toward Kyouki with its mouth parted and four needle-sharp fangs protruding dangerously at the front.
Kyouki didn't have to enhance himself to dodge such a front-on attack, so he did. Using the strength in his hind limbs, Kyouki jumped back at a more remarkable speed as he unsheathed his sword mid-air.
The snake narrowed its gaze in mockery as its head was just a ploy since the actual attack was to be blown from its tail, approaching Kyouki's back.
"Not so easy…."
**SLING**
Kyouki anticipated such a thing, as without even turning his body, he swung his sword in a precise slash and detached the creature's tail from its massive body.
**KHEEK**
The creature screeched in annoyance as purple blood gushed out from where its tail was previously. Regrowing its body part would be easy, but the troublesome human wasn't waiting at all.
"[Heaven's Judgment]"
Kyouki raised his sword, which was illuminating like a small sun by now, as he jumped toward the serpent queen at a furious pace.
The monster tried to move away from the trajectory when it felt its body glued to the ground, or rather its shadow was?
"You think I will let you get away?"
Cordelia shouted from a corner with her hand planted on the ground, and using Kyouki's blinding light; she trapped the Serpent's shadow in her hold.
The creature didn't bother trying to move anymore since it concluded the strength behind the weird Spell. There was only one remaining option, and that was to counter the Human Hero.
[Don't be full of yourself!]
With agitation filling the Queen's voice, it parted its mouth before a purple ball generated within a second before the creature released the giant sphere toward Kyouki.
Cordelia's eyes went wide since, in that proximity, Kyouki couldn't have dodged the attack, but suddenly a whip of air slashed the purple orb like a sharp knife cutting a fruit.
Before Cordelia could have searched for the chanter, who helped Kyouki just now, a defeating sound resonated in the labyrinth signifying that the Great Sword of Light Hero had met its prey.
The creature's massive head was split into two with Kyouki's attack, with life leaving its body at a threatening gait.
**DHAK**
Cordelia let go of the hold, before the massive body of the Giant Snake lifelessly fell to the ground with the radiance of its eyes, disappearing into nothingness.
"Kyo-chan! Are you alright?!"
In a panic, Cordelia rushed towards the place where still the smog of venom fermented profoundly.
There stood a handsome young warrior wielding his sword in a relaxed grip and his robust body covered in his enemy's blood.
The sight was marvelous enough to throw Cordelia into a stupor, but first, she had to check on her friend.
"Yeah, I am fine. What about you?"
Taking out clean clothes from his pouch Kyouki started wiping his face when Cordelia took the job and snatched the clothing from him.
Wiping gently, she answered him in a soothing tone.
"I am good, but my heart is racing. When did my silly Kyo-chan become this strong?"
Kyouki became embarrassed being complimented as he scratched the back of his head after letting go of his sword, which was planted on the ground.
"Indeed remarkable, Hero. As Saya said, you really have become stronger from the last time I remember."
From a distance, a voice approached them, but since the voice was familiar, neither of them became cautious.
"Couldn't you have come out of the shadows a little early?"
Continuing to wipe her friend clean, Cordelia spoke in a grumpy tone since she didn't like how her Kyo-chan was put into danger right off the bat.
"It's okay, Lia. Austin has supported me enough to let me have the victory."
Kyouki spoke with a sigh because, due to his haste, he didn't think such an attack could be reciprocated by the serpent. If not for the wind slash Austin threw at such a crucial moment, the result might have varied.
Cordelia didn't say anything but pouted since she still felt it was unfair to let Kyouki do everything. He might have gotten hurt there.
"It's just as you said, Onii-sama. The venom is almost similar, and so is its taste."
From a different side, Saya also walked to the group she brought to the small pouch containing the venom of the same snake but collected at different times.
As Saya handed the pouches, Cordelia and Kyouki looked at the blond youth in perplexion, trying to find something plausible.
With a thin smirk, Austin looked at the bags as he muttered under his breath.
"So we were indeed inside a game and just cleared the first level, eh…
_____________…
A/N: - Drop a comment and stay safe ✌️

chapters.title: Chapter 126: Something made for the hero!
chapters.content:
"Wait. Let me get this straight. That snake was the monster who engulfed Sicily, and you already killed it on your last visit?"
With a look of disbelief, Kyouki asked in an uncertain voice after he heard Austin's story of the time when Sicily was entrapped in the Labyrinth.
Cordelia also had the same expression, except for the fact that she didn't trust him entirely. From what she heard from Austin, it seemed he alone subjugated the Serpent Queen, but Cordelia had another opinion on that matter.
"Have you guys played games? Which have levels?"
Choosing not to answer the hero's curiosity since it was needless, Austin asked something out of nowhere, making Cordelia and Kyouki even more baffled.
"Level? I don't know about it, but sure, we have played games back in town."
Kyouki answered as he glanced at Cordelia, who was nodding in agreement. Back in his birthplace, he, Cordelia, and many other kids loved to play demon and Hero.
But what confused them was this foreign word called 'Level' included in-game. Fortunately, Austin made it more straightforward this time for them to understand.
"Let's imagine that you and I are two different players, who, despite diving in the same game, fight the same monster, yet separately. Well, it's natural for players to go through obstacles in-game, but what about real life? How was that thing slithering around when I killed it some weeks ago?"
Complete silence befell on the floor as Austin muttered those words, much to Cordelia and Kyouki's astonishment. They somehow understood what Austin tried to interpret, yet it seemed utterly implausible.
And not only that. Even Saya verified that both venoms belonging to the creature Austin killed some time ago, and the venom of the snake Kyouki cornered to death are the same.
There was no room to deny that the Reptilian Queen was one, yet she got killed twice.
"Onii-sama…if it really is like a game..then this floor would be…."
Rising to his feet, Austin took the lead and completed his sister's words.
"Indeed, we just cleared level one."
Throwing the venom pouches into his inventory, Austin looked at the two perplexed beings who still were trying to discern everything which Austin spoke.
"You guys. Have you taken the Mana Suppression Pills with you?"
Hearing Austin's query, Kyouki searched inside his pouch before he took out a small bag that contained a dozen of small orange candies-like balls.
Mana-suppressing balls, were something that was required for anyone other than Austin. The system possessing youth could suppress his mana through the system features but not the others.
The Pills Kyouki just showed temporarily represses mana for those who can't handle it. Some people buy those pills because of their axis mana reserve, which they can't control.
Since it becomes excruciating for mana users to even walk in the labyrinth, Austin asked Saya, Cordelia, and Kyouki to take at least a bunch since a single Mana suppressing ball works for 12 hours. Not more, not less.
"Good. Now let's see where's the entrance to the next level."
Turning his gaze away, Austin chanted a small fireball over his head which dispersed into several amber pearls and distributed around the hall.
Since all of them were superhuman, visibility to a certain distance was possible, but for scouting, they needed assistance.
Strangely, Austin wasn't able to find anything at all; even his vision was circulating profoundly along with his fireballs, and so were his senses.
"Onii-sama. I think it's beneath us… "
Hearing Saya's call, who currently had her hand touching the ground, Austin frowned slightly.
"You sure? I searched underground but didn't catch anything."
"I am not entirely certain, but I do feel there's or to say there are several entities beneath us."
Austin raised his brows with astonishment and pride, pumping his chest. More than his limitation of Detection skills, he felt extremely delighted to see how wonderful his sister has grown up to.
"Good job there. Nii-chan is very proud of Saya."
Since she was kneeling on the ground for surveillance, she was caught off guard by her Onii-sama, who suddenly started caressing her head while saying those fluffy words.
Grinning toothly, Saya let herself get patted as she leaned on his leg like a kitten and rubbed her face to show her elation.
"I again want to ask…what is their relationship?"
Cordelia, with her facial expression growing weird, asked Kyouki in a stiff whisper, to which the latter just shook his head.
Kyouki was himself flabbergasted to see such a sight of the woman who had gotten the title of Thorn Lady in the Academy and whatnot. He just couldn't align the image of Saya being a professor and Saya being a silly sister.
"Hmm… Let's see. Under this floor, huh…."
As Austin moved forward, Saya stood up and followed her brother. The other two also got out of their daze and started following the others.
"Everyone. Stick to the walls. I am going to be rough here."
Without turning back, Austin spoke in a loud tone before he pulled out something from his inventory which made the others wide-eyed.
**DHAK**
It was a massive sledgehammer of almost 30 meters in length and had cylindrical faces of a diameter of nearly 5 meters. The handle of the hammer was incredibly long if compared to its head.
The striking upper part was made of a black material which had golden pearls engraved at its border, making it look like some kind of showpiece, but no one dared to assume it such.
The handle was wholly made of standard wood, or so it seemed, with a width that seemed impossible to grip comfortably in human hands.
Soon Austin took out two red and black gloves from his pouch, which were also an artifact he got rewarded from the system not so long ago.
"Onii-sama…I think it won't take that much force…."
Saya didn't want her Onii-sama to do such a tedious thing when she had that much confidence to blow out his obstacle all by herself.
But her brother's following words made Saya realize something she nearly forgot because of her naivety.
"This Labyrinth is already creepy enough to make me intrigued. If something comes out upon smashing the floor, this hammer will negate its effect to a certain extent. So relax, my Imouto, and let your brother handle this."
Saya wanted to say something but decided not to since she might become a nuisance to him. Nodding, she stepped back and gave her brother some space.
"Let's go, Kyo-chan. That thing looks dangerous to be around."
Cordelia muttered as she held her friend's hand. Kyouki nodded with his gaze still fixed on the hammer, which somehow felt like it was inviting him, but Kyouki didn't move on with his urges and followed Cordelia.
"Okay then…"
The gloves simply suppress backlashes and enlarge the user's palm according to the weapon they are looking to wield.
As strange as it sounds, this creation of dwarves might minimize someone's hand if they have the urge to fight with needles.
Gripping the handle with his extra large hands, Austin levitates in the air using some portion of his suppressed mana.
Reaching up to a height of almost fifty meters, Austin brought the hammer over his head before he channeled magical energy into the tool and also , his body, so he didn't collapse with the strike.
Inhaling deeply, he once again checked everyone's position and concluded that they were at a safe distance.
"Okay then. Let's see what you can do buddy… "
______________….
A/N: - Pace good or should I escalate?
Lemme know in the comments~

chapters.title: Chapter 127: Something made for the Hero~2!
chapters.content:
As the heavens breaking sound resonated with the heavy impact, Austin bestowed on the surface, everything around the vicinity turned into dust.
The three who were standing close to the wall, felt their stance quaking at a furious pace before it disintegrated due to Austin's strike.
Cordelia used her Shadow Skill to stick herself and Kyouki to the wall and make their fall steadier to the next level. Saya didn't use mana and just let herself go with the flow since she wanted to follow her brother as closely as possible.
Along with heavy rubles of the whole floor, the four humans fell for more than half a minute, this time before Austin and Saya landed on something tough, unlike the other two, who were still descending.
Putting the sledgehammer back in the inventory, both of them didn't have to look much around to find the obstacle of this level.
"Fuck! Kyo-chan, jump!!"
Hearing Cordelia, Kyouki didn't even ponder before he gathered strength in his legs and using the wall as a launch pad, Kyouki, along with his friend, jumped toward Austin's direction at a booming speed.
The reason why Cordelia panicked was the things that were waiting for the two at the base of the side walls. If it was only some regular creature, Cordelia could have handled it by herself.
But those many…?
"Archanian spiders? But what's with that size and population?"
Kyouki muttered under his breath as he studied the ten-legged creatures staring at the group from every direction with unmoving red predatory eyes.
Archany monsters are those who contain one of the deadliest poisons in them, and spiders are the ones most commonly found.
The monsters around them indeed looked like the ones found in the wilderness, but their size was a little too huge to believe. Normal spiders are about the size of dogs in Austin's past life but the current ones were more like bulls.
"Hey, guys. Look above."
On Austin's call, the other three instinctively tilted their necks to see the place where they came from, only to get startled in the end.
"N-No way…"
Contrary to their expectation, the ground that Austin broke and led them to the next stage has been rebuilt for some reason. And not only that. There were hundreds of eyes glaring down at the human group.
**GULP**
"What should we do, team leader?"
With a strong gulp, Cordelia raised her query without turning her gaze from her surroundings in fear of getting attacked any second now.
"Now what? We will fight, of course."
"Come forth, Kamikurai."
(A/N: - Kaminari 雷+ Kurai 暗い= Dark Lightning)
Just as Austin finished speaking, Saya summoned her katana, bringing every attention to her.
The slim weapon had sparkling raven thunders dancing on its blade, with its long handle being held by its owner in a rigid stance. The whole blade was the size of one and a half meters, with an ominous chill extruding the entire thing.
**SWISH**
Taking the liberty of her brother's words, Saya launched to her front before ascending the air up to ten meters as she charged her blade.
Lightning started violently covering her whole body before she held the handle with both hands and landed in the middle of the horde of spiders.
"Die!"
With those words, the tip of the blade landed on one of the archany spiders, killing it instantly before the heavy raven lightning transmitted through the others, too, and burnt them to cinders.
**KHEEEEEEEK**
A heavy screeching voice resonated as, within a single strike, almost two dozen of monsters were annihilated.
"Tch."
Saya clicked her tongue since she was expecting a little more from that attack, but nevertheless, she didn't halt there.
"Fuee…. My sister really is something. "
Praising his little sister after witnessing her brute strength and remarkable technique, Austin also summoned his blade, which, unlike Saya's, contained a bright blaze.
His weapon was also a sword, except for the fact that in place of sharp wedges, Austin had more like saw-sculptured steel welded. It was almost three meters in total length with its blade, almost a meter in width.
"Hell blaze."
As Austin initiated one of the blade's skills, a bright amber shade spread on the weapon, covering the sharpness and providing a threatening add-on to the sword.
"Don't die, hero."
With those words, Austin also left the two before he dashed in a different direction from his sister. Soon loud screams and the severe smell of burning toxins fermented profoundly.
Even though only two humans have engaged in battle, the war cries became so piercing that they shook the skies and the ground, giving a threatening chill to Kyouki.
"K-Kyo-chan? Your eyes looks scary for some reasons."
Cordelia was taken aback as she saw the fierce look in her beloved's eyes as he gazed at the battlefield. That aggression in his eyes. The blood lust he portrayed crossed all the images of the innocent Kyouki she had.
Taking the legendary sword in his grip, Kyouki made a stance as he spoke in a confident tone.
"Let me show you how much I have changed, Lia."
_____________…
A/N: - It's been a while since I wrote a short chapter. I will wrap up the floor relatively fast since what's important is the center of this labyrinth.
Let's see where this goes~

chapters.title: Chapter 128: Retreat!
chapters.content:
It's been an hour since the terrifying battle commenced between four humans and countless ten-legged creatures—an hour of the total one-sided massacre.
The air has become entirely intoxicated to the point that even a breath could kill hundreds of manaless humans. Not only that, even amateur mana users could get choked to death due to the overcrowding of such dense pollution.
Compared to the previous floor where Kyouki fought the Serpent Queen, this floor was massive enough to let the four, fight to their heart's content without being cornered. They also kept their distance from others in check, so they didn't stray carelessly in the heat of the battle.
Cordelia was the only person who still hadn't ascended in the battle frenzy mode, and she was the only one having difficulties keeping up with the number of enemies emerging at such an alarming rate.
Using the Unique Grade daggers she received from the Capital, she eradicated the spiders and utilized her shadow skills against those who attacked from her blind spot.
Unlike the others, she didn't have any long weapons, which she was regretting at the moment.
"Look at them. What training they have gone through….'
Looking at distant places from where several big explosions and lightning thunders flared up, she thought about how much she had overestimated herself.
"Look out!! "
**SLIIING**
*KHEEK**
To her utter astonishment, Kyouki appeared out of nowhere as his blade bisected one of the spiders heading toward Cordelia from above.
Covered in blood, both stood face to face after Kyouki helped his friend to get up.
"I-I…
Cordelia stuttered in a fret blended with shame since, due to her carelessness, her beloved had to get out of his way to help her. And some minutes ago, she was dreaming of doing something like that.
The day couldn't go any worse than this!
"It's okay, Lia. Don't worry. I have got your back."
Kyouki brought his hand to Cordelia's cheek as he tried to calm her down when they had the small window to chat.
There were spiders in thousands of numbers around, but it would take time to approach these two humans.
As Kyouki expected, Cordelia sobered up as she stared at his eyes for a long second before she responded in a resolute tone.
"Thanks for the support, Kyo-chan. I won't disappoint you again."
Saying so, Cordelia extended her hand and called for her daggers which had been previously thrown somewhere with her fall.
Kyouki nodded with a smile before the two continued fighting, but this time in closer proximity to keep close eyes on each other.
On the other side, Saya was on a rampage to quench her bloodthirst. She wasn't just slaying the monster. Saya concluded the spiders' existence in the most brutal way, a human could ever is capable of.
She fought monsters, but if looked closely, there wasn't anyone bigger monster on the battlefield than her.
"Everyone retreat to the center right now."
Suddenly Saya, as well as the other two, halted in their movements as they heard Austin's voice resonating in their mind. Cordelia glanced at Kyouki, upon which the latter nodded with a frown before they cleared their surroundings and leaped back to the place from where they had started.
Saya also did the same, but her agility was somewhat immeasurable since she thought that her brother might have gotten hurt.
But to her utter relief, Austin was standing there, all healthy and unscathed, without a stain of blood over him at all.
"Sorry for the unsightly appearance Onii-sama."
Saya blushed upon seeing herself, all covered in blood and gore, unlike her brother, who was still as majestic as ever. Well, seeing her brother sweaty and covered in the same shade as hers would have been erotic too, but by no means would she say that.
"Don't be. It's a battlefield, so treat this blood as your ornaments and be proud."
Saya smiled heartily as she felt elated being praised by her brother every time.
Soon Kyouki and Cordelia also landed at the center, which was the most vacant place available at the moment. The spiders have detected the movement of their prey, but it would take at least twenty seconds to reach the group.
As soon they stepped in a certain range, Austin broke something which was in his hand, before a white smoke covered all of the four, astonishing the new arrives.
"This… ?"
As Kyouki asked, he saw the spiders, which were previously charging in their direction, were now frozen statues at their place.
"It's a time-freezing barrier that would last for five minutes. I thought some of you might need a breather before we continue."
Austin glanced at the panting Cordelia, who, upon being watched, became flustered and stood straight to pretend that she was fine.
Kyouki felt guilty for not noticing his friend's struggle and bringing her to such a spot.
"First, nourish yourself with mana until you guys have time."
Upon hearing Austin, the other three, along with the speaker himself, channeled mana through their pores. The effect of the Mana-suppressing pill is consistent, but not until the user himself tries to break through.
(A/N: - This breaking-the-pill effect is only possible in low grades pills not the higher ones.)
The need to nourish someone with mana was fundamental. Superhumans' life essence is their magical energy. Suppressing it for long might hamper them, so until they get the time it would be beneficial to shower themselves with the essence.
"These things aren't decreasing at all."
Muttering under her breath, Cordelia surveyed the vicinity and shivered upon sensing the number, which seemed to be multiplying with time.
"Indeed, they won't end until you don't burn it."
Every attention was gathered on the blond youth before he continued with his explanation.
"These things regenerate from even a simple fang, so cutting them wouldn't be sufficient. And without mana, you guys can't use fire magic, right?"
The others leaned their face downward since it was true for what all Austin spoke. And the vulnerability of spiders, he concluded, was observed by the other three, too; that's why they didn't argue with Austin.
"Onii-sama. My black lightning can…."
Saya seemed to take charge of bringing hell into the labyrinth, but Austin shook his head and spoke in a blatant tone.
"No, it won't, Saya. They are at least five thousand in number, and I have studied your sword skills. It won't do."
Saya bit her lips as she realized what her brother said was true and blamed herself for being such a useless little sister.
Austin sighed upon seeing his dejected sister and decided to coax her afterward.
'I might have spoken a little harsh….'
"Austin. What about me? I am confident in my blessing to annihilate this lot by myself."
Clutching his sword, Kyouki spoke in a poised tone only to get rejected by the latter.
"Nope. Save your energy, for now, hero. I might need that in a later situation."
Kyouki wanted to say something, but knowing his limitations, the hero could only grit his teeth and again let himself rely on his greatest rival.
Throwing his weapon back in inventory, Austin cracked his knuckles and neck before he called out for others.
"Just as the barrier vanishes, don't dare to leave my side."
_______________..
A/N: - Should I continue from this spot or skim through it and express the event in the monologue?
Comment down your opinions~

chapters.title: Chapter 129: Ploy of Gram!
chapters.content:
[Cordelia's POV:]
Along with my orders to work as an escort of the emerging asset of Gram, known as Austin, I was instructed to keep various things in check while I would be venturing into the Abyss.
The two key terms which I was being majorly drilled about were:
First, I have to give my full support, without holding back, to the subject since he is far more important than me at the moment. I was even told to sacrifice myself if it helps Austin.
I was okay with that since, despite my grudges against Austin, I was, first and foremost, a patriot who would do everything for my nation's development and prosperity.
The second thing I ordered was to keep an eye on him and report what the nation was still unaware about.
Austin miraculously has shown such growth and prowess, which even defies the existence of Seven Deities. Someone, from being a bastard child to a war hero, is a bit stretched to believe but evident enough not to regard it as bullshit.
And the fact he possesses such heavenly artifacts and weaponry is a mystery in itself. I know Prince Mikhail and Your Majesty aren't involved in this, but there are people in the upper echelon who are after Austin's arsenal.
They want him as a tool and snatch away all his priceless inventory. Well, not something I appreciate, but I don't have enough empathy to let the person know how his own nation is plotting against him.
Now when I have spent hours in the labyrinth with the man who has made a fool out of my Kyo-chan before, I came to discover various things about him.
First, Austin can use time and space magic. Well, he used a Time oriented barrier through an artifact, but no one can convince me that he doesn't have proficiency in Space Magic.
He has taken those many things out of nowhere which none of the spatial pouch or storage could contain. That proves he has Infinite Space in his control. It might be a little too much to estimate from a teenager, but that's the only conclusion I could land upon.
The second thing I have speculated about this singularity is that he has a weird relationship with the battle maniac named Saya, who's on the second list of investigations. Whatever their relationship is, I have sensed an impenetrable defense that both have for each other.
Even though Austin doesn't show, he's pretty possessive of his sister in a way and vice versa. I could barely keep up with this weird piece of siblings.
And the last thing which I would like to report as soon as possible:
'Fuck! He can use spiritual tongue?!'
My eyes went wide in shock and fretted as I witnessed the man who once I thought to be nothing more than an over-evaluated youngster who had gained some reputation, displaying something unbelievable.
After Austin told us not to leave his side, we three decided to stick together as Austin ascended in the air just when the barrier was about to lose its effect.
I clearly heard him talking in a particular language, which has been known since Ancient times but has yet to find a proper user.
And here he was…
Alive and strong.
Like an endless mirage who becomes higher as long as you stare at him.
____________
Austin has incredible efficiency with Fire Spirit. After all, he's a mage who unlocked his fire element when he was only three years old, and spirits like if someone binds with them before the age of blessings.
Austin wasn't sure why it was such, but it seemed his transmigration had helped him burn his inner flames quite early in age and led him to connect with these tiny creatures yet to be discovered entirely.
Spirits aren't such beings that depend on the favorability of the surroundings or the condition of nature. They could be present inside the deepest hell and greatest heavens.
So to talk with those little fiery things inside the labyrinth was equally convenient as it was on the surface.
'First, let's take precaution…'.
He knew that his squadmates could resist heat to a certain extent, but sometimes while using Spiritual Energy, Austin tends to go beyond what's needed.
Using some portion of his natural mana, he chanted a thick wall around the three, which had much tenacity to receive a single blow from him.
Saya had her eyes fixated on her brother as she witnessed the glory of the god she worships.
[XXXX-XX-XXXX-XXX]
With a set of commands, Austin requested the fire spirits to gather around and assist him in cleaning this floor. The small souls also didn't hesitate since they were pretty fond of the human to ignore his plea.
Austin felt the heavy surge of energy being directed at him in such a rapid state that it might break him down; if not, he charges it to his targets.
Just as rhe barriers disintegrated, the massacre commenced.
**SWIIISH**
**KHEEEEEEEEEEEEKKK**
A massive wave of flames which unlike normal fire contained enough combustion to break even a Terror Ranked demon's skin to cinders, was directed at the archanian spiders.
Amidst of ear bleeding cries and screams of agony, the smell of poison burning fermented profoundly in the air, making Austin nearly choke up.
[XXX-XXXXXX-XX]
Hurriedly calling for the Wind spirits, Austin created a windshield for the group standing beneath him. And now, when he has taken the help of Wind Spirits already he added their strength to the flames and created several massive typhoons.
**SWOOOOOSH**
**HIIIIICKKK!!"
The place was a living hell.
Death was rolling like a breeze in the air. Hundreds of lives were ceasing to exist every second. The blend of pure colorless air around the vicinity has been tainted with the hue of blood.
It indeed was a sight that could make weak hearts faint in fear and someone like Luna marveled at the scene in awe.
"I wonder what you might have been doing."
_____________….
A/N: - Next chapter would be from her side and the latter half from the labyrinth. Spiritual energy would be elaborate with time, and I will try to detail the construction, which I forgot initially.
Drop a comment if you are liking the story so far~

chapters.title: Chapter 130: Dwarven creation!
chapters.content:
After what seemed like half an hour or so, the wall which was erected around the three, Saya, Kyouki, and Cordelia, finally broke down as the scenery outside reappeared in their visions.
Kyouki and Cordelia have the same kind of expression. With their eyes at their broadest reach and lips slightly parted, they felt jolts of fret running down their spine as they saw the graveyard in front.
The previous floor, which was dyed with the multiple-legged creatures, was now nothing more than a molten mess with the after-effect of flames still evidently burning the remnants of the deceased.
Saya had a delightful smile as she felt the pride of being her Onii-sama's imouto. She was elated beyond words as her respect for her Onii-sama soared higher than anyone could comprehend.
She really adores him and admires what he has become.
"You guys alright? That smoke didn't get you, right?"
Austin walked back to the group. He took a big container of water before gulping it down in a slight hurry as he heard Kyouki speaking.
"You did all the work and asking about our well-being?"
Kyouki shook his head with a sigh since the fact that he had become just a dead weight was still profoundly stinging his chest. He knows his incapability inside the labyrinth, but still, Kyouki doesn't like to always be on the receiving end.
After Austin had his fill, he offered it to Saya before he looked back at the troubled hero. Austin really can never grow accustomed to this hero's way of thinking.
"Listen, Kyouki. I have a hunch that there might come a time in this place where me, Saya, or Cordelia wouldn't be of any use. The situation where the Light of the Hero could only ignite the path of victory. So accumulate all the favors and pay it back at that instance, got it?"
Kyouki didn't reply; he just took the container from Cordelia and gulped down the rest of the content. As the small conversation concluded, Cordelia walked up to Austin and asked in an uncertain tone.
"First time seeing a Spirit user."
Austin glanced at the girl who hadn't been able to come out of her reverie since the battle as he replied with a shrug.
"You just didn't look for one, properly."
Seeing Austin's careless attitude toward the matter, Cordelia narrowed her gaze and said something she didn't intend to.
"You don't fear that I might report this to the officials? There's a possibility that you might lose your freedom to move willingly any longer."
Saya's cold gaze fell on the bitchy woman who, despite getting her arse saved by her Onii-sama, dared to say such repulsive words.
Austin held Saya's hand fondly to help her calm down before he turned toward Cordelia.
"I think you have misunderstood something on my part, Cordelia-san. I do not belong to Gram, nor do I have much liking for this hippocratic nation. Do you think I would hesitate even a bit to abandon the place you are so devoted to?"
**GULP**
A stiff gulp passed down her throat as she gazed upon the unwavering eyes of the boy who, despite having the appearance, of a teenager, yet carried the ego of a Monarch.
Kyouki held Cordelia's hand and gestured for her to back away. Wordlessly, the girl took a last glance at Austin before retreating to her friend and breathed after a long pause.
"Okay then. Let's get going to the next one."
Since Austin sensed that everyone was fine and ready for the next battle, he didn't prolong the advance and pulled out the sledgehammer from his inventory.
Kyouki again felt a strange sensation that seemed to be inviting him toward the massive weapon. This time since he was closer, the temptation seemed denser.
Moving on his instinct, Kyouki walked to the weapon, which radiated with a golden hue as he extended his hand to touch the handle only to get slapped by Austin just inches apart from it.
Kyouki instantly woke up from reverie as his gaze redirected at the blonde guy, with panic written all over the hero's face.
"I-I didn't mean to…."
"It's okay, hero. I understand how you feel."
Saya and Cordelia were also studying Kyouki's movement, which seemed utterly strange before Austin explained the reason why the Hero was reacting in such a way.
Landing his hand on the weapon, Austin stated after an exasperated sigh.
"This and like this, many of my artifacts are made by the dwarves living somewhere in this vast universe. From what I have sensed, the fundamental thing between each of the dwarves' creations, is the presence of the Goddess of Light, Rahia."
The curiosity grew among the listeners as they heard the unexpected revelation about the weapon Austin uses.
Dwarves were a part of forklore who were famous for heavenly creations and those who were entitled to utilize the blessing of any god they desired.
Suddenly their perception toward the sledgehammer changed into something more as they heard Austin continuing.
"These weapons cannot be used by those who doesn't possess the essence of the Creators of this world. I am just using them through sheer strength and overwhelming will. But that doesn't change the fact that I never deserved such creations."
Silence befell, as Austin concluded his words, astonishing all three in the process. Many things they could never have guessed were disclosed, which made them realize again, how strong Austin is to move such a heavenly creation through his raw capability.
Hearing her brother calling himself unworthy, Saya's heart ached as she pinched his sleeve in protest.
"Onii-sama… "
Gazing at the expression on his silly Imouto, Austin shook his head with a smile as he brought his hand over her head.
"Don't make that face. Indeed I am incapable of drawing out the full potential of dwarven things, but that doesn't mean this is the limit of my ability. Other than blessed artifacts and weapons, I do possess something more. Something more potent and matching to your brother's taste."
Saying so, Austin pulled out something from his inventory, which swept the breath away from each three of them in an instant.
"O-Onii-sama… this!!"
_____________…
A/N:- There's a reason why Austin is revealing so many things in front of especially Cordelia. Well, you guys will know, so don't worry.
Drop a comment if you are liking the chapter, and yes, please let me know if you guys have issues regarding the pace of the plot.

chapters.title: Chapter 131: Wizard of the Abyss!
chapters.content:
The following two floors of the labyrinth went rather quickly compared to the second one. In mere eight hours since they dived in, the group of four was standing on the barren fourth level.
Thanks to the fact that the third and fourth ones contained a single entity as their bosses, which Saya and Kyouki annihilated without much difficulty.
Saya did her best not to let Austin move and do all the work by herself.
The prowess she showed. Her formidable blade skills and precise technique, blended with overwhelming strength, were more than enough to kill the bosses, which were on par with Terror Rank's initial stage.
Kyouki also showcased the skills worth being a hero. From what Austin has seen last time in the war, Kyouki has indeed improved a lot.
Austin hasn't touched his Legendary Sword even once, but he could sense the dormant energy inside the weapon, which the hero has been slowly accessing through his hard work.
'Well, this shounen hero would unlock everything with the power of friendship…'
With a light chuckle, Austin gripped the handle of his hammer, and just like he had gotten used to, Austin brought the strike down to the ground and broke through.
**BOOOOM**
The sky-shattering collision effect reverberated as the four descended to the next stage. By now, even Cordelia and Kyouki for accustomed to the fall, so they don't use the skills like before.
Austin threw the hammer back into the inventory while in mid-air since there wasn't any use for it until they didn't clear the fifth level.
Austin did try on the third floor to break through without defeating the boss, but it failed, and Austin suffered a severe physical backlash.
Thanks to his natural healing capability and the pills Luna had given him, Austin was back to full health in no time.
"Argh!"
"Lia!"
Just when the four pairs of feet landed on the ground, Cordelia fell on her knees, with her face contouring in pain. Kyouki turned toward his friend in panic before he supported her.
Austin and Saya looked at the girl in astonishment since nothing seemed to directly or indirectly affect their surroundings.
There was no artifact, no mana presence, or anything evident; even the pair searched all around.
"I-I am fine… it just feels a little stuffy…."
Cordelia replied while being supported by the hero as she uttered her words somehow in between her labored breathing.
Her face was drenched with sweat, and all her facial color was adapting to paleness.
Other than being in extreme pain, Cordelia seemed fine, with no vital danger whatsoever.
"Here, stick this on the middle of your chest."
Suddenly Austin pulled out a sticker that had some scribbling which none of them understood. Cordelia took the long paper instinctively before she looked at Austin for an answer.
"This will keep an invisible barrier around you, and resist whatever is affecting."
Cordelia thanked Austin before she started unzipping her jacket. Saya instantly covered the stupid woman from her brother.
Kyouki also turned his gaze away and tried to keep his mind occupied with anything but the rustling sound from beside.
Austin didn't have much care since he never gets bothered by any woman other than one. He took the time to check out the surroundings, which, unlike the previous floors, seemed incredibly silent.
The space was equally dark and cold, but something felt odd. Something which made Austin awfully cautious after who knows how long.
[Already here? Guess, I underestimated you guys.]
A voice that, by pitch and tone, seemed human yet at the same time contained the density which told otherwise resonated from an unknown source
Austin focused his senses to find the person, but unfortunately, it came from all around, not from a single direction. Using his fireballs, Austin searched for wider proximity, but the conclusion remained zero.
[Why are you struggling so much?]
Suddenly all three became stunned as they saw an unexpected presence standing just inches behind Austin. The latter mentioned didn't turn, but it doesn't mean he was standing there shocked.
[Hmmm~Aren't you an interesting one?]
The entity that erupted out of nowhere smiled in amusement as he saw the stance of the blondie. Even the young man has his front turned on the other side; his arm has been raised with a dagger held in such a position that advancing a step could cause a deep cut.
"I share the same sentiment."
It's been a long time since someone has been able to sneak to Austin's back like this. If not for his natural instincts, which rang like church bells, Austin couldn't have pulled the dagger in time.
(A/N: -Luna doesn't count since she's pretty above comprehensibility.)
Saya wanted to step forward as soon as she witnessed the person standing near her Onii-sama, but she knew there might arise repercussions which she would like to avoid.
Turning steadily with his guard still pulled up, Austin looked at the person who undoubtedly was the floor boss.
A black robe all over his body with white hair sticking out the cover. Red ruby eyes stared down at Austin with a strange glint of curiosity blended in them.
Apart from his eyes, nothing seemed unnatural with his appearance, which seemed just like an average human's. But that doesn't provide leeway for Austin to turn casual.
Even though the strange man was standing there lazily, Kyouki realized that there was no possible opening he had left at all. And the fact he was standing so near to Austin, didn't help either.
"Compared to the other floor bosses, you seem a little sane."
The others were just trying to kill Austin, and his group without any reason. Well, it was understandable since it was a labyrinth, but Austin wasn't here for the purpose of clearing this place.
He just wanted to get some answers, and this person in front seemed to be the right man.
Hearing the blond boy's words, the robed man smiled in amusement as he spoke in a prideful tone.
[Of course, I would. After all, what you have faced were all my slaves, and I am their master. The Wizard of the Abyss, Aèzar]
____________…
A/N: - Story hasn't turned boring, right?
I don't know, but keeping Luna out of the story makes me think that maybe viewers don't like it much.
Please let me know?

chapters.title: Chapter 132: Wizard of the Abyss~2!
chapters.content:
Amidst dark and heavy clouds which could break and drench the surface any moment now, flew a woman who by every angle seemed otherworldly.
Silver hair tied in a bun with oceanic blue eyes fixated on her front, yet not really caring about where she advanced. Her pale face and the minimal skin she exposed out of her dress, made her look like someone descending from the heavens.
The Saintess of Humanity. The Light of Hope and various others, heard and unheard names, have been regarded as this woman.
But Austin's favorite, The Dominatrix.
That kind of living legend flying over a vast forest couldn't be called a leisure hobby, nor could it be labeled as fighting loneliness.
Well, Luna indeed was lonely in the absence of her beloved, but it didn't mean she was killing her time by gazing at such a never-ending forest for no definite reason.
It's been almost ten hours since Austin left her side and went for the Labyrinth. She tried to engage herself in teaching stuff and other of her research, but nothing proved to be working.
She couldn't stop thinking about him at all!
Thanks to the tip she got about the creature who had been building the blessing suppressor artifact, Luna got something to spend her time on.
Almost a month ago, Luna spread a kind of spell where small mana balls wander freely anywhere. These aren't just any mana balls but special ones, which Luna creates using her Divine Energy and through her knowledge of Space Magic.
The significance of those small pearl-like spheres lies in their vulnerability. Since they aren't visible to anything or anyone, there was a slim chance of those mana balls getting interrupted in between.
What could only erase those mana balls is the same effect that the blessing-suppressing artifact produces.
As soon as the connection with one of her Mana orbs disconnected, Luna darted to investigate which bastard had been plotting from the shadows for who knows how long.
'Was it here…right? '
Being a little uncertain, Luna decided to land on the ground first as she enhanced her senses meanwhile
With a slow thud, she dropped her feet into the middle of no definite part of the forest which was filled with strange creatures and monsters.
'[Camouflage]'
Using her spell, Luna blended in the greenery as she surveyed her surroundings.
She was receiving different mana presence, but none of them were worthy of paying attention. What got her interested was the peculiar sensation she felt upon widening her mana search reach.
After a specific range, the channel became fainter before dropping to zero. That place wasn't so far, so she decided to walk rather than levitate.
She didn't even walk ten steps when she suddenly felt someone watching her. It was vague, but Luna wasn't an amateur not to notice such unwanted attention.
Turning herself to the left, Luna chanted an ice lance on her either hand before she spoke in a profoundly cold tone.
"Show yourself, or the next thing you will be peeking at would be hell…."
Her voice resonated enough for the person who was hiding on one of the branches of a humongous tree, to hear properly.
Luna had her aim fixed, and she would have killed the person within blinks; if not, she would have seen a familiar face appearing from the shadows.
"You… "
______________….
Back in the labyrinth, there was total silence befell on the fifth stage of the abyss as several figures stood with varying expressions on their faces.
Kyouki had pulled Cordelia behind his back since she wasn't much in shape to engage in battle. Even though he was shielding his friend, Kyouki himself was feeling extremely horrified at the moment to defend anyone.
Ever since this person who called himself The Wizard of Abyss appeared, strange chills spread across the hero with a sensation of being inferior raging high.
Of course, he wouldn't cower away, but for some reason, Kyouki knew how strong this strange appearance was.
It was the same for Saya, albeit a little less influential. She indeed felt the threat from the robbed man, but she wasn't fretting. Maybe she would have measured the man more rationally, if not for the distance he had from her Onii-sama.
She couldn't let herself even blink in cautiousness.
Back on the duo, where every other gaze was focused, Austin stood upright without any sign of wavering emotion on his face.
With a thin smile never leaving the older man's face, the Wizard asked in an assertive tone.
[And what is it you are so eager to know?]
Austin narrowed his gaze since he never said he came in search of answers. But since he indeed wanted to know a thing or two, he didn't beat around the bush.
"The reason why there's no mana can enter this labyrinth."
This question has been bugging Austin for a while. For some reason, he had a hunch that the mystery behind this unique phenomenon of this Abyss would reveal various of the things Austin desires to unravel.
Hearing Austin's words, the wizard also narrowed his gaze before his smile widened. It seemed he sensed something from Austin, which resulted in such an exaggerated reaction.
[Hahah… Wonderful! Wonderful indeed!]
Kyouki glanced at Saya as he saw her clutching her katana and ready for combat any second, as the wizard suddenly started to move.
While shaking his head, the wizard facepalmed himself before he leaned slightly forward and whispered something to Austin.
[You are a System User, aren't you?]
______________….
A/N: - I told yah, I have started the preparation for the end. Things would unravel. Various mysteries would be discovered.
Let's see where this goes.
Stay safe and drop a comment on your way back.
Peace out ✌️.

chapters.title: Chapter 133: You are just a dog!
chapters.content:
Villain's System.
Ever since Austin saw the screen displaying this specific name, he had various queries about it.
Well, since Austin was himself inside a world he read in a manga, he accepted this system rather quickly.
But the curiosity remains in its origination and how it works while keeping a record of different dimensions. An omnipotent system might it be, but still, there were various things that made Austin perplexed.
Like, how come it gives points, even Austin had done a not-so-villain-worthy task after he met Luna and also, how he was receiving such heavenly items which could break the world balance in an instant.
But Austin never paid attention to seeking answers since he already had many things going on in his life.
And now, suddenly today, entirely out of the blue, a strange person who called himself the Wizard, seems to be aware of his system, which naturally shocked Austin beyond belief.
[Haha… Don't worry, kid. It's not like I have any control over it, nor do I know about it more than its outer covering.]
Austin narrowed his gaze since the wizard said he didn't have control over his system. That suggests, there was someone who might have.
He didn't have a good premonition about this, but at this moment, he couldn't allow himself to panic. His team was dependent on him.
Collecting his stance, Austin relaxed his shoulders without letting his guard down. Maybe this man knows about the system, and someone might be present who could control it, but that won't hamper Austin very much.
He never had let himself get dependent on this sketchy Villain's System since the start.
[Hmmm? Seems like you are an odd one, too. You don't want to ask about something now, brat?]
The expression on Saya was growing darker with each of this bastard's words, who was talking in such a way with her Onii-sama.
The Abyssal Wizard completely ignored the raven flashes sizzling around the woman's blade since he found it unworthy to notice. His whole focus was now occupied by this blond kid, who, after this long, had shown something new to his interest.
"I know there's nothing you can answer. After all, you are just a dog protecting the real boss beneath our feet, right?"
The smile on the Wizard's face widened strangely as soon he started to laugh in amusement.
[R-Right. You are damn right about that.]
Kyouki and Cordelia were having a slight tremble of anxiousness with each of the weird man's gestures since he was reeking with an utter ominous sensation.
But fortunately, their group Captain was still not showing any sign of stress or hysteria whatsoever. Even though Kyouki had a tendency to be the leader anywhere, he went, but right now, he was thankful he wasn't standing in Austin's place.
[So, now you are intending to wipe this floor with me and advance to the next one until you don't reach the end, right?]
"Well, that's exactly what I have planned."
Without an ounce of hesitation, Austin affirmed the Wizard's words before the latter pressed his finger on his chin with his gaze upward.
Suddenly, he snapped his finger with his eyes widened, as it seemed, something popped into his mind.
[I completely forgot to tell you guys something….]
The man levitated in the air before he positioned himself in a position where everyone was able to audience him.
[All the floors above were protected by my spell, so if you kill me, you guys can have an easy way through to the final boss~]
All three except Austin blinked in surprise since it would become extremely simple for them to complete this labyrinth with unknown stages if they just kill this wizard.
But Austin knew, every easy leeway requires storms of difficulties.
And as he expected, the Wizard started to show why he was the only sane being present inside the Abyss.
With black fog being discharged from his either palm, the smile on the man's face for the first time darkened to a terrifying degree.
[But the problem is…. You guys are too weak to even leave a scratch on this dog…
______________…
A/N: -Let the battle commence.
I hope you guys are liking the story. Please let me know, in the comments~

chapters.title: Chapter 134: Let the battle commence~1!
chapters.content:
Ever since Austin started cultivating his magical prowess and learned martial arts from various teachers, he never met someone who could be regarded as his match.
Strange it may sound, but until now, only the Terror Rank golem Austin fought on his first expedition has ever given him the chills of threat.
Well, since Austin was superior to the demon in every way, the slight horror he felt was just the debut anxiety blended with the shock of an unexpected turn of events.
And also, the brawl with Captain Charles was a memorable event, but these two have taken place quite a while ago, so slowly, Austin has forgotten the sensation of his blood boiling with adrenaline.
This Wizard, who popped out of nowhere on the fifth floor and had been chattering like he had found something amusing, suddenly initiated the role of being the boss of this floor.
The sinister black smog which oozed out of the Wizard's palm covered the whole floor at an alarming rate, but Austin didn't move since he knew this smog wasn't meant to kill him or anyone else.
'He's just sealing this floor, huh….'
Elemental Types mage is what Austin was primarily evaluated on. He could discern the change in something's state in real-time.
If the floor beneath his feet was raw rocks and marbles until now, then that ominous add-on from the Wizard has made it impossible for Austin to evaluate where his foot has been standing.
As from what the Abyssal Wizard said, it was natural for him to seal the ground so Austin doesn't take a shortcut to the next stage.
"K-Kyo-chan…"
Kyouki's eyes turned from the Wizard to his friend before his gaze widened in shock just upon catching the glimpse upon witnessing Cordelia's state.
Her body was partially covered with a raven hue, with her eyes losing focus on the man she could only seek for help. She was feeling her world drowning in darkness.
[Poor child. Possessing Dark Runes in front of its Creator, would surely bring you to such a state. Well, if you don't want her to suffer blondie, then you better release her seal and let her dwell in my darkness.]
Undoubtedly Cordelia was a user of Ancient technique which was unknown to Austin. If the Wizard has the same attribute with such monstrous efficiency, it made sense why Cordelia had been suffering since she landed on this floor.
If not for the [Affect Suppressor] seal Austin has given to Cordelia, she might have become one of the Wizard's slaves until now.
"W-What should we do, Austin?"
The hero was panicking like never before since it was the first time seeing someone precious to him on the verge of death. If not for Austin being present around, Kyouki might have lost it.
Gritting his teeth in frustration, Austin commanded the hero with his eyes, never leaving the Wizard.
"[Call Of Purgatory]. Use that on her until I don't defeat this bat shit."
Kyouki's eyes widened in astonishment since the skill Austin spoke was something he had never shown to anyone. But it wasn't time to think of something useless.
"You know I won't be any help if I start exorcising her, right?"
Kyouki had no plan to back out when Austin gave him such a tremendous idea of something he himself possessed, but there was a limitation on what the current self of Hero could do.
While using the Purgatory, Kyouki could only focus on his subject and not even on himself. It was a high-ranking Light Magic, after all!
"Well, in front of that monster, you will be nothing more than a dead weight."
Kyouki sneered before he picked Cordelia in a bridal carry and went to a corner of the floor, leaving the brother-sister duo alone to face this unknown strange entity.
"Onii-sama?"
Saya tilted her head in confusion as she saw her brother extending two small daggers in her direction. Perplexed, she took the daggers before she realized their significance.
"T-this… ?"
Saya shuddered slightly upon receiving the plain-looking dagger with such enchantment which made her tremble in a fret and wonder who could have even mustered such Holy Energy to build the weapon.
"It's a gift from Luna. She asked me to give it to you when the time is right. Sigh* how does she know everything ...."
Saya could feel the helplessness and awe in her brother's voice for Luna, but currently, even Saya couldn't help herself from feeling impressed. Indeed Saya wasn't even near the level where Luna had been dominating for who knows how long
.
Clutching the hilt of the dagger in a rigid hold, Saya spoke in a determined tone.
"I won't let you down, Onii-sama."
Austin nodded with a slight smile before he refocused on the wizard, who hadn't moved from his spot at all.
[How heartwarming~ I will make sure to keep you guys close in my shadow army~]
Austin didn't answer since his attention was already drawn upon the unexpected appearance of those who the Wizard regarded as his Shadow Army.
Several figures of those creatures which Austin already had fought and some of those he had never thought of standing against so soon, erupted out of the ground.
Yes, this was what made him excited. This was what Austin needed to push himself to the limit. This sensation is what he could never get tired of.
[Brace yourself. You are now under my domain. The one who rules on shadow, the Wizard of the Abyss. Let's see what you have to offer in return, blondie~]
________________….
A/N: - Let the chaos commence~

chapters.title: Chapter 135: Let the battle commence~2!
chapters.content:
Dark magic isn't something taught in general since there isn't any method to know its route. Even its existence doesn't have any evident clue but just gossiped about through generations.
People write villain's in children's books as the user of Dark Magic but other than that, no one seemingly talks about this specific field of wizardry.
It was said that thousands of years ago, people used to possess such arts along with Spiritual tongues and other ancient techniques.
Necromancy is one of the branches which originates from Dark Magic and as its name suggests, necromancy allows the user to rule over the dead.
Austin was fascinated to know that something like slaving the deceased could be possible. But unfortunately, he didn't have time to marvel at the skill in leisure since it was that skill currently trying to kill him.
**SLASHH**
"You fine there, Saya?"
As Austin slashed the Giant Shadow Ape he asked his sister who was fighting these slaves at a different end.
It's been an hour or so since the battle of thousands against two commenced. The Abyssal Wizard was enjoying the show while levitating and the other two, silently took refuge in a corner.
The shadow slaves surprisingly didn't seem how one could expect them to be. Unlike real shadows, they weren't dark and seemed lifeless. Rather, it seemed they were just incarnations of their true self.
The initial monsters were easy to defeat or to say, Austin just needed his bare punches and kicks to wipe out more than a hundred shadow monsters.
But soon the difficulty started to increase with the strength of the newly added monsters, like Tyrant Ox and Ullr Stags, being on completely different levels. Austin had to keep up with the lot since he didn't want anything to pass his radar and attack Kyouki and Cordelia.
Not only were the new monsters stronger and faster but also contained some Unique skills or offensive attacks like the Serpent Queen used against the Hero.
Austin had the means to obliterate them in an instant through the help of Spirits but he knew it would be futile. He has understood that the Wizard is just testing him for some reason.
Even after summoning so many shadow warriors, the Wizard seemed to be relaxed and completely fine. His gaze was only drawn to Austin with a grin never leaving his face.
'Welp, I just have to gauge his heart out… '
Throwing useless banter for a later time, Austin swung his spear and decapitated a Silver Fang Wolf. The wolf, despite being about 10 meters in size, was cleanly chopped with the mysterious spear Austin carries.
Ranged arsenal suits his taste and so Austin chose the spear as his main weapon. The current one he carries had specifications like:
[Type: - Weapon]
[Grade: - S]
[Name: - Dark Star]
[Enhancement: - Dripping Blood Effect ]
[Description: - The fallen star of Raven Eye bestowed with the concentration of its soul which further poured down in a furnace to build this remarkable weapon. The blacksmith not only has applied what they found as raw but their experience along with blood-sweat also could be seen through its usage.]
It has the effect of drawing out the blood of the enemy it impales until the victim doesn't die of blood loss. But in front of these soulless beings, this effect was nothing but just a decoration.
But since Austin had only this spear to fight against such hard-skinned monsters, he wasn't going to complain and continued his onslaught.
Saya was also doing her side quite fluently without any scratches inflicted until now. She has trained herself for this moment. To be useful to her brother and make his burden as less as she could.
**SHLIING**
The thunder roared with the shrill reverberation of her katana as Saya sliced a Whiptail Iguana into pieces with ferocity and accurate precision.
Her blade skills were far better than any of the warriors existing in today's era and along with the humongous mana she carries, Saya could be counted as an army herself.
Despite being restricted on spells, Saya was able to utilize the minuscules of her mana through the skill of her blade.
Her kill rate was undoubtedly high but compared to her brother, she still was falling a lot short.
'No, I have to do better…'
Solely with the wish to reduce some burden from her brother, Saya ascended in the air as she gathered some higher degree of mana in her blade and covered herself in raven lightning in the process.
With her eyes clouding behind the bolts, Saya charged at the incoming horde of monsters.
[Fall of Judgment!]
**CREAK**
The eyes of the wizard slightly widened since with that attack, not only tens of monsters ceased to exist in an instant but also, the floor was impacted with a deep crack.
The Wizard wasn't threatened to get his seal broken, rather he felt surprised to see the prowess of the girl. Now she also piqued his interest but not as much as the blondie.
Saya was physically fine despite using such a ferocious attack but what troubled her was the backlash she felt because of using mana. Feeling slightly dizzy, Saya supported herself with her blade when she heard a very familiar voice.
"Didn't I say, not to use Mana? When did you become so disobedient?"
While panting Saya wanted to apologize but suddenly her brother pushed a pill into her mouth.
"!!"
Abruptly the burning sensation inside her vanished in an instant and the backlash she felt also disappeared.
Regaining her composure, Saya bowed deeply as she uttered her words of apology in the shame of what she partook in.
"I am deeply ashamed of myself, Onii-sama. I made you worry about me even though we are middle of this… "
Since Saya wiped all the nearby monsters, they had at least a minute window before another wave approaches.
Austin took his time to console his sister as he also felt regretful for scolding her. Bringing his hand over her head, he spoke in a warming tone.
"It's okay, you don't have to feel so dejected about it. I just don't want you to hurt in any way, so please take care of yourself a little more and don't let your emotions control your actions, okay?"
Saya slowly raised her head upon hearing her brother's words as she stared at his radiating gaze with utter fondness.
"Onii-sama… "
The atmosphere between the two was so gentle and familial that it could have even melted a rock. Even though Saya had romantic feelings toward her brother, her sisterly traits always dominated when her Onii-sama says such unfair things.
The feeling of having a family who has always cared for you without asking anything in return always leaves Austin in amazement and amplifies his love for his sister.
**ROARR**
Suddenly in between the pleasant silence, one of the Crimson Chimera roared as the stampede neared furiously.
Both Saya and Austin's expressions contoured in annoyance at being interrupted.
"This is getting on my nerves… "
Saying in a little agitation, Austin pulled out a peculiar sword from his inventory since he has decided to end this right here and right now.
Saya's eyes widened in shock as she gasped to breathe upon witnessing the blade her brother had chosen. And the same reaction was spread over the Wizard's face since he never imagined the blondie having such a thing in the store.
['It seems I underestimated you… ']
__________________…
A/N: - I'll describe how the usage of mana affects the user in the near future. Until then, let the comments rolling~

chapters.title: Chapter 136: Demonic Sword!
chapters.content:
Curse energy is the nemesis of Mana.
From where these two energies originate and what are their sources, no one has ever come to conclude. It's just been flowing around the globe since this world came into existence.
It was a commonly known knowledge that those who possess mana couldn't get involved with cursed energy since these two are the same poles of two different magnets.
After the first expedition, Austin was alleged to be a user of Cursed Energy which the Pope denied as a baseless presumption.
At that time, Austin indeed didn't possess anything which runs on the cursed power but now, things were different.
"O-Onii-sama, this…"
Saya stuttered in slight nervousness as she saw the long curved blade Austin pulled from the inventory.
The blade was almost two meters tall including its handle. The blunt side of the blade was carved like waves with the blade having a width of half a meter.
But rather than its design or the blade's size, what choked Saya's breath was the energy being released by the weapon. The condensed cursed energy was more than enough to put a low-rank warrior into a slumber.
Austin sensed the discomfort and concern from his sister before he let go of her hand and walked to his front.
The hundreds of monsters were ferociously approaching the duo with no stopping them in their stampede. There were almost every type of creature which they fought on this floor.
Austin inhaled deeply while holding the demonic sword in his left hand. It was the special prize that he had earned not long ago, through the completion of a quest.
At first, he was shocked but Luna convinced him that there was nothing evil or good in the path of strength. Whatever makes Austin stronger is acceptable until it doesn't hurt him.
Those were a Sanitess' words.
Austin raised the sword, pulling it toward his right shoulder he gathered some mana in his feet to maintain balance before slashing the blade in the open air.
**WOOOOOONG**
Like an intense churchbell rang from extremely close proximity, the purple wave of raw cursed energy slashed through the air and widened as it advanced.
The Abyssal Wizard raised his brows in amazement upon witnessing the perfect balance of curse and mana portrayed by the blondie.
It wasn't just a rare sight, but rather an anomaly. A mysterious boy who has piqued his interest to this extent, in so many centuries.
'I bet she would love to meet him…'
A [SS] rank demonic sword, when swung by such ferocity using the primitive skill of [Extermination], one could imagine how it would affect the victims.
Within tens of seconds, almost five hundred shadow monsters were slashed in two pieces with corps falling at an alarming rate.
Austin might have the strength to wield Cursed-originated weapons but it didn't mean it doesn't affect him. After the catastrophic attack, Austin threw the bloodthirsty sword back into inventory.
Kyouki and Cordelia were equally shocked to witness such prowess that took out a whole horde in one go. It was not just the raw strength and capability of holding a cursed sword. Austin also displayed how much he cares about his teammate by not letting even one monster pass a certain range.
While still exorcising his friend to keep her safe, Kyouki spoke in a soft tone.
"And you asked why I wasn't placed in the role of leader."
Cordelia sensed the helplessness and admiration in Kyouki's voice toward Austin. She wanted to console him but doing so would only have made the matter worse.
Gliding her hand on top of his, Cordelia rather chose to be optimistic.
"But there's always someone stronger than the strongest. I bet Kyo-chan can be that person one day."
Kyouki smiled thinly upon hearing her encouraging words which usually Sicily and Lilia use to keep his spirit burning.
Amidst the silence, Kyouki suddenly frowned upon a realization as he spoke in a heavier tone.
"Hey, Lia. What you saw right now, please don't add this in your report."
Cordelia wasn't surprised to hear the request since she already had guessed long ago. But rather than being reluctant, she smiled in understanding and spoke something unexpected.
