"I know how important Austin is for Gram and humankind. Reporting this to those old geezers would only push him away so I will be a little dishonest in my statements."
_.
Back in the center of the floor, the Wizard was smiling ear to ear as he approached Austin who still was cautious as ever with his sister standing beside him.
Saya had her hand on her katana's hilt as she awaited the opening she craves. But unfortunately, the Wizard despite looking carefree, had left no loop in his stance.
[Amusing you two. I had fun like this after who knows how fu*king long. Woof! I also had some goosebumps upon seeing that demon's tooth in your hand.]
The Wizard exaggeratedly spoke in a high pitch while exposing his pale hands to show how impressed he was.
Not receiving any reply from the duo, the Wizard soon becomes bored as he started explaining something out of nowhere.
[You know, what you guys fought was just the essence of their soul. If you two have gone against the real thing, I can't even imagine what chaos would have befallen my floor. Lucky me~]
Austin had a bad premonition about where this was going but until he doesn't clear this Wizard's annoying tests, Austin knew, he would end up gaining nothing.
There was no option rather than to wait and see what this robed bastard has in store.
After levitating around the brother-sister duo, the Abyssal Wizard landed in front of them before he summoned a big cube in his hand.
Looking at the pair with an egoistic glance, the Wizard spoke in a haughty tone.
[What you two fought were just broken toys of mine. I will recognize your worth only if you defeat this thing on your own, Austin Vincent Wright! ]
Saying so, the Wizard dropped the cube on the ground before a very familiar thing appeared in front.
Upon witnessing the appearance, Austin sighed as he muttered under his breath.
'All that hype for this thing…'
_____________________
A/N: - Readers have reduced somehow. Can you guys tell me, what might have changed in a bad way?
Lemme know in the comments ╥⁠﹏⁠╥

chapters.title: Chapter 137: Against the golem~1!
chapters.content:
During the great war which occurred between Hero and the Great Demon Lord in the manga, there came a time when the hero's party was against something they never expected.
Amongst the seven generals of the Monarch of Darkness, the sixth one who was proficient in Dark Manipulation and Mind Interference magic was the one who brought this catastrophe against Hero Kyouki.
It was a Mechanical Golem that had every kind of Element resistance and had physical prowess which could even outmatch the Hero of Light in his prime!
It was a brutal contest between the two which lasted for a whole volume(2 weeks) and only after the help of Lilia's inherited spell, the golem was put under a barrier yet not defeated.
The Hero's party was badly injured against such a danger which far surpassed the Demon General possessing it. But after their proper coordination and teamwork, it ended well.
Strangely, the same thing which Austin has seen through 2d drawings was recently summoned by the Abyssal Wizard.
The fact of the matter which made Austin perplexed was, how come this golem was here? Maybe, the creator of this war machine is also a demon? Or maybe, the demons steal it from this Abyssal Wizard?
Since curse energy works fine inside the Labyrinth, the second option seemed plausible. Well, Austin didn't have much leeway to think leisurely.
After all, Austin's subject of interest was currently raining an onslaught on him.
*DHAK*
With both hands joined, the 60 ft tall Golem with four limbs like a human and a square middle body, stomped its fist where Austin was a moment ago.
Its face just like its body, was also symmetrical with a pair of hollow eyes.
Austin felt like laughing when they saw such a cartoon as Golem in reality but again, he doesn't have the time to stop at the moment.
It seemed the mangaka didn't take time to draw this which resulted in this reality that Austin has to face.
Saya was commanded by her brother to stay on Cordelia and Kyouki's side since the Golem was huge enough to damage them through just shockwaves.
She was biting her lips in annoyance while shielding the two. In the end, her Onii-sama had to do all the things by himself.
But little did she know, Austin was just playing around with the thing while patiently waiting for the time when he could hit the big doll.
Austin was aware of the Golem's weak point which was in between its hollow eyes. One of the benefits of being a transmigrated.
**SWIING**
Suddenly two huge blades were released by its huge smiling mouth in Austin's direction. It was rotating at high speed as it advanced toward its prey.
They clearly weren't just two rotating blades but also had some kind of sorcery involved since, even though Austin dodged and dashed in a different direction, the pieces of metal didn't lose their sight and followed their target.
Using the inhumane raw strength in his legs, Austin was shifting from one place to another in no time but still, it wasn't enough.
'It's annoying… '
Austin got enough intel on the Golem and now he was done running around.
Landing his feet abruptly, Austin turned toward the incoming blades before he applied some minuscules of mana on his senses.
Soon the rotation speed slowed down for him and also the shape of it became vivid.
It was a slim double leaf-shaped blade with a circular gap at the center, probably given as a handle.
Saya's eyes widened in a fret and Wizard's in amusement when the blades reached only some inches apart from the blond youth.
"ONII-SAMA!!"
Saya was about to jump toward the spot despite not being sure whether she could make it or not, but soon she halted upon witnessing the scene.
The Wizard also raised his brows in admiration as he saw how perceptive and observant this teenage boy is.
The reason for such a reaction was, how easily Austin dodged the blades by just tapping some certain points.
A little push at the perfect time and their trajectory were changed. The blades passed by Austin and soon collided with each other and canceled out the rotation altogether.
The whole ordeal happened in fractions of a second. No one was able to discern when Austin moved and dodged the blades with such fluency. It indeed was a surprising event.
Austin wasn't much invested in what he did as he had to take out a piece of blabbering-robed bastard first.
"XXX-XXXXXX-XXXX-XXXXX"
The Wizard's eyes couldn't be stretched more in amazement, as he heard very familiar syllables being spoken by Austin. The sorcery which reins above all. The Spiritual Magic.
Austin on the other hand, had no mind to pay attention to anyone at the moment since he was gathering a whole lot of red fiery spirits around him.
The amount was quite a lot which required just his focus not much time.
After just ten seconds, Austin had what he wanted as he channeled the energy through his pores and commanded all the spirits roaming around the floor.
"XXXX-XXXXX-XXXXX!"
The command was simple yet destructive. But the spirits loved entertainment and looking at the funny big creature, they knew it would be going to be fun.
The Golem sensed something approaching but since it wasn't just from one direction, the Killing Machine, failed to counter.
**SWOOOOSH**
Like a domain of fire suddenly raining down the sky, the Golem got covered in flames which wasn't just restricting its body and blocking its vision from its prey, but also minimizing its movement.
The fire curtains were wide enough to cover the area where the Golem could flail.
The Golem finally analyzed the situation and commenced its arms movement clockwise to extinguish the fire at least from its body.
The inhuman thing had its senses again freed as it surveyed its whole body to find the human it was preying for.
But Austin wasn't an amateur to just show up like a guest visiting neighborhood.
With his body covered with nothing but burning flames, Austin appeared in mid-air with his demonic blade raised in arc and inches apart from the forehead of the Golem.
[Hahah! How many surprises do you have in store boy? Amusing! Amusing indeed! However… ]
**CLING**
Austin's eyes widened as his blade didn't connect at the spot he wanted rather a small protective seal was broken with his strike.
**UOOOOOH**
The Golem instantly identified the human before it extend its arm and got a hold of its prey.
The spirits were also called off since the connection was lost and the whole scene returned to normal except for the fact that Austin wasn't liberated any longer.
[...you can't just predict everything on just a whim~]
______________
A/N: - Drop a comment~

chapters.title: Chapter 138: Against the golem~2!
chapters.content:
From what Austin read in his previous life, the Golem which the Hero party fought had its weak point situated at the middle of its eyes.
The Golem was highly precautious about its vulnerability which was why Kyouki wasn't able to finish it off despite knowing the Killing Machine's weak spot. And Kyouki only discovered this fact from his anonymous strikes all over its gigantic body.
In the end, with Lilia's inherited spell [Seal of Elhiem], the Golem was put into a slumber of eternity where only Lilia could bring it back to life.
But in the manga, no seal was found when the Hero party fought the Golem which further implies that there might not be only one of these Chaotic Machines available.
Thinking of tens of these things roaming freely on the above land would undoubtedly bring chaos. But at the moment Austin didn't have much time to mind about such things.
"Ughh… "
With a slight groan, Austin tried to break free from the cage he was caught in. But due to the restriction to his limbs, he was failing miserably.
Saya was extremely frustrated at this point since she didn't have the courage to break her brother's order and seeing him in pain was making her heart clench.
She was completely stuck!
Fortunately, Austin didn't make his sister suffer anymore.
"[Gravity Manipulation]"
Channeling heavy mana through his pores, Austin applied gravity in reversal to push the Golem's hand apart.
The backlash was severe enough to bring a mouthful of blood in his mouth, but Austin didn't pay much mind to it and taking the slight agape in its grip, he instantly leaped out.
The Golem didn't take time to respond as it lifted its arm and brought it down to the place where Austin landed.
But it was a mistake to judge that the human would be vulnerable after the ordeal.
**SLING**
Like a horrifying shadow, Austin disappeared from his spot before the hand which was about to land was sliced apart from its arm.
The Golem lifted its severed arm in perplexion before it felt something massive approaching from its back.
**DHAKK**
Instinctively raising its hand above its head, the Golem saw being struck with a purple blade which was being held by the same human who seemed weakened a moment ago.
Austin didn't prolong his attack before using all the stat of his agility to move away from his spot. His eyes were slightly red without any particular emotions left in them.
The demonic sword he held suited the current self of the blond youth who had a terrifying aura presently surrounding him.
The Golem was unable to track Austin's speed before the latter appeared near the machine's leg and slashed his blade using strength rather than precision.
**SLING**
The slinging sound again resonated as the cursed sword made a deep cut in the Golem's left leg but to no avail. The Golem had high adaptability which caused the curse energy to affect it less with each strike.
The Golem just lifted its left leg with extreme force while lifting the human who was standing near along with it. But Austin didn't plan to be kicked so easily.
Using his skill [Indefinite Leap] Austin made some distance from the giant as he stabilized his mind for a moment.
His physical might may be tremendous but the Golem was even stronger than Austin when it comes to physical prowess. Using mana was also influencing Austin severely to the point where he felt slightly dizzy.
His only option was Spiritual Magic but other than Elements, he couldn't ask for Time and Space spirits since they are egotistical beings.
'Well, screw it! '
Austin bit his lips before conjuring three boulders over the approaching Golem. The rocks were heavy enough to destroy the fort of Eden Academy.
Just as the gigantic machine reached some meters apart from him, Austin brought the boulders down in an instant and stomped the Golem underneath the rocks.
**UGOOOOOH**
The Golem cried in agony as the boulders were heavy enough to make it fall to the ground. The rumbling of the floor was caused by the crash along with the heavy roar.
"XXXXX–XXXXX-XX"
Austin gathered the fire spirits again around himself before he levitate in mid-air. It wouldn't have taken much time for the Golem to break free, so Austin hurried and formed three votives surrounding the captive.
"XX-XXX"
A single command and the portals started pouring blaze on the Golem like hell has been bestowed upon upper lands. Any top-ranking warrior would have burnt to cinder under such a raging blaze that Austin brought down at one place.
The scene from afar was magnificent at the same time terrifying enough to make Cordelia and Kyouki gulp in a fret as they gazed upon the battleground.
The fire vortices lasted for half a minute before they disappeared as per Austin's command.
After the smoke subdued what came into vision was molten rocks sticking to the Golem like amber slimes. Austin expected such results as he soon called for Wind Spirits.
"XXXXX-XXXXXXXX-XXX"
The long command just focused om bringing storms over the temporarily paralyzed Golem. The gust was solely focused on n siding the molten rocks and so it went as expected.
**SWOOOOOOSH**
The storms of wind were heavy enough to make the surrounding people waver from their spot while the Golem tried to break free. However, the tribulation occurred fast enough for the Golem to even counter adequately.
The Wizard was enjoying the display of such continuous use of Spiritual energy and how Austin was guiding the spirits in the best way possible for his advantage.
Austin didn't give another glance at what he did as he brought the same hammer out of his inventory which he used to breakthrough the floors.
The Golem was caged but not for long. Austin's energy was depleting at a warning rate. The next strike would decide whether he could handle such catastrophic creation in his current strength or not.
'Never thought I would reach my limit so soon… '
__________________…
A/N: - Sorry if it seemed rushed since I wanted to cover this golem part rather quickly.
Drop a comment~

chapters.title: Chapter 139: Mature Venessa?!
chapters.content:
"Never thought I would meet you here…and alone."
Under the brightly shining sun, two women of similar ages walked through a dense forest that was only surrounded by greenery and wild creatures.
The girl who just spoke in an uncertain tone was a short crimson hair cool beauty who previously was also a student of Eden Academy, Vanessa Charles.
Unlike in the past, she had much more warrior sharpness in her frame, and her aura also seemed to be profoundly heavier than before.
Luna was surprised to see such a change in Venessa if taking the time she left the Academy into consideration. Not normally people grow this much in so less time.
"Alone huh? Were you expecting someone with me or something?"
Vanessa's steps halted abruptly as she heard Luna's teasing remark which for some reason seemed threatening as well. Vanessa chose to stay silent on the matter for her own good.
"Forget it. If you don't want to become a hindrance, stop following me."
Luna would have used levitation and gotten rid of this baggage that popped out of nowhere but to find the artifact creator, she has to tread carefully.
"Believe it or not, I am not the same person who bitched around the whole day. If anytime I seem to become a problem in your way, I will do my best to remove myself away."
Luna didn't respond but she know, the current Venessa was indeed a different person who unlike in the past seemed more reliable and mature.
"!!"
All of sudden, Luna's feet halted with her eyes stretching wide and the color from her face evaporating in an instant.
Vanessa got startled to see such a reaction from the Saintess as she hurriedly approached Luna and asked in a slow whisper.
"Did something happen?"
With her eyes still, unmoving Luna parted her lips and was able to usher a single word out of her throat.
"....Austin."
__________________
"Onii-sama! Are you okay?! Where does it hurt?"
As Saya charged at the scene she helped her fallen brother to sit while leaning his back on her bent leg and her free hand searching for any injury.
The Golem which has been creating havoc until now has been destroyed to pieces through the usage of Dwarves' Hammer.
But after the strike, Austin also fell to the ground with a profound frown contouring his face and discomfort seemingly rushing all over his body.
"I-I am okay… Just the usage of mana-Khwak…
Austin vomited a mouthful of blood on the ground, increasing Saya's anxiety as tears also started bubbling in her round eyes.
It was the result of the severe backlash Austin felt from using such a weapon which required his mana and added to the previous usage too. He was fortunate to have such a strong will that didn't let his consciousness fade away.
[Aww… and here I was stretching myself to go on a round or two against you. Sad you are dying..]
The Abyssal Wizard's voice reached up to the two before Saya growled with her eyes growing fiery toward the robed-talking piece of shit.
Her body was flickering with raven lightning as her breathing grew erratic past each second with her gaze turning life-threatening.
Anyone would have lost their confidence in front of the current Saya and it was no different for the Wizard as well. The smirk on his face vanished as he stared back at the woman who gave a presence seemingly bigger than he primarily evaluated.
The Wizard had a hunch that if not for mana restriction, the battle between him and the woman might not have concluded in his favor.
"It's okay, Saya. I'll be fine in a minute. "
Austin held his sister's hand before she does something irreversible as he took out a dagger from his inventory.
Saya turned her gaze toward her brother as she saw a cyan radiance glowing from the small weapon.
"Onii-sama, this… "
"Yeah. It's coated with Holy Magic which Luna gave me in case of emergency. I never thought I would be using it just on the fifth floor tho… "
Saying so, Austin pierced the dagger right into his left chest pad. The dagger was far better than any of Austin's recovery pills or recovery artifacts. But since it takes a toll on the user's body, Luna only created one.
"Argh! "
Austin's hold on Saya's hand subconsciously tightened to the point she felt her bones creaking but she didn't had mind to pay attention to it as she kept her worried gaze fixated on her brother.
Austin was in severe pain since the remedy was working efficiently at each corner of his body and recovering the mana that Austin lost during the fight. Since there was no mana in the surrounding, once lost mana would never be returned until they are in the labyrinth.
And Austin had lost a lot in his last onslaught.
While getting treated, Austin whispered in a low tone that only Saya could hear.
"Listen carefully, Saya. I will now engage in battle with that Wizard. I will occupy him in every way possible but as I have sensed, I cannot kill him. That's why I need your help."
Saya nodded in determination as she never was planning to let her brother get in this alone again. This time she would do whatever she can to end this robbed bastard once and for all.
"Alright, Onii-sama. You create the opening and I will use everything I have to land the final blow. "
__________________….
A/N: - This Labyrinth would be wrapped up in a couple of chapters. After this fight, most intel would remain.
Drop a comment if you are liking the story so far~

chapters.title: Chapter 140: Way to the core~1!
chapters.content:
Due to the last brawl with the Golem, Austin's armor was mostly broken and some cuts on his inner vest were also inflicted.
There was not much time to change into new armor and guards and the current one was nothing but seemed like a hindrance.
So after letting go of his guard, Austin just stood in his torn shirt with his lower wear fortunately still unscathed.
His breathing calmed down somewhat as he stared at the Abyssal mage who was still levitating albeit a little higher than before.
Saya took some distance from her brother since she was told to take the final strike. Until then, she could just pray that her Onii-sama doesn't hurt himself.
Kyouki and Cordelia were in their previous position with their eyes glued to the battlefield as sweat profoundly covered their foreheads.
It was mind-numbing to see Austin fighting the Golem one-on-one and came out victorious. Taking mana restriction and the prowess the Golem carried into consideration, both of them had no hope of even withstanding that machine for some minutes.
It wasn't that they were under-evaluating themselves. It's just that a single boy of the same age as them has strength that they have long lost the capability to comprehend.
Austin inhaled deeply, before he exchanged his demonic sword with a strange spear.
Until he doesn't evaluate what this Wizard actually is, Austin prefers to maintain a certain distance.
The spear he ejected out of the inventory was a golden-staffed weapon with a 10 cm spear blade and a dark orb connected to its rear end. It was 2.4 m in length and relatively lengthier than most of his weapons.
Pointing the tip in the Wizard's direction, Austin closed his eyes for a second before he gathered strength in his legs and lunged forward, leaving a smoke of gust behind.
"Hupp!"
The leap was huge, to say the least as within five seconds he was at a reachable distance from the Wizard before Austin swung his spear in an upward slash with ferocious speed.
*TING**
But to no avail. The Wizard just flickered the approaching attack with his fingers without much change of expression. It totally was a waste to attack him front-on.
Being thrown off-balance, Austin tried to retreat but it was too late.
**DHAK**
A fist revealed out of the long robe Wizard shrouds himself with and stuck near Austin's ribs.
**BOOOOOM*
Austin was thrown to the ground with a single punch as the crash formed cracks in the floor.
The exchange happened in so little time that the three watching from a distance had their eyes wide at their farthest reach and mouth parted in shock.
They have grown somehow accustomed to seeing Austin dominating the battle so this conclusion was somewhat startling.
But Austin was far from shocked. He darted from his place and this time he didn't leap but ran to the Wizard and threw his spear with sheer force.
**SLING**
Without letting a second go waste, Austin ran to the back side of Wizard and jumped furiously with his eyes turning slightly red.
The spear and his leap were in alignment as they approached the Wizard from two different directions.
It was a splendid display of precise spear technique and tremendous agility to match himself just accurately with the weapon.
But again, it was futile…
**TING**
With a bell ringing sound, the Wizard grabbed both the spearhead and Austin's incoming punch with his body turned sideways without much effort at all.
Austin was in the Wizard's hold, but rather than shocked, a grin spread across his face which made the man frown slightly.
But before he could have expected what was to come, Austin swung something in a frightening manner and got himself out of the hold.
The wizard raised his brows before he lifted his hand and saw there was nothing after his forearm.
Landing on the ground, Austin threw the slain hand away as he figured something useful out.
There wasn't any blood or muscle visibly flowing out of the cut but just a black smoke emerged before the Wizard's hand was back to normal.
'He's weak in close range… '
Austin concluded that the man's reflexes were a little dull when he slashed his dagger and thus formed the next thing which the blond youth is going to advance upon.
But the problem was Wizard's position. While being in the air, Austin couldn't engage in close combat for long. That brings the requirement of the only way possible.
'Let's take you down first… '
________________…
A/N: - Action scenes are tiring. I am gonna wrap this up real quick, until then~
Drop a comment~

chapters.title: Chapter 141: Way to the core~2!
chapters.content:
*Hah*Hah*
Panting in slight exhaustion Austin stood with his hand resting on his bent knees as he stared at the Abyssal Wizard who still was in his previous position, completely unfazed.
Austin tried his Spiritual Magic on the Wizard. Flames, Earth, Aqua. But the man either dodged or blocked the attacks somehow.
Austin did have an artifact, especially for binding purposes but it requires a heavy amount of mana, thus no good. If he really has to use mana then he would use it on something less taxing.
[Gravity Manipulation]
Extending his hand, Austin applied a pulling force to the Wizard's feet, and surprisingly it wasn't much troubling to do so. The robed Wizard was brought down quite naturally but it wasn't like Austin felt nothing out of it.
The small amount of magical energy released was enough to make him feel slightly dizzy but not to the point where Austin would miss such a good opportunity to hunt his prey.
[Hahaha… Even this skill? How many tricks do you actually possess kid~]
It was evident that the Wizard wasn't struggling at all being pulled down to the floor as he laughed in amusement at the new interesting discovery he had about the blondie.
Taking out his twin short dagger which was a [A] rank reward he got from the system a long time ago, Austin rushed toward the wizard without any further ado.
Saya was primarily quite troubled seeing her brother again using mana but there wasn't anything she could do other than wait. She knew jumping in the fight now would be nothing more than becoming a hindrance.
'Please don't hurt yourself Onii-sama… '
The first thing Austin did was to maximize his speed as much as he can despite knowing that the Wizard has his gaze fixed on his every movement.
From a natural perspective, Austin was going for a frontal assault but that was just to look predictable.
Since in reality…
[Hmmm?]
The Wizard raised his hand to halt Austin's attack which was a pathetic frontal slash with his back-gripped dagger. But the Wizard wasn't able to grab hold of the blondie for some reason. It somehow seemed like he was seeing an after image…?
'[Don't tell..] '
Before the Wizard would have realized what trickery he had fallen into, a massive impact was inflicted on the left side of his torso.
[Urgh… Wha..?!]
There stood Austin with an expressionless complexion adorning his face as he didn't use his still-held daggers rather he chose to punch this damn Wizard for once.
[How you… ]
It was the first time when the expression on the Wizard's face contoured this dangerously since he never expected the blondie to play such a card all of a sudden.
Austin didn't have any intention to quell the old man's curiosity as he slashed his left hand and intended to rip the man's throat with his dagger.
But the Wizard wasn't a newbie who would fall for everything. He gripped Austin's approaching wrist in a rigid hold before a grin spread on his pale lips.
[Not so smart kid… ]
But it was a misconception of the Wizard that he got a hold of Austin.
[Huh!]
Before the older one could have perceived the situation entirely, Austin kicked his leg and fell on the floor with the Wizard above Austin and the latter's leg caging the Wizard's back in an unmovable hold.
(A/N: - Imagine Luna appearing all of a sudden X-D )
"Let's burn."
The cold tone of the teenager resonated heavily in the Wizard's ears before the downfall of blazing heat poured down on both of them.
[AHHHHH!!]
Earlier, the Wizard was able to dodge Austin's attack through his precise levitation skill but now being captured, there was no way for the man to run away.
Like a heavy cascade of the crimson blaze, both Austin and the Wizard got shrouded under the hellish curtains.
Even the hero would have burnt to a cinder if such flames would have rained on him for too long which made the duo on the sidelines gasp at the scene in horror.
The Wizard was also hurting quite a lot. More than Austin thought as he saw the man struggling to get out of the hold but surprisingly, Austin was way stronger than the man when it came to such extreme situations.
[You damn kid!!!]
Suddenly the Wizard shouted as his robe left his body and extended like a sheet over both of them and countered the flames before the Wizard punched Austin right in the face.
**BAM**
Austin felt his nose bleeding but he didn't let go of the Wizard since he knew the robe wouldn't last long against the spirits.
**BAM*BAM**
But Austin wasn't able to protect himself from getting punched since he was also restrained to move freely.
But something Austin didn't expect happened as a familiar voice rang in his senses and an overwhelming presence approached.
"You bastard! Let go of my Onii-sama!"
The wicked smile on the Wizard's face returned as he smirked upon hearing the person he was triggering by hurting the blondie.
"Saya no!!"
__________________
A/N: - How was the chapter? I am trying to detail everything I can.
Please let me know in the comments~

chapters.title: Chapter 142: Way to the Core~3!
chapters.content:
"SAYA NOOO!!"
Despite crying out loud, Saya was agitated enough to stop in her track as she dashed to the scene with fury burning in her gaze and heavy mana leaking subconsciously.
Austin knew that the flames which the Wizard was shielding himself from, through his robe, would surely burn Saya severely.
And it goes without saying that the sly man would retract his robe as soon Saya enter the proximity where she could be rained down with the Spiritual Flames.
Austin has no choice rather than to request the spirits to pull away before they hurt his sister.
"XXX-XX!!"
The fall of hell vanished in an instant as the older-looking girl reached near the wizard as she intended to slash her blade and decapitate the bastard's head off.
But what troubled Austin was the smirk which never left the man's lips and soon Austin realized the reason for it.
**SWISH**
The robe indeed moved out of its shield form but it didn't get back over its owner, rather approached someone else.
"!!"
Saya didn't even notice when something wrapped around her at such a ferocious pace before her blade dropped down to the ground and she found herself facing nothing but darkness.
"Mmmph! Hmmph!!"
Saya tried her best to break free but from Austin's perception, that robe wasn't even moving even a bit. Only after entrapping Saya within fractions of seconds, the robe levitated away.
The turn of events happened in mere blinks and Austin was left shocked beyond belief. Only when he saw Saya being taken away, did he get out of his stupor and extended his hand to grab the man.
But it was too late…
[Hahah! The pitiful soul got targetted just because of her love for her brother~]
The Wizard took the advantage of Austin's absent-mindedness as he flew away from the floor and levitated just beside his robe.
Saya's struggling figure was right in Austin's view as he instantly got up and threw all his worries about the backlash of mana.
But before he could have flown off and gouge the life out of the shithead, some figures suddenly emerged out of nowhere and smashed Austin back to the ground with a strong thud.
"Fuck!"
Austin couldn't help but groan in annoyance as he saw the number of shadow slaves emerging in front. If they were regular slaves then Austin would have annihilated them with Spiritual Energy but no.
What made Austin quite troubled since some minutes ago was now in more than one in quantity, standing tall and ready to engage in battle any moment now.
[Thanks to you, their pseudo soul got destroyed and I can now summon them as much as I want.]
Austin wasn't standing still to listen to the useless chatters as the Golems started raining down a barrage of front-on attacks.
Their strength wasn't like the original ones but in that quantity, it was almost impossible to get out unscathed.
"Argh!"
Austin tried to sneak between the gaps but the wizard suddenly fired strange energy from his finger which threw Austin back to the surface.
One of the Golem took the chance and slammed its massive fist just precisely at the place where Austin fell, further engraving a greater with the blond youth as its center.
Austin felt massive damage surging from inside but he has to use his skill to reach Saya as soon as possible.
[Gravity Manipulation]
Extending his hand, Austin put pressure on the dozens of Golem but due to the constant jammer of his natural magical energy, the skill remained short of fulfilling its role.
The four who were near him fell flat on the ground just after Austin left the crater and dashed toward the nearest Golem.
He knew the Wizard won't let him save Saya until he doesn't defeat all the Golem and so he shall do so.
Gritting his teeth, Austin clenched his fist as his world seemed red due to the pressure he was feeling with the heavy amount of mana he released.
But he cared about none at the moment.
**BOOOOM**
A roaring blast echoed in the surroundings as Austin hit the Golem right in its abdomen before the gigantic thing could have blocked him.
But rather than being forced to take two steps back, the Golem wasn't harmed much and so it countered soon enough.
The Golem didn't hit the human rather it pressed its big hand on him and pushed the human down to the ground roughly.
This time the other undead Golems didn't wait and landed their foot on Austin one after another before the human could get back on his feet.
The sound of massive feet smashing to the ground restlessly made the empty floor horrifyingly noisy.
Kyouki could only grit his teeth in frustration since leaving his place would only mean leaving Cordelia to die. And the hero still believes that there was more to Austin, even though he knows it was just his wishful expectation.
Cordelia was growing pale to see that amount of terrifying beings stomping over the boy who seemed undefeatable some moments ago. The shift of events was too frightening to believe.
Austin's Gravity Manipulation also faded away as he found himself struggling even to keep his eyes open by the brutal onslaught he came in contact with for the first time.
His half-open eyes were lingering on his sister who was still caged by the robe.
His thought process was getting clogged up as Austin ran across his brain to think what possibly he could do when suddenly something caught his partial vision.
Saya's movement seemed to be slowing down all of a sudden. Like she is accepting her defeat.
Like she is going to lose hope in her brother.
Like he might never see her again.
Like there won't be anyone who will call him Onii-sama again.
Like… she…is going to…
**SNAP**
The Wizard who was enjoying the show with his eyes curved suddenly widened his gaze as he felt something.
Something massive and furious from the place where the blondie is….or…was…
_________________
A/N: - Next chapter would be lit. Drop a comment if you are liking the story so far~
P. S: - I know you guys hate the emo drama but I just couldn't help myself X-D

chapters.title: Chapter 143: Way to the Core~4!
chapters.content:
Currently, Kyouki was gawking at the sight which was nothing short of a nightmare even though he wasn't in the center of it.
He still was on the sideline constantly exorcizing her friend so she doesn't get influenced by the Abyssal Wizard's presence with his eyes never leaving the battlefield which has taken another shift of turn.
Just some moments ago, he was about to resign from the role he was given and dash there to help Austin. His condition was going severe as time passed due to the barrage of attacks that befell one after another on him.
Cordelia also was urging Kyouki to leave her and help Austin but suddenly her voice came to an abrupt halt as she also gazed upon the sudden change of events.
The Austin who was on the receiving end until now and seemed to be growing close to losing his consciousness or maybe his life any moment now suddenly rose up once again.
But unlike before he wasn't moving at his usual pace. Heck, he didn't even seem to be moving anymore. More like he was teleporting from one place to another as he commenced his offense.
Kyouki had never seen someone fight like that. Austin wasn't using any spell nor even Mana was leaking from him, but still, he was brawling with those Golems like he was thrashing newbie warriors.
His physical might was raised just like his speed and this time he wasn't even caring whether he was getting injured in the process of inflicting damage or not.
He was behaving like a battle-driven maniac who knew nothing more than to annihilate his enemies.
Battle cries resonated as the strong onslaught landed at different corners of each Golem and sent them flying away in different directions.
Austin wasn't just fighting right now. He was overwhelming the battle one-sidedly.
'What have you become Austin… '
_._._
Austin was no more conscious of what he was doing. He was just moving on his instincts with his gaze lifelessly red in bloodthirst.
He could only think about one thing. And that was to annihilate his enemies in order to save his sister.
He no longer felt any kind of discomfort or any injuries. He just let go of the restraints which humans generally have in the name of humanity.
These were his enemies who were restricting him to rescue his sister. There was no point in showing them mercy. They are meant to be massacred in the cruelest way.
**BOOOOM**
As Austin gathered his natural elemental blaze over his hand, he punched the weakest spot of the Golem and turned the whole thing into bits and pieces.
The other Golems started to gather in order to fight efficiently against the human but Austin cared about none.
Before they could have joined forces, he dashed with a speed that exceeded his limitation and appeared in front of one of the random Golems.
Leaping high in the air, he didn't halt before taking out his war hammer and pummeling it down on the Golem's head with sheer force nothing else.
**CRACK**
**BOOOOM**
An audible crack erupted from the weapon because of the Golem's defense but it didn't stop the heaven shattering strike from destroying the head of the Golem and further leaving it lifeless.
Austin never stopped any time as he lunged at the nearest Golem with his spear springing out of his inventory. Using Spear's skill [Penetration] he felt himself spinning in mid-air before his whole body with the weapon started to rotate at extreme speed.
The target was clear and the attack was precise.
**THUD**
Another Golem dropped to the ground after Austin created a small yet impactful hole through the Golem's forehead.
The Spear was burnt enough to be of no more use as Austin threw it away and stood while facing three remaining Golems.
His body was dyed with his own blood and the remnants of the only living Golem he faced. But he wasn't in his sane mind to think about such things.
His bloodlust grew severe as the Golem launched themselves toward Austin from different directions.
Austin leaped once again high in the air before he took out a particular chain from his inventory which was named [Curse Binder].
The chain doesn't require mana, rather the blood of the user in order to show its effect.
Austin thoughtlessly, released the chains toward the three inhumane creatures which got enlarged as it approached its prey and successfully restrained the Golems with ease.
A lot of blood was absorbed in the chains as the binding started to show its effect and the Golems started to erode slowly yet surely. Their struggle to be set free also slowed down due to the effect of 'SS' rank binders.
The only one left was-
[You damn brat!]
The Wizard's face was pale as he suddenly landed over Austin and kicked the teenager's head with his whole might, intending to tear off Austin's head at the time he seemed most vulnerable.
Due to the Curse Binders, even the Wizard was feeling the effect for some reason which made him furious at Austin and so he decided to stop playing around and kill the son of a bitch once and for all.
But it was a mistake on the Wizard's part to think that Austin would let his guard down just because he annihilated some measly Golems.
Due to the force of the kick, Austin's head just only tilted to the right but he remained unmoved much to the older one's fret.
['I have to retreat! ']
The chills of death crept into every fiber of the Wizard as he tried to flee but…
_______________
A/N: - Next chapter would conclude the Abyssal Wizard arc and we will proceed with the labyrinth.
I hope you guys liking the story so far~

chapters.title: Chapter 144: Way to the Core~End!
chapters.content:
The battle has concluded.
The previously wagging body of the Abyssal Wizard was now hopelessly lying on the cold ground as Austin stared at the man's pale white face, devoid of any emotions.
Austin slew the Wizard without utilizing any mana or artifact and not even weapons. He just tore the floor master's limb one after another mercilessly with bite strength as the Wizard cried in agony all along.
Stomping his knee, ankle, toes, elbow, testicles… Autin made sure to crack every single breakable thing before he bisected the Wizard while enjoying his screams
In the process, the robe which was previously entrapping Saya flew toward Austin to save its master but failed.
Even though Saya was set free and the mana-restricting curse was broken, Austin didn't stop in his torture. He was no longer fighting to save his sister. He just wanted to hear the Wizard's screams of misery and end his life in the cruelest way possible.
Since the curse was ripped off, seemingly because of the Wizard's near-death condition, both Cordelia and Kyouki were unrestrained.
The first thing they did was to check on Saya since presently, they can only rely on her to stop Austin from his frenzy. Austin currently looked nothing but horrifying.
"Lia… the pill. It will work now."
The pill that Kyouki hurriedly asked for was a mana-stimulating pill, which triggers a person's dormant magical energy.
Since there was no backlash they could feel while channelizing their mana, that pill would help Saya's natural essence to heal her.
Cordelia nodded, and after parting Saya's lips, she dropped the pill inside her mouth before Kyouki passed some water for Cordelia to pour down Saya's throat.
On the other side, Austin was done with his ordeal as he shredded the robe in bits and threw it away. The Wizard was only left with his armless upper body with his heart slowly numbing passing each second.
Even so, his eyes were parted as the Wizard witnessed the cruelty that the blondie carried. The old man was just shocked would be an understatement. He was beyond petrified to meet such a being after a long time.
But even in face of death, the Abyssal Wizard had a smile plastered across his lips as he muttered his last of the words before Austin stomped his life away.
[If… it's…you… I think*hah*...you might…defeat-]
**CRACK**
And with that, the end of the fifth stage master came to an end as Austin stepped on the man's heart and without hesitation crushed it.
There was still a smirk on the man's face as he felt his century's worth of life fading in the face of a single brat. But that smirk signified that he regretted nothing.
Now there was someone who might…
"O-Onii-sama…."
**SNAP**
Hearing a familiar tone, Austin's gaze widened, and for the first time after a long while an expression of anxiety spread over his face.
Hurriedly he turned toward the source of the voice only to see the person for whom he started this massacre. The murderous daze took over his mind so profoundly that he forgot because of whom he ever fell into that state.
Regret, sorrow, elation, and many other emotions vividly grew thick on Austin's face as he stepped toward his sister.
"Saya I-khak!!"
"Onii-sama!!"
Saya limply got up with help of Cordelia as they followed Kyouki who reached for Austin first and helped the latter.
Austin had his mouth wide agape as he tried to catch his breath. His face grew pale and his vision darkened severely.
Kyouki in a panic, laid Austin to the ground with his head on Kyouki's thigh in order to not let Austin choke.
"Hey, hey! Calm down and breathe, okay? Just relax and breathe properly."
Kyouki rubbed Austin's chest as he spoke in a hurried tone while the other two knelt on either side of Austin.
None of them had any idea what was wrong with Austin. Since mana should've been working properly there doesn't seem any reason for his sudden fall.
Saya was crying non-stop while holding her brother's cold hand as she condemned herself for his condition. The chain of events has made her mind blank to even think properly at the moment.
Cordelia was checking his pulse and rubbed his palms to calm his nerves but to no avail. His life was evidently leaving his shell as the remnants of his mana depleted dangerously.
Kyouki was the only one yelling at Austin to calm down with tears also moistening his eyes. He just doesn't know what he should do and only could blame his incapability that Austin had to force himself to this extent.
Even though the threat of the Wizard had subdued, the group was in deep desperation. If not, greater degree than before.
The person who fought for them. The person who saved their worthless life was now falling into a slumber that seemed no way of returning yet they could only watch him die while crying like a loser!
At times every hope seemed to diminish, a familiar voice resonated heavily on the labyrinth floor, making the three flinch in expectation and slight horror as well.
"I left my husband to you guys just for a few hours and this is how you have taken care of him?!"
_________________
A/N: - Stalker for once, stalker for life.
I hope you guys liking the story so far. Drop a comment on your way back~

chapters.title: Chapter 145: You are useless, Saya!
chapters.content:
"Hmm."
Luna hummed in response to the story, Kyouki narrated about the whole ordeal which took place on the fifth floor.
Saya was still weeping in silence as she stared at her unconscious brother while being supported by Cordelia.
Luna was constantly healing Austin from tip to toe while providing him the blood he had once stored in her ring if situations like this occurred.
Her eyes were cold as ever which made Kyouki gulp in a fret. The hero, after telling the full story, stepped back as he stood beside the other two while waiting for the evident upset Luna's next words.
After what seemed like an eternity, Luna's chilling tone finally reached up to the three but the most startled one was the person who got targeted by her words.
"Weren't you a Demi-God ranked or something, Saya? Is that just for show or you deliberately left your brother in trouble in order to see how much he loves you?"
Saya wanted to say something but in the end, she only bit her lip until a small stream of blood didn't start pouring down.
Even though her words were hurtful and sharp, Saya knew she deserved it. And not only that, a lot more than this.
Despite being strong and training for so damn long, she was nothing more than dead weight for her brother who brought him into such a state.
She was nothing more than a disgrace who doesn't have the right to live anymore!
"Try to hurt yourself and you will find your brother in more pain when he wakes up. I don't care at all, but I don't want my husband to be sad, so stay right there."
Saya flinched upon witnessing Luna's perception, who without even looking at Saya could tell what she was thinking at the moment.
She really deserves to be on her brother's side.
"I… I am sorry Luna… I just… I-I just couldn't save him…."
More tears rolled down her cheeks as she stuttered those words somehow.
Luna sighed as she kept her gaze focused on the man for whom she had tolerated this foolish girl until now.
"If your brother wakes up, the last thing he would want to see would be your crying face. Cry how much you want but not now, since I wouldn't like to see any discomfort on my Austin's face."
Kyouki was astonished to see how selfish Luna has become to only care about Austin. But then again, it was the best way to console Saya in such a situation. After all, both the ladies had only a single weakness.
'Lucky bastard… '
…________________…
[Austin's POV:]
'Am I floating… '
The most recognizable thing I remember was seeing Saya limply walking in my direction when I felt a sensation protruding inside my body somewhere. And it hurt like hell!
The most painful thing was that I wasn't able to discern where I was hurting but it pained like my very soul would get ripped off from my body to escape this suffering.
'How this started again… '
I had a vague recollection of a notification that popped out in front of my retina when I was getting beaten down and saw Saya losing her strength inside that robe.
I felt so pathetic at that time.
I still had no idea what that notification was but I am sure it was a skill that flipped and helped me fight those huge golems.
Right now I have no idea where I am or where I would end up. I won't be dying that's for sure since I have the Moon-stone.
But this feeling was creepy. It was the same as when I was reincarnating.
Pitch black surrounded me while I floated uncontrollably as I felt eyes on me from everywhere. Like someone is watching me yet I couldn't point my finger where this person or thing was.
It was eerie, to say the least.
While I have the time I can think about my future and what I might be doing from now on.
I might sound optimistic but there was a certain warmth over my chest which assured my safety.
'Hmm… It's better that I get control over other nations as soon as possible… '
The rebirth of the Monarch of Darkness was now two years away if I take the main plot into account. But now the plot no longer matters
I pretty much fucked up the story a long ago when I got first in contact with Luna. Not like I care. I feel fortunate that the plot shifted and I got my fair share of happiness in the face of my adorable Saintess.
'I better hide about this fight with that Wizard Bastard from her… '
I made a mental note to not tell Luna about this battle and also to make sure that those three do not speak a single word about this whole situation.
Luna might be adorable and such but when it comes to my safety she becomes quite scary. She would pretty much tie a leash on me and won't let me go for a week, to say the least.
'Well, that won't be that bad… '
Shooing away my perverted thoughts I felt a bright star shining in this endless darkness before I started to get sucked into it.
My thoughts were fixed on how to console Saya and convince the three to not speak a word about this incident to Luna.
But little did I expect that the first person greeting me would be….
"Ah, you woke up darling~."
________________…
A/N: - Luna is quite agitated with the three so her attitude was justifiable.
Please drop a comment if you are liking the story~

chapters.title: Chapter 146: Is Luna a yandere?
chapters.content:
It was around two hours since the Abyssal Wizard was defeated and an unexpected yet welcomed person arrived.
After Austin came back to his senses, Luna asked everyone to give them space before she chanted a barrier around the two.
Kyouki and Cordelia went to a corner as they treated each other with the first aid kit they had in Kyouki's pouch. They didn't have many injuries but the accumulated stress was much needed to be released.
Saya just stepped backward but didn't move her gaze from the place where she knew her brother was. She didn't have the capability or intention to pry into Luna and her brother's intimate moments, but the greed to meet her brother as soon as possible didn't let her move away.
Despite being tired both physically and mentally, Saya was standing still with her gaze frozen at the same spot.
_._._
Inside the dome, Austin lay down on the floor with his upper body completely exposed.
Luna did treated him but the blood stains were still there and so was her own assurance. She couldn't sit still until she doesnt check all his injuries by herself.
"Hey."
"..."
It was the third time, Austin called for her but Luna still didn't reply and continued to clean him with warm water and soft towels. Her eyes were filled with concern but whenever she heard his voice her gaze turned slightly cold.
Austin was even restricted to move his limbs since Luna was binding his limbs with mana.
Being annoyed a little, Austin spoke without minding whether she responds but it somehow backfired or not.
"Hey, it alright now. As you see, I am quite fine-"
"Fine huh?"
Luna finally turned her chilling gaze in his direction making Austin shut up in an instant. Her hand which rubbed the towel gently came to an abrupt halt as she finally began to wail out her build-up anxiety.
"You know how hard it was for me to see you like that? After being separated for so long, I was greeted with a half-dead Austin…do you know what would have gone across my heart. I felt burning this world and the things inside it who dared to hurt you! To hurt the person I love!! And here you…hick.."
Amidst reprimanding, tears started rolling down her fluffy cheeks when Austin instantly broke free of her frail binds and held Luna in his arms.
Luna also didn't resist and let herself get wrapped in her favorite warmth as she rested her head on his chest while he rubbed her back gently.
"Don't cry now. You know it pains me the most when I see you like this. I know it was reckless of me to go overboard but you know if it comes to you or Saya, I just lose it. And I knew, even if I push myself to the point which I can't afford, you will save me, somehow. So please don't be sad anymore. I am completely fine now."
Austin kept on consoling and pampering the weeping Luna that he was alright but only she knows how she felt when her eyes landed on the lifeless Austin. If not for her arriving another minute, then he might have lost his life.
There indeed was a stone that would have bestowed him with another life but still, Luna was utterly distressed about the idea to let Austin die in the first place. She couldn't even think of that moment when he closes his eyes before her…
It took some time but Luna seemed to calm down after his continuous comforting and assuring her about his well-being.
"Baka….always making me worried…"
Luna bit on his nape in the complaint which Austin accepted wholeheartedly. If it quells her pain he would let her bite as much as she wants.
"I swear if you dare to let yourself get hurt like that again… I will chain you up and never will let you go away from my sight."
Austin trembled slightly as he thought that Luna might have some y-dere traits but he shooed those thoughts away and hugged her even more tightly.
"Mm…whatever you say…"
_______________…
After more than half an hour of recharging herself enough to survive for a day and two, Luna disintegrated the barrier making the three outside, startled.
Saya stepped forward as she saw Luna walking forward while hugging her brother cozily. Compared to earlier it felt like even flowers might bloom if planted under her feet at the moment.
However, Saya's gaze only lingered her for a moment before her gaze fell on the man beside her. Messy blond hair, evidently ragged condition but healthy enough that he was able to walk properly, and a pair of eyes that radiated nothing but genuine concern for her.
Her brother's face and outer appearance might have changed but the emotions he carries in those eyes were still the same as she remember. Seeking out for her even though she messes up a big time. Or whenever she felt lonely, he would extend his arms just like he was doing now…
"Why do you look so dazed? Come here."
Saya trodded feebly for some steps before she fell into her brother's arms, leaving all the worries and exhaustion she has been weighted down with.
Luna gave the two some space as she approached the duo standing still in the corner.
'Well, she deserved that much… '
__________________…
A/N: - The last phrase was actually Luna thinking about the harsh words she used upon arrival. Even the saintess feels emotions toward someone other than Austin.
Anyway, lemme know if you guys liked the chapter.

chapters.title: Chapter 147: Mutual respect!
chapters.content:
"So what's the plan from now on, Captain?"
As Austin returned to the group while holding his sister's hand fondly, Luna asked in a mild tone. She couldn't help but feel a little bitter after she saw how close these two are and also how protectively Austin was holding Saya's hand.
Even though she was the one who encouraged Saya to go after Austin, Luna wasn't actually entirely ready for this change. Thanks to the fact that Austin was a little dense when it came to matters like this, it was providing Luna with the time she required to adapt.
"After some rest, we will be moving further down. Since the curse of mana has been lifted, it would be easier to venture."
Luna expected such an answer from him. Earlier Austin told her when they were in the dome, that the floor boss was aware of Austin's Villain System.
It goes without saying that Austin must be impatient and anxious to know more about his system's origin and things that may be about his rebirth.
Luna undoubtedly was going to support him from hereon but for some reason, something was weighing down her heart. Like they might come to know something not-so-pleasant.
'Ah, I have to collect myself… '
Shaking her head, Luna threw her useless thoughts as she turned toward Austin. Whatever happens, she wasn't going to leave his side.
"We are also ready to go."
It was Kyouki who declared for him and his partner's stead as he stood while supporting Cordelia. The latter mentioned was slightly pale-faced due to being constantly influenced by the Wizard but other than that she seemed fine.
However, before Austin could have nodded and proceed with his further plan, Luna interjected.
"Your lovers might die at the rate they have been crying since forever."
Kyouki perked his ears as his lashes blinked in perplexion upon hearing Luna's remark which undoubtedly was targeted at Sicily and Lilia.
"What happened to them?"
It has been only a week since they dived into the dungeon so Kyouki didn't find any reason for them to get worried so soon.
However, the hero and everyone present inside got startled upon hearing Luna's following reality check.
"Well, of course not seeing their loved one for a month would make them worried. And they are aware of me entering this place so…"
Luna trailed off her words since she knew Kyouki had understood the essence of the matter.
The reason Luna dived into the labyrinth must be because of some unforeseen circumstance. And having no way to check on Kyouki's condition would undoubtedly make them uneasy.
"Yeah, you should go back Hero."
Kyouki turned toward his team captain with a bitter expression since he was utterly conflicted about what he should be doing now.
It didn't take time for Austin to know what the hero was thinking as he sighed and approached the raven-haired youth.
"Listen, your job is finished. You assisted me enough until now. Even with the wizard, I primarily thought of using you as the final strike but well…"
Kyouki was a little taken aback since Austin rarely talked in such a manner with him before. Soon his expression loosened up since what Austin said made the hero slightly less guilty for being just a dead weight.
With a contended look Kyouki nodded along with his words.
"Okay, I will return now. And you too, don't go rampaging like a maniac again."
Austin narrowed his eyes and smacked the hero in the torso.
"Buah!"
"That maniac saved your ass, hero. Now get going."
Cordelia rubbed Kyouki's back in concern as the latter held his stomach in mild pain because of the punch. But amidst pain Kyouki had a snicker plastered on his face as he saw Austin retreating back to Luna's side.
Luna was surprised to see that Kyouki and Austin have grown closer than before and the attitude of the hero toward Austin has also shifted a lot.
"I-I will be leaving with Kyo-chan as well."
"Hmm, alright."
Cordelia bowed after some time before she went to Kyouki's side and enveloped both of them in her shadow.
Kyouki gave a last glance at the blond youth with a nod as the darkness covered them before their presence vanished all in an instant.
Left were the three still on the fifth floor. Saya's condition was better than before. Luna was beautiful and smiling as ever. And Austin himself after Luna's care felt a lot better.
Austin was about to use his skill to penetrate through the floor and continue his venture along with the two beauties when a familiar yet unpleasant voice reached up to them.
[Where do you think you guys are going?]
________________…
A/N: - I wanted to add another scene but it would have gotten a whole lot longer. So yeah, sorry for this short one. I will surely compensate.
Drop a comment ~

chapters.title: Chapter 148: Warning!
chapters.content:
The person who brought this much trouble for Austin after so long a time. The man who nearly killed him. And the bastard who dared to hurt his sister as well was yet again standing in front of the three.
However, from close observation, it became clear that the person standing all tall and arrogant was no longer a living existence. Rather, just a fragment of his soul.
[You guys don't even seem surprised. How boring.]
The Abyssal Wizard pouted like a kid as if the person who was doing his all to kill Austin was someone else entirely.
However, the whiny expression of the Wizard soon shifted exponentially as he sensed a peculiar energy radiating from the silver-haired girl.
Luna had no motive to let this chance go. This was the opportunity to bestow the most painful death to the insect who dared to hurt her husband.
The Wizard realized that he might vanish from existence since the creepy girl had Holy Magic overflowing around her. Even being alive, the man was sure that he would've lost to such an absurd level of raw mana.
"Do you have anything useful to say?"
Austin gently wrapped his hand around Luna's waist before she could have gone berserk.
Even being angry, Luna seemed extremely adorable to let go. And also, he had a hunch that this useless Wizard might deliver some information related to the thing waiting beneath them.
Luna understood Austin's intention but still, it was too much to ask for. She just wanted to slice a limb or two for starters. That much wouldn't have killed the pest.
However, she didn't protest against Austin and obediently stood at her spot.
The Abyssal Wizard sighed in relief as the overwhelming killing intent was pulled back temporarily.
[Yes… I, as the guardian of this Labyrinth, allow you and your party to proceed further. But before you face the being resting at the base of this abyss, I want to request you guys something.]
The first half of his statement seemed utter bullshit since Austin didn't require any approval now to proceed further. But what intrigued the three was the Wizard's following words.
With a deep frown, the Wizard continued.
[The one resting on the tenth stage of this place has the knowledge of your System and the person who caused so many troubles for you. But beware of one thing…]
Saya frowned slightly since she was entirely unaware of what system this robed bastard was talking about. However, from her brother's expression, it seemed that this matter contained extreme concern.
Just as Saya and Luna could see, Austin indeed had a severe frown on his head as he waited for the Wizard to continue. If things really go as desired then Austin may find various answers he has been pursuing for a long time.
His tone grew slightly mild like he was trying to not let someone else lurking around hear it, the wizard continued.
[...don't piss her off whatever it takes. Once her tolerance level reaches a point she might explode and also take down the place situated above the Labyrinth.]
Austin understood what this Wizard was trying to imply.
If the person on the tenth floor gets annoyed then she might eradicate the whole of Eden's Academy at once. Well, Austin doesn't believe what he has yet to witness but there was no harm to keep Wizard's warning in mind.
"You done right? Now let me slaughter you."
Luna instantly got away from Austin's grip and approached the Wizard at a frightening speed.
[Hehe… not so easy there… ]
But the wizard was able to escape by converting himself into a shadow and blending in the darkness.
Luna's eyes glittered with cyan radiance as she used her skill to trace the bastard but…
"He's moving continuously. I better destroy this whole floor."
Since the Wizard's consciousness remained only in his soul, he was able to use himself as a shadow and kept on moving to dodge any kind of lethal blow.
Luna made her decision to bring this whole place into rumbles to see the despair on that creature's face and kill him slowly while listening to his agonizing screams.
But before she could have started, Austin held her hand and pulled her in an embrace.
"That's okay, Luna. He's already dead. Killing him again would gain us nothing. I am happy that you are angry in my stead but I think it's best to stop here and focus on the final destination."
Luna, who was getting into her battle mode suddenly felt the warmth of her man enveloping her, before her eyes lost the glint they carried for the Wizard.
The Saintess whined like a child as she complained with a bulge appearing on her left cheek.
"You always forgive anyone so easily."
Austin sighed in awe upon seeing the childish protest as he tried to calm down the troubled Luna.
"That's why we are the most balanced couple, aren't we?"
Luna quit struggling upon hearing the flirtatious comment as she dipped her face, deep into his chest while trying to hide her embarrassment.
Austin laughed lightly as he extended his hand toward Saya who was cautiously keeping her eyes on their surroundings.
Seeing her brother's approach, she instantly jumped forward and leaned slightly to place his hand on top of her head.
While pampering the ladies, Austin's eyes looked intently at the base on which they were standing as a thought emerged in his mind.
'Let's see who is the mighty creator of this wonderful system… '
______________________
A/N: - Drop a comment if you are liking the story so far~

chapters.title: Chapter 149: Austin’s Origin~1!
chapters.content:
The rest of the four floors were nothing but a walk in the park since the restriction on Mana was lifted.
Saya wanted to ask about this System thing that the Wizard told them about but Austin assured her that it would be better for them to first clear this matter with Labyrinth.
He knew it was unfair of him to not tell Saya something so crucial about himself but right now, Saya was not in much stable mind to handle such a not-so-pleasant past.
She does have the right to know since Austin has never hidden anything from her and the same was for Saya as well, but right now, it would only make things worse for Saya.
Luna was easily sweeping away the bosses and mob creatures on each floor since she didn't want Austin to strain himself anymore.
Since she seemed very comfortable in annihilating those masses, Austin just stood at his place while being awestruck as they fluently dashed through the floors.
"Are we ready?"
On the ninth floor. Standing in the middle of an empty hall that previously was filled with strange blue slime creatures, Luna asked in a serene tone regarding advancement.
Austin looked at Saya who nodded albeit a little hesitantly as she strengthen her hold on her brother's hand.
Austin knew why she and even Luna were nervous despite not showing outwardly but there was no way he would be returning after coming this far.
Nodding toward his girl, Austin and the others felt the ground rumbling before a small crater was formed, and through sheer force of heavy mana, Luna made a hole through the floor.
Austin controlled their gravity to make the fall slower as their eyes wandered the whole floor.
Generally, some creatures would have already latched at them as soon the ceiling of the new floor disappeared but not on this tenth floor.
Strangely, there was no presence whatsoever around. But that doesn't mean they didn't find someone on the floor who possibly was the final boss.
In the middle of the floor there planted a queen-sized bed with a crown like a headboard and a pink net curtain canopy over the furniture. Just like how a little princess would want their bed to be.
The three of them didn't land much further from the bed and they were able to see the person lying on the bed.
There was no snow white princess but an old hag clearly in her eighties with white hair spread all over her pink pillow. The small sleeping cap didn't make her look any childish or younger, rather the scent of cringe only reeked profoundly.
"Should we wake the granny up?"
Saya proposed the idea since despite being not the kind of being they primarily were expecting, this old lady was the only source to gain the knowledge for which her Onii-sama was so anxious about.
Austin was contemplating a bit since it seemed rude to wake such elderly who have been sleeping so peacefully. But Luna had different plans.
"Austin~Can I have some money?"
Austin was perplexed by such a sudden and unexpected request but he didn't deny it and instantly pulled out a thousand gold coin pouches from his inventory.
"Don't you earn a lot already?"
Saya asked in genuine confusion, but soon she regretted opening her mouth.
"You won't understand the happiness of asking money from a husband~."
With those words, Luna started walking backward, with her face still toward the blushing girl who clearly was borderline offended but slightly tempted to feel the sensation that Luna told about.
Austin had no idea what Luna meant but he felt slightly bothered thinking about Saya's marriage. Well, it must be his protectiveness toward his innocent little sister.
Luna soon twirled on her toes and faced the sleeping woman who had no effect even though Luna was just some meters away from killing her.
Austin and Saya also slowly followed the suit and walked toward the scene where they saw Luna bringing up the pouch of gold coins before jerking it slowly.
**CLINK*CLINK**
Luna felt happy that Austin doesn't hold back in spending money when it came to her. But due to the heavy amount, the coin made a slightly dull noise.
However, it was enough to fulfill the purpose for which Luna shook the coins for.
"I will do the job!"
The woman instantly shot her eyes and spoke the first thing which came to her mind upon hearing such a melodious tune.
Luna knew that the woman was a Witch who can do almost everything if given the right amount. It was not a commonly known knowledge that was why Austin and Saya seemed oblivion about this old hag.
The witch straightened her back and turned toward the pouch intending to latch at the bag and greet her eyes with her favorite shining shade.
But Luna was not here to deliver free lunch.
"Not so easy woman. If you want this and five more of the same amount then you have to tell me everything about someone."
The Witch had a mastered ability to count the coins just upon hearing its clink and she can tell that the pouch had four digits coins no less!
And five more of this just for information?
"About whom tell me. I will expose every single thing about the person. From birth to death…nothing is hidden from these eyes of mine."
Luna frowned upon hearing the word 'Death' associated with Austin but she didn't say anything for now. Moving to a side she gave space for her husband to walk forward.
The Witch sensed a boy and woman walking in her direction but her vision was not clear because of her dying age.
Putting up her round glasses she turned toward the subject whom she seemingly have to appraise.
However as soon the Witch saw Austin's face, her movement halted abruptly and mouth parted agape.
The remaining vigor from her face paled right at the instant as a single drop of tear rolled down the Witch's left eye.
"Y-You……
_________________..
A/N: - Drop a comment if you are liking the story so far~

chapters.title: Chapter 150: Austin’s Origin~2!
chapters.content:
Witches are folklore creatures even for Austin's new world where things like mana and demons were a reality.
Dwarves, Witches, Elves, Vampires, and many other fantasy beings are often discussed and people knew they existed but no one found any evident clue to prove their presence.
One of those fairy book subjects—a Witch—is known to be a being who is equivalently greedy as goblins have the talent to alter even the universal law.
It was known widely that in return for a decent sum, a witch can do anything for anyone regardless of the person's intention behind it. And after Luna went for the venture where she found Venessa, she can say that indeed Witches only care for gold nothing else.
But right now something that could be called, being entirely out of character, a witch was actually shedding tears just upon witnessing Austin in front?
Luna was undoubtedly shocked just like the other two, but an ominous sensation made her feel uncomfortable all over. She knew there was something unpleasant to come that Luna might hate to learn.
But, was there anything she could do rather than face the reality?
"W-What happened? Why are you crying?"
Austin walked forward and asked in a fluster since the old granny looked rather pitiful crying like this all of a sudden.
The witch was quite touched seeing the gesture as she tried to somehow collect herself.
She knew this moment would be arriving as soon she felt spiritual energy channelizing above her head but still that doesn't help her to get prepared for this situation.
Wiping away her tears which greeted the lady after who knows how long, she spoke in a hoarse voice.
"Please sit down, first."
With such words, the three of the guests felt the surroundings altering in real-time before they found themselves, sitting around a tea table.
Even Luna wasn't able to trace the transition of the magic and by no means she was happy about being outplayed.
"What would you like? Tea, coffee?"
"How about we start with some truth?"
Luna's straightforward response which probably both Saya and Austin also were wanting to hear, made the old lady sigh in defeat.
While still wearing her night pajamas and round glasses resting over her long nose, the white-haired woman took the fourth seat, which was in between Luna and Saya.
"The essence of that beast has made you quite short-tempered."
Luna narrowed her gaze coldly since she realized what the witch was speaking about.
Saya and Austin perplexedly blinked at each other before they turned their gazes toward Luna who not long after cleared their doubts.
"Say another word about my grandmother and you may be sharing a table with your sister."
The beast which the old woman referred to, was Luna's grandmother who has trained the girl for years and undoubtedly poured her essence into Luna throughout the time.
Since Saya and Austin knew those godly beings as Guardian Deity, the old witch's referral made them baffled.
Regarding a deity as a beast was truly a little…
Hearing Luna's clear threat, the old woman just smiled with a shake of her head as she magically brought a set of cutlery and a hot teapot over the table.
"You killed Liliana huh? Well, not like I cared about that corrupted bitch."
Austin looked toward Luna in hope of hearing what this old lady was talking about.
Luna previously thought to talk about this after clearing this mess out and after having a good night rest. But well, since the topic was brought up, there wasn't anything Luna sought to hide.
"The person who created that Mana restrictor was also a Witch whom I found some days ago. Apart from being forced by some unknown entity, she didn't provide much intel." (Luna)
Austin didn't have to ask what Luna must have done after scraping out the information and he was pretty satisfied with it.
That artifact was the reason why Luna fell into such miserable conditions during the war. There was nothing less than death that could have compensated for such a sin.
"You did a great job, out there."
Gently squeezing her hand over the table, Austin spoke in a soft tone making Luna smile in glee as she enjoyed the blissful moment.
Being complimented by her darling was the best thing she could count on until this date.
There was a small smile hanging on the old woman's lips but soon it disappeared as she remembered what has to come in the youngster's life.
"Are you okay, ma'am?"
Saya asked in an unsure tone since she was reading the Witch's expression all this time. The sudden shift of emotions was so vivid that Saya felt slightly scared of the lady's thoughts about her Onii-sama.
After pouring down the milk tea into four cups, the lady swirled the teapot back into thin air before she looked at Austin and spoke in a weak tone.
"My life is nearing its end. So please, I request you to consider before trying to kill me."
It was evident that the woman was pleading to Austin with those words but that was quite baffling.
There was no reason for Austin to kill the lady until she doesn't attack him first. And taking her behavior into the account, it doesn't seem she was interested in fighting them whatsoever.
"Why would I… attack you…?"
Austin's query was to be expected but the woman's following words made clear all the doubts in one go.
"The one who created this Villain's system while keeping you as the primary subject was none other than me."
_______________________
A/N: - I did say, this labyrinth would unfold a lot of truth and move the plot drastically.
Drop a comment if you are liking the story so far~

chapters.title: Chapter 151: Austin’s Origin~3!
chapters.content:
Austin always thought that in each of his lives he always faced what someone calls, a misfortune that he never deserved.
He never whined but not like Austin was entirely ignorant about it.
In his past life, he had to struggle for everything which a normal boy of his age should just receive without him even requesting.
He faced the evils of society and had to go through things that made Austin quite detached from reality and live a life of complete isolation.
At those times, only a single person reached a helping arm to him and made Austin aware of the brighter side of his life.
The person who never asked anything in return and always used to provide him with the share of happiness Austin deserved.
His little sister Saya.
Undoubtedly, Saya was the reason why Austin never fell into the darkness and came to hate this world for the way it was. Saya was the primary reason why Austin became the person he is in the present.
And Austin felt lucky to receive such life and got the chance to be reborn to meet Luna.
…..but now, someone out of nowhere was telling him that all the life he spent in his previous vessel was a part of a plan?
That all the misery he went through and the reason why Saya ever coincidentally came into his contact…was just to prepare him for the next life?
"Don't spout bullshit! I never met Onii-sama by mere luck. I was attracted to his kindness that's why I approached him!"
