Saya enraged shout broke the cutlery on the table as she cleared her point. It was not just a stroke of luck that she got close to her brother. And she was not going to take that crap by staying silent!
The older woman sighed without complaint and replied in a weak tone.
"Then can you tell me, why you were the only one who was able to identify his kindness but not anyone else? How come you always saw him at times when your brother was in the middle of helping someone or partaking in any good deeds? Please don't say something childish like it was fate or your brother was a social helper whose daily task was to assist people in need. We both know that's pure excuses."
The anger in Saya's eyes diminished slowly as she kept her mouth agape, intending to rebuke the Witch but after registering each of the words, Saya was left speechless.
Saya was hating herself to question those moments which connected her with her brother. Now the old hag has told her something like this, it was impossible for Saya to not think anything otherwise of those chance encounters with her brother.
(A/N: - I might detail why she even started questioning herself.)
Luna was not completely sure of what reason Saya ever started regarding Austin, her brother but the Saintess has confirmed the strong bond between the two.
However, now things are starting to seem different because of Saya's silence on the matter.
…and it was a little disheartening as well.
"So what was the purpose of carving my life in such a way? And why did I receive this system?"
The eyes of the two ladies turned instantly toward their beloved.
Unlike Saya and Luna, Austin had a naturally calm expression spread over his face like what he heard was something he already expected.
If Luna didn't have felt Austin's hand clutching hers under the table, she might have gotten worried.
He's in utter chaos but right now, Austin felt utilizing his priority in something else that would be beneficial to the future.
Saya also sensed the motive behind her brother's demeanor and decided to shut her mouth despite having hundreds of things to shout.
Hearing the query, the old woman kept her gaze fallen on the table as she responded in a grieving tone.
"We wanted a perfect human who would be bestowed with the Villain's System but doesn't exploit it. As you have seen, the system provides you with a marvelous reward that can turn a nobody into a single-man army. We wanted a person who does not misuse the resource and when the time comes, he can utilize the system in the best possible way."
The statement had some of the points which cleared Austin's previous doubts but a bunch of new questions arrived as well.
He took his time to sort all the stuff and raise the first thing he felt complicated about.
"And who is this 'we'you are talking about?"
Luna also had a very urgent itch to know about this reference to an unknown entity.
The Witch slapped her forehead lightly in the realization of how basic things she forgot to add to her explanation.
"I did tell you that I created the Villain's system but that was a request from my customer. And those are the customers who made it possible to change your fate in the first place. The beings who reside above all of us or what I call them, The Administrators."
Austin glanced at Luna with an equally perplexed expression as hers before he followed up with words.
"Gods?"
"Yes, you can call them that."
For a second Austin felt that the lady was indeed speaking nothing but bullshit but he felt some sensation from Luna's side.
Turning his head, he found Luna almost pale-faced like never before as she raised one of her own doubts.
"H-Hey what was your na-name again?"
The old lady frowned her brows slightly as she tilted her head and spoke in an unsure tone.
"Amanda Ravewing. I never introduced myself?"
Austin was not focused on the forgetful behavior of the witch but rather on Luna's reaction. Suddenly, he heard a voice in his head that cleared the clouds.
'Austin…whatever she is telling might be true. '
It was telepathy. A branch of Space magic that was not impossible for a brilliant mage like Luna which didn't bring any shocked expression on Austin's face as he heard her continuing.
'My grandma told me whom to be wary of… And Amanda Ravewing was on top of that list… '
Luna could never have imagined that no one else but the most ancient Witch in existence would be waiting down here in the labyrinth.
The being whom even her grandma called to be unpredictable yet on the other realm from every guardian deity in existence.
Amanda Ravewing wasn't just a witch but a presence who holds the ability to write over the reality of numerous with a wave of the hand and also become the cause of their demise.
When such a being says that she has been in contact with God, then there was no possible option rather than to believe her words.
Austin was worried about Luna's condition but he chose to focus on the matter at hand first.
Turning toward the old lady, Austin moved to the very question which may decide where he might be leading from hereon.
"Then what is the purpose of this Villain's System?"
_________________…
A/N: - Next chapter would probably conclude the Labyrinth arc but well, since I don't want to rush Austin's origin, I might take two more chapters.

chapters.title: Chapter 152: Purpose of this system?
chapters.content:
"Before I tell you the reason why I ever created this system, I want to ask you something."
Austin blinked in perplexion since he didn't have any idea what she would be asking even though his life cycle was pretty much monitored by the lady.
Without thinking much, he nodded before the woman leaned slightly forward as her eyes radiated with somewhat severity.
"If the Demon Lord and the First Guardian Deity once again engage in a heaven-shattering war… which side would you pick?"
That was not some tricky inquiry from the lady's side since anyone who has been living among the humans while being shadowed by the protection of the Guardian Deities would answer in their favor.
Demons are creatures who know nothing out of destruction and chaos. Siding with them would be utterly foolish for distinct reasons.
Not to talk about Luna's relationship with her grandma or to say a Guardian Deity. Luna had the essence of a heavenly being so there seemed only an obvious route to walk upon.
However…
"I will not take any side if war really breaks out."
The expression on Saya and the Witch's faces evidently took a turn of surprise as they heard Austin's non-hesitant response.
Luna was sitting with her eyes unfocused since she was already aware of what her husband had thought of their future. And she had no problem with such an opinion at all.
"You won't take either side? But why? With your strength and coupled with your women you can easily overwhelm your opposition with a huge margin."(Amanda)
It was true that Austin had a lot of room for growth before the resurrection of the Demon Lord takes place and not to talk about Saya and Luna's assistance.
But Austin has already thought about this a long time ago and he still adhered to his beliefs rigidly.
"I have learned a long time ago to never follow what others force you to believe. Not every time Gods are a source of prosperity and not every time Demons tend to bring detriment. I just seek my own happiness and for that this world can burn all it wants."
Holding Luna and Saya's hands on either side, Austin smiled in satisfaction as the conclusion followed soon after.
"Just a small space where I can spend the rest of my life with my loved ones would be enough for me."
Austin felt he was sounding like an old man but it was what he desired and could go to greater degrees to attain.
A life where his lover and sister can coexist with him would be everything Austin could demand. He never sought strength or he would have taken advantage of his system. Neither he liked fame or any other superficial source of happiness to pretend like a happy man.
He just wants to live in peace.
"Never thought I would be hearing such a thing from such a young boy."
Austin frowned slightly since what he suspected of himself, the witch worded it out. But he also agrees that his thoughts really don't match his appearance.
After showcasing a small smile, the old lady leaned back on her chair as she started narrating Austin's previous query.
"You were granted this system because there would be a time when the world would become a literal hell. Demons and Humans would collide and world-shattering chaos would erupt."
Austin was no longer concerned whether Amanda got the answer she desired or not from him. What made him and the other two concerned was the news she broke.
With her eyes oozing with a single emotion of concern, Amanda finished the part of her prophecy.
"And that war would end up swallowing each and every existence from the globe. The vegetation would dry up and so would be mana."
The atmosphere further grew heavy upon hearing the possible future that the Witch had spoken about.
Might be this all bullshit but the war everyone has been expecting after the rebirth of Demon Lord may conclude in the same way which Amanda just conveyed.
The thought of such a world was nothing short of frightening.
Taking a massive factor of concern aside, without mana the world would naturally die out since, like any human being, the planet requires mana as it's a fundamental necessity.
It was indeed dreadful.
"W-what if I stop Demon Lord from its rebirth?" (Austin)
"Then you will invite the inevitable destruction on a sooner date."
Austin was left speechless since there was only one thing he could think of to prevent the war. And that was to stop the Monarch of Darkness from regaining his grip on the reins.
But that would make things worse…?
No one had any idea what to say anymore as Austin leaned back on the chair in utter disbelief before the old lady continued.
"Listen Austin. This system was provided for you to stand in between the two forces and take necessary measures to stop the destruction. I know it might sound ridiculous but this is the sole purpose why the Gods groomed you and I instilled that system."
After she finished speaking, heavy silence dominated the space as Austin stared at nothing constant while registering what the lady stated just now.
It was true that with the system he felt he could become something more. A better version of himself.
But standing against Deities and Demon Lord?
That's nothing less than suicide since neither side is, just powerful. They are literal Planetary level beings who cannot be compared to Captain Charles or Alex Nuèye.
Hell, their comparison is basically impossible.
The Demon King and the First Deity who has taken the role of Gram's guardianship are not the existence to ever be taken lightly.
And to think Austin would be standing as a sole force against these two?
"I know your system gives a lot of overpowered artifacts and skills but it's simply impossible for us to stand against those monstrosities."
Hearing Austin's remark, the old witch tilted her head like Austin seemed to have misunderstood something.
After a short pause, the lady spoke again in an uncertain tone.
"I think you misinterpreted something. This system was never built to grant you strength."
Now Austin was perplexed beyond belief as he glanced at Luna and found her equally confused.
Turning toward the woman with his brows raised and evident bafflement aroused, Austin stayed silent and allowed the lady to explain.
But little did he think that the answer would be so startling to believe his own ear…
"The system is not inside you to make you powerful. It's just there to restrict what you actually possess but never was aware of..…"
_________________
A/N: - Drop a comment if you are liking the story so far~

chapters.title: Chapter 153: Mana core?
chapters.content:
Austin always felt that there was something inside him that he never scratched off. Something inside him which was too frightening and audacious to discover.
First, he thought that it was the original Austin's soul or something related to his lineage which was not shown in manga that's why he never pried in that space.
With time he got busy with worldly affairs ever since he started partaking in adventurer works at the age of eight—through special permission—and also this Villain's system didn't help either.
Things happened and Austin never found the opportunity to think of that golden orb inside of him which even Luna was not able to discover even though she diagnosed him various times in the past.
Since he never thought of that mystery as a relevant component, Austin did never mention it either.
But today, a woman—strange in distinct ways—made him aware once again that Austin has yet to unravel the secrets he possesses since his birth.
"W-What the heck is this…?"
Currently, the witch had her left hand on Austin's chest after she called him near for a survey. Luna was reluctant to let the woman touch Austin but upon being pursued, Luna conceded.
She knew that the Witch had the might to obliterate each one of them in an instant. If Amanda wanted, she could've hurt Austin ever since he landed his feet on the floor. That was why Luna somehow convinced herself that this analysis that Amanda suggested was for Austin's good.
Saya was equally worried but with Luna's one comforting look which told her that she(Luna) could handle it if things went south, the raven-haired beauty also settled down. But never left her brother's side just like Luna.
As for Austin, then he was currently in a realm where nothing made sense.
As soon as the Witch forced her peculiar energy inside of him, Austin's eyes glowed with a strange golden hue before Austin found himself floating in darkness with nothing beneath or above him.
There was only a single visible thing radiating in a bright golden shade, some meters away from him. It was pulsating and was covered with thin veins-like lining around it.
Austin had an idea what it was since he had seen the gist of this thing a long time ago. But the problem was….why now. He was anxious to know how the system was responsible for limiting his strength when it was already far less when compared to Deities and Demons.
But it didn't make any sense when the Witch was making him see something he never found to flaunt, at the times when she should be explaining things.
'Wait…why am I being so impatient… '
The self-realization hit hard since Austin was feeling uneasy ever since Amanda sent him to survey his own body.
And the voice of the Witch made his doubt about his uneasiness clear.
"You are anxious since you have already guessed the reason for that thing's existence inside you. "
Austin was pulled back to reality as a gasp left his lips while his vision abruptly shifted to see the face of the Witch in front.
"Are you fine? Do you need water or anything?" (Luna)
Luna was transmitting a low-grade healing spell that would help lessen Austin's anxiety but nothing was working on him at the moment.
"Tell me what's that weird thing pulsating inside of me?"
Austin was no longer asking politely. It was the series of events weighing down his shoulders ever since he entered the labyrinth.
Amanda understood the reason for such behavior and she didn't have any complaints about it. She was impressed that Austin hadn't lashed at her even though he came to know how he has been played by God's ploy in his either lives.
"You have read a lot of novels in your last life, right? You have seen how an omnipotent being always grants a reincarnating protagonist with blessings or wishes. Well, then the golden orb or your 'Mana core' is just a gift from the being who was responsible for your transmigration."
No words were spoken further as Austin leaned back on his chair and registered Amanda's words slowly and carefully.
The period of his death and rebirth was done in a flash and he never was met with any being which every isekai manga or novel portrays.
Austin always thought that the memory of his past life was hefty enough to expect anything further.
He was in a fantasy world where he could grow exponentially if he worked hard. He never greed for more.
But after almost seventeen years of his rebirth, this woman has turned around a chapter of his book that Austin never was able to unfold.
…no doubt why he was feeling troubled about this whole dive in the labyrinth.
Amanda cleaned her glasses as she spoke further about the gift Austin possesses.
"Unlike others who borrow mana from their surroundings, you Austin, generate yours without the need for any external source. Even if the world's mana gets sucked right at this moment only you and I will be left alive in this room."
"Wait…why you?"
It was Saya who almost spontaneously raised the question. It was rather troubling for her to hear that she wouldn't be with her brother but this old witch could.
"It's because I don't have a single drop of mana baby girl."
Saya glared at the woman being called such but her focus was distributed on rather something else.
It indeed was troubling her and the other two as well, that Amanda had no mana presence at all. Even Luna was unable to track down the witch's identity of mana even though the latter used it quite a few times ever since they landed on this floor.
"Don't ask me how or why since we are focusing on Austin here, right?"
Saya instantly pursed her lips and restrained herself from asking anything further. Her brother held her first and foremost priority.
"You still didn't answer my first question."
With a small pause, Austin again asked the same thing he did after hearing the purpose of his system.
"Why was something built in the first place to restrict my powers? What is the true purpose of this system?"
Amanda gathered her focus on the blonde boy once again as she sighed and explained to him further.
"Every being has a limitation for how much they grow and those limitations are decided by the size of their mana vessels. The storage in which someone contains their mana temporarily and channels it according to their use. But you Austin… have no such limitation. You can grow your vessel with time and proper training and your mana core would discharge such energy to support your growth."
After a slight pause, she continued.
"The restrictor I provided with the system is the true purpose of its existence. It's just to not let you become overwhelmed by your own strengths and help you to keep your feet connected to the ground. Unlike deities or demons, you are not bound by anything nor do you have to rely on any source for your survival. You were destined to stand alone ever since. And that's why you don't have any boundaries."
Without meeting his gaze since the latter had leaned his face low, Amanda concluded her words.
"You, Austin Wright, are a limitless being who is destined to rise above them all."
_________________
A/N: - A special request to my readers who have been reading this story ever since.
Can you recall if I ever mentioned Austin's past life name?
Please let me know in the comments.

chapters.title: Chapter 154: Another fool in love!?
chapters.content:
"I am glad that you all returned safely."
A genuine relieved smile was expressed by the first Prince as he saw the trio return from the Labyrinth.
After Kyouki and Cordelia returned to the surface some days ago, the latter mentioned went to inform the ordeal to her superior after a proper rest.
Kyouki didn't stop her but just he altered her report and asked his childhood friend to keep some of the things hidden. Cordelia assured him since she now knew, what worth Austin carried and how much Gram requires such a being.
No. It goes for the whole of humanity.
The second prince was undoubtedly anxious just like his sister who didn't even leave the headmaster's office ever since that day when Austin left.
The white-bearded mage had to shift his working documents to his quarters since the first princess was not ready to budge at all.
Mikhail had come to his conclusion about Tiara's unexpected actions but he has chosen to gather more information and let her collect her feelings first.
"Thanks to you, I was able to gain a lot from there."
Both men let go of each other hands after a shake, as Austin spoke with a genuine smile, much to Mikhail's astonishment.
There wasn't anything mentioned in Cordelia's report of gaining artifacts or other treasure inside so whatever Austin was talking about either comes from the last floor or was something beyond such level?
Mikhail had his thoughts but he did his best to hide his curiosity for now since the three in front deserved a much-needed vacation.
"I will probably find you in the evening if your highness has time today."
Mikhail sucked on thin air by being offered such generously as he jumped to snatch the opportunity without hesitation.
"Then I will be waiting for your arrival, Master Austin."
Austin nodded as they once again shook their hand before turning toward their person in concern.
Luna and Saya were chatting with Tiara and Merlin who was the only one present alongside with Kyouki who was standing silently in a corner after his initial exchange with Austin.
The hero was glad that they made it back and that was enough for him to stay at his place, smiling merrily as he saw the others conversing.
"Umm…since my dear sister has got assurance of Sir Austin and his teammates' safety, I am assuming I will not be returning alone today?"
Upon hearing her brother's remark, Tiara flinched as her face turned crimson within a second. A complaining glare at the smiling bastard brother was the only thing she could do for now.
Austin blinked in perplexion before Saya told him about the situation.
"Your highness has been staying in the office since that day of our departure. She was quite stressed…apparently more than she should be."
Saya's suspicious gaze made Tiara even more embarrassed since the latter found herself being gawked at by the man she could not resist.
Austin with his brows raised in surprise, approached Tiara before he spoke his genuine thoughts.
"I am touched, your highness. But it's not good as well for your to keep your family worried, isn't it?"
Tiara lowered her head in shame but from inside even the sweet scolding of Austin was making her squirm in elation and excitement.
Luna had her focus on the girl ever since and with such behavior, she became certain about a lot of things.
'This guy…really… '
"T-Then I will be returning now, Sir Austin. But ca-can I ask for your a-a-appointment as well in the evening?"
Austin was not sure why the fidgety princess asked such a thing but he affirmed without putting much thought into it.
"Sure. I will be looking forward to it then."
_._._._
After greeting the headmaster and having last words for the night with Kyouki, everyone except for the person whose office they were acquiring, left the place.
Saya was mentally and physically exhausted so Luna cast a low calming spell on her and tucked her in the blanket.
It was a very harmonious sight for Austin to see his lover and sister getting closer with time.
Since Saya was staying at Luna's place, both of them retired back to their love nest around midnight.
"That princess has fallen over heels for you, master Austin."
As they walked inside Austin's room, Luna suddenly broke the news since she had an idea of how oblivion Austin could be to such matters.
And indeed he had no clue.
"Really? I think rather she is more concerned for us since we are considered as so-called Gram's assets?"
Luna could only sigh in resignation on how ignorant he could be at times as she let loose of her overcoat and was left in a simple one-piece dress.
"I don't want to surveillance so please keep an eye on what she feeds you tomorrow. Or should I just bind you in chains and declare you no longer accessible to others?"
Austin laughed hearing such an absurd joke as he shook his head and replied in an amused tone.
"I will take care so stop overthinking."
Austin also let go of his armor as he put the other stuff in his inventory before he saw Luna approaching the bathroom door.
Turning just at the partition, she raised her brows and asked in a coquettish tone.
"Care to join?"
As she said, her dress slid down slowly on the ground, exposing her pale white skin which gave her curvacious body even more tempting touch.
*Gulp*
"Can't say no to that… "
_________________
A/N: - The last line… did you get the ref?

chapters.title: Chapter 155: Stop hating yourself!
chapters.content:
"Do you really not ever get tired? I am not complaining but still, I barely have seen you exhausting yourself."
Lying on the bed with no space to pass through between their naked bodies, Luna asked in a curious tone as she enjoyed the warmth pressing against her body.
After their wild session which went on for quite a long time and were elevated from the bath to the tea table before the final round ended up on the bed.
It was Luna who in the end had to accept her defeat since she felt numb everywhere with such never lasting fierce attack from her not-so-gentle darling.
She admits that she likes it that way but the problem was her pride which has been shattering for some time whenever they engaged in a love-making session. She always concedes early.
"Having such a beautiful girl as my partner, it will take a lot more to make me tired."
In response to her innocent query, Austin just caressed her bare back as he spoke in a whispering tone.
And in actuality, with time Austin's stamina has been improving which made him astonished as well. But now, he knows the reason behind his rigorous growth.
The night sky has been nearing dawn with the early canaries chirping merrily which echoed vividly in the room as the silence prevailed for a short period.
"Hey, Austin…"
With her head still resting on his chest, Luna whispered his name with her gaze unfocused and mind in a slight turmoil which Austin was able to sense.
"Hmm?"
"That witch….told you something which I am not aware of right?"
Luna still could clearly remember the Time Barrier in which Amanda shrouded herself and Austin in after the discussion of his system was over.
It was just for a tenth of a second but Luna saw something transpiring which she felt nothing less than distressing.
She was aware of how Time Barriers work but had yet to entirely master them. It goes without saying that Luna could not breach such a barrier with her current strength, more so when the castor was none other than the oldest Witch in existence.
She knew that Amanda conveyed something to Austin that the latter didn't tell her or Saya about. And that was enough to make Luna feel anxious and nervous.
But as she primarily thought…
"There was nothing like that, Luna. I got to know everything which you and Saya also heard."
She knew Austin for the first time lying to her and she didn't like it. It was clear from the way his body stiffened even for a second or how he took his time to respond.
She knew that his eyes would also betray his words if she tilts her head in his direction and asked him to confess the truth.
She had ways to pry into his mind but Luna was not going to use them.
She respects Austin's decision and knows that it should be something Luna shouldn't be aware of, that's why Austin was left with no choice rather than to hide the truth.
"Hey, Luna… "
Intertwining his fingers with hers Austin slowly raised their hand which gave Luna a spot to keep her eyes on, as she heard him continuing.
"Do you believe in me?"
"More than anyone. You are the only person I can blindly put all my trust in."
Her answer came right after which contained not a single ounce of hesitation. And Luna meant what she conceded. Austin felt it and did not doubt her words.
Both of them knew why Austin was asking such a question but they had their distinct reasons to not talk about it.
Austin silently gawked at their hand or to be precise Luna's well-sculpted fingers which were unblemished and porcelain as ever.
But something was missing…
"I was thinking…why don't we get married?"
___ ___ ___ ___ ___ ___ ___
On an open grass field, the slow breeze of early morning was making it almost impossible for a normal being to stand straight without shivering and seeking out for shelter.
Yet in such condition, a raven-haired youth was swinging his great sword without an ounce of discomfort or fatigue even though he was practically bathed in sweat.
With his torso wrapped in bandages and loose pants on his lower body, Kyouki practiced his sword skills while using the technique that old Hachi taught him.
His growth was evident but not enough since his mana reserve was stanant as ever and it was making Kyouki agitated.
His powerlessness was yet again proven in the Labyrinth and Kyouki hasn't been able to rest ever since. He just… couldn't forget how cowardly he just stood in a corner while relaying all the burden over Austin.
He no longer has dreams of acquiring Luna's heart since he knew he doesn't deserve her by a long shot. But this feeling of rivalry with Austin doesn't fades.
Kyouki no longer loathes Austin but himself since it was Kyouki's own powerlessness that he always made it seem that Austin was evil and he was on the side of justice.
Kyouki was delusional and that blindness left him hanging at his spot while everyone leaped forward, for a better future.
Luna was already out of comprehensibility. Vanessa also left to attain something in her life. Even Sicily and Lilia had gotten proficient in their skills and had actively worked on their weakness in Kyouki's absence.
He just… can't tolerate his own existence.
"Stop that, Kyouki."
A stern voice pulled Kyouki out of his reverie as he found himself frozen at his spot for who knows how long.
Turning himself to the source of the voice, he found Sicily standing there with her gaze narrowed and annoyance written all over ger face.
"Sicily… Ah!"
Without warning the girl walked forward before she wrapped her hand around him while she felt her cheeks heating just upon feeling his bare body.
Kyouki was startled since he never found Sicily so assertive before. But he didn't dislike the feeling, so wordlessly he let go of his sword and also wrapped his hand around her thin frame.
"Stop abusing yourself, Kyouki. It hurts to see you like this… You have no idea how your thoughts and actions influence me and Lilia."
Kyouki sighed inaudibly since he knew how caring his teammates were toward him. It made him gratified and slightly burdened as well.
He liked this feeling to be cared for by someone but it makes him feel miserable whenever he fails to respond to their expectancy or the emotions they carry.
Sicily felt that Kyouki was still troubled about his progress so she suggested the plan that her father preferred some days ago.
"You are worried because of your slow growth, right?"
After separating herself Sicily wiped the moisture off her eyes as she saw Kyouki nodding with a dumb look on his face.
It was quite an adorable sight.
Collecting herself she held his hand as she spoke in a determined tone.
"Then let's go. It will be either us dying out there or coming out stronger than ever. It might be risky but I am certain that you will never feel the same way you are right now."
___ ____ ___ ____ ___
A/N: - Characters would scatter and new ones would be introduced. The ending is not so near but with the completion Labyrinth arc, the beginning of the end has initiated.
Drop a comment if you are liking the story so far~

chapters.title: Chapter 156: Mana craft!?
chapters.content:
It was nearly five in the evening when with a serene smile, Austin approached the office of the second Prince in the central palace.
The guards were informed to not stop Austin from entering inside any time of the day. Except for the inspection near the entrance gate to verify whether it is Austin or not, there was no other disturbance in between his walk to Mikhail's cabin.
"Oh, hey!"
"Uhh...Austin..."
It was Cordelia who bumped into him as she was walking out of Mikhail's office, with some paper in hand.
Cordelia was evidently startled to meet Austin all of a sudden but since she got the chance, there was no way Cordelia was going to miss it.
"For whatever you have done for me and Kyouki is more than I could compensate with my life with. I am truly grateful, Austin."
Now Austin was taken aback by being bowed in such a sincere manner and also the heartfelt gratitude was no helping either. It was the opposite of how he was being treated by her the first time they met in the palace.
Being a yandere character Cordelia bowing to someone who has tormented Kyouki in past was indeed surprising. But he has forgotten the past and has long grown uncaring toward what he read in his previous life.
"I accept your gratitude, so please raise your head."
Cordelia half reluctantly strengthened her back as it felt that she didn't express properly how thankful she was. But it would be too embarrassing to list those things here.
With an apologetic smile adorning her unblemished innocent face, Cordelia spoke in a regretful tone.
"I really wanted to have a chat with you and properly apologize for my behavior from back then but you see I am going somewhere."
As she said, Cordelia lifted the papers in her hand making Austin perplexed as he gestured in questioning.
"I am taking leave from my job and joining Kyouki's journey for some months."
Austin was surprised that Kyouki was going on a journey all of a sudden. But then again, that guy must have been feeling quite miserable. It was just like Kyouki.
And Austin understood his urge to get powerful as soon as possible.
Austin himself after learning about his origin and his true potential has been itching to dive into dungeons and fight until exhausted.
Collecting his thoughts, he smiled at the raven-haired girl as he spoke in a contented tone.
"Be safe out there."
Cordelia was taken aback by that ridiculously charming smile that only a noble like Austin could be capable of. But soon she gathered her thoughts as well and responded in a similar tone.
"Mmm. We will."
_._.
**Kncok*Knock**
**Click**
Just upon tapping on the door, it was parted from the inside before a beautiful woman in her twenties appeared from the other side.
"Greetings, Sir Austin."
"Evening Jeanne."
With a mutual nod, both of them finished their greetings before the secretary guided Austin inside the office where as usual emerged piles of papers and dusted old files.
The room was filled with the smell of caffeine but Austin's liking for coffee and the heaviness of the atmosphere was something that doesn't makes him bothered.
Suddenly he found himself needing to take a lit while sipping on hard coffee.
'Maybe later....'
Mikhail was standing at his place with a grin lifting the edge of his lips as the prince greeted his guest in an enthusiastic tone.
"Good evening, Austin. I hope you had a great night's rest."
Austin felt like sighing since he never actually slept after walking out of the labyrinth thanks to his soon-to-be bride's excitement which soared higher than he ever saw after he asked her hand for marriage.
But Austin can't complain either since it was he who took the lead whenever Luna laid down on his chest, all spent while panting heavily.
'Get yourself together you horndog! '
Reprimanding himself Austin greeted back as they shook hands and sat down facing each other with Jeanne as usual standing some feet to the left of Mikhail.
The two men then engaged in casual conversation which mainly circulated around the Labyrinth and Austin's experience.
Apart from what happened on the fifth and tenth floors, Austin told most things truthfully since there was nothing to hide.
Soon a maid delivered the trolley of tea and snacks which Jeanne took a hold of at the door and proceeded to serve the two without missing a single word that left Austin's lips.
"So there's a chance where we might fight without the support of mana..."
A knitted frown was currently adored on Mikhail's forehead as he heard Austin's words.
According to Austin, there might arise chances where the artifact that the Witch created for the demons might emerge once again on the battlefield.
Luna did kill that Witch who was hiding in the jungle but that doesn't imply there couldn't be any more ancient creatures hidden from bare perception.
Not to talk about Dwarves which now don't seem to be a part of a mere fairytale. If Witches could be alive then so be the Dwarves or maybe creatures like Leviathan.
The situation was growing severe and Mikhail has no issues in accepting that humanity is more or less the same as it was since the first Great war except for some advanced artifacts and weaponry.
"There's an option, Your highness. There's a way to fight while being mana disarmed. And no, I am not talking about a physical brawl."
Mikhail perked his ear and refocused his eyes on Austin. The impatience and anxiety were written over his face and one could easily guess the reason behind it.
Even Jeanne was quite taken aback after hearing so many details and exposure to unheard reality.
Putting the cup back on the saucer, Austin picked a chocolate chip cookie as he quelled their curiosity.
"Mana Craft."
For a second Mikhail thought he heard it wrong since what Austin said was nothing more than humanity's dream ever since they discovered mana core.
However, it's a dream implying it hasn't been achieved yet but the enemy was ready out there.
But Austin's following action made the prince way beyond flabbergasted.
"Check this."
Austin knew that the man in front won't believe it until he doesn't see the proof so he(Austin) took out a dagger from his inventory and put it on the table.
Jeanne got alerted instantly but Mikhail raised his hand in denial before he put his undivided attention on the peculiar short weapon.
"T-this...."
Mikhail was left short on words as he touched the weapon and felt raw active mana radiating from the small ruby embedded at the bottom of its handle and carved in a way to assist in grip.
Unlike how one imbues their mana in their weapon to bring a better version out of it, this short dagger was emitting its own mana energy like it was a living thing.
"If another Mana restrictor goes off in this room, this weapon would work fine for at least seven hours since that mana core belongs to a Terror rank demon. As higher the level goes the longer magical energy a weapon would sustain."
Mikhail felt the weight of the dagger suddenly increasing after he heard of what mana core was fixated on the dagger.
But he held his inner warrior who was itching to try this dagger right at this moment and thought more about his people's development.
Wiping away his awe, Mikhail looked at Austin with a severe expression as he asked in a sincere tone.
"Sir Austin. How much it would require to buy this and any other mana-crafted weapon you have."
Austin leaned back on the chair with a sigh leaking out his lips, since he knew this question would arrive.
Munching on the cookie and finishing it with the last sip of the tea, he spoke in a nonchalant tone, much to the other two's shock.
"It's priceless and I won't be giving anything from my arsenal."
___________________...
A/N: - Any reader out there who thinks this story should turn into a harem with selected members?
Let me know in the comments~

chapters.title: Chapter 157: Promise and request?
chapters.content:
A long pause spread in the first Prince’s office as the words left Austin’s lips’ so nonchalant.
Neither Jeanne nor her lord was able to comprehend what they heard but by whichever means they thought, it was inevitable that Austin just now bluntly rejected the request to sell his weapons and completely pull away from the upcoming crisis.
“Can I ask the reason?”
With a severe frown, Mikhail asked in a heavy tone since it was a matter of national security.
It was true that Austin was not liable nor bound with Gram but still being a citizen of the empire and also considering their ‘smooth’ relationship which has been continuing until now, Mikhail expected at least an answer of such an upfront rejection.
Austin saw the assistant walking forward to refill the cup which brought a smile on his face as he liked the taste of the beverage along with the cookies. But that doesn’t means he would change his answer.
“Two reasons, actually.”
With a brief pause and after thanking Jeanne with a small bow, Austin took the cup as he continued, “ First, I don’t want to. Second, you don’t need it.”
Mikhail felt his veins popping somewhere on his forehead but remembering who was sitting across him, the blonde prince held himself together and with a forced smile asked.
“ I can understand the first reason, but can I ask why we don’t require such support which practically could help us from possible annihilation.”
Austin knew the prince was frustrated since he had thousands of people to worry about. He really would be a responsible leader in the future.
Twirling the cookie on his fingers, Austin burst their impatience but a cloud of bewilderment soon followed.
“I can teach the blacksmiths some basics of mana craft and after that, it will be their hard work. Your people would get employment and the empire would strengthen altogether. Win-win, I guess?”
Mikhail leaned back on his chair in utter astonishment as he heard Austin's confident remark which seemed nothing short of bullshit. Well, Mikhail was having his doubts but remembering the miracles Austin have shown until now, he halted his thoughts.
Not only does Austin have mana-crafted weapons but he also knows how to make it as well?
‘Is it really true…’
Well, it was certain that the weapons Austin carries are no regular shop purchases but some refined work of a godly professional smith. And to Mikhail’s knowledge, there hadn’t been any craftsman able to achieve such feat till date. Then there was a possibility as well that Austin might have been making all his weapons all by himself until now?
It certainly might be the case and since Mikhail didn’t have any other plan in mind, there was nothing he could do other than nod his head.
“Then once again I will be relying on you.”
Austin enjoyed the last sip of the tea as he thought to wrap up the meeting and see the princess before returning to his dorm.
But then he realized the primary motive for which he came here.
“Umm…yeah, can I ask a favor of Your highness?”
Mikhail beamed with a surprised smile since favoring Austin was one of the things he could never decline.
“Please tell me, Sir Austin.”
Austin saw through the intentions of such elated curiosity even though Austin was going to ask for something. The sly prince just wants to raise more and more opportunities to burden Austin with favors.
With his eyes still narrowed, Austin confessed his request.
“It's about Cathedral. You see I ….
(Scene Break)
“How nice~ Of course, I would help. Rest assured I would personally take care of everything.”
Austin had a bad feeling about this but apart from the central authority he had only coercive methods in mind.
Seeing even the stoic secretary smiling as well, made Austin embarrassed as he soon took his leave.
—----------------------------------------
After some more minutes, Austin walked out of the office having everything said and promised.
The next place he was guided to by one of the maids who was waiting just at the office door, was a beautiful garden.
There were small flower beds arranged and gardened neatly to give a peaceful vibe and attract attention.
The drowning sun at the horizon was flashing brightly as Austin located the only person visible in the garden, currently seated near a tea table.
There was something that made Austin hesitate before approaching the first princess Tiara and that was the things that Luna told him about yesterday.
He wasn’t bothered about it since he never thought about the girl in any other way but just inviting her to his wedding would now seem utterly disrespectful.
Austin decided to refrain from doing so as he finally began to walk forward.
The flowers indeed smelt nice as he walked on the pavement made in between them while enjoying the scene.
But as soon he stood beside Tiara, his movement froze as his breath.
She was…crying…no, wailing actually….
“W-what happened your highness?”
Austin instinctively knelt beside her as he asked without minding the manners. She seemed just like Saya for a second there which aroused his brotherly instincts.
Turning her head slowly in his direction Tiara took a hold of his hand as she sobbed her words out somehow,
“You….you…c*sniff*can’t do this to me..….”
----------------------
A/N: Next chapter would be long.
I have decided to tear this story into two parts since I don't want to rush things. The first part would conclude at their wedding so brace yourself.
Drop a comment if you are hyped~

chapters.title: Chapter 158: Unexpected Confession?!
chapters.content:
Austin in his either lives has been mostly clueless about a single subject and that is women’s emotions and their approach toward him.
In his last life, he had some physical relationships but just that. He never understood how those women think of him or whether someone can actually love him for what he was or is.
Even in this life, he had various figures of the opposite gender around him, but most of them either hated him or simply avoided him. Except for his first and only personal maid who was the only woman who genuinely cared for him before he met Luna.
Later when he came to know about Luna’s feelings he was over cloud nine since such an amazing and beautiful woman was romantically interested in him, albeit the reason behind it was a little different.
But still, despite spending a decent amount of time with Luna, he finds it difficult to consider a woman’s feelings through their behavior around him. Maybe because Luna is different from others but he never actually cared.
Not so long before, it was Luna and Saya who told Austin that he was actually quite popular in the school and how many confession letters they have shredded, which baffled Austin.
They told him the reason why all the guys look scornfully at him despite him not behaving like a jerk anymore. And why there were so many girls visiting the church to pray these days when Austin was in the labyrinth. He was unaware of all of this.
Similarly, when Luna told Austin that the first princess is in love with him, he did not entirely believe in her. Apart from different social standings, Tiara never actually said anything to Austin which could have made Luna’s remark, believable.
But looking at the woman in front and the things she confessed started to make sense about those things which Austin took casually.
Tiara’s favoring him in the headmaster’s office and helping him get the approval of the upper echelons to enter the labyrinth was something Austin thought was the result of Tiara’s innocence or maybe she wants to weigh him down with favors, just like her brother? But he was mistaken.
About a lot of things...
“So Princess Tiara is in love with me for a long time and never was able to confess just because she was shy?”
Austin summarized the long thirty minutes confession of the girl who told him about things he never has believed if she hadn’t have given him the proof. It was tough for her to say so many things but Austin constantly tried to calm her down and patiently each and every word of hers before he drew out such a conclusion.
She has been once saved by him during his adventuring days but Austin never got to know her identity since he left the scene soon after.
The precise description she gave of his adventurer uniform and also the exact time she told him about such an incident aligned with the memory of his when Austin saved a royal carriage.
And since the first princess’ studied in another continent due to safety measures at that time she never got to see her savior again until her sixteenth birthday when she returned to Gram. However, it was already late...
She kept an eye on him and tried to help him from the shadows but due to her lack of authority and the consecutive wars in the nation made it nearly impossible for Tiara to do anything in order to help him or save him from various circumstances. She particularly hated herself for not being influential enough to stop that curse investigation on Austin.
Despite understanding her situation Austin couldn’t help but feel that the girl was somewhat not speaking the whole truth. But he didn’t want to pry in those matters since Tiara haven’t done any damage to him or his loved ones. She was just...helplessly falling in love.
Holding her hand fondly which the girl required in order to stop her from bawling, he spoke in a soft tone.
“I understand your feeling Tiara, but we both know I cannot reciprocate them.”
Tiara’s breath choked with her long sob as her eyes started damping once again, but this was something Austin had to say clearly and firmly, in order to save her from any further misunderstanding.
“I love my Luna more than anyone or anything and having more than one relationship would hurt her. And by no means, I could afford that, so please try to understand my feelings.”
Austin never actually thought of having multiple women because of two reasons. First, he would feel like betraying Luna. Second, he doesn’t want to divide his attention from her.
Tiara despite already anticipating his answer still felt thousands of needles piercing her heart and dripping her life out. She felt like dying at that moment when she was forced to face the reality.
A reality where Austin doesn’t see her as anything more than an acquaintance. A life where she could not be with him.
That’s it. He doesn’t love her. He couldn’t be with her. He has to go, far...far from her. And there was nothing she could do other than mourn and cry.
“If... you can’t be with me...”
Austin got startled as the long silent Tiara suddenly began to talk albeit it was more like she was gasping to utter those words.
But what caught his attention was the thing suddenly appeared before he heard her continuing...or more like concluding.
“....then at least... let me die by your side...”
“TIARA NO!!”
----------------------------------------
A/N: A little bit of drama is required before I conclude the first part of the story.
I hope you guys liked the chapter. Lemme know in the comments~

chapters.title: Chapter 159: Not willing to live anymore?!
chapters.content:
In the Eden Academy, it was a distressful day as every professor along with the headmaster himself was gathered at a place and was anxiously standing along with some major figures of the empire.
Among those were the first prince, Duke Reynold, and Alex who came to guard a single entity.
The Emperor of Gram.
After they heard from Tiara’s maid that the first princess has stabbed herself and Austin had taken her away, Alex tracked down where the blond boy went and informed his majesty.
It was a matter of life and death which undoubtedly would panic any father, especially when he already has lost his eldest son.
Along with a troupe of soldiers, they all rushed to the Academy through the portal, and from what Alex sensed, Austin has taken Tiara to his dorm, where all these people have gathered.
The reason they weren’t able to walk in was because of a single woman standing as a guard who has forbidden anyone from trespassing.
Emperor William through authority or by force tried to dismiss Saya but he failed when all his guard was lost just under her aura. She was frightening through and through, about whom even Alex conceded.
There was no hero Kyouki or Commander Charles around as well who could force with brutal strength and Merlin was also helpless since commencing some high-degree spell might damage Tiara who was inside.
Duke Reynold was helplessly sighing as well since his best shot was his daughter who might have pursued the matter but some days ago he received her letter that she was going somewhere for some days.
He indeed was worried for her but he knew Sicily was a sensible girl who wouldn’t do anything rashly. But the matter of fact remains in this anomaly currently standing in front of Austin’s dorm.
There were reports about a strange professor in the Academy who regards Austin as her brother but neither Reynold nor any other high official paid much mind to it before.
‘
But now, the Duke regretted such a decision.
Mikhail was the most nervous after his father since despite knowing Tiara’s obsession with Austin didn’t inform the latter. If Austin would have known what madness she possess then Austin might have taken things with Tiara more cautiously.
But all he can do now was to wait…
After what seemed an eternity for some, which in reality was just half an hour, Saya jerked slightly before she stepped forward and announced in a loud tone.
“Any five of you may go inside.”
Emperor William didn’t even think a second before he marched forward, without caring whether he was guarded or even anyone was following him. He just wanted to see his daughter.
Mikhail nodded toward Reynold, Alex, and Merlin before they also walked inside wordlessly.
Saya closed the door after the last man walked in before she stood straight once again, facing the crowd sternly.
------------------------
In the room, there were three people present. Other than Tiara and Austin, Luna was also there who was sitting on a chair with her face pale in exhaustion.
As the others walked in, Austin turned to them and bowed to the Emperor as the man only responded with a small nod before he moved to the bed where his precious daughter was lying with her nape wrapped in a thick band-aid and a strange mana circle revolving actively around the region.
Tiara’s face had tear stains and the redness of her face was entirely evaporated like she was just on verge of dying.
William’s heart clenched but he was able to hold himself together as while roaming his hand over Tiara’s cold forehead he asked in a hushed tone.
“How is she? Will you be able to save her, Luna-san?”
The saintess recognized by the pope of the cathedral undoubtedly would be the best doctor William could ask for so Luna’s following words were critical for the Emperor.
Luna calmed herself; as she took a heavy breath before getting up from her seat. The others gave her space as she walked up to the man.
“She has injected with an Enzaer which I have only come across once. I am trying my best to cure it but I need time. However…whether she would be able to hold that long highly depends on her willingness and from what I could sense, Your Highness is doing her best to oppose my cure.”
Alex widened his eyes since he recognized the name of the poison Luna spoke of but never found one even though he tried all his resources. However, he was not going to quell his curiosity at the moment.
William didn’t have to ask further since he already grasped the fatality of the matter. He was left speechless for a long time as he thought of any possible resort of how he could save his princess but he was able to think of none.
“Why…why isn’t she willing to live anymore?”
Hearing the mournful voice, Luna turned to look at Austin since she didn’t know whether she should be saying this. Thankfully, someone else walked forward to take care of the situation.
“Father…let’s talk about it later. First, we have to save Tia.”
Mikhail squeezed his father's shoulder as he spoke in a whispering tone. His guilt and remorse intensified ever since he entered the room, but he have to keep himself collected.
Luna stepped back as she stood beside Austin before the latter wrapped his hand around her shoulder while various thoughts resurfaced in his mind. He actively was thinking about whether any of his artifacts could help her.
But he could not think of any and he was feeling miserable about it. After all, even though no one blames him, it was no denying that Tiara ended up like this because Austin was late to react.
The room fell into dead silence with the only thing audibly echoing was the ragged breath of the princess.
Suddenly, Luna’s eyes widened as she suddenly felt something but before she could have affirmed whether she sensed it right, a joyful voice abruptly barged in.
“I heard there was a wedding?”
------------------------------------------------------------------
A/N:- Guess who?
Drop a comment if you are liking the story so far~

chapters.title: Chapter 160: Take the responsibility~
chapters.content:
“I heard there was a wedding~”
Every gaze turned toward the beautiful woman who suddenly entered the room despite the tight security at the entrance.
The woman, by appearance, seemed a middle-aged lady but her beauty and confident aura adorned with the tempting charm which made it nearly impossible for anyone to tear their eyes off made her presence prominent in the room.
However, more than anything that made everyone except Luna, widen their eyes was the dense yet purest form of mana they felt from the lady which made the air slightly suffocating yet pleasant to breathe at the same time.
The natural admiration for the lady was making it seem natural for the others to kneel and worship the lady, but thankfully Luna’s loud call helped them get out of their daze.
“Grandma!”
Luna walked forward, after elbowing Austin who staring at the lady, as she hug the woman fondly and found the latter reciprocating the gesture by chuckling heartily as she patted Luna’s back.
Austin instantly regretted and questioned his morals be eyeing like that to Luna’s grandma. He hesitantly thought about whether he should walk forward to introduce himself but found himself nervous like never before.
For Luna, her grandma was the dearest person she had apart from Austin so the blond-haired boy was anxious about how he should be approaching the matter.
Thankfully, the older woman seemed not-so-strict as she smiled at Austin knowingly before she separated from her granddaughter.
“I, William der Gramdour, pay respect to the Lady Supreme.”
Mikhail had no idea why his father suddenly knelt on the ground but when he and the other two heard how their majesty referred the woman, they also fell on their knee and head leaned forward.
There was only no doubt in the fact that the entity in front who was extruding such dense mana was one of the guardian deities in her human form.
“You recognized me?”
“I did not receive the blessing, Lady Supreme, but I do have the experience to identify our guardians.”
William despite having an emotional breakdown some moments ago, displayed a sight of pure admiration toward the being he could have never expected in this situation.
Duke Reynold had his mind short-circuited like the bespectacled mage beside him since it was the first time they had come in the air of a deity. Expect being too overwhelmed they could do nothing rather than let their majesty take the lead.
Celeria, paused before the blond youth with a faint smile on her face as she surveyed him up to down. Austin could only glance at Luna in stress but the latter was just smirking since it was rare for her to see Austin so bloated with anxiety.
“We shall have a nice chat over a cup of tea?”
Austin didn’t let his gaze fixate her as he soon nodded and replied in a firm tone.
“Yes, of course. “
Celeria contended with Austin’s physical and internal condition from what she surveyed so these shortcomings he showed were already forgiven.
“We have a rather pressing matter in hand to take care of.”
William was washed with a sense of relief as the lady advanced toward Tiara with a small frown on her face. Luna soon followed.
Celeria traced her hand over Tiara’s whole body with a faint cyan hue radiating over her hand. The frown knitted further as it seemed she finally grasped what Luna told them earlier.
“Enzaer huh….I am impressed how you have restrained its growth, dear.”
Celeria smiled at her granddaughter which further making the girl smile in delight but that smile soon died down as she asked in a heavy tone.
“But Grandma…”
“Yeah, I know.”
Refocusing her gaze on the young girl lying lifeless on the bed, the older woman continued.
“Her mana is restlessly trying to accept the poison which in turn makes it nearly impossible for any cure to reach before the poison erodes her vessel and turns her into a corpse.”
William's heart clenched to a further extent as he heard a such a thing from Celeria who was the last hope left. Being at such a divine level, William knew Tiara wouldn’t survive if even Celeria declare her as a lost cause.
“Father….”
Mikhail supported his father as they silently waited for the guardian deity to continue.
Celeria turned her head in Austin’s direction as she spoke in a firm tone unlike before.
“Austin…”
He stepped forward, still slightly tensed as he wordlessly nodded for her to continue.
“I will connect you to this girl’s subconscious. You have to do your best to convince her that it’s not the end for her. Her reluctance for life derives from you so I guess you won’t mind taking some responsibility, right?”
The room fell dead silent since those who didn’t know why and how Tiara committed suicide or why she was not ready to continue her life anymore, got a gist of what might have happened. Well, they already had an idea but hearing the lady’s words, they got the clarity.
On the other hand, Luna had a frown adorning her face as she spoke in a complaining tone.
“But Grandma-“
“I know my child, but if Austin’s lies could help someone’s life then I don’t find any issue worth not trying~”
The fact of the matter was, Celeria wanted Austin to enter Tiara’s subconscious and on basis of some lies and sugar-coated words, convince the princess so she doesn’t actively try to end herself.
And in the meantime, the lady could heal the patient back to safety.
Austin didn’t have to think much since even Luna would have stopped him, Tiara’s condition was something he calls himself responsible for.
With a serene look on his face, he nodded toward the lady.
“I’ll do it.”
------------------------------------------------------------
A/N:- We are nearing the end of the first half. Ooof…it was a long journey…

chapters.title: Chapter 161: Welcome back, Princess!
chapters.content:
Heavy silence prevailed in the room where several figures could be seen wearing different expressions.
Mikhail, his father, and Duke Reynolds were standing together with a trace of anxiety and a frown continuously knitted on their brows as they stared at a mutual side.
In a corner, Alex was conversing in a very low tone with the headmaster of the academy only after, he cast a barrier around them to not disturb the operation in the process.
Luna with a solemn expression was standing beside her beloved without touching him as per grandmother’s instructor who currently was kneeling beside the first princess.
With a beautiful cyan hue covering her whole self, the guardian deity was currently channeling a specific kind of spell with her one hand connected with Austin and another with Tiara as she sent him into her subconscious to convince the dying princess. Simultaneously the older woman was healing the patient as well, since despite slowly she could sense the willingness of Tiara returning.
Austin was succeeding in his task.
Luna had a slight frown on her brows since she knew whatever sweet lies Austin was going to tell the princess, Luna wouldn’t like them.
Not talking about Tiara’s disappointment to know that Austin wouldn’t be fulfilling any of his promises once she regain consciousness would be devastating for her for sure.
But this has to be done since her grandma was sensitive to strong emotions and from what she told, Tiara holds genuine and quite heavy feelings for Austin. Despite not admitting it, Luna was slightly happy that someone identified how much her man was worthy of, but not like she would allow anything to happen between them even if the princess returned back alive.
Saya was already quite a lot Luna could share his love for. No one other than that was allowed near him!
“It’s happening.”
With a charming smile on her face and her eyes still closed, Celeria announced which washed the room with relief as Mikhail exhaled audibly like he was bursting out his stress.
William had similar sentiments but the line of work has made him least reactive even in times like these, but that doesn’t mean he didn’t care about his children.
For more than ten minutes, the hue kept on channeling both ways as the audience kept their mouth shut and waited for the older lady to finish up first.
Finally, after what seemed like an eternity for some, Tiara’s eyes fluttered groggily before she steadily lifted her lids only to be greeted by the man she was expecting the most.
Stood in her vision was the man who was the cause of her potential death and now was her savior as well.
With her gaze fixated on Austin, Tiara in an almost inaudible tone asked, “…you meant it, right?”
Another wave of tension flashed on the emperor’s face as he more or less understood the situation. The thought of Austin telling her that it was just a lie was making William’s heart clench.
But against his and others’ expectation…
“I will comply with my promise, princess. Now focus on your treatment.”
Like the first flower of spring, a smile bloomed on Tiara’s face as with her eyes curved she nodded.
“Mm.”
Soon William and Mikhail approached the girl as Celeria gave them space while negating the last drop of poison from Tiara’s system.
Austin backed away and exchanged some words with the other three, mainly about Hero’s party and future prospectus.
As per what Merlin said, Kyouki left the school some days ago with Lilia, Sicily, and Cordelia with him for an uncertain period. Austin has an idea of what must be going through the hero’s mind so he didn’t pry into the matter.
Despite being now weaker than he should be according to the actual plot, because of Austin’s intervention, Kyouki was destined to shine in the near future. And the way things are going to turn, Austin needs strong people he could trust.
After excusing themselves, Austin and Luna left the building for some fresh air since the treatment was going to take some time.
“Onii-sama?”
“Everything is fine, now. But don’t crowd the dorm since it might not go well for the patient.”
Austin announced to the crowd of soldiers and professors as they sighed in relief and nodded in understanding upon hearing the latter part of the statement.
Turning his head toward his little sister, Austin gently patted the girl as he spoke in a calm tone.
“You did well, Saya.”
In response, Saya only kept her head down but the redness her ears adapted didn’t go unnoticed by Luna or the shocked surroundings as they saw the previously stern woman acting all shy and adorable in front of the boy.
There indeed was something fishy…
“Should we grab something in the meantime?”
On Austin’s proposal, Saya nodded without much thought, similar to Luna who was silent ever since Austin has returned from Tiara’s subconscious.
Austin knew she had to ask something so he took them to sit somewhere before he could talk things out.
The canteen was open for the students until ten, so they had no problem choosing the location to grab some light while they chat.
As usual, Austin brought some cakes and tea for the ladies as they sat on the dining table by the entrance where no one was present. Well, the canteen more or less was empty.
When Austin returned to his seat with trays in his hand he saw that not only Luna but Saya also had some serious questioning look in her eyes, signifying that the saintess has spilled the beans.
Well, not like he was going to hide such a fact from his sister.
Sighing he plopped down on his seat and served something sweet to both as he voiced his concern first.
“…regardless of what I promised to the princess, I want you to know Luna that you are the only woman whom I could come to love ever in my life. Remember that.”
Saya’s heart clenched but she didn’t let it show on her face. She might be disheartened after hearing that her brother couldn’t love anyone else, but the promise mattered more at the moment.
Similarly, Luna also was tense. More so upon hearing his words which told her that something undesirable would be following.
But even so, she has decided to hear it whatever it was.
Nodding she urged him to continue.
Austin took a deep inhale, making the two in front even more nervous as he finally decided to tell them what caused Tiara to agree with him.
“Actually….”
----------------------------------------------------------
A/N: - Maybe five or six chapters are remaining. Drop a comment if you are excited about the marriage~

chapters.title: Chapter 162: Luna’s fantasy
chapters.content:
“So she asked you to be hers for a day once a year…”
Inside the Academy cafeteria sat a group of two beautiful ladies with a grim expression on their faces. In front of them rested a blond-youth with his hand scratching his head as he didn’t think his words would be this impactful.
“Don’t phrase like I will be belonging to her. Tia-..I mean the princess just asked to spend a whole day with her once every year and that would be enough for her. And since I didn’t find any problem in promising such small request…”
Seeing the narrowed gaze of both his lover and sister, Austin closed his mouth before he could have blurted anything wrong. Or he already has gone over the board?
There was a long silence spread in between the three as the chattering from the background became prominent.
Saya had complicated look on her face and her entire being wanted to protest against such a decision her brother took without putting much thought behind it. But she knew it wasn’t her place to object his decision.
As for Luna…
“What if I don’t like it, Austin? What if I want you to not to meet her ever again?"
Luna had her face leaned slightly with her fingers tracing the ede of her cup as she asked in a heavy tone.
Austin upon hearing Luna’s words didn’t have think even for a minute before he responded with a voice which was void of any hesitation.
“Then I will go back on my words and not see the princess even once from this point on. If there is something which you don’t like Luna, I will not try to force with it in names of my circumstances or anything like that.”
Luna heard what she expected as she clenched her fist under the table. It was not that she was frustrated or angry. It was more like she was overwhelmed by how love he pours in their relationship.
Shestayed silent for some moments which made Austin naturally tensed but soon an audible sigh leaked her lips as she leaned back on her seat and looked at her man with a tired expression.
“I sometime want to lock you up to hide you from others…”
Though she muttered Saya was able to hear such tremendous idea which she herself has thought in the past. And if it’s Luna then Saya would be granted to be with them as well, so she has no problem with such arrangements.
“Did you say something, Luna?”
“N-No nothing. I just want you to know that whenever you meet that princess, you are strictly not allowed to breach a thirty-meter distance between you two. Got it?”
Austin blinked perplexedly as he heard the requirement which told that Luna had no problem with his promise.
Since he was himself was a loyal partner he was not going to get intimate with Tiara in the first place so he readily agreed with Luna’s condition.
“Sure.”
----------------------------------------------------
It was around seven in the evening when Luna’s grandma was done with her treatment as she retired off the dorm along with the other nobilities. The emperor did try to invite the Guardian deity to the palace, but she politely rejected since she wanted to spend this brief time with her granddaughter and son-in-law.
Saya chuckled at the sight of her nervous brother who knew Luna’s grandma would be having a chat with him as he continuously kept on asking Luna about how he can impress her grandma so she doesn’t break off the marriage.
And Luna being Luna, kept her lips pursed despite him pestering as she left all the responsibility of the matter on Austin.
From Saya’s point of view Luna was troubled with the promise her big brother made and she herself was anxious to let her brother meet that weird princess as well. But Saya knew that if Luna had agreed on the matter which meant she already have made necessary arrangement.
‘When did I become dependent on her…’
Saya had no idea when but slowly she has started to see Luna as someone she could rely on. On whom Saya could entrust her big brother on. Maybe it was the fact that Luna is stronger than her or maybe because it was the immense love Luna carries for him? Saya don’t know and she was not seeking an answer either.
For her, Luna was a figure on whom she can trust and if someone can keep her brother happy for his life then it could be only her.
‘Yeah…it would be for the best…’
Just when Saya was resigning her role to stay as Austin’s little sister as long as she can, cold water poured down her intention as Austin returned after chatting with Luna’s grandma for some minutes.
“It seems, Celeria-san would be staying with Luna in her dorm, so let’s go and rest at my place Saya.”
The fact the conversation between Austin and the old lady lasted for a minute described they might be continuing their chat tomorrow. But this wasn’t the fact which made Saya shocked beyond belief at all.
‘Me…and Onii-sama…under the same…for a whole night…!!!’
-----------------------------------------------------------------
A/N:- There would be a chat between Kyouki and Luna in the following chapter as well, so look forward to it and drop a comment~

chapters.title: Chapter 163: Tempting him
chapters.content:
‘What should I do…’
It was nighttime in Eden’s Academy when Saya and Austin returned to the latter’s dorm after having a relaxing dinner at the cafeteria.
Luna’s grandmother was also there. She seemed to be rather enthusiastic talking about Saya and Austin’s past and how come Saya calls him big brother.
Luna has already told them in the afternoon that she didn’t share Austin’s and Saya’s reincarnation with anyone so Austin came up with some story and kept the conversation going. The old lady also didn’t seem suspicious and most of the time gossiped about Luna and her past which Austin eagerly entertained despite the adorable protest from the saintess.
Saya was also surprised to hear so many things about Luna that she could never have imagined from someone like so cool and dignified. The most embarrassing part was when Celeria started to talk about Luna’s impression of Austin and how much she praises him, whenever the saintess visited her grandmother past months.
Luna had a red face all the time and in the end, she dragged her grandmother away before she could pry in deeper secrets. However, the old lady promised Austin that she would continue their chat at a later date when Luna would not around. Austin readily nodded since knowing more about Luna seemed to carry his greatest interest.
Back to the present. Currently, Saya was standing in the washroom of her brother’s dorm, pondering whether she really should go out wearing something indecent like this or not.
Currently, Saya had a black negligee on, which was mostly see-through except for the private part, fortunately. The two thin straps over her cream-white shoulder somehow held the weight of her bust which was giving a decent view of her cleavage. To check her attire, Saya put her arm under her breasts and saw the two globes, even more, enlarging in her arms, before the girl shyly let go.
Her long legs were protruding sexily out of the dress and giving off a dangerous amount of view of her shaped thighs which despite being her slim stature, seemed a little bit on the meaty side. Even Luna has complimented her legs that’s why Saya picked this negligee where she could show her assets to her brother but now, she had a feeling that she overdid it.
Twirling on her toes, she checked her back which was the least covered as a big ‘U’ was missing and her bare flawless back glimmered in the mirror. Without any makeup or other beauty products, her skin seemed this smooth after the bath but Saya had no mind to pay attention to that at the moment.
She sighed and took something of her spatial storage. The first thing was blood-red lipstick which she got from her brother. She steadily moved her fingers and painted her lips without any essence of smudge spread which gave a significant compliment to her tempting puffy lips.
She already had dried and combed her hair, so she just draped them over her shoulder to expose her nape and back in clear view. The last thing that remained was a perfume that Luna gave her just before she walked away to her dorm. Saya had no idea what it was, but she had enough trust in Luna that she didn’t joke with her.
Even so, Saya inhaled the top of the perfume and found a very sweet fragrance exuding. Letting go of her remaining hesitation she sprayed the perfumed on her nape, wrist, and around her bosom.
‘Sigh* I just hope it works…’
Exhaling deeply Saya clicked the door open, and while trying to keep her legs as steady as possible, she walked out of the washroom only to get startled at the sight with which she was greeted.
“O-Onii-sama?”
With his toes pressed on the chair, Austin was doing declined push-ups. But the fact that he was topless made the scene enthralling enough to make Saya forget about her previous nervousness. The manly cuts around his arms and the way his sexy collarbone was in full display made Saya subconsciously gulp.
He was too damn hot to handle…
“I thought since I have to wash up then why not do som-“
As Austin got up from the ground and stabilized his feet, his eyes naturally drew to the woman he was talking to. But when his eyes rested on Saya, his tongue halted in mid-way as his voice cracked.
But soon he pretended to be normal and finished his sentence as he approached the woman, who was his sister.
“..some workout for a change.”
Saya’s heart began to race as she smelt the profound raging manly pheromones in the air, as her brother walked in her direction. She was elated to see that even for a second his eyes traveled all over her body, providing a thrilling sensation for her to remember for the rest of her life.
But it was not the time to rejoice since her brother was now some inches apart from her and eyes are drawn to her face. Saya stood at her place, entirely frosted as she waited for her brother to walk away, which he usually would have done.
But….
“You look beautiful Saya…” As he said, Austin tucked her glossy hair behind her small ear which was flushed enough that even Austin noticed who generally skim over such details.
*BA*DUMB*
Her heartbeat thumped audibly as she heard his compliment from this close along with his hot breath which brushed all over her face. His scent from this closeness made her feel slightly dizzy like she was getting drunk, but she held her ground and replied in a bold manner.
“I am glad you liked it, Onii-sama…but you see, since it’s my first time wearing this…I-I am kinda nervous.”
Austin can see how shy she was wearing such an adult-like dress which signifies she was not accustomed to such apparel. But even so, it suited her well and made it vivid how quickly she has grown when Austin was not with her.
With a smile, he put his hand on her left cheek and asked in a warm voice.
“Then tell, your brother what he can do to calm his little Saya?”
Hearing the words she was expecting, Saya leaned her gaze downward and gathered the very last ounce of her courage to spread her arms meekly as with teary eyes she spoke in a delicate tone.
‘T-Then…please h-hold me O-Onii-sama…”
------------------------------------------------------------
A/N:- It’s official that Saya would be his lover as well and no more spreading harem than two wives. If I write the second part of the story then you will find various cute scenes of these two.
