Drop a comment if you are hyped for the upcoming chapters~

chapters.title: Chapter 164: Marriage Ring!
chapters.content:
“It’s surprising.”
It was after dinner when Celeria borrowed Luna for tonight from Austin since she wanted to have a peaceful chat with her granddaughter.
After returning to the dorm Celeria and Luna took a bath and after changing into nightwear Luna had in her wardrobe, the pair sat on the bed with Luna’s head resting on her grandma’s lap.
Hearing her grandma’s words Luna glanced upward with a confused look.
“What is?”
Celeria ran her finger through Luna’s hair as she responded with a smile, “ That you are willing to share Austin with that girl, Saya.”
Luna blinked in astonishment since she wasn’t the one who suggested Saya to be alone with Austin in the first place but still Luna wanted to give Saya some space so she can express her feelings for Austin.
But as Luna could expect from her grandma, she saw through her without Luna even saying anything about it.
“If anyone can love Austin to the point where I can no longer keep them separated from him, then it’s her, grandma. “
Gazing at nothing particular, Luna expressed her genuine thoughts in a soft tone. For Luna, Saya can be the only one who has the right to love Austin and get reciprocated since that girl is the one who has taken care of Austin at times when Luna was not a part of his life.
Luna has witnessed the immense feelings Saya carries for her brother to the point where she could sacrifice herself on the drop of a hat. Saya also preserves a peculiar admiration for her brother which Luna was never able to understand, but she didn’t dislike how Saya sees her brother.
Luna might love Austin more than anyone but if there could be any second person below her, it could be only Saya.
“You are not afraid that she might snatch him away?”
Hearing her grandma’s voice, Luna forced herself out of her daze as she rested her eyes on the old lady before replying in a more certain tone.
“I believe in Austin and to a certain extent, I trust Saya as well. And even so, if she really tries to take him away, I have my ways to pull the string and bring Austin back to where he belongs~”
Celeria was elated to see how brilliantly her granddaughter has grown up to and how Luna had control over things that she holds dear. Nothing less to be expected from her~
“Ah, about your marriage, Luna. I have the ring for you.”
Luna’s straightened her back instantly upon hearing the word ‘marriage’ as she looked at her grandmother with sparkly eyes.
Celeria chuckled at Luna’s enthusiasm before she pulled out something from her spatial storage.
It was a violet small box which Luna carefully took from her grandmother and hastily lifted the upper case.
There rested a centimeter and half thick ring which was golden in color and a blue tear-like small gem embedded at its center. It looked beautiful and nothing extravagant in nature which Austin would probably like.
But knowing her grandma, Luna was expecting some mana-imbued special ring however Luna could perceive there was no signature of mana on the ring at all.
Finding the slight frown on her granddaughter’s brows, Celeria sighed as she patted her shoulder and extinguished the little one’s doubts.
“It’s not some ordinary ring, Luna. Actually, it will….”
_____________________________________
Austin was in a dilemma on how he should respond to his sister’s sudden request to be held by him.
In the past he never found any trouble hugging or cuddling with her since he always thought of her as a kid sister on whom he doted and pampered wholeheartedly.
But the current Saya was different. Let’s not talk about her physical appearance but her fragrance and aura were something that brought Austin on the edge.
He never took a notice of how Saya could blush so vehemently like she was suffering from either sickness or it was her embarrassment she was experiencing to be in front of him.
But why she would feel shy in front of him when he was her big brother?
Austin didn’t know and this situation was overwhelming enough for him to get dizzy.
“Come here.”
He inched forward and wrapped his arms around the girl as Saya trembled slightly feeling the foreign sensation enveloping her frame and caging her in such a stronghold.
She was stiff for a brief moment after she presented the selfish desire to be held by her big brother. She was extremely nervous upon the thought that what if her brother gets disgusted by her behavior or worst case scenario starts to dislike her?
But when he calmly gathered her in his embrace then she relaxed herself and let go of all her anxiety in a swift moment.
She had already decided to not hold back tonight which was why she didn’t remain passive and also snuggled as close she can to her brother. His manly scent actively wafted and made her enshrouded with his presence.
He was everything she can see or feel at the moment and it was the same for Austin as well, who strangely felt somewhat comfort and exhilaration at the moment when he had his sister in his arms. He might reprimand himself for such vulgar thoughts but at the moment he wanted to enjoy the moment with her.
That night none of them talked much after their short moment, however, there was a lot of things changed in their relationship and Austin was aware of those changes.
Even if he want to, the instant he thought of Saya as a potential partner would never fade from his memories. And when he would look back in past, he would never feel regretful about this day at all.
---------------------------------------------------------------
A/N:- That brings a sweet closure to their relationship for this first half. Now Austin is at least aware of Saya.
Drop a comment if you guys liked the chapter~

chapters.title: Chapter 165: Kyouki’s farewell!
chapters.content:
It was a very joyous occasion for Eden Academy and Capital of Gram since two of the well-known figures, legendary figures are going to be tied in the holy knot named marriage.
It was exactly a year since the first-year student was admitted to the academy and saw various ordeals in their first year. Either it was the brawl of the knight commander with Austin or the great war at the academy boundaries where if not for Austin, thousands of innocent lives would have been annihilated.
Days went, the calendar flipped, and in the month of spring, the news of the most-heard names of the past year began to circulate even more as soon people heard of the auspicious event unfolding in the central cathedral of the capital.
The Saintess and the Savior were going to be wed and uncountable blessings would make the occasion memorable for everyone to remember down the history.
-----------------------------------------------------
In a brightly lighted hall that had a stone furnished structure and a long conical top window carved at the side wall could be seen several figures currently giggling and gossiping with a sole beautiful young lady as its center.
"Never thought your day of marriage would arrive this soon, Luna-san. I am happy about you both~"
One of the classmates who have shared a decent time with Luna during the start of the first ear sighed with her words as she hugged Luna's shoulder from the back while staring at the bride through the mirror in front.
Luna just smiled shyly since whatever was being said today was only escalating her heartbeat, resulting in the maiden being all beet red with each comment.
"Awww~ Luna-san is so cute. I bet Austin would be in a daze once he sees you like this."
Another short girl chimed in whose words were being nodded by others as well since the current Luna was dangerously adorable. If not for the fact that no one was allowed other than some selected guests in the church, there were thousands of audience who came to catch a glimpse of the Saintess.
"Do you think, Sir Austin would be shy to kiss, Luna-san? Ne~ne, do you guys have already held hands?"
One of the girls asked on which Luna felt stumped since she thought they were just teasing her but the expectation in their eyes told that it was the norm for the young generation to be slow in their relationship.
Luna barely held herself from sighing as she parted her lips to reply when suddenly she sensed something and changed the words she previously intended to say.
"Now, you girls get going and join the others. The ceremony is about to start."
The girls grumbled since they wanted to tease the bride some more when they got the chance but it was true that the time of the ceremony was nearing so after some groans and well wishes they left.
Luna sighed for a moment before she looked at herself in the mirror as she heard a familiar voice from the corner of the room.
"Should I throw him away?"
It was Saya who was standing at the side without giving away her presence all this time, who suddenly spoke in regard to the sudden appearance of a certain someone.
Luna contemplated for a bit before she shook her head and replied uncaringly.
"It's okay, and you may enter."
The last of her words were slightly louder to alarm the man who was standing just at the entrance of the bride's cabin, pondering whether he should be meeting Luna or not. But as the lady herself affirmed, he solidified his resolve and walked in with nervous steps.
"It's been a while...L-Luna."
Walked in was a raven-haired young man wearing a formal black and white suit, with a nervous expression shrouding his features. His eyes were drawn to the bride as he felt himself falling into a daze, where it felt nearly impossible from recovering.
Kyouki always regarded Luna as the most beautiful person he has ever come across, regardless of how many beauties he has seen in the past, but right now, she couldn't be described with mere words.
She looked like a goddess descended to bless humanity with her presence.
"It's really been."
Thanks to Luna's reply, Kyouki was able to pull himself out of his stupor as he redirected his gaze in another direction to save himself from further embarrassment.
Luna didn't take it as an offense as she turned herself and stood while facing the boy,
"So you are here to...?"
Kyouki in a fluster pulled out a small box from his spatial storage before he shared his good wishes in a hurried tone.
"I...I just came to congratulate you and Austin. This is a small gift from me, Sicily, and Lilia. I hope you like it."
Luna took the box and upon lifting the top she found a pair of pendants resting inside it which has a half heart carved at the end of each pendant, designed to be complete when the duo would be together.
It was beautiful enough to bring a smile to Luna as her reply came in a much softer tone.
"Thank you for the gift. And thank the other two as well for me."
"Ah...sure I will."
As Kyouki responded the atmosphere around the two became awkward as Luna stayed silent with her gaze awaiting the thing which Kyouki majorly came to say.
Kyouki was a little hesitant at first but soon he let go of his uncertainty and after landing his gaze on hers, he spoke in a gentle tone.
"I just want to thank you, Luna. Despite you never realized, you were the greatest motivation I had which helped me to always get stronger and look forward to a greater future. And I wanted to apologize as well for my past behavior toward you and Austin. Without considering your feelings I always imposed my thoughts and whatnot. Anyway, I can't ask you to forgive me but as a friend please don't hesitate to ask for me ever in the future, if you find my requirement."
Luna stayed silent and despite wanting to stay something about the last part, she stayed silent and respected Kyouki's dignity. She particularly didn't like the boy but his past recent behavior has cleared out some clouds of hatred for him.
"I will be mindful of it, and you also take care of the girls."
Kyouki smiled with a nod before he walked away without any further ado.
In this life, he was never able to confess his love for the girl he has ever fallen for, but seeing the person who he dearly adore smiling beside someone else, was enough for Kyouki to rest assured.
And like that Kyouki brought a final closure to this chapter of his life in which he never was the main character yet he was still contented with this happy ending.
-----------------------------------------------------
A/N:- Drop a comment if you are liking the story~

chapters.title: Chapter 166: Happy Ending~
chapters.content:
It was a special day for Austin for which he was both excited and anxious as well since it was the first time in his both life that he was going to be tied in a bond called marriage with the woman he could have only dreamt of if someone would had asked him a year ago.
Sure, he got engaged to Lilia and if things would have proceeded in the correct order and Austin wouldn't have had to act like a villain in mid-way then he would be marrying her in the near future. But looking back now, Austin was thankful for the system that made him do things that led to the engagement annulment.
If not for that night when Lilila insulted Austin in the middle of the whole crowd, maybe Luna would have never approached him in the first place, and maybe not anything that has been currently taking place would have transpired if not for that eventful day.
Austin still could vividly remember that night when he was sitting in the corner of the garden of the academy while staring at Saya's almost lifeless profile through the tablet when a mysterious yet familiar scent approached him.
It surely was a really eventful day since thinking about such a prominent person as Luna approaching someone who has only acted rudely toward her and also pursued him to tell everything was entirely out of something that Austin could consider as a wishful imagination.
Yet, that night his soon-to-be bride consoled the near-broken Austin and gave him the courage to move forward in life. Despite his betraying her soon after during the expenditure, she returned to him and lend her shoulder at Austin's worst time when his family disowned him.
Luna has stood beside Austin at his loneliest times when he had no one to rely on and always has thought of his best without asking anything in return. She truly is a goddess in his life and Austin knew, he was never worthy to be standing beside her yet he fought his fate and for his love, he dared to hold Luna as his.
Now Austin has almost everything. He has the strength and godly potential to become a human who can protect the people he calls his beloved. He has his sister who was currently standing at the side and smiling at him with contentment. His mother, whom he always thought to be hateful to him, was sitting with other ladies in the audience seats with a joyous smile adorning her lips as she sent some prideful glances at Austin. There were professors and warriors along with the Prince of the nation as well who came just to attend his wedding because of the deed he has partaken in the past, signifying his current worth among the masses.
This fame, this strength, this love that he was receiving from so many people, might have never come face to face with Austin if not for a single person who held his hand and never let go of whatever it took.
Indeed Austin was lucky to have Luna by his side and just like always he today as well, promises to god and himself that until his last breath arrives, he will take Luna's utmost care and never let her face any sorrow or grief. And for that Austin was ready to go on any length.
***
The ceremony time was about to begin and everyone stood up from their seats as the choir began playing the music of the bride's arrival. The esteemed guests who were allowed to attend the marriage of the two legends were limited to a number however that number was enough to fill up the cathedral until the last row.
Austin who was standing by the priest, held his breath as his eyes fell on the beautiful fairy advancing with slow steps toward him. Her eyes were covered with a veil however because of the fabric he could see her blue eyes directly staring at him, increasing his heart race to a further extent.
The white bride dress seemed so perfect that made it seem to Austin that this dress was made for Luna as he took his time to check out his wife and gave a hundred out of ten in his heart. Despite being a little too nervous he held himself perfectly and stepped down to take Luna's hand from Nordeik's.
"Take care of her, brat!"
Luna's uncle Nordeik's rough voice reached up to Austin to which the groom nodded vigorously with a cold sweat as he gently squeezed Luna's hand in anxiety-like he was holding her for the first time.
"You seem nervous, Mister Husband~"
As Austin led her to the center, he heard Luna's teasing tone whispering only for him to hear which made Austin even more conscious about his actions.
"I mean can you blame me? Seeing you like this...I am barely able to stand still, you know."
Austin replied truthfully as the current Luna was anything but healthy for his heart. Even her soft hand in his hold was making him sweat like a virgin loser but there was nothing he could do. It was his first time marrying someone damn it!
Luna on the other side forgot all her nervousness to see the adorable reactions from her man as she giggled silently and made a mental note to tease Austin afterward.
'"Please maintain silence."
As the priest announced, he came forward with a book in his hand as he looked at the pair and with a nod began to narrate the vows.
"Father Charles, it would be not necessary."
When the father was about to begin the vow, suddenly Austin shook his head on which the bald priest tilted his head however he soon understood Austin's intention.
Looking directly in eyes of his wife, Austin who has been nervous since morning, suddenly grew calm and began to utter the words which he never learned yet just came off naturally from his heart.
"I, Austin, ask you, Luna Eldritch, that will you accept me as your better half. I might be not the coolest guy out there, but I can promise you a future where you wouldn't be alone in your worst or best. I wouldn't leave your side even if you ascend to godhood or grow old along with me. I promise that whatever happens to this world or whoever goes against us, I will always hold your hand and make you assured of my presence. I promise to always take your utmost care and never let you face any kind of worry if possible. I know it might sound cringe, but I promise that my love will far surpass any limit that you know of. And for the official vow, in richer or poorer, in sickness or in health, I promise to be your side. So tell me Luna will you accept a wannabe villain like me as your lawful husband?"
By the time Austin finished his words, the smile of amusement from Luna's lips has already vanished as tears of joy clouded her expression. Hearing his words made her so delighted and fortunate to have this man, that she was no longer able to hold herself.
Feeling the loss of words her mind was allowing her to, there was only one thing Luna could respond with using all the remaining energy she had.
"Yes...yes, I do accept you, my husband!"
Luna let go of the last thread of restraints as she jumped toward Austin and after removing her veil she planted her lips on his which Austin accepted with a contended smile as he supported his wife comfortably in his embrace.
And like that, the wedding of the two living legends came to a conclusion as everyone presents inside the church cheered and shed tears of joy seeing the two in front. This day would forever be etched in history when the two heroes of the whole of humanity and this world united and were tied in the bond of marriage.
Only god knows what chapter and what deeds would these two be partaking in the future which not only this generation but many of future generations would remember as a legacy of the two entities who despite being just humans by origin, were able to pull things which even Gods shudder to think about.
Until that time, let's just raise a toast and congratulate the two love birds.
Cheers!
------------------------------------------------------
A/N:- And like that, the first half of the 'Isn't the Wannabe Villain too cute' comes to an end. I first thought to finish the story but just because the number of readers has decreased doesn't mean I would ruin the story so I have concluded to tear in two parts and probably write the next one depending on audience reviews in the future.
If I get positive reviews then we will meet shortly again with new chapters, and if not then it was a really memorable journey so far~
Drop a comment and congratulate the newly weds~
